details: Vessel was disabled due to main engine problem in Prince Rupert Harbour off Spire Island, British Columbia. Crew carried out repairs with assistance of standby tug. She sailed Prince Rupert on 17 November.

Vessel had technical problems and was disabled and adrift on Trondheimsfjord for 3 hrs off Brekstad. Hornflyer-RS 142 called to assist vessel back to quay. She arrived at Kvithylla Port on 10 November.
Vessel suffered engine failure in Marmara sea south of Istanbul while heading for Bosphorus, en route from Denmark to Istanbul. She was towed to Ahirkapi Anchorage and anchored.
Vessel had engine failure, in pos 40 58 18N, 029 00 30E, south entrance of Istanbul st in Marmara Sea, Turkey. Tug towed to Istanbul anchorage. She sailed from anchorage on 10 November to Batumi.

Vessel en route from Jebel Ali to Marsaxlokk rescued a Russian crew member of the Kavka 3 after he fell overboard. He was found some 55 miles south-southeast of Cartagena. The man showed signs of hypothermia, although he was conscious. He was evacuated by helicopter and was transported to Almería Airport for further care.

Vessel towed Holmen Pacific which was reportedly boarded by 1 perpetrator while transiting Phillip Channel,Singapore Strait in pos 01 18 14N, 103 29 36E, Malaysia. Crew safe but 1 mooring rope stolen.

Vessel had fire in funnel and dropped anchor off coast of Breskens, Netherlands. Vessel sailed Breskens on 11 November and berthed at MSC-PSA in Antwerp for cargo operations ahead of required repairs.
Vessel had water ingress on board and sank at CNNII wharf in Port Gentil, Gabon. Measures taken to preserve integrity of vessel. Salvage team proceeded with refloating operations.
Vessel en route from Falmouth to Gosport, UK, with 7 people on board, experinced fouled propeller in pos 50 47 32N, 001 06 54W. Tugs attended and towed her to Haslar Creek.
Vessel was disabled due to a transmission issue near Sept-Illes, Quebec, Canada, in lat 49 59 28N, long 065 52 10W, abt 14.60 NM SE Pointe de Moisie. Towed to Riviere-au-Renard, Quebec.

Vessel collided with fishing trawler Olokun XII being towed by Olokun IV in Lagos channel, Nigeria. Olokun XII capsized. Nigerian navy vessel Beecroft rescued 10 crew of Olokun XII. MSC CORUNA moored at Tin Can Island and sailed on 15 November.
Vessel hit debris, thought to be a log, while crossing the Solent from Ryde, Isle of Wight to Portsmouth. Significant damage was caused to vessel’s propeller. Sailed to Portsmouth on 10 November.

Vessel ran aground while entering Itajai Port, Brazil, during her maiden voyage. She was entering port in low tide and contacted a sandbar in turning point area, but was quickly refloated by assisting tugs, and safely reached Itajaí and Navegantes Port Complex.
Vessel lost port side anchor while approaching Rhodes, Greece. She sailed safely to Rhodes and disembarked all passengers. After repairs, she safely sailed to carry out scheduled routes.
Vessel caught fire in North Pacific some 250 nm E of Kuril islands. 48 crew went into 2 life rafts and were picked up by nearby Chinese fishing vessel. 1 fisherman went missing and was not found.

Vessel had technical malfunction after transiting Kiel Canal locks in Brunsbuttel, Germany. She aborted passage and berthed in Brunsbuttel. Sailed again on 12 November,  arriving at port of destination on 14 November.
Vessel had bow thruster failure during Kiel Canal locks passage in Brunsbuttel, Germany. She was towed to Total bunker station inside canal and was banned from sailing.

Vessel was diverted by the Vietnam Maritime Rescue Coordination Centre (MRCC) to assist trawler LADY R3 that broke down and was adrift at sea nearly 260 nautical miles off the cape of Vung Tau. There were 303 migrants on board of trawler which were transported by HELIOS LEADER back to Sri Lanka.
Vessel en route from Rostov-on-Don, Russia to Bandirma, Turkey, had technical failure, in pos 42 01 00N, 035 12 00E. She anchored at Sinop anchorage. Crew commenced repairs.
Vessel had technical failure, sheltered and dropped anchor at Hisaronu anchorage, Turkey. Crew did initial repairs but had to berth at Tuzla for permanent repairs on 22 November.

Vessel lost power and came in collision with another vessel at Yalova shipyard area, Turkey during undocking manoeuvre from shipyard. She sustained structural damages. Carried out repairs at shipyard.

Five crew members were detained at Alexandria, Egypt after police found 28 tons of synthetic analgesic material in a sealed container. The ship arrived from Istanbul Turkey on Nov 4, and remained in port as of evening Nov 14. Investiagtion under way as crew can not be held responsible for the cargo in sealed containers, unless their involvement in drug trafficking is proven.

Vessel had propulsion failure and started drifting  close to shore in Sto, Norway. Lifeboat Halfdan Grieg towed her to Myre, Vesteralen, then again towed and berthed at Ballstad shipyard as of 8 March 2023.

Vessel had a technical failure at southern entrance of Canakkale, Turkey. Shifted to north of Bozcaada Island anchorage and dropped anchor under its own power. Crew did repairs and the ship sailed on 6 November.
Vessel reported as NUC due to electrical blackout in position lat  51 36 47N, Long 1 58 44E, United Kingdom. Completed repairs and continued voyage to Tilbury, UK on 5 November.

Pilot fell into water at Keelung Port, Taiwan when the pilot ladder broke as he was boarding ship. He was rescued by pilot boat and safely transferred to hospital. Vessel remained in port, she’s bound for Kaohsiung.

Vessel suffered an engine failure and drifted towards the shore at Kanlica in the Istanbul Strait, while en route to Novorossyisk, Russia. The ship proceeded to the Büyükdere anchorage under the supervision of a Coastal Safety tug, where it moored the same afternoon. She was prohibited to depart until the completion of repairs and an inspection by the State and class surveyors.
Vessel had a machinery failure while anchored in Vancouver, in position lat 49 16 56.0N, long 123 11 32.5W, British Columbia, Canada. Crew carried out repairs while vessel was at anchorage.

Vessel had navigation system issues in St. Lawrence River off Champlain, in position lat 46 26 10.8N, long 072 20 25.9W, Quebec, Canada. Continued to lock in St. Lambert to carry out repairs. No pollution reported.
Vessel suffered engine failure en route from Ferrol, Spain to Boston, Lincolnshire, UK. The ship was towed back to Ferrol where she was berthed.
Vessel collided with tanker Zimmer's Gambit on the Dordtse Kil, Netherlands. Both vessels continued with own power. Vessel arrived and moored at Immingham on 5 November.

Vessel en route from St. Petersburg to Santos had engine damage in pos 48 18 48.6N, 05 40 18.5W. She was escorted to Bay of Douarnenez by fire fighting tug Abeille Bourbon . Vessel resumed voyage on 27 November.

Vessel requested medical assistance in Japan sea off Tsugaru Strait, while en route from China to Canada. Captain of Turkish nationality fell sick and was airlifted by Japanese MRCC helicopter and transferred to hospital. The ship called Hakodate anchorage, understood to receive a new Captain.
Vessel had a machinery failure in lat 48 45 33 N, long 123 04 32W, at Boundary Pass off Saturna Island, British Columbia, Canada. The crew carried out repairs and vessel continued voyage.

Vessel capsized and sank 4.8 nm off Sai Ri Sawi Beach, Chumphon Province, Thailand, Gulf of Siam. She was en route from Surat Thani to Laem Chabang, but developed list. The ship reportedly sank by stern and crew was ordered to abandon ship.
Vessel had technical failure, at Gelibolu port, north entrance of Canakkale st, Turkey. Moved to Sevketiye anchorage. Repairs were done by crew. The ship arrived in Sariseki on 7 November.

It's been reported that vessel sailed from Busan, South Korea bound for Vancouver, Canada, with 2 of its 4 auxiliar engines out of commission and a third operating at about half power. She is to be laid up in South Korea for repairs.
Vessel en route from Mongstad, Norway to New York, USA was NUC after engine stopped due to fuel valve issue in pos 50 51 23.4N, 01 12 29.4E, UK. Crew repaired and vessel continued voyage,
Captain of vessel detected engine problems and returned to Cadiz, Spain for repairs. The ship rejoined its weekly rotation with Canary Islands on 14 November, after repairs.
Vessel collided with tug Stormont at Detroit-Windsor Truck Ferry Inc, Detroit, MI, USA. No pollution, damages or injuries were reported.

Vessel came in collision with passenger ro/ro Legionnaire, while docking at Bell island, Canada. Both vessels were damaged and must undergo inspection before allowed to return to service. Damage being assessed.
Vessel colided with bulk carrier American Mariner at Detroit-Windsor Truck Ferry Inc, Detroit, MI, USA. No pollution, damages or injuries reported.
Vessel got into difficulty, became adrift, off Maryport, UK. Workington RNLI volunteers battled bad weather to help it. Volunteer crew managed to attach a tow and brought vessel safely into Maryport.

Fire erupted on board of vessel, while en route from Samsun Turkey, Black Sea to Novorossiysk. Ship’s engineer was engulfed in flames and jumped overboard. AZOV CONFIDENCE returned to Samsun, SAR was unsuccessful. There are no details on the cause of fire and probable damages.

A crew member was medevaced by helicopter and transferred to hospital at Kone, New Caledonia after he was stabbed by another crew, who jumped over board right after the incident. After evacuation of wounded man, vessel continued her voyage from Korea to New Zealand. Lost man was not found during SAR operations.

Vessel ran aground in Lonngrunnen, Norway in pos 63 56 00N, 009 47 00E. SB rudder immobilized with possible seawater ingress in cofferdam. Rescue vessel Horn Flyer towed to Folla Maritime shipyard, Flatanger.
Vessel came in collision with Roll On Roll Off Beaumont Hamel at Bell island, Canada. Both vessels were damaged and must undergo inspection before allowed to return to service. Damage being assessed.

A crew member needed immediate hospital treatment east of Donoussa, Greece. A Greek Air Force helicopter hoisted the patient and transported him to Syros airport, where he was picked up by an ambulance and transferred to the Syros General Hospital.
Vessel suffered a failure of its radio navigation system, along with the magnetic compass, in the port of Novorossiysk. Departure was denied by the Harbour Master until completion of repairs.

Vessel en route from Oran, Algeria to Birkenhead, UK, had pitch control and main engine defects in pos 50 08 25N, 005 53 36W. After repairs, vessel ws underway using engine power. She arrived at  Birkenhead on 3 November.
Vessel id: 340943) had engine trouble, needed assistance, 50 NM NE of Vardo, Norway, in pos 71 21 29.9N, 33 12 12.2E. Norwegian CG deployed patrol ship KV Bison to assist, which took vessel in tow.
Vessel was berthed at the adjacent wharf at Kitakyushu Port in Mojion when container ship Futaba struck her during a docking manoeuvre. No reports on damage to either vessel.

Vessel allided with container ship Glory Guandong during a docking manoeuvre at Kitakyushu Port in Mojion. No reports on damage to either ship. The vessel left port the same day, en route to Kobe, Japan.

Vessel ran aground at Sandviksberget. The bow plating was dented and cracked, affecting the fore-peak tank and a fresh water tank. No pollution was reported. The vessel was taken to the Kvernhusvik Skipsverft for damage assessment and repairs.
Vessel had steering gear issues on Lake Huron off Sarnia, in position lat 43 04 27.0N, long 082 24 18.0W, Ontario, Canada. Vessel proceeded to anchor and crew did repairs. No pollution reported.

Vessel had technical failure during Istanbul Strait passage in position 41 09 24N, 029 03 06E and anchored at Buyukdere anchorage. Crew started repairs. Vessel stationary at anchorage position as of same day.

Vessel suffered a mechanical failure in Talao, in Lucena City, Calabarzon, Philippines. The vessel drifted and almost allided with an anchored vessel. She then sailed, but became disabled shortly after.

Vessel collided with support structure of Blagoveshchenskiy Bridge on River Neva, St. Petersburg, Russia, due to strong winds. She contacted 4th pillar of bridge. No injuries and no damages to bridge or vessel were reported.

Vessel suffered an engine failure in the Marmara Sea. Tug Nazim Tur was sent to assist. The Gulf was moored at the Ahırkapı Anchorage under the coordination of the Istanbul Ship Traffic Services Centre and a pilot. As of November 3rd it remained anchored in the Marmara Sea
Vessel had technical failure at Gelibolu point northern entrance of Canakkale strait. She shifted to Sevketiye anchorage and dropped anchor, but resumed voyage after repairs on 2 November.
Vessel was reported as NUC in the vicinity of lat 52 52 00N, long 03 58 00E, Netherlands. She berthed in Hornhaven on 1 November.
Vessel had engine breakdown off Nabbetorp at Glomma, Norway, while en route from Greaker to Halden, Norway. Tug Railo towed vessel to Fredrikstad same day.

Vessel suffered engine failure, in rough weather conditions brought by typhoon NALGAE in Taiwan Strait some 35 nm SW of Taichung Taiwan, en route from Vietnam to Taichung Taiwan. 17 crew were on board, 5 were rescued by passing container ship, other 12 are still missing.

Vesel collided with a Chinese fishing vessel 42 nm E of Yangtze estuary en route from Taicang (Shanghai) to Point Samson, Australia. Fishing vessel sank, of 14 fishermen on board 3 were rescued, 11 went missing. SAR underway. CAPE BRILLIANCE was anchored for investigation.

Vessel had failure in the starboard main engine, while proceeding between Aegina and Piraeus, Greece. She was able to sail under its own power to Piraeus and safely disembarked 380 passengers and their vehicles.
Vessel en route from New Orleans, USA to Ardalstangen, Norway, was NUC as fuel system required to be cleaned, 16 NM NW of Westray, Orkney, UK. Issue resolved, vessel underway.

Vessel lost power and drifted towards Penghu islands while en route from Vietnam to Ningbo. She dropped anchor but couldn’t stand against strong wind, she dragged anchor and drifted towards Penghu main island. Tugs can’t assist because typhoon NALGAE.
Vessel lost main engine power in St. Lawrence River off Port Cartier, in lat 50 00 24.6N, long 066 44 34.8W, Canada. Crew did repairs and sailed to Port Cartier with 2 tugs assistance.

Vessel ran aground in waters off Batangas City, Philippines, due to bad weather conditions by tropical storm Paeng. Philippine CG Batangas coordinating with owner to monitor status of vessel and the 5 people on board. No oil spill was reported.
Vessel allided with cargo ship Zilos which was berthed in Neos Molos at Drapetzona, Piraeus. Both vessels suffered damage but no injuries or pollution have been reported.
Vessel ran aground near Port of Batangas in Batangas, Philippines. Vessel, which caught on fire in Aug 2022, was supposed to sail to shipyard in Mabini for repairs when incident occurred.

Fire erupted in engine room of while vessel was berthed at Cilegon port, western Java, Sunda Strait, and soon engulfed all engine room. Attempts to extinguish fire failed, fire continued spreading, so it was decided to take the ship from berth to anchorage, to avoid fire spreading to other ships. All 27 crew left the ship, no injures reported.

Vessel capsized in Manila Bay, Philippines. Philippine CG reported that vessel anchored at Manila Bay anchorage area, when strong waves battered her causing her to list and eventually it capsized. 5 people on board rescued.
Vessel berthed in Neos Molos at Drapetzona, Piraeus was struck by passenger/vehicle RoRo Alexandra L. Both vessels suffered damage but no injuries or pollution have been reported.
Vessel reportedly collided with quay of Elbe Port, Brunsbuttel, Germany during mooring maneuver. Both vessel and quay were damaged. Vessel anchored at Elbe left anchor on 04 November.
Vessel ran aground at the Jagna Port in Bohol, Philippines after dragged by strong winds, waves. An oil boom was installed around vessel to prevent oil spill.

Vessel collided with fully cellular containership MSC Rita at 63nm off Chincoteague, US. Bow sank. Private boat rescued 12 POB. MH-60 Jayhawk helicopter rescued master. Barge stationed near vessel to assist.

Vessel was boarded by armed robbers while operating off Escravos, Gulf of Guinea. Two crew members including the Captain, were wounded during the attack. The perpetrators fled the vessel and escaped when a security vessel came to help.

Vessel  ran aground in lat 45 49 53N, long 047 33 01E, at the 60.2-Km of the Volga-Caspian Sea Navigation Canal in the Astrakhan region. Tugs Ural and OT-2080 were dispatched to refloat vessel from the shallows.

All sailings of vessel cancelled on 28 Sep 2022 and 29 Sep due to electrical fault causing an issue with the ship’s control system, sidelined in Wellington, New Zealand. Vessel expected to return to service on 30 Sep.

Vessel collided with 35-meter fishing vessel TREMONT some 95 nm NE of Norfolk, USA, while proceeding from New York to Charleston. Fishing vessel sank, all 13 people on board were rescued, MSC RITA turned back after collision and took part in SAR. She resumed voyage 4 hours later.

A longshoreman aboard the vessel lost his life due to a container handling accident at Port Everglades in Florida. Paramedics arrived at scene and after evaluating the victim, they declared the man dead on site. Eyewitnesses stated that they saw the man getting hit by a shipping container.
Vessel had a defect with its controllable pitch propeller while at anchorage in Sorel, in position lat 46 03 11.8N, long 073 08 28.7W, Quebec, Canada. Crew did repairs and vessel resumed voyage.
Vessel had technical failure, in pos 36 31 30N, 027 41 00E, while en route from Mersin, Turkey to Durres, Albania. She anchored at Datca, Turkey and crew commenced repairs.

Vessel ran aground shortly after leaving Frederica Denmark, Little Belt, bound for Bremerhaven Germany. Reportedly ship’s sailing was suspicious and the ship was boarded by the police, finding Master to be intoxicated. He was arrested, and taken on shore. No leaks reported, no tugs seen around, probably waiting for high tide to refloat RAGNA.

Vessel had mechanical problems en route from Primorsk Russia to Turkey. She went NUC and was drifting for some time, without properly notifying authorities. Authorities ordered tanker to be towed to Algeciras Anchorage and  inspectors found on board other deficiencies, including exceeded bunker fuel sulfur limit. A fine was imposed before being allowed to sail.
Vessel allided with a fender while maneuvering to get alongside in Port Cartier, in position lat 50 01 56.6N, long 066 47 01.4W, Quebec, Canada. She suffered minor hull damage. No pollution reported.

Vessel, en route from Maloy, had engine failure off Landegode, Norway and requested assistance. 2 NSSR lifeboats Odd Fellow III & Hans Hermann Horn went alongside at both sides and pulled vessel to port of Bodo.

Vessel had issues with its main engine’s turbo in St. Lawrence River off Tadoussac, 3.90nm SW of Pointe-au-Bouleau, Quebec, Canada. Under reduced power, vessel headed for Le Gros Cacouna, to assess issue.

UPDATE: 10/11/22 - Vessel has been refloated with the help of 3 tugs, sailing in southern direction. Vessel ran aground in Singapore Strait, while proceeding from outer Singapore Anchorage in South China Sea to Nipa island, Riau islands, Indonesia, with final destination Mozambique. She grounded near gas pipeline, so salvors have to be extremely cautious to avoid damaging pipeline. No leaks reported.

The master of vessel became unwell and required immediate medical evacuation when the vessel was 17nm northwest of Trevose Head, North Cornwall. The patient was taken to RCH Treliske, Truro. The company appointed a replacement Master.
Vessel's starboard hull was breached in cargo hold area, with ensuing water ingress in Valencia, Spain. Damages were repaired and she left Valencia on 2 November.
Vessel had technical issues on 26 and so her morning scheduled sailings were cancelled on Ceuta-Algeciras route. Vessel at Algeciras for troubleshooting.
Vessel had technical failure while towing sea pontoon barge. Towage rope parted at Anadolukavagi point in the Istanbul Strait, Turkey. Shifted to Buyukdere anchorage. Crew doing repairs.

Vessel reportedly disabled because of engine issues, in pos 48 30 51.0N, 064 11 04.1W, 1.22nm E SE of Perce, Quebec, Canada. Canadian CG Ship CAP BRETON towed vessel to Caraquet, New Brunswick, the same day.
Vessel had engine failure west of Ashdod, Israel. Tug/supply Cengiz Han towed vessel to Iskenderun, Turkey. She remained there since31 October. Repairs ongoing.
Vessel allided with a berth at Canvey Island in the Thames Estuary, United Kingdom. Both vessel and berth were damaged. Investigation on.
Vessel reported a technical breakdown at Cadiz, Spain. Sailings for the day were canceled and postponed to 27 October.

Vessel caught fire in Savu sea off southwest Timor, near Batek island, while en route from Kupang to Kalabahi, Indonesia. The ship was quickly engulfed in flames, SAR Agency of East Nusa Tenggara deployed inflatable boats and more than 50 rescuers, to evacuate passengers and crew. According to latest Indonesian updates 277 were rescued and 14 were found dead. Search is ongoing.
Vessel had technical problems while being berthed in the port of Swinoujscie, Poland. She left Swinoujscie after repairs on 25 October and arrived in Trelleborg.
Vessel slightly struck a fishing boat in Rostov-on-Don near the drawbridge. No injuries were reported. An investigation into the incident was launched.
Vessel reported as NUC due to engine failure in position lat 50 28 38.0N, long 005 57 57.0W, UK. Repairs done and sailed on the same day.

Vessel suffered explosion in engine room, some 25 nm off southwest coast of Iceland, while en route from Immingham to Reykjavík. Icelandic CG patrol ship THOR steamed to assist, with helicopters preparing to transfer firefighters on board of container ship. Crew took situation under control, no firefighters were needed. All crew are safe, no injuries reported, understood explosion wasn’t followed by fire or it was quickly extinguished.
Vessel had technical failure during Canakkale strait passage and dropped anchor at Karanlik liman anchorage under supervision of strait pilot. Repairs commenced by crew.
Vessel disabled after blackout while approaching First Narrows in Vancouver, Canada. Crew restored power. Proceeded to anchor in Anchorage 10 for inspections.

Vessel lost four 40-foot (FEU) containers in Marghera harbor, Venice, Italy, during cargo operations. All four were empty, two were pushed to pier by work boat, two sank, but later were also recovered. Details of accident unknown.

Vessel suffered a blackout while en route from Amsterdam to Algeciras with 4,822mt of steel scrap as cargo. Eight crew members were on board. The engines were running at minimal capacity and the crew was unable to use them to manoeuvre the vessel. As of October 27th the vessel was moored at Gijon, Spain.
Vessel had failure of its x-band radar while berthed in lat 46 19 46N, long 072 32 49W, in Trois-Rivieres, Quebec. A new radar was installed and the vessel continued voyage.
Vessel ran aground in the Kuala Kedah estuary in Malaysia. The Malaysian Maritime Enforcement Agency assisted the vessel and towed it to Kuala Kedah Ferry Jetty.

Vessel was boarded by five perpetrators in position lat 01 10 02N, long 103 26 01E, in the eastbound lane of the Singapore Strait. Alarm was raised and robbers escaped empty handed. Investigation underway.
Vessel had water ingress due to a leak in the cargo hold, off Port-en-Bessin-Huppain, France. Vessel returned to the port. No injuries or pollution.

Vessel requested the medical evacuation of unconscious crew member. The Huelva centre of Salvamento Marítimo mobilized an SAR helicopter. The patient was hoisted and taken directly to the Juan Ramón Jiménez hospital.

Vessel suffered a technical failure during its transit of the Bosphorus. It moored at Büyükdere anchorage. Repairs were commenced by the crew and the vessel remained stationary. The vessel was en route from Novorossiysk to Ambarli, Turkey.

Vessel en route from Flakk with 58 people on board allided with ferry quay at Rorvik, Norway. No injuries were reported, 2 cars had damage and about 10 litres of hydraulic fuel leaked out. Two divers to investigate hull. Police investigating.

Vessel collided with yacht near Terschelling, Wadden Sea, Netherlands. Many people were injured. Vessel took on water and was taken to Harlingen for investigations. Both skippers arrested. Vessel was at Damen Shipyards as of 04 November.

Vessel sank during mooring operations of the cruise ship Azamara Journey in the port of Patmos, in unclear circumstances. Two crew members, a skipper and an engineer, were on board at the time. The engineer was picked up in good health by the lifeboat and transferred to land. However the captain was found unconscious inside the sunken ship and was later confirmed to have died.

Vessel reported NUC due to a faulty gasket, in pos 50 19 55N, 001 13 51W. Required 20 mins for replacing gasket. Completed repairs and headed destination using own engine, arrived at Marseille on 29 October.

Vessel suffered steering failure in Bay of Biscay, while en route from China via Suez and Malta, to Cuxhaven, with cargo of wind turbine blades. SAR tug ABEILLE BOURBON had to intervene and towed her to Lorient, where she arrived and was berthed early in the morning Oct 23. Was in the same position in the morning Oct 24.
Vessel en route from Sandvika to Edoya, Norway with 38 passengers, 5 crew on board had signal failure in one of manoeuvring systems, on Edoyfjord. Berthed in Kristiansund, crew repairing.
Vessel collided with tug Tim McKeil at 0.04nm NW Cap-Aux-Meules, Quebec, in pos 47 22 38.3N, 061 51 13.5W, Canada. Both vessels continued their voyage to Belledune, NB.
Vessel collided with tank barge Niagara Spirit at 0.04nm NW Cap-Aux-Meules, Quebec, in pos 47 22 38.3N, 061 51 13.5W, Canada. Both vessels continued their voyage to Belledune, NB.
Vessel undergoing a month-long biennial check in Spain, since 21 Sep 2022, had damage to propeller and driveshaft. She had to alter half-term sailing between Channel Islands and UK.

Vessel contacted gantry crane by ship’s cranes, damaging both gantry crane and ship’s cranes while shifting berth at Puerto Moin, Costa Rica, Caribbean coast. Reportedly gantry crane didn’t suffer serious damages and resumed operations, while two of three ship’s cranes suffered serious damages.
BC Ferries is warning that vessel that travels between Vancouver and Victoria will take longer to reach its destination by 15 mins commencing from 23 Oct 2022, due to a mechanical issue on board.

Vessel lost power while cruising off Sydney, waiting out for scheduled ETA Oct 25. The ship drifted south along New South Wales coast, some 30 nm offshore. Tug SVITZER GLENROCK was assigned, RIO MADEIRA was taken on tow in the morning Oct 22 to be towed to Sydney, ETA didn’t change.
Vessel had engine failure, loss of power off Sagres, Portugal in pos 36 59 00N, 009 09 12W. Tug Spartacus assisted. Towed by support Castelo de Obidos to Sines on 25 October.

Vessel had main engine issues, in Lac Saint-Louis off Chateauguay, Quebec, Canada. Vessel secured alongside in the Sainte-Catherine Lock and crew carried out repairs. Following repairs, the vessel continued voyage.

It was reported vessel has been attacked by two drones while it was loading oil at the Ash Shihr Oil Terminal off the coast of Yemen. One drone exploded just in front of the bow, while a few minutes later another exploded 30 metres from the starboard side. The tanker immediately stopped loading, left the oil terminal and headed for international waters. No one on board the tanker was injured as a result of the attack. It was not clear whether the tanker or the oil terminal was the actual target of the mid-afternoon attack.

Vessel collided with local fishing vessel 11 nm off Ravenna, Italy, while en route from Rasa Croatia to Ravenna. Fishing vessel sank, MIKA rescued 5 fishermen who were on board, and resumed sailing. MIKA berthed at Ravenna and remained berthed, already undergoing cargo operation.

lost stability, developed list and capsized in Kumai port, Southern Kalimantan, Indonesia. Heavy truck was to roll out to berth, but the ship suddenly listed. Salvage attempts have worsened the situation and crew had to leave the ship as she shifted perpendicular to berth, capsized portside and sank, remaining partially above waterline.
Vessel suffered engine failure in Celtic sea, while en route from Dublin to Rotterdam. Tug was assigned to tow disabled ship to Waterford, Ireland. Caravan was entering Waterford Harbor as of Oct 20.

Vessel ran aground twice in approach channel of Nakskov port, Nakskov Fjord, Denmark, Baltic sea. The ship ran aground in the morning Oct 19 first time, but managed to refloat by own means, to ground again 3 cables further in fairway. No damages, no leaks, no water ingress reported.

Vessel bottom allided with uncharted object while underway to Baker Lake W of Chesterfield Narrows, in position lat 63 59 36N, long 094 18 54W, Nunavut, Canada. Small list to SB, anchored nearby to assess damages.
Vessel was reportedly stuck in Southampton, UK, after something got wedged in propeller. Vessel left port after technical issues rectified, voyage to Amsterdam, Netherlands, remains as scheduled.

Vessel berthed in Ostermoor, Germany, was checked by officers who found some copies of oil, cargo, garbage logs etc . Offense proceedings for owner and management. Left port on 21 October headed to Deception Bay.

Vessel had one of its 2 main engines failed in Northumberland Channel off Gabriola Island, British Columbia. Continued its voyage by using its other main engine while the crew carried repairs. She arrived in Richmond on 17 November.

Vessel suffered a technical failure during its transit of the Canakkale Strait, Turkey, and moored at the Karanlik liman anchorage, en route from Novorossiysk to Jeddah. The crew commenced repairs, and the vessel remained stationary as of October 19th.

4 crew members fell overboard under unclear circumstances while vessel was en route from Singapore to Xiamen China. Three seamen were rescued and hoisted aboard of bulk carrier soon after fall but suffered broken limbs. The fourth went missing. Vessel sailed to Kaohsiung, understood to get medical assistance as soon as possible.
Stern of vessel collided with with bow of ARIES J. at Port of Algeciras, Spain next to TTIA terminal in outer Isla Verde area. No injuries or material damage. She sailed on 18 October.

Vessel an aground entering Punta Penna Harbor, Vasto, Italia, Adriatic sea en route from Istanbul. She was refloated with port tugs assistance, and berthed. No information on damages, no grounding details available.

Bow of vessel collided with stern of berthed fully cellular containership ANL Wangaratta at Port of Algeciras, Spain next to TTIA terminal in outer Isla Verde area. No injuries or material damages were reported.

The US Coast Guard evacuated an injured crew member when vessel was 16 miles south of Galveston, Texas. The man had injured his hand at the Galveston Fairway Anchorage. A USCG helicopter crew arrived on scene, hoisted the man and transported him to the University of Texas Medical Branch at Galveston. The patient was reportedly in stable condition.

Vessel rammed into jetty and collided with Talisman in Terschelling, Netherlands. Talisman broke loose, drifted in port with damaged railing. Bystanders jumped to reattach vessel. Investigation underway.

Vessel ran aground in sea area off Alexandroupolis, Greece, in vicinity of 40 28 12N, 25 31 12E, due to water ingress. No injuries or pollution. She was refloated by owner and taken to Alexandroupolis. Departure prohibited.

Vessel had issues with controllable pitch propeller control system in St. Lawrence River while approaching lock in Iroquois, in pos 44 50 46N, 075 17 08W, Canada. Cause identified, repair intended at destination.
Vessel had technical failure of radio communication system along with energy support unit at Novorossiysk, Russia. She sailed after repairs by crew on 17 October for Egypt.

Vessel collided with anchored general cargo ship LADY NURGUL at Ahirkapi Anchorage, Istanbul, Marmara sea.  NEW HORIZON was brought to anchor after collision. Both ship sustained damages, extent unknown, both remained anchored.
Vessel was struck by bulk carrier NEW HORIZON while at anchored at Ahirkapi Anchorage, Istanbul, Marmara sea. Both ships sustained damages, extent unknown, both remained anchored.

Vessel reported that crew sighted 3 perpetrators in engine room while proceeding along Phillip Channel in Singapore Strait. Upon search perpetrators not found. Crew safe. Vessel continued its passage to Singapore.
Vessel collided with bow of Norwegian Frigate HNoMS Roald Amundsen in pos 55 52 29N, 004 21 20W on River Clyde, UK. She suffered damages to mast.

Vessel had minor fire underneath its No. 3 generator turbo charger, in pos 50 46 06N, 127 24 36W, in Queen Charlotte Strait off Port Hardy, British Columbia, Canada. Fire immediately extinguished by crew.
Vessel had engine issue on Lake Huron, 4.50 NM E SE of Thunder Bay Island, Michigan, in pos 44 57 48.0N, 082 52 04.8W, US. Vessel sailed after crew carried out repairs.
Vessel ran aground on sandbar near Hay River, Canada. Gear and cargo were offloaded on tug and barge on 16 October in order to safely float vessel off sandbar. She was secured at Hay River.

Vessel had damage to its port main engine caused by foreign object, in vicinity of lat 37 28 48N, long 23 21 00E. Vessel proceeded safely to port of Poros. Departure was prohibited until repairs done and class maintenance certificate issued.

Vessel suffered a fire in accommodation block during maintenance works. The crew, assisted by the shipyard’s fire-fighting team, brought the fire under control. As of 15th November she remained under repair at the Yasarsan Shipyard in Yalova.

Vessel was believed to be in collision with rented 18-ft-runabout at Vancouver, Canada. Unclear whether wake of vessel flipped the boat or vessels made contact. 3 people were rescued with no significant injuries.

Vessel sank 25nm south of Wuqui island, Kinmen County, Taiwan, Taiwan Strait. Tanker was en route from Hong Kong to Gunsan Korea. Of 20 crew on board, 1 died, 19 were rescued and survived. Tanker is said to be in load, carrying cargo of oil and chemicals totalling 7,500 tons.
Vessel, in ballast condition, experienced technical failure during its Canakkale Strait passage and dropped anchor at Karanlik liman anchorage.  Repairs commenced by crew.

Vessel was struck by bulk carrier AMIS WISDOM VI, while anchored at Ahirkapi Anchorage, Istanbul, Marmara sea. Both ships sustained damages including breaches in superstructure area (CHRISTINA B) and stb hull dents in fore section (AMIS WISDOM VI). Both ships remain at anchor.

Vessel struck anchored bulk carrier CHRISTINA B at Ahirkapi Anchorage, Istanbul, Marmara sea, shortly after she heaved anchor and started sailing. Both ships sustained damages including breaches in superstructure area (CHRISTINA B) and stb hull dents in fore section (AMIS WISDOM VI). Both ships remain at anchor.
Vessel reported NUC, due to an issue with fuel injector on main engine, at 62.5 NM, NW of Butt of Lewis, Scotland. Repairs completed and en route to its destination same day.

Vessel had technical failure during Canakkale strait passage, anchored at Karanlik liman anchorage, Turkey under supervision of Strait pilo. Repairs were done by crew and vessel continued voyage on 17 October.
Vessel allided with the middle wall 3 times when entering new northern lock in inner port of Brunsbuttel, Germany. Investigations carried out. Traffic was disrupted. Vessell resumed voyage same day.
Vessel collided with dock on Lake Ontario in Colborne, Ontario, Canada. Vessel proceeded to Clarkson to unload and conduct repairs.

Vessel ran aground on rocks of Ramkeen Island, Palm Islands, 3.5 nm off Tripoli, Lebanon, straying off traffic lane. 47 people on board were evacuated, divers are said to already survey ship’s hull, she’s expected to be refloated during daytime Oct 14. MED BRIDGE is en route from Turkey to Tripoli, she’s deployed on Tasucu (Turkey) – Tripoli service.

Vessel en route from San Pedro Ivory Coast to Las Palmas was disabled and started to drift. She is surrounded by several offshore tugs and other offshore units, cause of trouble unknown, ship’s status, condition unknown. Next day was under tow escorted by Senegalese patrol ships. As of 16th Oct she was sailing under own power at reduced speed of some 8-9 knots, ETA Las Palmas Oct 19.
Fire broke out in engine room of container ship at Tanjung Perak Port, Surabaya, Indonesia. Fire spread to superstructure and fire engines and tugs fighting fire both from berth and from seaside.

Vessel had issues with its starboard engine at Port of Montreal in Montreal, in position lat 45 33 27.4N, long 073 31 29.3W, Quebec, Canada. Proceeded to Quebec City with other engine to effect repairs.

Vessel suffered engine failure in northern Bosphorus, already completing the Strait transit, ballasting from Tuzla Turkey to Kavkaz Kerch Strait, Russia. Bulk carrier had to drop anchor, traffic was suspended. Traffic Control Center tugs responded and towed disabled vessel to Buyukdere Anchorage, back to the Strait.
Vesssel reported NUC west of La Coruna Spain, Atlantic, en route from Felixstowe UK to Canakkale Turkey. She was on tow by Spanish SAR tugs since Oct 14, after 27nm inshore drift.
Vessel had problem with its main engine cooling system. She was sidelined for repairs.Ferry Katama taken over the service, during night hours, same day.

Vessel had mechanical breakdown off Franquelin, Canada. She was towed to Baie-Comeau by tug. Had electronic problem, diagnosis underway. Crossing from Baie-Comeau to Matane cancelled as well as crossing between Matane and Godbout.

The Central Port Authority of Kalamata, Greece, was informed that the third Engineer of the vessel needed immediate hospital care. An Air Force helicopter hoisted the patient from the vessel and flew him to the military airport of Kalamata, where he was picked up by an ambulance and transferred to the General Hospital of Messinia. The vessel was 120nm southwest of Kalamata, en route to Suez.

Vessel leaked hundreds of litres HFO into harbour basin, W port of Hanko. Leakage was discovered by crew and rescue services worked on removing HFO. Vessel did not have major damage and moved to Helsinki same day.

Vessel en route from Damietta, Egypt to Midia, Romania in ballast, reported technical failure at end of Canakkale passage. She sheltered and anchored at Cardak anchorage. She sailed on 13 October after repairs.

A fishing boat was in collision with the vessel at the Black Sea entrance of the Bosphorus, off the coast of Türkeli Feneri. Two tugboats and a lifeboat were deployed to the scene by the General Directorate of Coastal Safety. No one was injured in the incident, but damage occurred and the cargo ship was anchored off Rumeli Feneri. On October 14th the vessel berthed in Poti.

Mooring wire wrapped around propeller of vessel and restricted manoeuvrability, 55 NM ESE Foula, Shetland. IEVOLI BLACK escorted her to Scalloway. Drydock at Orskov Yard A/S, Frederikshavn on 19 October. Sailed on 29 October.

Vessel had a malfunction to one of its main engines, 7 NM NW of Limnos, Greece. Vessel continued on to the port of Kavala. Departure was prohibited until repairs done and class maintenance was issued.

Vessel collided with towed barge loaded with coiled steel sheets, at Bangkok approach channel near red buoy No. 23, Samut Prakan waters, while proceeding to Bangkok, in poor visibility. No casualties, no injuries were reported. VASI STAR resumed moving shortly after collision, and berthed at Bangkok same day.

Vessel was disabled and adrift due to an engine failure in the vicinity of 12 00 00N, 109 21 00E, South China Sea, Vietnam. Vessels in vicinity requested to keep sharp lookout, assist and report to MRCC Vietnam.

Vessel allided with the stern of cargo ship NS Explorer during docking manoeuvres at berth No 1 of the MBM Port in Durres, Albania. The berthed NS Explorer suffered some damage to its stern, but remained seaworthy. The Kaptan Hilmi III was undamaged and immediately started discharging operations.

Vessel was struck by cargo ship Kaptan Hilmi III during docking manoeuvres at berth No 1 of the MBM Port in Durres, Albania. She suffered some damage to stern, but remained seaworthy. The Kaptan Hilmi III was undamaged and immediately started discharging operations.
Vessel had engine failure and was disabled while heading South along coast of Sunnmore.Tug was deployed to assist. Moored at Gurskebotn and resumed voyage 13 October.

Vessel suffered engine failure in front of Canakkale, Dardanelles, while transiting the Strait en route from Tekirdag to Italy. Traffic Control Center tugs responded, the ship is to be towed to Erenkoy Anchorage, southern Dardanelles.
Vessel had a problem with one of the engines at Port Louis, Mauritius, stuck for over 20 hrs. Repaired on 11 October and sailed towards Agalega.

Vessel went NUC and strayed off recommended traffic lane and ran aground in Baltic sea south of Aland, while en route from Gdynia Poland to Rauma Finland, Service BBX2. She managed to refloat by own means and resumed voyage. As of Oct 11, X PRESS GODAVARI was sailing in Gulf of Bothnia, heading for Rauma.

Vessel allided with residential house, fish cages, boats on Batanghari River in Tebat Patah Village, Muaro Jambi Regency, Indonesia. No injuries reported but losses estimated at Rp. 121,000,000 ($7,882).

Vessel grounded in approx pos 63 40 13.1N, 09 01 09.1E, Norway, carrying live salmon from fish farms. Refloated by own engine but suffered bottom damage. No pollution reported. Headed for Mone Verft at Rorvik for repairs.
Vessel had technical failure while at Turkeli anchorage, Turkey at northern entrance of Istanbul strait. She sailed after repairs on 11 October, bound for Reni, Ukraine.

Vessel had engine failure in the port main engine, while conducting main engine preparation checks. Passengers were transferred to another vessel and taken to their destinations. Repairs are underway.

Vessel ran aground in vicinity waters of Benoni Port, Camiguin, Philippines. Steering power failed and she veered off course. Philippine CG evacuated 103 passengers and 17 cargoes, which were taken by Super Shuttle Ferry 28.
Vessel was reported to have sunk on October 9th or earlier in Nouadhibou harbour, Mauritania. She capsized and rested starboard side on bottom, remaining partially above the waterline.

Vessel had engine failure South of Hitra, Norway. She was towed to Kvernhusvik Shipyard A/S, Melandsjo, then fire fighting tug Boa Brage towed to Sandness on 17 October. As of 26 October she was towed at Hirtshals.

Vessel requested medical assistance for five crew who were suffering from suspected gas poisoning. The tanker was anchored at Bakirkoy, Marmara Sea, Istanbul, bound for Novorossiysk, Sea of Azov, Russia. Apparently the crew were poisoned by fumes sitting in empty cargo tanks while undertaking tank cleaning or checking duties. The captain was also reported to have suffered gas poisoning. All five crew were evacuated by SAR boat and transferred to hospital. As of October 13th the vessel had reached Novorossiysk, here it was moored.
Vessel had engine failure at South entrance of Istanbul Strait. Tug Kurtarma 9 towed her to Kucukcekmece anchorage for repairs. Sailed from Istanbul on 17 October for Odessa, Russia.
Vessel reported engine problems while downbound, in the Saint-Lambert Lock, Quebec, Canada. Crew members completed repairs and vessel resumed voyage.
Vessel reported being disabled due to main engine issues caused by a leak in its lubricating system, in the Strait of Georgia, BC, Canada. Vessel's crew carried out repairs and resumed voyage.
Vessel had technical failure at Taman, Russia.  Departure was temporarily cancelled by HM until repairs. Crew carried out repairs in Istanbul from 23 Oct to 29 Oct, she sailed on 29 Oct.
Vessel ran aground in the Detroit River off Windsor, in position lat 42 20 36.6N, long 082 55 55.8W, Ontario, Canada. Vessel used two tugs to get alongside.

Vessel lost control in Chao Phraya river in Samut Prakan, Bangkok, while proceeding upstream in full load to an oil terminal. To avoid grounding, tanker had to drop anchor and reverse engine to full astern. She managed to stop being very close to embankment and riverside restaurant, scaring off diners. Later tanker safely reached destination, after offloading cargo she left Bangkok, bound for Sri Racha, Chonburi.
Vessel was disabled 30 NM west-southwest of Pointe Ouest on Anticosti Island, Quebec, Canada. She was towed to Riviere-au-Renard, Quebec, Canada.

Vessel was disabled due to maine engine issues, related to its cooling water system, at about 34 NM south of Cape St. James, Haida Gwaii, BC, Canada. Crew carried out repairs and vessel resumed voyage.

Vessel collided with Demerara Harbour Bridge in Demerara river, Georgetown, Guyana, while proceeding upstream to Guyoil pier or terminal, with cargo of fuel. The bridge was seriously damaged and rendered inoperable, at least partially, by Oct 10. Tanker reportedly, also sustained damages.
Vessel was NUC due to engine power failureen route from UK to Marsaxlokk, Malta. Vessel had issues fixed and was underway using own engine. No tug assistance was requested. No pollution reported.

Vessel, which was currently operating on Svanesund route, Sweden as replacement for Saturnus, during its scheduled maintenance had technical problems. Traffic on route was suspended. Vessel was sidelined in Svanesund for repairs.
Vessel had technical failure at Poti, Georgia. Departure permission temporarily cancelled by HM until repairs. Crew carried out repairs and vessel sailed for Yeysk next day.
Vessel reported experiencing engine issues, off Quebec, Canada. The crew members carried out repair works and the vessel continued voyage.

Vessel propeller was fouled by fishing nets while at anchor, in pos 50 05 36N, 005 02 07W, UK. Nets were retrieved but unable to make full assessment. Divers arrived to inspect. She moored at Falmouth on 08 October.

Vessel's second engineer injured, amputated thumb while working in engine room off New Brighton within river Mersey, UK. Holyhead MRCC coordinating. Vessel was berthed in port. SAR operation finished.

Vessel contacted brand new FPSO RUBY at Kakinada Anchorage, India, Bay of Bengal, causing damages to NOR GOLIATH gangway used to transfer offshore staff, and to FPSO RUBY staircases. Contact was caused by rough weather and high seas, nobody was injured. As of Oct 9, both vessels remained anchored off Kokinada.

Vessel had main engine issues, while preparing to leave berth at Milne Inlet, Nunavut, Canada. She was assisted by tug to Milne Inlet Inner Anch. Crews carried out repairs. Sailed from Milne Inlet Port same day.
Vessel had engine failure at SE off Rhodes Island, Greece. Tug attended vessel to Syros anchorage. Vessel sailed after repairs and sea trials on 04 November, bound for Garrucha.

Vessel was contacted by offshore support vessel NOR GOLIATH at Kakinada Anchorage, India, Bay of Bengal, causing damages to NOR GOLIATH gangway used to transfer offshore staff, and to FPSO RUBY staircases. Contact was caused by rough weather and high seas, nobody was injured. As of Oct 9, both vessels remained anchored off Kokinada.
Fire erupted in engine room at Alexandroupolis Port, northeast Greece, Aegean sea. Two fire engines and two tugs were deployed in fire fighting.
Vessel experienced blackout and was disabled, at about 11 NM south-southeast of Pointe Rouge, QC. The crew members carried out repair works and vessel continued voyage.
Vessel had bow thruster issues and was withdrawn from service next day. She sailed to Greenock, UK and berthed at Garvel Clyde Shipyard for repairs. Sailed from Greenock on 11 October.

UPDATE: Vessel reported sank on 13th October in Red sea after major fire. Many floating containers reported drifting in the area. Vessel caught fire in Red Sea while en route from Jeddah to Aden. Apparently fire erupted in containers, with thick black smoke billowing from burning containers, superstructure is engulfed in smoke and probably, fire. All 25 crew abandoned the ship and were rescued, understood by passing tanker. They were later taken by Saudi Arabia CG and disembarked at Jazan Port, Saudi Arabia, all are safe.
Vessel was reported as NUC due to leaking coolant pipe in engine room, in position lat 50 28 40N, long 00 24 26W. Repairs completed and vessel underway.
Vessel had major problems with its water supply after its arrival in port of Crotone, Italy.S pare parts were flown in from Germany to repair. Vessel will reach port Katakolon, Greece with delay.

Vessel encountered mechanical issue in Lake Michigan, Great Lakes, while en route from Milwaukee to Thunder Bay, Lake Superior. She was taken on tow by tug MEREDITH ASHTON, to be towed back to Milwaukee, ETA Oct 8.
Mechanical and electrical issues were identified after vessel arrived at Auckland, New Zealand. She was docked in Auckland as of 17 March 2023 and expected to return to Tonga next week after repairs.

Vessel collided with fishing vessel Guiding Light in pos 59 14 42N, 000 40 00W, UK. 8 crew members abandoned vessel and went into life rafts and were recovered by CG R900. SAR ops terminated. Vessel sank.
Vessel had water ingress in towing barge and was destabilized off Vauville, France. Barge weighed, cable broke. Tug Abeille Liberte passed a tow on barge and arrived in Cherbourg on 07 Oct.

Vessel allided with bridge over Rhein-Herne-Canal at N Star Park in Duisburg, Germany. Wheelhouse was completely torn off. Vessel allowed to resume sailing with temporary fix, arrived in Mannheim on 08 October.
Vessel collided with fishing vessel GUIDING STAR in pos 59 14 42N, 000 40 00W, UK. 8 crew abandoned to life raft and were recovered by CG R900. GUIDING STAR sank.
Vessel was disabled and adrift after engine failure, off Moltenort Liegengeblieben on Kiel Fjord during scheduled service. Tug Stein towed vessel to company's workshop pontoon in Kiel for repairs.
Vessel had engine issues as per news reports. She was taken off service between Islay and Colonsay, UK because of non-scheduled maintenance work on Port-side main engine turbo charger.

Vessel suffered engine failure in Bosphorus, near Yavuz Sultan Bridge, while transiting the Strait in northern direction, en route from Tuzla to Novorossiysk. Traffic Control Center tug responded, the ship exited Bosphorus and was anchored at Turkeli Anchorage, Black sea.

Vessel broke down in Nort sea / English Channel twice during 3 days, finally was taken on tow and towed to Brest. The ship left Immingham bound for Lisbon, and encountered main engine issue on Oct 5, she stopped, but crew managed to fix problem, and resume voyage. Early in the morning Oct 8 she suffered steering failure, and reportedly, requested assistance. SAR ship ABEILLE BOURBON responded, she was taken on tow in the afternoon Oct 8 and arrived at Brest in the morning Oct 9, where she was berthed. Remained berthed as of morning Oct 10.

Vessel suffered electrical failure shortly after unmooring, less than a mile off container terminal Vuosaari, Helsink, bound for Bremerhaven. The ship was disabled in exit fairway and understood, was anchored until tug or tugs responded. SKALAR was towed back to port and berthed.
Vessel reportedly allided with dock in Kitimat, BC, Canada. Moored in pos 53 59 54N, 128 40 60W and sailed on 14 October for Masan, Korea.
Vessel was removed from service between Claonaig and Lochranza on Arran, UK, after problem with generator. Engineers due to resolve the issue once spare part delivered.

Vessel was taken out of service Flakk - Rorvik, Norway after biodiesel spilled from tanker on board. 3 crew members were sent to hospital for check-up after they helped to remove diesel spill. Ferry deck cleaned.

Vessel collided with Norwegian fishing boat Tornado SW of Larvik, Norway, shortly after leaving Larvik en route to Copenhagen. Fishing boat sustained serious damages, but remained afloat, nobody was injured. EDMY returned to Larvik and was berthed. She sustained minor damages, like scratches and dents.

A crew member suffered a cardiac arrest in the engine control room when the ship was in the outer port of Emden, Germany. The local fire brigade, supported by volunteer forces from Larrelt and Twixlum, assisted in a difficult recovery. The man was then taken to hospital.
Vessel had engine failure and lost control at Lapseki point, Canakkale strait. Tug attended and towed to Sevketiye anchorage. She arrived at Novorossiysk on 09 October.

A medical evacuation was carried out when vessel was 100 miles north of Lanzarote, Canary Islands, , en route from Santa Cruz de Tenerife to Tanger Med. An SAR helicopter hoisted the sick crew member and transported him to the airport, where an ambulance was waiting to transfer him to a hospital for further care.

Vessel reported NUC due to leakage in engine cycle shut down causing loss of power, 18.5nm from Portland at 185.7 deg. Repairs were completed and vessel was underway the same day. Arrived at Maasvlakte Rotterdam on 06 October.
Vessel reported a crack in the side plating on its aft port-side quarter, in Detroit, United States.

Vessel serving between Saebo and Leknes, Norway had technical problems and went out of service. She was replaced by Roll On Roll Off Dalsfjord.Vessel was towed to Fiskarstrand Shipyard for repairs. Sailed from Fiskarstrand on 21st October.

Vessel lost control while sailing upstream in Danube river in Romanian waters below Tulcea and ran aground, damaging pontoon and three boats in the process. The ship is en route from Sulina Romania to Braila Romania, loaded with laminates. As of 1540 LT Oct 4, the ship seems to remain aground. No damages, no leak reported.
Vessel reported a machinery failure, in lat 54 30 40N, long 130 37 00W, while transiting Chatham Sound, in British Columbia. Crew carried out repairs and resumed voyage.

Vessel had a leak of exhaust gases from intake valves in No 1 cylinder of starboard main engine, approx in pos 39 31 53N, 20 06 47E, Greece. Sailed to Igoumenitsa where repairs took place and sailed on 04 October.
Vessel had technical system failure at Novorossiysk, Russia. State surveyors verified after repairs. Vessel sailed, reached and moored at Samsun on 05 October. Remains there as of 06 October.
Vessel en route from Aveiro, Portugal to Liverpool, UK, was reported NUC due to water ingress in cylinder No.8. No pollution. She sailed same day, arrived in Liverpool on 05 October.
Vessel was reported NUC due to fuel injector issue in pos 50 36 06N, 006 01 06W, UK. Fuel injector was replaced and she reached Belfast next day.

Vessel sank in Makhachkala Port, Dagestan, Russia, Caspian sea, in stormy weather. Dredger was deployed in dredging works in Makhachkala for at least 8 months. All crew safe. No other information available at the moment.
Vessel reported a mechanical failure of the port-side anchor winch, about 6.0 NM southeast off Les Escoumins, Quebec, Canada.

Vessel sank some 12 nm SE of Hai Phong, Vietnam, Gulf of Tonkin, while en route from Phu My to Hai Phong. Ship’s superstructure including upper deck is partially above waterline. Wreck position is marked with buoy. Understood crew are safe.Most probably, the ship was caught in typhoon.
Vessel had engine failure, loss of power at Kafireas strait NW off Andros Island, Greece. Tug Apollon towed vessel same day, arrived in Tsingeli on 4th October.
Vessel reported a small diesel oil spill during the transfer of bilge water ashore, in Inuvik, Northwest Territories, Canada. The crew members cleaned up the spill.
Vessel had damage to bow anchor hoisting system, while preparing to sail on scheduled service. She was prohibited to depart until repairs and certification.

Vessel ran aground in thick fog with 174 passengers and four crew members on board during its scheduled service from Vladivostok to Popov Island. The passengers were evacuated by personnel from the Russian Emergencies Ministry to other vessels and work started to refloat the vessel.

A hose broke while vessel was being loaded at the Tüpraş Izmit Refinery in Izmit, Turkey, causing asphalt to be scattered on the pier and on the side. There was pollution on the pier and in the water. The Metropolitan Municipality and the Provincial Directorate of Environment, Urbanization and Climate Change responded. Anti-pollution barriers with fuel absorbents were laid out, and cleaning work began.
Vessel had slow water ingress in position lat 53 32 57 N, long 0 13 39E, United Kingdom. Vessel continued its passage utilising pumps to maintain draft, stability.
Vessel collided with roro vessel HOUTOKU MARU in position 34 15 0N, 136 59 0E, Japan. It had scratches all over bow. Roro had crack in lower port stern. No pollution or injury.
Vessel collided with SITC Inchon in position 34 15 0N, 136 59 0E, Japan. It had crack in lower port stern. SITC had scratches all over bow. No pollution or injury.

Vesel struck Polish fishing boat DZI 18, 30 nm NE of Swinoujscie, Poland, while en route from Szczecin to Helsinki. Container ship dragged fishing boat in her bow for about an hour, until finally, ship’s watch spotted the boat and responded. 3 crew of DZI 18 were injured and hospitalized, boat was severely damaged, but remained afloat.
Vessel reported NUC due to a fuel injector replacement, about 39 NM SE of Lizard Point. No tug assistance was required and time for repair completion wa not reported.

A fire broke out aboard vessel in the southern Pagasitikos Gulf. The fire was extinguished by the crew. Two patrol vessels of the Coast Guard and the tug Christos VII arrived at the scene, but the ship was able to sail under its own power to the mooring of the port facility of Agria Volos, Magnesia, Thessaly, Greece. As of October 4th she was moored at Heraclio (Heraklion), Greece.

MRCC Vung Tau and Vietnamese Maritime Authorities were alerted by distress call from the ship, reporting mass crew poisoning. Vietnamese SAR ship approached bulk carrier and took on board 11 crew still alive, they’ve been transferred to hospital in Con Dao islands, of whom 2 died, 1 while on the way and 1 in hospital, the remaining 9 are treated in hospital for food poisoning, their condition understood to be stable. Vessel was en route from Koh Si Chang Anchorage, Thailand, to China.
Vessel reported a small crack in its No.5 bilge tank and experienced water ingress, abt 0.10 NM north of Calcite, Michigan, USA. Crew carried out repairs and vessel continued voyage.
Vessel reported to be disabled due to a cooling water leak, while alongside in the St. Lawrence River off Trois-Rivières, Quebec, Canada. The crew members carried out repair work.

Vessel struck anchored tanker GOLDEN DAISY at Ijmuiden Anchorage, Netherlands. ARM 18 sustained damages, but managed to return to home port under own power. Tanker portside in superstructure area suffered a big breach, fishing vessel’s bow severely damaged.

Dropped anchor after the total failure of the main engine cooling system off Les Razades in St. Lawrence River in pos 48 17 09.6N, 069 05 31W, 5.50NM W of Pointe a Cives, Quebec, Canada, on 17 Jun 2024. Sailed from anchorage after repairs on 25 Jun.
Vessel reported issues with steering gear, anchored in Pointe aux Trembles anchorage, QC. Technicians boarded vessel and carried out repairs. Following subsequent testing vessel proceeded its voyage.
Vessel, anchored at Ijmuiden Anchorage, Netherlands, was struck by Dutch fishing vessel ARM 18. Tanker portside in superstructure area suffered a big breach, fishing vessel’s bow severely damaged.
Vessel had stern tube oil leak in Port-Cartier, Quebec, Canada. She sailed on 29 Sep, reached Les Mechins, stationary in pos 49 00 18N, 066 58 40W at Verreault Navigation Inc. Shipyard on Sep 30.

A problem on forward engine of vessel resulted in cancellation of sailings between Southampton and Cowes, UK on 28 Sep 2022 and 29 Sep. Technicians carrying out repairs at New Cruise Terminal in Southampton.

Vessel allided with quay gantry crane, while approaching New Mooring CT at Chittagong, Bangladesh. She was moved to anchorage and Port Authority demanded approximately USD 4M for damaging gantry and 14day shutdown. She sailed from Chittagong on 4th November.

Vessel suffered rudder failure in southern Bosphorus shortly after she entered the Strait for a north bound transit, en route to Tuapse Russia. She was taken on tow by tugs and started moving back to most probably, Zeytinburnu anchorage, Istanbul, Marmara sea.

A civil service mariner disappeared from the vessel off the coast of Virginia. A 37-hour search was called off during the afternoon of September 29th. The circumstances of his disappearance are under investigation. As of October 1st the vessel had moored at Norfolk, Virginia.
Vessel was reported to be disabled due to a machinery failure, off Moresby Island, British Columbia, Canada. Crew carried out repairs and vessel continued voyage.
Vessel reported a minor fire in the engine room workshop while transiting in Trincomali Channel, British Columbia, Canada. The fire was extinguished by the crew using a portable fire extinguisher.

Vessel ran aground on the coast of South Bengkulu Regency, South Sumatra southwest coast. All people on board were rescued, Indonesian salvors tried to salvage the ship after sealing underwater hull breach, but shortly after she was taken off beach, on Oct 16, she developed list and sank in shallows, at 5-6 meters depth, remaining partially above water.

Vessel collided with container ship GSL GRANIA in Malacca Strait halfway between Malacca City and Singapore, en route to China. Both ships sustained heavy damages and have been anchored after collision.

Vessel collided Aframax tanker ZEPHYR I in Malacca Strait halfway between Malacca City and Singapore, en route from Savannah to Tanjung Pelepas. Both ships sustained heavy damages and have been anchored after collision.

Vessel ran aground in the shallow waters of Umashima Island in the Kurushima Straits off the coast of Imabari, Japan, en route from Niihama Port to South Korea. No injuries, no spill reported. A tug pulled the ship out a few hours after the grounding. As of September 28th the vessel was at Imabari anchorage.

Vessel caught on fire in waters of Atas Island in Samarinda city, Indonesia, during process of transferring coal to another ship; 4 tugboats helped to extinguish fire, 11 crews evacuated, 1 crew had burns.

Vessel had structural failure of cargo hold access ladder, side hatch coaming handrails, pertinent equipment at Hereke, Turkey, during cargo discharge operations. Sailed after repairs on 28 Aug for Durres.

Vessel had technical failure of maneuvering stations together with capstans, winches, at Novorossiysk, Russia. Crew did repairs, state surveyors verified repair status. Departure permission granted, sailed, 27 Sep.
Vessel had mechanical failure in starboard main engine, in pos 37 38 19N, 023 50 27E, Greece. Returned to Piraeus with vehicles and passengers and sailed off on 20 May 2023.

Vessel suffered a fire in the engine room while it was berthed at a terminal in the harbour of Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada. There were four crew members on board at the time. As of October 5th the vessel was moored at Vancouver Port.

Barge was caught by strong currents when approaching Pulau Tengah, Malaysia, en route from Singapore to Batam and ran aground while being towed by tug Independence. Indonesian rescue vessel Babinpotmar Sagulung was deployed and coordinated with the tug master, who had requested assistance. Both the Independence and Falcon Chief were refloated after about six hours and proceeded safely.

Technical issue with anchor occurred on vessel. Unable to return to Douglas, Isle of Man from Heysham, UK.Passengers taken to passenger ro/ro Manannan. Issue resolved, vessel can’t leave until tide rise.

Fire on board vessel with lagging on generator at Belfast, UK. NIFRS liaison officer attended, confirmed fire extinguished. Vessel shifted to shiprepair quay of Harland and Wolff assisted by tugs, after investigations sailed.
Vessel got its propeller fouled by its net, disabled in Norwegian Sea. Norwegian patrol ship KV Bergen took it in tow, berthed in Eggesbones, Norway on 26 Sep, sailed Eggesbones on Sep 26.

Vessel was caught by strong currents when approaching Pulau Tengah, Malaysia, en route from Singapore to Batam and ran aground while towing barge Falcon Chief. Indonesian rescue vessel Babinpotmar Sagulung was deployed and coordinated with the tug master, who had requested assistance. Both the Independence and Falcon Chief were refloated after about six hours and proceeded safely.

Vessel reported disabled, adrift in Gulf of Tonkin north of Da Nang. She was en route from Vung Tau to Macau. Salvage operation was underway but came to a halt due to approaching typhoon Noru, 14 crew were asked to abandon ship and were rescued by Vietnamese SAR ship in the afternoon Sep 26.

Vessel had engine failure at Southern entrance of Istanbul Strait. Fire fighting tug Nazim Tur and Kurtarma 12 took it in tow, sailed anchor pos 40 56 50.4N, 28 53 34.8E after troubleshooting on 26 Sep.

Vessel had damage to generator near Piraeus port anchorage, Greece. Safely moored at Piraeus anchorage. Piraeus Port Authority banned sailing until repairs done and presentation of seaworthiness certificate by class.
Vessel covering Nynashamn-Rostock route in Germany reported the breakage of a Vulkan joint, sidelined in Rostock. Roll on roll off with container capacity Cadena 3 as replacement until repairs.
Vessel had engine failure, loss of control at Kumburnu point in Istanbul Strait. Tug Mehmetcik towed vessel to Karanlik liman anchorage, same day. Vessel resumed voyage after repairs.

A mooring boom broke at jetty in Brunsbuttel, Germany and fell onto berthed vessel. Damaged lifeboat of ship. No injuries. Initially banned from sailing. Vessel resumed its voyage, ETA at Riga, Latvia, 27 Sep.

Vessel had propulsion issues, abt 5.10 nm southwest Cape Roger, in the Strait of Georgia off Bowen Island, British, Columbia, Canada. The crew members carried out repairs and the vessel continued its voyage.
Vessel  had engine failure, lost control at Nara point in Canakkale , Turkey. Sailed to Karanlik liman anchorage on 24 Sep. Crew doing repairs. Remains stationary as of 24 Sep.
Vessel ran aground on a rocky coast near Nichinan, Miyazaki Prefecture, Kyushu island, Japan, sailing in southern direction en route from Uwajima. No leak reported, salvage already commenced.

Explosion occurred on board of vessel, berthed at Pier 1, Incheon Inner Harbor. 42 years old Captain of Chinese nationality died in explosion, the rest of 14 crew left the ship, understood explosion was followed by fire. According to preliminary report, oxygen cylinder exploded. The ship arrived at Incheon on Sep 22 from China.
Vessel suffered main engline filter problems and anchored in pos 51 18 37N, 01 58 13E. A few hours later, problem fixed, vessel under way, resumed passage.

Vessel was under way, some 70 nm SE of Shanghai when it requested medical assistance to a crew member who suffered chemical burn, and whose condition was deteriorating. SAR vessel DONG HAI JIU 321 was sent, injured crew member was safely disembarked onto SAR vessel, and later transferred to hospital.
Vessel reported main engine issues in the Chenal des Grands Voiliers off Ile d'Orleans, Quebec, Canada. It proceeded to anchorage to perform repairs and resumed  its voyage after repair done.

Vessel was involved in a collision with a pleasure craft, in the Strait of Georgia off Richmond, British Columbia, Canada. GRENFELL 1 escorted the pleasure craft to Steveston, British Columbia, Canada.

Vessel en route from Ashdod, Israel to Koper, Slovenia in ballast had technical failure, sheltered and dropped anchor at Kemer anchorage, Turkey, sailed from Kemer, 24 Sep, bound for Koper, Slovenia, ETA 28 Sep.

Vessel ran aground at the edge of Harle fairway, about 1NM SSW of Wangerooge island, Germany, during outgoing tide. Lifeboat Fritz Thieme reached and pulled vessel off. Vessel returned to Harlesiel with own power.

Vessel brushed Indian fishing boat some 15 nm off Kochi, India, Arabian sea. Tanker according to local fishermen, didn’t stop and sailed away. Fishing boat was damaged but remained afloat, of 13 fishermen on board 4 were injured. GLOBAL PEAK stopped hours later, probably ordered to stop by Indian Coast Guard, for investigation.

Fire broke out on cargo deck while vessel was docked at Tacoma, USA. Fire was extinguished by the crew, electrical malfunction of the equipment on deck caused the accident, according to preliminary investigation. No injuries, no leak reported.

Vessel caught fire in Gulf of Finland, being en route from Ust Luga Russia to Turkey, understood in load. Fire was extinguished, nobody was injured but tanker was disabled and was adrift, surrounded by at least 3 CG and SAR ships and boats, both Finnish and Estonian.
Vessel disabled and adrift due to engine failure in approx pos 00 07 05S, 106 44 43E, as reported by RCC Basarnas, Indonesia. Ar in Southeast Malaysia Outer Port, Malaysia, 26 Sep and Sd same day.

Vessel serving between Thyboron and Agger, sidelined at its berth in Thyboron, Denmark due to malfunction of electrical system and been idle, as of 27 Sep, due to long delivery time for necessary spare parts.
Vessel was reported as NUC due to engine problems. Vessel rectified issues and continued its passage the same day. Ar in Zeebrugge, Belgium, 23 Sep and sailed same day.

Vessel, with 24 vehicles on board, en route to Chios, collided with bulk carrier PARADISE ISLAND in Kafirea Strait, Aegean sea, Greece. Reportedly both ships sustained minor damages but they were ordered to anchor at Karystos bay.
Vessel had damage to port main engine while proceeding in sea area N of Iraklion, Greece; sailed at reduced speed to Piraeus port, disembarked 355 passengers, vehicles. Sailed Drapetzona on 23 Sep.

Vessel en route from Bizerta, Tunisia to Tuzla, Turkey had engine failure off Mykonos Island, Greece. Tug Karapiperis 18 towed it to S of Mykonos Is. Arrived Tuzla shipyard on 29 Sep, repairs ongoing.

Vessel en route from Phu My in Vietnam to Soderhamn, Sweden got too close to  embankment of Kiel Canal, got stuck near Quarnbek close to Kiel, in foggy weather. Refloated unassisted, berthed in Kiel for investigations.

Tug with barge A M ATULYA reported disabled, adrift, 17 nm E of Hambantota, Sri Lanka. Ship’s last AIS dated Sep 16, when she was sailing south of Trincomalee in southern direction, destination unknown.

Vessel, en route from Spain to Aliaga Turkey, collided with ro-ro cargo ship PELAGITIS in Kafirea Strait, Aegean sea, Greece. Reportedly both ships sustained minor damages but they were ordered to anchor at Karystos bay.

Vessel ran onto breakwater of Nakajima Port, Nakajima island, Inner Japan Sea, while leaving the port, bound for Matsuyama. Ferry was refloated some 2 hours later, and returned to port. Understood there was no spill, ferry damages unknown.
Vessel had engine failure off Constanta, Romania. Repairs could not be carried out by crew. Tug Ayaz Bey secured vessel and towed her to Tuzla.
Vessel reported that one of its emergency fire pumps was unserviceable in lat 45 34 25N, long 073 30 39W. The vessel was placed under detention in Montreal until repairs are done.

Emergency services were deployed to vessel which had been berthed since August 4th in the port of Harlingen for repair works. A man had fallen into a cargo hold. The seriously injured victim was lifted from the hold by crane.

Vessel had fire on board while proceeding eastbound towards Battersea Power Station Pier, London, UK. Passengers evacuated. Captain alerted Port of London Authority, contacted London Fire Brigade. Fire extinguished.

Vesselrequested the urgent medical evacuation of a 54-year-old Filipino crew member due to a possible cardiovascular problem.She was 59 miles from Maspalomas, en route from Tanger-Med, Morocco, to Port Elizabeth, South Africa. An SAR helicopter hoisted the patient and transferred him to the Dr Negrín hospital.

Vessel had a partial blackout due to a failure of its auxiliary generator no. 3 while approaching lock 7, off Iroquois Island, Ontario, Canada. The crew carried out repairs and the vessel continued its voyage.
Vessel NUC due to defect with main engine cooling pump in position lat 50 22 24.0N, long 005 51 48.0W, UK. Engineering works done. Sailed on same day.
Vessel had technical problems and the service between Levang & Nesna, Norway was cancelled. Sidelined in Nesna for repairs. Resumed on 22 Aug.
Vessel had a technical problem and had to be taken out of service Starheim-Isane until further notice. Vessel remained sidelined in Starheim, Norway for troubleshooting, as of 20 Sep.

Vessel drifted aground at Chengshan, Weihai, Yellow sea, China. The ship earlier left Longyan port, Weihai, anchored, but under strong wind and waves brought by typhoon in East China sea, anchor dragged, and the ship drifted aground, issuing distress signal and asking for evac. All 25 crew were safely airlifted by rescued helicopter by noon.

A fire broke out in store room on sports deck near Les Cayes, Haiti; caused damage to area, smoke, deck 13 and parts of deck 12 closed. Fire under control. No injuries. Vessel arrived at Kravendijk on 20 Sep.

Vessel voyage interrupted due to mechanical problems. Dropped anchor off the port, awaiting spare parts for the repairs. Vessel left Tanger on 20 Sep, arrived in Algeciras on 29 Sep. ETA London Gateway 02 Oct.
Vessel had engine trouble in the approach of Weser 19; anchored off Spiekeroog island. Tug Nordic and support Neuwerk on scene. Approaching the Strom Quay in Bremerhaven with a delay of 5 hrs.

Vessel had to interrupt her voyage from Ashdod to Diliskelesi Turkey as she was ordered by Turkish Maritime Authorities to rescue some 300 illegal migrants on board of a boat. PAOLO TOPIC had to sail to Turkish waters. She reached Antalya anchorage in the evening Sep 20.

Vessel ran aground on the River Don near Konstantinovskaya, Russia. Tug Priboy was sent to assist. Ship traffic on the Don was not blocked. The vessel was refloated early next day and continued its passage to Rostov-on-Don. September 21st she was at the port of Rostov-on-Don.
Vessel en route from Bremerhaven to Rotterdam, lost engine power on New Weser Fairway,  went adrift amid strong winds. Engine restarted, remained stationary as of 20 Sep.
RCC New Orleans reported that distress signal received from vessel in position 27 10 25N, 090 21 52W, Gulf of Mexico, USA. Vessels in vicinity requested to keep sharp lookout, assist if possible.

Update: The 14 lost containers have been lifted and deposited onto a pier. The fuel that remained onboard was emptied safely. Divers have been working with the salvage master to establish the vessel’s centre of gravity. Shore-based mobile cranes and barges will be hired for the refloating operation. Vessel loaded with containers lost stability during offloading operation at Iskenderun Port, Turkey. The ship listed and capsized portside, resting on bottom stern and portside, partially above waterline. Many containers went overboard. No info yet on number of lost containers and their recovery; oil leak. Wreck is surrounded by booms, understood salvage, cleansing operation, containers recovery are under way.

Vessel had engine issues, abt 0.75 nm northwest of Pointe de la Durantaye, Chenal des Grands Voiliers off Saint-Michel-de-Bellechasse, QC. Vessel continued its voyage to Port-Cartier, QC to carry out repairs.
Vessel had technical failure of navigation systems, together with pertinent connections at Novorossiysk, Russia. Vessel left port after repairs on 17 Sep. Headed to Jebel Ali, ETA 20 Oct.

Vessel broke off her moorings at Guaraguao Oil Terminal, Puerto La Cruz, Venezuela, during loading of gasoline. Shortly after mooring lines broke, cargo hose also broke, and minutes after a fire erupted. Tanker was taken to Puerto Lacruze outer anchorage, and anchored, fire on pier and probably, on tanker too, was extinguished in some 40 minutes, no injuries reported.

Vessel reported low fuel pressure at approx 20 NM E of Lizard Point, UK. Vessel advised by owners to proceed to anch. at Fowey for repairs. Sailed after repairs on 19 Sep, arrived, moored at Ghent on 21 Sep.

Vessel broke off her moorings at Ravenna Italy, in stormy, rainy weather with wind in gusts exceeding 100 km/hour. 5 tugs responded, it took them some 4 hours to take ship under control and keep her in stable position, avoiding grounding or collision. The ship was docked back at Cruise Terminal in the afternoon. No injuries or damages reported.

10 robbers in wooden sampans boarded barge towed by tug, in position 01 19 32N, 04 18 30E, Ebound lane of Singapore St. Alarm raised by tug crew. Robbers stole cargo from barge and escaped. Informed Singapore VTIS.

Protestors from Greenpeace blocked vessel from unloading LNG at the Port of Röyttä in Finland. The arrival of Coral Energice was delayed for 24 hours by Greenpeace activists. The protest was an attempt to draw attention to ongoing LNG imports from Russia’s Vysotsk LNG Project.

Vessel reported failure of main engine lubricating oil pump, abt 10.40 NM S of Pointe a Michel in the St. Lawrence River off Rimouski, Quebec, Canada. Vessel proceeded under its own power to Port Alfred, QC for repairs.
Vessel broke off her moorings in the typhoon Muifa which raged over Shanghai and drifted aground.
Vessel broke off her moorings in the typhoon Muifa which raged over Shanghai.

Vessel had water ingress in engine room, disabled on wind turbine site, lat 48 40 59N, long 001 59 23W, France. Tug assisted, moored at Saint-Malo. Will inspect origin of engine failure and damage to hull.

Vessel en route from Great Yarmouth, UK to Harlingen, Netherlands had issue with engine abt 3 NM SW of Gorleston. Gorleston RNLI ALB assessed. Vessel continued under own power, arrive in Harlingen on 17 Sep.

Vessel experienced fire on board erupting from a refrigerated container, in lat 49 57 42N, long 005 40 15W, abt 5 NM from South Land's End. Fire was extinguished in 15 mins and vessel underway to destination.

Vessel was taking on water, in lat 52 35 19N, long 001 45 44E, abt 1 mile off Great Yarmouth, UK. Assisted to port by Gorleston RNLI lifeboat and Seacat Enterprise. Gorleston RNLI lifeboat-assisted pumping water.
Vessel reported as NUC due to defect fuel pumps, in position lat 49 47 05N, long 04 21 21W, about 24 NM south of Eddystone Lighthouse. Vessel underway.

Fire erupted in engine room., some 9 nm SW of tanker’s destination, Cinta Oil Terminal, Java sea, NW of Jakarta. Tanker drifted or moved dead ahead until 1830 LT Sep 16, when she anchored 18 nm north of Ciwandan, Java, Sunda Strait. Reportedly, fire was extinguished, situation understood to be under control
