Vessel was alleged to have polluted the Gulf of Izmit by discharging dirty ballast water. A pollution fine was imposed by the local municipality environmental pollution prevention department. As of September 18th the vessel was south of Istanbul in the Marmara sea, underway from Yarimca. Turkey, to Poti, Georgia, ETA September 23rd.
Vessel allided with a crane while departing Fraser Surrey Docks in Surrey, British Columbia, Canada. Vessel later resumed its voyage. No pollution reported.

Vessel developed heavy list after massive water ingress in ballast tanks in Arabian sea some 3 nm off India western coast, while en route from Khor Fakkan UAE to New Mangalore India, with 3,911 tons of bitumen on board. 19 crew abandoned tanker, they’ve been rescued by Indian Coast Guard. Tanker is afloat, Indian authorities demand owner to organize towage, and prevent possible leaks.
Vessel had technical failure during Canakkale strait passage in Gelibolu point. Sailed and anchored at Sevketiye anchorage on own. Crew doing repairs. Sailed from anchorage on 16 Sep 2022.
Vessel reported experiencing issues with its VHF radios, abt 3 NM North of Pointe de Yamachiche on Lac Saint-Pierre off Yamachiche, Quebec, Canada. The vessel continued to its destination port.
Vessel had damage to its port main engine while sailing from Iraklion port to Piraeus, Greece. Vessel arrived at Piraeus on 15 Sep for repairs, class inspection. No injuries or pollution.

Vessel had sustained damage to its rudder while proceeding from the port of Corfu to Igoumenitsa, Greece. She sailed to Igoumenitsa. Departure prohibited until repairs and issue of class maintenance certificate.

Fire erupted in engine room of vessel in Aegean sea, off Chios island western coast. Fire was extinguished by the crew, no injuries reported, but the ship had to be anchored in front of Agio Gala village, Chios.

Vessel was reported to have suffered a loss of deck cargo overboard during Typhoon Muifa, when the vessel was off Jeju Island, South Korea. It was initially reported that around 72 containers might have been lost overboard, while other containers stowed on deck could have sustained damages as a consequence of the movement of containers stowed on deck. As of October 7th the vessel was in the Malacca Strait, moored at Port Klang.

MRCC Mumbai reported vessel was disabled and adrift due to broken propeller shaft in position lat 18 03 00N, long 072 29 24E, India. Vessels in vicinity requested to lookout, assist if possible and report to MRCC.

Vessel touched bottom or ran aground in Long Pond, Conception Bay, Newfounland. She was refloated and anchored, but apparently, damaged. On Oct 4 she was taken on tow by 2 tugs (ATLANTIC FIR; ATLANTIC LARCH), to be towed to Les Mechins Canada, ETA Oct 10. While at anchor, she was fenced off with booms in stern area, light oil sheen was later observed.

Three pirates armed with firearms boarded German general cargo ship, anchored some 16 nm south of Conakry, from a boat, crew managed to muster in citadel, so no crew were injured or kidnapped. Pirates looted the ship and, understood, fled, unhampered. Shortly after attack, MARTINA heaved anchor and left anchorage, moving further of to sea.
Vessel had a failure of its port and starboard polar Lights, in lat 73 19 02N, long 070 03 00W, in the Baffin Bay off Bylot Island, Nunavut, Canada. Ar in the  Milne Inlet Port, Canada. 17 Sep.
Vessel while under the conduct of a pilot, reported not having propulsion power, in lat 46 49 44N, long 070 11 55W, while manoeuvring to get alongside in Quebec, Canada. Sd from Quebec same day.

Port Authority of Rhodes was informed of fire on open deck of vessel docked at Tourist Port of Rhodes, Greece; caused material damage to stored loungers on deck. Crew extinguished fire. Sailing allowed to Heraklion port.

ran aground on a coral reef in marine reserve in Gulf of Aqaba, Jordan, Red sea, while approaching port of destination Aqaba. She was refloated about an hour and a half later and towed to Aqaba anchorage. No news on possible oil leak, but according to Jordan Authorities, reef was damaged.

Vessel reported one of its diesel generators failed, blackout in position 47 16 30N, 070 32 00W, Quebec, Canada. Restarted main engine with remaining generators, sailed to Pointe-au-Pic to assess situation.
Vessel reportedly collided with Canadian Coast Guard Ship PENNANT BAY, in the south of L Anse au Clair, Newfoundland and Labrador, Canada.

Vessel held up in Boston, US as law enforcement authorities investigate allegations of sexual assaults OB with perpetrator, victim said to be crew members. Departure delayed, arrived at Saint John, Canada on 15 Sep.
Vessel reportedly allided with the wall in the Canso Canal, Nova Scotia, Canada.

Vessel collided with fish factory Tutungeni in foggy weather at slow speed in thick fog and dark of night in Walvis Bay, Namibia. Crew safe. Tutungeni had big hole in hull escorted vessel to port of Walvis Bay.

Vessel had leak, unable to start its engine 40 NM from Cape La Hague, France. Water ingress under control, engine started. Vessel returned to Cherbourg on 13 Sep escorted by Mona Rigolet of SNSM station.
Vessel collided with trawler Erica in foggy weather at slow speed in thick fog and dark of night in Walvis Bay, Namibia. Crew safe. Vessel had big hole in hull escorted Erica to port of Walvis Bay.

Vessel was reported NUC due to a defect to a valve in the main engine, in lat 49 39 05N, long 005 24 38W, abt 20 NM SW of Lizard Point. The engineer rectified the issue and continued its passage, the same day.

Vessel collided with dredger SCHELDEOORD in Brunsbuettel near Northern Lock. Dredger reportedly, was seriously damaged. Feeder resumed transit later same day, completed transit and as of Sep 13 was sailing in Baltic sea, soon to arrive at port of destination Gdansk.
Vessel was reported NUC due to an issue with the engine, in lat 50 32 34N, long 000 16 57W, abt S of Rampion Wind farm. Completed repairs on 12 Sep. Underway to destination.
Vessel reported as NUC, 25.2 NM from Lizard Point in pos 49 32 51N, 05 19 07W. Cylinder heads on main engine was replaced and the issue was fixed. The vessel is now underway to destination.

Vessel contacted wooden piles and then docked brand new US littoral combat ship USS MINNEAPOLIS ST. PAUL at Baltimore Inner Harbor, while being towed out of port. Both ships reportedly, sustained minor damages. Tall ship was towed from inner harbor and anchored in Baltimore harbor, Patapsco river.

Vessel had damage to port main engine, while proceeding off the port of Gaios, Paxos, Greece. PA banned departure of vessel until it repaired and certificate issued. Passengers transferred to another vessel.

Vessel had rudder problems while fishing in Oseberg field, Norway and requested assistance. NSSR lifeboat Bergen Kreds tasked from Floro. Vessel safely docked at berth 1 of EWOS Feed Factory in port of Floro on 12 Sep.
Vessel had technical failure during Canakkale strait passage, dropped anchor at Karanlik liman anch under strait pilot. Repairs by crew and vessel remains stationary at anchorage position.

Vessel leaked small amount of oil from stern area at Spiekeroog, Germany, due to damage in stern. Repairs complete at Mutzelfeldt Yard in Cuxhaven and berthed at Spiekeroog General Cargo Terminal on 14 Sep.

Vessel had technical failure during Istanbul strait passage and dropped anchor at Buyukdere anchorage under supervision of strait pilot. Sailed Sariyer on 12 Sep, arrived and anchored at Hereke on 13 Sep.

Vessel reported engine failure while anchored in pos 50 45 27N, 000 01 49E. Awaiting parts from shore to arrive in 3 hrs approx. Engine available if required. Completed the repairs, berthed in Shoreham, 12 Sep.

Greek CG fired vessel approx in pos 39 41 0N, 25 46 0E, Turkey. Had structural damages on bridge and accommodation block. No injury/water ingress. Reason unknown. Vessel berthed at Haydarpasa port repair pier on 13 Sep.

A dozen Nigerian stowaways were reported to have fled or been thrown from the Chinese-crewed bulk carrier when the ship was sailing along the Liberian coast, en route from Lagos to Orinoco. It was alleged that there had been 14 stowaways on board but that two of them had died in unclear circumstances. Of the 12 survivors, six of them swam to the shore and notified the Joint Security Task Force in Grand Kru. The other six were rescued by a Joint Security Task Force.
Vessel got stuck close to Teignmouth's shoreline, UK. Sailed but got into difficulty off the Point in Teignmouth around 25 mins. Tugs assisted to move. It berthed in port.

A Technical problem on board vessel delayed voyage from Puerto del Rosario upon Fuerte Ventura via Lanzarote to Cadiz, Spain; during berthing maneuver. Tug came to complete berthing maneuver. Repairs ongoing.
Vessel pushed underneath new container bridge in Bensersiel, Germany after it couldn’t be raised due to technical malfunction; 1 electric lifting cylinder deformed, bow hatch damage, removed.

Vessel ballasting from Lome Togo to Novorossiysk Russia, suffered engine failure, while transiting Dardanelles, in front of Gelibolu. The ship anchored in emergency, two hours later she was taken by tugs to Sevketiye anchorage, Marmara sea.

Vessel had technical failure of fire detection systems together with pertinent connections at Novorossiysk, Russia. Repairs completed, state surveyors verified repairs. Vessel sailed from Novorossiysk on 13 Sep.

Vessel reported fire in machinery workshop at 0.16nm SW Tsawwassen Ferry Terminal, in pos 49 00 16.3N, 123 08 05.8W, BC, Canada. Heat gun and some rechargeable batteries were damaged. Crew extinguished fire.
Vessel en route from Durban ZA to Tallinn Estonia collided with general cargo ship HELGE while both ships were sailing in the same direction. HELGE was breached and started taking on water.

Vessel collided with bulk carrier Hakata Queen which collided with Atlantic platform at wharf 1 of Barranquilla port, Colombia. Hakata Queen hit vessel at stern during its departure maneuver. Destroyed pier, rebuilt.

Vessel reported a release of diesel fuel while conducting gas freeing operations at a dock in position 49 15 18.0N, 055 02 00.0W, Canada. Containment and cleanup measures affected. Reported minor pollution.

Vessel, en route from Antwerp to Heroya Norway, collided with reefer WILD COSMOS in North sea 32 nm NW of Ringkobing, Denmark, while both ships were sailing in the same direction. HELGE was breached and started taking on water, but still afloat as of 9th September.

Vessel loaded with coal went out of control after unmooring at Barranquilla port, Colombia. The ship struck nearby aux pier with moored tug, and literally, wiped away pier. After contact, HAKATA QUEEN dropped anchor and was taken under control. Later she was taken out of port and anchored at Barranquilla outer anchorage.

A crew member went overboard in the North Sea for well over an hour, near the Shell gas platform Leman, around 33 miles north-east of Cromer off the coast of Great Yarmouth. He was rescued safely but was suffering from hypothermia. The Coastguard helicopter hoisted him and took him to hospital in Great Yarmouth.

1 barrel crude oil released from vessel during maintenance activity in position 08 00 59N, 056 54 51W, Guyana. Light sheen approx 13 miles NW of vessel observed by crew, activity stopped. Monitoring closely.
Vessel reported having made bottom contact while transiting in lat 42 07 35N, long 083 06 58W, in the Detroit River off Amherstburg, Ontario, Canada.

Vessel had issues with one of its engines while transiting in lat 47 55 05N, long 065 24 06W, Canada. Crew carried out repair works at the port of Paspebiac, moored and remains stationary as of 14 Sep.

Vessel with some 1,000 tons of fuel on board sank at anchorage off Diem Dien port channel, Thai Binh province, being caught in adverse weather. 7 crew rescued, no reports on oil leak yet, but authorities already deployed Oil Response Agency to deal with possible leak and oil on board.

Vessel ran aground on St. Lawrence river in Grondines, Portneuf, Canada after unsuccessful to emergency anchor in shipping channel at buoy D25; mechanical problems cause loss of main engine. Tug to refloat it.

Vessel en route from Chittagong to Singapore was reported disabled, adrift in Andaman sea 270 NNW of Phuket island. The ship reportedly, collided with 30-meter barge, and understood, sustained serious damages.

Vessel reported that controls for controllable pitch propeller failed in St. Lawrence River, 13.6nm North of Marsoui, in position lat 49 26 13.2N, long 066 00 00.0W, Quebec, Canada. She sailed to Les Mechins for repairs.
Vessel suddenly lost its anchor, hooked into a cable at the bottom and stuck on fjord outside Slovag ferry quay in Vestland, Norway. Connection suspended temporarily and lster cleared.
Vessel failed to transit Bosphorus after engine breakdown in front of Haydarpasa, Istanbul, Marmara sea. The ship was taken back to Ahirkapi Anchorage by Traffic Control tugs, and remained anchored.
Vessel had fire on board during welding works in pool equipment at Jos. L. Meyer Shipyard in Papenburg, Germany. Fire put out. Amount of damage unclear. Workers return on board.

Vessel collided with general cargo ship ANT at Amfilochia port, Ambracian Gulf, northwest Greece. Both ships reportedly, sustained damages, in bow section and in stb area. No leak occurred, both ships remain at port.

Vessel was detained by Inspectors of PSC of Port Authority of Olbia. Anchored in bay of port of Olbia. She was below minimum safety standards required by international law. Left anchorage on 11 Sep, headed Sagunto.
Vessel had engine problems off Terneuzen, Netherlands. She resumed voyage after engines restarted on 08 Sep. Vessel arrived, berthed at Uniport Terminal, Rotterdam on 09 Sep assisted by tugs.
Vessel reported being disabled due to a problem with its power management system, while departing Vanterm in Vancouver, BC, Canada. Crew carried out repairs and vessel resumed voyage.

Alert duty crew on board anchored vessel noticed 2 perpetrators boarding it via anchor chain at Suez Canal southern anch., Egypt. Crew direct search light towards perpetrators, perpetrators abort boarding, move away.

Vessel reported being disabled due to the main engine failure in lat 49 58 27N, long 061 35 12W, in the Gulf of St. Lawrence off Natashquan, Canada. The crew members carried out repairs and it resumed the voyage.

Vessel collided with general cargo ship GERDA S at Amfilochia port, Ambracian Gulf, northwest Greece. Both ships reportedly, sustained damages, in bow section and in stb area. No leak occurred, both ships remain at port.

Vessel had engine failure in Fehmarn Belt, Denmark, emergency anchor in fairway. Abt 9 hrs later crew restarted engine, resumed voyage with own power to destination. Ar Ust-Luga, Russia, 12 Sep and Sd 14 Sep.

Vessel which was serving on route Levanger-Hokstad as replacement for Ytteroy during its yard stay had to be sidelined due to technical trouble for repairs in Levanger port, Norway. Alternatives being worked on.

Vessel en route from Samsun, Turkey to Kavkaz, Russia in ballast condition had technical failure, sheltered and dropped anchor at Samsun anchorage. Crew doing repairs, vessel stationary at Sinop anch. as 09 Sep.

Vessel went adrift at the edge of the fairway in Elbe estuary, Germany; obstruction fouled propeller near Scharhorn Reef abt 15NM off port of Cuxhaven. Lifeboat Hermann Marwede establish towing connection.

Vessel had lost its port anchor while proceeding NW of Rhodes, Greece; sailed to port of Akadia, disembarked 437 passengers. Port Authority prohibited vessel departure, until another anchor secured, fitted, certificate.

Vessel suffered a small scavenge fire which was extinguished quickly by the crew. The ship, en route from Coryton to Hamburg lost the main engine in the course of the events and dropped anchor in the North Sea. She was assisted to the black deep anchorage by two tugs during the evening. Engineers started assessing the damage and the Corryton pilot remained on board.

Vessel had fire on board in Internal Bay of Buenaventura, Colombia. 29 crew safe. Sank in bay. Started spilling fuel, 08 Sep. 5% of 40,000 gallons of fuel. Divers found 3 fuel leak site, sealed. Investigation on.

Vessel contacted pier while mooring at Vierow Port, Mecklenburg-Vorpommern, Germany, Baltic sea, on arrival from Antwerp via Kiel Canal, with 2800 tons of fertilizers on board. Both ship and pier sustained damages, ship’s portside forecastle and bow are heavily dented. No hull breach, no leak reported.

Vessel had technical failure of navigation systems, magnetic compass, charts, VDR together with related systems at Novorossiysk, Russia. Departure permission cancelled until repairs. Vessel sailed on 08 Sep.
Vessel had an engine failure, NUC while transiting SW lane of Dover, UK. Anchored in TSS in position lat 50 39 32N, long 000 50 17E. Repairs done, resumed voyage same day. No pollution.

Vessel went NUC due to propeller pitch fault, unable to start engine, in position lat 49 56 48N, long 004 35 12W, UK. Monitored on AIS and VHF Communications and unable to give timescale for underway.
Vessel had engine failure, loss of power,NW of Bizerte, Tunisia. Repairs could not be done by crew. Tug Paul towed her to Tuzla anchorage on 30 Sep, berthed at Assan General Cargo Terminal of port.

Vessel came in collision with Wharf Bravo Pier at Goose Greek, Charleston, South Carolina, pier sustaines damages. Vessel berthed at N Florida Shipyard in Jacksonville on 18 Sep for repairs of significant damage

Vessel suffered fire in engine room, some 35 nm WNW of Hoek van Holland, Netherlands. Fire was extinguished by Halon fire suppressing system, but tanker was disabled. She’s to be towed to port of destination Rotterdam, en route from Singapore.

Vessel had steering issue in position 45 44 55N, 062 40 37W, Canada. Captain anchored between two berths. Steering functions. Sea trail successful. Returned service from Caribou, 05 Aug. No damage/injury/pollution.

Vessel had technical failure at Tuzla, Turkey. Departure permission was temporarily cancelled by the Harbour-Master until the completion of further repair works. Stationary at Tuzla, Turkey, as of 05 Sep.

Vessel and tug Alpha 1, controlling general cargo De Sal 1 collided with edge of retractor span of Demerara Harbour Bridge, Guyana. Pushed bridge out of alignment, damage 3 spans, buoys attached burst.

Vessel , en route from Constanta, Romania to Tuzla, Turkey had technical failure during Strait passage, anchored at Buyukdere anchorage under supervision of Strait pilot. Crew repairing. Sailed on 04 Sep.
Vessel, en route from Azov, Russia to Bartin, Turkey, had technical failure of navigation systems at Bartin. Departure permission canceled until repairs. Vessel stationary at Bartin as of 05 Sep.
Vessel en route from Tekirdag, Turkey to Rostov-na-Donu, Russia in ballast condition, had technical failure; sheltered, anchored in Sinop anchorage. Crew carrying out repairs as of 04 Sep.

Vessel suffered mechanical failure while transiting Bosphorus in northern direction en route to Chornomorsk, Ukraine. She had to anchor in emergency in Kandilli area. Istanbul Ship Traffic Control tugs responded, the ship started moving but she turned back, and was taken back to Marmara sea and anchored at Ahirkapi Anchorage.

While anchored with tank barge JOHN J.CARRICK in tow, vessel had main engine issues, in position lat 47 36 03N, long 070 03 06W, Quebec, Canada. Vessel and barge left the anchorage after repairs were completed.

Vessel had technical problems with engine, taken out of service on Smage-Orta-Finnoya-Sandoya-Ona route, Norway by operator Torghatten Nord; sidelined in Smage for repairs, waiting for spare parts from France.

Vessel had to cancel its sailings between Tangen and Horn until further notice; lost anchor during maintenance in Randsjord, Norway. Work being done to get temporary reserve anchor. Vessel located in Bjoneroa.
Vessel en route from Damietta, Egypt to Nemrut Bay, Turkey in ballast condition, had technical failure N of Rhodes Islands; shifted to N of Rhodes anchorage under own power same day. Crew repairing.

Vessel loaded with fuel oil encountered engine issues on arrival at Port Louis anchorage, Mauritius, from Caribbean. Tanker was banned from entering port on the grounds of expired safety certificate, and drifted west of Mauritius, waiting for spare parts. As of Sep 6 tanker was to enter Port Louis after completing repairs.

Vessel allided with a scaffolding in the new southern lock of Brunsbuttel, Germany upon entering lock chamber, which had scratches of 4m length. It resumed its voyage and arrived in Paldiski on Sep 5.
Vessel had a technical failure during Canakkale strait passage and dropped anchor at Karanlik liman anchorage. Crew doing repairs.

Fire erupted in cargo hold, at Petit-Couronne (Seine-Maritime), Rouen, France. 40 engines and 70 firefighters, plus tug, were deployed, fire was taken under control by the morning Sep 3, but fire wasn’t yet extinguished, firefighting continued well into the morning.

Vessel ran aground in Western Scheldt in front of Bath, while sailing downstream, en route from Antwerp to Zeebrugge. Tugs assisted, the ship was refloated and taken upstream to Schaar van Ouden Doel anchorage. No reports on damages.

Vessel allided with cargo ship ER Nazir, while the former was approaching berth No 1 at Saleef, Yemen. The Ince Karadeniz was dented in the forecastle area, while the ER Nazire suffered dents at the port side aft with a tear of about 40cmx40cm between the port side freshwater tank and the engine spare parts room. The starboard side also contacted the pier and caused damage to the fender and pier at berth No 2, which was dented on an area of about 9 metres x1 meter.

The US Coast Guard medevaced a 48-year-old man about 60nm south of Dutch Harbor, Alaska, en route from Keelung. An MH-60 Jayhawk helicopter hoisted the patient, and transported him to an awaiting LifeMed Alaska air ambulance in Cold Bay.

Bulk carrier Ince Karadeniz allided with cargo ship ER Nazir, while the former was approaching berth No 1 at Saleef, Yemen. The Ince Karadeniz was dented in the forecastle area, while the ER Nazire suffered dents at the port side aft with a tear of about 40cmx40cm between the port side freshwater tank and the engine spare parts room. The starboard side also contacted the pier and caused damage to the fender and pier at berth No 2, which was dented on an area of about 9 metres x1 meter.
Vessel had issues with its main engine in St. Lawrence River off Ile d'Orleans, Quebec, Canada. Vessel proceeded to anchorage in Rade Maheu, Quebec to conduct repairs, continued its voyage.

Vessel  boarded by 3 perpetrators while underway in E bound lane of Singapore Strait in pos 001 16 36N, 104 16 57E. Master activated alarm. Spare generator parts stolen. None injured. Vessel continued voyage to China.

Vessel ran aground in Bebek Bay, Bosphorus, Istanbul but was refloated hours later with several tugs assistance, and taken to Ahurkapi Anchorage, where she was anchored. LADY ZEHMA with cargo of corn is en route from Ukraine to Italy. Rudder failure said to be the cause of accident. No other damages reported.
Vessel suffered fire in engine room area and probably, some utility compartments but was extinguished by the crew in an hour.

Fire erupted on board the vessel in Yellow sea NE of Yantai. Tanker was en route from Huanghua Port to Lanshan. Fire reportedly was caused by fire works on cargo deck. SAR ships responded. Status and condition of tanker unknown.

Vessel had a mechanical failure during the process of starting the port main engine. Port Authority of Skopelos prohibited sailing until the engine was repaired and a class maintenance certificate was issued.

A container exploded at Crotone Port, Calabria, southern Italy, reportedly killing three crew and injuring one. Land fire teams and a tug were deployed, with the fire understood to have been extinguished after a couple of hours.
Vessel had technical error, charging problems, taken out of service bet Lavik-Oppedal, Norway. Route closed for the day, expected to be back operation next day.

Russian 63-year old Captain collapsed and died on board of the ship. His body was transferred to Arish Hospital for forensics, investigation and formalities required for sending body to Russia. The ship was positioned off Arish port, North Sinai, Governorate of Egypt, Sinai Peninsula.

Vessel had engine failure, lost of power in pos 37 34 30N, 25 43 00E. Anchor handling tug Pothitos II attended. Vessel secured, towage commenced. Vessel rescheduled to Nemrut Bay, Turkey, ETA, 01 Sep.

Vessel suffered engine failure in Barents sea some 50 nm north of Hammerfest, Finnmark, Norway, while en route from Haydarpasa Istanbul to Murmansk. As of Sep 1 the ship was still adrift, drifting some 10 nm in southern direction towards Norwegian coast. Norway Maritime Administration is readying tug in case towage will be required.
Vessel had technical failure, listed to SB side during Canakkale Strait passage, Turkey. Anchored at Sevketiye on own, crew repairing. Investigation on. Sailed after repairs on 01 Sep for Izmir.
Vessel NUC, drifting 34deg, 3knots due to nets tangled in propeller/fouled propeller approx. 18NM from Ramsgate, UK. Fishing vessel GO1 towed vessel to Ostend, Belgium.

UPDATE:  It transpired that container on pier near the ship was on fire. There was no fire on board of the ship. Fire erupted on board of vessel at Haydarpasa, Istanbul, since late 2021, understood under repairs. Firefighting teams and tug responded, fire in the aft section of the ship was extinguished.

Vessel had water ingress from ballast tanks to engine room, 8degree port side listed, at exit of westbound Dover TSS in position 50 33 35N, 000 02 17E. Water pumped out, no list. Water in lube oil. Tow awaits.

Vessel had issues with some of its main engine safety sensors off Grande-Vallee, in position lat 49 18 19.4N, long 065 08 03.7W, Quebec, Canada. Vessel proceeded to anchorage in Baie-Comeau for investigation.

Vessel ran aground because of steering (rudder) failure, while transiting Suez Canal in southern direction, halfway between Bitter Lakes and Suez. Canal Traffic Control tugs quickly responded, and she was refloated half an hour later. Tanker is en route from Portugal to Saudi Arabia, no damages are reported.
Vessel had engine issues off Cap aux Oies, in position lat 47 27 16.2N, long 070 12 06.0W, Quebec, Canada. Vessel proceeded to anchorage in Pointe-au-Pic to investigate the issues.

Vessel reported being disabled, in lat 49 57 46N, long 063 52 51W, in the Detroit de Jacques-Cartier, off Anticosti Island, Quebec, Canada. Towed to Riviere-au-Renard, Quebec by fishing vessel Cap Diamant.

It was alleged that, while coming to the outer anchorage of Chittagong Port, bulk carrier Golden Bright had allided with the vessel. The owner of Jahan Brothers filed a case for damages. Both vessels may have been damaged, but the report of the survey was yet to be released.

It was alleged that, while coming to the outer anchorage of Chittagong Port, the vessel had allided with Bangladeshi-owned bulk carrier Jahan Brothers. The owner of Jahan Brothers filed a case for damages. Both vessels may have been damaged, but the report of the survey was yet to be released.

A gang of 20 to 24 perpetrators in black face masks with guns, long knifes boarded vessel for 30 mins at Macapa anchorage area Alfa, Brazil; Paint stores, mooring ropes, items from accommodation area stolen.

Vessel allided with bullnose below lock 4 in Welland Canal off Thorold, in position 43 07 48N, 079 11 35W, Canada. Reported a hole on port stern quarter while departing lock 2. Repaired, resumed voyage on 31 Aug.

Vessel allided with pier at Eilat, Israel during berthing. Port side anchor heavily bent, surrounding plates indented; pier heavily damaged. Vessel sailed on 01 Sep after loading fertilizers and placing 250K LOU.

Vessel ran aground on a shallow muddy bottom in sea area of Nea Lampsakos, Greece, reported by Central Port Authority of Chalkida. Patrol vehicle attended. No leakages/injury/marine pollution. Sailing prohibited.

Vessel collided with LNG tanker ADAM LNG, while leaving anchorage off Gibraltar Point. ADAM LNG was anchored at the time of collision, and didn’t suffer serious damages. Bulk carrier sustained hull breach somewhere in fore asection, she developed heavy fore tilt and slight stb list, water ingress couldn’t be put under control, so the ship wastaken to the other side of the peninsula and grounded at Catalan Bay, to avoid sinking.

Vessel en route from Ras-Selata, Lebanon to Antalya, Turkey had technical failure off Antalya, Turkey. Repairs still being carried out by crew. Vessel drifting, repairs ongoing. Moored in Antalya on 01 Sep.

Fire erupted on car deck of ferry, in Baltic sea SW of Gotska Sandon island. Ferry with some 300 people on board and vehicles was en route from Stockholm to Ventspils Latvia, she stopped and went adrift shortly after fire started. Fire reportedly, was extinguished by the crewband the ferry is returning to Stockholm, most probably on tow, encircled by a number of tugs and SAR boats and ships.

Vessel was banned from sailing after entering new southern lock of Kiel Canal in Brunsbuttel, Germany with only one engine working, no bow thruster. Tug Luchs towed vessel to railway station pilings for repairs.

Bulk carrier OS 35 collided with vessel while leaving anchorage off Gibraltar Point. ADAM LNG was anchored at the time of collision, and didn’t suffer serious damages. Bulk carrier sustained hull breach somewhere in fore asection, she developed heavy fore tilt and slight stb list, water ingress couldn’t be put under control, so the ship wastaken to the other side of the peninsula and grounded at Catalan Bay, to avoid sinking.
Vessel reported having an electronic issue with its port engine, in position 47 22 44N, long 061 51 16W, off Cap-aux-Meules, Quebec, Canada. Sd from Cap-aux-Meules, 02 Sep.
Vessel had technical failure and sheltered at Cesme anchorage, Turkey. Crew doing repairs and vessel remains stationary at anchorage, Aug 30.

Vessel had technical failure during Istanbul strait passage and dropped anchor at Buyukdere anchorage under supervision of strait pilot. Crew commenced repairs, vessel remains at anchorage position as of 28 Aug.
Vessel had an engine issue and was anchored in lat 51 24 34N, long 001 59 07E, approx 22 NM on a bearing of 077 degrees from Port of Ramsgate. The vessel had minor engine trouble and is now underway.
Vessel was unable to leave the Port of Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada due to a tugboat strike. By August 30th the ship was underway again, travelling from Vancouver to the Hubard Glacier.
Reports of an explosion in the funnel section of vessel while wielding works was being carried out. At least 2 crew members were injured and hospitalised.

Vessel was boarded by three perpetrators armed with metal rods, hammers and knives, while she was transiting eastward along the Phillip Channel, Singapore Strait. The alarm was raised and a search of the vessel was conducted, but there were no further sightings of the perpetrators. There were no casualties and no items were reported stolen.
Vessel, while anchored,  collided with fishing vessel in position lat 48 51 15.1N, long 067 35 41.9W, Quebec, Canada. After inspecting for damage, both vessels continued their voyage.

Vessel had mechanical damage to port main engine while proceeding 2.5 NM off port of Corfu; sailed safely to port of Corfu, passengers disembarked. Departure prohibited until engine repairs, certificate.
Vessel had a propulsion failure and was disabled in St. Lawrence River off La Malbaie, in position lat 47 36 30.8N, long 070 07 19.0W, Quebec, Canada. Crew did repairs and vessel resumed its voyage.
Vessel ran aground onto shallows, in position lat 33 54 26N, long 130 51 01E, Kitakyushu, Japan. Refloated on its own same day.
Vessel ran aground off Gelibolu, Northern Dardanelles laden with grain.

Vessel NUC due to main engine failure in position lat 59 07 36N, long 000 23 13E, North Sea. Fishing vessel towing to Skagen, Denmark. Entered Norwegian waters and not planning to stop until it arriving Denmark.

Containers fell in Taipei Port, Taiwan, during offloading of vessel. Accident is believed to be caused by crane operator mishandling of the crane. EVER FOREVER arrived from USA, she left Taipei on Aug 29, on Aug 30 she already arrived at port of destination, Xiamen China.
Vessel caught fire while approaching Batangas, Philippines from Calapan, Mindoro. AT least one passenger was hospitalised and 9 reported missing.

Vessel en route from Aliaga, Turkey to Antalya, Turkey had fire on funnel, in way of engine room connection at Antalya anchorage, Turkey. Crew fought fire, controlled, cooling ops ongoing. Investigation on.
Vessel en route from Londonderry to Silloth, UK with 7 crew, a Pilot on board, ran aground off entrance to Silloth harbour. Refloated. No injury/pollution/water ingress/hull damage.

Vessel had engine issues, in lat 45 47 26N, long 073 20 37W, off Vercheres, Quebec, Canada. After a few minutes, the vessel regained power and anchored at the anchorage off Contrecoeur to investigate.

Fifteen perpetrators in 8 sampans approached and boarded a barge towed by underway vessel while transiting eastbound lane of Singapore Strait. Singapore police CG vessel responded. Crew safe. No property stolen.
Vessel was disabled due to its port variable frequency drive tripping off in Northumberland Strait off Logans Point, Canada. It proceeded to anchor nearby to prevent the risk of grounding.

Vessel had a mechanical failure in the starboard side main engine. The Port Authority of Kalymnos banned the vessel from sailing until the damage is repaired and the presentation of a seaworthy certificate

Vessel had water ingress due to unknown reasons while docked in Bjergsted in Stavanger, Norway. Crew started pumping out and situation under control. Captain notified a professional company for future assistance.
Vessel en route from Kaliningrad, ran aground for a short time at entrance to Legue commercial port, Saint-Brieuc, Cotes-d'Armor, France. With raising tide, vessel reached quay same day.

Vessel ran aground in the Dardanelles while approaching Akçansa en route from Ashdod. She was refloated during the afternoon of August 28th and taken to anchorage nearby. The divers will carry out a reinspection of the underwater section under supervision of a class surveyor.
Vessel informed Port Authority of Igoumenitsa, Greece that she lost anchor while mooring at Igoumenitsa; prohibited from sailing until anchor replaced, class seaworthiness certificate issued.

Vessel had mechanical failure in port outer ME en route from Tinos to Rafina, Greec. She reached Rafina using 3 MEs, disembarked 748 passengers and 134 vehicles safely. Vessel banned to sail until repairs done. Sailed on 26 Aug
Man overboard during work operations at Bonny Port. He was rescued and transferred to the hospital with sympthoms of hypothermia.
Vessel collided with a small boat at Dardanelles off Burhanli while transitting the Strait enroute from Novorossiysk, Russia to Perama, Greece.
Vessel ran aground, in position lat 63 40 21N, long 009 01 47E, Norway. Got free on its own power, resumed its voyage on 26 Aug.

Vessel had engine problems, off service while repaired; services between Oban and Kennacraig on mainland, UK and islands of Colonsay and Islay cancelled for the day. Repairs unsuccessful as of early next morning.

Vessel had technical failure at Antalya, Turkey. Departure permission canceled until repairs. State surveyors will attend on board to verify repair. Crew carrying repairs, vessel at Antalya anchorage as of 25 Aug.
Vessel ran onto a sandbank due to failed propeller and turned sharply to Femo. Detained by PA. Ferries put in operation to serve Asko-Femo. Few sailings from Fejo-Kragenaes were cancelled.

Fishing (general) Mondremad came in collision with anchored vessel BERTHOLD K. and sank off Saint-Nazaire, France. Master of fishing vessel sent distress call after collision. Fishing vessel Kiosga reach location, rescued 2 fishermen.

According to Societe des traversiers du Quebec vessel had to be sent to dry dock due to anomaly in hull. Service between Quebec and Levis, Canada reduced to 1 ship for start of school year, Alphonse-Desjardins on hold.
Vessel, serving as replacement for Queen of Surrey, had problem with fuel pump. Travellers stuck for hours at Horseshoe Bay ferry terminal, Canada. Repaired in Langdale, resumed service same day.
Vessel, while performing its scheduled route sustained damage to its starboard main engine. Iraklion Port Authority banned it until repairs are done. Repairs were completed and resumed its voyage.
Vessel collided FV Pedrito in fishing zone off Puerto Madryn, Argentina. Vessel still dragging, lost anchor, rail damaged at bow, SB bulwark bent. Pedrito lifted fishing gear. Both crew unharmed.
Vessel reported as the source of oil spillage into the Aqaba beaches, Red Sea. Unconfirmed reports that it was due to fulty bunker tank(s).

Vessel collided with fishing vessel Santiago I in fishing zone off Puerto Madryn, Argentina. Santiago I still dragging, lost anchor, rail damaged at bow, SB bulwark bent. Vessel lifted fishing gear. Both crew unharmed.

Vessel had technical failure at Novorossiysk, Russia. Departure permission cancelled by Harbour-Master until repairs. After cargo operation, vessel shifted from inner port to anchorage. Crew doing repairs.
Vessel was detained in Subic Bay, Philippines for allegedly smuggling 7K tons of sugar and in possession of forged documents.

Vessel had a malfunction in the port's internal main engine while it was alongside at the port of Paros. Port Authority prohibited it from sailing until repairs are done. Repairs completed and it resumed voyage.

Vessel allided with a wall while entering Lock No.4 in the Welland Canal off Thorold, Ontario. The vessel suffered minor damage and then moored 0.9nm from Thorold early on August 24th, where it remained stationary as of August 26th.
Reports that vessel encountered engine malfunction on approach to La Coruna, Spain. She was laden with about 70K tons of maize when incident occured and required tug boat assistance into the port.

Vessel ran aground on the coast of Salibabu Island, Sulawesi, Indonesia with 202 passengers and 17 crew members onboard. All passengers had to be evacuated safely. Poor visibility reported to be the main reason.
Vessel technical trouble with side thruster and was removed from service between Hidra and Kvellanstrand, Norway. Sidelined in Flekkefjord until further notice. Hidraferja replaced route.
Vessel had engine trouble outside Levang, Norway. Engine stopped, drifting ashore before crew started engine. LEGONA and Sanna on their way. Vessel sailed from Sandnessjoen on 27 Aug after repairs.

Vessel had a port main engine control failure, in lat 54 41 32N, long 130 26 51W, at Portland Inlet, Canada. With the vessel's starboard main engine fully functional, members attempted to affect repairs.

Vessel sank due to bad weather in waters of the Makassar Strait, South Sulawesi, Indonesia. Ferry Dharma Ferry 3 rescued 4. SAR is underway for finding 8 missing people. Body of missing engineer was recovered.
Reports of man overboard. Crew member seriously injured when he got tangled with a line and fell off. He managed to climb back onboard but required medical assistance soon after.
Vessel had technical failure and dropped anchor in Karanlik liman anch., in Canakkale St. Repaired by crew, resumed voyage and berthed Marmara Ereglisi on 24 Aug.
Vessel had technical failure during Canakkale  passage, Turkey, anchor at Karanlik liman anchorage. Crew commenced repairs. Sailed on 23 Aug.

Vessel had a problem with its propulsion in St. Lawrence River off Montaigu, in position 46 56 48N, 070 50 48W, Canada. Proceeded to nearest anchorage for technical investigation. Repairs done, resumed voyage.

The vessel, which arrived at the port of Monfalcone, Adriatic Sea, Italy from Paradip via Suez, lost part of its fuel into the water during bunkering. The cause of the accident remained unknown. A slick of diesel affected a section of the quay from bollard number 30 to 42 and required the intervention of an anti-pollution company.

Vessel enroute from Singapore to Middle East had damage to main engine turbine rotor assembly, 22 Aug 2022; 2 main engine turbine rotor assemblies damaged, 1 repaired at Cochin Port, India, sail Cochin to Middle East on 31 Aug.

Vessel under pilot conduct, had total failure of main engine, in position lat 49 17 28.8N, long 123 11 13.8W, British Columbia, Canada. Resumed voyage after repairs, berthed at Vancouver, Canada, 24 Aug.

Vessel had propulsion trouble at end of eastbound transit of Kiel Canal, Germany. Shifted to Kiel-Holtenau anch., dropped anchor for troubleshooting. Resumed voyage after repairs, 22 Aug. Arrived Vaasa, 30 Aug.

Explosion occurred on board vessel just before she was about to leave quay in Haugesund, Norway; caused by short circuit in battery of side propeller. Damaged door, batteries, no injuries. Shifted to Leirvik for repairs.

Boom draped over top of superstructure of vessel after pier collapsed underneath crane at Shipyard in Tuas area, Singapore. Rail mounted crane fell into water when section of quayside gave way adjacent to vessel.
Vessel had damage to the anchor winch during handling operations at the port of Myrina. The vessel was allowed a single passage to the port of Lavrion, with the port of Agios Efstrati in between.

Vessel had serious leak in bow thruster, significant water in-flow at Kallo lock, Antwerp, Belgium. Fire brigade assisted. By afternoon ship stabilized, propeller changed, leak patched. Vessel resumed operation.

Reports of fire onboard vessel during drydocking operations at Schiedam, Netherlands. 29-Mar-2022 : FV Alfonso V sustained damage to bow after collision with vessel (IMO:9139309) off Cabo Penas, Spain, 29 Mar 2022. FV headed tocompany shipyard Ipsa from Aviles, in San Juan de Nieva. Vessel berthed at Gijon, on 29 Mar and left port, today.
Vessel en route from Nemrut Bay to Istanbul in ballast condition had technical failure, sheltered and dropped anchor at Edremit anchorage, Turkey. Crew doing repairs.

Vessel arrested by the Malaysian Maritime Enforcement Agency for operating in Malaysian wasters without a valid permit. 13-Apr-2007 : Had engine problem 13 Apr 2007 and anchored at Beykoz Bay. Heaved anchor 14 Apr.

Vessel collided with bulk carrier AP Revelin in Sabine Pass, USA; engine shutdown cause steering loss; bow damage, took water. Structural damage to AP Revelin. No injury/pollution. Vessel reached Beaumont 26 Aug.

AP REVELIN collided with an unidentified cargo ship in Port Arthur Waters, Gulf of Mexico while the former was bound for Immingham. She sustained serious damage and forced to undergo further inspection at the port.
Vessel had engine damage during its eastbound transit of Kiel Canal, near Schwartenbek. Tugs Parat and Stein towed it to anchorage in Kiel-Holtenau. Sd from Friedrichsort, 22 Aug.

Vessel allided with dock at Jack Layton Ferry Terminal, Canada. 12 people injured. Fire boats disembark passengers. Cause unknown, schedule modified . Vessel will return to service after final series of checks.

Vessel had loss of electrical power, disabled on its scheduled route from port of Zakynthos to port of Kyllini, Greece; sailed under its own power to port of Kyllini, where it safely disembarked 440 people on board.
Chemical Tanker Ryoshin Maru collided with vessel at about two NM off Kushimoto, S coast of Honshu, Japan. Ryoshin Maru's bow collided with starboard side of vessel just forward of the pilothouse.
Vessel's cargo crane contacted  the Rokko Ohashi Bridge while sailing from Kobe Port, Japan in lat 34 41 56.7N, long 135 16 03.9E. The crane sustained scuffs and peeling paint.

Blackout reported onboard vessel while she was approaching Brunsbuttel Lock at the Kiel Canal. Anchor was dropped to avoid collision. Traffic suspended at the canal while divers and inspectors worked to ensure there were no damages. 05-Apr-2003 : Struck by drifting barge in Szczecin/Swinoujscie Channel during the night of Apr 5-6. Barge sank. Baltic Viking "practically intact". Sailed Police Apr 9 for Sweden.

Vessel had engine failure while entering new southern lock of Kiel Canal, Brunsbuttel, Germany. She ran aground in construction site region of new locks. Stationary at Voith Quay in N port of Kiel. Sd Kiel, 21 Aug.
Vessel had a main engine failure in St. Lawrence River off Baie Comeau, in position lat 49 06 02.0N, long 067 55 05.0W, Quebec, Canada. Proceeded to nearest anchorage for repair. No pollution.

RYOSHIN MARU collided with the XIN HAI 99 at Kushimoto, Wakayama Japan. Both vessesls were travelling in opposite direction when XIN HAI 99 was struck in the starboard superstructure area (sustaining severe hull breach and flooding in the engine room).

Crew member was hit by a truck during loading operations. He sustained injuries and had to be carried in ambulance for treatment. 10-Sep-2021 : A passenger onboard sustained injury and in critical condition forced vessel to sail to Thira from where he was disembarked and rushed to the local hospital. No further disclosure on the cause of the injury. 20-Mar-2021 : Vessel lost PS anchor while proceeding off Kasos Island, Greece on 20 Mar 2021, continued to Karpathos. P Auth of Karpathos detained it until another anchor fitted and class seaworthiness certificate issued. Sd Karpathos on 20 Mar.

Vessel had engine failure and lost power in Aegean Sea. Tug Pothitos II towed vessel to Iskenderun MMK port on 26 Aug. Discharge ops complete. Tug Anka 6 start tow on 02 Sep to Tuzla shipyard, ETA 09 Sep.
The Italian Coast Guard provided helicopter medevac for an injured child while vessel was off the coast of Sardinia.
Vessel had main engine failure, in lat 48 17 49N, long 069 22 57W, off Les Escoumins, Quebec, Canada. The vessel proceeded to the nearest anchorage for repairs.
Vessel had a port main engine failure, in lat 41 54 04N, long 083 04 07W, abt 19.50 NM WSW of Kingsville in Lake Erie. She proceeded to the nearest anchorage for repair works.
A fire broke out during dismantling works while moored at dock of Pescamex shipyard, Yukalpeten, Mexico. Dense smoke; no injuries or damage to shipyard, fire extinguished.

UPDATE: According to Russian Master report, his ship has nothing to do with the accident, but another unidentified ship, of similar size which was berthed next to EVOLUTION 8. Understood Korean sources and media mistook the ships, because it was night time and the ships were of similar size and type. Vessel struck berthed chemical tanker GOLDEN CREATION at Gamcheon, Busan, Korea, while shifting berths. Both ships were damaged in stern area. Russian Captain of EVOLUTION 8 was tested and found to be intoxicated. As of Aug 19, both ships remained berthed at Gamcheon harbor.
Vessel ran aground on N jetty near Galveston, Texas, USA. Vessel refloated on 19 Aug, proceeded to port of Galveston, escorted by tugs Henry T, Jessica Lynn and vessel Donna.

Vessel ran aground in Bali Strait, Indonesia. Strong winds dragged to shallow waters until ran aground approx 200M from shores of Pura Segar. Passengers evacuated, refloated and docked at Gilimanuk Harbor, 25 Aug.

Vessel had SB engine defect, in lat 55 17 31N, long 006 31 52W off Isle of Man, UK. Anchored at Douglas port for repairs, since repairs are not possible, on passage to Dun Laoghaire on port engine power only.

Reports of fire outbreak at the engine room causing serious damage to the turbo chargers. At least 2 of the 4 engines were totally destroyed. Vessel was enroute from Mobile, Alabama to Den Heldar, Netherlands.
A passenger onboard fell through several decks and was declared dead shortly after. Vessel was enroute from Kiel to Oslo when incident occured.

Young Ukranian Cadet reported to have died as a result of inhumane working conditions and heat stroke. He collapsed onboard while working long hours in horrible conditions. 22-Dec-2018 : Vsl came in contact  with alongside a barge due to strong current prevailed at Mongla Anchorage, 22 Dec 2018. Vsl sailed Mongla on 28 Dec 2018.

Vessel, on scheduled service on Molde-Vestnes route, Norway, had bow thruster failure, about 700 metres from shore in Molde. Tug tow vessel to port, people, vehicle disembarked, crew commence troubleshooting.

UPDATE: According to Russian Master report, his ship has nothing to do with the accident, but another unidentified ship, of similar size which was berthed next to EVOLUTION 8. Understood Korean sources and media mistook the ships, because it was night time and the ships were of similar size and type. Vessel was struck by Russian general cargo ship EVOLUTION 8 at Gamcheon, Busan, Korea, while shifting berths. Both ships were damaged in stern area. Russian Captain of EVOLUTION 8 was tested and found to be intoxicated. As of Aug 19, both ships remained berthed at Gamcheon harbor.
Vessel en route from Rotterdam, Netherlands to Providence, USA, with 28 people on board had defect with engine fuel leakage sensor at 17 NM SW Lizard Point. Defect rectified, continued its passage.

Vessel had a mechanical failure in oil pump of starboard main engine while arriving at Mastichari, Kos, Greece. Port Authority of Kos prohibited sailing until an emergency inspection done and engine repaired.
While towing barge MM Newfoundland, vessel had SB ME failure, in Gulf of St. Lawrence. Barge ran aground, later refloated, towed to Cap aux Meules. Vessel stationary at same place as of 19 Aug.

Vessel collided with bulk carrier JOY at Westhinder Anchorage, Ostend, Belgium. JOY was anchored at the time of collision, while MARITSA was under way after she heaved anchor and proceeded to destination port Ghent, on arrival from Constanta. Both ships sustained minor damages.
Vessel was disabled due to engine issues, while anchored in pos 49 16 56.8N, 123 10 45.5W, off Vancouver, at Anchorage 10 in English Bay, BC, Canada. Crew carried out the repairs.

Bulk carrier MARITSA collided with vessel at Westhinder Anchorage, Ostend, Belgium. JOY was anchored at the time of collision, while MARITSA was under way after she heaved anchor and proceeded to destination port Ghent, on arrival from Constanta. Both ships sustained minor damages.

Vessel collided with Korean 24-ton fishing vessel west of Taean County coast, western Korea, Yellow sea, while en route from Pyeongtaek to Mizushima Japan. Fishing vessel sank, 11 crew were rescued by cargo ship, all are safe. The ship moved to Jangansea Anchorage, north of Taean, and anchored for investigation.
Crew member injured during a snap wire incident onboard. Medevac was requested to take the casualty to the hospital.
Vessel collided with a floating trunk at port Gaios, Paxos. Shortly after, she experienced severe vibrations starboard side main engine. She had to be repaired after passengers disembarked.

Vessel had a fire in its port side generator room and was disabled in lat 73 14 07N, long 091 18 09W, at Batty Bay off Somerset Island, Nunavut. The fire was extinguished and vessel was anchored for repair works.

Vessel had failure of its navigation system along with communication units at Novorossiysk, Russia. Repairs were completed by the crew. Granted departure permission and sailed from Novorossiysk 17 Aug.
Vessel ran aground south of Westport, near Cohassett Beach, Washington. No injuries. Salvage planned, remained onshore. Cause unknown, investigation underway.

Chinese crew member was electrocuted at Veracruz, Mexico. The vessel had arrived at Veracruz on Aug 3 from China. Sailor was electrocuted while doing his job by accidentally touching wires or outlet. His body was taken to hospital for forensic, investigation under way.
Vessel NUC due to a faulty fuel pump, in position lat 50 51 48N, long 006 01 12W, UK. Repairs done, resumed voyage on same day.
Port Authority of Rafina was informed about mechanical damage to the starboard side main engine of vessel. Banned from sailing until repairs done. Repairs done by crew, vessel sailed same day.

Vessel suffered engine failure in southern Dardanelles off Kumkale, while en route from Gibraltar to Istanbul, apparently in ballast. Canakkale Traffic Control tug responded, tanker was taken to Bozcaada northern anchorage and anchored.

Vessel suffered an engine failure at Jorf Lasfar, Morocco. Repairs could not be carried out by the crew so tug Seabuffalo was appointed to tow the ship to Tuzla, Turkey for repairs. The towage operation started on August 27th, with an ETA at Tuzla of September 10th.
Vessel was listed as Not Under Command, about 150 miles to the west of northern Madagascar while en route from Colombo, Sri Lanka to Beira, Mozambique.
The fire brigade attended to a fire on board vessel, at the port of Piombino, Italy. The flames were quickly extinguished. Cause of the fire was being investigated.

Vessel collided with yacht Rustler 36 Bayanat while completing the SITraN Challenge to Les Sables d’Olonne, France, 120 NM off Gijon, Spain. Yacht bow crushed, arrive Port-Olona 16 Aug; crew safe. Vessel docked in Bilbao.

Vessel suffered engine failure in central part of Dardanelles while transiting the Strait in southern direction, en route from Sulina Romania to Tripoli Lebanon. Canakkale Traffic Control tugs responded, freighter was towed to Karanlik anchorage, southern Dardanelles, and anchored.

Vessel ran aground north of Ras Gharib, Egypt, Gulf of Suez, while en route from Suez to Jeddah, Saudi Arabia, with cargo of cars on board. According to report, the ship suffered mechanical failure and had to anchor, later she drifted aground in stormy conditions. Problem was fixed, the ship was refloated and resumed voyage.

Vessel had mechanical failure which led to travel delays, confusion on both sides of Vineyard Sound, Vineyard and Woods Hole, USA; rear port governor fail, had to be replaced. Operator SSA swap in ferry Sankaty.

Vessel caused oil spill due to faulty bunker tank on Aqaba anch. Oil drifted on Aqaba beaches, emergency anti pollution teams responded. Beach safe and slick not affected Marine env., Spill size not known

Vessel suffered engine failure while entering Bosphorus from Marmara sea, en route from Egypt to Russia, Black sea. Istanbul Traffic Control Center tugs responded, tanker was taken to Bakirkoy anchorage, Istanbul, Marmara sea.

Vessel reported discharge of fuel into the water during fuelling operations of Miami, US. CG cleaning spill. Amount spilled unknown as of 14 Aug. Vessel sail Miami on 15 Aug for Kingston, Jamaica, ETA 17 Aug.

Vessel detained by authorities at Savona, Italy due to deficiencies with the structure and overall safety conditions. 21-Sep-2017 : Grounded on River Elbe off Hamburg-Cranz at the Muhlenberg Hole 21 Sep 2017. Tugs assisted & pulled vessel to Monckeberg Quay in port of Hamburg same day. Entered shipyard 27 Sep. Departed yard 10 Oct & moored in River Elbe. Sd Hamburg 30 Oct.

Vessel had malfunction after foreign object stuck in water propulsion system E of Kea Island, Greece; reached Piraeus. Departure prohibited until repairs, certification. Sail after crew carry out repairs same day.

Sailings of vessel, between Argentia and North Sydney, Nova Scotia, was cancelled, due to a mechanical issue with one of the engines, from 12 Aug 2022 to 14 Aug. Maintenance crew fix the issue and it sailed.

Vessel had engine failure, lost power, in lat 37 02 0N, long 003 58 30E, Algeria. Repairs not carried by crew. Tug attended and towed from incident scene. ETA at Alger, 15 Aug. Berthed Skikda Containers Quay no. 34

Southern lock of Kiel Canal, Germany barred for shipping after barrels loaded onto vessel broke off crane, fell into lock chamber, onto fender woods. Fire brigade attended, acid barrel secured, all barrels lifted.

A fire broke out on boardvessel while it was moored in the port of Svetly near Kaliningrad on the Baltic Sea. There were no reports on casualties. The fire affected an area of 12 square meters, and there was no threat of spread. Firefighting units from Kaliningrad, Svetly and Baltiysk attended the scene.

Fire broke out in a car on board vessel while sailing between Halhjem and Vage in Tysnes, Norway. Crew brought fire under control, 1 person needed medical care. Vessel docked at Vage, all passengers, cars disembarked.
Vessel NUC due to issue with its engine, in pos 59 59 05N, 001 16 01E, abt 73.5 NM at 097 degrees from Lerwick. Comms relayed via Armada Kraken, repairs completed, vessel continued its passage.
Vessel reported crane having struck power lines in Keating Channel in Toronto, Ontario, Canada, while towing tank barge MM 170B. 4 power lines and boom of crane were reported as damaged.

Korean tanker 103 DONG SUNG collided with vessel at Busan outer anchorage, probably during tanker approach. Understood tanker was to bunker bulk carrier, but the ship went out of control and struck anchored KUAI BANG HAI 18 which suffered hull breach in ballast tank area 2 meters above waterline, with ensuing ballast water leak.

Vessel was approached by unknown boat while anchored at Freetown anchorage, Sierra Leone; perpetrator boarded vessel, guard on board vessel spotted perpetrator, directed flashlight, perpetrator escaped. Vessel, crew safe.
Due to technical problems vessel left port of Marseille, France with significant delay. Vessel headed to Barcelona, Spain where it berthed on 12 Aug, passengers disembarked.

Vessel collided with Chinese bulk carrier KUAI BANG HAI 18 at Busan outer anchorage, probably during tanker approach. Understood tanker was to bunker bulk carrier, but went out of control and struck anchored KUAI BANG HAI 18. Bulk carrier suffered hull breach in ballast tank area 2 meters above waterline, with ensuing ballast water leak.
Vessel ran aground and stuck on a sand bar on lower Warnow off former Neptun Shipyard, Germany. Sailing vessel Zephyr assisted to refloat. Berthed in port of Rostock. No injuries/spills.

Vessel was hit by extra tropical cyclone. Battering of metre high waves cause loss of lifeboat in storm abt 400 NM off coast of Santa Catarina, Brazil. Lifeboat plunged down into sea, later capsized, damaged, drifting.
Vessel had technical failure during Strait passage at Guzelyali point Canakkale Strait, Turkey. Sailed to Karanlik liman anchorage. Crew doing repairs. Remains stationary at anchorage position.

Vessel was disabled and adrift due to limited engine power which began on August 9th. Vessels in the vicinity were requested to keep a sharp lookout, assist if possible and report to the MRCC Mumbai. As of August 12th the vessel was reported as underway north-west of Mumbai on India’s west coast.

Vessel collided with Ain Snan Express in descending lane of Ouessant Traffic Separation Scheme, France; its bow sank, Ain Snan Express sustained breach of 6M length, 1M width in hull, 3.50M above waterline.

Vessel reported aborting approach to Larne due to technical problem with generator, in lat 54 52 25N, long 005 47 38W, 3.5 NM SW of East Maidens Lighthouse. The vessel effected repair and underway. Ar Larne, 10 Aug.

Vessel in ballast condition, had propulsion trouble and went adrift, in position lat 16 51 42S, long 003 25 42E, South Atlantic. Attempt made to fix, tugs assisted and towed to Cape Town, ETA, 01 Sep.

Vessel contacted berthed unidentified container ship and struck gantry crane while mooring at Hai An Port, Hai Phong, Vietnam. Both ships sustained slight damages, but gantry crane of German production, installed in 2012, is said to sustain serious damages. As of Aug 19, TIGER MAANSHAN was still berthed at Hai An Port.

A fire broke out aboard oil major Equinor’s FPSO Johan Castberg, which is under construction at a shipyard in Norway. Workers were evacuated and there were no reports of injuries. Equinor said that the vessel suffered only minor damage and that the project’s timeline would not be affected.

Vessel ran aground on Igbon island coast, Philippines, while en route from Iloilo to Cebu. Ferry ran aground because she tried to avoid collision with fishing vessel. Understood passengers remain on board, there’s no danger, refloating attempts are under way. No leak reported.

Major technical problem on board vessel caused changes in itinerary, when power supply, air-conditioning failed. Vessel did not leave Barcelona. After repairs vessel sail Barcelona on 10 Aug, arrive Valencia on 11 Aug.

Vessel collided with French fishing vessel CORAIL in Ouessant Traffic Separation Zone some 40 nm west of Ushant (Ouessant) island, while en route from Southampton to Suez. Fishing vessel’s bow was badly damaged, flooded, but managed to return to Lorient under own power. Container ship suffered hull breach 6x1 meter, 3.5 meter above waterline, and resumed voyage.

Vessel took on water, issued Mayday call about 60 NM off St. John's, Canada. Supply vessels Atlantic Griffon, Atlantic Shrike arrived, 7 people, 2 dogs rescued. CG issue navigational warning monitor for pollution.
Vessel reported disabled due to a main engine transmission failure in Labrador Sea off Makkovik, in position lat 55 08 11.8N, long 058 18 09.3W, Canada. Towed to Makkovik by LISA MARIE &BROTHERS.

A 31-year-old crew member was assumed to have deliberately jumped overboard from the Eurodam near Juneau, Alaska. A search operation began straight away with emergency services being despatched. However search efforts to locate the missing man were stopped the same afternoon.

Vessel disabled due to a machinery failure while transiting English Bay in Vancouver, in position 49 17 16.7N, 123 09 40.8W, British Columbia, Canada. Proceeded to a nearby anchorage with tugs assistance.
Vessel during berthing maneuvere, SB rear quarter panama and poop deck damaged by Ashdod tug at Ashdod, Israel. It was carrying out repairs at the port of Haifa and sailed from port on 13 Aug.

Vessel reported a problem with its port azimuth thruster and it was docked in the Detroit de Jacques-Cartier in Havre-Saint-Pierre, Quebec, Canada. The vessel completed repairs and resumed operations.

Vessel had a propulsion failure upon departing from Dock No. 94 of the Port of Montreal, in lat 45 36 42.9N, long 073 30 21.7W, Quebec, Canada. Remains moored for a technical inspection. Sd from Montreal, 09 Aug.

Vessel operating in Bay of Campeche offshore fields, Mexico, Gulf of Mexico, was boarded and looted by 10 armed persons. Perpetrators tied up 10 people and intimidated others, they stole some 30 Self-contained breathing apparatus (SCBA), communication equipment and other valuables, and fled.

Vessel lost part of her deck cargo lnear Preobrazhenya, southern Primorye, Russia, Japan sea. She loaded timber at Olga port, Primorye and was sailing in southern direction, destination unknown. After accident the ship sailed to Plastun Bay, north of Preobrazheniya, and was anchored there. Seaside at Preobrazheniya is littered with tons of planks, washed ashore.

General cargo with container capacity Rix Emerald allided with corner of pier in Vierow, Germany, then collided with berthed vessel RIX BAY. No injury. Slight damage to both vessels, investigation on. Sd 09 Aug.

Vessel allided with corner of pier in Vierow, Germany, then collided with berthed general cargo with container capacity Rix Bay. No injuries. Slight damage to both vessels, investigation on. Sd on 10 Aug.
Vessel reported NUC due to leaking high-pressure hose in position lat 50 30 34.0N, long 001 00 26.0W, UK. High-pressure hose replaced, resumed voyage. Ar in Santander, 09 Aug.

Vessel collided with coastal cargo ship XINGHANG (XH489), southeast of Ningbo, Zhejiang province, East China sea, while sailing in southern direction en route from Qingdao to Hong Kong. XINGHANG (XH489) sank, of 4 people on board 3 were rescued, 1 died in collision. BF TIGER interrupted voyage and was brought to anchor off Ningbo. As of Aug 9, she remained in the same position.
Vessel had engine failure, lost of control at southern entrance of Istanbul Strait. Tug Kurtarma-12 rescued, secured and towed it to Istanbul anchorage, repairs commenced by crew.

Fire erupted on Aug 7 or 8, when the ship was approaching Colombo or was already anchored, on arrival from Singapore. On Aug 8 ZIM CHARLESTON left Colombo waters and sailed in western direction, turned back and returned during Aug 8-9. was berthed on Aug 11. as of Aug 16, remained berthed. Some 300 containers are probably, damaged.

Vessel was taken out of service in Livorno-Bastia route in Italy due to problems with engine, air conditioning system. Sidelined at Livorno Cruise Terminal for repairs. Vessel sailed Livorno on 15 Aug.

Vessel allided with the wharf upon the mooring operation in the port of Aegina, Greece. She was on a scheduled route from the port of Piraeus to the port of Aegina, with 591 passengers on board. The ship moored safely in the port, but the mooring cable got entangled in the starboard side propeller shaft, causing the main engine to become blocked. The passengers and their vehicles were safely disembarked at the port.
Vessel missed a sailing due to a technical issue on the island's busiest day of the year. Police had to be called to Ardrossan port to calm passengers down as well at Mallaig.

Vessel reported that port engine not operational in Gordon Channel off Pine Island, in position 50 59 28N, 127 45 37W, Canada. Continued voyage to Port Hardy using starboard engine and docked with tug assistance.
Vessel had engine failure, lost power at central part of Ionian Sea. Tug Agonistis Z attended, towed, anchored at Katakolon anchorage. Repairs ongoing as of 12 Aug. Sail on 18 Aug for Ravenna.

Vessel suffered engine failure in Gulf of Tonkin, some 120 nm west of southwestern Hainan,while en route from Vietnam to Nansha, Hong Kong. Chinese SAR ship NAN HAI JIU 116 towed her to Shenzhen (Hong Kong) waters on Aug 12.
Vessel had failure of its port main engine off Grande-Entree, in position lat 47 22 31.8N, long 061 51 11.3W, Quebec, Canada. Vessel proceeded to Cap-aux-Meules for repairs.

Vessel reported as NUC following engine blackout due to fault in freshwater cooling system at 17.30 NM at 080 deg from Southwold Lighthouse, UK. On 07 Aug, completed repairs, testing, resumed passage to Sweden.

Due to series of human errors vessel capsized/sank during unloading ops at Puerto Madryn, Argentina. Weight shifting manoeuvres caused vessel to tilt heavily to SB side. Refloating ops to take about 4 months.
The Almería Maritime Captaincy has prohibited the departure of vessel until damage to one main engine, plus the bow thruster, had been resolved. Later, the vessel finally left Almería after repairs.

Vessel had failure of its bow ramp hydraulic hose upon departing in NW Arm off North Sydney, Nova Scotia, Canada. Approximately 15L of Hydraulic Oil released on vessel, dock and sea. Minor pollution reported.
Vessel had technical failure at Novorossiysk, Russia. Harbour Master cancel departure permission until repairs. Permanent repairs being done by crew. Sailed after repairs on 08 Aug.
Vessel ran aground north of Mongstad, Norway, while en route from Hareid to Bergen. Norwegian SAR responded, sending ship or ships to assist. So far, no water ingress, no leak reported.
Vessel had a technical failure at Guzelyali point, in Canakkale strait. Shifted from place of incident to Karanlik liman anchorage in Strait with its own power. Berthed at Altinova on 07 Aug.

Vessel had a failure of its port main engine whilst berthing in Port of Montreal, in lat 45 30 24.2N, long 073 32 45.1W, Quebec, Canada. Remains moored for further investigation. Sd from Montreal, 05 Aug.

Vessel drifted onto anchored bulk carrier SSI PROVIDENCE at Ahirkapi Anchorage, Istanbul. SSI PROVIDENCE was receiving supplies at that moment, supply boat could be crashed between two big ships, but escaped thanks to quick respond. Bulk carrier PHILIPP OLDENDORFF arrived from Kerch Strait Russia, understood in load. Extent of damages unknown, cause of PHILIPP OLDENDORFF going out of control unknown.

Bulk carrier PHILIPP OLDENDORFF drifted onto anchored bulk carrier SSI PROVIDENCE at Ahirkapi Anchorage, Istanbul. SSI PROVIDENCE was receiving supplies at that moment, supply boat could be crashed between two big ships, but escaped, thanks to quick respond. She had arrived from Haifa and she was bound for Burgas, Bulgaria. Cause of incident and extent of damages unknown.

Vessel had mechanical difficulty with engine control transfer; consequently BC Ferries  cancelled 6 sailings of vessel departing Langdale and Horseshoe Bay, Canada. Employees working to resolve problem.
Vessel had main engine failure and was disabled, in lat 41 56 22N, long 083 05 56W, on Lake Erie off Harrow, Ontario, Canada. The vessel has been anchored to carry out repair works.

The anchor of vessel, which was moored in Thiras Port, became unhooked, resulting in its allision with a jetty. The Thiras Port Authority initially banned the ship from sailing, but after the presentation of a certificate of seaworthiness and the repair of the damage, the ship set sail on its scheduled route to the port of Heraklion with 135 passengers on board.

Vessel was permitted to dock in Anchorage, Alaska despite reporting a lubrication leak while transiting to the Port of Alaska. Given the low toxicity of the lubricant, the strong tidal currents and the slow release rate, the USCG authorized the vessel to dock.

Vessel suffered an engine failure at İzmir-Karaburun, Turkey and went adrift off Aliaga. Repairs could not be carried out by the crew so tug Sirapinar XVIII was deployed to assist. It pulled the tanker to Aliağa anchorage, where it dropped anchor on August 6th. As of August 9th, the ship remained stationary at Aliağa anchorage No. 3 while repairs were ongoing.

Vessel had steering failure at rough buoy, in position lat 51 50 07N, long 001 30 09E, UK. Currently anchored in the inner anch, 05 Aug. Investigation underway. Steerage was affected. Completed repairs and underway.
Vessel had engine failure at Suez, Egypt. Tug Christos LVII attended and towage operation commenced from Port Said Anchorage to Piraeus, Greece on 10 Sep. Vessel anchored at Eleusis on Sep 16.
Vessel reported errors with charging; departure from Leirvag in Austrheim to Slovag, Norway cancelled. Technicians from Bergen called to solve the issue. Services resumed same day. No damage.

Vessel ran aground in Napoli Port area while approaching berth, on arrival from Santana Brazil with cargo of grain. She was refloated with high tide next morning with tugs assistance, and berthed. No damages, no leak reported, the ship reportedly rested on a sandy bottom.
Vessel was NUC due to a problem with fuel parts, in lat 50 25 28N, long 000 29 27W, range and bearing from Selsey Bill, approximately 24 miles at 148 degrees true.

Vessel suffered engine failure and went adrift some 30 nm west of Mauritius, while en route from Reunion to Port Louis, Mauritius, with cargo of cement. SAR Mauritius was on standby to assist if crew fails to fix engine. She entered Port Louis at around 1840 UTC Aug 4, as of 1855 UTC was in process of mooring with assisting tug.

Vessel was determined by local authorities to have polluted the sea after inspections by teams of Kocaeli Metropolitan Municipality and Control Department, Turkey. Oil leakages were said to have been detected from the shaft of the vessel when it was in Dilovası Port. Oil barriers were erected around the ship. As of August 3rd the vessel was moored at Diliskelesi, near Gebze, Turkey.

Port Authorities of Piraeus, Aegina, Poros informed that vessel with 19 crew on board, no passengers, had mechanical breakdown 10 NM SE of Aegina, Greece. Greek tug Ektor towed vessel to Perama shipyard on 04 Aug.

Vessel en route from Turku, Finland to Stockholm, Sweden had blackout, lost power due to data malfunction in control system at Erstan in Aboland archipelago after leaving Turku. After few mins everything OK.

Vessel was NUC due to the requirement of repairs to the engine on Auxiliary Blower, abt 39 NM SE of Lizard Point, UK. Estimated to complete repairs in 6 hrs. Rectified the defect and underway to its destination.

Vessel en route to Ischia, Italy allided with San Vincenzo pier while leaving Naples, after veering to SB side towards docks. Minor injuries to some passengers, no serious injuries. Vessel at Naples as of 03 Aug.

Vessel reportedly suffered fire in engine room while proceeding in Shanghai approach channel with cargo of ore. She had to be anchored in fairway, understood she was disabled. Fire was extinguished by switching on fire fighting CO2 system. She was still anchored as of 2130 Beijing time Aug 3, with at least 3 tugs at her side.
Vessel had technical failure of fire fighting system, pertinent connections at Tuapse, Russia. Crew completed repairs, vessel sailed from Tuapse on 04 Aug for Samsun, Turkey.
Vessel with 189 passengers, 76 crew on board had mechanical failure due to overloading of electrical cables in SB ME off Piraeus, Greece. Repaired, vessel permitted to continue sailing same day.

Vessel en route from Mykonos to Naxos, Greece, with 278 people on board had mechanical failure of water thrusters No.1 and No.3; departure prohibited until repairs, certification. Passengers taken by another vessel.

Vessel had technical issue affecting CO2 firefighting system; all sailing between Tarbert, Lochmaddy, Uig cancelled. After repairs, vessel sail from Garvel Clyde Shipyard, Greenock on 07 Aug; to resume service.

Vessel had an issue with turbocharger about 1.9 NM from Kingsdown. Later advised by Port of Dover that it had engine power loss. Secured in Dover by pilot and 2 tugs. Repairs are expected to take several days.

Vessel, en route from Hamburg, Germany with cargo of barley, allided with harbour quay in Buckie, Moray; breaches, dents above water line on SB side. Berthed in Ghent on 06 Aug, sailed on 08 Aug for Boston, UK.

Fire erupted on board of oceanic reefer trawler in fore area in fish flour cargo hold, Admiralt Ship Yard, S-Petersburg, Russia. Vessel was running trial tests. Fire was extinguished few hours later, tugs, 14 engines and 58 fire fighters responded. No injuries reported, extent of damages yet unknown.

Guyana Ministry of Public Works advised general public vessel currently out of service following technical difficulties; operate Parika to Wakenaam, Parika to Leguan routes, out of service until further notice.
Vessel released small oil spill, in position lat 46 20 26N, long 072 32 17W, Canada. Crew cleaned the oil spill.
Vessel was NUC due to engine problems in position lat 52 59 07N, long 01 54 34E. The Engineer investigated and managed to get one engine started. Vessel was safely alongside in Lowestoft.

Fire erupted on one of cargo decks while it was berthed at Valencia, Spain as arrived from Palma de Mallorca. The fire was extinguished by Valencia firefighters and no injuries were reported. She sustained unclarified damages and had to cancel scheduled trips.
Vessel collided with bulk carrier MAGIC THUNDER and tanker NCC QAMAR and allided with both dock, in position lat 46 49 42N, long 071 12 05W, Canada. All vessels sustained minor damages.

Vessel capsized and rested on bottom portside along berth at Shunan Port, Honshu, Seto Inland Sea. The ship lost stability during loading of containers, and capsized. Some 100 containers went overboard and drifted around in port area and Tokuyama Bay waters.  About 40 liters of fuel leaked. Operations under way to recover floating containers and contain fuel stain.

Vessel had technical problems near Babar Islands in Maluku Province, Indonesia. The vessel reportedly encountered problems with its steering wheel and rudder due to high waves, which caused it to drift.

Vessel had a technical failure during the Canakkale Strait passage and dropped anchor at Karanlik liman anch, under supervision of Strait pilot. Repairs commenced by crew and it remained stationary at the anch, 31 Jul.

Vessel involved in a collision with fishing vessel Frapoli , while heading to Punta Redonda, in the commune of Maullin, Los Lagos Region, in lat 41 36 14S, long 073 02 15W. The vessel continued the voyage to Pecket. ETA 05 Aug
Vessel ran aground on the Weser near Altenesch while en route to the UK. The ship moved instead to Bremen in the industrial port, where it remained as of August 3rd.
Tanker and bulk carrier MAGIC THUNDER collided by Self Discharging Bulk Carrier ATLANTIC HURON, in position lat 46 49 42N, long 071 12 05W, Canada. All the vessels sustained minor damages.
Vessel and tanker NCC QAMAR collided by Self Discharging Bulk Carrier ATLANTIC HURON, in position lat 46 49 42N, long 071 12 05W, Canada. All the vessels sustained minor damages.

Vessel had power loss, but was able to control the vessel, off Cap Brule, Canada. After several minutes, power was restored. Lost power again after 30 minutes and ordered help of a tug. Anchored off Ile D'Orleans.
Vessel en route from Borkum to Emden, Germany had engine damage, arrived Emden with reduced speed for repairs. Sail Emden on 04 Aug for Borkum, arrive same day.

Vessel informed Port Authority of Iraklion, Greece of port main engine failure, hence had to reduce speed. Greek CG patrol boat, tug Mentora readied. Vessel reach Iraklion, sailing prohibited until repairs, certification.

Vessel was in collision with general cargo ship Douwe S about 41nm southwest of Land’s End, south of the Isles Of Scilly. Both vessels suffered minor damage, but no water ingress. The Steph Of Ladram was fishing with the gear in the water at the time and therefore had restricted manoeuvrability. She dropped its fishing gear in Mounts Bay, before proceeding into Newlyn harbour.

Vessel had mineral oil leak from gearbox in position 53 34 48N, 000 30 53E, UK. Anchored. Need to identify cause of leak. Dive company will check propellors. No pollution. Tugs towed to Immingham Dock on 31 Jul.

Vessel was disabled due to main engine issue off Vancouver Island, British Columbia, Canada. Berthed at Shipyard Common in Vancouver on 16 Aug, left port after issue fixed on 08 Sep for Da Chan Bay, ETA, 29 Sep.

Vessel was hit by fishing vessel GABBY G at Nantucket, USA East Coast. Cruise ship left Boston on Jul 29 for a week-long cruise, she wasn’t damaged except maybe some scratches and dents, while GABBY G sustained serious damages in stb bow area, she was taken to New Bedford, probably on tow.

Vessel was in collision with fishing trawler Steph Of Ladram about 41nm southwest of Land’s End, south of the Isles Of Scilly. Both vessels suffered minor damage, but no water ingress. The Douwe S was en route from Nea Moudania, Greece, to Sharpness, UK. She continued voyage to Sharpness, where it arrived on August 1st.
Vessel reported as NUC due to navigational equipment failure in position lat 50 57 32.4N, long 001 21 25.8E, UK. Fixed issues and resumed voyage.

Vessel was in collision with yacht Mahayana off Kaleucagiz. No injuries were reported, but the yacht suffered structural damages to its side. The Andrey Zuev was en route from Novorossiysk to Mersin, Turkey. The Turkish Coast Guard attended the incident scene. The Andrey Zuev sustained slight damages to its hull and was adrift at the scene after the accident, but then resumed its voyage.
