Vessel collided with Roll On Roll Off Ciudad de Malaga that was manoeuvring in Tangier Med, Morocco. Ciudad de Malaga had broken glass, damage to deck. Vessel safety not affected; both vessels continue service.

Vessel, replacing crashed Cathlamet on route from Bremerton to Seattle, USA had to be taken out of service due to steering malfunction. Crew of Washington State Ferries repair, return Kitsap to service.
Vessel had water ingress in the steering gear, Fairhaven, USA. 4 inch crack in hull on direction of a vessel stern. Vessel will sail to Thames shipyard for replacing structural steel.
Vessel allided with moored barge in Ventspils, Latvia. No injuries or pollution reported. Vessel left port of Ventspils again on 30 Jul, en route to Paldiski, Estonia where it arrived on 31 Jul.

Vessel in collision with passenger ro/ro Morocco Star while manoeuvring in Tangier Med, Morocco. She sustained broken glass and damage to deck. Vessel safety not affected. Both vessels continued service same day.

Vessel running between Breistein and Valestrand, Norway, came in collision with Breistein ferry wharf, after crew had problems slowing vessel down. Ramp destroyed. No injuries to passengers. Police interrogating.

Vessel had engine failure during westbound transit of Kiel Canal short before switch Breiholz, Germany. Two tugs towed to communal port of Rendsburg. Sail banned. Repairs done, resumed voyage on 30 Jul.

Vessel was in collision with Capesize bulk carrier BRAVE SAILOR at Singapore bunkering anchorage. BRAVE SAILOR was under way, probably going to anchor, and struck anchored LUCKY JOY starboard, inflicting serious damages, estimated at $3.9 mil. Extent and character of LUCKY JOY damages weren’t specified.
Vessel had engine failure, lost control at Anadolu Kavagi point, Turkey. Tugs Kurtarma-12, Nazim Tur, fast rescue boat secured vessel. Dropped anchor at Istanbul anch. Investigation on. Fine imposed.

Vessel while underway in Malacca Strait, crew sighted 2 perpetrators in engine room in pos 001 09 18N, 103 27 51E, Malaysia. Some engine spare parts reported stolen by perpetrators during incident. Crew safe.
Vessel collided with Panamax bulk carrier LUCKY JOY at Singapore bunkering anchorage. She was under way, probably going to anchor, and struck anchored LUCKY JOY starboard, inflicting serious damages.
Vessel suffered engine failure, lost control, Beykoz point, Turkey. Rescue team provided assistance. Resumed passage.Fine for breaching strait safe passage regulation.

Vessel collided with Madrid Trader moored at Puerto Madryn dock, Argentina; bow crushed, National Nautical Safety Certificate withdrawn until repaired, pass inspections. Damage to Madrid Trader unknown.
Reports that vessel allided with a Dolphin on arrival at Fauntleroy Terminal, SW Seattle. Major portside damage and at least 1 car pinned under the wreakage.
Vessel had damage to its starboard main engine while proceeding 8 NM SE of Corfu,  in its scheduled service from Corfu to Paxos. Returned to Paxos, banned from sailing until repairs are done.
Vessel had engine breakdown off Mjosa, Norway; strut for vacuum pump in steam engine broken. NSSR boat left Gjovik to tow ship back to Gjovik, out of service for couple of days.

Vessel towing 2 barges, was in collision with anchored vessels Eli’s Inheritance and Humpty Dumpty off Apalachicola, Mobile, USA. One man injured, taken to hospital. Vessel sail to Panama City on 29 Jul for investigations.
Fire erupted on board of vessel. Black smoke billowed from Economy Class Passengers Quarters, where fire started. No injuries reported.
Vessel en route from Port Melbourne to Devonport, Australia had a fire broke out in engine of a truck on main garage deck. General alarm sounded. Fire extinguished. Safely berthed in Devonport.

Vessel allided with a berth after its arrival at Mizushima Port, Japan, during manoeuvring. No information on the extent of damage to the hull and the berth. However, the vessel appears to have left the port on July 29th. As of July 31st the vessel was at anchor in Busan New Port Anchorage, South Korea.

Vessel discharged oil during fueling op's with fuel barge ,Ama anch., USA. Investigators estimated 2100 gallons of fuel oil entered water and contaminated approx 50-60 barges in vicinity. Booms placed, investigating cause.

Generator that supply power to network on board vessel failed near Biebesheim, Germany. Second generator also did not start; steering system, bow thruster, radar, radio failed. Crew start generator, vessel berthed at Gernsheim.

Vessel came in ccollision with KM Murni Jaya II in the waters of Berakit in Bintan regency, Indonesia; crew reportedly did not see the fishing vessel. Crew of vessel stopped, helped evacuate crew of FV.
Vessel collided with fishing vessel Petrel at Puerto Madryn dock, Argentina; damage unknown. Bow of Petrel crushed, National Nautical Safety Certificate withdrawn until repaired, pass inspections.

Vessel ran aground at Cape Ostrovnoy, east of Nakhodka, Primorye, Russia, Japan sea. The ship is en route from Vladivostok to Okhotsk Port, Okhotsk sea. No information on damages, salvage, oil leak if any.

Scheduled departure of vessel from Heligoland to Cuxhaven, Germany was cancelled due to technical failure. Sailings from 29 Jul to 31 will not take place due to needed repairs. Vessel dock at shipyard in Lemwerder.

A fire broke out aboard tug in the fuel storage tank during the vessel’s stay at the Haskoy shipyard in Istanbul for routine maintenance. The crew and the shipyard duty fire-fighting team backed up by local fire brigade teams fought the fire. It was controlled and extinguished, but the extent of damage and the cause of fire was not yet known.

Vessel had technical failure at the S entrance of Canakkale Strait. It was shifted from the incident place to the N of Bozcaada anchorage with its own power and safely dropped. Done repairs. Ar in Asyaport, 29 Jul.

Vessel was disabled due to an electrical power failure while transiting in lat 48 32 21N, long 123 13 24W, in Haro Strait, Canada. With escort from responding vessels, crew carried out repairs, sailed on Aug 01.

Vessel had damage to the port side main engine while sailing in waters S of Cape Kavo Sidero. Returned to the port of Corfu. Port Authority of Corfu banned the vessel from sailing until repairs are done.
Vessel had engine failure in position lat 35 58 12N, long 27 01 06E, NW of Karpathos Island, Greece. Tug KAPTAN DIMITRIS II towed vessel to anchorage at Rhodes for repairs. No pollution.

Fire erupted in cargo hold of vessel while berthed at Eemshaven, Netherlands. Firefighters had to remove or relocate cargo on deck and in hold. Fire is said to be under control or extinguished, it started in one of the containers in hold bottom.

Vessel collided with fishing vessel or fish carrier in Busan outer anchorage waters. Both ships were under way, both sustained damages, both were anchored after collision. According to available data, bulk carrier can be identified as WOORI SUN, she left anchorage several hours after accident, and resumed sailing in NE direction.

Vessel had a mechanical breakdown in the waters of Pedio bay off the beach of Agios Nikolaos, with 3 passengers on board. Taken in tow by tug Agios Vasilios. Port Authority banned it from sailing until repairs done.

Vessel had technical failure at Northern entrance of Canakkale strait, Turkey; shifted to Sevketiye anchorage with own power, sail Canakkale on 27 Jul after repairs, continue voyage to Thessaloniki, Greece, ETA 27 Jul.

Vessel had engine failure in lat 36 58 05N, long 027 23 05E, off Bodrum, Turkey. Crew members were not able to carry out the repair works. Patrol boat KIYEM-6 towed it to Bodrum ferry terminal, same day.

Vessel collided with fishing boat BTh 98750 TS some 30 nm east of Vung Tau, while en route from Da Nang to Ho Chi Minh. Boat sank, all 4 fishermen on board were rescued by MORNING VINAFCO, to be disembarked at Ho Chi Minh. The ship continued voyage, she arrived at Ho Chi Minh and was berthed, in the afternoon same day.
Vessel had engine failure in lat 41 18 00N, long 039 28 00E, off N of Trabzon, Turkey. Repair works are still being carried out by the crews. The vessel was drifting as per wind direction.
Container ship SITC Shenzhen allided with the stern of berthed container ship BF Carp in the port of Tokyo. No injuries, water ingress or pollution resulted. The BF Carp left the port later that day.
Vessel had main engine cylinder issues, disabled & drifting, off Vancouver Island in position lat 49 28 19.2N, long 128 17 19.8W, British Columbia, Canada. Crew did repairs, resumed voyage.
Vessel allided with the stern of berthed container ship BF Carp in the port of Tokyo. No injuries, water ingress or pollution resulted. The BF Carp left the port later that day.

Vessel ran aground near Pier 2 of Padang Bai Harbour, Padang Bai Village, Manggis District, Indonesia. The ship had sailed from Lembar Harbour, West Lombok. When approaching the Padang Bai Harbour Pier the weather turned suddenly and the ship became stuck in strong winds and dropped anchor.
Vessel had engine damage, sidelined in Harlesiel, Germany. Sailings from and to Wangerooge island disrupted on 25 Jul. After repairs, vessel sailed to Harlesiel on 28 Jul.

Vessel had engine breakdown with a subsequent fire in the engine. Fire was due to the breakdown and was quickly extinguished by the crew. Returned to the port of Valencia, 25 Jul. Expected to be operational, 26 Jul.
Vessel reported water ingress in EA field southwest of Warii, Nigeria. As of morning Jul 29, there weren’t yet detailed and timely updates on what happened and what are ship’s status and condition.

Vessel allegedly leaked oil outside Stenungsund, Sweden. As per CG oil in water around vessel but not yet confirmed. Oil sheen near vessel parts observed. Oil boom placed. Investigation on, vessel sailed Marstrand on 02 Aug.

Vessel had a fault in an engine component, while it was berthed at town hall pier 4 during the disembarkation of passengers, in lat 59 54 36N, long 010 43 52E, in Norway. Vessel is to be replaced by Oslofjord I.

Vessel suffered explosion and subsequently, sank, in Semoi Setawir, Sungai Sepaku river, upstream from Balikpapan, Eastern Kalimantan Makassar Strait, Indonesia. Of 12 people on board, 4 suffered burns (their condition unknown), 1 went missing, 7 escaped. There were wielding works taking place in stern area, shortly after works started an explosion came about.
Vessel was taken out of service after a leak was discovered in the hull but resumed service 26 Jul 2022. Vessel has passed all inspection checks at drydock in Fraserburgh, UK.
Vessel had an engine failure, in lat 47 50 47N, long 64 43 41W, in Shippagan Channel, New Brunswick, Canada. Towed to Lameque,  by the Canadian Coast Guard Ship Cap Breton.

Bow of vessel allided with a floating jetty at quay of Fuglenes, Norway. Floating jetty had several large gashes. Vessel had slight damage. Berthed and left Hammerfest port for offshore duties, 25 Jul.

Vessel reported water ingress in Gulf of Mexico some 65 nm south of Port Fourchon, Louisiana. The ship was returning to Port Fourchon after carrying out offshore works. She was disabled and went adrift. As of Jul 24 she was dead in the water, drifting in southern direction, with US Coast Guard ship USCG MORAY nearby.
Vessel had engine issues while transiting in Ungava Bay, in position lat 59 58 58.1N, long 069 21 41.7W, Quebec, Canada. Transited to safe anchorage location nearby. Crew did repairs, resumed voyage.

Bulbous bow of vessel collided with port side of support vessel Thunder (IMO: 9684847) near Port Fourchon, Louisiana, US. No injuries or pollution reported. Both vessels sustained damages. Officers failed to maintain proper lookouts.

Fire erupted in engine room when ferry was entering Wood Islands Harbor, on arrival from Nova Scotia, Gulf of St. Lawrence, Canada. It was decided to ground the ship to avoid negative developments. Fire was contained by crew, passengers on board were evacuated, no injuries reported. Ferry is said to block entrance channel, i.e. Wood Islands port is blocked.
Vessel had steering gear issues shortly after departing in St. Lawrence River from Les Escoumins, in position lat 48 19 27.7N, long 069 2207.9W, Quebec, Canada. Crew did repairs, resumed voyage.
Vessel reported that one of the ropes for opening of stern hatch was broken in Bari, Italy and was taken out of service. Two departures cancelled. Sd from Bari, 23 Jul.

Vessel (IMO: 8874366) collided with vessel Stella moored at Khora Sfakion, Greece. Both had material damage. No injury, pollution. Port authority prohibited departure of both vessels until certificates of seaworthiness issued.

Vessel ran aground near Aino-Shima Island, in the Fukuoka Prefecture. After the vessel refloated from the shallows, it travelled to a nearby quarantine anchorage. As of July 27th it was north of Kitakyushu, Japan.

Vessel had technical failure in southern entrance of Canakkale Strait, Turkey. Shifted to N. of Bozcaada anchorage on own, anchored. Crew doing repairs. Remains stationary at anchorage position as of 21 Jul.
Vessel experienced engine problems during westbound transit of the canal near Breiholz, Germany. She was towed to Voith Quay for surveys and repairs.
Vessel reported NUC due to cable kinking in the engine room. She was able to resume voyage within hours.
Vessel allided with Kattwyk bridge after technical defect,  in Hamburg, Germany. She was towed to Fassmer shipyard near Bremen for permanent repairs on 30 August. Sailed from Motzen on 23 December.
Blackout experienced onboard due to a fire alarm triggered by water vapour escaping from the engine room. Incident occured during routine maintainance while vessel was enroute from Bergen, Norway.
Vessel had an engine failure off north of Samsun, approximately in position lat 41 35 00N, long 036 23 30E, Turkey. Crew doing repairs. Drifting in wind and current direction as of 20 Jul.

The Tzelepi Port Authority was informed that a crew member of passenger ship had been injured while docked at the port of Piraeus. The man was transferred to the local General Hospital out by the Central Port Authority of Piraeus.
Around 30000 gallons of fuel spilled from vessel in Bahamas. BPL generation team, Valiant Marine Salvage recovered 15000-20000 gallons by 20 Jul. 95% fuel removed, beach will close until 10 Aug
Vessel had water ingress and was grounded at the sea area of Kea Island. The vessel was towed at Lavrion port where it remained for relevant repairs and class inspection.

EUNAVFOR ATALANTA Command was alerted by distress signal or message from the ship, reporting total blackout, lack of supplies. Technicians team failed to restore power and propulsion, and she was finally taken on tow to Bosasso Somalia, Gulf of Aden.

Fire broke out on board of vessel while docked at Puerto Bolivar, Colombia. Four personnel on board who have been carrying out repairs and maintenance duties, alarmed Port Captaincy. Port firefighters and emergency team responded, fire was extinguished after several hours of firefighting. Extent of damages unknown.

Vessel ran aground in river Clyde, in Old Kilpatrick area, while sailing upstream to Glasgow from Greenock. The ship was refloated about an hour and a half later with tug assistance, and resumed sailing
Vessel allided with a wharf in the port of Hakata, Japan, reportedly causing damage to the wharf and a fender. The ship left the port again the same day, headed to Shanghai, with an ETA of July 22nd.

Vessel was NUC due to a faulty cylinder no.7 fuel pump in the main engine, in lat 49 32 15N, long 005 44 30W, abt 30 NM SW of Lizard Point. It was able to rectify the issue and was underway using its own engine, 20 Jul.
Vessel reported technical failure, sheltered, anchored at Sinop anchorage, Turkey. Crew carried out repairs. Vessel resumed voyage to Aliaga.
Vessel collided with tanker Lenaneft 2031, which was anchored on the river Lena in the Yakutia region. The vessel was berthed near Yakutsk the same day and remained in a stationary position since.

Vessel reported damage (type not reported) while on scheduled service to Aegina, Greece; returned to Piraeus under own power, central Port Authority of Piraeus prohibited departure until repairs, certification.

River-sea type reefer MAGDEBURG, struck anchored river-sea type product tanker LENANEFT 2031 on river Lena, Yakutia Region, Siberia, Russia. Tanker hull was breached in forecastle area, port side, above waterline.

During discharge of cargo of wet bauxite at Alumar in Brazil the terminal’s shore crane suffered a fire, which caused the grab to fall on to the deck of the vessel. The reason for the fire on the crane was not disclosed. The ship left port on July 20th and moored on Itaqui anchorage that evening.

Vessel en route from Hamburg, Germany to Alexandria, Egypt with 7 people on board, NUC after engine failure in pos 50 40 54.0N, 000 49 58.8E, UK. About 3 hours later repairs done, vesssel resumed passage.
Vessel was NUC following main propulsion failure 14NM ESE of Lizard Point. About 35 mins later, the vessel was underway to Falmouth; berthed at the A&P Falmouth Ltd Shipyard for repairs the same day.

Vessel had a technical failure at the N entrance of Istanbul Strait. Granted departure permission and entered Istanbul Strait under the supervision of Coastal Safety tugs. Ar at Tuzla shipyard, 20 Jul.

Vessel had complete engine failure due to a fuel leak and was drifting northerly at a speed of 1.7 knots, in lat 57 28 38N, long 001 13 53W, abt 20 NM ESE of Peterhead. Issues rectified and underway same day.

Vessel serving between Gaios (Paxi) and Corfu, Greece reported damage to SB main engine. Port Authority of Corfu prohibited vessel's sailing until repairs are done. Vessel sail same day apparently back on route.

Vessel allided with pier at Spetses port, Greece. High-speed craft sustained minor damages. No injuries, water pollution, or water ingress. Passengers disembarked and sailed at Perama for relevant repairs.

Vessel suffered fire in engine room in Gbraltar Strait, while en route from Algeciras to Huelva, Spain. Tanker was disabled and was taken on tow by SAR tug LUZ DE MAR, she arrived back at Algeciras in the morning Jul 18. Reportedly crew extinguished fire by own means, extent of damages unknown. Tanker cargo status unknown.

Fire broke out on board of the ship TRANS ASIA 1 in Lapu Lapu City waters, Cebu, Philippines. She was inoperable or decommissioned, with 9 people on board. All of them were evacuated, 2 were treated for smoke inhaling. Fire was extinguished in some 4 hours, officials said.

The ship is said to suffer hull breach, either as a result of grounding or iceberg contact. Crew sealed the breach and there were no signs or signals of danger for ship and for passengers. The report came from an anonymous source. She was ordered to return to Longyearbyen, Spitsbergen, escorted by CG ship. She berthed at Longyearbyen late Jul 20, subject to inspection and investigation.

Fire broke out on board of ferry KMP NUSA PENIDA, docked at Dukuh Raya Port, western Lombok, Indonesia. There were no passengers on board, ferry is said to be undergoing repairs at Dukuh Raya. Several hours after fire started, it was still on. No updates on ship’s condition, damages, as of Jul 16.

Vessel reported abandoned and adrift some 400 nm NE of eastern Papua New Guinea, South Pacific. The ship sailed into the area from Kaohsiung, probably she was engaged in bunkering fishing vessels. No news on ship crew fate, character of accident, etc., awaiting details, updates.

A 25-year-old Chinese crew member was reported to have been seriously injured in an incident in the port of Antwerp when a batch of windmill blades was detached by some crew members in the Leopold dock. He apparently suffered a broken hip but reportedly was not evacuated to a hospital for a couple of days. As of July 21st the vessel remained at Antwerp.

The US Coast Guard medevaced a crew member after he suffered a stroke and related medical complications aboard the vessel when it was about 1,000 miles west of the Oregon coast, having travelled from Kobe, Japan. The aircrew transported the man to emergency medical services at Air Facility Newport. He was reported to be in a stable condition.

Vessel had a minor fire in one of its main engines shortly before it reached port at Hou, Denmark. Fire extinguished, sailed to port using 3 engines. Two departures from Hou and two from Samso were cancelled.

Vessel brushed pier catwalk, at San Lorenzo, Parana river, Argentina while berthing at YPF Chacabuco Gas Terminal. There were slight damages or none at all, but it was a close call. Dangerous approach was caused by strong wind, not by some fault made by personnel manning tanker and tugs.

Vessel had its starboard propulsion unit as inoperable, in lat 51 18 27N, long 128 23 33W, in Queen Charlotte Strait off Calvert Island, Canada. The vessel proceeded to an anchorage to investigate the issue.

Vessel reportedly sank in Indian ocean off eastern Somalia coast, on Jul 15 or 14. 12 crew abandoned the ship, no news on rescue yet. Understood tanker HAFNIA BEIJING interrupted her voyage from Turkey to Cape Town and is engaged in SAR.

Vessel reported its portside azipod as out of service while out to sea, abt 22 NM W off Hippa Island, Canada. Continued voyage to Victoria, with the use of its starboard azipod. Ar in Seattle, US, 17 Jul.

There was an oil spill of about 20 litres from vessel during bunkering operations in Gibraltarian territorial waters. An oil spill contingency plan was activated and the Algeciras Port authority a short way away in Spain was notified. The vessel was initially detained by the Gibraltar Port Authority while an investigation was conducted. The vessel sailed from Gibraltar on July 16th. As of July 24th the vessel was en route to Santos, Brazil
Vessel had technical failure in approx pos 36 32 00N, 030 51 00E, off Antalya, Turkey. Repairs carried out by crew. Arrived at Dumyat (Damietta) on 18 Jul.
Vessel had some type of engine damage and was subsequently being towed back to Honolulu by tug Navajo, arriving 18 Jul. The vessel departed Honolulu, Hawaii, 14 Jul and was bound for Guam.

Vessel had engine trouble off port of Barranquilla, Colombia. Issue with cooling system, due to blockage with plant materials. Transferred to "Cano Dulce" area, issue fixed. Resumed voyage to Santarem, Brazil.
Vessel diverted from its Izmir to Cape Town route as part of SAR operation in the sinking of general cargo ship Chang He.

During the mooring process in Kythnos, vessel lost an anchor in port waters. Due to its inability to moor at Kythnos, it returned to the port of Lavrio safely. Prohibited to sail until repairs completed

Crew memebers are calling for help and claiming they've been held on board of tanker for months, without payment, with supplies running out, fast. Tanker is anchored in Gujarat State waters, Western India, since Jul 14.

Vessel ran aground south of Hundested, northern Zealand, Denmark, Kattegat, while en route from Poland to Frederiksvaerk, Denmark. She is to be refloated according to Danish Maritime Authorities, in the morning Jul 15, tug is arranged. No leaks reported, no information on damages.

Vessel was NUC and drifted around 1.5 cables/hr, due to an unspecified engine failure, in lat 49 55 10N, long 003 28 04W, approx 25 NM abt 170 degrees from Dartmouth. Repair works are estimated to take up to 8 hrs.
Vessel en route from Marmara Ereglisi, Turkey to Aliaga, Turkey in ballast, had technical failure at Kilitbahir, dropped anchor at Karanlik Liman anchorage. Sailed and anchored at Aliaga on 17 Jul.

Vessel had an engine defect due to high-pressure fuel oil leakage, in lat 58 43 39N, long 003 49 51W. Underway at a speed of nine knots. CG will monitor the vessel throughout its Pentland Firth passage.

A fire alarm was triggered aboard vessel, while approaching the New Free Port Siot Pipeline Terminal, in Trieste, Italy. Found that the alarm was activated due to the breakage of a flexible hose of an engine.

Vessel reported a total failure of its forward engine while in the St. Lawrence River off Sorel, Quebec, Canada. She was assisted to the wharf for repairs. 24-Sep-2022 : Vessel reported issues with one of its main engines in the Riviere Saguenay off Tadoussac, Quebec, Canada. Vessel was secured alongside, repairs were carried out and resumed voyage following day.
A fire broke out while vessel was docked in Lorient for repairs. Security protocol activated, workers evacuated. Fire under control by firefighters and emergency services. No casualties.
Vessel en route from Novorossiysk, Russia to Damietta, Egypt in laden condition, reported technical failure, sheltered, anchored at Sinop anchorage, Turkey. Crew carrying out repairs.
Vessel had water ingress in galley at Hirtshals Yard, Denmark. Hull was previously damaged due to operating in ice.

Vessel suffered a minor fire in its engine room while the vessel was in the St. Laurent River, Quebec, off the Ile de la Batture. The crew extinguished the fire, and the vessel continued its voyage to Iqaluit.

Vessel caught fire while docked at Pare Pare, Indonesia. Fire started from kitchen, spread to other parts. Passengers escaped, no injuries. It was declared seaworthy and permitted to sail again after inspections.
Vessel had engine trouble near Prajurit Island in the Sunda Strait, in Indonesia. Reportedly stopped sailing after departure from Bakauheni.

Master of vessel informed Port Authority of Volos, Greece that vessel was unable to service Volos to Sporades due to SB Main Engine damage. Central Port Authority of Volos prohibited sailing until repairs and certification.

Vessel  with 6 people on board broke down, took on water on Salcombe Bar, UK. Salcombe RNLI ALB self-tasked to vessel, which was recovered to harbour with pumps after about 1 hour. Vessel underway to Salcombe using engine.

Vessel informed Piraeus Port Authority that after departing Piraeus, Greece on scheduled route to Aegina and Agistrio, vessel had mechanical breakdown. Vessel prohibited from sailing until repairs, certification.
Vessel allided with a car stopper on the berth, while leaving the port of Funabashi, Japan. The vessel was free from any damage and resumed its voyage. Ar in Kawasaki, 12 Jul and Sd 15 Jul.
Vessel had technical problems; some ferry services between Starheim and Isane, Norway cancelled. Roll On Roll Off Sognefjord inserted as replacement. Vessel sidelined on the Starheim side.

Vessel reportedly came in contact with a German pleasure boat, in fairway off Rudkobing upon Langeland, Denmark. Pleasure boat appeared completely damaged, its lone sailor slightly injured. Vessel had minor scraping at bow.

Vessel had main engine issues off N Australian coast in pos 10 57 00S, 139 09 00E, continued sailing towards next PoC in slow speed, arrive Darwin Anchorage on 17 Jul. Sail from Darwin anch on 23 Jul.

Vessel had port propeller shaft damage, small sea water ingress in Frobisher's Bay, in position lat 63 37 33.0N, long 068 26 29.5W, Nunavut, Canada. Crew installed temporary seal, sailed Saint-John's for repairs.
Vessel had an engine malfunction in Mactan channel in Cebu, the Philippines. It dropped anchor to repair, unable to lift it after completion, stuck for more than 7 hrs. Passengers safely evacuated.
Vessel had technical problems at Bremerhaven, Germany, scheduled cruise to Iceland and Norway postponed.

Vessel en route from Diliskelesi, Turkey to Izmail, Ukraine had technical failure during Istanbul Strait passage, anchor at Buyukdere anch under Strait pilot supervision. Crew repairing. Sail 11 Jul for Izmail.

Vessel en route from Abenraa to Antwerp had engine failure while leaving new southern lock of Kiel Canal, Brunsbuttel, Germany. Tugs Fairplay Onagua and Sonke pulled vessel to South Anchorage, Brunsbuttel. Sail 11 Jul.

Vessel ran aground while leaving Barranquilla Colombia with some 22,000 tons of coal on board, bound for Brazil. Traffic in channel was restricted. The ship was refloated few hours later with tugs assistance and taken to anchorage.

Vessel had fire in port engine compartment in Canary Wharf, in position 51 30 27.0N, 000 00 21.6E, UK. Gravesend lifeboat, MARINE POLICE 3, LFB Firedart, LFB Fireflash tasked. Fire extinguished on 10 Jul.

Vessel with 200 POB in collided with general cargo Mayera at river KM-402 on Rhine, Germany, bow damage above WL, continue voyage. Two injured. Mayera re-floated same day, berth in Braun Shipyard, Speyer.

Fire erupted in engine room while at Temryuk port, Azov sea, Russia. Understood tanker was to be dry docked at the port and at the time fire broke out, was entering ship repair yard basin. Fire disabled the ship, pilot on board anchored tanker in basin, but later, because of threat of explosion, took vessel to outer anchorage, with tugs assistance.
Vessel had engine failure in pos 35 46 00N, 27 41 00E off SW of Rhodes Islands, Greece. Tug Pothitos towed to Famagusta, moored off Ceyhan, Turkey on 20 Jul for repairs at Akdeniz Shipyard.

Vessel en route from Frederiksvaerk to Gijon, had engine failure during westbound transit of Kiel Canal at swithc Breiholz, Germany. Damage fixed next morning, vessel resumed voyage, ETA at destination 15 Jul.

Vessel lost propulsion in pos 38 30 04N, 008 54 55W near port of Setubal, Portugal. Incident reported by Portuguese maritime safety office. Anchored for repairs. No injuries, pollution. Investigation on.

Vessel with 5 crew on board had fire in engine room, issue distress signal about 4 NM off Urville-Nacqueville, France. Fire put out, water leak in engine compartment noted. Vessel towed to Cherbourg, docked safely.

Vessel with 2 passengers on board had blackout, disabled, ran aground off ferry dock in Kittuis, Finland. Passengers were evacuated. No injuries. Vessel berthed in Turku (Abo) on 11 Jul for repairs.. Sail Turku on 19 Jul.

Vessel under construction in yard No. 716 at Jos. L. Meyer-Shipyard in Papenburg, Germany had 2 fires on board. One in storage room in garbage can and other in fully equipped cabin. Fires extinguished. Cause unclear.

Vessel had leak and threatened to sink in Duquesne basin, Dieppe. Fire brigade attended scene. Vessel could be stable, rags placed to stop water ingress. Mechanic installed bilge pump. Vessel shifted to tech area of Dieppe.
Vessel suffered a technical failure en route from Samsun to Galati. She moored at Sinop anchorage where repairs were commenced by the crew.
Vessel had a small lubricating oil leak, in lat 45 38 52N, long 073 28 34W, in the St. Lawrence River off Montreal, Canada. It proceeded to a nearby anchorage to carry out the repairs.

Vesel suffered a fire in its engine room, resulting in injury to one crew member. The vessel was disabled and adrift in the Gulf of Aden off the Yemen coast. It was taken in tow by tug Boka Expedition on July 17th and on July 21st the convoy moored at the Al Duqm Anchorage.

Unmanned barge towed by vessel, en route from Colombo, Sri Lanka to Djibouti with some heavy machinery, broke loose. She ran aground on 19 Jul off Guhagar Beach, India in stormy weather. Barge drift bottom up.
Vessel was NUC west of Queen Charlotte Islands, reported as disabled. No tugs in sight, no updates on probable towage/salvage. She was en route from Prince Rupert to Gwangyang Korea.
Vessel had an engine failure approximately 50 NM E of Cabo de Palos, Spain & drifted out of control. Spanish naval vessel Salvamar Draco was mobilised and it took the vessel to Cartagena, Spain.

Vessel came in collision with moored vessel WOLF while berthing at TPP Ezerovo, Varna. Slight scratches to plating, minor indentation. No injuries, pollution. Vessels complete cargo ops. Vessel sail on 12 for Constanta.

Vessel reported sinking, 7 crew abandoning ship, in Ionian sea. Ship was en route from Turkey to Reggio Italy. Container ship MARGUERITE A near sinking site changed course, moving at slow speed, probably engaged in SAR.
Vessel changed course near sinking site of general cargo ship QUATERDECIES, in Ionian sea. She probably engaged in SAR.

Vessel was in collision with chemical/oil products tanker Tanab while en route from Istanbul with 24 crew members and a cargo of 3,000 metric tonnes of gas oil on board. No injuries, water pollution or water ingress were reported due to this incident. Both vessels sailed with own power to Karystos anchorage for investigations, repairs and class inspection.
Vessel reported NUC due to problem with engine cooling, in position lat 59 21 25.0N, long 000 15 45.0E in North Sea. Repairs were completed and it is underway to its destination, 08 Jul.

Vessel suffered deck machinery cargo collapse in Arabian sea off western coast of India off Kannur, while en route from China to Mumbai. Understood no cargo was lost overboard, it’s damaged but not lost

Vessel was in collision with Tanker Amelia south of Karystos island, while en route from Aliaga, Turkey to Varna, Bulgaria. No injuries, water pollution or water ingress were reported due to this incident. Both vessels sailed with own power to Karystos anchorage for investigations, repairs and class inspection.

Vessel had engine failure and allided with wall of new southern lock of Kiel Canal in Brunsbuttel, Germany. Bow dents. Berthed at Europe Quay, Cuxhaven on 06 Jul. Investigation on. Banned until proven seaworthy.
Vessel had engine failure at Drapetzona, Greece. Tug CHRISTOS XL towed her to Yalova, Turkey on 17 September. Repairs underway and it remains stationary at Tuzla as of 26 December.
Vessel had engine failure off Samsun, Turkey; crew could not repair, tug assistance requested. Tug Timur Bey attended, started towing vessel to Istanbul, ETA 10 Jul.

Vessel suffered an engine failure at Nemrut Bay, Turkey. The crew could not carry out the needed repairs so tug Esenkiyi was appointed to tow the vessel to Tuzla. The towage operation commenced on July 8th, with an ETA at Altinova of July 11th.
Vessel NUC due to engine coolant pipe leak, in position lat 50 35 52.0N, long 005 46 09.0W, UK. Repairs completed and vessel resumed its voyage.

Vessel with 22 crew reportedly is taking on water, probably sinking, in Arabian sea some 70 nm west of northwest coast of India. She’s en route from Khor Fakkan Anchorage, UAE, Gulf of Oman, to Karwar India.

Vessel reportedly collided with dredger while leaving Kemi Port, Finland, Gulf of Bothnia. The ship had to return to Kemi after collision, not clear if because of sustained damages or for an investigation. Dredger wasn’t identified.

Vessel with 180 tons of salmon from fish farm on board, ran aground and partially sank in southern Chile waters, some 100 nm west of Punta Arenas. The ship rested on bottom, capsized on starboard and partially submerged. 13 crew went into life rafts and were rescued.
Vessel ran aground on the Ems near Mellum island, Germany. Refloated with rising tide and berthed at Wilhelmshaven. Banned from sailing until confirmation of its seaworthiness by class society.

Vessel is reportedly sinking in stormy Arabian sea off Oman coast. The ship left Port Sudan on Jun 18, destination Chittagong, understood it’s her last voyage and she is (was) to be broken up. No information yet on crew and ship’s status
Vessel  had failure of propulsion system, in the St. Lawrence River off Ile Verte, Quebec, Canada. The vessel underwent repairs and resumed operations the following day.

Vessel had malfunction to rudder and propulsion mechanism of port outboard engine, Syros. People and their vehicles moved to another vessel. Prohibited vessel departure until defects rectified and class maintenance issued.
Vessel ran aground at S. tip of island Renga in position 66 34 47N, 013 06 40E, Norway. KV Farm and Rs169 Odd Fellow III attended vessel. Moored in pos 67 18 04N, 014 42 14E on 06 Jul.

Vessel had engine trouble in seaport of Rostock, Germany prior to its departure to Trelleborg, Sweden. Tugs assisted. Blocked TT pier. Towed to berth 44 on opposite side of port basin. Resumed voyage on 06 Jul.

Vessel ran aground on the island of Swona, a now uninhabited island in the Pentland Firth off the north coast of Scotland. The ship was refloated hours later and continued its journey under the escort of Orkney Marine Services tugs and the Thurso and Longhope lifeboat, returning to St Margaret’s Hope.
Vessel collided with V.D. Graaf Sr at old southern lock of Kiel Canal in Brunsbuttel, Germany. Vessel had scratches and allowed to continue voyage to Kiel, where it was to be investigated further.

Vessel ran aground, 57 48 16N, 039 38 34E, Russia. Cause: violation by duty watch of navigation rules at night. Legal assessments will be given to Captain and crew. Ar in Yaroslavl Port, Russia, 06 Jul and Sd same day.

Vessel was caught in storm, lost power and started drifting but managed to stop after dropping anchor 0.5 nm off Garie Beach in the Royal National Park, south of Sydney. She is en route from Port Kembla to an unknown destination.

The master of vessel reported a mechanical failure during the process of unmooring from the pier of Iconium in Piraeus. The ship sailed to the anchorage of Piraeus with the assistance of the tugs Christos 45 and Karapiperis New Generation. The Port Department of Keratsini of the Central Port Authority of Piraeus prohibited the sailing of the container ship until the repair of the damage and the presentation of a seaworthiness certificate by the classification society which is monitoring it.
Vessel had propulsion problems after arrival at Ngqura, South Africa. Tug SA Amandla towed vessel to Durban on 16 Jul, for repairs at berth 103 on Pier-1.

Vessel disabled and adrift in western North Atlantic, in position lat 06 34 06N, long 052 52 59W. Vessels in vicinity requested to keep a sharp lookout, assist if possible & report to MRCC Fort de France.

UPDATE: The accident victim was allegedly killed by a crane but this was actually a deck disaster brought on by inclement weather. A crew memeber died on board vessel while operating ship’s aux crane in aft section, and was hit.The ship was en route  from Baltimore USA to China via Suez. Body of the Filipino seaman was transferred from bulk carrier to authorities in Banda Aceh waters, Sumatra, on Jul 14.

Vessel had a sudden shutdown of the port main engine. Continued its passage using its starboard engine & was able to sail into the port of Corfu. P.Auth of Corfu banned it from sailing until repairs are done.

Vessel allided with fender at Port of Bakauheni in Lampung, Indonesia; port structure damaged. Dent in hull, no other damage, no injuries. Vessel resumed normal operations. Reportedly strong current caused incident.

Vessel had mechanical failure in SB main engine, returned to Piraeus under own power; 7 passengers on board disembarked safely. Piraeus Port Authority banned vessel from sailing until repairs, certification.

Vessel had fire in cargohold during routine loading of steel scrap at Ashdod, Israel. Fire extinguished by crew, assisted by port duty firefighting team, local fire brigade. Vessel sailed on 12 Jul for Iskenderun.

Vessel reported missing Captain in Mediterranean being halfway between Malta and Panteleria islands, while en route from Istanbul to Tanger-Med. The ship started SAR, which lasted until morning Jul 5, with  involvement of SAR and CG of coastal states. The ship arrived at Algeciras on Jul 7, she was thoroughly searched by police, all crew were interrogated, but Captain’s disappearance remained a mystery.
Vessel was reported to be NUC due to a minor fuel leak in the engine space, in lat 49 50 12N, long 004 58 48W. It was able to fix the issue and was underway to its destination.

Vessel was reported to be NUC due to engine issues related to the engine cooling problem, in lat 54 40 00N, long 000 55 00W, about 082 degrees 7.8 NM from Tees. Fixed the issue & underway to its destination.

Vessel suffered loss of containers sometime between Jul 3 and Jul 5 in Arabian sea, while en route from Singapore to Southampton via Suez. The ship had to interrupt voyage and arrived at Djibouti Anchorage on Jul 6, on Jul 15 she moved to port, at 0440 UTC Jul 15 she was in process of berthing, assisted by tugs.
Vessel roke in two & sank in the South China Sea, abt 160 NM SW of Hong Kong, China, after being caught in passing typhoon "CHABA". 4 found, 12 body rescued & searching op's ongoing for 14 crew.
Vessel had issues with its main engine cooling pump off Ferryland, in position lat 47 00 06.6N, long 052 34 42.0W, Newfoundland and Labrador, Canada. Ann Harvey towed vessel to Saint-John's.
Vessel was beached by typhoon CHABA in Yangxi County, Yangjiang City, South China, while en route from Vietnam to Zhanjiang, China. The ship was still aground as of Jul 5. The crew remain on board.

Vessel reported fire in cargo hold 3, while sailing off Bari, Italy, Adriatic sea, en route from Koper Slovenia to Misurata Libya. Fire was subdued or extinguished, the ship interrupted voyage and called Brindisi, Italy, where she remained as of morning Jul 3. Some deck containers are understood to be offloaded, some 52 more due to be offloaded on Jul 5, in order to get access to hold 3. No reports yet on number of damaged and destroyed by fire containers. No injuries reported.

Vessel ran aground in waters off Barangay Bani, Zambales, central Luzon western coast. Philippine Coast Guard responded, managing to rescue 22 crew in stormy conditions. No news on ship’s cargo, fuel and possible leaks. Strong wind and high seas are believed to be the cause of grounding.

Vessel allided with Karakoy ferry terminal ramp during berthing manoeuvring because of steering gear system failure. Structural damages were noted on the ferry ramp and shell plating. Shifted to repair pier.
Vessel sank in the Arafura Sea. Ten crew members were rescued by nearby fishing boats, meanwhile, search and rescue operations are ongoing for 15 of the crew who went missing.

Oil products spilled overboard from cargo ship at the port of Astrakhan, Russia. The oil response team monitored the port waters around one of the berths and found a significant pollution of the water surface from the spilled oil products. An oil boom was deployed, after which the oil response team removed the pollution in the area of the berth. About 600 kgs of oil products and oil-soaked sorbent were collected from the water surface.
A fire broke out in a hold on board vessel at the Freza shipyard. Extinguished fire in about 40 minutes. Cause of the fire is investigated which was under repair in Petropavlovsk-Kamchatskiy, Russia.
Vessel had fire in engine room, steering gear station, during routine maintenance at shipyard in Tuzla. Crew did initial fire extinguishing, put out later. Damage and cause unknown.
Vessel ran aground due to loss of steerage off Spurn Head, UK. Tugs Svitzer Eleanor, Trent Fisher attended. Refloated, towed to Bull anchorage. Docked at Grimsby dock on 01 Jul.
Vessel, serving Edmonds-Kingston route in USA, reported a mechanical issue, seemingly with the generator. Vessel towed back to Kingston for repairs. Vessel stationary at Kingston as of 01 Jul.

Vessel allided with Bohus Bridge in central Kungalv, Sweden after trying to avoid a leisure boat coming in way. Passengers unaffected, vessel had hull damage. Leisure boat sail away. Vessel returned to Gothenburg.

A sick crew member was medevaced in the Øresund strait. The ship was en route from Porsgrunn, Norway, to Szczecin, Poland when it requested assistance. A rescue helicopter took off from Roskilde, Denmark. The patient was hoisted and flown to Roskilde for further treatment.
Vessel collided with the quay in Marstal, as it had arrived with too much speed while entering the port. A couple of cars on board were pushed against each other & sustained minor damages.

Vessel collided with a pleasure craft in St. Lawrence River off Levis, in position lat 46 48 41.0N, long 071 11 41.5W, Quebec, Canada. Pleasure craft escorted to marina by support Cap Tourmente. No pollution.
Vessel was NUC as it needed the main engine fuel pump replacement, abt 15 NM of Bolt Head. The defect was fixed. Ar in Zeebrugge, 30 Jun 2022 and Sd from the port, same day.

Vessel was invovled in a collision with cargo ship Nemesis, while berthed at Korissia, Greece. The accident had caused dents and abrasions to the Macedon some five metres above the water line. The Nemesis suffered damage to the rails of the middle deck. The collision did not cause any injuries and no marine pollution was observed.

Vessel allided its port side with the berthed Passenger/Cargo RoRo Macedon at the port of Korissia, Greece, due to a north-northeast wind of 5-6 Beaufort, while manoeuvring to depart for the port of Sitia, Crete. The accident had caused dents and abrasions to the Macedon some five metres above the water line. The Nemesis suffered damage to the rails of the middle deck. The collision did not cause any injuries and no marine pollution was observed.

Vessel was NUC due to a need to replace the exhaust valve in ME, 19.4 NM E of Start Point, UK. About 3 hrs later repairs are done & the vessel is underway. Ar in Antwerp, 29 Jun & Sd from the port, same day.

Vessel experienced fire onboard while under construction at Myklebust shipyard in Gursken, Norway. Fire brigade arrived on scene and extinguished fire. Caught fire during welding works. No injuries were reported.
Vessel had structural damage during in cargo hold access ladder, side hatch coaming handrails and pertinent equipment, at Hereke, Turkey. Was stationary at Hereke, 28 Jun. Ar in Shengjin, 08 Jul.
Vessel en route from Rhodes to Symi, Greece with 16 POB had malfunction of SB-side main engine. Tug Christos XL escorted vessel to Akantia; banned until repairs, certification.
Vessel had engine failure off coast of Westkapelle, Netherlands and came to a standstill off the dike. After 1 hr, power restored, vessel continued voyage under own power.
Vessel experienced fire onboard off coast of port of La Spezia. Fire Brigade from La Spezia intervened & extinguished fire. Returned to the port of Livorno on 28 Jun.
Vessel had LPG leak on nozzles, NUC in position lat 59 04 24.6N, long 007 51 18.0W, 60nm NW of Butt of Lewis, Western Isles, U.K. Injector seals repaired. resumed voyage on 27 Jun.

Tank with 25 tons of chlorine gas fell onto cargo deck of the brand-new vessel at Aqaba Port, Jordan, during loading operations. Tank was damaged, a big thick orange cloud of gas covered the ship and pier alongside. At least 10 people died, and 251 were injured. Local residents are asked to stay at home and close windows.

Vessel ran aground in Bali Strait off Gilimanuk Port, western Bali, Indonesia, while approaching Gilimanuk on arrival from Ketapang Port, East Java. All passengers reportedly were evacuated and transferred to Gilimanuk. No injuries were reported. Engine failure and high waves are believed to be the cause of grounding.

Vessel en route from Burgas, Bulgaria to Istanbul, Turkey, reported technical failure, anchored at Igneada anchorage. Crew repairing as of 07 Jul. Sailed from Igneada anchorage on 13 Jul, reach Istanbul anch.

One of gears of vessel stuck while manoeuvring to dock at Cos Nou in port of Mao, Spain; vessel moved forward, allided with cruise ship dock. Maritime Captaincy investigate, permit to sail to Valencia.
Vessel had an engine failure in Arzew, Algeria. Tug assistance was requested. Tug FFS Arion started towing it, 01 Jul. Berthed at the Dique Fotante in Campamento, 03 Jul.

A 53-year-old crew member needed immediate hospital treatment while vessel was sailing north of Crete. A Greek Air Force helicopter  hoisted the patient and transported him to Heraklion International Airport, where he was picked up by an ambulance and taken to Heraklion University General Hospital for a medical examination.

Heavy machinery vehicle fell onto cargo deck of vessel during offloading at Terminal Two, Valparaiso, Chile as it arrived from China. Reportedly the vehicle wasn’t secured by leading lashes so it lost balance, flipped over and fell. Nobody was injured but ship’s cargo deck and vehicle sustained damages.

Fire erupted in hold number five with cargo of plywood being offloaded at Fernandino Port, Florida. 35 firefighters were deployed, fire was extinguished in about 6 hours. Extent of damages and cargo losses are yet to be confirmed.
A crew member had to be evacuated by helicopter while vessel was en route from Verdal, Norway, to Mo i Rana, Norway. He was taken to a hospital in Sandnessjøen in critical condition.

Vessel loaded with 570 second-hand cars caught fire in Japan sea some 55 nm north of Toyama, Honshu, Japan. She was en route from Fushiki to Vladivostok. All 25 Russian crew abandoned burning ship according to Japanese sources. No injuries or casualties were reported. It is believed fire erupted on cargo deck in one of the cars.
Vessel hit an iceberg size of grand piano off Hubbard Glacier, Gulf of Alaska, and is understood to have suffered hull breach and probably other damages. She was en route from Juneau to Victoria BC.

A port worker in Bremerhaven, Germany, was killed in an accident aboard the vessel while being loaded in the East Port. He was crushed between a moving excavator and other cargo. He was treated on scene and then taken to a hospital, but he died from his injuries the next day.

Vessel had steering issues and requested tow in Gulf of St. Lawrence off Miscou Island, in position 47 54 10.1N, 64 10 18.5W, New Brunswick, Canada. Canadian Coast Guard vessel CAP BRETON towed vessel to Caraquet.
Vessel experienced technical failure, sheltered & dropped anchor at Datca, Turkey. Crew commenced repairs, while vessel remained stationary at anchored position.

Vessel came in contact with chemical tanker Oriental Lotus while berthing at Ashdod, Israel. Both vessels had heavy damage, under temp repairs. Vessel sail Ashdod on 03 Jul for Piraeus, arrive on 06 Jul.
Vessel was taking on water, in lat 57 55 06N, long 000 02 05. The hole was plugged, ingress stopped & it made way to Peterhead. Arrived in the Peterhead harbour, United Kingdom.
Vessel ran aground in pos 53 17 36.6N, 03 40 19.2W, due to engine failure. Defect was fixed and vessel allowed to sail to its destination, same day.

Vessel reported a total failure of its diesel generator engine while docked in lat 44 39 00N, long 63 33 00W, in Halifax Harbour, Nova Scotia, Canada. Crew done repair works. Remains stationary as of 04 Aug.

Vessel came in contact with bulk cement carrier Seaven Sky while berthing at Ashdod, Israel. Both vessels had heavy damage, under temp repairs. Sail Ashdod on 06 Jul, arrive at Bandirma anch on 09 Jul.
Vessel attempted declutch engine resulting jerking forward & colliding with Tug, in position  53 44 30N, 000 15 35W. Tug subsequently sinking. Awaiting further details as to the extent of pollution.

Vessel collided with sailboat off coast of Oropos, Greece under unspecified circumstances. No damages to vessel. Sailboat sunk. No injuries or pollution. Class inspection done, resumed voyage on 24 Jun.
Vessel had a mechanical failure during its departure from Varna, and threatened to run aground at the entrance of the Varna Channel. Tugs were deployed & towed to the anchorage area.

Vessel reported that the port cable of the upper landing platform had broken, at the port of Kyllini, Greece. Port Authority of Kyllini prohibited the departure of it and after completion of repairs, it sailed.

Vessel sank in waters of Tanah Laut Regency, Southern Kalimantan, Indonesia, Java sea. She was en route from Banjarmasin to Samarinda, East Kalimantan, Makassar Strait. 5 crew were rescued on Jun 24, but 6 are still missing. Details of disaster are unknown, most probably loss of stability.

Vessel collided with Inversa on the river Nieuwe Merwede near Dordrecht, Netherlands. Severe bow damage, a hole above waterline. Taken and berthed at Werkendam. Sailed again, bound for Uerdingen, Germany.
Vessel sustained mechanical damage in sea area 1.15 nm east of Cape Sounio. She was escorted to Laurium anchorage for repairs and investigation. Can sail after repairs.

Vessel was damaged after alliding with fender at Botafoc dam in port of Ibiza, Spain due to strong winds. A hole was torn into SB side hull above WL. Sailed after repairs on 26 Jun, apparently back in service.

Three robbers armed with long knives boarded vessel while it was moored at the Callao anchorage, Peru. The perpetrators were sighted by the crew, and the alarm was raised. Hearing the alarm, they fled the vessel, escaping with property stolen from the ship. The incident was reported to the Callao port authorities.

As per Global Radiance Ship Management (GRSM), Singapore, vessel had engine problems, until 04 Jul on way to Al Mokha, Yemen; 2 generators out of service, ME stopped abt 44 NM off Aden. Arrive Al Mokha 13 Jul.

Vessel, en route from Tianjin, China, to Damietta, Egypt, lost some deck cargo due to adverse weather conditions when it was south of Yemen. Part of the cargo lashing broke, resulting in the cargo shifting from the main deck stowage and falling into the sea. The starboard side main deck handrail was damaged. The vessel sailed from Damietta upon completion of formalities and notifications and the vessel arrived at Diliskelesi on July 8th.

Fire erupted in cargo hold vessel while loading scrap at the Sifferdok in Oostakker, Ghent Belgium. Fire engines and a tug were deployed. No injuries reported, extent of damages unknown. Self-ignited scrap fire is a regular type of accident.
Vessel had technical failure, sheltered and dropped anchor at Anamur, Turkey. Repairs carried out by crew. Vessel was underway the same day.

Vessel was en route from Quy Nhon to Hai Phong with cargo of stones, she was caught in heavy swell while anchored, understood there was cargo shift, which caused capsizing and sinking. Crew managed to seal off fuel tanks and fuel pipes before abandoning the ship, no leak reported so far.
Vessel ran aground S. of Bunavullin, Sound of Mull, UK, in pos 56 36 13.2N, 005 58 42W. Minor water ingress pumps coping. Tobermory RNLI lifeboat escorted. Moored at Corpach on 22 Jun.

A 33-year-old crew member needed immediate hospital treatment while the vessel was sailing southwest of Pylos, en route from Sousse to Tuzla. The ship approached the waters of Methoni, Messinia, where the patient was transferred to a patrol boat and transported safely to shore. He was then picked up by an EKAB ambulance and taken to the Pylos Health Centre for medical treatment. He had since been discharged.

Vessel ran aground due to bad weather conditions near Rizal Boulevard in Dumaguete City. She suffered damages to SB-side hull. Towed to Dumaguete, crew safe. No oil spill, underwater inspection will be conducted to check vessel condition.
Vessel had electrical issues with one of its main generators while berthed in Riviere-du-Loup, in position lat 47 50 51.7N, long 069 34 12.1W, Quebec. Crew done repairs resumed voyage next day.
Vessel sunk in waters off Sapudi Islands in Sumenep Regency, Indonesia. Crew safe.
Vessel was in a laid-up situation, at Iraklion (Heraklion) port, Greece. She was towed and moored at Laurium (Lavrion) on 23 Jun, awaiting shipping company's decision.

UPDATE: The Indian Coast Guard deployed six vessels and two Dornier aircraft in its effort to check marine pollution from submerged cargo ship, which sank on June 23rd. Only a minor sheen of oil, thought to be from engine bilges and dirty water tanks, had been observed to date. Vessel issued distress signal, reporting water ingress, and reportedly, intentionally ran aground to avoid sinking. 15 crew, all Syrians, were rescued. PRINCESS MIRAL is en route from China to Beirut Lebanon, with some 8,000 tons of steel coils on board.

Vessel suffered fire at Perama Ship Repair Yard, Piraeus, in aft area, probably in engine room. Fire was extinguished by joint efforts of 2 SAR ships, 5 fire engines and crew, no injuries reported, extent of damages unknown. The ship is undergoing repairs to be refitted for ferry services, since Apr 2022.

Vessel suffered explosion in engine room, followed by fire, some 60 nm SE of Fos, France, while en route from Napoli to Fos. 3 crew were injured and medevaced by helicopter, all 3 transported to hospital, 2 of them in serious condition. The ship was disabled and had to be towed to Fos anchorage.

Vessel had damage to its hydrofoil wing following the involvement of a foreign debris object. It sailed independently to Aegina where 108 passengers  safely disembarked. P.Auth of Aegina allowed sailing to Perama for repairs.
Vessel  remained alongside at Rosyth, UK, 21 Aug 2022, after an emergency drydocking following a major leak earlier in the year. On 22 Aug, the vessel sailed from Crombie.
Vessel came in contact with chemical tanker Livatya on Danube River, near port of Tulcea, Romania. No pollution or injuries. Both vessels sustained damages and remained stationary near Tulcea.

Vessel had engine technical trouble near Kiel Canal. Captain decided to repair fault at Lindenau Yard. Water police found Captain on breathalyser along with bleeding head wound.Vessel detained until repairs.
Vessel came in contact with product tanker Lefteris on Danube River, near port of Tulcea, Romania. No pollution or injuries. Vessel was damaged at port side near superstructure above waterline.
Vessel sustained engine damage and loss of propulsion in Brunsbuttel , Germany. She was towed to Container Terminal Altenwerder in Hamburg same day by tugs Bugsier 22 and Fairplay IX.

Ukrainian troops struck Chornomornaftogaz's drilling rigs in Crimea, including MODU CRIMEA-2, according to head of occupation administration of annexed Crimea. Of the total of 20 POB, 5 evacuated, search on for rest.

Vessel was NUC due to an electrical fault, stopped main engine, in lat 49 36 45N, long 004 46 56W, UK. After restart, it had to shut down again. Completed repairs same day. Ar in Dunkirk, 20 Jun and Sd 23 Jun.

Vessel allided with quay wall in port of West-Terschelling, Netherlands. No injuries. Vessel sustained damage to rear with crack in steering engine room above waterline. Will undergo repair in Harlingen.
Vessel en route from Thessaloniki, Greece to Mangalia, Romania had technical failure at Canakkale Strait. Shifted to Bozcaada anch, crews carried out repairs. Sailed next day towards Mangalia.

Vessel was reported NUC as its air control main engine lost control, in lat 51 38 43N, long 001 16 15E, abt 9.1 NM SSE of Clacton-on-Sea. Air control is now restored and in working condition. Vessel is underway.

A crew member fell unnoticed into the water of the port of Montevideo while boarding the vessel. His absence was noticed only a few days later when his family contacted the port because he had gone missing. After an exhaustive search, late on June 24th a security camera footage was found that showed him falling into the water. He slipped accidentally when he was trying to board the tug, which was moored in the port and was inactive at the time. The Uruguayan Navy launched a search. Divers from the Prefecture have also been looking for him.
Vessel came in contact with ro/ro Isola di Capri in Marina Grande of Capri, Italy. No injuries. Napoli Jet sustained damages to its starboard side superstructure and berthed in Naples for repairs.
Vessel had fire broke out in a clothes dryer in laundry room in Calais, France. Sprinklers triggered, crew put out fire. People safe. Resumed service to Dover, UK the same day.
Vessel came in contact with hydrofoil Napoli Jet in Marina Grande of Capri, Italy. No injuries. Napoli Jet sustained damages to its starboard side superstructure. Vessel sailed for Naples.

Vessel allided pilings near Annacis Auto Terminal while departing Surrey, in lat 49 11 10.8N, long 122 54 54.6W, British Columbia, Canada. Returned to dock to assess the damages. Sd from Surrey, 22 Jun.

Vessel had structural damage in cargo hold bulkhead, during loading ops at Ennore, India; cargo hold bulkhead heavily holed, damaged and deformed. Vessel sail and reach Izmir, Turkey on 13 Jul; to be repaired.
Vessel suffered a fire off Fogo, Newfoundland and Labrador, with 32 crew members on board. No damage or injuries were reported and the ship continued its patrol in the Labrador Sea.

Vessel had a blackout for an hour, in lat 60 33 24N, long 004 55 37E. Later it was able to rectify issues and was underway to its destination. Anchored in the Port of Olden, Norway, 19 Jun. Sd from Olden, 19 Jun.

Vessel was in 7-degree list caused by ballast water, in lat 53 30 34N, long 003 17 15W, abt 9.6 NM at 007 degrees from Point of Ayr, UK. Berthed at East Float of Birkenhead Dock in Liverpool on 19 Jun.
Vessel had a technical failure at southern entrance of Istanbul Strait. Repairs by the crew. Shifted to Istanbul anch., with slow speed using own power, remains stationary as of 19 Jun.

Vessel developed heavy starboard list and requested assistance in front of Tuapse Port, Russia, Black sea. It was confirmed by RosMoRechFlot (Russian Maritime Agency) that she was intentionally grounded in shallows along coastline, to avoid capsizing.
Vessel had engine trouble after entering new southern lock of Canal in Brunsbuttel, Germany. Luchs towed and moored vessel at railway station pilings for inspection and repair.

The Chief Engineer was found dead in his cabin while the vessel was waiting for a berth allocation at an anchorage off New Mangalore Port, Karnataka, India. The cause of death was unknown. The body was taken to the mortuary of AJ Hospital, Mangalore.
Vessel had bow thruster failure while docking in Vancouver, in position lat 49 17 22.2N, long 123 06 36.0W, British Columbia, Canada. Tugs assisted vessel. No pollution.

Vessel had issues with one of its main generators while underway in St. Lawrence River off Godbout, in position lat 49 09 44.0N, long 067 26 14.0W, Quebec, Canada. Crew done repairs in Matane, sailed on 18 Jun.

Vessel ran aground on the western shore of Unimak Island between Unalaska and the Alaska Peninsula with four crew members on board. A US Coast Guard helicopter did not observe any pollution during a June 26th flyover. Resolve Marine was hired to recover the vessel but said that she was “too stuck” for them to be able to tow her. She will instead have to be scuttled.

3-5 cubic metre oil spill occurred during crude oil transfer between 2 crude oil tanks OB vessel at Jadestone's Montara field, Australia, production stopped. 30mm hole at bottom of tank. Repairs to take 4 weeks.

Vessel was NUC due to a problem with a turbocharger of ME, loss of power, anchored in pos 51 39 05N, 003 11 48E, 10.5 NM off Thorntonbank, Belgium, for repairs. On 17 Jun, crew completed repairs. Ar in Ghent, 18 Jun.

Two Indian seamen died while checking empty cargo tank. They’ve been taken to hospital, and declared dead on arrival. Probably they died from asphyxiation. Tanker arrived at Chittagong on Jun 15, probably in ballast, after offloading cargo of soybean oil.

Vessel had main engine problem off Contrecoeur, in lat 45 50 03.6N, long 073 17 04.8W, Quebec, Canada. Proceeded to nearest anchorage for repairs. Ar in Montreal 18 Jun, completed repairs and Sd 20 Jun.

Vessel was asked to leave the port of Nice a few hours after its arrival following complaints from residents about smoke and the noise made by its engines. Following a decision taken by the harbour master’s office, the vessel, carrying 300 passengers, sailed within the hour, just before midnight. The ship arrived on June 17th in the port of Toulon.
Vessel reported explosion OB while anchored and undergoing repairs at Seychelles anch. 2 crew killed, 3 injured. Could have been caused by an ammonia leak. Damage to vessel unknown.

Vessel collided with fishing vessel Zaliv Petra in the Sea of Okhotsk, about 100nm southeast of Magadan. The Zaliv Petra was damaged at the hull on the starboard side aft. The vessel remained seaworthy and headed to the port of Busan for repairs. The Aleksandr Shalin suffered minor damage to the bow.

Vessel technical problems and has been out of service for several maintenance breaks in Mariehamn, Aland. Will be out of service till 10 Jul.  Permanent repairs underway, 29 Jun. Sd from Mariehamn, 10 Jul.
Vessel while operating its planned route from Rafina to Tinos, Mykonos, Naxos & Paros, sustained mechanical damage between ports of Naxos and Paros. Repairs done and vessel underway.

Vessel collided with fishing vessel Aleksandr Shalin in the Sea of Okhotsk, about 100nm southeast of Magadan. The Zaliv Petra was damaged at the hull on the starboard side aft. The vessel remained seaworthy and headed to the port of Busan for repairs. The Aleksandr Shalin suffered minor damage to the bow.
Vessel had main engine turbocharger failure on Lake Erie off Port Alma, in position lat 41 59 22.0N, long 081 55 58.0W, Ontario, Canada. Vessel anchored to carry out repairs.
Vessel collided with Lady Anne at the Govert van Wijn Quay in Maassluis/Rotterdam. Vessel was mooring in the port when its stern contacted the bow of Lady Anne. The stern of the vessel was punctured.
Vessel had an engine failure and went adrift in the middle of the fjord. The vessel had to be towed back to the quay in Eidsnes by another ferry on the route.
Captain of vessel reported to Port Authority of Patmos, Greece that vessel had rudder failure E of Patmos. Greek CG patrol boat and MV Irini reached, found water ingress in vessel, towed to Patmos.
Vessel ran aground in lat 55 44 06N, long 004 56 22W. Was refloated same day and proceeded to Ardrossan for water survey.

Vessel suffered a fire in a cargo hold stowed with frozen fish while the vessel was at berth at Ijmuiden. The fire was reported to have been extinguished with the assistance of the local fire brigade.
Vessel had a total breakdown of one of the paddle wheels off Mjosa. Crew requested assistance and Mjosvekteren-RS 148 towed it to Gjovik.

General cargo ship SUN UNICORN allided with berthed container ship ABANOZ at Novorossiysk Port, Russia, Black sea, after unmooring. SUN UNICORN was shifting the berth at the time of an accident. She also contacted pier. The ship sustained stern damages, ABANOZ probably, sustained only minor damages, because she left Novorossiysk the same day, bound for Samsun Turkey.

Vessel, en route from Tuzla to Kepez, allided with the pier on the port side during a berthing manoeuvre. The hull was holed, cracked and a ballast tank heavily damaged above the water line. The stored ballast water leaked from the hole into sea. The vessel shifted from the pier to Karanlik liman anchorage, and dropped anchor. The ship left port towards Jacksonville after repairs and new class certificate was issued.

3 crew members of container ship SIMBA jumped overboard, when outbound ship was passing Fort George island, St. Johns River, Jacksonville, USA. 1 was caught shortly after he reached the shore, 2 other are still missing, search under way. Apparently all 3 persons want to stay in USA. SIMBA sailed out of river, anchored, but 3 hours later heaved anchor and returned to Jacksonville, where she was berthed.

Vessel ran aground in Fuglefjorden, northwestern Spitsbergen, Svalbard, Norwegian archipelago between Norway and North Pole, Arctic. Ship’s hull was breached in fuel tank area, oil leak reported. She was refloated some 4 hours later, probably with offshore tug assistance.

Vessel was beached by heavy swell on Oquendo beach, Callao, Peru. Two watchmen on board were rescued. Reports say the owner will probably try to rescue the ship because of valuable equipment on board. Understood the ship is in a lay-up, for maybe 2-3 years.

Vessel had a malfunction of the oil pump connection of the port main engine, outside the port of Symi. Was able to sail independently to Symi and disembark passengers. Departure banned until repairs are done.
All sailings of vessel on route Starheim - Isane, Norway cancelled by operator due to technical problems. Bolts on fuel valves in engine had broken. Was towed ashore by ferry Oppedal.
Vessel had a technical failure at the N entrance of Istanbul Strait. Shifted from incident place to the Tuzla shipyard area anch. Repairs are being done.

Vessel allided with bridge crossing Neckar in Ilvesheim while en route from Mannheim to Frankfurt am Main, Germany. Wheelhouse destroyed, 1 person had slight cuts. Vessel damage estimated 100,000Euro. Investigation on.
Vessel had engine damage after arriving in Puerto Colon, Cristobal, Panama. Fire fighting tug VB Hispania started towing vessel on 16 Jun to Las Palmas de Gran Canaria for repairs.

Vessel, during sea trial performance test, had power loss, dangerously drifted to shore in Tuzla anchorage, Turkey. Tug SARK secured vessel to first convenience anchorage. Fined. Need to pay tug assistance expense.

A 51-year-old foreign crew member needed immediate hospital treatment. He was medevaced, transported safely to the port of Gythio and then transferred to the local Health Centre for medical examination.

Vessel ran aground in Savannah river near Old Fort Jackson, while sailing upstream to Savannah Port, en route from Charleston. The ship was refloated 2 hours later with several tugs assistance. No reports on damages and oil leaks.

Vessel ran aground off the port of Argostoli en route from Drepano Riou.  With the assistance of a tug she was removed from the grounding site and then anchored, prior to inspection by a private diver. The Port Authority prohibited the departure of the ship until the repair of the damage and the presentation of a certificate of seaworthiness by the classification society that monitors it. The ship was moored temporarily in the port of Argostoli.

Vessel had damage to port main engine, Aegina, Greece. Passengers taken to Piraeus by another vessel. P.auth prohibited sailing until repairs & class maintenance certificates were issued. Sd from Aegina, 13 Jun.
Vessel collided with Maritime Polaris at Sudan Port. Both vessels had some limited damage. Port operations affected.

Vessel struck pier at Santos Port, Brazil, while shifting berths. The ship is said to be loaded with 71,000 tons of sugar. She didn’t suffer serious damages, though damages assessment is still under way to assess ship’s seaworthiness. She was docked at Santos on Jun 10, arriving from Vietnam via Singapore.
Vessel had steering gear issue in St. Lawrence River off Neuville, in position lat 46 41 24.0N, long 071 32 51.6W, Quebec, Canada. Vessel proceeded to anchorage for repairs. No pollution.

Vessel contacted berthed unidentified cargo ship, most probably bulk carrier, at Sudan Port, Sudan. Tanker entered port and was proceeding to berth, when accident occurred. Both ships sustained some damages.
Vessel had engine issues in the Detroit River off Windsor, in position lat 42 17 42.8N, long 083 05 17.0W, Ontario, Canada. Vessel proceeded to Sarnia for repairs.
Vessel experienced engine failure, while en route from Piraeus to Poros. It completed repairs and class inspection. Will resume voyage as scheduled.

Fire erupted in engine room at Yalova, Turkey, Marmara sea. Fire was extinguished by joint efforts of SAR ship, tugs and firefighting engines. The ship is docked in shipyard (Sefine Shipyard probably), she’s under repairs since Jan 2022 and therefore, in ballast.

Vessel had machinery failure while transiting St. Lawrence River off Montreal, in position lat 45 34 17.6N, long 073 30 26.0W, Quebec, Canada. Anchored, crew done repairs. Resumed voyage. No pollution.

Captain of the vessel was arrested in the port of Thassos, because the vessel had too many passengers on board upon its arrival from Keramotis. It was claimed that there were 463 passengers on board rather than the current maximum of 311. A preliminary investigation is being carried out by the Thasos Port Authority.
Vessel requested a medical evacuation of its master by MRCC Holyhead Coastguard while 10nm west of the Isle of Man. He was hoisted and transferred to the Dublin hospital.

Vessel suffered an engine failure at Marmara Ereglisi and was towed to the Yasarsan Shipyard for repairs. Permanent repairs have commenced as per the surveyor’s recommendations. The vessel remained stationary at the shipyard as of July 11th.
Vessel had problem with starter motor and service from Abelnes to Andabeloy, Norway had to be cancelled. It remains sidelined in Abelnes, 16 Jun. Roro used as alternative triangle route.

Vessel capsized and partially sank along pier at Suakin Port, Sudan, Red sea, while about to leave port. The ship with some 16,000 cattle on board is resting starboard on bottom, remaining partially above waterline. Overload is said to be most probable cause of capsizing since the ship’s permissible max load is 8,000 cattle.

Vessel,en route from Rostov-na-Donu, Russia to Damietta, Egypt, had technical failure, sheltered, dropped anchor at Kaleucagiz anchorage, Turkey. Crew carryout repairs, vessel sail on 13 Jun for Damietta.
Vessel had mechanical trouble, approx in lat 38 0 45N, long 007 0 11E, Italy. Maria Onorato was deployed from Cagliari and took the vessel under tow to Messina. Convoy Ar in Messina, 16 Jun.

Vessel suffered a technical failure at Zonguldak while en route from Istanbul. Permission to depart was cancelled temporarily by the Harbour Master until the completion of repairs and a verification by state surveyors. On June 13th the vessel was granted departure permission and sailed to Giurgiuleski, Moldova.

Vessel had broken piston and engine overheating, in position lat 50 47 56.3N, long 000 47 21.0E, UK. Way out of lane on own, anchored at Eitz and contacted Dover CG. Engine fixed and continued voyage, same day.
Vessel had engine breakdown, she sailed from Olbia, Italy towards a shipyard in Genoa without passengers. Sailed entire route at 14/15 knots, docked at Drydock in Genoa on 12 Jun.
Vessel was anchored in lat 51 25 10N, long 001 50 53E, due to an engine valve defect that required a replacement. The vessel repaired the defect and was underway to its destination, on the same day.

Vessel collided with tug BINA MARINE 59 and barge in Singapore Strait north of Batam, Indonesia. Barge loaded with some 4,500 tons of granite was damaged, understood she was towed to shallows to avoid sinking. Bulk carrier didn’t interrupt her voyage from Singapore to Bahodopi, South East Sulawesi, and sailed away, understood she was allowed to continue sailing.

Bulk carrier HONWIN collided with tug as it was towing barge in Singapore Strait north of Batam, Indonesia. Barge loaded with some 4,500 tons of granite was damaged, understood she was towed to shallows to avoid sinking. Bulk carrier didn’t interrupt her voyage from Singapore to Bahodopi, South East Sulawesi, and sailed away, understood she was allowed to continue sailing.

Croatian 35-year old deck officer was reported lost in mid-Atlantic, while the ship was en route from Kuwait to Point Fortin Trinidad and Tobago. Tanker searched for missing officer for 3 days. Investigation is under way.

Sailing yacht ELEONORA E was hit by SAR ship PUNTA MAYOR at Tarragona Port, Spain. Yacht starboard side was crushed and ELEONORA E sank along pier. PUNTA MAYOR was maneuvering to exit port, her engines controls suddenly were blocked in reverse mode and struck hapless yacht by her stern, at rather high speed. Nobody was injured. Yacht hull is made of steel, probably she will be restored.

Vessel allided with moored luxury yacht Bliss in Mykonos Port, Greece. Both vessels suffered minor damage. The Mykonos Port Authority prohibited the departure of both vessels until class seaworthiness certificates were issued by the monitoring classification societies. As of June 15th the Alexander was underway from Santorini, Greece, to Naroussa, Greece.

Sailing yacht ELEONORA E was hit by SAR ship PUNTA MAYOR at Tarragona Port, Spain. Yacht starboard side was crushed and ELEONORA E sank along pier. PUNTA MAYOR was maneuvering to exit port, her engines controls suddenly were blocked in reverse mode and struck hapless yacht by her stern, at rather high speed. Nobody was injured. Yacht hull is made of steel, probably she will be restored.

Vessel struck pier and Ship Boarding Bridge (SBB) at Busan Port on arrival from Jeju with 180 passengers on board. SBB collapsed and operator of SBB suffered injuries. The ship sustained damages in bow, fore starboard area, including dents and hull breaches. Ferry will have to undergo repairs before resuming scheduled voyages

Vessel made an emergency call at port of Baie-Comeau, Quebec Province, Canada, about a month ago, after encountering rudder problems. Tanker was suuposed to fix the problem and resume voyage, but she has been stuck in port for a month or more, waiting for spare parts, and will probably remain at port until at least Jul 20.

Greek ferry Alexander allided with moored luxury yacht in Mykonos Port, Greece. Both vessels suffered minor damage. The Mykonos Port Authority prohibited the departure of both vessels until class seaworthiness certificates were issued by the monitoring classification societies. As of June 15th the Alexander was underway from Santorini, Greece, to Naroussa, Greece.

Vessel en route from Hull, UK to Ambes, France NUC after complete loss of engine power/loss of manoeuvrability 30NM E of Start Point. Fuel pump believed to be the problem. Few hours later repairs done, vessel sailed.

Vessel met with a minor incident on arrival at Buenos Aires during docking manoeuvre, sustain hull damage - breaches, bruises, dents above WL. Returned to Juan Lacaze, repairs done on 13 Jun, operational again.

Vessel had an engine failure upon approaching CoteSainte-Catherine lock in St. Lawrence Seaway off Sainte-Catherine, in position 45 24 30.0N, 073 34 31.3W, Quebec, Canada. Crew done repairs. Resumed voyage.

Fire erupted in engine room in Amurskiy Bay, Vladivostok, Russia, Japan sea. Fire engulfed most of the ship, all 17 crew had to be evacuated, all are safe except Captain, who was hospitalized with head injury, caused by fall. Vessel is severely damaged. Salvage ships and boats were deployed in firefighting.

Vessel capsized at the quay in Bonnerup, North-Djursland. Two crew members already left vessel. Vessel raised on 12 Jun, completely damaged, declared total loss. Towed to Grena on 23 Jun, for demolition.

UPDATE: Report emerged on a collision between tuna fishing vessels VIVA FAFA NO. 707 and understood, MOAMAEU, in the evening of 8th June. According to VIVA FAFA NO. 707 crew testimony, collision was caused by MOAMAEU reckless maneuvering.  MOAMAEU made sudden turn and was struck amidships by VIVA FAFA NO. 707 bow, her crew was rescued by VIVA FAFA NO. 707. Vessel reportedly sank 160 nm south of Pohnpei island, Micronesia. No other information available at the moment.
Vessel suffered an engine failure off the coast of Kilitbahir, Turkey, while en route from Tuzla to İzmir. The ship was assisted by a tug and anchored at Karanlık Liman.

Captain of vessel informed Port Authority of Kyllini, Greece of sustained mechanical failure while operating its scheduled route from Sarakiniko to Kyllini. No injuries, pollution. Resumed sailing on 10 Jun.

Sailings of vessel, from Uig to Tarbert had to be cancelled due to a burst pipe within the fire protection system. The vessel needed to undergo repair works in Uig and has been removed from service until 11 Jun.

Vessel reported as NUC due to problem with cooling valve and small pipe burst, in pos 50 53 55N, 005 58 43W, abt 33 NM N of Land's end TSS. About 90 mins later, repairs done, vessel underway. Observed for 5 hrs.
