Vessel had engine room water ingress, at Hansweert/Schore, Netherlands. Eiltank 69, salvage companies, KNRM moored vessel in Hansweert. 3 worker, salvage pumps transferred and controlled ingress. Moored at pontoon.

Vessel ran aground in approach to channel while entering Port of Barranquilla Colombia in load, arriving from USA via Santa Marta Colombia. She was refloated some 4 hours later with tugs assistance. POLESIE reached port and was berthed same day. Grounding probably, was caused by patchy insufficient depths along fairway due to sediments.

A helicopter crashed on the deck of the vessel while on a flight over the anchorage area of Sao Luís Bay, Brazil. It was attempting an emergency landing on the deck at the time. The helicopter was reportedly a total loss, but no casualties were reported.

Vessel reappeared on AIS after mysterious 9-day gap confirming Ukraine's suspicions that stolen cargo of grain was being trasported. The ship called unidentified port to offload cargo, most probably Syrian port.

Vessel suffered explosion followed by major fire in front of Batam Port, Riau islands, Indonesia, Singapore Strait. There were no passengers on board but 1 crew died in explosion, 1 jumped overboard after explosion and went missing and 4 were badly burned and are in hospital in critical condition. The fire engulfed most part of the ship and she’ll probably burn out.

Vessel collided with tuna fishing vessel MOAMAEU, 310 nm east of Rabaul, East New Britain province of Papua New Guinea. According to crew testimony, collision was caused by MOAMAEU reckless maneuvering. MOAMAEU sank, her 31 crew was rescued by VIVA FAFA NO. 707.
The Rostock port authority informed the water police Rostock that a hydraulic hose had ruptured on board vessel after she had moored and opened the aft ramp at berth 62.

Vessel has spilled 800 litres of diesel at the AZ-1 Petronor dock in Bilbao. Detained for the cleaning and containment work continued after the leakage was recorded. Remains stationary in Bilbao, 09 Jun.

Vessel allided with wall of lock No. 5 and sustained damage to its port side rescue boat davit, while transiting Welland Canal off Thorold, in position lat 43 08 05.5N, long 079 11 31.5W, Ontario, Canada.
Vessel experienced engine failure at south of Anamur, Turkey, in pos 35 45 14N, 33 14 46 E. Repairs are being carried out by the crew and vessel drifting as of 10 Jun.

Fire broke out on vessel's engine room, while she was on tour in Norfolk harbor, with more than 100 passengers on board. Another tour boat came alongside and evacuated all passengers and most of the crew, with two crew remaining on board to assist fire fighting. Boat was later berthed at pier, tug or tugs were joined by firefighting engines from pier.

Vessel reported a faulty steering mechanism off IJmuiden/Velsen, Netherlands in pos 52 31 36N, 04 29 42E. She made it to IJmuiden where repairs were arranged. As of next day, vessel operational again.
Vessel had loss of astern propulsion at English Bay in position lat 49 17 15.7N, long 123 10 44.0W, British Columbia, Canada. Crew carried out repairs. No pollution.

Vessel informed Thassos port authority that it had damage to SB main engine, at Prinos Thassou, Greece. Vessel prohibited to depart until repaired, seaworthiness certificate issued. Sail Prinos Thassou on 07 Jun.
Vessel ran aground in rocky area off Koundouros, Greece. JRCC assisted, refloated, sailed unassisted to Korrisia, 07 Jun. Port Authority prohibited departure until presenting a seaworthy certificate.
Vessel experienced technical failure and sheltered in Cesme anchorage, Turkey. Crew carrying out repairs and sailed from Cesme anch, 10 Jun.

Fire erupted in engine room after vessel arrived at Santos from USA, to load citrus juices. Fire engines were deployed, fire was taken under control, but fire fighters remain on board to monitor situation and investigate the cause.

Vessel suffered an engine failure while off the Egina Islands, Greece, en route from Ravenna, Italy to Samsun, Turkey with 10 crew members on board. Repairs could not be carried out by the crew, and the vessel had to be towed by tug Christos XXXIV to the islet of Agios Georgios.

Vessel was alleged to have supplied wrong arrival figures of fuel and cigarettes onboard while staying at Ambarli anchorage. A fine was imposed and legal crew statements were collected by the customs officers. Upon completion of the legal process, departure permission was granted and the ship sailed from Ambarli anchorage headed to Novorossiysk.
Vessel had generator failure at Wilhelmshaven, Germany. Vessel undertook trials at Jade, 07 Jun and returned to New Jade Yard for repairs. Remains stationary as of 13 Jun.

Fire erupted in cargo hold after the vessel left Mersin Turkey, eastern Med, bound for Kumport Turkey, Marmara sea. Fire reportedly was extinguished or taken under control by the crew, but she had to interrupt voyage and anchor at Mersin anchorage, requesting assistance.

A 63-year-old crew member needed immediate hospital treatment, while en route from Tarragona, Spain, to Ashdod, Israel as vessel was sailing near Rhodes. A Greek Air Force helicopter picked up the patient and transported him to the helipad of the General Hospital of Rhodes.

A 34-year-old crew member needed immediate hospital treatment northwest of the Gulf of Chania en route from Aviles, Spain to Damietta, Egypt. A patrol boat picked up the patient and transported him to the “Porto Veniziano” in Chania, where he was picked up by an ambulance and taken to the General Hospital of Chania for medical treatment.

Vessel issued distress signal on 406Mhz channel in lat 37 15 00N, long 058 06 00W. The vessels in vicinity requested to keep lookout, assist and report to RCC Norfolk. Ar in Skagen Anch, 18 Jun & Sd same day.

A crew member was injured by a fall on board 152nm west of the tip of Penmarc’h, France. The patient evacuated by a NH90 Caiman helicopter and was taken to the Cavale Blanche hospital centre in Brest.

Vessel was reported NUC due to defective crankshaft, in lat 50 02 40N, long 005 55 45W, abt 9.8 NM 092 degrees from Land's End in North Bound Lane. Estimates 2 hours to repair. Completed repairs and underway.
Vessel propeller fouled by its net, 150 nm off Tromso. Vessel towed to Fugloy Sound and lifeboat took over. It berthed at Skjervoy. Sd from Skjervoy, 08 Jun.

Vessel suffered a fire in its engine room while en route from Fort-de-France, Martinique to Roseau, Dominica. The vessel was disabled due to an electrical issue with the alternators and switchboards. Tugs towed it back to Fort-de-France.

Vessel (IMO: 9511521), en route from Primorsk, Russia to Port Said, Egypt, had blocked fuel filter, NUC, in position lat 50 01 04.0N, long 003 10 56.0W, 22nm SE of Start Point, U.K. on 05 Jun 2022. Under repairs.
The US Coast Guard medevaced a 34-year-old crew member 167 miles off Marsh Island, Louisiana. He was transported to the University Medical Centre in New Orleans and was in stable condition.

Vessel, en route from Elblag, Poland to Rotterdam, Netherlands, had engine failure after entering the large Northern lock of  Canal in Brunsbuttel, Germany. She was towed to Brunsbuttel. Sailed on 11 Jun. Voyage resumed.
Vessel was NUC due to a burst of fuel pipe, NUC, in position lat 50 07 10.9N, long 005 53 16.0W, the UK. Completed repairs and continued voyage same day.

Vessel suffered a mechanical failure 6.5nm south of Alexandroupoli, Greece. She was towed safely to the port of Alexandroupoli. The Central Port Authority of Alexandroupoli banned the ship from sailing until the repair of the damage and the presentation of a class maintenance certificate by the classification society that monitors it. As of June 6th the vessel was moored at Alexandroupoli, Greece.
Vessel ran aground while sailing from Teluk Batang Harbour, North Kayong, to Rasau Jaya Harbour on Muara Kubu River, Kuburaya Regency, Indonesia. A tugboat also ran aground, block vessel.

Vessel sank in the Cedar Bayou in Baytown. It was submerged in the upper deck. The U.S. CG and the Texas General Land Office were responding to oil leaking from the vessel and laid out oil booms around the wreck.
Vessel (IMO: 9234989) reported as NUC due to engine cylinder head fault, in position lat 49 58 00.0N, long 005 50 14.0W, UK. Completed repairs, resumed passage on 03 Jun.

Vessel (IMO:7504392) sinking in Gran Sol after sustaining a leak, 64 NM SW of Cape Mizen, Ireland on 01 Jun 2022. All crew evacuated. MRCC Falmouth & counterpart in Valencia coordinating. Vsl sank 01 Jun. Investigation on.

Ukrainian tanker, stuck in Ochakov port, Ukraine, since Russian invasion, was hit by Russian bomb or shell, reported Ukrainian Shipping Magazine. Tanker suffered big hole in forecastle area portside, above waterline and fire, which was extinguished by firefighters.

Vessel was disabled while approaching Anchorage B in Vancouver Harbour, in lat 49 17 54.0N, long 123 05 24.0W, British Columbia, Canada. Repairs done and anchored. Ar in Vancouver, 02 Jun and Sd, 06 Jun.

Vessel collided with Autostrada Azzurra Bridge, Pisa Canal, Pisa, Italy. She tried to pass the bridge during high tide, but for vessel of such size, bridge is passable only during low tide. Understood vessel was seriously damaged in collision.

Vessel (IMO: 9291389) had engine issues, drifting & disabled in position lat 48 57 03.8N, long 063 27 15.8W, in Detroit d'Honguedo off Riviere-au-Renard, Quebec, Canada on 31 May 2022. Crew carried out repairs & vessel resumed voyage.

Vessel had uninterruptible power supply system failure, cancelled sailing while docked at ferry terminal in Saltery Bay, in position 49 46 52.8N, 124 10 37.3W, Canada. Repairs done, resumed sailing. No pollution.

Greenpeace activists demonstrated against the ship and its cargo, showing a banner from its boat with the inscription: “Russian coal is fuelling war and the climate crisis". The activists were waiting for vessel in Rostock en route from Ust-Luga with a cargo of Russian coal.

Vessel (IMO: 9853242) reported high temperature in exhaust value on cylinder of main engine, NUC in pos 49 54 28.8N, 004 27 06W on 31 May 2022. Exhaust valve of Unit 4 replaced by spare one, Repairs completed, vessel resumed voyage.

Vessel had engine issues, drifting and disabled in position lat 49 17 00.0N, long 607 10 00.0W, in the Gulf of St. Lawrence off Pointe-des-Monts, Quebec, Canada. The crew did repairs and vessel resumed its voyage.
Vessel had a fire while conducting welding operations in harbour of St. John's, in position lat 47 33 27.0N, long 052 42 24.0W, Newfoundland and Labrador, Canada. Crew extinguished fire.
Vessel collided with barge Nt 805 on Hay River, in position lat 60 50 43.0N, long 115 45 16.0W, Northwest Territories, Canada.

Vessel went adrift and collided with Eckaloo and KIMBERLY ANN III on Hay River, in position lat 60 50 43.0N, long 115 45 16.0W, Northwest Territories, Canada. Vessel secured at company dock for repairs.

Vessel (IMO 8918318) had a fire off the coast of Mauritania, abt 50 NM NW of Saint Louis, Senegal & issued a distress signal, 30 May 2022. Pilot Whale, Marshal Krylov & Simonas Daukantas evacuated crew. Fire is being fought externally

Vessel was struck by a barge while berthed at Chittagong port container terminal. Ship’s hull was holed on a fore area. She was moved next day to TSP Jetty for repairs. X-PRESS KOHIMA is deployed in Colombo – Chittagong service.
Vessel (IMO:9771638) had technical issue & suspended from connection Maaloy-Husevagoy-Oldeide, Norway on 30 May 2022. Sidelined for repairs in Maaloy. Sognefjord (IMO: 8311302) replaced voyage.

General cargo ship MARE struck the stern of anchored AREL 4 at Kartal Anchorage, Istanbul, Asian coast, Marmara sea. Ships didn’t suffer serious damages. MARE was brought to anchor after collision near her adversary, AREL 4. MARE was disabled prior to collision, cause unknown.

Vessel struck the stern of anchored general cargo ship AREL 4 at Kartal Anchorage, Istanbul, Asian coast, Marmara sea. Ships didn’t suffer serious damages. MARE was brought to anchor after collision near her adversary, AREL 4. MARE was disabled prior to collision, cause unknown.

A 34-year-old crew member suffered an injury during mooring at Thessaloniki. The crewmember suffered injuries at the right elbow and the right thigh. He was transported by ambulance to the General Hospital of Thessaloniki, and has since been discharged.

Vessel broke down in vicinity of Port of Venezia, Italy, due to propulsion issues. Master requested assistance from Harbour Master's Office. 2 tugs towed to Venezia, 29 May. Sailed on 07 Jun for Malta.

Vessel (IMO: 9000687), had issues in the mooring at the Akantias port of Rhodes due to a failure in propulsion system, 28 May 2022. Banned from sailing untill repairs are done. Moored in lat 36 26 57N, long 028 14 58E, off Rhodes, Greece.

Vessel (IMO:9299496) reported as NUC due to main engine defects including punctured valves, 1.7 NM at 263 deg from Inter Bank Buoy, UK on 28 May 2022. 3 hrs for repairs. Completed repairs & resumed passage, 29 May.

Vessel collided with Philippine fishing vessel FB JOT-18 in Sulu sea, while en route from China to Australia. Bulk carrier was ordered to interrupted voyage, turned to Panay island, Philippines, and anchored off Culasi early in the morning May 29. Fishing vessel sank, of 20 fishermen on board 13 were rescued by nearby fishing vessel, 7 remain missing, SAR under way.

Turkish Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry decided to send vessel back from Iskenderun Bay after the “Indian Rubella” virus was detected in a wheat cargo imported from India. The ship moored on Ceyhan Anchorage on May 28th.

Strong smoke development noted aboard vessel (IMO:5337771) at Kiel Fjord, Germany, 27 May 2022, berthed at nearby Reventlou Pier. Fire located in a store underneath main deck. Situation under control. Returned to the Sea Garden Pier in Kiel

Vessel issued distress signal, reporting sinking after engine failure 135 nm north of Aruba, Caribbean. Patrol planes and nearby cargo ships were deployed, 14 crew were rescued, 2 remained missing. Tanker was en route from Barahona Dominican Republic, to Venezuela.

Vessel (IMO:9181833) had technical failure approx in lat 36 19 00N, long 028 44 00E, at the S of Fethiye, Turkey, 27 May 2022. Repairs carried out by crew & were drifting in current direction, 29 May. Sailed on May 30.

Vessel (IMO: 9217254) reported to Rhodes Port Authority on 27 May 2022 that it had sustained mechanical damage to SB main engine shortly after leaving Rhodes, return to port. Detained until repairs. Sail after about 2 hrs, back on service.

Vessel ran aground at St-Lawrence Montreal Sainte-Catherine but was refloated hours later and berthed near Sainte-Catherine Lock. Tanker loaded with chemicals is en route from Point Lisas, Trinidad and Tobago, to Hamilton, Lake Ontario. She grounded onto soft bottom and reportedly, didn’t suffer hull breach, or oil spill. Engine failure is said to be the cause of grounding.

Vessel requested the medical evacuation of a crew member when she was about 38nm northwest of Cape Finisterre in the North Atlantic. An SAR helicopter was mobilized and the patient was hoisted and transferred to the Santiago airport for further transport to hospital.

Vessel ran aground when approaching ferry landing/berth at Arasvika. Operator Fjord1 concluded reason on 26 Sep, medical conditions led to inattention, ferry veered off course, got stuck. No technical errors found.
Vessel en route from Klaksvik, Faroe Islands had engine trouble in Toppsundet, Norway; tug Abrami from Tromsoe towed vessel to Harstad; sailed Harstad on 24 Aug.

UPDATE: The four-night sailing scheduled to leave Port Canaveral on June 2nd and the five-night sailing scheduled to leave Port Canaveral on June 6th have been cancelled because of the need to repair the fire damage that occurred on May 26 Vessel suffered funnel fire while being berthed at Grand Turk, Turks and Caicos, Caribbean. Nobody was injured but passengers were guided to safety stations and had to put on life jackets. Crew extinguished fire by own means in less than an hour.

Vessel allided with a dock in Falmouth, Jamaica. No guests or crew members were injured. The vessel struck a small concrete mooring pylon while backing to its berth at Falmouth. The ship suffered dents, paint scrapes and other cosmetic damage at the stern.

Vessel (IMO: 9728368) had engine damage, propulsion loss in international waters in pos 37 33 46.8N, 009 30 37.4W, en route from Suez to Sines, Portugal on 26 May 2022. GAMA, Lisbon informed on 27 May. Damage fixed, reached Sines 28 May.

A container barge towed by MEGA DAYA 43 suffered containers shift in Singapore Strait off Karimun, Riau Archipelago, Indonesia and developed heavy list. Some 12 containers were lost overboard. SAR team was deployed, barge was stabilized and was to be towed to Singapore.

Vessel (IMO: 8864907) had technical problem and was listing to the port side due to heavy flooding, off Karachi, Pakistan on 25 May 2022. Patrol vessel Madadgar repaired the defect, pumped water out, made vessel seaworthy again.

Vessel (IMO: 9099561) requested tow, due to engine failure, 16NM SE of port of Blanes, Spain on 25 May 2022. CCS Barcelona mobilized the Spanish rescue vessel Salvamar Sirius, which is towing vessel to Blanes.

Vessel sanctioned by U.S. Treasury and accused of transporting Iranian oil, was lingering off the coast of India, since 25 May 2022. Headed S.Lanka at a slow speed. Need repair, but could not enter a port in India due to sanction.

Vessel (IMO 9401128) allided with the fairway buoy 58a, while calling at the Brunsbuttel NW Anch, 25 May 2022, the impact caused major damage to the buoy. The incident was caused by a navigational error. It ar in Ust-Luga, Russia, 29 May.

Vessel (IMO 9467598) was reported to be NUC due to a leaking valve on the cooling system, in lat 51 53 21N, long 002 28 20E, about 44 NM at 095 degrees off Harwich port, 25 May 2022. Completed repairs, 26 May & is underway,

Vessel (IMO: 9720287) reported as NUC following engine coolant leakage in the engine room, in pos 49 51 03N, 003 22 20W, 25 May 2022. Completed repairs, changed navigational status to underway using its engine power & resumed passage.

Vessel (IMO: 7814046) reported port main engine failure after sailing from Iraklion for Piraeus in pos 35 39 00N, 24 56 18E on 24 May 2022, continued with other engine, reach Piraeus, detained until repairs, inspection. Sail on 25 May.

Vessel (IMO: 8500680) taken off route from Port of Spain to Scarborough, Trinidad & Tobago on 24 May 2022 for urgent repair works, for up to 3 days. Vessel to be taken off from 29 May for emergency repairs.
Vessel had engine failure, off Tuapse, Russia. Tug towed bulk carrier to Diliskelesi on 24 May. Shifted from Yalova to a shipyard at Tuzla, 05 Jul. Undergoing repairs at Tuzla.
Vessel (IMO: 9561629) c/w Grande Fortuna (IMO: 9561643) lying alongside at a berth in Yokohama Port, Japan on 24 May 2022. Both vessels sustained minor damage. No pollution.
Vessel (IMO: 9561643) c/w Taikli (IMO: 9561629) lying alongside at a berth in Yokohama Port, Japan on 24 May 2022. Both vessels sustained minor damage. No pollution.

Vessel had engine failure, south of Kas, Turkey,  moved to Kas anch., at slow speed, 25 May to carry out repairs. 1st Trial unsuccessful. Repairs carried out by crew with tech support. Vessel sailed, 02 Jun.

Vessel passed an inspection by the UK Maritime and Coastguard Agency (MCA) and can resume sailing. She had been sidelined in Dover following the sacking of 800 P&O workers, who were then replaced by agency crew. The ship remained stationary in Dover Eastern Docks as of May 28th.
Oil products tanker LEFKAS transferred fuel to vessel but had oil spill in Algoa Bay. SAMSA initiated containment and cleanup operation. It is moored at the Port Elizabeth anch, as of 14 Jun.

Vessel (IMO: 9373632) c/w O111 KATRINE id:13091511) off Frederikshavn, in position 57 28 11.4N, 010 40 36.6E, Denmark on 23 May 2022. Mette Miljo (IMO:8002468) set to inspect incident site. No pollution. Vsl entered port of Strandby.

Vessel (IMO 9417531) transfers fuel to Umnenga II (IMO 9311610) had oil spill, Algoa Bay, 23 May 2022. SAMSA initiated containment & cleanup. Booms used. Vessel docked in Port Elizabeth & cleaned of all traces of oil, operating in bay.

Vessel ran aground off West Breakwater in Fairport Harbor, Ohio, Lake Erie, while entering port. The ship was loaded with limestone. As of May 23, she was still aground, with tug at her side. No leaks reported.

Vessel struck berthed general cargo ship VYACHESLAV ANISIMOV in Ulysses Bay, Port Vladivostok, Russia. Tanker was maneuvering to moor. VYACHESLAV ANISIMOV sustained hull breach or breaches in fuel tank area, diesel oil leak reported. LOTOS sustained slight or no damages.

Water supply tanker LOTOS struck berthed general cargo ship VYACHESLAV ANISIMOV in Ulysses Bay, Port Vladivostok, Russia. Tanker was maneuvering to moor. VYACHESLAV ANISIMOV sustained hull breach or breaches in fuel tank area, diesel oil leak reported. LOTOS sustained slight or no damages.

Vessel was boarded by 5 armed with rifles pirates off Tabasco coast, Mexico, Gulf of Mexico. Pirates looted the ship for some 45 minutes, and fled on their small boat after they took what they have been after – 35 autonomous breath devices, plus communications and other valuable equipment. Nobody was injured.

Vessel (IMO: 7361312) had stopped generators, lights off, blocked air conditioning systems, and was a blackout, off the coast of Aleria at the west coast of Corsica on 21 May 2022. Drifted to east & southwards. Berthed at Genova on 22 May.

Russia has threatened to use weapons against the vessel which had transited Ukraine’s territorial waters near Zmiinyi (Snake) Island en route from Istanbul to Sulina on May 21st. The vessel reported receiving a signal from the Russians demanding that it leave the territorial waters of Russia, or weapons would be used.

Vessel (IMO 9078414) ran aground in shallow waters in Gulf of Thessaloniki on 21 May 2022. No response from master. Patrol boat & tug attended. Vsl refloated & sailed own power to Thessaloniki. Master arrested. Sailed on 21 May.

Vessel allided with pier at Yeongheung Power Plant, Incheon, Korea while berthing. She suffered 4-meter long hull slash above waterline. Power Plant Coal Terminal sustained much more serious damages coal conveyer was damaged or destroyed, also fenders, several months repairs are required to make pier operable again. Master of the ship and Pilot are believed to be the main culprits of an accident, because of their reckless ship’s control and most of all, excessive speed.

Vessel (IMO: 9477335) had engine damage during transit of Kiel Canal at Breiholz, Germany on 21 May 2022.  Tugs Kiel, Bugsier-2 towed vessel to Brunsbuttel, berthed at Nay Pilings North on 22 May for investigation, repairs. Sail on 26 May.
Vessel was reported to be on fire, in North Atlantic some 600 nm W of Azores. She was en route from Convent USA to Gibraltar. No details available at the moment.

Vessel (IMO:9016882) with 14 POB lost automatic steerage, while transiting Land's End TSS causing drastic course change on 20 May 2022.Vessel rectified course with manual steerage. Repairs done & vsl continued voyage 20 May.
Vessel (IMO: 9438585) reported NUC due to electrical outage with no engine power, in position lat 58 32 21N, long 001 01 12W, UK, 20 May 2022. Completed repairs & underway to port.

Vessel was disabled off western coast of North Island, New Zealand, while en route from Newcastle Australia to New Plymouth New Zealand, and started to drift towards island’s coast. She was taken on tow early May 23 by offshore tug SCANDI EMERALD, to be towed to New Plymouth (Taranaki).
Vessel had technical failure in Atlantic Ocean.Tug Alp Winger towing it in Sargasso Sea as of 03 Jun. Supply Leader Z towing vessel to Aliaga. Berthed at Salamisysrd for repairs, 13 Jun.
Vessel (IMO: 9742118) ran aground roughly in lat 32 36 41.2N, long 130 27 32.3E, 20 May 2022. The vessel was refloated from the shallows with the assistance of a tugboat, the same night.

Vessel drifted aground in Chios harbor, Chios island, Greece. Ferry failed to moor on arrival from Piraeus due to strong wind, and had to drop anchor, but drifted aground in harbor. Ferry was refloated some four and a half hours later with tug’s assistance, and has been safely berthed.

Vessel sank some 50 nm off Bari coast, in Adriatic sea, while en route from Ancona to Bari, Italy, towing pontoon with 11 people on board. Only tug Captain survived disaster, of 5 other crew 2 are still missing, 3 bodies were recovered. Pontoon with 11 people on board was later towed to Bari, all people are safe.

Vessel sank in the estuary of Meghna in Lakshmipur, Bangladesh, after hitting underwater object. The ship rested on bottom of sea canal with superstructure remaining above waterline. All 12 crew were rescued. TAMIM was transporting wheat to Nabil Auto Flour Mill in Narayanganj.

Vessel(IMO:9195717) had technical failure while approaching Kiel Canal on Kiel Fjord off Friedirchsort on 18 May 2022. Allided with 2 dolphins. Damage to vessel, dolphins. Berthed at Lindenau Yard, Friedrichsort on 18 May. Sailed on 23 May.

Vessel (IMO: 9211975), allided with Lochmaddy Pier, 18 May 2022. Underwent a temporary repair, 19 May, to allow the vessel to travel to James Watt Dock in Greenock for permanent repairs. Taken out of service. Resumed service on 23 May.

Vessel suffered a blackout 7nm east-northeast of Flamborough Head, en route from Rotterdam to Teesport. The engineers located a leakage of cooling water and attempted to fix the issue. The vessel subsequently anchored. The repair was completed some six hours later and engine trials commenced.

Vessel requested medical evacuation stating a man aboard the ship was experiencing complications from high blood pressure, when it was about 130 miles southeast of Galveston, Texas, en route from New Orleans to Houston. A USCG helicopter crew hoisted the man and transferred him to the University of Texas Medical Branch at Galveston, where he was in a stable condition.
Vessel collided with towed barge Saratov 2529 on the Volga river. The cargo vessel suffered a small hole and dents at the port side above the waterline. No water ingress nor pollution were reported.

Vessel ran aground in Savu sea, Timor Leste, Indonesia, on Meko island between Lembata and Adonara islands. Evacuation of passengers was complicated by low tide but understood most part of passengers were already evacuated by morning May 18. The vessel connects islands and ports of southeast Indonesia and Papua Guinea.
Captain of vessel informed the Port Auth of Rhodes, Greece, that its port main engine could not be started. Central Port Auth of Rhodes prohibited the departure until repairs and certification.

Vessel (IMO:9245378) had engine failure, power loss at Marmara Sea, Turkey on 16 May 2022. Anchored at Istanbul on 17 May for repairs. Class do damage survey & inspection. Must pay salvage expenses to Coastal Safety account prior departure.

Vessel (IMO: 9275945) had technical malfunction on 16 May 2022 on Wester Scheldt, Netherlands. An engine part had broken. Problem resolved next day but recurred; vessel continued on one engine. Solution from supplier of a part sought.
Vessel polluted the sea off the coast of the Yalova shipyards. The situation was reported to the Coast Guard 17 Command. An action has been initiated regarding the ship polluting the sea.
Vessel ran aground in Barranquilla Canal fairway while approaching Barranquilla, on arrival from Cartagena. The ship was refloated and safely reached port same day. There were damages reported.

Vessel requested the urgent evacuation of a crew member who had been injured in an accident. Shel was en route from Castellon to Huelva in Spain. The MRCC mobilized a lifeboat which medevaced the man to the port of Mazagón, from where he was transferred to hospital.

Vessel encountered temperature deviations due to a fuel injection issue in the main engine when it was about 17nm southwest of Isles of Scilly. The vessel was en route from Houston to Le Havre with 26 crew members on board. Repairs were carried out within hours, during which the vessel was drifting at 2.4 knots. The ship resumed its voyage and arrived at Le Havre on 17th May.
Vessel sank near Kanonersky Island, St. Petersburg, Russia while undergoing repair works. There were no injuries or pollution reported.

WALTER HAMMANN and DAGNA collided in Lower Weser upstream from Nordenham, Germany. Dutch freighter DAGNA was sailing upstream, to Brake, while German coaster was sailing downstream, from Bremen. Both ships reportedly suffered serious damages and are in need of repairs. WALTER HAMMANN sustained bow breaches or deep dents and was soon docked at Bremerhaven ship repair yard.

WALTER HAMMANN and DAGNA collided in Lower Weser upstream from Nordenham, Germany. Dutch freighter DAGNA was sailing upstream, to Brake, while German coaster was sailing downstream, from Bremen. Both ships reportedly suffered serious damages and are in need of repairs. Starboard hull of DAGNA  sustained breaches or dents. She reached Brake, and after completing cargo operation she sailed to Bremerhaven where she was docked on May 17.

Vessel (IMO:9341720) allided with industrial pier in Nordenham, Germany on 15 May 2022, destroying it to a length of about 40 metres; berthed in Nordenham for investigations. No tech malfunction found. Reach Bremen next day, sail on 17 May.

Vesel had taken on a load of grain in Sevastopol and headed towards the Bosporus. Ukrainian Ambassador to Turkey requested the Turkish authorities prevent the vessel from crossing the Bosporus or calling on Turkish seaports as cargo was stolen from Ukraine and sold on by Russians. Ukrainian intelligence believes that the stolen grain is laundered through Syria for sale in neighboring countries.

Vessel (IMO:8710998) in ballast condition, had technical failure, sheltered & dropped anchor at Ayvalik anchorage, Turkey on 14 May 2022. Crew doing repairs. Vsl sailed from anchorage 17 May & anchored in Eregli on 20 May.

Vessel developed heavy starboard list and issued distress signal in Chiba Prefecture waters, Honshu eastern coast, south of Tokyo. The ship was en route from Hitachinaka. 5 crew went into life raft and were rescued, 2 of them suffered injures. MEISEN 2 capsized and rested starboard on bottom. The ship probably, was intentionally grounded in shallow waters close to shore, to avoid sinking.
Vessel (IMO: 9505754), had technical failure at Hrakliou, Greece on 14 May 2022; tug Mentoras (IMO: 9061722) appointed to tow to Piraeus, Greece. Towage commenced on 15 May, ETA at Piraeus 16 May.

Vessel's Captain has been charged with attempted smuggling of some 320 kilo of cocaine into Australia when the ship was anchored at Hedland Anchorage en route from Dalian, China. Police say a forensic examination of the ship captain’s mobile revealed messages relating to the drug smuggling attempt.

Vessel (IMO: 9307944) had loss of propulsion in the Mediterranean Sea in pos 36 34 12N, 12 14 24E on 13 May, Portuguese maritime safety office notified via Italian CG. No injury, pollution. Evidence being collected for analysis of incident.
Vessel suffered fire in engine room ENE of Ningbo, East China sea, while en route from Taicang China to Chi Lung Taiwan. SAR ship BEI HAI JIU 101  responded and all crew were evacuated.

Vessel suffered a technical failure in the Istanbul Strait on May 13th while en route from Icdas, Turkey to Tuapse, Black Sea, Russia. The vessel dropped anchor and the crew commenced repairs. As of May 19th the vessel was at anchor off the south side of Istanbul.

Ukrainian forces were reported to have attacked and damaged the Russian naval support vessel in the Black Sea. The ship was reported to have sustained damage and was to have caught fire. It was limping towards Sevastopol. No AIS since April 26th when it was moored in Sevastopol, Crimea.

Vessel (IMO:7928160) had navigation system & pertinent connections failures at Novorossiysk, Russia on 12 May 2022. Repairs completed, state surveyors verified final repairs, departure permission granted, sailed from Novorossiysk on 16 May.

Vessel ran aground on a sandbank in Oude Maas river, while sailing upstream to Moerdijk, Netherlands, short of Spijkenisserbrug Bridge. She was refloated with tugs assistance but interrupted her voyage and was taken to Matrans Rotterdam Terminal where she was docked.

Vessel had malfunction on its port side main engine. Vessel reached the berth unassisted & dropped off the passengers. Central Port Authority of Rhodes banned vessel from sailing until repairs, certification.

Yacht Stord 1 (IMO: 5341564) with a group of British tourists OB came in contact with vessel (IMO: 9904558) which was berthed in Bergen, Norway on 12 May 2022, due to a technical error. Damaged at SB side where Stord 1 came in contact.

Vessel requested the medical evacuation of a crew member with respiratory problems while she was off the Canary Islands. CCS Las Palmas of Salvamento Marítimo mobilized an SAR helicopter which hoisted the patient and transported him to Lanzarote.

Vessel allegedly polluted the port of Derince, Turkey with dirty ballast water.The local authority opened an investigation and found the vessel guilty of the pollution. The vessel’s departure permission was cancelled by the Harbour Master until payment of the fine together with the cleaning expenses.
Vessel caught fire in Galapagos Archipelago waters. Catamaran burned out and sank, all 25 people on board rescued, safe.

Fire broke out in superstructure of vessel anchored off Temryuk Port, Russia, Azoa sea. She reportedly didn't require assistance, assuring authorities that the crew will extinguish fire by own means. The ship was bound for Karasu Turkey. Hours later fire was extinguished but one crew member reportedly died. Some or all equipment was destroyed as fire errupted on the bridge.

Two port workers were reported to have died  aboard vessel at the Karachi Port Trust. The body of one of the labourers was recovered quickly, but it took quite some time to recover that of the second one. The men entered a wrong hatch by mistake and fell a considerable distance. They died of suffocation.

Vessel (IMO 8402008) had a fouled propeller, in the North Sea off Teesside, 09 May 2022 & subsequently was disabled. Upon request for assistance, tug Kingston (IMO: 5344437), towed the vessel to the port of Teesport, UK.

Fire erupted in engine room while at Civitavecchia port, Ital. Fire engines and tugs were deployed in fire fighting. Most probably, fire was either extinguished or taken under control. Tanker is loaded with diesel oil.

Starboard quarter of vessel collided with mooring dolphin while maneuvering in Sitka Sound toward pier at Sitka Sound Cruise Terminal, US. She had minor hull indentation but caused a $2.1 million damage to pier.
Vessel (IMO: 9494670), had technical difficulties, in the pilot station Wandelaar, 09 May 2022; reach and moor in Antwerpen same day.

Vessel (IMO: 9210139), had its starboard engine as being disabled, in lat 51 14 07N, long 129 42 41W, about 32.60 NM NW Triangle Island, in Queen Charlotte Sound. Was able to continue its voyage to English Bay, using port engine.

Vessel (IMO:1007677) had water ingress, disabled approx. in pos 47 23 07N, 124 50 24W, 25mi off Washington coast, U.S.A. Crew rescued. No injury/pollution. Cutter towed, passed to salvage company. Scheduled tow to Port Angeles for repairs.

Vessel suffered a technical failure at Syros Island. She was subsequently towed to Piraeus on May 16th and berthed at a repair pier and a detailed damage survey was carried out by the attended surveyor, together with the owner’s superintendent. Permanent repairs have commenced by shore-based technical teams as per the class surveyor’s recommendations. The ferry remained stationary at Piraeus as of June 24th.

Vessel sank north of Sangeang island, Bima, West Nusa Tenggara, Lesser Sunda islands, Indonesia after water ingress in engine room and headed for Sangeang island. Some 2 nm off northern coast of island, engine died, and the ship sank. All 18 crew were rescued.

Fire erupted in cargo hold while she was docked at Ortona, Italy, Adriatic sea. Firefighters responded but the ship had to shift berths to move away from nearby ships. Some cargo had to be offloaded in order to get access to hold and fire bed. Fire was extinguished, no major damages were reported except cargo packaging.

Vessel (IMO: 9112521) came in c/w ferry Miguel Torga (IMO: 9283368) while proceeding off Lisbon on the River Tagus on 06 May 2022. No injury, pollution, no assistance required. Portuguese safety office investigating. Vessel continue to ply.

Vessel reported water ingress while in Biscay Bay, being en route from Bilbao Spain to Poole UK. SAR ship ABEILLE BOURBON delivered equipment required for taking water ingress under control. Helicopter delivered a team of technicians, and water ingress has been taken under control. MN PELICAN had to interrupt voyage and arrived at Brest under own power, where she was docked.

Vessel was disabled in Ionian sea, while en route from Cagliari to Hereke Marmara sea. She was taken on tow by tug IOANNIS late May 8, port of destination unclear, probably Igoumenitsa. Cause of trouble is unknown.

Vessel (IMO: 9283368) came in c/w ferry Alges (IMO: 9112521) while proceeding off Lisbon on the River Tagus on 06 May 2022. No injury, pollution, no assistance required. Portuguese safety office investigating. Vessel continue to ply.

Vessel suffered explosion and leak of carbon dioxide from one of cylinders. Five or four people were poisoned by gas, understood at least four of them are crew members. She was undergoing maintenance repairs at Tuzla Turkey.
Vessel had machinery failure with one of its engines during sea trials in St. Lawrence River off Matane, QC, Canada. She proceeded to Matane with other engines.

Container ship Eponyma (IMO 9808039) allided with the berth and then with the New Mingzhou 68 (IMO 9751755) which was mooring nearby, when leaving Yokohama Port. The extent of damage to the hulls of the vessels and other conditions were unknown.

Vessel allided with the berth and then with the New Mingzhou 68 (IMO 9751755) which was mooring nearby, when leaving Yokohama Port during the afternoon of May 6th. The extent of damage to the hulls of the vessels and other conditions were unknown.
Vessel had engine failure, loss of power at Iskenderun, Turkey. Sonduren 10 towed vessel to Tripoli, Lebanon, 13 May. Repairs still carried out and it remains stationary at Tripoli as of 14 Jun.

Vessel suffered a fire on the poop deck during cargo operations at Sousse, Tunisia. The initial fire extinguishing operation was carried out by the crew, but subsequently the port duty fire brigade attended the scene. Slight structural damages were reported due to the fire.

Vessel suffered mechanical failure south of Thasos island, northern Aegean sea, while ballasting from Diliskelesi Marmara sea to Nea Karvali, Greece. She was taken on tow and towed to Nea Karvali (Kavala) anchorage.

Vessel ran aground in Parana river off Ramallo, Argentina while sailing downstream, en route from Arroyo Seco to Abidjan Ivory Coast, understood in load. The ship managed to refloat by own means some 2 hours after grounding, but shortly after ran aground again, this time blocking the main channel. A tug was seen nearby.
Vessel (IMO: 9725897) reported NUC, sensor change over req in the main engine, 30 NM SSW of lizard point, 05 May 2022. Completed repairs, underway to port.

Vessel (IMO 9798985) had its port propeller as being fouled by a fishing net while anchored, in Trincomali Channel, BC, Canada, 05 Mar 2022. Resumed its scheduled departure for Nanaimo. Ar in Alert Bay, 06 May & Sd 07 May.

Vessel ran aground in the waters of Sapeken, Kangean Islands, Sumenep Regency, East Java, after leaving the port en route from Sapeken-Kangean to Kalianget Port. The ferry managed to back from the reef in Sapatako Bay several attempts later.

Pusher tug and barge PML 9000, loaded with steel coils from Algoma Steel, ran aground on Vidal Schoals west of Soo Locks, St. Mary’s river, Great Lakes. Caravan is en route from Sault Ste Marie to Calumet. As of May 5 caravan or barge was still aground.
Vessel reported engine failure at Fethiye, Turkey; crew could not carry out repairs, tug Horoz began towing vessel on 06 May. Stationary in Tuzla shipyard, 18 Jun.

Vessel informed the port of Piraeus that it wished to return to the port because a crew member needed immediate hospital treatment. Unfortunately, although the 41-year-old man was provided with first aid on board and was later transported by ambulance to the General Hospital of Piraeus, he was pronounced dead.

General cargo ship Wilson Dordrecht allided with cargo ship Wilson Main during a berthing manoeuvre at Valsneset, Oskvoll, Norway. The Wilson Main suffered some damage to its deck and railings. The Wilson Dordrecht sustained minor damages and sailed from Valsneset, berthing in Egersund on May 5th.
Vessel had technical failure N of Crete Island, in position lat 36 19 00N, long 024 37 30E, Greece. Crew doing repairs.

Vessel ran aground in China Strait, Mine Bay,southeastern Papua New Guinea, while en route from PNG ports to port of destination (China, probably). The ship grounded on reefs. Salvage required partial offloading and she was refloated and anchored near grounding site, to load offloaded logs and undergo inspection and investigation. Underwater inspection found no damages to ship’s hull. As of May 11, MICROSTEP remained anchored probably due to environment damages compensation.

Vessel was reportedly hit by a cluster shell at the port of Nika Tera. The vessel was thought likely to have been hit by indirect fire. It had arrived at the port before the Russian invasion to load a cargo of sunflower oil, but had been stranded there ever since. No AIS since March 29th, when it was at the port of Mykolaiv, Ukraine.

Vessel loaded 27,000 tons of grain at Kerch Strait anchorage, Black sea, in April 2022, left anchorage late April and initially, headed for Alexandria Egypt. Ukraine protested and asked Egypt not to accept the ship and the cargo, because all of grain lot was reportedly, taken from occupied Ukrainian territories and transported via Crimea. Egypt rejected cargo and vessel's destination was changed to Beirut.

Vessel (IMO 9856543) allided with an unknown floating object & damaged its rudder in a fish farm in Storfjorden, Norway, on 03 May 2022. Rudder could only spin halfway. Vsl berthed in Alesund after being towed.

Vessel contacted silo constructions at Rethe, Port of Hamburg, while leaving dock, bound for Sweden. Both silo and the ship sustained damages. Reportedly accident was caused by ship control mistake – instead of moving backwards, the ship moved forward, and struck silo.

A crew member needed immediate hospital treatment while the vessel was 128nm southeast of Rhodes, en route from Ashdod, Israel, to Ravenna, Italy. A Greek Air Force helicopter collected the patient and transported him to Maritsa Airport, Rhodes, where he was picked up by an ambulance and then taken to the Rhodes General Hospital for treatment.

Vessel allided with cargo ship Wilson Main during a berthing manoeuvre at Valsneset, Oskvoll, Norway. The Wilson Main suffered some damage to its deck and railings. The Wilson Dordrecht sustained minor damages and sailed from Valsneset, berthing in Egersund on May 5th.
Vessel suffered engine issue and couldn’t restart engine. Tug VENTURE was assigned to tow the ship, probably to Fishguard, UK.

A number of passengers had reported people feeling ill on the ship after detecting an unusual smell. A USCG crew went to the vessel, but no one needed to be evacuated for medical treatment. The vessel was docked in Norfolk. The odour was apparently produced by an outside painting project taking place.

Turkish Captain fell overboard in Java sea north of Bali island. The ship was en route from Australia to Vietnam but she interrupted voyage and went SAR, alerting all the concerned authorities. He was found and rescued by local fishermen on May 5, and immediately transported to hospital. He’s in stable condition, suffering mostly, from sunburns.

Vessel strayed off course while transiting Kiel Canal in northern direction, en route from UK to Sweden, in Schulp area, below Rendsburg. She contacted bollards along embankment, went off about half an hour later, and resumed transit. No serious damages reported.
Vessel had engine failure at Varna, Bulgaria. Crew unable to repair. Ayaz Bey towing vessel to Tuzla, Turkey on 21 Jun. During Istanbul strait passage, Coastal Safety tug provides escort service.
Vessel ran aground in pos 57 40 01.2N, 21 40 33.0E, 17NM N of Ventspils, Latvia. DBT Tank No.1 Starboard, DBT Tank No.2 Starboard damaged. Re-floated, towed to safe place at Riga.

Vessel (IMO 9447689) allided with pier at port Ibiza on 01 May 2022; bow allided against quay causing several damages to it, to fenders, and bow itself, above WL. Vessel being repaired. Sail Eivissa on 09 May apparently back in service.

Vessel suffered a technical failure at Ravenna, Italy but could not be repaired by the crew. She is now being towed by the Sea Lord to Yalova for permanent repairs. The towage operation commenced on May 31st with an ETA at the Yalova shipyard area of June 10th.
Vessel (IMO:8906303) en route from Chioggia, Italy to Iskenderun, Turkey NUC, SE of Rhodes Island failed to inform JRCC Piraeus. Tug SOUDA II towed vessel to Iskenderun.
Vessel requested assistance from MRCC Almeria, Spain after a cable entangled around its propeller and disabled it, west of Alboran Island. Spanish rescue vessel Salvamar Spica towed her to Motril.

Vessel allided with Piers 30 and 29 corner at Taichung Port, Taiwan in the process of shifting berths. The ship suffered hull breach in midship area, above waterline, so there’s no water ingress. Berth wall, specifically fenders, sustained serious damages.

Fire broke out in engine room of vessel (IMO: 9239977) while transiting Raritan Bay, USA on 29 Apr 2022. New York City’s fire department (FDNY) responded. Vessel towed to an anchorage then to berth in Port Newark Channel, NJ on 15 May.

UPDATE: Vessel finally docked in the port of Barcelona on May 31st after more than a month of wandering around with a cargo of Russian oil. The ship had sailed from Primorsk on April 24th. Vessel loaded with cargo of Russian oil was rejected by Sweden, not by Swedish authorities though, but by Gothenburg dockers, who refused to handle the ship. As of Apr 30, is hanging around in Kattegat and North sea for some 6 days already, looking for a chance to get rid of “toxic” Russian oil.
Vessel allided with the dock at section 42 of the Port of Montreal, Quebec, during a berthing manoeuvre. The vessel and the dock suffered minor damage. The ship remained stationary as of May 9th.

Vessel ran aground in Lake Michigan, while entering Muskegon port. The ship was loaded with 25,000 tons of stone, she had to offload part of cargo into barge, before she managed to refloat. Understood grounding was caused by Michigan Lake water low level.

The derelict vessel destroyed and sunk in Gulf of Mexico, 16 NM S of Destin's East Pass in a Joint Direct Attack Munition demonstration attack by Air Force Research Laboratory and Eglin’s Integrated Test Team.

Ferry service in the San Juan Islands was severely reduced, after the vessel that travels to and from Anacortes sustained damage near the Lopez Island dock. Steel anchor bent and punctured its hull above waterline.

Vessel was banned from entering Barcelona, Spain and was drifting off Barcelona, waiting  for instructions. Tanker is loaded with palm oil and oil derivatives. Spanish Authorities have sound reasons to believe that the cargo was loaded from Russian tanker ANDREY PERVOZVANNIY in waters off Malta during Apr 23-25, in STS operation. EU sanctioned not just Russian ships, but Russian cargoes as well, if they’re bound for EU ports.

Vessel suffered mechanical failure and went adrift while en route from Cairnryan to Larne, with 410 passengers on board. According to track date, the crew managed to fix the problem, and ferry was under way within 2 hours. Media reports a blackout as “passengers were left in the dark”.
Vessel ran aground on the Lek between Bergambacht and Lekkerkerk, Netherlands. Two tugs refloated the vessel and she arrived at Geulhaven, Rotterdam the same day.

Vessel collided with general cargo ship DA FA NO.1 15 nm SE of Taitung port, southeast Taiwan coast. DA FA NO.1 sank, crew went into life raft and were rescued by Taiwanese CG patrol boat, all are safe. LIA was en route from Singapore to Onsan Korea, DA FA NO.1 was en route from Taitung to Orchid Island, SE of Taitung, meaning that the coaster was crossing LIA course. LIA stopped after collision, and remained dead in the water for several hours, until completion of investigation and other formalities. She was allowed to resumed voyage, at 1230 LT was sailing full speed to port of destination, understood she suffered slight damages or no damages at all.

Vessel suffered a technical fault and was taken out of the service Svelvik-Verket for troubleshooting in Svelvik, Norway. Later, the operator reported that the repairs were completed and the vessel will resume its voyage.

Vessel collided with a Japanese fishing vessel some 50 nm north of Niigata, Japan sea. She was, reportedly, engaged in offshore cargo operation in collision area. After collision the ship sailed to Niigata and anchored at Niigata anchorage. Fishing vessel also remained under way and sailed to her base port in Tsuruoka, north of Niigata.

Vessel (IMO:9559626) NUC, due to engine defect, no propulsion, 25M SE of St Catherine’s Point, UK on 25 Apr 2022. Tug FFS Arion (IMO:9056789) towed vessel to Schiedam & back to Rotterdam on 28 Apr. Sail on 01 May for Dordrecht.

Vessel finally berthed in Slagen port, Norway after activists from Greenpeace and Extinction Rebellion had attempted to paddle their small boats out to the tanker, where they chained their inflatable boat to the anchor chains of the tanker, thus preventing it from raising anchor and moving to the terminal. Tanker was anchored offshore and expected to move to Esso Norway’s oil terminal outside Åsgårdstrand when this happened. The Norwegian Coast Guard arrived on the scene to monitor the situation.

Vessel rescued two German nationals from a yacht off the coast of Puerto Rico after one of them sustained a leg injury, and the other had a broken leg. The survivors were later medevaced off the LNG carrier and transported to the “Fernando Luis Ribas Dominicci Regional Airport in San Juan, where they were tended to by emergency medical service personnel.

A port worker was crushed to death by coal while loading the vessel at Cashin Quay in Lyttelton, New Zealand. Three ambulances and two fire appliances responded to the incident. The ship had arrived at the port on April 22nd, being en route from Tianjin.
Vessel got caught in stormy weather and lost deck cargo and barge after secure lashings failed. The ship was en route from Juan Fernandez to Puerto Montt, Chile. Unmanned barge sank.

Vessel ran aground in the new port of Tinos, Greece, on arrival from Rafina. A short time later it managed to detach itself and moored at the port when disembarkation of the passengers commenced. The Greek Coast Guard attended to carry out the necessary checks. The passengers were carried on to their destinations with other ships of the company. There were no reports of injuries.

Vessel was near the Kuril Islands off eastern Russia, when the trawl door dropped down and hit three crew members on the fishing deck with the slack wireline, who died at the scene from their injuries. Upon the arrival of the vessel at the Petropavlovsk-Kamchatskiy anchorage, investigations were carried out as well as a search of the scene of the incident.

Vessel suffered engine failure while proceeding upstream in Cam river Haiphong, Vietnam and got stuck between bridge and embankment, with ship’s crane tower locked under the bridge and stern stuck in the embankment, damaging and ruining embankment railings and light poles. She was en route from Shanghai.

Vessel allided with the lower approach wall and the lock gate of the Welland Canal’s lock No 1 in Port Weller, Ontario, Canada. Minor damage was caused to the lock gate, but the ship suffered no damage and continued its voyage from Port Colborne to Nanticoke

UPDATE: Vessel was put out of service when the Norwegian Ministry of Foreign affairs ruled against the application for getting it insured via an exemption. A planned voyage on May 15th along the Norwegian coast was canceled. Havila Kystruten was forced to cancel a voyage of the vessel HAVILA CAPELLA from Bergen to Kirkenes and then back to Bergen. This unforeseen complication is that the liability insurance for the vessel has been invalidated by the European Union's sanctions on Russia.

The Fijian government has taken action to prevent yacht Amadea from leaving the port of Lautoka, according to reports. The judiciary ordered the yacht not to leave the territory of the island nation until the powers of confiscation were received by the authorities.

P&O Cruises has announced the cancellation of cruises aboard the vessel, extending to June 23rd due to the limited availability of crew members. The cruise liners are working hard to recruit and train new crew members, given that they had repatriated most of the crew in the early days of the pandemic.
Vessel was berthed at Freeport when container ship TROPIC FREEDOM contacted her while maneuvering to berth, on arrival from Palm Beach. Both ships sustained some damages.

Vessel requested Sri Lanka for a medical evacuation of its 3rd officer while the Elizabeth was en route from Algeciras to Tanger-Med. The CCS Algeciras of Salvamento Marítimo mobilized the SAR vessel Salvamar Denebola, which took the man on board and took him to Saladillo, where an ambulance picked him up for the further transfer to the Hospital Quirón.

Two crew members serving on board the vessel collapsed while performing routine tasks in one of the vessel’s cargo tanks while at the Amsterdam anchorage in the Netherlands. The two individuals received first aid on board, one of which has been airlifted to hospital ashore by the Netherlands Coastguard. However, the other individual was declared dead by the medical team on board. Investigation is ongoing.

Vessel sailed from Dover to Calais, where the UK Maritime and Coastguard Agency (MCA) have refused to release her, citing several deficiencies on the vessel grounds for detention. The MCA has stated that they have advised P&O to invite them back for inspections after sorting out the vessel's problems.

Bulk carrier HAI DAT 36 collided with cargo ship PHUC TINH 266  off Phan Rang Bay, southern Vietnam. Ships were on opposite courses. PHUC TINH 26, loaded with 3,200 tons of rolled sheet steel bound for Dong Nai, sank – understood the ship sailed into Phan Rang Bay intending to ran aground, to avoid sinking. HAI DAT 36 rescued all 8 crew of PHUC TINH 26 and sailed to Cam Ranh, to disembark rescued crew.

Vessel contacted berthed cruise ship MARINER OF THE SEAS while maneuvering to berth, on arrival from Palm Beach. Both ships sustained some damages, including smashed bridge left wind of TROPIC FREEDOM.

Vessel stopped short of port of destination, Murmansk, some 15 nm off easternmost Norway, with the intention of changing 12 of its’ Ukranian crew via Vardo port Norway. Norwegian news agency NRK believes Ukrainian sailors don’t want to visit Russian port, while Vardo Traffic Control Center says no explanation was given in crew change notice and application.

Vessel was offered as a temporary shelter for Ukrainian refugees in Rotterdam. For three months, the vessel will remain at Merwehaven, a port at the river Maas in Rotterdam. She is expected to accommodate around 1,500 refugees. All the refugees will be provided three meals a day, private stateroom accommodations, housekeeping services, public spaces, fitness facilities, internet access, and other necessities. The chartering of this vessel is a part of the Netherlands’ commitment to accommodating 50,000 people who have fled their homeland in Ukraine.

Vessel suffered engine failure and ran onto embankment in Kiel Canal near Levensau High Bridge , while transiting Kiel Canal, en route from Ust Luga Russia to Antwerp. The ship was taken off embankment and berthed in Kiel Canal near Kiel Locks.The ship may have suffered serious hull damages, but no reports confirmed said damages.
Vessel reportedly came in contact with a berth/dock section in Montreal, Canada. No injuries or damages reported

10 passengers were found carrying cocaine, an overall 54 kgs of cocaine, when they were intercepted aboard the vessel in Valencia, Spain. Spain’s National Law enforcement agency conducted the check. In another instance, a Brazilian couple was apprehended on the same vessel on April 4th in Marseilles carrying 12kgs of cocaine. The MSC SEASIDE arrived at the port of Valencia from the port of Santos, which is a notorious hub for cocaine smuggling activities.
Reports emerged, that the vessel lost either rudder, or propeller, so understood, tug ALP WINGER is to tow disabled ship after 2 week drift. She was en route from Corpus Christi to Europa Point.

Vessel requested help from the Lavrio Port Authority, Athens, Greece as one of the crew members needed medical assistance. However, by the time an ambulance arrived, the patient had died. The body was transported to the General Hospital of Nea Ionia in order to confirm his death and to perform an autopsy-necropsy. A preliminary investigation was carried out by the Central Port Authority of Lavrio. As of April 19th the vessel was still at Lavrio. It had arrived from Messina, Italy, on April 17th.

Vessel serving between Trondheim and Rorvik, Norway, allided with Flakk ferry berth twice while about to dock in Trondheim; hole in bow, neck injury to 1 passenger. Repairs to vessel ongoing as of 25 Aug.

The Philippine Coast Guard  report that fire broke out onboard vessel after a pipe explosion. This occured while she was anchored off Talisay City on the island of Cebu. 1 crew declared dead, 3 injured and 19 evacuated.

Vessel detained at Karystos Bay, Petalioi Gulf, Attica, Greece, because of EU ban on all Russian ships, to call EU ports and even inner waters. She had left Piraeus bound for Kavkaz port, Russia, but interrupted her voyage and sailed in Karystos Bay, reason unknown.

Vessel failed to head for an agreed repair yard after failing a Paris MOU Port State Control inspection and was reported to have been refused access to any port or anchorage within the Paris MOU region. The vessel was detained in Venice after failing a PSC inspection on March 12th. The vessel was held with 14 deficiencies, including a lack of knowledge of fire drills, missing high-pressure lines, oil leakage alarms, and inoperative rescue boats. The steering gear was also not properly maintained. It sailed from the port on March 16th having promised to head for a repair yard in Alexandria, ETA March 17th. However, it failed to arrive. The latest AIS data for the vessel showed it at anchor off Marsa Brega, Libya, on April 16th.

The captain of vessel was taken off the ship at Ramsgate and was taken to the Queen Elizabeth The Queen Mother Hospital in Margate, Kent. He had exhibited Cold/Flu type symptoms for some time, and these had gradually worsened. He was reported as confused, lethargic and not eating for three days. The ship was en route from Drogheda, Ireland to Howdendyke, UK.

Vessel suffered explosion, followed by fire, at Taiwan Strait some 170 nm ESE of Hong Kong. 6 crew were reported injured, 1 died in the explosion. MRCC Hong Kong said fire was extinguished, 2 helicopters and plane were sent to tanker to evacuate injured crew.

Fire broke in one of the containers when the vessel was 35nm north of Banda Aceh, western Sumatra in the Andaman sea. Three-quarters of the container was burned, but the crew was able to extinguish the fire and prevent it from spreading. The vessel was monitored by the National Search and Rescue Agency and the Directorate General of Sea Transportation (Ministry of Transportation) of Malaysia and was been deemed safe to sail to Port Klang where it arrived on April 22nd. The fire was suspected to have been caused by a short circuit.

Vessel contacted pier at Horsenes Port, Denmark, on arrival from St. Petersburg with cargo of steel. Pier was damaged on a strip of approximately 15 metres but that didn't interfere with cargo operations. The ship suffered breach of bow stern, hull dents and probably lost portside anchor, too. She was in a hurry to complete cargo operations before EU ban on Russian ships to call EU ports came into force on the night of 17th April. The ship was to continue voyage to Morocco, but Denmark Maritime Authorities allowed one-way trip to Kaliningrad, considering ship’s damages.

Vessel suffered engine failure in Taiwan Strait off Taichung, Taiwan, while ballasting from Ningbo to Manila, and started to drift towards Taiwan coast. After several technical difficulties and adverse weather she was towed into Taichung harbor in the afternoon Apr 20, and berthed.

Vessel developed a heavy list after the main wire of one of the cranes broke during the load test, and one of the main ballast valves failed, in Amoyfjorden off Stavanger, Norway. Barge alongside SAIPEM 7000 understood capsized and sank. Of some 275 people on board, nobody was injured.

Vessel was sunk in a collision with another trawler south of the Faroe Islands. The ship sank quickly after the collision, according to a brief announcement from the Faroese MRCC in Torshavn. All of the crewmembers were safely rescued by a launch from the Vesturbúgvan, and no injuries were reported.

ORION EXPRESS collided with the HAIAN CITY near Chittagong, Bangladesh. Both ships  were underway in Chittagong Anchorage area, proceeding opposite direction. HAIAN CITY lost some containers overboard. Both ships sustained damages, details not yet known, but container ship had an issue with stability.

UPDATE: Cargo of Iranian oil has been seized by the US because of sanctions against Iran. The US Department of Justice chartered a tanker from the Greek Dynacom to empty the Lana of its cargo, which will subsequently be shipped to the US. During the time of the detention the ship had formally changed owner to a non-sanctioned company. Vessel was detained at Karystos Bay, Petalioi Gulf, Greece, for violation of EU sanctions against Russian ships. She was to STS offload her cargo off Peloponnese (or more probably, was already engaged in STS), but suffered mechanical failure and was towed or escorted to Karystos Bay, by a Greek tug. Understood she was en route from Marmara Sea, Turkey.

Container ship collided with tugboat GEORGE M due to high speed during a harbor-assist maneuver in the Houston Ship Channel. There were no injuries reported but the damages were valued at over $900k and 1000 gallons of gear oil was released from the tugboat’s port propulsion unit.
Some containers fell into the water during cargo operation at Tecon container terminal, Santos Port, Brazil. Four containers stack had collapsed but remained on board.

ORION EXPRESS collided with the HAIAN CITY near Chittagong, Bangladesh. Both ships  were underway in Chittagong Anchorage area, proceeding opposite direction. HAIAN CITY lost some containers overboard. Both ships sustained damages, details not yet known, but container ship had an issue with stability.
Reports of cargo scrap on fire in cargo hold while she was docked at Kirkdale, Liverpool.  5 fire engines were deployed, plus tugs with water cannon. Fire extinguished hours later.

Container ship MSC AQUARIUS collided with tug GEORGE M due to high speed during a harbor-assist maneuver in the Houston Ship Channel. There were no injuries reported but the damages were valued at over $900k and 1000 gallons of gear oil was released from the tugboat’s port propulsion unit.

Vessel was arrested in a litigation case at the outer anchorage of Chittagong, Bangladesh, on April 12th, due to High Court orders issued the previous day. The ship had arrived on April 3rd and was waiting for the owner’s instructions.

Reports that 18 Ukrainian vessel crew were seized by Russian military and taken to Donetsk city, controlled by Russia. She has been stuck in Mariupol since Feb 26, all communications with crew were lost since Mar 25, AIS is off since Mar 30 or Mar 31.
The five crew members four Turkish citizens and one Georgian, were arrested after  Spanish authorities discovered almost three tons of cocaine hidden in the boat’s fuel tank.

Vessel had mechanical damage, requested assistance, SW of Kalymnos. Kurtarma 10 towed her from Golcuk to Eregli; after cargo discharge, Eregli to Tuzla shipyard. Repairs undergoing at Tuzla shipyard, 12 Jun.
Vessel fired upon and 19 crew members seized by the Russian military. She is currently docked in Mariupol
Vessel, which had been based in Cambodia as a casino ship in its last years, sank in Laccadive Sea while being towed to Alang for recycling by support ASL Leo.

An ailing crewmember was medevaced from vessel while she was in the Gulf of Mexico. The USCG received a distress call from the vessel, reporting a medical emergency with a crewmember on board. A 27-year-old mariner was transferred to awaiting emergency medical services personnel at Coast Guard Station Dauphin Island. He was last reported to be in stable condition.
Vessel capsized and sank in Ormoc Bay, southwest Leyte island, while enroute for Cebu. According to reports, she was sunk by tropical storm Agaton.
Vessel collided with  fishing farm off Cesme, Turkey, continued voyage for Canakkale with own power. Structural damages to fishing farm. Remains stationary atTuzla, as of 02 Jul.
Reports of vessel having suffered massive water ingress in engine room while in the Gulf of Guinea. The ship was adrift according to last available AIS position 2100 UTC Apr 9
Bulk c arrier lost steering omnidirectional indicator and ran aground in Port Hedland, Australia. She dropped anchor for temporary repairs to be done.
Reports that vessel has been disabled and adrift for more than a week now in the North Pacific close to Japan. No confirmation of planned rescue effort.

WAN HAI 176 suffered engine failure shortly after leaving Oakland California, bound for Seattle. She drifted to a coastline and dropped an anchor, also had to drop second anchor to prevent drift. Other port tugs responded and provided further assistance.

SC Phoenix (IMO 9236262) collided with Smyrna (IMO 7527887) at the new pier of Drapetsonas, causing damage to both ships. No injuries were reported from the incident and no marine pollution was observed. A preliminary investigation was carried out by the Port Department of Keratsini, while the departure of both ships was prohibited until a certificate of seaworthiness had been presented and a class maintenance certificate by the attending classification society.
Vessel issued distress signal while pushing a barge from Busan, South Korea to Batam, Indonesia.SAR underway but all the crew have been unacounted for as of 24 hrs after the incident occured.

VINAFCO 28 collided with the TRUONG NGUYEN 136 off Tam Quan, central Vietnam, South China sea. TRUONG NGUYEN 136 sank after the collision, of 10 crew on board 9 were rescued by VINAFCO 28, 1 went missing, local fishermen joined SAR and continue search.

SC Phoenix (IMO 9236262) collided with Smyrna (IMO 7527887) at the new pier of Drapetsonas, causing damage to both ships. No injuries were reported from the incident and no marine pollution was observed. A preliminary investigation was carried out by the Port Department of Keratsini, while the departure of both ships was prohibited until a certificate of seaworthiness had been presented and a class maintenance certificate by the attending classification society. 25-Mar-2022: Vessel was reported on fire in Mediterranean 90 nm north of Damietta, Egypt and started drifting. She was en route from Ashdod Israel to Piraeus. The ship managed to get under way on 26th March, changing port of destination to Limassol, Cyprus.

French company-owned ferry JEAN NICOLI struck the Algerian tanker TOLGA at Algiers port, Algeria, during maneuvering. The Tanker had serious damages in  superstructure areas, ferry is understood to suffer slight damages, she left Algiers on Apr 7 and continued her scheduled voyage.
EMBLA collided with the RoRo ship BOTHNIABORG at Westsluis Lock, Terneuzen, Netherlands. Both vessels with hull damage. The lock gates also badly damaged.
EMBLA collided with the RoRo ship BOTHNIABORG at Westsluis Lock, Terneuzen, Netherlands. Both vessels with hull damage. The lock gates also badly damaged.
Reports of fire explosion onboard while enroute from Tanjung Pelepas to Nhava Sheva, India. Cause of fire unknown. She was declared NUC and adrift as of April 6th.

Vessel struck pier at container terminal in Jade Weser Port, Wilhelmshaven, during berthing maneuvers. Ship’s stern reportedly sustained damages, pier also badly damaged. Vessel had arrived from Gdansk, Poland when incident occured.

French company-owned ferry JEAN NICOLI struck the Algerian tanker TOLGA at Algiers port, Algeria, during maneuvering. The Tanker had serious damages in  superstructure areas, ferry is understood to suffer slight damages, she left Algiers on Apr 7 and continued her scheduled voyage.

GREAT ROYAL collided with anchored bulk carrier FATEMA JAHAN, during high tide in Pashur river, Bangladesh. Both ships sustained damages in forecastle area. Investigations by the port authorities commenced after both vessels refused permission to leave.

GREAT ROYAL collided with anchored bulk carrier FATEMA JAHAN, during high tide in Pashur river, Bangladesh. Both ships sustained damages in forecastle area. Investigations by the port authorities commenced after both vessels refused permission to leave.
Vessel harrased by Greenpeace activists who attached themselves to the cranes, preventing loading/unloading operations. She was docked at Salmaasari coal terminal Helsinki when event occured.

Vessel hit the landing at Colman Dock, Washington State, taking out the vessel and a slip at the Seattle ferry terminal out of service. She had been sailing from Bainbridge Island to Seattle when the accident occurred. There was damage to one of the wing walls but no reported injuries.

Vessel was fired upon by reportedly, Russian military while in berth at Mariupol port, Ukraine. It is unclear whether it was hit by a missile which resulted in fire outbreak in the engine room. Out of 12 crew, 1 was injured.
Vessel suffered engine failure while approaching Bosphorus in Black sea, en route from Novorossiysk, Russia. A tug was sent to assist and she was shortly declared NUC.

Vessel ran aground at Fladda Lighthouse and had few dents on starboard side. Unconfirmed reports of some leakage in the ballast tank. She was refloated with tug assistance and went on to moor in Troon, Scotland for inspections.

Vessel ran aground in southern Bosphorus, Istanbul, while maneuvering to berth at Haydarpasa, Istanbul. She was refloated  with tugs assistance and moved to Ahirkapi Anchorage. No leaks or hull breach reported.

Vessel sank while heading from Equatorial Guinea to Malta carrying up to 1,000 tonnes of oil and the Tunisian navy had rescued all seven crew members. Officials later said a specialised diving team sent to counter a potential environmental disaster found the ship cargo did not contain fuel, but rather was empty. A Tunisian judge detained seven crew members, as authorities investigated whether the ship may have been deliberately sunk.
MN TALOS collided with the RODION OSLYABYA while she was approaching Sulina Canal, Danube. Reports suggest that MN TALOS may have lost starboard anchor. No injuries to crew members.

A pollution slick was detected by satellite in the wake of vessel, about 100nm northwest of Tromelin Island, French Overseas territory, while she was en route from Madagascar to the port of Tuticorin. A Casa aircraft was dispatched by the CROSS Sud Ocean Indien (Réunion Island), which was able to locate the slick and draw up a report against the allegedly offending vessel. The Master of the ‘Momentum Phonix’ refused to comply with the diversion order given by the aircraft commander and continued its voyage. A request for investigation will be sent to the vessel’s next port of call, within the framework of the International Convention for the Prevention of Pollution from Ships (MARPOL) and under the Memorandum of Understanding on Port State Control in the Indian Ocean. As of April 19th the vessel was at Chittagong Anchorage after a 21-day voyage from Toamasina, Madagascar.
MN TALOS collided with the RODION OSLYABYA while she was approaching Sulina Canal, Danube. Reports suggest that MN TALOS may have lost starboard anchor. No injuries to crew members.

Vessel (IMO: 9311701) with 21 POB experienced steam leak in engine room, and anchored in pos 50 48 47N, 000 52 32E, off Rye, UK, 02 Apr 2022. One crewmen injured and was medevaced in helicopter. No pollution was reported. Sailed, 02 Apr.
Vessel reported damage to Schottel propulsion when an obstruction got caught in propeller during assistance for a seaship. Vessel at Wilhelmshaven as of 13 Jun.

Drujba allided with cargo ship Adnan H at  the port of Burgas, Bulgaria, in stormy weather. Two tugs pulled the passenger ship free. No casualties or pollution were reported during the incident and the damage is said to have been minimal.

Drujba allided with cargo ship Adnan H at  the port of Burgas, Bulgaria, in stormy weather. Two tugs pulled the passenger ship free. No casualties or pollution were reported during the incident and the damage is said to have been minimal.

Vessel (IMO 9171096) was reported to be NUC due to a defect with its oil heater, in lat 51 22 09N, long 001 58 06E, 01 Apr 2022. Repaired its defect & is underway to its destination, about 15 minutes after breaking down.

Vessel has been fined for damage to the reef during a survey work for the government’s submarine cable project of the reclaimed island of Hulhumale, Maldives at the beginning of April. It was established the USBL poles on the HiPAP system and the multi-beam echo sounder on the ship touched the reef and caused damage.

Tanker (IMO: 9306627) in laden condition experienced technical failure during Canakkale strait passage at Akbas point, Turkey, on 01 Apr 2022. Vessel resumed strait passage under supervision of strait pilot & Coastal Safety tugs. Vsl fined.

Vessel(IMO:9356488) had engine trouble in English Channel, NE of Dover, in English channel on  01 Apr 2022. Drifted in wind force 8-9. Dropped anchor in pos 50 49 26N, 001 25 43E, off Boulogne, France. Arrived Moerdijk on Apr 3.
Vessel suffered an engine room fire and went adrift en route to Ravenna to Rotterdam while towing a barge.
Fire broke out in the cargo hold while she was laden with wood. After several hours, the fire was put out with support from firefighting tugs and onboard extinguishers.

Vessel suffered mechanical failure and was disabled at eastern Med 90 nm ESE of Rhodes, while en route from Istanbul to  Iskenderun. She was taken on tow – on Apr 2 according to AIS tracking, and towed to Rhodes, Rhodes island.

On approach to the port of Rostock, vessel was NUC and ran into several yachts and other harbour infrastructure. She had to be towed backwards to be removed. No injuries and no major damage to her hull integrity.
Vessel suffered a fire outside Rost in Lofoten, Norway. 14 of 22 crew rescued. She was towed to Vegsund Slip. Police concluded the fire was caused by electrical fault.

Vessel (IMO 7803229) experienced engine failure & was drifting S of Istanbul strait on 31 Mar 2021. Tug Kurtarma-6 (IMO 9463176) & rescue boat KEGM-6 towed & anchored vsl in Istanbul anch, same day. Fine imposed.Repairs will be done by crew

Vessel (IMO:8417247) ran aground at harbour entrance of North Sea Island of Wangerooge, Germany on 31 Mar 2022. Refloated with rising tide, berthed in Wangerooge on 12 Apr & berthed at New Jade Yard for repairs. Sailed on 23 May.
Vessel (IMO 9036002) was not under command due to engine problems, in pos 50 04 17, 002 30 17W, 31 Mar 2022. No assistance was needed. Rectified the defect & underway to its destination.
Auxiliary engine blackout

Vessel ran aground underneath Nordsund Bridge in Kristiansund, Norway, sustained damages, but no leaks. Docked at the Kristiansund Mekaniske AS for repairs on 31 Mar. Sail Averoy on 13 Jun for Kristiansund.

Vessel (IMO 8906303) experienced engine failure & loss of power southeast of Sicilia Island, Italy, in pos= 39 28 00N, 014 44E, on Mar 30. Vsl towed to Valletta for repairs. Departed from there for final destination Ortona, ETA 06 Apr
She ran aground in Fredrikstad, Norway while enroute from Sarpsborg to Rissa. Refloating plan swiftly arranged with traffic control authorities.
ARUBABORG allided with a dock while berthing in the port of Baie-Comeau, Quebec. There was damage to both the vessel and to the dock.

Vessel (IMO: 9118006) experienced engine failure, in Ionian Sea, position lat 38 33N, long 18 38E, on 29 Mar 2022. Later was towed to destination Igoumenitsa, on 30 Mar. Tug is appointed to tow it to Tuzla.

Vessel collided head-on with general cargo ship PAIVI in Kiel Canal just below Old Levensau Bridge, sailing in opposite directions. Both ships’ bow sections and forecastles were breached and severely damaged. BJOERKOE was taken out of Canal and berthed at Kiel, both ships had to be towed.

Vessel suffered blakcout after generator failure, followed by engine failure, in Xiamen harbor while proceeding to berth on arrival from Taiwan. Tugs were sent to assist and take the ship under control, as she could collide with other vessels and port constructions. Tugs ensured ship’s safety until problem was fixed, and KRASZEWSKI resumed power.

Vessel collided head-on with general cargo ship BJOERKOE in Kiel Canal just below Old Levensau Bridge, sailing in opposite directions. Both ships’ bow sections and forecastles were breached and severely damaged.  PAIVI was berthed in Kiel Canal near collision site, BJOERKOE was taken out of Canal and berthed at Kiel. Both ships had to be towed.

Vessel (IMO: 9813993) en route from Klaipeda, Lithuania to Tees, UK report as NUC due to water leak on Cylinder 7 on main engine on 29 Mar 2022. Estimated to complete repairs in about 10 hrs. Completed repairs in abt 6 hrs, sailed.

Beverly M I (IMO 9084047), while towing vessel (IMO 5294307), reported losing its tow, in lat 41 41 53N, long 083 27 54W, off Toledo, Ohio, US, 28 Mar 2022. Vessel ran aground in Entrance Channel & was refloated by other tugs & tow resumed.

Vessel(IMO: 8516782) had propulsion issue, NW of North Cape, in approx pos 71 28 17N, 24 21 40E, 28 Mar 2022. Tug(IMO: 9544425) towed it & anchored in pos 70 41 49.2N, 23 20 12.6E, off Hammerfest, 29 Mar. Sailed port, 30 Mar.
Vessel ran aground off Kumkale, when about to enter Dardanelles from Aegean sea, en route from Iskenderun to Burgas.She was refloated and moved to Akcansa anchorage, south of Kumkale.
