Vessel suffered explosion, followed by fire, in Chao Praya river mouth, Bangkok area, Thailand, while mooring at the Bangchak depot in Phra Khanong district. The ship arrived from Koh Si Chang Anchorage with cargo of crude oil (offloaded from large tanker). One crew died in the explosion and three were injured. Tanker drifted downstream for about 3 miles, and finally, managed to drop anchor. Fire was extinguished by firefighters in about an hour.

Vessel issued distress signal and requested assistance in Black sea about 2 nm south of southern Crimea, while en route from Istanbul to Rostov, Azov sea, Russia. The ship reported breached hull and flooded engine room. She was towed to Kerch Strait, anchored south of Kerch Bridge. All Russian mainstream media said, citing Russian Maritime Authorities (ROSMORRECHFLOT) statement, that the ship was damaged after she “was hit by a big wave”. Most probably, the ship was hit either by breakaway “friendly” mine or “friendly fire”.

Vessel ran aground in Japan sea near Malaya Kema village, Primorskiy Region, Russia, being en route from from Plastun to Amgu, Primorskiy Region coast. The ship was sailing at full speed so she should be hard aground. 2 tugs were sent to assist. 9 crew were evacuated, no spills reported.

Vessel docked in San Francisco after multiple passengers and crew members onboard tested positive with Covid 19. 05-Aug-2021 : A passenger onboard had to be evacuated by the USCG medical team shortly after he experienced heart complications. Incident occured near Point Loma.

Vessel caught fire while approaching port of destination Pichilingue, Gulf of California, Mexico. Fire started in one of the trailers and spread around in cargo deck. 24 passengers were evacuated and no injures were reported. Fire is said to be extinguished, firefighters waiting for cargo deck to cool down.

Vessel (IMO: 8516835), which was under arrest since 01 Jul 2020 at Berdiansk, Ukraine sustain structural damages due to rocket strike by Russian force attack on Berdiansk on 26 Mar 2022. None OB at time of incident. xtent of damage unknown.

Vessel (IMO: 8863355) en route from Rostov, Russia to Hereke, Turkey in a laden condition reported technical failure upon completion of Strait passage, and dropped anchor off Istanbul Anch, Turkey on 26 Mar 2022. Vessel resumed voyage.

Vessel (IMO: 9513622) allided with the wall of lock of Kiel Canal in Brunsbuttel, upon entering chamber, 26 Mar 2022, after veering to SB side. Water police investigated. No damage, spill, injury reported. Ar in Swinoujscie, Poland, 27 Mar.

Vessel collided with fishing vessel 5 nm north of Kumkoy, northwest Istanbul, Black sea. She suffered portside damages in superstructure area and was escorted by tugs and SAR boats to Kumkoy Anchorage area, most probably to be anchored for inspection and investigation. VECTIS ISLE was en route from Bulgaria to Greece.
Vessel ran aground about 45nm south of Olya, Russia. No reports of water ingress and no pollution. Vessel owner was working with the local authorities to formulate a plan to refloat the vessel.
Vessel (IMO: 9481049) had oil leak in engine cylinder, while underway in position lat 51 03 17.0N, long 001 20 33.0E, United Kingdom, on 24 Mar 2022. Repairs completed & vessel underway.
The vessel is owned by the Russian billionaire Dmitry Pumpyansky and was seized when it docked at the Gibraltar port. Sanctions were applied to the oligarch by the EU, UK, and the US.

Vessel ran aground on 142.6 kilometer mark Volga-Caspian Sea Channel, while en route from Astrakhan, Russia, to Anzali, Iran, understood in load. She partially blocked fairway and traffic. There were no reports of hull breaches or spills.

Vessel (IMO: 9705287) had fire in the cargo hold at Tilbury Docks, UK, 24 Mar 2022. 40+ firefighters attended & extinguished scrap metal fire. Metals removed by dock crane. Cargo unloaded. Firefighters left after temp checks.

Vessel capsized and rested portside on pier at Kolkata port, India. The ship is deployed in container service connecting Kolkata and Chittagong, she was about to leave Kolkata on Mar 25. The most probable cause for capsizing would be cargo shift.
Vessel was hit by missile at Mariupol, Ukraine. She departed the war-torn city controlled by separatists on 9 November. It will proceed to Varna, Bulgaria, where it will undergo repairs.

Vessel encountered rudder malfunction while en route from Palembang Indonesia to Gusan Korea, with cargo of pulp. Her voyage was interrupted as she was towed to Xiamen, China. Unconfirmed reports suggests the rudder got stuck while in starboard position.

An ailing crew member was medevaced by the Indian Coast Guards of Kerala and Mahe. The vessel was en route from Yantai, China to Suez. The patient was described as critical and requiring immediate hospitalization. The Grand Neptune was directed to approach Kochi harbour to reduce response time. The patient was safely transferred to tug Ocean Pioneer and later was shifted to a hospital in Kochi.
Vessel allided with quayside at starbord aft while manoeuvering at Daito Honmuko container terminal, Japan. Hull breached but no leak reported.

Vessel was arrested in a litigation case on the orders of the Bangladesh High Court orders. The vessel had arrived at Chittagong on February 24th and was awaiting owner’s instructions. As of March 26th the vessel was at Chittagong Anchorage, Bangladesh.

Vessel suffered engine failure in Kepez area, Dardanelles, while transiting the Strait, en route from Iskenderun to Kocaeli, suspending traffic for 1-2 hours. The ship was anchored for about an hour before she was moved to Erenkoy anchorage.

Vessel capsized and sank in Taiwan Strait some 55 nm WNW of Taichung, Taiwan, en route from Kaohsiung, due to rough weather. There were 8  crew on board of which 7 were rescued and one is still missing.

Theodoros I.V. was in collision with Petion  following a malfunction whilst manoeuvring at Cienfuegos inner anchorage, Cuba. The Theodoros I.V. sustained a slight deformation of the hull plating on the starboard side, above the waterline. She was detained due to the unsafe condition of her hull. The Petion was not damaged. No injuries nor pollution were reported.

Theodoros I.V. was in collision with Petion  following a malfunction whilst manoeuvring at Cienfuegos inner anchorage, Cuba. The Theodoros I.V. sustained a slight deformation of the hull plating on the starboard side, above the waterline. She was detained due to the unsafe condition of her hull. The Petion was not damaged. No injuries nor pollution were reported.

Vessel was allowed to dock at at Immingham port, UK arriving from Primorsk, Russia because Russian cargo is permitted to enter UK ports as long as the vessel is not owned, operated or chartered by Russians.
Vessel (IMO: 9379583) while berthing in Yokohama, Japan, was driven by winds causing its portside stern to come in contact with wharf on 22 Mar 2022.

Vessel was offloading cargo of crude oil at Qingdao Haiye Mercuria Terminal when she broke off her moorings and drifted aground, cargo hose also broke, with ensuing small oil spill. She ran aground but was refloated on 23rd March and moored back at Qingdao Haiye Mercuria Terminal.

Vessel was arrested in a litigation case on the orders of a Bangladesh High Court. The vessel had arrived at Chittagong anchorage on March 20th and was awaiting owner’s instructions. As of March 26th it was still at Chittagong anchorage.

A crew member needed to be evacuated while vessel was en route from Barcelona to Lisbon. An SAR helicopter was mobilized by the CCS of Salvamento Marítimo in Valencia to carry out the medical evacuation. The patient was hoisted aboard and transferred to Manises airport, Valencia, where an ambulance was waiting.

Vessel was forced to make an emergency detour to Bermuda after the chief engineer suffered heart trouble when the vessel was 575 miles southeast of Bermuda, necessitating urgent medical assistance. The crew member was transferred ashore to the local hospital via the St George pilot boat. The ship was en route from Baltimore, USA to Dakar.

A 52-year-old crew member needed immediate hospital treatment. The vessel was anchored near the port of Litochoro, Greece. He was transferred to a patrol boat and was then transported to the beach port of Pieria, where he was picked up by an ambulance and transported to the General Hospital of Katerini.

Vessel (IMO: 9640970) had ammonia leakage OB at the quay at the Tromso terminal in Tromso, Norway, on 21 Mar 2022. Emergency services arrived at scene; crew evacuated. Leak located, repairs on. No leak into sea. Sail Tromso 22 Mar.

Vesel was sailing southeast of the Skyros prefecture en route from Gebze to Corpus Christi, when a crew member needed immediate hospital treatment. The ship proceeded to the bay of Karystos, where the patient was transferred to the Agios Nikalaos and was then transported to the port of Karystos, where he was picked up by an ambulance and taken to the Dioklio Hospital in Karystos.
Vessel lost many containers in North Pacific SE of Kamchatka while en route from Yantian China to Seattle.

Vessel collided with commuter ferry in Meghna river in Narayanganj, Bangladesh. Ferry capsized, people were jumping overboard, at least 6 dead bodies were recovered, dozens are feared missing. The ship has been detained for further investigations, but it's probable she couldn't have done much to avoid collision with ferry considering fairway narrows, strong river current, lack of time to respond to ferry’s dangerous crossing of the ship’s way.
Vessel dragged anchor and drifted close to northeast coast of Malta as she was arriving from Algeciras, Spain. 2 tugs responded, trying to stop the drift and prevent ship’s grounding.

Vessel(IMO:9384186) experienced engine failure, dangerously drifted to Poyraz point, southern entrance of Istanbul strait, Turkey, 19 Mar 2022. Vessel towed to Buyukdere anchorage for repair. Imposed fine for breaching strait safe passage.
Vessel was detained in Long Tau River, Vietnam because the captain was unable to present proper documents regarding the origin of 900 tonnes cargo of coal.

One person was seriously injured in an accident aboard the vessel, in the Lange Lijnbaan in Harlingen, northern Netherlands. Emergency services attended with ambulances and a helicopter. They lifted the victim from the cargo hold using a crane. The victim was taken immediately to hospital.

Vessel (IMO: 9685621) went NUC following engine failure some 21 NM W of Kithnos, Greece on 19 Mar 2022. After about two and half hours, repairs were completed with own means, vessel continued voyage to destination Gibraltar.

UPDATE: As of 20th March, vessel was under way heading for Cape Town, with SA AMANDLA nearby. She wasn’t abandoned, all or some crew remain on board. Details of accident still unknown. Vessel is reportedly abandoned, adrift 213 nm NNW of Cape Town but the information has not yet been confirmed. She is en route from Singapore to Brazil. According to track she encountered problems on Mar 11, being south of Cape Town. Understood SAR tug SA AMANDLA responded, probably bulk carrier was under tow for some time. Still waiting for updates.

Spanish authorities seized the vessel in Barcelona. The yacht is said to be owned by Sergei Chemezov, a former KGB officer leading the state-owned weapons conglomerate Rostec although vessel is registered in the name of Chemezov’s granddaughter Anastasia Ignatova, as disclosed in the 2021 Pandora papers information leak. The vessel was moored for repairs at a shipyard in the port of Barcelona. The authorities have stated that the repairs were complete, and the ship was ready to depart when the yacht was seized.

Vessel developed heavy list in Persian Gulf off Iran coast due to rough waether. She then capsized, although it is unknown if she is still afloat or has sunk. She was en route from UAE to Umm Qasr, Iraq. Most probably, she suffered cargo shift on cargo deck or decks, followed by water flooding cargo deck. 30 crew were on board, 16 are reported to be rescued, 11 remain in life rafts, 1 rescued by merchant ship, and 2 remain in water.

Spanish authorities have seized the vessel at Palma de Mallorca in response to the sanctions issued by the west and the European Union against Russian oligarchs and billionaires. The seized vessel belongs to Alexander Mikheev, the current CEO of Rosoboronexport, a Russian state-owned weapons export conglomerate. Sanctions were issued against him amongst other Russian ruling elites by America on 14th March.

Vessel experienced a failure of its rudder on March 11th when about 3nm off The Smalls, Wales. She was towed to Rotterdam on 17th March. WK Webster has said that It was possible that General Average / Salvage and associated recovery issues might arise as a result of the casualty.

MRCC Vietnam reported vessel (IMO:9237187) disabled in S.China sea in pos 11 15 00N, 115 00 36E, 17 Mar 2022. 2 vsls towed it to Song Tu Tay Island, 18 Mar. Had engine failure, drifted, 3 lights malfunctioned. 1 more vessel to assist 21 Mar

Vessel  (IMO:9262637), with 23 POB, experienced engine failure, in pos 37 52 51N, 023 33 19E, about 2.8 nm from Piraeus anch., Greece, on 17 Mar 2022. Departure permission cancelled by local port authority. Vessel at anchorage.

Vessel (IMO: 9396701), c/w the berthed Zodiak II (IMO: 9851866), while entering Port of Gdansk, Poland, 17 Mar 2022. No injuries or pollution were reported. Vessel was docked at the Ostrow Shipyard in Gdansk for its repairs, as of 23 Mar.

Vessel (IMO: 9624079) reported GAMA about a water ingress through a crack in bow in pos 60 53 20.4N, 03 59 17.2E, 17 Mar 2022. Flooding contained. GAMA notified EMCIP & counterparts. Investigations underway. Vessel sailed Mongstad, 19 Mar
General cargo ship Rix Gulf collided wih vessel, while entering Port of Gdansk, Poland. No injuries or pollution were reported. Vessel sailed from the port on 19 March.
The superyacht was arrested by the port of Rijeka as it's allegedly owned by Russian oligarch Viktor Medvedchuk. The yacht had been moored in Croatia for a considerable time.

Vessel was secured by the Harbour Master’s Office and the Batam Special Port Authority, Riau Islands, Indonesia under suspicion of undertaking ship-to-ship transfers of goods in Batu Ampar Waters, Batam City without the required document permits.

Vessel suffered engine trouble and went adrift, then dragged its anchor off when about 6.9nm from the Port of Shimoda, Japan. She received assistance from an offshore tug two days later. The ship was en route from Yokohama.
Tanker (IMO: 9256432) experienced fault with fuel pump on main engine & drifting in pos 51 48 40N, 005 58 59W, 29 nm from St. Bride's Bay, UK, 16 Mar 2021. Repairs completed. Vessel sailed, 17 Mar.

Vessel has yet to find a port to discharge its cargo since she's been turned away from the UK more than a week ago. As of March 15th the NS Champion was stopped in the Skagerrak, south of Oslo, Norway, and north of Aalberg, Denmark.
Vessel (IMO: 9574999) had engine failure near the Port of Makassar in South Sulawesi, Indonesia, 16 Mar 2022. The vessel reportedly remains at the port and is yet to resume operations.

Vessel (IMO: 9075371) grounded at Pirholmen in Austevoll, 15 Mar 2022. Rudder broken; hull & propeller damaged. Tugs towed vsl to Vaksdal to unload cargo & towed to Skudeneshavn, Norway for repairs on 19 Mar.

Vessel (IMO: 9348625) in laden condition, had engine failure, power loss & drifted off SW of Lesvos Islands, Greece, in pos 39 01 00N, 25 17 00E, 15 Mar 2022. Tug (IMO: 7431806) assisted & towing vessel to Piraeus, ETA, 17 Mar.
The Singapore Supreme Court arrested the vessel in Singapore. The arresting solicitor was Rajah & Tann Singapore LLP. The vessel was moored at the Pilot Western Boarding Ground “A”.

Vessel was underway from Zeebrugge to Sabine Pass when it requested Salvamento Marítimo for assistance. A crew member was evacuated by SAR helicopter and transferred to the Alvedro airport for further care.

Vessel's stern was struck by container ship ESCAPE while she was berthed at Gdansk DCT Container Terminal. ESCAPE reportedly, went under way too early as she was about set sail for Kaliningrad, Russia. Both ships remained in the same position. Damages sustained by both ships are said not to be serious.

Vessel (IMO: 9213337)  damaged due to bad weather of storm Celia, after leaving Los Cristianos, Canary Islands, 14 Mar 2022. Considerable damage to halls and vehicles in garage. Vessel arrived at Santa Cruz de la Palma, with none injured.

Vessel (IMO: 9371878) had problem with piston, in sunk anch., UK, 14 Mar 2022. Sea trails successful after repairs & vessel awaiting a pilot to enter port, 15 Mar. Finally arrive in destination Dagenham on 15 Mar.

Vessel struck the stern of berthed container ship HANNI at Gdansk DCT Container Terminal, while unmooring. The ship reportedly, went under way too early as she was about set sail for Kaliningrad, Russia. Both ships remained in the same position. Damages sustained by both ships are said not to be serious.
Vessel ran aground while leaving Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic. According to track, she was refloated in the early hours of the 15th March and taken back to port where she was docked.
GAMA was notified that vessel (IMO: 9785380) c/w quay at Raahe, Finland, on 14 Mar 2022. GAMA informed EMCIP & started investigating. Vessel sailed on 18 Mar.

Vessel reported as damaged, 2 crew injured during fishing vessel rescue, in position 45 23 12.0N, 060 06 06.0W, 31nm S. of Louisbourg, Nova Scotia, Canada. Crew transferred to hospital once vessel reached Mulgrave.

Cargo caught fire near the port of Shenzhen, Guangdong province, China. while vessel was  en route from Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam to Qingdao, Shandong province, China. Rescue operations were launched and the situation was brought under control. The vessel returned to the port of Ho Chi Minh City to assess the damage and carry out repairs.

Vessel went disabled and adrift in the South China Sea due to an engine failure, while en route from Wakayama, Japan, to Davao, Philippines. Vessels in the vicinity were requested to keep a sharp lookout, assist if possible and report to the MRCC Hong Kong. As of March 17th the vessel was at Kaohsiung anchorage, Taiwan.

Vessel changed its destination for Le Havre after initially signalling its destination as Philadelphia. She was carrying Russia’s arctic Varandey crude oil. Litasco SA, the trading arm of Russian oil producer Lukoil, chartered the ship to send oil from Russia to Philadelphia, but the US announced a ban on imports of Russian oil on March 8th.

Vessel (IMO:9532549) with 23 POB had engine failure, drifted abt 110NM off Cocos Island, Mauritius in pos 18 34 36.1S, 61 59 30.1E on 13 Mar 2022. Tug (IMO:9737266) assisted, vsl arrived near Mauritius on 23 Mar. Resume voyage 29 Mar 2022.

Vessel (IMO: 9544932), en route from Swinoujscie, Poland to Eemshaven, Netherlands allided with lock wall of the Great Southern Lock in Brunsbuttel on 13 Mar 2022 during exit manoeuvre. Damage to vessel unknown, vessel continued voyage.

Vessel ran aground in Chesapeake Bay channel, stranding off fairway, shortly after leaving Baltimore en route to Norfolk. Salvage company has been already designated and tugs were nearby. According to USCG, the ship doesn’t obstruct traffic.

Fire in boiler room of vessel (IMO: 7343607),  at Thunder Bay, Canada, on 12 Mar 2022. Crew initiated fire extinguishing and the firefighters controlled the blaze. Boiler room & electrical system extensive damaged. Investigation underway.

Vessel (IMO 8702252) experienced rocket attack off Taganrog, Russia in pos 47 00 00N, 038 02 30E on 12 Mar 2022. Vsl sustained serious structural damages & experienced fire which was extinguished. Will be towed to Taganrog. No injuries.

Vessel (IMO:9130951) reported starter motor failure, anchored in pos 51 21 40N, 003 26 13W, abt 1.4 NM SW of Breaksea Point, UK on 12 Mar 2022. Vessel rectifying problem, awaiting info on spares, engineers. Sail after repairs on 14 Mar.

A crew member of cruise ship was medevaced by helicopter after suffering a cardiac arrest and he had subsequently been revived. The ship was located north of Rangiroa, more than 120nm from the atoll while en route from Uturuda, French Polynesia to Papeete, French Polynesia, in the South Pacific.

Vessel collided with Balearic ferry NAPOLES in Alboran sea some 53 nm SE of Malaga, Spain. She was en route from Panama to Italy via Tanger and Algeciras and NAPOLES was en route from Malaga to Melilla, Spain territory, Morocco. No information on LAUST MAERSK damages but the ship interrupted voyage and turned back. She was sailing east at reduced speed, probably waiting for preliminary investigation results. No injures reported both on container ship and ferry. There was probably containers loss, looks like one container from LAUST MAERSK hooked on NAPOLES bridge structure.

Vessel collided with container ship LAUST MAERSK in Alboran sea some 53 nm SE of Malaga, Spain. She was en route from Malaga to Melilla, Spain territory, Morocco. NAPOLES sustained damages in fore section portside above waterline but was able to continue voyage to Melilla. No injures were reported both on container ship and ferry.

Vessel (9287924) had problem with lubricating pump, in Sunk TSS Deepwater Anch on 12 Mar 2022. Anchored in pos 51 53 52N, 001 41 25E for repairs. Estimated time to complete repairs 12 hrs. Sail after repairs on 14 Mar, arrive Felixstowe.

Vessel suffered steering failure while transiting Bosphorus in southern direction near 15 July Martyrs Bridge, while en route from Tuapse, Russia. Istanbul Traffic Control Center tugs responded. Tanker was taken under control, completed transit and moved to Ahırkapı anchorage, Istanbul, Marmara sea.

Smoke billowing from cargo hold in foreship of vessel (IMO: 9574303) after berthing in Wicklow, Republic of Ireland on 12 Mar 2022. Fire brigade attend incident scene & solved problem. No pollution, injuries. Sail Wicklow on 14 Mar.

Vessel hit bulk carrier AKTI after breaking free its moorings during very strong winds near the VT Halter Shipyards and Chevron docks in Pascagoula, Mississippi. The rig was secured promptly and was safely returned to its mooring location. Both vessels sustained minor damages, with some additional damage to the pier.

Drill ship (IMO: 9630078) came in contact w/ Akti (IMO: 9660619) due to strong winds, near VT Halter Shipyards, Pascagoula, USA, 12 Mar 2022. Both vessels sustained minor damages. Pier damaged. No pollution/injuries so far. Channel closed.

Vessel lost a crew member over board in the North Sea, while en route from Antwerp to Hamburg. The missing 41-year-old seaman was thought to have fallen overboard. The container ship had issued a Mayday and a large-scale search was initiated. With good visibility but challenging conditions, the units involved systematically searched the area, but without success. The operation was stopped at around 19:00 that evening after night fell. As of March 14th the vessel was moored at Hamburg.

Vessel capsized and sank at Alexandria Anchorage, Egypt, in rough weather. Most probably there was cargo shift, which caused capsizing and sinking. 10 crew were rescued. The ship had arrived from Tripoli.
Vessel collided with bulk carrier BURAK DEVAL at anchorage, in Iskenderun Bay. Understood MAHER was under way, while BURAK DEVAL was at anchor. No damages have been reported yet.

UPDATE: 01/11/2022 - Vessel has been refloated and taken to Izmir, to a scrap yard, for dismantling. UPDATE: It was reported that the vessel sustained serious structural damage and water ingress as a result of the grounding as continuing adverse weather conditions have prohibited any attempts to refloat the vessel in good time. As of March 16th the vessel was in the English Channel, due south of Plymouth, Devon, heading for Rotterdam. Vessel was pushed aground by strong winds  in Iskenderun Bay. Tugs have been sent to refloat her and there were no reports on any damages.

Vessel ran aground on a coast near Kilitbahir, Dardanelles, while transiting the strait in southern direction, en route from Constanta Romania to Bari Italy. SAR tugs responded, the ship was refloated and taken to Kumkale Anchorage, southern Dardanelles, where she was anchored. Understood there were none or just slight damages as she ran aground on a sandy bottom.
Vessel collided with heavy load carrier MAHER  at anchorage, in Iskenderun Bay. Understood MAHER was under way, while BURAK DEVAL was at anchor. No damages have been reported yet.
Vessel encountered engine issues south of Reunion, while en route to Tubarao Brazil.Three tugs responded and ship was to be towed to Port Louis, Mauritius.
Vessel reported engine failure while in  Placentia Bay, southwest Newfoundland, and started to drift. She was en route from Pointe Noire Canada to Suez. 4 tugs responded, operation under way.

Vessel (IMO 8955469) experienced technical failure & sheltered & dropped anchor in Bodrum anchorage, Turkey on 10 Mar 2022. Repairs are being carried out by crew, vessel remains stationary at anchorage as of 11 Mar.

A crewmember was medevaced from the cruise ship when it was 80 miles west of Tampa, Florida, the US Coast Guard said. It was reported that the man was suffering from abdominal pain, and a USCG flight surgeon recommended the man be brought ashore. An Coast Guard Air Station Clearwater MH-60 Jayhawk helicopter aircrew medevaced the 34-year-old man and flew him to Tampa General Hospital in stable condition.

Vessel (IMO:9629809) NUC due to faulty fuel pump, in lat 49 48 40N, long 003 23 40W, 31NM S off Start Point, UK 10 Mar 2022. Main engine stopped for repairs; estimated to take 3 hrs. Completed repairs, vessel underway to destination.

Vessel collided with a fishing boat in the waters off Thousand Islands in Jakarta, Indonesia. One crew member of the fishing boat was reported killed, while the other two crew members were safely rescued.

Vessel suffered explosion fire, on cargo deck at IRPC Co pier, Samut Parakan, Bangkok. She had arrived the previous day from Rayong with cargo of gasoil and diesel oil. One crew was injured and taken to hospital, one went missing. It's understood gas in tank or tanks exploded, because of some negligence. Fire was taken under control by fire teams in about an hour.

Vessel (IMO: 9234422) reported engine failure off Ambarli, Turkey on 09 Mar 2022. Repairs carried out and sea trials satisfactory. Depature permission issued. Vessel berthed at Ambarli port container terminal, on 01 Apr 2022.
Vessel allided with a breakwater while sailing in the Kanmon Strait, Japan en route from Moji to Ichihara. No oil leakage or water ingress occurred.

Vessel (IMO: 9670743) NUC after losing main engine, all power & ran aground in pos 55 06 13.8N, 007 12 18.0W, UK on 09 Mar 2022. No pollution, damage; being towed. Anchored at Moville, 09 Mar. Repairs complete, vessel transiting to Belfast.

Vessel (8104515) reportedly allided with Tres Bocas dock near Puerto Azul, Guayaquil on 08 Mar 2022; some damages to port facilities. Port Authority of Guayaquil investigated the causes. Vessel subsequently berthed in La Libertad on 10 Mar.

Vessel (IMO: 8919855) had engine failure, loss of power, drifting SE off Salerno, Italy in pos 39 58 35N, 014 56 04E, on Mar 8. Crew could not repair; tug (IMO: 9359193) towed vessel to Marina di Carrera on 12 Mar. Sailed Carrera on 17 Mar.

UPDATE: 13-Jun-23 - Dismantling operations have begun, after salvage attempts have failed due to rocky area. The work is expected to take 3 months to complete. UPDATE: Salvage operations have been unsuccessful so far, as there are too many rocks in the area where the ship ran aground. Operations have been suspended pending a reevaluation of the area. All 15 crew members remained on board, as instructed by the shipping company. Vessel ran aground at Sancang Beach, Cibalong District, Garut Regency, southwest Java, while en route from Ketapang to Cilacap Indonesia, after steering failure. Authorities are waiting for tug to refloat tanker. No spills were reported.

Vessel was escorted to Phuket, Thailand by a patrol ship of the Royal Thai Navy after five crew members had requested help. One of them claimed to not have been ashore for 13 months, four months past the expiry of his contract date. Officials were examining the employment contracts and investigating the employment. As of March 12th the vessel, which was en route to Chittagong, Bangladesh, was underway again to Bangladesh, although its ETA of March 11th would not be met.

The ship called at the Port of Assens during the afternoon of March 8th while en route from St. Petersburg. The Port “reluctantly” serviced the ship, since Denmark has not officially closed its ports to Russian ships. The Assens Municipality of Southern Denmark has decided to donate to a charity for the benefit of Ukraine the money the port earned from the call of the Russian cargo ship.

Vessel (IMO:9644251) report broken piston ring, advised it would take 12 to 16 hrs to repair, off Newhaven, UK in pos 50 45 21.4N, 000 01 22.1E on 08 Mar 2022. 18300 MT Ammonium Sulphate OB. Repairs completed next day, vessel under way.

Vsl (IMO:9794472) at Tarakan Anch, Indonesia notify Gabinete de Investigacao de Acidentes Marítimos e da Autoridade para a Meteorologia Aeronautica(GAMA),Lisbon of loss of propulsion requiring tow assistance.GAMA notify European Commission.
Vessel was denied permission to dock at Milford Haven. The diesel load was taken on at Primorsk and had been bound for Puma Energy, but the ship was now bound for Antwerp.

The Harbour Master’s Office and the Batam City Special Port Authority found that the vessel was to be allegedly carrying out an illegal STS transfer with tankship Tutuk in Batu Ampar waters, Batam, Riau Islands, Indonesia.

Vessel lost power and drifted aground off Jigang port, southeast Taiwan. The ship dropped anchor, but anchor dragged. She was en route from Yantai China to Bahodopi, Sulawesi, Indonesia. Maritime authorities and CG are expecting tug from Kaohsiung, to refloat her. No spill was reported.

Vessel was secured by the Harbour Master’s Office and the Batam City Special Port Authority after it was found to be allegedly carrying out an illegal STS transfer with oil products tanker Lynx Satu in Batu Ampar waters, Batam, Riau Islands, Indonesia.

Vessel was intercepted by Greenpeace activists on the River Weser, near Bremen. The environmental group said that it wanted to send a signal against the Ukraine war as the Seasprat was loaded with Russian oil. The activists painted “Peace – not Oil” in large yellow letters on the hull of the tanker. The inflatable boats accompanied the tanker ship for some distance, but did not block her. She berthed in the industry port of Bremen later that day.

All crew have been laid off following arrest of vessel in the port of Hamburg. The international sanctions against Russia as a state, and Usmanov (yacht's owner) as an individual meant that he could no longer pay the crew or captain. A skeleton crew provided by the ship builder was now on the ship.
Vessel sank during a dead ship tow by tug CAPT. BEAU from Port of Miami to Haiti, near Magallanes Bank, approximately 25 miles NW of Santo Domingo Cay, Bahamas.

Vessel (IMO: 8611013), en route from Hamburg, Germany to Vordingborg, Denmark, ran aground in the Saelhundholm Lob in the Nissum Bredning on 06 Mar 2022. Divers found ship undamaged. Vessel left Skive, and sailed to destination, 08 Mar.

Vessel (IMO: 9298545) displayed status as NUC, approximately 30 NM W of Lundy Island, UK in pos 51 11 34.8N, 005 29 04.8W on 06 Mar 2022. MRCC Falmouth unable to contact the vessel. Vessel resumed voyage on 07 Mar.
Vessel was arrested in Singapore after she arrived from Tanjung Langsat. The arresting solicitor was Oon & Bazul LLP. No further details as yet.

Vessel was en route from Halifax to Montreal, when she was disabled after engine failure in Gulf of St. Lawrence. As of 10th March, she was still adrift some 30 nm west of western Newfoundland, no tug yet in sight.

A man had a dramatic escape from the path of container ship while it was in the Solent, en route from Southampton to Le Havre. He was in a dinghy that found itself in the path of the container ship, with a stalled engine. He jumped overboard and swam for his life and was later recovered from the water by a patrol boat and taken to hospital after treatment for shock. The Harbour Authority for Southampton Water was investigating the near miss.
Fine imposed on vessel for polluting the Gulf of Izmit (Basiskele district).The EPA were quick to respond to prevent further damage to the environment. Leakage occured when vessel was taking bunker.

Vessel (IMO: 9444974) driven by strong winds & allided with a wharf, while departing from Kobe, Japan, 05 Mar 2022. Permitted to sail by Japan Coast Guard, 05 Mar. Ar in Yokohama, 06 Mar & Sd from the port, same day.

Italian government seized luxury yacht under European Union economic sanctions against Russia, in the Port of San Remo, Italy. Italian authorities linked the yacht to sanctioned Russian individual Gennady Timchenko.

Vessel suffered a technical failure while en route from Gulluk, Turkey, to Port Said, Egypt. The ship moored at Datca Bay, Turkey, where the crew started carrying out repairs. As of March 7th the vessel was underway again, heading for Damietta, Egypt.

Vessel rested on bottom after developing portside list, at Papeete, French Polynesia. Her inside compartments were flooded via open valve, which may have been faulty or due to negligence. Overloading wass also mentioned.

Vessel (IMO 8402589) attacked or contacted mine, holed below waterline & 70-deg list off Odessa in the Black Sea, 03 Mar 2022. Was under control of Russian Navy 02 Mar. Sunk in Ukrainian Black Sea port of Odessa, 03 Mar.

Vessel (IMO:9154270) reported engine failure, loss of power, drifting off south of Finike, Turkey in pos 35 06 00N, 030 36 00E on 03 Mar 2022. Crew could not carry out repairs, tug Pothitos II (IMO:9186572) towing vsl to Tuzla as of 04 Mar.

Vessel was disabled after passing under Lions Gate Bridge, Vancouver, in English Bay while en route to China. Tugs responded and she later moved to English Bay and was anchored for inspection. Understood problem already fixed.

Vessel became disabled and adrift when it was about 95nm south-east of Port Elizabeth, South Africa. The ship was en route from Pointe Noire, Congo, to Port Elizabeth; it berthed at the Ngquare Liquid Bulk Terminal in Ngqura on March 4th where it remained as of March 5th.

Vessel (IMO: 9757084) was NUC due to a defective water pipe, in lat 54 10 09N, long 005 23 02W, abt 10 NM & 106 degrees from St. John's Point, 03 Mar 2022. Effected repairs & en route to the destination. Ar in Bayonne, 06 Mar & Sd 08 Mar.

Vessel docked in Kolding under escort of patrol vessel P520 Diana. The Danish port wanted to boycott the ship since the government was currently in the process of imposing sanctions on Russian ships calling at Danish ports but the details of the implementation were not yet clear. As of 3rd March, the Omskiy-135 had left Kolding and was heading for Kaliningrad, Russia, ETA 4th March
Vessel (IMO:9234276) NUC after problems with main engine that had to be shutdown 28 NM S of Start Point, UK on 02 Mar 2022.ETC of repairs abt 90 mins. Vessel was underway again, 02 Mar.

Vessel (IMO: 9264207) had main engine problems, at around 02 Mar 2022. The shipping company has announced several changes in its vessel rotations. Returned to Suva, Fiji & remains anchored, as of 17 Mar.
A fire broke out aboard vessel while she was undergoing repairs at Kaliningrad, Russia. The fire ignited during welding work on the ship’s hull but it was extinguished relatively quickly.

Vessel (IMO: 9315549) while berthing, came in contact with a dock in Argentia, Newfoundland, Canada, 02 Mar 2022. The vessel and the dock sustained minor damages. Sd from Argentia, Canada, 07 Mar & Ar in Sorel, 12 Mar.
Local customs officials seized the vessel, after it arrived at Lorient, France, on February 27th. The vessel flies Panamanian flag but is the property of the Russian Ministerial Transport Company.

Vessel hit by a missile of Russian Navy ship, while anchored off Oktyabrsk, Ukraine. The superstructure was on fire and 3rd engineer died. BSC gave a $5,05,000 cheque to the family of the deceased engineer, 16 Jun.

Vessel issued distress signal between Iceland and Faroes, while en route from Iceland to Thyboron Jutland, Denmark. The ship encountered rough weather and suffered engine failure. MRCC Torshavn received signal and is coordinating salvage.

Vessel (IMO:7358755) experienced engine failure, and sidelined at Portoferraio port, Italy, 01 Mar 2022. Propulsion stopped causing vessel to drift. Anchored to avoid grounding. Vessel resumed service, on 02 Mar.

UPDATE: As of March 3rd the vessel was listed as en route from Arkhangelsk (departed February 23rd) to Saint Malo, France, ETA March 11th. Vessel was scheduled to arrive in Hull on Thursday March 3rd but port call is unlikely since UK ports are refusing access to Russian vessels following the invasion of Ukraine. The official destination remains Hull although her last position was NW off Norwegian coast.

Vessel suffered an engine failure in Kerch. Crew attempted repairs, but were unsuccessful. The ship was taken in tow to the Tuzla shipyard area by tug Terinalind on 2 January. The generator and other power supply units, including battery support system, were out of service.

Initial reports from the local salvage team state that the vessel had sunk around 220nm off the Azores, having suffered a list to starboard after fire in one of the cargo decks. The ship was en route from Emden Germany to North Kingstown USA.

Vessel (IMO:7311329) had engine failure in pos 34 44 14N, 022 54 11E, SW of Crete Island, Greece, 28 Feb 2022. Crew unable to repair, towed by tug to Eleusis, 04 Mar. Animals transferred to Adel I. Sailed Drapetzona, 30 Mar.

Vessel suffered heavy damages in a head-on collision with islet, in Mediterranean, while en route to Spain, exact date unknown, probably late Feb. She arrived at Malaga on Mar 5, and is already dry docked. Bulbous bow was crushed, starboard hull in forecastle area sustained a huge breach.

High water flow into the Brisbane River caused the vessel (IMO 9344150), to break away from the Ampol Products wharf at Lytton, 28 Feb 2022.  The vessel was refloated successfully & anchored in Moreton Bay without any incidents.

Ukrainian crew member attempted to sink yacht (owned by Russsian arms tycoon) by opening valves and blocking fuel pipes, to disable pumps. Vessel partially submerged but was rescued by two other Ukrainian crew members. He was later arrested and then realeased on bail. He took all responsibility and said he does not regret what he did.

3 armed perpetrators sighted on board vessel (IMO: 9701267), in position lat 01 02 17.4N, long 103 38 27.0E, Singapore Strait, on 27 Feb 2022. Engine spare parts stolen. No assistance required. Crew safe. Vessel sailed.
Vessel suffered engine failure 7 nm west of Cies island, while approaching port of destination Vigo, en route from Bristol UK. Two tugs responded towed her to Vigo, where she was berthed.
Vessel (IMO: 9884904) allided with berth at Toyohashi, Japan, and damaged vehicle stopper, while berthing, on 27 Feb 2022. Sailed port on 27 Feb.

Vessel ran aground on 51 kilometer mark Volga Caspian Sea Channel, while en route from Astrakhan to Anzali Iran. She was later refloated with tug assistance and towed back to Astrakhan. There were probable damages, but no leaks reported.

Vessel (IMO 9660528) ran aground in pos 32 40 59S, 60 42 50W, at 453KM of Parana River, Argentina on 26 Feb 2022. Tug Tumbador assisted & refloated vessel, 26 Feb. Later, arrived & berthed at San Lorenzo Anch., 26 Feb

Vessel (IMO 7392610) was hit by shell (rocket) in neutral waters of Black Sea, in pos 46 22 13.3N, 031 07 05E, near Odessa, Ukraine on 25 Feb 2022. Fire broke out. Crew left vessel with help of nearby ships. Vsl reported to be sinking.

Fire erupted in engine room while en route from Chittagong to St Martin's island, Cox's Bazar, Bangladesh. Fire was extinguished by crew, several crew said to suffer injures. BAY ONE was disabled, tug called for assistance. She eventually returned to Chittagong, probably under own power, escorted by tug.

Vessel ((IMO: 9296315) had rocket attack in lat 46 34 00N, long 31 07 00E off Yuzhny, Ukraine, 25 Feb 2022. Structural damages were noted on main deck starboard side in the way of no.3 cargo hold of the vessel. Berthed at Tuzla anch, 27 Feb

Vessel (IMO: 9841299) was hit by rocket & damaged & an able man OB was injured, near Yuzhnyy Anchorage, Ukraine, on 25 Feb 2022. 1 crew injured. Vessel remains in  Yalova shipyard, Turkey, for repairs, 02 Mar.

A crew member collapsed in the engine room while the ship was sailing near Lübeck on Germany’s Baltic coast, and needed to be resuscitated. The crew of the Finnfellow provided first aid under remote guidance from the physician. A helicopter from Northern Helicopter GmbH transported the man to hospital.

Vessel (IMO: 9504293) notified the Portuguese maritime safety office, that the vessel lost its port anchor during an anchoring operation, while located 6 NM S of Changi, Singapore, 24 Feb 2022. An investigation into the incident is underway

UPDATE: 28 surviving crew members were evacuated at the port of Oktyabrsk during the night of March 3rd. The vessel has been declared abandoned because of its condition after being hit by two missiles on March 2nd while at the small port’s anchorage, killing one crew member and destroying the bridge of the vessel. After the death of the third engineer was reported the Bangladeshi Foreign Ministry and Ministry of Shipping acted. Vessel has been stranded in Mykolaiv in the Dnieper Estuary ever since the conflict between Russia and Ukraine started. The sailors called on the Bangladesh government to take necessary steps to rescue them quickly as it's impossible for them to take ship anywhere because of Russian Navy presence.

Vessel was hit by either Russian air strike or Russian missile off Odessa, Black sea, while en route from Dnepro-Bugskiy to Constanta Romania. Turkish MRCC says the ship sustained damages in cargo hold area, but she remained under way and continues voyage. All crew are safe.

UPDATE: Crew have abandoned ship, 9 were rescued, 8 are still missing and 2 dead have been recovered. The ship developed list after engine failure, in adverse weather. Most probably, cargo shift took place. Status of the ship unknown but it is likely she is still afloat, either heavily listed, or capsized. Vessel issued distress signal and requested assistance in South China sea 162 nm ESE of Vung Tau, Vietnam. The ship reported 20 degrees list and 19 crew ready to abandon the ship, fearing she may capsize. Last updates were showing ship already adrift. SAR was launched with deployment of Vietnamese SAR ship and merchant ships in the vicinity.

Vessel was disabled and adrift due to engine trouble 26nm from Malahayati in the Andaman Sea while en route from Tanjung Pepepas to Colombo. Vessels in the vicinity were requested to keep a sharp outlook, assist if possible and report to RCC Basarnas.
Vessel suffered engine trouble near Calais, while en route to Terneuzen port in the Netherlands. Salvage tug Abeille Languedoc was deployed to assist and took the ship in tow to Dunkerque anchorage.

Ferry (IMO: 9197105) cancelled sailings b/w Rosslare and Pembroke, due to damaged bow door, after sailing to Rosslare, on 22 Feb 2022. Passengers were accommodated, on Stena Lines sailing between Rosslare and Fishguard, on 23 Feb.

Vessel (IMO:9373204) had engine malfunction off Balo in East Nusa Tenggara, Indonesia, 22 Feb 2022. Anchored near beach in Desa Hokor for repairs. Tools/mechanics to arrive. Sail on 04 Mar, arrive Surabaya 12 Mar. At Surabaya as of 23 Mar.

A crewmember of the three-masted, full-rigged school ship fell off the mast he was working on at the port of Assens. The victim was quickly taken to Odense University Hospital, where he was pronounced dead. An investigation has been opened into Denmark's Labor safety regulator and the Danish Maritime Authority.

Pilot boarded vessel at Taichung port, Taiwan, to take her to berth on arrival from Shanghai. He fell while climbing but the weather was rough and it took around 40 minutes for him to be recovered from water. He was unconscious and taken to hospital where he unfortunately died. The ship left Taichung on Feb 22, bound for Shanghai.

Vessel (IMO: 9071064) experienced technical failure during Canakkale strait passage and dropped anchor in Karanlik liman anchorage, Turkey, 21 Feb 2022. Vessel departure permission cancelled until state surveyor checks final repair status.

Vessel ran aground near Kavaratti port entrance, Laccadives islands, India, while approaching port. She is loaded with some 700 mt of different types of fuel. There are no reports on damages and cause of grounding.

Vessel broke off her moorings at Taichung port, Taiwan, due to storm in Taiwan Strait and western Taiwan coast. She drifted off the berth and contacted container ship OSG ADMIRAL. OSG ADMIRAL sustained slight damages. XIANG FU drifted across the basin and ended up aground off the embankment. She was refloated and taken back to her berth. Extent and character of damages unknown. Oil leak was mentioned but not confirmed.
Vessel was berthed at Taichung port, when during storm, bulk carrier XIANG FU broke off her moorings and contacted OSG ADMIRAL. She sustained slight damages.

Vessel (IMO 9294965) experienced technical failure approximately in pos lat 36 33 05N, long 28 41 00E off Fethiye, Turkey on 20 Feb 2022. Vessel shifted to Fethiye anchorage, Turkey, under own power. Repairs underway as of 01 Mar.

Vessel(IMO: 9549592) had crankshaft damage, at communal port of Brunsbuttel, Germany, on 20 Feb 2022. Towed as dead by 3 tugs to port of Brunsbuttel. Towed to Hamburg & berthed repairs, 05 Mar. Entered Norderelbstrasse Yard, 11 Mar.

Boxship suffered damage to the main engine and lost manoeuvrability. She went adrift in the waters of Pulau Pom Pom, Semporna, Sabah. She was en route from Kota Kinabalu to Tawau at the time of incident.
Damage to propeller hub

Vessel suffered damage to its main engine turbocharger rotor in the Barents Sea, while en route from Archangel to Ryfylke. She was diverted to Hammerfest at slow speed, where it arrived during the afternoon of February 23rd for repair works. As of February 27th it was moored at Rypefjord, Norway.

Update: It has now been established that the vessel could not be repaired at the anchorage area. The vessel heaved up anchor and was towed to Haydarpasa port on May 19th. Decisions on the cargo handling operation and permanent repairs are under progress. Vessel (IMO: 9442108) had engine failure in lat 44 54 00N, long 035 44 05E, SW of Kerch, Ukraine, 19 Feb 2022. The crew were not able to carry out the repairs. Shifted to Kumport, 24 Feb. Repairs underway. Still at Kumport as of 25 Mar.

Vessel (IMO 9461879) experienced main engine failure and air lock in fuel line was NUC and anchored in pos lat 51 42 41N, long 002 10 51E about 39 NM off Clacton, UK on 19 Feb 2022. Tug assistance requested. Repairs underway.

Vessel (IMO: 9804423) while berthing under the conduct of a pilot, in lat 45 37 16N, long 073 30 19W, allided with a dock at section 101 of the Port of Montreal, Canada, 19 Feb 2022. The vessel & the dock sustained minor damage.
A crew member suffered head injury after being struck by a loose mooring rope. He was rushed to the hospital for further treatment.

Vessel was intercepted and detained by a Libyan National Army patrol vessel about 14nm northeast of Ras el Hilal for breaching the LNA ‘No Sail Zone’ and was escorted to the Ras el Hilal anchorage for administrative procedures. She was en route from Abu Qir, Egypt, to Foynes, Ireland.

Vessel with 5 POB went adrift from Lelystad, Netherlands, in storm Eunice; capsize, partially sank. Sheerleg Hebolift 6 raised vessel on 23 Feb. Lelystad Municipality to recover 60,000 Euros salvage cost from owner.

UPDATE: 2 people remain trapped on board, 11 are said to be missing. Full scale SAR underway, salvors are trying to douse fire as soon as possible, to make way to 2 trapped inside, divers are deployed to search for missing people. Major fire broke out on board the vessel near Corfu island, Ionian sea, en route from Igoumenitsa Greece to Brindisi Italy. All people on board, including crew, left the ship and went into lifeboats and to nearby ships, all are reported safe. A number of boats and helicopters, coordinated by Greek Navy frigate HYDRA have been deployed, and firefighting is under way.

Danzig id: 9832212) while on the Kiel Canal said it was ceasing operations becoz of storm “Eunice”, 18 Feb 2022. Shortly, Danzig c/w passing vessel (IMO: 9306005) & allided with the dolphin no.3 & adjacent moored San Bacco (IMO: 9753818).

Vessel lost at least 26 containers, due to being caught in storm Eunice, in North sea NNW of Frisian islands, Netherlands. She was en route from Bremerhaven to Rotterdam. Dutch CG has started a search for lost containers.

Vessel (IMO: 9322334) lost both of its anchors in position lat 44 30 25.8N, long 063 24 15.6W, Halifax, Canada, on 18 Feb 2022. Using engines vessel held position until weather subside, taken to Halifax for repairs on 20 Feb.

Vessel was anchored at Vandelaar Anchorage, North sea, west of Zeebrugge when she dragged anchor and drifted through windfarm mine fields, situated west of Vlissingen, due to storm Eunice. The ship didn’t collide with windmills, and she later returned to anchorage under own power.

Vessel arrived at Vandelaar Anchorage in the morning Feb 18, waiting to be allowed to dock at port of destination Antwerp. She drifted  into windfarm, and managed to anchor about a cable off a bloody C-power windmill. As of Feb 19, she was still at anchor, stuck between windmills, offshore tug ALP FORWARD was trying to take tanker to anchorage.

Vessel was berthed at TOTAL Energies Terminal, Ostermoor, Kiel Canal, Brunsbuettel area when Kiel Canal ferry DANZIG contacted her. Investigators found ferry skipper to be intoxicated. Criminal proceedings are under way. This has probably caused damages to both ships.

Vessel went out of control in Noordzeekanaal, Ijmuiden, Netherlands, sailing upstream from Noordersluis to Amsterdam. The ship was pushed off course by strong wind and though she managed to drop anchor, she couldn’t come to full stop and contacted the embankment of Kanaaldijk road. She resumed sailing towards Amsterdam about 20 minutes later.
Ocean A Gauthier (IMO: 7305904) came in contact with the unloading boom of the berthed vessel (IMO: 6714586), in lat 43 44 43N, long 081 43 36W, at Goderich, Ontario, Canada, 16 Feb 2022.

Vessel (IMO: 7919781) had a technical failure, at the entrance of Istanbul Strait, 16 Feb 2022. Shifted from the incident place to Istanbul anch., under own power. Safely dropped anchor at 0300 hrs. Repairs commenced by crew.

Vessel issued distress signal and reported fire in one of cargo decks. She was en route from Emden Germany to North Kingstown USA. 22 crew were evacuated and transported by helicopter to Faial island. Portugal Navy patrol ship NRP SETUBAL will be on a standby until tugs arrive and tow her to nearest shelter.

Vessel lost 4 containers overboard in western English Channel and reported accident to French MRCC, CROSS Corsan. Accident was caused by very bad weather and the ship had to maneuver to stabilize containers, after the accident. She resumed trip from Thamesport UK to Nilbao Spain, Bay of Biscay. 2 drifting containers were spotted on Feb 17 north of Ushant, during a surveillance flight.

vessel (IMO: 9458444) out of control in hurricane force winds of storm “Ylenia” in Elbe estuary & requested assistance on 16 Feb 2022. Tug Nordic held vsl in place. Vsl released & can maintain its position on its own 17 Feb. Tug released.

Vessel sank approximately 255 nm E of easternmost coast of Newfoundland. 22 or 24 crew went into life rafts of which 2 were found empty, 3 fishermen were rescued from another one, fourth raft is still missing. The three rescued fishermen are suffering from hypothermia. SAR ships and helicopters were deployed in the area.

Vessel(IMO 9349980) & Roibeira (IMO 9414187) came in contact with each other in Figueira da Foz, Portugal on 15 Feb 2022. Material damage on both vsls. No pollution or injuries. Investigation on. Vsl sailed port on 18 Feb

Vessel (IMO 9414187) & bulk carrier Dakota (IMO 9349980) came in contact with each other in Figueira da Foz, Portugal on 15 Feb 2022. Material damage on both vsls. No pollution or injuries. Investigation on. Vsl sailed port on 18 Feb.

10 crew members were poisoned by unknown substance while carrying out works at Nevelsk port Anchorage, western Sakhalin island, Russia. Four of them were hospitalized with mild symptoms, while the other six suffered only slight symptoms. It is presumed they had been handling fuel with additives.
Vessel allided with berth in Morocco during berthing at Casablanca. She sustained transom breach. The ship had arrived at Casablanca from Hamburg.

Vessel (IMO: 9772278) lost its port anchor, abt 12 NM ESE from Les Escoumins, Quebec, at Ile-aux-Basques-et-des-Razades Anch., Canada, 14 Feb 2022. Able to proceed on the voyage with 1 anchor. Ar in Quebec, 17 Feb & Sd 19 Feb.

Vessel (IMO:9494096) had engine, rudder failure while berthing in San Lorenzo, Argentina on 13 Feb 2022.Initially unable to drop anchors due to winch problems; knock down terminal's north mooring tower.Taken to centre roads for inspections.

Vessel which had been docked at the Keppel Verolme Ship repair in Rotterdam since an engine room fire on 13 Feb 2022, started sea trials off the Dutch coast, 21 Jul, Sailed Rotterdam on 27 Jul, bound for Dover, ETA 27 Jul.

Vessel suffered a fire en route from Busan, South Korea, to Oita near Suo Nada, Yamaguchi Prefecture, Japan. Crew extinguished the fire without external aid, and the vessel entered Oita port the same day. However, it was unable to depart there due to the loss of a lifeboat. It remained at port as of February 15th.
Vessel (IMO: 9401051) while unberthing, came in contact with a dock at berth 8 of the Surrey-Fraser Docks in Surrey, BC, Canada, on 12 Feb 2022. The vessel and the dock sustained minor damages.

suffered engine failure shortly after she entered Bosphorus Strait en route from Spain to Zonguldak, Turkey, Black sea. Traffic Control tugs responded and the ship was towed back to Marmara sea for repairs and inspection.
Vessel (IMO 9797802) c/w Kaiser lock wall, Germany on 14 Feb 2022. Hull breached, ballast tank holed. Vessel berthed at Fayard yard, Odense, Denmark, for repairs, 16 Feb. Sailed, 18 Feb.

Vessel (IMO 9835886) was NUC in pos 49 03 54N, 007 00 42W & drifting at course 088 deg with speed 3.3 knots on 12 Feb 2022. MRCC Falmouth contacted owner & confirmed vsl drifting for orders & AIS status changed to underway using engine.

Vessel was raided by narcotic teams in the Kilimli district of Zonguldak, Turkey. They carried out a search after receiving a report that there was a large amount of cocaine on the ship, which was en route from Rotterdam to the Eren Energy Thermal Power Plant.

PRES PORTLOUIS (DISCHARGING) ETD 15.2.2022  Next voyage is fixed from Durban toWCI.      WE HAVE AN IDWAL REPORT WHICH CANBE RELEASED TO POTENTIAL BUYERS FOR A COST OF USD 1,000   WITH OUR PRIOR APPROVAL.   OWNERS ARE INVITING BEST OUTRIGHTOFFERS – COM
Vessel (IMO: 9155432) allided with pier while arriving alongside at Gefle, Sweden, on 10 Feb 2022. Investigation underway. No injuries/pollution reported. Sailed, 10 Feb.

Vessel (IMO: 9355989) was in distress while midstream in the Federal Ocean Terminal (FOT) Onne, due to operational error, moved to a better location away from the FOT Onne Channel, 24 Feb 2022. Sustained a list to port, 10 Feb.

Vessel was suspected in oil spill off southern coast of Newfoundland as she was passing by, en route from Baie Comeau Canada to Rotterdam. The ship’s fuel tank was somehow, damaged while she was sailing in stormy weather, with allegedly, ensuing oil leak. Tank was sealed, but the ship was ordered to remain in the area and she's been looping back and forth since.  Ship’s operator contracted a Transport Canada-certified spill response company.

Vessel (IMO: 7225350) reportedly came in c/w Roll On Roll Off Nusa Dharma (IMO: 7303308) off Merak, Indonesia on 09 Feb 2022, apparently due to high waves and strong winds that made vessels drift, even while anchored. No injuries.

Vessel allided with pier 1 at Heraklion, Greece, during mooring. The ship hit the pier with its bow and suffered dents and scratches on the starboard side, above the waterline. A ballast tank was breached. The Central Port Authority of Heraklion banned the ship from sailing until the damage was repaired and a certificate of seaworthiness was presented by the attending classification society. No injuries were reported and no pollution was observed.

Vessel suffered engine failure SW of Stavanger Norway, while en route from Riga Latvia to Murmansk Russia. She managed to regain some power, and sailed to shelter port Mekjarvik, off Stavanger escorted by Offshore tug BB OCEAN.

Vessel suffered a fire in the accommodation block at Datca anchorage. One crew member was injured during firefighting and was taken to shore for hospital treatment. Technical inspections were completed on February 11th and the vessel resumed its voyage to Iskenderun.

Vessel had rudder failure near kudensee, Germany, Kiel Canal, 09 Feb 2022. Canal barred for shipping in incident area. Towed to Brunsbuttel, banned till investigation & seaworthiness confirmation. Sailed, 10 Feb, arrived in Hamburg, 12 Feb.

Vessel (IMO: 8002731) came in c/w FVs docked at Bethesdaweg, Paramaribo, Suriname on 08 Feb 2022; Maritime Authority Suriname launch investigations. All damages settled with claimants. Vessel allowed to sail & left Paramaribo on 17 Feb.

Vessel ran aground  in the strait between island Graciosa and small islet Praia, shortly after leaving Praia da Graciosa port. It seems it was more contact than grounding but she suffered propeller damages and underwater hull breach in engine room area, with ensuing war ingress. She developed a heavy aft tilt, but she’s still afloat. She’s loaded with diesel and gasoline, no leaks reported.

Vessel was en route from Antwerp to Primorsk Russia when her anchor chains entangled between each other while transiting Kiel Canal, blocking the traffic. It is still unclear why this happened but the chains were eventually untangled and tanker resumed transit.

Vessel collided with Passenger/Vehicles RoRo KMP Panorama Nusantara in an Indonesian port. She suffered water ingress in the stern part after the ramp malfunctioned and opened. High waves and strong winds had caused the two vessels to go adrift after the anchors dragged. No injuries were reported. As of February 8th the Nusa Dharma was at Merak anchorage.

Vessel(IMO:9050826) broke lose from moorings & allided with quay due to wind, despite own propulsion & assistance of 2 port tugs, at Marseille, on 07 Feb 2022. Minor damage to SB stern & hull, vsl will return to Porto-Vecchio, for service.
Vessel was detained in Singapore, at the Sudong special purpose anchorage most likely due to disputes over payment of goods and services. The vessel arrived in Singapore en route from Koper.

Fire erupted on board of the ship in Persian Gulf, when she was en route from Sohar Oman to Dayer Iran. Iranian SAR ship responded, and fire is reportedly, extinguished. Iranian sources said the 17 crew “were rescued”.
Vessel broke off her moorings, drifted across narrow basin, and allided with berthed heavy lift ship BLACK MARLIN. She was taken back to berth. No damages have been reported yet.

Vessel  Kelly C. (IMO: 9558024) initially reported having collided with Pacific Cobalt (IMO: 9788617), at Ghent, Belgium, on 06 Feb 2022. This was  denied by agents of both vessels and Port Capt; the vessel reportedly allided with quay wall

Vessel had steering gear damaged in rough weather at Amchit Anchorage, Lebanon. Tanker arrived from Turkey via Beirut loaded with 42,000 tons of diesel oil and was in process of offloading cargo, when accident occurred. Circumstances and damages unknown and no leak was reported.

Vessel  Kelly C. (IMO: 9558024) initially reported to have collided with Pacific Cobalt (IMO: 9788617), at Ghent, Belgium, on 06 Feb 2022. This was later denied by agents of both vessels and Port Capt; no damage visible. Sailed 08 Feb.

Strong winds caused vessel to break off her fore part moorings with stern lines still holding on. Tugs responded and moved fore back to berth. No damages, no injures reported.She is bound for Felixstowe.

Vessel suffered engine failure while leaving Xiamen China.Three tugs were able to respond almost immediately, and prevent her blocking the channel. She was taken back to berth and inspection found main engine so damaged it needs ship repair yard at Shanghai. More than 5,000 containers were offloaded and will be delivered to their destinations by substitute ships.

Vessel allided with quay in Patras, Greece during mooring operations. The port side stern hit the quay about one meter above the waterline, causing the distortion of plates and a small rupture. There was no water ingress.

Vessel struck oil berth at San Lorenzo, Parana river, Argentina while leaving the port. The extend of damages is unknown. She resumed voyge but was later anchored at Zona Comun Anchorage off La Plata, Argentina. She was still at anchor on the 8th Feb, probably awaiting damages assessment.

Vessel collided with yacht Kleen Breeze 84nm northwest of Arrecife, Lanzarote, Canary Islands. The yacht suffered a leak as a result. The MSC Romane reported that the three men crew on the yacht were safe and that the yacht had pulled alongside the container ship. The vessel was en route from Las Palmas to London Gateway.

Vessel was en route from Colon, Panama to  Antwerp when it requested medical assistance. She anchored at Vlissingen, Scheldt mouth, Netherlands. One injured crew was airlifted by helicopter and transferred to hospital. The nature of the injury is unknown.

Vessel had to intentionally run aground at Abagatanen Beach, western coast of central Luzon, Philippines, on Feb 4, interrupting her voyage from Indonesia to China, reportedly with cargo of steel. The ship suffered water ingress and ran aground, understood, to avoid sinking. As of Jun 13, SUNNY LINK remains in the same position, local authorities request from owner to remove the ship, in view of oncoming typhoon season. SUNNY LINK didn’t damage reefs, there’s no leak.

Vessel  (IMO: 9285677) sustained damage to its starboard anchor in an anchorage, in pos 54 07 58.9N, 130 22 06.3W off Prince Rupert, BC, Canada, on 04 Feb 2022. The vessel was able to use its port anchor.

Vessel was seen drifting closer to the south of Bahuluang Island in Selayar Islands, South Sulawesi province, Indonesia. There did not appear to have been any efforts to tow or evacuate the vessel. It was continuously being monitored by the National Search and Rescue Agency. As of February 1st it had been listed as “not under command”.

Vessel's Chief Officer fell into water from pilot ladder while trying to read draft marks at Taman port, Russia, Black sea and died of hypothermia. He was recovered after 45 minutes could not be resuscitated.

Vessel suffered water ingress in tank number 3 while docked in the port of Chalkida, Greece. A private diving crew carried out an inspection and found two tank cracks. The Central Port Authority of Chalkida banned the ship from sailing until a class maintenance certificate is presented and they imposed administrative sanctions.

Fire broke out in the engine room while vessel was en route from Bremerhaven, Germany to Riga, Latvia. The fire was extinguished by the crew and there were no reports of injuries or pollution. The ship berthed at the Riga Central Terminals on February 4th and as of 12th Feb she was still there.

Vessel with 11 crew ran aground on the eastern coast of Reunion. She was pushed hard aground by cyclone Batsirai, lashing the area, and might be a total loss. Crew were successfully transferred to land bu firefighter teams.
Vessel has exploded and sunk at the Ukpokiti Terminal, around Excravos, Warri South-west, Delta State, Nigeria. Apparently ten workers were on board of which seven are missing.

Cay Trader II (IMO: 7928768) experienced leak in bilge at La Luz port, Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, Spain, on 02 Feb 2022. Punta Salinas (IMO:7931894) & Salvamar Nunki (LLP :623016) assisting the vessel and diver team assessing damages

Vessel ran aground in Lasserre (Admiralty) Bay, King George Island, the South Shetland Islands, Antarctica. She was refloated with help from Argentina Navy icebreaker and research ship ARA BAHIA AGRADABLE, and headed for Ushuaia, Argentina, under own power. It is unknown the extent of damages or if there were any at all.

Vessel sank at Zarubino port, Primorye, Russia, Japan sea, on Feb 2, while off loading the catch. The ship sank following massive water ingress. Chief Engineer tragically died and Master is in hospital with hypothermia.
Vessel suffered engine failure in Dardanelles while ballasting from Egypt to Chornomorsk Ukraine. SAR tugs responded and towed her to anchorage in front of Saltik, Dardanelles.
Ship ran aground while sailing to Bremerhaven, on arrival from Rotterdam. At least five tugs have responded.
Vessel had engine failure at Trieste, Italy. Crew were unable to carry out repairs. Tug Ollan towed it from incident scene to Tuzla ship yard.

Vessel (IMO: 8213500) report engine failure, loss of control at Sariyer point after entering Istanbul Strait on 01 Feb 2022. Vsl secured & towed & drop anchor at Buyukdere anch. Moored in Hereke, 03 Feb.
Vessel had engine failure at Rostov-na-donu, Russia; crew could not repair; tug Bas Viking began towing vessel on 22 Sep to Yalova shipyard area, Turkey, ETA, 30 Sep.
Vessel had engine failure at Rostov-na-donu, Russia on 01 Feb 2022. Crew could not carried out repairs. Tug Bas Viking took vessel under tow to Yalova shipyard area, Turkey on 01 Sep. ETA, 07 Sep.

Vessel suffered a crack some 7cm in length in its number 1 FOT(P) fuel tank after she had received bunkers at Bremerhaven the previous day. During routine checks post bunkering an oil slick was observed but the crew managed to stop the leak and the vessel continued its voyage towards Boston, Massachusetts. A full repair is planned after the arrival in Boston.
Vessel contacted embankment of southern breakwater in Kaohsiung Port, Taiwan. Ship’s hull was breached, followed by water ingress and a heavy starboard list.
Vessel (IMO: 9317781) boarded by 3 robbers, at Belawan anchorage, Indonesia, on 01 Feb 2022. Ship properties stolen, Robbers fled vessel & escaped. Incident reported to local authorities.

Vessel (IMO: 9355812) had an engine blackout during the eastbound transit of the Kiel Canal & ran into the S embankment short past the switch at Fischerhutte, 01 Feb 2022. Vsl departed after repairs on 02 Feb.
Grounded

Vessel (IMO: 9280691) en route from Pasajes, Spain to Goole, UK, with 3351 MT steel profiles OB, along with 8 crew, 1 pilot, ran aground at Goole Ocean Lock, UK on 31 Jan 2022. Vessel to be refloated at 1828 hrs, UTC, 31 Jan.

Vessel collided with with bulk carrier JULIETTA D at Ijmuiden outer anchorage, North sea. JULIETTA  was breached in engine room area with mass water ingress. All crew were evacuated by helicopters, in very challenging storm conditions.

Vessel collided with tanker PECHORA STAR at Ijmuiden outer anchorage, North sea. She was breached in engine room area with mass water ingress. All crew were evacuated by helicopters, in very challenging storm conditions.

Svelvik(IMO: 9907990) with 6 POB, had blackout & grounded at Svelvik, Norway, 31 Jan 2022. Lifeboat RS Klaveness Marine assisted. Crew safe & vessel refloated after damage inspection. Vsl arrived at Svelvik on 31 Jan.
The ship reported disabled and adrift while on maiden voyage from China to Santos, Brazil.

Fire broke out in engine room of MUNIN (IMO: 8915782), in Esbjerg port, Denmark, on 30 Jan 2022. South West Jutland Fire Brigade deployed smoke divers and extinguished fire. 5 crew  taken to hospital for smoke poisoning.

Vessel suffered generator failure in Japan sea 35 nm north of Okinoshima island, Japan. The ship drifted towards island’s northern coast and anchored approximately 5 cables off the coast, to avoid grounding. As 2nd February, the ship is understood to remain anchored, with CG ships and tug nearby. She wass en route from Los Angeles to Ningbo.
Vessel had technical failure at Ampelakia, Greece. Crew couldn't carry repairs. Tug CHRISTOS XXVII towed vessel to Tuzla shipyard, Turkey on 22 December.

Vessel was caught in severe storm while waiting for orders at outer anchorage Cuxhaven/Wilhelmshaven, Germany. Tugs responded, helping bulk carrier to prevent onshore drift. The ship was holding on against storm without assistance, as of Jan 30.

Vessel(IMO: 9552068) allided with canal side gate of old S. lock of Kiel Canal, Brunsbuttel during entry manoever, 29 Jan 2022. Vessel had scratches & damage to gate under investigation. Resumed voyage after investigations, 29 Jan.

According to Turkish sources, Captain of vessel died at Tianjin port, China as he was trying to measure ship’s draft using pilot ladder from the shore side of berthed ship, because zero-covid Chinese policy prohibits any physical contacts between crew and shore. Apparently he slipped and fell onto pier but crew were prohibited to assist him. He was found dead by paramedics. MATHILDE OLDENDORFF left Tianjin on Jan 31, bound for Hedland Australia.

Vessel (IMO: 9794513) languishing at the state-owned Ferguson Marine shipyard in Port Glasgow, UK, needed assistance from 2 tugs as it battled to stay in the dock, after breaking its moorings during storm “Malik”, 29 Jan 2022.

Vessel(IMO:7606023) submerged near wharf at Devonport, Australia, 28 Jan 2022. Not repairable. 6 weeks to refloat. 18T of oil, fuel recovered from sunken vessel & sunken tug York Cove. Salvage underway. Declared Constructive Total Loss.

Vessel (IMO:8844244) submerged, PS hull crushed, alongside in Devonport, Australia, 28 Jan 2022. 6 weeks to refloat, 03 Feb. 18T oil, fuel from sunken Campbell Cove & sunken vessel. Salvage underway. Declared Constructive Total Loss.
Vessel (IMO: 8937352) had engine failure at Gabes, Tunisia, 28 Jan 2022. Tug(IMO: 7719686) towing vessel after approval to Tuzla, Turkey for repairs, ETA, 10 Feb.

Vessel collided with two tugs (YORK COVE and WILGA) at Devonport, Tasmania, while maneuvering to berth, on arrival from Melbourne. Both tugs suffered considerable damages with ensuing water ingress. YORK COVE is already partially submerged with her portside hull crushed in midshipsection area.

Thorswind(IMO:9173135) ran aground near Palm Deira, UAE, on 28 Jan 2022. No injuries or damage occurred while refloating. The Emirate’s Maritime authority assisted in refloating and vessel currently moored in position 25 25 34N, 055 03 08E.

Vessel with load of metal scrap caught fire in one of the holds at Southampton, UK. Fire services responded and took control of fire. Vessel is now monitored to make sure fire is completely extinguished.

Loss of jacket water discovered in one of generators of vessel, taken to SSA Fairhaven, New Bedford, USA for examination; emergency dry-dock due to hull crack. In Thames Shipyard, Connecticut as of 03 Sep.

Vessel suffered a total blackout several minutes after unmooring from Shenzhen, China, bound for Manila. The issue couldn’t be fixed in a short time, and according to officials, she had to be taken back to berth. As of morning Feb 1, she was sailing in South China sea after a short stop outside Manila Bay.

Vessel (IMO: 9373541) reported NUC due to leak on rubber joint of main engine cooling water system, in lat 49 33 51N, long 004 14 15W, about 48.5 NM S of Plymouth, UK, 27 Jan 2022. No tugs needed, require 3 hrs for completion of repairs.
Vessel(IMO: 9858527) damaged upon striking fender chains while berthing at the Alliance Grain Terminal in Vancouver Harbour, British Columbia, in pos 49 17.322N, 123 04.797W, 27 Jan 2022.

Fire broke out while passengers were embarking from Samarinda Port for Parepare, South Sulawesi. The vessel was temporarily banned from sailing. Hundreds of passengers were diverted to other ships. It is still not clear what caused the fire. As of today, the vessel still remained at Samarinda.

Alopo (IMO: 9329564) had a technical failure during its Strait passage & dropped anchor at Karanlik liman anch, 26 Jan 2022. Repairs were commenced by the crews & it remains in a stationary position, at the anchorage, as of 26 Jan.

Vessel's Chief Engineer fell overboard in Black sea off Turkish coast, while en route from Gemlik port, Turkey to Temryuk, Russia. The ship was anchored at Bartin anchorage, for SAR and investigation. Rescue boats and helicopter have been deployed.

Vessel loaded with cargo of steel ran aground on northwest Crete island coast in Kissamos Bay, while en route from Iskenderun Turkey to Misrata Libya. Unconfirmed reports suggest the ship broke in two as it couldn't hold against strong winds and bad weather. 10 crew were rescued, 2 of them reportedly had to be hospitalised with hypothermia.

Vessel (IMO 8616336) experienced damage to the port side main engine as informed by the Captain of the vessel, north of Chania, Greece on 25 Jan 2022. Tug escorted provided. Vsl berthed at Piraeus on 26 Jan.

Fuel oil was spilled from vessel during bunkering operations in the seaport of Ust-Luga, Russia. Some of the fuel got onto the deck and leaked overboard. Marine Ecology LLC  was to establish the volumes of fuel collected during the emergency response and the amount of damage would be presented to the shipping agent for compensation. The Greenwing had arrived from the port of Kotka on January 24th and was bound for the port of Sillamäe, but as of 29th January she was still at anchor off Ust-Luga.

Crew member needed emergency treatment after inhaling fumes from a hydrochloric acid leak aboard vessel. Fire engines and hazardous material units were able to respond swiftly and began decontaminating the vessel.

Vessel (IMO: 9753284) boarded by 2 robbers at Guanta anchorage, Venezuela, on 25 Jan 2022. Alarm was raised, crew mustered and robbers escaped with stolen ships properties and stores. Reported to Harbour Master & coast guard. Sailed, 03 Feb

Vessel had a fire on board, shortly before it set sail to Japan carrying the world’s first international shipment of liquefied hydrogen. ATSB investigated a gas pressure control equipment malfunction on board.

Vessel suffered a fire in its engine room while she was about 450nm south-west of Baja California Sur State coast, Mexico. She was en route from Yokohama to Balboa, Panama. The fire was extinguished by the crew but the ship was disabled. Tug Drew Foss (IMO 7626217) sailed from San Diego and took her on tow on December 30th.

Fire broke out in engine room, while vessel was cruising in Black Sea, east of Taman, Russia. Tanker is having about 700 tons of heavy fuel in cargo tanks, but fire is restricted to engine room only. Three tugs and a SAR ship responded and had fire under control.

Vessel (IMO 9102746) disabled due to a main engine scavenge fire, in pos lat 49 20 02N, long 64 02 08W about 31 NM SSE of Port-Menier, Canada on 23 Jan 2022. Repairs completed. No injuries. Vsl resumed voyage the same day.

Vessel developed heavy starboard list caused by water ingress at Salalah Anchorage, Oman after arriving from Tanzania. 21 crew were evacuated by Royal Navy Oman. Condition and status of the ship are unknown.

Vessel (IMO: 9163192) on 23 Jan 2022, it allided with outer jetty while boarding a Pilot in port of Bilbao, Spain. It sustained damage & water ingress. No injury, pollution. Sailed Antwerp after repairs 17 Feb.

Vessel (IMO: 9866926) with a cargo of 2,500 T of polyethylene report engine breakdown, loss of propulsion, 65.3 NM W of Brest, France on 23 Jan 2022; towed by tug Abeille Bourbon to Brest next day. Cargo to be unloaded at Brest.
Reports that several crew members tested positive for coronavirus after a Covid-19 test at Valparaiso, Chile. Vessel and crew forced into 10 days isolation.

Bulker hit the stern of PIERRE RADISSON, an ice breaker that was clearing its way on the St. Lawrence river, near the bridges connecting Quebec City and the south shore. The ice breaker has suffered damages but is not taking on water, and there has been no pollution resulting from the incident. There was no one injured in the accident.

Vessel suffered engine failure in Pentalnd Firth strait, Scotland, while en route from Killeybegs Ireland to Egersund, Norway. She was supposed to be taken on tow by offshore tug but managed to sail on low power to Scrabster Bay and is currently waiting on spare parts to be delivered.
Vessel(IMO 9354454)  notified Portuguese maritime authorities, that during its passage through the Hull tidal locks c/w the quay on 21 Jan 2022. Vessel damaged. Sailed Hull, 21 Jan.

Reports that Ise Mirai allided with berthed vehicles carrier Asaka (IMO 9700201) while leaving the port of Yokkaichi. Some vehicles on the wharf fell into the sea. Both vessels suffered minor stern damage.

Investigations ongoing to determine why the RoRo vessel (ADMIRAL BAY 3) collided with several yachts in the port of Bridgetown, Barbados. She had been on a return leg from Vieux Fort, St Lucia to Bridgetown when incident occured.
Vessel developed heavy list in Kattegat in Danish waters while en route from Copenhagen to Randers. All crew were airlifted to safety. She may have been disabled prior to developing list.

Asterion II (IMO: 8922163) had damage to its starboard main engine in the sea, in lat 40 06 43N, long 019 21 49E, 25 NM NW of Corfu, 20 Jan 2022. Issued with a class maintenance certificate & permitted to sail to Patras. Ar Patras, 21 Jan.

Vessel collided with pier wall while berthing at Wismar, Germany, Baltic sea, on arrival from Kaliningrad Russia. Both the ship and the pier sustained some damages. Strong wind is believed to be the cause of the accident.

Vessel ran aground at Karachi port after its steering mechanism malfunctioned and it veered off course. Three tugs were sent to refloat her. She was freed before noon and berthed at the Karachi International Container Terminal.

Vessel encountered mechanical issue en route from Piraeus to Kavkaz as was about to commence Straits transit. She was anchored to Ahirkapi Anchorage, Istanbul, Marmara sea, and left anchorage under own power few hours later.
Cargo of scrap metal went on fire in cargo hold at Motril port, Mediterranean Spain. Fire services, tugs and SAR ship tackled the fire in approximately one hour. There were no injures reported.

Oil tanker is reportedly the source of the oil spill near the seaside city of Ventanilla, 2km of Peru's central coast. The vessel was rocked by strong winds while unloading crude oil at the La Pampilla refinery.
