A probe has been launched into the event by Peruvian prosecutors as this has led to significant environmental contamination, causing death of birds and ocean microorganisms.
Wilson Hansa (IMO: 9583859), had a defect with injector in main engine 3rd cylinder while anchored abt 5NM W of Portrush, UK, 20 Jan 2022. Sailed after repairs, same day. Ar in Odda, 23 Jan.

Reports that Ise Mirai allided with berthed vehicles carrier Asaka (IMO 9700201) while leaving the port of Yokkaichi. Some vehicles on the wharf fell into the sea. Both vessels suffered minor stern damage.
Unconfirmed incident at Vopak Terminal, Europoort ruptured vessel tank which was loaded with chemical cargo. She has been towed to Gdansk for inspection and repairs.
Vessel experienced blackout and subsequently ran aground at Lunheim embankment, Tromso Norway. She was refloated with Tug assistance, no leaks reported.

Vessel caught fire at Karachi port, after arriving from Novorossiysk, Russia. It was reported that barrels with carbide on cargo deck caught fire, but Karachi Port firefighters responded  and fire was extinguished.

Fatima M. (IMO:7382500) had a technical failure at Novorossiysk, Russia, 18 Jan 2022. Departure permission temporarily cancelled. Repairs underway & state surveyors will attend onboard to verify repair status. Sd from Novorossiysk, 22 Jan.

NS Tera (IMO: 8411566) had mechanical damage, in lat 36 26 50N, long 022 46 47E, NW of Kythira Island, 18 Jan 2022. Fotini Z towed it to the port of Perama for repairs. Departure prohibited until repairs are done. Sailed  13 Feb.

Vessel (IMO: 8611221), en route from Tekirdag, Turkey to Temryuk, Russia in ballast condition had engine failure, loss of control, drifting off Zonguldak, Turkey on 18 Jan 2022. Crew could not repair; towed by tug to Zonguldak, same day.

Vessel contacted the wall of Northern Lock at Brunsbuettel, Kiel Canal. Both ship and wall sustained slight damages. After inspection, she was allowed to resume Canal transit and continued voyage from Eemshaven Netherlands to Liepaja Latvia.

Vessel (IMO: 9160982) en route from Mundra, reported engine defect while entering navigational channel of Port Muhammad Bin Qasim, Pakistan, on 18 Jan 2022. Tugs SL Mukalla (IMO: 9543029) and Kadiro Test assisted and vessel berthed at port.

Vessel (IMO 9292357) lost control after engine failure near Bundal Island, on entering navigational channel of Port Qasim, Pakistan, on 18 Jan 2022. Arrived FOTCO oil terminal for discharge on 19 Jan. Earlier reports of grounding incorrect.
Vessel allided with a jetty in Antwerp, Belgium. She was damaged and needed emergency repair work. She was manouvred to berth in the Delwaide Dock at the Mexico Natie Logistics Jetty.

Stornoway authorities were alerted of a deceased person onboard vessel. Cause of death unknown and investigations are ongoing. Vessel was forced to divert to a UK port as part of normal procedure to register the death.

Crew alerted the Chinese Coast Guard of water ingress into the engine room. This prompted SAR operation to get all crew onboard to safety. Power was restored onboard vessel and she was towed to Penglai awaiting repairs.

Vessel suffered steering failure and started to drift 40 nm north of Lofoten, Norway, Norwegian sea while en route from Riga Latvia to Murmansk, Russia. Patrol ship NOCGV HARSTAD (IMO 9312107) responded and took disabled ship soon but she will soon be replaced with tug BORG PARAT.

Vessel suffered engine failure shortly after passing Sultan Selim Bridge, while transiting the Straits. She was en route from Turkey to Romania Black sea. Traffic Control Center responded by sending tug and service boats which towed her back to Buyukdere Anchorage, Bosphorus.

Cargo ship was towed to Yalova, north western Turkey, on February 8th having suffered an engine failure in the Alboran Sea on January 16th. A detailed damage survey was carried out by a class surveyor, together with the owner’s superintendent and shipyard duty engineers. A detailed permanent repairs plan was issued by the classification society and commenced by shore based technical teams. The vessel remained stationary at Yalova as of February 15th.
Vessel detained by the Libyan Patrol Force for breaching the 'No Sail Zone' while enroute from Suez to Misurata.

Gaschem Pacific (IMO 9402574) was NUC & needed to change engine's position sensor on exhaust valve No.6, in lat 52 38 12N, long 002 51 55E, 41 NM E of Great Yarmouth, 16 Jan 2022. Sailed after repairs, 16 Jan. Ar in Stenungsund, 18 Jan.
Reports that vessel hit underwater object causing hull breach and ingress. Her hull was also badly damaged. Vietnam authorities reported to have ordered vessel to be grounded to avoid sinking.
Vessel was caught in strong winds forcing it to drag anchor and drift towards shore. She later regained control although unconfirmed reports is that she grounded.

Barge(IMO: 8200216) borke its mooring ropes & collided with the bow of tanker(IMO: 8913708) due to high winds at Liepaja Port, Lativa on 14 Jan 2022. Tanker sailed to Lindoe Shipyard Fayard for repairs on 17 Jan. Sailed to Gdansk, 19 Jan.

Mermerdelen (IMO: 9006265) had maneuvering problems in Brake port, Germany, 14 Jan 2022, causing the gyrocompass to fail. Excess cargo of animal feed caused Vsl banned sailing to Egypt, 15 Jan. Sd from Brake, 21 Jan.
KENNICOTT allided with HUBBARD (new build ferry) while docking at Ketchikan, Alaska. Both vessels damaged with more severity for the KENNICOTT. The USCG will be investigating the cause of accident.
Some crew members tested positive with Covid-19 and forced to isolate. Among those infected were some with severe symptoms but no further details from vessel manager.

Draftdodger (IMO: 9746102) was NUC due to a defect with the gasket & head cylinder on main engine, in lat 50 05 28N, long 002 19 43W, at the entrance to SW bound lane of Casquets TSS, 14 Jan 2022. Expected to complete repairs by 0900 UTC.

Vessel (IMO: 9798167) had main engine blackout & was NUC in lat 49 34 04N, long 004 08 41W, approx 38 NM S of Eddystone lighthouse, UK, 14 Jan 2022. Engine restarted. Completed repair by 1 hr & underway. Ar in Rostock, Germany, 17 Jan.
KENNICOTT allided with HUBBARD (new build ferry) while docking at Ketchikan, Alaska. Both vessels damaged with more severity for the KENNICOTT. The USCG will be investigating the cause of accident.
Ship ran aground in Volga-Caspian Sea Channel, Caspian sea while en route from Iran to Astrakhan, Volga, Russia. Status of vessel is unclear. Awaiting updates from Russian emergency services.

Vessel (IMO: 9249831) report engine failure, disabled, went adrift shortly after entering Kiel Canal in Kiel-Holtenau on 13 Jan 2022. Tug Stein and support Scharhorn towed vessel to Voith Quay in Kiel. Sail Kiel on 06 Feb for Brunsbuttel.
Vessel drifted aground after being disabled due to a blackout in Kristiansund waters, Norway. She was refloated and berthed at Kristiansund. No leaks were reported.
Vessel collided with pier while leaving Helsinki on scheduled trip to Stockholm due to blackout. Both pier and ship’s bow stern sustained some damages. Ship will resume trip after inspection.
Due to strong winds, the HORIZON 9 contacted ASIAN FLOWER while departing from Kinuura port, Japan. The ASIAN FLOWER was badly damaged and would require extensive repairs before leaving the port.

Update: Vessel has been grounded in one of Poland’s main waterways for more than 3 weeks, most probably due to political tensions between Poland and Russia. Vessel with cargo of steel ran aground in Szczecin fairway in Szczecin Bay while approaching port of destination Szczecin, from St. Petersburg. Tug and CG boat reported to be at her side.

Federal Sable (IMO: 9595888), was disabled, due to its main seawater system being blocked by ice which caused its main engine to overheat in the St. Lawrence River, off St Nicolas, Canada, 12 Jan 2022. Sd from Quebec, 16 Jan.

Ship is out of schedule for an unknown period as one crew member got positive antigen test on arrival from Callao Peru. The vessel was diverted from San Antonio Chile, to Valparaiso Chile where it was anchored. All crew awaiting PCR tests results.

Vessel ran aground off Risoya islet, south of Maloy, Norway, while en route from Honningsvag to Flam in Sognefjord, Norway, in stormy weather. The ship suffered hull breach, with controllable water ingress and was berthed at Maloy, where necessary repairs will be carried out.
Due to strong winds, the HORIZON 9 contacted ASIAN FLOWER while departing from Kinuura port, Japan. The ASIAN FLOWER was badly damaged and would require extensive repairs before leaving the port.

Vessel caught fire near Belitung Island, Bangka Belitung. All crew members and passengers abandoned ship and were rescued by the Samudera Jaya Abadi. She was carrying 18 trucks and two minibuses when the incident happened. The fire is thought to have originated from a vehicle onboard the ship.
Strong winds forced vessel to collide with a tug boat while she was approaching berth at Obama Port, Japan.
Reports of fire outbreak in the engine room while vessel was en route Napoli to Cagliari with passengers and vehicles onboard. Rescue ops underway as vessel is drifting dangerously.
Malaysian Maritime Enforcement Agency detained vessel in Perak waters for allegedly anchoring without permission near Jarak Island. She will remain in detention until investigation concludes.
Vessel sustained propulsion damage 100 kilometers west of Brest, on 11 Jan 2022. Tug Abeille Bourbon towed vessel & moored it near port of Brest, France, same day.

Reports that vessel caused a spill of lubricating oil in the port of Valencia. It first spilled on ship's deck and then into the water. Anti-pollution barriers and absorbent sheets have contained the liquids between the ship and the dock. No major disaster declared.

Vessel was taken on tow and towed to Brest, after losing propulsion in Bay of Biscay 45 nm west of Brest. According to track, she encountered mechanical issue or issues prior to being disabled. She was en route from Rotterdam to Bayonne, Bay of Biscay, France.
5 crew members tested positive with Covid-19 and ordered into quarrantine. Vessel also restricted within pilot station until crew change can be effected.
Vessel was arrested in Chittagong while discharging her cargo. It was as a result of a local High Court order. She was moved to Chittagong anchorage and would remain there until dispute is resolved.

Vessel's anchor chain entangled with the chain of another ship, on Jan 8 or 9, in Yangtze estuary between Chongming island and Taicang. Floating crane and tugs responded, trying to disengage chains and free the ships. China's strict restrictions on pilots activities in a number of ports have led to ships having to anchor in space-restricted anchorages, in dangerously close proximity to each other.

Vessel suffered engine failure while transiting Bosphorus in northern direction. Istanbul Traffic Control tug and boat responded, the ship was taken to Buyukdere Anchorage and brought to anchor. Vessel completed transit and was already sailing in Black sea. She’s en route from Ceuta to Zonguldak, Turkey, Black sea.
Vessel experienced restricted manoeuvrability after it's anchor malfunctioned. She was enroute from Fawley to Rotterdam at the time of incident.

Vessel detained by the Malaysian Maritime Enforcement Agency for allegedly anchoring without permission about 31nm southeast of Jarak Island in Perak. She was later released but no confirmation on whether a fine was issued.

Vessel sank off Port of Aviles, Spain. Pilot vessel rescued crew. Helimer 206 helicopter, FVs assisted, MRRC Gijon coordinated. Crane ship Lateromar to refloat vessel. Salvage postponed due to weather as of 29 Aug.

Karla C. (IMO 9558012) notified (GAMA) about leak in its hull which occurred during change of quay in Port of Antwerp, Belgium on 07 Jan 2022. Sailed after repairs on 09 Jan & arrived in Seville on 15 Jan.

Vessel lost more than 30 containers in North Atlantic while en route from Singapore to New York via Suez. As of Jan 11, MADRID BRIDGE was proceeding at reduced speed in western direction after a long log in southern direction in order to escape rough weather and to avoid further losses.

SHUN SHIN said to have collided with 60-ton fishing vessel some 50 nm south of southern Jeju island, Korea, according to Korean CG. All 8 crew of fishing vessel were rescued, while vessel is still afloat with heavy fore tilt, stern raised above waterline. Fishing vessel identity not yet disclosed.
Vessel ran aground on a rocky embankment in Kamafuli river in river mouth area, Chittagong, Bangladesh. She will be refloated with high tide and tug assistance, no leaks reported so far.

Vessel sank off Saumlaki Harbor, Indonesia, after arriving from Surabaya. Bad weather conditions forced her to be temporarily disabled, she developed a list, and sank at 30-meter depth. 15 crew had to jump into water and swim to the shore, all reached the shore, all are safe.

GNV BRIDGE broke off her moorings in strong wind in Valencia Spain. She drifted across harbor and collided with berthed container ship SEASPAN SAIGON. Both ships understood to sustain some damages but nothing more serious than dents and scratches.
Reports of fire outbreak in generator compartment while vessel berthed at Le Havre after arriving from Portsmouth. 34 firefighters responded and extinguished the fire, no injures reported.

GNV BRIDGE broke off her moorings in strong wind in Valencia Spain. She drifted across harbor and collided with berthed container ship SEASPAN SAIGON. Both ships understood to sustain some damages but nothing more serious than dents and scratches.
Vessel allided with a sheet pile at Jalan Ahmad Yani on approach with a cargo of cement. Significant damage was reported when the vessel hit an embankment.
Explosion on vessel while moored for maintenance at Kooiman Hoebee shipyard on Merwedeweg in Dordrecht, Netherlands. One man died, another man seriously injured. Police investigating. Sail on 15 Aug.
Reports from Russian Coast Guard confirm that vessel got stuck in ice while sailing the Okhotsk sea. Rescue operations for the crew still ongoing as of PM Jan 4th 2022.

Vessel collided with Chinese fishing vessel in East China sea, near Wenzhou, China, while en route from Tieshan to Lanshan. Fishing vessel sank with all 5 crew declared missing, SAR under way as of Jan 5th 2022.
Crew member tested positive with Covid-19 after vessel arrived San Antonia, Chile. The remaining crew placed under quarantine while cargo operations halted.

03-Jan-2022 : Vessel experienced engine fault while sailing off the port of Skopelos with 35 passengers onboard. They all safely disembarked at port while vessel was banned from sailing until repairs and inspections are conducted. 20-Oct-2021 : Reports of damage discovered on the port side shaft during cleaning works while the ship was moored inside the commercial port of Volos. It was banned from sailing until the repair of the damage and the presentation of a certificate of class maintenance by the monitoring classification society.

Duty officer of vessel(IMO 9330795) sighted 3 perpetrators OB in pos 22 46 47N, 70 03 40E, Kandla Anch., India, 03 Jan 2022. Perpetrators escaped & 40 vessel’s properties found missing. ICGS C-152 deployed to investigate, 04 Jan.

Heenvliet (IMO: 9536076) reported NUC due to an engine failure suspected issue with injector pump, in lat 49 59 42N, long 002 57 27W, in Casquets TSS, 03 Jan 2022. Repairs were completed by the crews & it was underway.

WINPOSH RAMPART broke off towing line, in eastern Gulf of Siam, and drifted towards Telok A oil rig at Telok gas/oil field in Malaysian waters. She was under tow of  LIMIN ROSMINA and en route from Matak Indonesia to China for repairs. Malaysian Maritime agencies are on standby, ready to respond if necessary.  Lastest reports that LIMIN ROSMINA will take breakaway ship back on tow.

WINPOSH RAMPART broke off towing line, in eastern Gulf of Siam, and drifted towards Telok A oil rig at Telok gas/oil field in Malaysian waters. She was under tow of  LIMIN ROSMINA and en route from Matak Indonesia to China for repairs. Malaysian Maritime agencies are on standby, ready to respond if necessary.  Lastest reports that LIMIN ROSMINA will take breakaway ship back on tow.

Vessel encountered rough weather causing some of the containers onboard to shift. Attempts by the Bosun to restack the lose containers turned out to be fatal. He was declared dead shortly after being hit by a falling container.
Vessel had to be towed to Victoria anchorage, BC Canada after drifting while NUC. A fault with the fuel system is reported to be the cause.
Vessel disabled due to undisclosed mechanical fault while on ballast leg from Iskenderun, Turkey to Tuzla. She was towed for the remainder of the voyage.

Bosun of Maple (IMO: 9811543) squeezed between deck and shore mobile crane during wood chip loading at Keystone terminal Jacksonville, USA, on 02 Jan 2022. Despite medical assistance, Bosun died. Vessel sailed to Turkey on 16 Jan.
Vessel had engine failure at Drapetzona, Greece. Tug Christos XL appointed to tow vessel from place of incident to shipyard at Yalova, Turkey. Towage operation commenced on 31 Aug. ETA, 17 Sep.

Vessel (IMO: 9000168)  experienced technical failure at Ambelaki, Greece, on 01 Jan 2022. Tug (IMO 7400936) towed vessel to Yalova shipyard for repairs on 16 Mar. Damage survey done. Permanent repairs underway at Yalova as of 03 Apr.

Reports that SAAM Humber was in collision with the SAAM Mississippi while assisting a container vessel at the Fairview Container Terminal, Prince Rupert. Both vessels sustained major damage but no injuries or  pollution was reported.

Reports that SAAM Humber was in collision with the SAAM Mississippi while assisting a container vessel at the Fairview Container Terminal, Prince Rupert. Both vessels sustained major damage but no injuries or  pollution was reported.
Vessel had engine failure at Douala, Cameroon, crew could not repair. Sold to Turkey-based new owners. Tug Amber II appointed to tow vessel on 26 May to Tuzla shipyard area, ETA 14 Jul.
Vessel had mechanical problems and was disabled 40 miles from Valletta, on 01 Jan 2022. Tug Spinola towed it to Grand Harbour, Malta Dockyard, Valletta, on 05 Jan. Remains stationary, as of 11 Jan.
Vessel declared an environmental hazard as it remains beached at Veracruz, Gulf of Mexico since Nov 2020.
Vessel reported minor fire in engine room, 210 NM East of Hopen in Barents Sea. Vessel was berthed in Tromsoe for repairs. She left the port on 25 February 2023 and proceeded to jetty.

Vessel ran aground on Sunda Strait, Indonesia shortly after leaving Bakauheni port Sumatra. There were 342 passengers and 97 cars on board. Strong wind reported as a cause. At least 2 tugs assisting her as of noon Dec 30th. All passengers remain on board and no hull breaches reported so far.
Vessel crew member (Cook) died of Covid after all crew members tested positive of Covid-19
Vessel suffered engine failure while in transit at the Bosphorus, bound for Constanta Romania. She was towed back to Marmara sea and anchored for inspection and repairs at Ahirkapi Anchorage.

Reports that GNV SEALAND broke off mooring line during unmooring maneuver at Ibiza port, Balearic island, and collided with VOLCAN DE TIJARAFE. Both ships suffered slight damages but left Ibiza in accordance with their schedules later same day. Strong winds believed to be the main cause of the accident.

Reports that GNV SEALAND broke off mooring line during unmooring maneuver at Ibiza port, Balearic island, and collided with VOLCAN DE TIJARAFE. Both ships suffered slight damages but left Ibiza in accordance with their schedules later same day. Strong winds believed to be the main cause of the accident.

Vessel disabled due to mechanical damage in sea area, about 13 NM SE of Rhodes, Greece. Tug Ocean Ergun towed her to Tuzla, entered shipyard 07 Feb. Repairs ongoing, it remains stationary as of 28 Aug.
Vessel suffered engine failure on Dec 12th and drifted for one week before being towed to Hamilton, Bermuda. Planned repairs to be carried out at berth.

Five crew members aboard were sent to hospital in Sydney, Nova Scotia, Canada after suffering injuries from an explosion on the ship. Two crew members suffered minor burns to their faces and hands, while three others sustained superficial injuries. The incident was caused by methane igniting in a carpenter’s workshop while the ship was at anchor.

Reports that Hai Feng Hai Kou allided with the berthed container ship Bohai Star (IMO - 9224362) during manoeuvre while the former was leaving the port of Kobe. The extent of damage to the vessels was unclear, but both ships were able to depart Kobe the same day.

Reports that Hai Feng Hai Kou allided with the berthed container ship Bohai Star (IMO - 9224362) during manoeuvre while the former was leaving the port of Kobe. The extent of damage to the vessels was unclear, but both ships were able to depart Kobe the same day.
Vessel made contact with pier while berthing at Taichung Port, Taiwan, on arrival from Taiwan. Her bow was damaged. Some 5-7 meters of pier were also damaged.
Vessel came in contact with Raputra in waters off Merak in Cilegon City, Indonesia. Both vessels were anchored but strong wind and huge waves caused incident. Sailed 28 Dec.
Vessel was disabled shortly after leaving Aveiro, Portugal. Tug EEMS WRESTLER was dispatached, towing her to Villagarcia, Spain where she could be inspected and repaired.
Vessel was disabled after reports of water ingress in engine room. Crew abandoned ship and were all rescued. She difted while NUC and rough weather prevented towing operation.

TROPIC BREEZE in collision with mega yacht UTOPIA IV near New Providence island, Bahamas, while en route to Great Stirrup Cay. Tanker sank, crew rescued, all are safe. Yacht returned back to New Providence after collision, understood she sustained some damages.
Vessel propulsion failed while sailing on the Portuguese coast enroute from Piraeus, Greece to Rotterdam. She was disabled and adrift for a few hours before resuming sailing on own power.

TROPIC BREEZE in collision with mega yacht UTOPIA IV near New Providence island, Bahamas, while en route to Great Stirrup Cay. Tanker sank, crew rescued, all are safe. Yacht returned back to New Providence after collision, understood she sustained some damages
Crew reported fire outbreak onboard vessel to MRCC (Norway). It started in the engine room according to early reports. She was disbled and required assistance to port Sandnessjoen.

Reports that AMADEUS AQUAMARIJN collided with Belgian trawler FV Z60 BLUE ANGEL near Frisian islands, North sea. Both ships were sailing in same SW direction before the collision. AMADEUS AQUAMARIJN sustained major damages.

Reports that AMADEUS AQUAMARIJN collided with Belgian trawler FV Z60 BLUE ANGEL near Frisian islands, North sea. Both ships were sailing in same SW direction before the collision. AMADEUS AQUAMARIJN sustained major damages.
Man overboard after Surveyor fell off while descending from vessel. He had been working onboard to survey the cargo when incident occured. Although transported to the hospital, he was declared dead.
Vessel ran aground at Noshiro Port basin, northwest Honshu on approach. She was refloated same day, no damages, no leaks reported.

Reports that vessel encountered mechanical problem while transiting Bosphorus in southern direction, en route from Sulina Romania to Sevilla Spain, with cargo of sunflower oil. She had to anchor in emergency in traffic lane blocking traffic for about an hour and a half. She was briefly disabled then resumed moving under own power. She is now anchored at Atakoy anchorage for inspection.
While enroute from Istanbul to Algeciras, her engine developed a fault. Vessel was disabled and adrift while awaiting towing tug.

Vessel became disabled while it was en route from Nacala Mozambique to the AG. Cause of the problem unknown, but on December 31st she was taken on tow by offshore tug Teja (IMO 9274783), to be towed to Colombo with an ETA of January 11th.
Vessel ran aground on approach to berth at Ust-Luga port, Russia. She had arrived to discharge fertilizer cargo from Estonia when incident occured.
Reports from vessel operator (Royal Caribbean) confirmed that 48 passengers onboard had tested positive for Covid-19. Most of the affected had mild symptoms.

Incident report statement from vessel operator, Ocean Network Express (ONE) reads as follows; “…MV MOL EMISSARY, serving in our Trans-Atlantic 5 (AL5) Service, experienced rudder issues while awaiting to berth at Los Angeles. The vessel is currently assisted by the tugboat to move into inner anchorage in Los Angeles for further inspection before her berthing. All reefer units onboard are working and are being monitored regularly.”

Vessel laden with fuel oil collided with underwater wreck in Mongla port area, Bangladesh. Her ballast tank was breached with ensuing water ingress. No leaks reported, cargo is to be transferred to another tanker as soon as possible.

Vessel detained at the Mombasa Container Terminal on the orders of the Kenya health Authority. Reason given that she had suspected radioactive leak. Authorities to  inspect the cargo onboard. Incident occurred after vessel arrived from Salalah on December 12th.

Vessel fined in Gebze, Turkey. The pollution penalty was imposed by the local municipality environmental pollution prevention department because of an alleged breach of local regulations. She was found guilty of pollution because of hydraulic oil leaks, and was fined $201,500. Permission to depart was cancelled by the Harbour Master until the payment of the fine together with the cleaning expenses.
MARY QUEEN OF HOPE + JAKE VINCENT DOS + landing craft LCT CITIC 102 grounded by typhoon RAI on the Negros Island, Philippines. No spill reported.
MARY QUEEN OF HOPE + JAKE VINCENT DOS + landing craft LCT CITIC 102 grounded by typhoon RAI on the Negros Island, Philippines. No spill reported.
Vessel denied permission to make scheduled call at St. Lucia after it emerged that some crew members had tested positive for Covid-19.
Vessel ran aground on the coast of Stakks Fjord, east of Keflavik, isouthwest Iceland. Icelandic patrol/SAR ship FREYJA responded, assisting MASILIK in refloating.

Vessel suffered engine failure while transiting Bosphorus, en route from Constanta Romania to Izmit Turkey, and was emergency anchored, in traffic lane. Traffic was blocked temporarily for other vessls on the same route.
Vessel (IMO: 9114543) at Tripoli, Libya, due to technical failure, since, 15 Dec 2021. Repairs could not be carried out by crew. Towed to Syros, Greece on 27 Jan.

Vessel reported ammonia leak in engine room near Bjornoya, Norway; Norwegian CG deployed patrol boat Barentshav to assist on 15 Dec 2021. Some crew evacuated to Bjornoya. Vessel berthed in Aalesund 19 Dec.
Vessel made bottom contact off Ervik near Raudeberg, 15 Dec. NSSR-lifeboat Bergen Kreds escorted to Battbygg AS for investigation, 15 Dec. Sailed Raudeberg on 09 Mar 2022.
Reports of fire outbreak on vessel deck which spread quickly to the bridge causing severe damage. Crew ordered to abandon ship and have all been accounted for. No passengers were onboard.

Vessel lost stability early in the morning northeast of Van Phong Bay, central Vietnam south, and developed heavy portside list. This was caused by cargo shift. Order to abandon ship was given by Captain.
HENG YU collided with a 129-ton fishing vessel some 50 nm southwest of Yeosu, Korea. Reports that the fishing vessel sank. Of 27 people on board 25 were rescued, 2 remain missing, SAR underway.

UPDATE: On 10 January the forward section of the wrecked vessel left Sri Lankan waters aboard heavy load carrier GPO Amethyst, headed for a certified decommissioning facility in Indonesia for dismantling, recycling, and disposal. Update: Vessel wreck to be removed. Salvage operations to begin in the coming weeks. 20-May-2021 : A fire erupted on the 2,743 teu X-Press Pearl yesterday afternoon off Colombo. The ship, which was carrying around 25 tons of nitric acid among is cargoes, radioed for help and the Sri Lankan navy dispatched a number of vessels to douse the severe blaze at an anchorage 9.5 nautical miles from Colombo port.

Reports that fire broke out in the accommodation area while welding work was taking place. The vessel was moored at the Diomidov fish port in Vladivostok at the time. Four crew members were injured and taken to a health care facility for treatment.

Vessel began listing dangerously after noticeable leak from the cargo holds. She was enroute from Batam, Indonesia to Jakarta with general cargo items. She anchored off Batu Betumpang for inspections and possible repairs.

Investigations ongoing after the SCOT CARRIER collided with the KARIN HOEJ. Swedish Maritime Coastguard received distress call from vessel crew and launched rescue operation. KARIN HOEJ capsized with at least two persons still missing.
Vessel sailing to Puerto Eden when crew raised fire alarm. She was disable and towed to port for inspection and repairs.
Vessel detained on local court order at Chittagong. Details of the dispute not yet published.

Vessel suffered engine failure while sailing south of Las Palmas, Canary islands. She was towed to Las Palmas by Spanish SAR ship MIGUEL DE CERVANTES and berthed in port in the morning Dec 12. No further details at this time.

Investigations ongoing after the SCOT CARRIER collided with the KARIN HOEJ. Swedish Maritime Coastguard received distress call from vessel crew and launched rescue operation. KARIN HOEJ capsized with at least two persons still missing.

11-Dec-21 : Vessel disabled after its engine failed while enroute via the Gulf of Siam. She was on a voyage from Singapore to Laem Chabang, Thailand.05-Jul-21 : Reports that the vessel ran aground off the coast of Vietnam but later refloated itself and adrift.
Vessel had to be towed by tug boat to Victoria anchorage after it encountered undisclosed mechanical fault. She was on a voyage from China to Vancouver Canada when incident occured.

Zheng Run (IMO: 9593816), had engine issues, in lat 49 17 38N, long 123 12 47W, upon departing Anch no.5 in English Bay, British Columbia, Canada, 11 Dec 2021. Re-anchored for crews to conduct repairs. Ar in Vancouver, Canada, 12 Dec.
While vessel was undergoing decomissioning, it's mooring line snapped causing vessel to lose balance. 3 crew workers since declared dead.
Ferry ran aground in Gythio port harbor, Greece, on arrival from Kythera. There were 30 passengers on board at the time of incident but no casualties.
Vessel experienced engine failure and was disabled while transitting the Kiel Canal. She  was then taken under tow by tugs to Brunsbuttel, and moored for investigation and repairs to follow.
Fire outbreak onboard the luxury yachts which were being transported on deck from Kaohsiung, Taiwan to the USA.

Alcmene (IMO: 9568586) had a machinery failure, in lat 49 18 02N, long 123 04 05W, while arriving Anch B in Vancouver Harbour, Canada, 10 Dec 2021. Tug assisted it to the anch, where crews conducted repairs. Sd from Vancouver, 12 Dec.
Sketchy reports of vessel grounding at Gadani. She was being considered as a potential scrap candidate recently.
Captain was murdered by another crew man while he was at the bridge. Motive for the attack remains unknown but reports suggest the crew man may have been drinking too much alcohol.
A number of containers tipped overboard after vessel ran into heavy storms on leaving Alexandria Egypt.
A crew member had to be medevaced after worsening health conditions onboard. Vessel had to anchor at Kalamata from where the patient was transported in a helicopter to the hospital.

Vessel collided with dredger and in contact with pier while maneuvering to berth at Shahid Rajaei port, Bandar Abbas, Iran. She was arriving from Kandla India. Her bulbous bow severely damaged and a breach in bow stern above waterline reported.
Fire broke out on deck area of vessel while it was at berth in Houston. Firefighting tugs seen nearby but no further details as of Dec 9.
Vessel lost power and declared NUC after it ran into Storm Barra. She was later towed to St. Helier's Victoria Pier for inspection and repairs.
Unconfirmed reports with exact dates but vessel is said to have grounded in the Aegean sea while maneuvering away from the Turkish coast.

Vessel suffered engine failure near  Dardanelles while en route from Novorossiysk Russia to Djibouti. Straits Traffic Control Center immediately responded by sending assistance tugs. FORTUNE TRADER was taken under control and towed back to Marmara sea and anchored at Sevketiye Anchorage.

Vessel suffered engine failure and became disabled in the Irish sea some 15 nm north of Holyhead, Wales while en route to Liverpool. She anchored in the afternoon of the same day, waiting for a tug, to be towed to Liverpool.
Vessel detained by the Nigerian Navy for alleged theft of crude oil in Bayelsa State. She was laden with 603 MT of crude oil at the time of arrest.

Vessel grounded close to Kholmsk port, Russia, shortly after she heaved anchor and tried to sail further out to sea to wait out heavy storms. She arrived at Kholmsk anchorage on Dec 4 from Japan. No oil leak spotted or reported.

Vessel sank in Chittagong Port area, due to water ingress. She struck bottom or underwater object according to early reports. EXPRESS 54 was deployed in supporting dredging works, carried out as part of Payra deepwater Port Project. 12 crew were rescued and transferred to Payra.
Cruise ship operator had confirmed that at least 17 passengers onboard tested positive for Covid 19. Vessel was docked in New Orleans when the tests were carried out.
Vessel contacted pier at Sassnitz, Ruegen island, Germany, while proceeding to berth. She suffered a crack in the hull among other damages, pier was also damaged.
Vessel ran aground in St. Lawrence river, Canada, while proceeding downstream. She was refloated and proceeded to Quebec. No damages or leakage reported.

Vessel almost grounded in Gdansk waters. Reports emerged that the Captain and two other officers were under the influence of alcohol. It was en route from Klaipeda to Gdansk, when spotted recklessly heading straight for the coastline, alerting Polish traffic control authorities.

Major fire outbreak on vessel's timber cargo while it was sat at anchorage in Gothenburg, Sweden. As of December 6th, reports that the fire is now contained although emergency services still working to keep the vessel and crew safe.

Vessel ran aground in NW part of Caspian Sea on 04 Dec 2021, refloated on 08 Dec morning. No damage to hull, no leak of fuels, lubricants. Tug OT-2080 towing vessel from Astrakhan to Bautino as of 09 Dec.
Vessel reported as NUC after main engine scavenging fire resulted in damage to piston, 40 NM SW of Prawle Point, UK, 04 Dec 2021. Repairs completed. Vsl resumed voyage on 05 Dec 2021.
Vessel ran aground on approach to Hekinan Port, Japan from Katsunan. A nearby tug was spotted trying to assist her shortly after.
Four crew members missing after vessel sank shortly after running into heavy currents. 3 others were rescued by fishing boats and 1 confirmed dead as of Dec 8.

The vessel had a fire broke out on board off the Kimberley coast, Australia, 02 Dec 2021, which caused the production at the $24 billion giant to be shut down & left the crew members using backup power.

Vessel suffered fire in engine room while leaving Cilacap port, Indonesia on laden voyage. Tugs and firefight teams were deployed, of the 26 crew, 21 were evacuated by 1000 WIB, 5 remain on board to assist in firefighting.
Vessel ran aground in Greek waters near the port of Ikonio. 22 crew members on board while it was en route from Piraeus to Novorossyisk. No leaks or pollution reported.
Vessel abandoned by crew and left to capsize in the South China sea. She was en route from Malaysia to Taiwan when she encountered heavy storm and cargo shift.

Vessel had issue with turbo charger, in lat 50 03 33N, long 003 30 00W, abt S of Rame Head, 01 Dec 2021. It is making its way to the Plymouth to effect repairs to turbo charger using its engines. Anchored at Falmouth, 01 Dec. SAR completed.

Vessel (KAVARATTI) suffered fire in engine room at around noon LT Dec 1 in Laccadive sea, off southwest India, while en route from Kavaratti island to Lakshadweep, with 322 passengers on board. Fire has been  extinguished, but vessel is disabled, adrift some 30 nm NE of Kavaratti, waiting for assistance. Coast Guard already dispatched a support tug.

Vessel upon entering the northern lock of the Kiel Canal in Kiel-Holtenau, c/w the gate in stormy weather conditions, 01 Dec 2021. Heaved anchor to resume its voyage through the waterway with an ETA as of 18 Dec.

Tug CHANDRA NEPTUNE with barge JACOB on tow reportedly disabled and adrift in the Arabian sea, while en route from Mumbai to Mundra. Latest AIS report, Dec 2, tug under way at some 5 knots speed probably assisted by tug.
Man overboard before vessel issued distress signal prompting SAR operation. 17 of the crewmembers have been rescued from deployed lifeboats.

Vessel allided with middle wall of Northern lock, Kiel canal, Brunsbuttel, 01 Dec 2021. Anchored off Elbe Port, in pos 53 53.28N, 09 08.83E. Vsl berthed at Athabasca Quay, Hamburg on 01 Dec. Investigations underway.
Vessel was beached by storm in Unten Port area, Japan, East China sea. It was approaching Unten port at the time of  accident. Reports of damage to fish farm cages and fishing boats in the area.
Man overboard. While vessel lost control in rough weather conditions and drifted, a crew man lost balance and fell off. SAR performed by divers. No further info.

Five stowaways onboard vessel were arrested by the Nigerian Navy while it was sat at Lagos anchorage. The suspects gained access onboard but were caught by the crew and handed over to the patrol team during a routine harbour patrol.
Sank at Maltepe, Istanbul S.O.M after grounding due to heavy storm weather conditions.
UMUT, UMIT K, & BORAS all battered by heavy storm weather at the Marmara Sea, Istanbul. All 3 vessels broke off their moorings and drifted dangerously out of position.

Voyage from Colombia-USA to Busan, South Korea was interrupted after several crew members became seriously ill and in need of medical attention. 3 of them had to be medevaced while 5 tested positive for Covid-19.
Vessel broke off moorings and drifted before crashing into pier, at Ambarli port, in strong wind. She is understood to remain stuck in pier as of Nov 30th.

A passenger was medevaced while vessel was sailing south of Madeira. The passenger was complaining of severe abdominal pain. The Portuguese Navy coordinated the rescue operation. Passenger was taken to the Dr Nélio Mendonça hospital, where she was admitted to the Emergency Service.

Vessel at Aliaga, Turkey, since 20 Nov 2021, due to technical failure, undertow, berthed at Yalova, 18 Dec 2021. A new set of spare parts were provided by the owners & repairs are being carried out in the Yalova shipyard, 14 Feb 2022.

ENTEBE EXPRESS with 81 passengers and 18 crew on board was beached by storm at Mamuju Regency coast, South Sulawesi, Makassar Strait, shortly after leaving Mamuju port, bound for Balikpapan, Kalimantan. All passengers and crew abandoned ferry and made shore by own means – life rafts.
Vessel ran onto breakwater in Hakata harbor, Japan sea, while bound for Kobe.

A crew member sustained injury while on duty requiring a medevac operation. The Isidoris F was deployed from the port of Chios to medevac the victim firstly transporting him to the port, from where he was picked up by an ambulance and taken to the General Hospital for treatment.
Reports that propeller was damaged after it got entangled with the fishing gear. Divers were sent in to assist.
Vessel allided with a conveyor spout of the shore loading facility at Shuaiba port, Kuwait, during berthing operations, while en route from Abu Dhabi. She suffered some hull damage.
Vessel suffered engine failure in the English Channel, while en route from Rouen France to Las Palmas, Canary islands. She is being towed to Le Harve for further inspections and repairs.

Reports that fire broke out in the engine roomwhile at Torgem Shipyard, Tuzla, Turkey. She was berthed there for repair and maintenance. The fire was brought under control by the fire brigade of the yard.
Vessel reported mechanical fault at Reykjavik Iceland. She was towed to Akureyri Eyjafjorour Fjord northern Iceland for repairs.

Vessel disabled due to fire in engine room in pos 37 22 43N, 012 32 17E, Italy, 26 Nov 2021.Tug Megrez towed it to Messina inner port & arrived on 19 Jan, 2022. Repairs underway. Sailed Messina, 22 Mar.
ATLANTIC GRACE and bulk carrier AVIATOR collided in the Gulf of Kutch, western India, while proceeding in opposite directions. Efforts to decouple vessels were underway few hours later.
Vessel was disabled in the English Channel, while en route from Southampton (UK) to Antwerp. It resumed sailing 3 hours later although reasons for incident not yet known.

ATLANTIC GRACE and bulk carrier AVIATOR collided in the Gulf of Kutch, western India, while proceeding in opposite directions. Efforts to decouple vessels were underway few hours later. *** December 4th update, both vessels have now been decoupled***

Vessel momentarily lost steering near the Blue Water Bridge, USA on 25 Nov 2021. According to U.S. Coast Guard Lt. Jeremiah Schiessel, issue was fixed very soon after it was reported. The ship did not run aground, Schiessel said.

Vessel reported container loss to regional operational center CROSS Corsen, France, while en route from Dunkirk to Bilbao, Spain. 7 empty containers fell overboard. All ships in the vicinity have been issued with warning to approach with caution. It is understood rough weather is the main cause of an accident.
Vessel boarded by perpetrators in position lat 01 15 27.0N, long 104 12 10.2E, Singapore Strait, on 24 Nov 2021. Stores stolen.

Vessel diverted to Brest to medevac a passenger. She had departed from Southampton the previous evening with 2,160 passengers and 1,083 crew on board, en route to Madeira. The patient was taken by ambulance to hospital.
Vessel ran aground due to generator failure, at NE coast of Myodo island, Yeosu, 24 Nov 2021. Refloated & taken to Gwangyang Port Anch., 25 Nov. Sd from Gwangyang Anch, 26 Nov.
Vessel interrupted her voyage from Busan to Long Beach after losing a large number of containers. Accident took place in the Pacific southeast of Iturup island, Kuril Archipelago.
Near miss collision with a sailing Yacht - FREEBIRD reported to the Maltese Maritime Safety Investigation. KARIN SCHEPERS was en route from Santa Cruz de Tenerife to Las Palmas.

Vessel broke off her moorings at Prince Rupert Harbor, Canada, and drifted aground in strong winds. She was refloated with the assistance of several tugs, and taken back to berth, no damages reported.
Port State Control inspectors of Port Naples detained vessel at the Gesil terminal on various alleged infractions.

Vessel ran aground in waters off Merak Kecil Island in Banten province, Indonesia in bad weather on 23 Nov 2021. Vessel was able to refloat under its own power & sailed Merak & continued service on 24 Nov.
After encountering rough seas under bad weather conditions, vessel issued distress signal but later sank in Thousand Islands waters, Java, Indonesia.
Vessel drifted for 3 days in the Celtic sea after losing it's engine. It was assisted by tug ALP DEFENDER back to port for repairs.

Vessel reported NUC due to automatic stop for the transport of fuel oil, in lat 53 02 53N, long 001 36 49E, abt 13 NM NE of Cromer, 23 Nov 2021. A few minutes later changed its status to underway & confirmed it was continuing passage.

Vessel ran aground & damaged while departing Avedore Port, Denmark, 23 Nov 2021. Sd from Avedore, 26 Nov & headed to Soby where it was drydocked at the Soby Skibsvaerft, 28 Nov. Remains in a stationary, as of 03 Dec.

Some cargo (steel products), fell off while others shifted in position when the vessel was 191nm west of Vancouver Island. There was also damage to the vessel’s railings. 31-Jul-2021 : Vessel was caught in the area hit by typhoon In-Fa and as a reult, lost balance of the stacked containers in holds 1 to 4. No confirmation of cargo loss yet.

Vessel sustained a fire on board, believed to be in the engine room. According to reports, the crew was able to put out the fire, and towed the vessel to Villa San Giovanny. Passengers were evacuated with no reported injuries.
Reports that vessel suffered engine failure while transiting Dardanelles. It was assisted by tugs and taken to Karanlik Anchorage, western Dardanelles likely for repairs.
Vessel forced to change route to allow medevac for badly injured crew member. The accident occured in the engine room and the operation was carried out by Indonesian Navy Paramedics.

Vessel forced to change route to facilitate medevac operation for a crew member reportedly injured in a engine room accident. It sailed to Kochi, India from where Indian Coast Guard Paramedics perfomed the medevac.
Vessel sanctioned by the US Congress in connection with work on the Nord Stream 2 gas pipeline. Also sanctioned is the registered owner - Transadria Ltd

Vessel had an engine failure, in pos 42 23 00N, 34 58 30E, Turkey, 22 Nov 2021. Vessel towed to Tekirdag, 29 Nov. Sea trial performance tests carried out successfully. Shifted Tuzla shipyd to Tuzla anch, 02 Feb 2022. Sailed, 03 Feb.

Reports of fire in engine room while vessel was off the coast of Portugal. Two crew were badly injured and medevaced by the Portuguese Air Force. Sadly, they’ve been declared dead as of the morning Nov 23. Vessel has since been disabled, adrift, and monitored by the Portuguese Navy.
Vessel ran aground near the Volga Caspian Sea Canal while enroute from Offshore field to Astrakhan. There are no reports of serious damage to the vessel or pollution.

While vessel was about 72 miles south of Southwest Pass, Louisiana, the US Coast Guard was called in to medevac a passenger. She was exhibiting symptoms consistent with internal bleeding, according to  watchstanders and was flown to University Medical Center in New Orleans.
Vessel reported to have come in contact with an embankment at the Kiel Canal while in transit. It was taken to berth, inspected for damages (confirmed) and now subject to further investigation.

Vessel had a technical failure at Gocuk point in the Canakkale Strait, 21 Nov 2021. Arrived and dropped anchor at Yalova anch, 25 Nov. Repair has been commenced by the shore-based technical team & it remains stationary at Yalova, 01 Dec.

Vessel experienced a loss of propulsion during the departure amidst rough seas and strong gusts of wind, at the port of Calais, France on 21 Nov 2021. Vsl went adrift against pile fender. Vsl departed on 22 Nov.
Vessel while leaving the port assisted by a tug, struck the berthed vessel Federal EMS at Goderich, Ontario, Canada on 20 Nov 2021. No damages to the vessel. Vsl departed on 21 Nov.

Vessel forced to call at Brest, although under own power at reduced speed, after it encountered propulsion problem. Divers found ship’s propeller shaft entangled in hawser. She will offload 178 containers on board and head for drydocking shortly.
Berthed vessel struck by leaving vessel Saginaw at Goderich, Canada on 20 Nov 2021. Minor damages to the vsl.
Vessel had engine failure, at the west part of Kythira Island, Greece, at approx lat 36 20 00N, long 022 36 24E, 20 Nov 2021. The vessel is drifting with tug Othello, standing by at the scene.

Confirmed report that the vessel Cook murdered the Captain in his cabin. The bizzare incident took place while vessel was on route from South Africa to India. It was forced to change course and aarived Port Louis, Mauritius where investigations are ongoing.
Vessel ran aground under the Skye Bridge in Kyle while en route from Neskaupstadur,  Iceland to Kyleakin, western Scotland.

Indian Customs and DRI officers seized some containers from vessel following claims that the cargo was suspected harzardous materials. Vessel is still anchored at Mundra while investigations continue.

WAN HAI 288 collided with bulk carrier AMC NAVIGATOR, in Hong Kong waters. According to reports, the bow of WAN HAI 288 was severely damaged, and it will most likely be transferred to a yard in Taiwan for repairs. AMC NAVIGATOR was also severely damaged.

Vessel suffered mechanical failure and was disabled after leaving Tuzla, destined for Poti Georgia, Black sea, on ballast leg. It was sailing in Marmara sea approaching Bosphorus, Istanbul. Traffic authorities sent tug which towed it back to Tuzla anchorage.

Eighty litres or more heavy fuel oil went overboard when vessel was taking bunkers offshore, at Algoa Bay, South Africa on 17 Nov 2021. Clean-up underway, oil booms placed. Released & sailed from Port Elizabeth Anch., 24 Nov.

WAN HAI 288 collided with bulk carrier AMC NAVIGATOR, in Hong Kong waters. According to reports, the bow of WAN HAI 288 was severely damaged, and it will most likely be transferred to a yard in Taiwan for repairs. AMC NAVIGATOR was also severely damaged.
Vessel ran aground in waters around the Southern Chile Fjords. Attempts made by SAR ship FUENTEALBA to refloat her failed today (18th Nov).
Vessel had a technical failure at Haydarpasa, Turkey, 16 Nov 2021. Departure permission cancelled. Repairs completed by crew in Haydarpasa, 17 Nov. Voyage to Suez canal resumed.
The BBC MAINE and chemical carrier IRENE DP are both under quarantine due to suspected cases of Covid 19.
The BBC MAINE and chemical carrier IRENE DP are both under quarantine due to suspected cases of Covid 19.
Crew reported damage to the steering system which left the vessel drifting and NUC. This happened shortly after vessel left Merak Port, Indonesia. It was later towed back to port.

Vessel had a technical failure, approx in lat 35 48 00N, long 028 46 00E, about SE of Karpathos Island, 15 Nov 2021. Repairs are still being carried out by the crews & it was drifting as per the wind & current direction, as of 17 Nov.

Vessel had an engine failure at the northern entrance of the Istanbul strait, in lat 41 18 26N, long 028 55 10E, 15 Nov 2021. Crew unable to complete repair causing the vessel to be towed to the nearest convenient anchorage in Istanbul.

In collision with another vessel identified as FARDIN-1. The FARDIN-1 was laden with coal and sank at Mongla Port, Bangladesh shortly after the collision. 3 out of 6 Crew declared missing while rescue operation underway.

JAN D coliided with general cargo ship SEA ENDURANCE in Havstensfjord, Sweden. Details unclear. Images of the JAN D damages can be seen via link below but no confirmation of damages on the SEA ENDURANCE. http://www.shipspotting.com/gallery/photo.php?lid=3362819

Vessel had ongoing technical issues, hence the company DFDS had to adjust sailing schedule for Dover-Dunkirk service, 16 Nov 2021. Remain sidelined at RoRo berth no.3, Dunkirk, since 14 Nov. Repairs completed & sailed from Dunkirk on 16 Nov
Vessel was reported not under command due to engine failure, in lat 49 54 58N, long 005 59 02W, 14 Nov 2021. Defect rectified. Resumed voyage using own engine, 15 Nov. Ar in Gothenburg, 18 Nov.

JAN D coliided with general cargo ship SEA ENDURANCE in Havstensfjord, Sweden. Details unclear. Images of the JAN D damages can be seen via link below but no confirmation of damages on the SEA ENDURANCE. http://www.shipspotting.com/gallery/photo.php?lid=3362819
More of an incident than casualty but, scheduled sale from Miami was cancelled abruptly with no clear reasons given. This occured while vessel was waiting to transit the Panama Canal.
Vessel restricted manoeuvrability after a small crack in cooling pipe, in pos 58 06 12N, 05 36 40W, 6NM W of Stornoway, 13 Nov 2021. Repairs completed by crew & voyage resumed, 14 Nov.

A US Air Force team based in Africa rescued a British citizen who had suffered a heart attack on board vessel while it was in the Indian Ocean en route from Durban to Djibouti. A team of five US Air Force pararescuemen were deployed and they wera able to stabilize his condition.

Vessel was intercepted and detained by the LNA patrol vessel for breaching the Libyan National Army No Sail Zone about 16.8nm north of Ras el Hilal, while proceeding from Port Said, to Misurata. It was escorted to the Ras-el-Hilal anchorage, where it moored at 20:30 local time.

Vessel reported sustaining a main engine malfunction and striking the lower ship arrestor of the Welland Canal's No 1 lock, Port Weller, Canada on 13 Nov 2021. Welland canal closed for 8 hrs. Vsl departed on 13 Nov after repairs
Damage to stern tube
Vessel experienced technical issue on its main engine, Oban, United Kingdom, on 12 Nov 2021. Repairs completed & returned to service, 13 Nov.

Vessel disabled due to engine failure, in lat 45 43 17N, long 073 25 57W, Vercheres, Canada. Crew restarted engines & proceeded to Montreal to assess & carry out repairs. Sd from the Montreal, Canada, 14 Nov.

Vessel allided with quay, while departing Rosslare, R of Ireland, 12 Nov 2021. Breach above waterline, causing it to be sidelined. Headed to the Belfast Dock for repairs, 16 Nov. Completed repairs, 27 Nov. Resumed service Rosslare, 29 Nov.

Vessel exp heavy weather with NEE winds of force 7, gusts 9&heavy SSW seas causing it to roll & pitch heavily from 12 Nov to 17 Nov 2021. List exceed up to 30 deg both sides. Hold 2&3 water ingress, cargo damaged. Arrive Summerside 18 Nov.

Vessel from Bremerhaven, Germany, to Luebeck, allided with the middle wall of new northern lock-in Brunsbuttel on 12 Nov 2021. Vessel was banned from sailing until declared seaworthy. Continued voyage 13 Nov. Ar at Lubeck, 14 Nov.

Vessel disabled with main engine fuel oil pipe failure & anchored in pos 41 04 00N, 81 20 23W, near Lake Erie, 11 Nov 2021. The crew carried out repairs & the vessel resumed the voyage, 11 Nov. Ar in Parry Sound, 13 Nov.
Vessel allided with dock due to the wake created by two other vessels, while moored in pos lat 45 32 45.2N, long 073 31 43.7W, Montreal, Canada, 11 Nov 2021. The vessel and dock sustained damage.

Vessel had a technical failure during its Strait passage & dropped anchor at Gelibolu anch, Turkey, 11 Nov 2021. Repairs are still being carried out by the crew & it remains in a stationary position at the anchorage, as of 12 Nov.
Fire broke out in generator of vessel while underway in RJ-Campos-basin near P-50 oil platform, Brazil on 11 Nov 2021. currenly underway to a shipyard in Guanabara Bay, in Rio de Janeiro for repairs.
Vessel NUC, adrift since morning Nov 10, west of Port Elizabeth, South Africa, from Singapore to Tema Ghana. Under tow of SAR tug SA AMANDLA back to Port Elizabeth.

During cargo operations, a loading grab wire broke, causing the loading grab to fall onto the main deck. Confirmation of damage to the grab and to the vessel, although no injuries or pollution were reported.

Vessel had to be relocated from Durban South Africa, after her cargo of chemicals started to emit toxic fumes. According to the South African Maritime Safety Authority SAMSA, cargo became unstable after it became wet during discharge operation in rainy weather.

Vessel came in contact with bulk carrier Apollo Bulker, in pos lat 40 58 18.0N, long 028 56 06.0E, at Istanbul Anch., on 10 Nov 2021. Departure permission cancelled pending survey. Vsl berthed at Tripoli, Lebanon on 30 Nov for repairs.

Vessel had flooding in the foreship on deck no. 1, in the middle of the Sargasso Sea, which caused a chemical reaction followed by thick smoke, 10 Nov 2021. Later the crew brought the situation under control. No injured crew or passengers.

Apollo Bulker in collision with dredger Daytona-H while manouvering to anchorage off Istanbul. The Apollo Bulker was en route from Constanta to Suez, while the Daytona-H was heading from Constanta to Tripoli. Apollo Bulker moved under its own power to a convenient anchorage area. The Daytona H remained stationary. The vessel’s departure permissions were cancelled until completion of damage surveys and an incident investigation.

Cruise liner deviated from its route to the rescue of a sailboat that was in trouble, saving the passengers and a couple of dogs on board. The sailors were all transported to Galveston and disembarked along with all the passengers on Thursday morning. The USCG is advising seafarers that the sailboat is still drifting in the Gulf of Mexico.
Vessel ran aground during rough weather and issued distress signal to the Russian Coast Guard. Visible cracks on the ship hull and flooded engine room forced the evacuation of entire crew to safety.

Vessel confirmed disabled, adrift, cause not yet known. No AIS report during last 6 hours. Earlier reported as disabled and adrift in Bay of Bengal since Nov 7. 20-May-2021 : Vessel had to interrupt its voyage from Port Klang, Malaysia, to Shenzhen, China, on May 13th while it was in the South China Sea. It had requested immediate medical assistance. The ship then sailed to Quy Nhon port in Central Vietnam and anchored off the port. One crew members was reported to be in critical condition, while three other crew members were also ill. All of them were said to have been showing symptoms of Covid-19.

Vessel disabled & drifted after net got stuck in a wreck while rinsing it, at Breidsundet, Norway, 09 Nov 2021. Towed to Aalesund, 10 Nov. After the obstruction was removed, it sailed from the port again, 11 Nov, back to fishing grounds.
Vessel NUC due to engine cooling drain leak, in pos 50 29 59N, 00 05 00W, 09 Nov 2021. Repairs completed by crew. Underway using own engine.

While en route to Australia, vessel ran aground in the trans-national River Parana, South America. This happened while it was unmooring at Rosario in order to proceed downstream to Zona Comun Anchorage, Rio de la Plata. Vessel was loaded with 25,000 tons of soybean cargo.

Cargo on board vessel described as granite in sheets fell down from container unit CMAU180910-2 during the discharge operation anchored at Fortaleza port, Brazil on 09 Nov 2021. Damage to two container units and vsl. Berthed as of 09 Nov.
Finish Maritime Safety Board investigating reports of a collision between the MIRJAM and TRANSMAR while the lata was at berth. No injuries or pollution reported.
Finish Maritime Safety Board investigating reports of a collision between the MIRJAM and TRANSMAR while the lata was at berth. No injuries or pollution reported.
Vessel drifted aground on Cua Lo beach, Vietnam, in adverse weather conditions.
Vessel ran aground at Swinoujscie, Poland, while entering port on arrival from Norway. It managed to refloat by own means, and was berthed at Swinoujscie later in the day. no damages reported.

Vessel collided with steel dolphin in New Lock harbor, Brunsbuettel, while entering Kiel Canal. It's hull was holed some 3 meters above waterline in portside cofferdam area. Vessel had to berth in Brunsbuettel harbor in Kiel Canal, for inspection and repairs.

A crew member needing urgent medical attention forced vessel to anchor at Kalamata so he could be transferred to the AGIOS NIKOLAOS I, picked up by ambulance and taken to hospital for further treatment.
Finnish Coast Guard alerted after fire erupted in engine room, the ship was disabled. As of Nov 8th 2021, fire extinguished and vessel on anchor getting ready for next voyage.

Vessel was intercepted by a Libyan patrol vessel in position around 16nm northwest of Ras el Hilal, and was detained for allegedly breaching the LNA ‘No Sail Zone’. She was en route from Benghazi to Tobruk at the time of incident.

A crew member had to be medevaced while vessel was approaching Galveston, Texas. Reports that he fainted and was unresponsive to first aid onboard. He was later in stable condition at the University of Texas medical centre.

According to local Indonesian news report, vessel ran aground on Tanjung Keluang Beach, while en route from Kumai Kalimantan to Surabaya Java. It later  refloated with high tide and tug assistance  and resumed its voyage. The vessel was loaded with palm oil cargo at the time of incident.
Vessel allided with the outer pier in Workington Port, UK. It was holed below the waterline but continued to its berth. Damage on the bow thruster tube caused water ingress.

Vessel, en route from Cuxhaven, Germany to Alexandria, Egypt reported as NUC due to engine problem 16NM off Beachy Head, UK, in pos 50 33 07N, 000 33 29E on 06 Nov 2021. CNIS is aware. No further info available due to language difficulties.

RMS DUISBURG collided with inland cargo ship ARCHIPEL at the Rhine river in a head-on collision. Both ships sustained heavy bow damages. Images can be found on Instagram ... https://www.instagram.com/salvage_and_wreck/
Removal from the wreck site on Bodie Island, North Carolina commenced. It is understood to be sold for scrap!
Vessel awaiting judicial order to sail out of Berbes docks where it was seized by the port authorities. It was allegedly carrying cocaine.

RMS DUISBURG collided with inland cargo ship ARCHIPEL at the Rhine river in a head-on collision. Both ships sustained heavy bow damages. Images can be found on Instagram ... https://www.instagram.com/salvage_and_wreck/

Reports that vessel had engine failure at Marmara sea while proceeding towards Bosphorus, being en route from Tekirdag Turkey, to Poti Georgia. The ship was taken to Ahirkapi anchorage, Istanbul, Marmara sea, and anchored there, with tug’s assistance.

Vessel had engine fault & anchored in lat 50 39 10N, long 000 23 17E, abt 7.5 NM SE of Beachy Head, UK, 05 Nov 2021. Vessel has water in engine lube oil. Repairs underway, ETA 12 hrs. Rectified defect & ready to continue voyage, 07 Nov.
Port authorities had prevented vessel from entering into the Clyde which had been marked as Cop26 restricted zone. This was because of some Climate Activists onboard at the time.

During cargo unloading, a crane cabin broke & fell 20m down onto vessel, OT Port Swinoujscie SA, 04 Nov 2021. 1 died, rescue operation was delayed. Prosecutors & criminal police investigating. Sd Szczecin Anch., 16 Nov. Ar Porsgrunn, 18 Nov

Vessel got its propeller entangled with portside bow anchor chain of passenger ro/ro Lady Carmela at Pozzuoli, Italy on 03 Nov 2021. Both vessels disabled, diver called to resolve the complex situation.

Vessel collided with 5-ton fishing boat off Cape Muroto, Japan, while en route from Shunan to Hekinan, Honshu. The fishing boat capsized, two fishermen on board were rescued, but one of them was recovered already dead.

Vessel caused an oil spill due to the overflow of one of the fuel tanks while carrying out loading and transfer operations on 03 Nov 2021. Oil dissipated due to the high evaporation rate. Vsl departed on 08 Nov.

A crew member needed to be medevaced to the hospital in Las Palmas on Gran Canaria  while the vessel was en route from Algeciras, Spain, to Cotonou, Benin. A helicopter was  dispatched to pick up the crew member who  was taken to hospital.

O.P.K 3 and NP PATHUM THANI, collided at the Chao Phraya river in Bangkok area. Both ships loaded with containers. NP PATHUM THANI struck by her bow and suffered slight damages, while O P K 3 portside hull was breached, causing massive water ingress. The ship rested on bottom in shallow waters with superstructure and partially, cargo deck remaining above waterline.
Vessel came in contact with a quay during the maneuver to leave, at the port of Vado Ligure, Italy, on 02 Nov 2021. Vsl departed the port on 03 Nov after repairs.

Vessel drifted due engine failure and ran aground, after leaving Sandvikvag, Norway, 02 Nov 2021. Vessel reached quay under own power, assisted by another ferry. Sailings cancelled. Sailed Rubbestadneset after repairs on 14 Nov.
Vessel reported as disabled, NUC, and drifting on Nov 2nd. Update on Nov 14th, it has been towed by the MEXTUG DUERO to unknown destination.
Vessel came in c/w fully cellular containership Delphis Bothnia during Kiel Canal transit on 02 Nov 2021, partially significant damages to both vessels. However, both continued voyage.
Vessel came in c/w fully cellular containership Empire during Kiel Canal transit on 02 Nov 2021, partially significant damages to both vessels. However, both continued voyage.
Vessel reported engine failure at Torre Annunziata, Italy.Tug towed it to Tuzla, Turkey; entered shipyard on 25 Feb. Repairs completed, sailed from Tuzla anch, 14 Jul.

Vessel had a total steering power loss, in lat 51 21 21N, long 003 12 41W, in the Bristol Channel, 01 Nov 2021. Operation is carried out in a normal manner every hour. Contact has been made with the technical department for guidance.
Vessel had fuel line leak in engine room & anchored, in lat 52 47 55N, long 001 51 05E, abt 15 NM NE of Great Yarmouth, UK, 01 Nov 2021. Sailed after repairs, 01 Nov.

Reports that vessel allided with a gantry crane and ran aground in shallow waters  during a trial engine run prior to its departure from Tokyo. The mooring ropes snapped and main engine was out of order. It was later refloated several hours later.

Vessel suffered engine fault while transiting Bosphorus, en route from Ukraine to Turkey. The ship drifted dangerously close to shore but was stopped on time and later completed transit, not clear if towed or under own power. Vessel was anchored at Ahirkapi anchorage.
Vessel reported as NUC due to main engine exhaust brake needing repair in pos lat 51 14 52N, 004 20 45W, abt 9.2 NM from Ilfracombe, UK, 30 Oct 2021. Under way after completing repairs within 5 hrs.

Vessel ran into a quay following a blackout and subsequent engine failure at the port of Gothenburg ON 30 Oct 2021. Pilot deployed soon and vsl moored. No leakage or spills. Vsl anchored as of 31 Oct.
Vessel had a technical failure at Sariyer point, Istanbul strait, 29 Oct 2021. Tug Kurtarma 8 towed the vessel to Kumkapi anchorage & repairs were underway.

Vessel was NUC due to an issue with its fuel pump, in lat 51 11 31N, long 001 40 30E, 29 Oct 2021. The estimated time for the completion of repairs is an hour. Completed repairs & is en route to Flushing, Netherlands, instead of Aviles.

NEW GLOBAL collided with KM MAJU 9 (wooden cargo ship) at Maluku Province, Indonesia, Arafura sea. Reports that both ships were trying to avoid collision with several local fishing boats in the area. MAJU 9 capsized. Of 32 people on board, 28 were rescued by NEW GLOBAL, 4 went missing. Tanker was en route from New Guines Indonesia to Gresik.

Vessel was caught in rough weather off Taichung, western Taiwan, Taiwan Strait while en route from Kaohsiung to either mainland China or northern Taiwan. She was probably anchored and suffered massive water ingress and developed heavy portside list up to 25 degrees. 7 crew members were evacuated and ship was towed to Taichung.
Man overboard reported after crew member jumped without life jacket. Search and rescue operation ended with no sighting of the casualty.

Vessel experienced fire in smokestack after arriving at new port of Patras, Greece on 28 Oct 2021. Passengers, non-essential personnel and vehicles disembarked. Crew along with Patras Fire Service and Greek Coast Guard extinguished fire.
Reports of fire outbreak onboard while vessel was approaching the Barito River. Causes of the fire not yet disclosed.

Canadian Port Authorities report that vessel suffered a main engine failure and ran aground about in Quebec, Canada. It  refloated with the high tide and moored at the Riviere Maheu anchorage with assistance of two tugs for further inspections and repairs.

Vessel was court ruled to be arrested  together with her crew, by Federal High Court in Lagos, Nigeria. Following a case filed by to the National Drug Law Enforcement Agency (NDLEA). Reports that about 32.9 kilos of cocaine was found in cargo hold of the ship on Oct 15 during a search.
Vessel suffered mechanical failure and was disabled at Finisterre, Spain. It started drifting towards the Spanish coast, while en route from Rotterdam to Lisbon.

Vessel struck a reef during mooring operations at the port ramp of Paleochora  due to a sudden gust of wind. It suffered a two-metre diameter breach near the engine room, about 1.5 metres above the waterline. There were no injuries or pollution. The Port Authority of Paleochora prohibited the departure of the ferry until the presentation of a certificate of sea worthiness by the classification society monitoring the ship.

Vessel suffered engine failure in the Mediterranean Sea, east of Rhodes Island, Greece, while en route from Iskenderun, Turkey to Constanta, Romania. Ship is now disabled and will be towed to Souda, Crete.

Vessel allided with a dock while manoeuvring in the port of Halifax, Nova Scotia. Both vessel and dock suffered minor damage although vessel left port on October 29th en route to Portland, arriving October 30th according to AIS reports.
Vessel had propulsion problems in pos lat 48 08 20N, long 069 43 37W, Canada, 26 Oct 2021. The vessel was deemed unseaworthy & docked in Tadoussac, to assess the problem.
Reports yet to be confirmed that vessel was attacked by pirates in the Gulf of Guinea. It was enroute from Lome, Togo to Douala, Cameroon.

SS Sun (IMO 9135028) in collision with the Hua Hang Han Ya 2 (IMO 9879545) at the Kurushima Strait, Japan. One crew member of the SS Sun was injured, and had to be taken to the hospital for treatment. Both ships remained under command. The SS Sun berthed in Imabari after the accident.

Vessel had engine failure SW off Kithira Island, Greece, in ops 35 47 03N, 022 51 00E, 25 Oct 2021. Anchor handling tug/supply Platytera commence towage same day for Piraeus; convoy waiting off Kithira for clear weather, as of 28 Oct.

Vessel in lat 09 22 52N, long 013 41 28W, at the Conakry Anch, Guinea, was boarded by 7 perpetrators armed with guns & knives, 25 Oct 2021. Vessel was robbed of computers & laptops. Informed Conakry port auth. All crews are reported safe.
Vessel ran aground off Isle of Wight, UK shortly after leaving Fawley, after veering off fairway. No damages were reported for now. Tanker was heading to Alexandria, Egypt.

SS Sun (IMO 9135028) in collision with the Hua Hang Han Ya 2 (IMO 9879545) at the Kurushima Strait, Japan. One crew member of the SS Sun was injured, and had to be taken to the hospital for treatment. Both ships remained under command. The SS Sun berthed in Imabari after the accident.

Vessel reported being NUC due to main engines failure, in lat 52 02 45N, long 005 48 11W, about 20 NM NW of Small Lighthouse, 24 Oct 2021. The vessel inspected their crankcase & filters resolved the issue. Underway to its destination.
Vessel reported loss of propulsion in pos 53 43 30N, long 140 36 21W on 24 Oct 2021. Repairs could not be done by crew, requested tow assistance. Being towed to Seattle, USA as of 28 Oct.
Vessel not under command due to engine blackout, in lat 29 02 18N, long 015 48 08W, near Santa Cruz de Tenerife, Spain, on 24 Oct 2021. Repairs completed & continued voyage, on 25 Oct.
Vessel ran aground while enroute from Barranquilla to Altamira and Houston. T&T Salvage was contracted to help refloat the vessel which is now anchored off Barranquilla.
Four perpetrators spotted near stern deck of vessel in position lat 01 14 27.6N, long 104 02 06.0E, Singapore Strait, on 24 Oct 2021. Nothing stolen. Vessel continued voyage.

Vessel collided with capesize bulk carrier BENITAMOU, as they were headed to Dardanelles, due to dense fog. BC VANESSA struck BENITAMOU portside in midshipsection area, causing heavy damages to both ships. BENITAMOU hull suffered a huge breach, with ensuing water ingress. BC VANESSA bow and forecastle were heavily damaged. BC VANESSA was anchored at Sevketiye anchorage and is in no immediate danger, while BENITAMOU suffered more serious damaged and is either dead in the water or anchored south of collision site.  BENITAMOU was en route from Yuzhny, Ukraine to China and BC VANESSA was en route from Varna, Bulgaria to Tunis.
Vessel ran aground 20km from the coast on the Dolgaya spit, Sea of Azov, Russia, 23 Oct 2021. Refloated on 23 Oct.

Vessel was reported NUC due to main engine issues, in lat 53 40 09N, long 000 27 26E, abt 14 NM ENE from Spurn Point, 23 Oct 2021. Reduce speed & resolve the issue on the same day. Underway to its destination.

Vessel had a mechanical problem & remained side-lined in the port of Dover, United Kingdom, for repairs, 23 Oct 2021. After the repair works were completed, the vessel resumed its service to Dunkirk, 26 Oct.
Vessel battling a cargo fire after the ship lost 40 containers in heavy seas west of the United States-Canadian border. The ship is currently at anchor in the Straits of Juan de Fuca.

Vessel's 3rd Officer shot dead both Master and Chief Officer on board while vessel anchored at La Plata Anchorage, Rio de La Plata, Argentina. He reported himself to the police now investigating this tragic accident.

Vessel collided with general cargo ship BC VANESSA, as they were headed to Dardanelles, due to dense fog. BC VANESSA struck BENITAMOU portside in midshipsection area, causing heavy damages to both ships. BENITAMOU hull suffered a huge breach, with ensuing water ingress. BC VANESSA bow and forecastle were heavily damaged. BC VANESSA was anchored at Sevketiye anchorage and is in no immediate danger, while BENITAMOU suffered more serious damages and is either dead in the water or anchored south of collision site.  BENITAMOU was en route from Yuzhny, Ukraine to China and BC VANESSA was en route from Varna, Bulgaria to Tunis.

Vessel while anchoring under the conduct of a pilot, reported being disabled due to engine problems, in lat 46 43 14N, long 071 22 04W, at the anch off Saint-Nicolas, Canada, 23 Oct 2021. Crews carried repairs & it resumed voyage.
Vessel collided with fishing boat off Tamil Nadu State coast, southern India. Of 17 fishermen on board, 2 were thrown overboard as a result of the impact, although rescued shortly after.

Vessel reported being disabled due to engine problems, in lat 45 33 11N, long 073 31 24W, at section 109 of the Port of Montreal, Canada, 23 Oct 2021. Crews carried out repairs. Voyage resumed. Ar in Port Tracy, same day.

Vessel had a technical issue with the cooling pump while departing Stornoway, United Kingdom, 22 Oct 2021. Engineers investigated & resolved the issue. Returned to service after successful repairs, same day.
Vessel collided with Berth No 18 in Chornomorsk port, Ukraine while maneuvering to berth after arrival from Gebze, Turkey. Both vessel's bow section and berth sustained heavy damages.
Vessel was forced to promptly divert to Key West to evacuate a seriously ill passenger shortly after it began it's first cruise voyage since March 2020.
Vessel allided with the berth no. 3 in Taganrog while docking, causing damage to two oil terminal stand pipes. An investigation was launched by Russian inspectors.

The KONSTANTIN collided with anchored tanker SMERALDO at Brunsbuettel anchorage, while en route from Sweden to New Holland, UK, with cargo of wood. SMERALDO was anchored at the time of collision, KONSTANTIN is thought to have been maneuvering to anchor. KONSTANTIN hull was breached in engine room area, with ensuing water ingress. SMERALDO sustained slight damages, and resumed voyage from Stade Germany.
Grande Ghana (IMO 9343168) and Grande Argentina (IMO 9198135) broke loose from berths 1303 and 1307 respectively during stormy conditions at the AET Terminal and Port of Antwerp.

Evelyn Maersk while entering the Port of Antwerp, Belgium, was caught in wind gusts in the Deurgang Dock & c/w Milano, which was already berthed in the dock with two barges, 21 Oct 2021. Vessel scraped along the port side of Milano.
Grande Ghana (IMO 9343168) and Grande Argentina (IMO 9198135) broke loose from berths 1303 and 1307 respectively during stormy conditions at the AET Terminal and Port of Antwerp.

Vessel broke loose from its berth after mooring ropes broke in a storm and the vsl’s bow came in contact with the quay at the port of Hamburg, Germany 21 Oct 2021. Vessel sailed from port Oct 24, bound for Zeebrugge, Belgium, ETA 25 Oct.

The KONSTANTIN collided with anchored tanker SMERALDO at Brunsbuettel anchorage, while en route from Sweden to New Holland, UK, with cargo of wood. SMERALDO was anchored at the time of collision, KONSTANTIN is thought to have been maneuvering to anchor. KONSTANTIN hull was breached in engine room area, with ensuing water ingress. SMERALDO sustained slight damages, and resumed voyage from Stade Germany.
Vessel was about 70 minutes behind schedule due to a mechanical issue with its main engine, in Nanaimo, Canada, 20 Oct 2021. No estimated time  given for when the issue might be resolved.

Vessel had the main engine lubricating oil pipe failure while in St.Lawrence Seaway off Salaberry-de-Valleyfield, Canada, 20 Oct 2021. Proceeded to the anch in Saint-Zotique. Repairs done & it resumed voyage. Ar in Port Weller, 21 Oct.

Vessel had a technical failure at Aqaba, Jordan, 20 Oct 2021. Dep permission temporarily cancelled by Harbour Master until the completion of repairs. After completion of repairs, the state surveyors verified & allowed to sail.
Reports of fire in the cargo hold while vessel arrived Ploce port, Croatia. According to local reports, scrap metals in cargo hold may have been the cause.

A crew member was seriously injured in an accident. Requests made for a medevac made by Captain. The fire brigade at Cuxhaven was alerted and assisted with a ladder to get the victim ashore for further transport to hospital.

A man robbed a pilot boat & c/w Maria Grazia Onorato, which was bound for Cagliari, Italy, stopped 13 m from the coast, off the port of Leghorn, 20 Oct 2021. The boat sustained serious damage. Maria Grazia Onorato had no damages.

Vessel had a fire on board due to overheating generator, at Gafoors Complex, Land of Canaan, East Bank of Demerara, Guyana, 19 Oct 2021. Diamond & Timehri Fire Stations responded to the incident & brought the fire under control, 19 Oct.
Vessel was intercepted and detained by the Libyan National Army for breaching a ‘No Sail Zone’ while it was proceeding off the coast of Ras el Hilal from Benghazi to Beirut.
The USCG were called to medevac a crew man after he sustained injuries to his pelvic area. He was flown to Dutch Harbor to receive medical attention.
Vessel had a broken door ramp, subsequently not allowing the passengers & their cars off the vessel, in Portsmouth, United Kingdom, 19 Oct 2021.

Vessel ran aground at the entrance to Vaeroy harbour, Norway on 19 Oct 2021, took in water, in bad weather. Refloated on own, NSSR lifeboat Det Norske Veritas and CG escorted vessel to Vaeroy. Ar Moen Verft AS, Ottersoy, 27 Oct, for repairs
After almost one week of waiting for port clearance, vessel finally disembarked 105 migrants rescued in the Mediterranean.
Vessel reported engine trouble during its westbound transit of Kiel Canal, on 19 Oct 2021, a tug towed it back to Kiel. Berthed at Voith Quay. Shifted to Lindenau Yard, 28 Oct.
15 crew members tested positive for Covid-19. The crew members and a number of close contacts were required to quarantine on the ship.

19-Oct-2021 : Vessel suffered mechanical failure and was disabled at Elaphonisos Channel between southern Peloponnese and Kythira island.
