It was taken on tow to Piraeus Anchorage. 17-Jun-2021 : Vessel collided with a fishing boat under Yavuz Sultan Selim Bridge, Istanbul while transiting the strait on route to Constanta Romania. Reports that the fishing boat 1 of the 33 fishermen onboard died unfortunately as a result.
Vessel suffered engine failure south of Hong Kong while en route from Kalimantan, Indonesia, to China with 50,000 tons of coal on board, and went adrift. Rescue operations commenced on Oct 25th.

Vessel collided with pedestrian bridge at  Guayaquil, while leaving the port. It developed heavy list, but returned to even keel with the help of rescue tugs. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=05bH8_8XfNA&feature=emb_imp_woyt
One crew member died allegedly from covid complications. Another 13 out of 26 crew tested positive and have been placed in shore quarantine facilities.
Vessel had rudder failure & ran aground, in pos lat 33 57 48N, long 130 58 46E, on 18 Oct 2021. It refloated from the shallows, the same day. Anchored at Kitakyushu Port.

Vessel ran aground around the Bornholm island, Denmark while en route from Antwerp to Estonia, carrying a cargo of fertilizer. No breaches reported and there was no spill. Refloating attempts were under way.
Vessel jacked up alongside Ormonde B01 wind turbine and dropped three 61 m turbine blades and a blade clamping tool weighing 3000-3100kg overboard.
Vessel suffered engine failure and dropped anchor at the Penghu Islands, Taiwan. Anchor dragged and forced vessel to drift and run aground. All crew safely evacuated by rescue helicopter.

Vessel ran aground off the coast of Cua Viet, Quang Tri province in heavy rain and high winds. It was anchored at buoy number 0 in the Cua Viet area, but the chain broke in severe weather. It drifted to the south shore of the Cua Viet port.
Reports of fire onboard caused by a faulty hatch cover hydraulic system. It was quickly  extinguished by crew using onboard extinguishers. No serious damages reported.
Vessel sank shortly after collision with the PUNTA MEDANOS in La Plata port, Argentina.

Third Engineer sustained serious injury while carrying out routine work at the engine room. Captain had to request immediate medical assistance while vessel was enroute from Salvador, Brazil to Cartagena, Spain.
Vessel detained by the USCG on suspicion of being responsible for the Orange County oil spill. Investigations ongoing

Vessel was NUC due to problems with its main engine shutdown & was unable to manoeuvre in lat 50 02 26N long 004 14 39W, at 8.5nm from the Eddison Light UK, 16 Oct 2021. Completed repairs. Ar in Newport, UK, 17 Oct & Sd same day.
Vessel collided with tug boat RUA II during a maneuver at the La Plata port, Argentina. The RUA II capsized and sank shortly afterwards.
Vessel suffered engine failure while in transit from Trieste, Italy to Tekirdag, turkey. It was assisted by traffic control tugs and anchored at the Sevketiye anchorage awaiting repairs.

Vessel was disabled with a faulty propeller in the Aegean sea, Grecce, while en route from Mariupol Ukraine to Beirut with cargo of grain. The ship reportedly is drifting and a  Tug said to be dispatched.
Fire broke out in the cargo hold while vessel was in berth at Sheerness Docks, UK. It was put out with the help of Kent Fire Service and onboard entinguishers. No injuries reported.
On the Supreme Court orders obtained by solicitor Allen & Gledhill LLP, vessel was arrested and detained while at the Eastern Bunkering Anchorage A/0317D.

Vessel was disabled in Myrtoan sea, Greece, while en route from Diliskelesi Turkey to Port de Sagunt Spain, Balearic sea. It was a mechanical issue and was towed to Lavrio anchorage, southeast Attica, where she is to be anchored until proven seaworthy.
During an unscheduled inspection, 115kg of cocaine was found onboard according to Customs at Rotterdam. Vessel has since left for Amsterdam. No crew member was detained.

Basel Athena, during the process of disengaging from the pier at Neos Molos Drapetzonas, Greece, engaged its anchor with that of the adjacent moored Kopernik, 14 Oct 2021. Material damage was caused to the anchor of Kopernik.

Vessel collided with Greek fishing vessel west of Agios Efstratios island, Aegean sea, while en route from Algeria to Greece. No injures or serious damages were reported. 07-Mar-2021 : Vessel in ballast condition experienced technical failure at southern entrance of the Istanbul Strait, Turkey on 07 Mar 2021; shifted to Istanbul anchorage and dropped anchor under its own power. Vessel stationary at anchorage position.

ARA Amsterdam reported that during manoeuvers while departing the port of Rotterdam, Netherlands, with a pilot on board, c/w barge Haldis, 12 Oct 2021. The incident did not result in injuries or pollution.
A crewmember died after falling into cargo hold. Vessel was in berth at Samsun port, Turkey when incident occured. Police investigation ongoing.

JIN WAN NV WANG and the QI YE 6 (class B ship) were distressed by the KOMPASU typhoon in the South China Sea. The QI YE 6 is disabled off Xiamen and under tow. JIN WAN NV WANG dragged anchor and driftted at anchorage. 16 crew were evacuated, though more are thought to be waiting onboard.

Vessel experienced technical issues with its engine stopped & NUC in pos 51 27 26N, 001 47 53E, 15.8 NM Ramsgate, UK 12 Oct 2021. Vessel completed repairs at Margate and arrived at Rotterdam Anchorage at 16 Oct.

Vessel had a blown scavenge exhaust cylinder, anchored in pos 51 40 00N, 001 25 00E, in the Black deep channel between No.3 & No.5 on 11 Oct 2021. Defect rectified, vessel continuing passage to Le Havre, same day.

10-Oct-2021 : Declared as sunk! 20-Sep-2021 : Vessel ran aground on Bulgaria’s coast. AIS ship tracking data shows the MV Vera Su was traveling at about 7 knots when it ran straight into the rocky shore near Cape Kaliakra. Bulgarian National Radio reports no pollution or injuries as a result of the accident
A crew member suffered serious injuries during a docking manoeuvre at port Aveiro.
While sailing from to Borkum, vessel collided with the quay wall at Hamburg port causing severe damage to the facility. No injuries or hull breach reported.
Vessel arrested in Singapore. The arresting solicitor was Rajah & Tann Singapore LLP and the vessel was moored at the Eastern Anchorage. Reasons for the detention not yet known.
Vessel lost port anchor while mooring at Piraeus, Greece, on 08 Oct 2021. Prohibited from sailing until anchor was replaced & seathworthiness certificate was issued. Sailed, 08 Oct.
Vessel's mooring lines broke off while at Lavrio, Greece. Reports that up to four leisure boats docked nearby were damaged as a result.

Two injured crew were medevaced by fire rescue helicopter off Chioggia port, Italy. She was bound for Alexandria Egypt, when incident occured. A rescue helicopter made two flights to lift injured seamen, both were transferred to hospital.

Fishing vessel BT 98398 TS sank due to collision with vessel in South China sea in pos 006 18 00N, 107 15 00E on 08 Oct 2021 morning. Vessels in the vicinity requested to keep sharp lookout and assist if possible.
A foreman fell to his death while carrying out repair work on the vessel. The unfortunate incident occured at Patenga Light House, Chittagong.

Vessel suffered engine failure in Rotterdam while proceeding towards Dordrecht. It had to drop portside anchor in emergency, to prevent collision. An hour later she was moved to nearby pier and berthed, resumed sailing towards Dordrecht at 0750 UTC arriving port of destination at 1030 UTC.
A crew member was medevaced while vessel was en route from Istanbul to Samsun. He was taken to an ambulance in Kovanağzı. No further reports from the hospital about his condition.

Obirix experienced an engine blackout at Port of Rendsburg Germany within Kiel Canal and came in contact with vessel which was about to unmoor along with barge Bokabarge 82, on 7 Oct 2021. Vessel and barge resumed their voyage.

Vessel experienced engine blackout at Port of Rendsburg Germany within Kiel Canal & came in contact with Pegasus which was about to unmoor along with barge Bokabarge 82, 7 Oct 2021. Vessel left Rendsburg after investigations & repair 8 Oct.

A crew member was evacuated while vessel was en route from Gibraltar to Odessa, Ukraine. The evacuation was done by MRCC of Salvamento Marítimo in Tarifa. He was flown to Jerez airport where an ambulance was waiting to take him to Jerez Hospital.

Vessel  was arrested at the outer anchorage of Chittagong port on the order of a local High Court issued  following a litigation case. The vessel had arrived with imported rice and was waiting for instructions of the owner.

Vessel was intercepted in English Channel and taken to Dunkirk by French anti drug agency which was alerted by a source on possible drug trafficking on board of TRUDY. It was en route from Brazil to Antwerp. 1127 kilo of cocaine was found in cargo hold. All 20 crew were arrested, and under  investigation.

Vessel sent out a distress call following flooding in cargo hold. All 14 crew members evacuated; vessel remained at 22 00 27 N 113 33 06 E. Zhengli Ocean Engineering Co Ltd began salvage operations in March 2022.

Captain requested medical evacuation for a crew member when it was about 75nm northwest of A Coruña, Spain. CCS Finisterre mobilized a helicopter which transported the patient to A Coruña airport, where an ambulance was waiting for the further transport to hospital.

Duty crew onboard vessel noticed 2 robbers on forecastle at Sandakan inner anchorage Malaysia, in lat 05 48 48.0N long 118 5 31.2E 5 Oct 2021. Able seaman shouted & notified the bridge. Seeing the alerted crew robbers fled with ships stores
Vessel allided with a pier while berthing at the port of Setubal, Portugal. There was damage to the pier prompting investigations into the incident. There were no injuries or pollution reported.

Vessel suffered engine failure off western coast of Rivttek island, Harstad, Troms, while en route from Harstad to Bellsund. It is assisted by nearby general cargo ship VESTLAND (IMO 8412857), to avoid drifting ashore while Tug has been dispatched to tow it away.
Vessel c/w the upper approach wall of the Welland Canal Lock No. 7, Port Colborne, Canada, 04 Oct 2021. Damage to the vessel & the dock was reported. Ar at Thorold, Canada, 05 Oct & Sd same day.

A crew member had to be medevaced after suffering health complications. Vessel sailed to the anchorage of the bay of Fira and the patient was transferred to the hospital for medical examinations and treatment.

Ferry suffered fire on its way from Koh Samui island to Koh Phanang island, Thailand. Ferry was evacuated at Koh Phanang with no victims reported. Fire was quickly extinguished. Fire services reported the cause of fire was a shortcut in one of the vents which caused a fire with a lot of smoke.

Ferry RAFFAELE RUBATTINO contacted by her stern bow of berthed ferry ANTONELLO DA MESSINA in Palermo Sicily, on arrival from Naples. Both ships sustained damages, but extent unknown. It is understood stern thruster failure was the cause of an accident.

Vessel ran aground on the Svir river. It had a cargo of 2,700 tons of timber on board. The fairway was not blocked, and no oil spill was reported although ships were asked to navigate with increased safety measures and speed limits.

Ferry RAFFAELE RUBATTINO contacted by her stern bow of berthed ferry ANTONELLO DA MESSINA in Palermo Sicily, on arrival from Naples. Both ships sustained damages, but extent unknown. It is understood stern thruster failure was the cause of an accident.

Vessel hit a reef 5 nm south of Nanri island, Putian waters, Fujian Province, while en route from Quanzhou. Hull was breached with ensuing water ingress. It developed some 10 degrees portside list before issuing distress signal. Professional salvage responded and carried out underwater salvage works and survey.

Vessel collided with quay wall when arriving at Wilhelmshaven, Germany from Goole, UK. The hull was breached and the quay also suffered some damages. It is believed strong winds may have caused this accident.

Vessel collided with canal bridge in Mondragon-Donzère canal, Rhone, while proceeding upstream. The bridge was destroyed in crash, and the Captain who was on the bridge at the time of the incident did not make it alive.

Vessel struck fishing ponds in Gulluk Gulf, Turkey, Aegean sea, while approaching Gulluk. Estimates suggest some 1 mil fish escaped the ponds. The ship anchored with her propeller entangled in ponds debris.

Vessel experienced mechanical failure and was disabled due to adverse weather conditions 37km northwest of Terschelling, Netherlands, 1 Oct 2021. Tug Guardian towed vessel to Port of Harlingen 2 Oct. Departed Harlingen 16 Oct.
Third Officer found hanging in bow thruster room. Attempts to resuscitate him proved unsuccessful and he was pronounced dead shortly after.

Vessel reported being NUC due to blackout in lat 51 04 06N long 001 32 02E, abt 6.1 NM on 01 Oct 2021. Tug En Avante 10 started towing vessel on 02 Oct to Rotterdam. Vsl berthed at Rotterdam as of 03 Oct.

Vessel suffered engine failure at Larviksfjorden, southern Norway, while en route from Larvik to Eydehavn. The vessel started to drift but it was quickly towed back to Larvik by tug BOXER (IMO 9191890).
Vessel was seized by bailiffs at the port of Nakhodka because of the owner company’s alleged debts of RUB8.5m.

One crew member injured with severe burns when fire broke out in the engine generator  room. Incident occured while vessel was off the coast of Mersin, Turkey. The other crew members got help from the coast guard firefighters and were able to put out the fire soon after.

Vessel contacted oil terminal jetty in Chattogram, Chittagong, Bangladesh while berthing. Jetty suffered heavy damages, amounting to Tk16 crore (approximately $1,9 mil). According to port authorities, accident was caused by anchoring mechanism failure.
11 crew members tested positive for Covid-19 after suffering flu symptoms. Vessel was on route from Singapore to Fremantle, Australia.

Two Ukrainian sailors died on board while vessel anchored at Chittagong, one after another, without any obvious cause or illness, according to local sources. Rumuors suggest probably, heart attack as the cause. Medics said no covid symptoms or signs found. Bodies were taken to hospital, to undergo autopsy.

Vessel was enroute from Singapore to Suez on Sep 30 in Laccadive sea north of Maldives but had to be berthed at Colombo after one or more containers started to leak. containers were carrying hazmat material or liquid and had to be removed. ETA has been delayed from 5thOctober to 11th October due to probable decontamination required.
Vessel suffered mechanical failure and was disabled in the Aegean sea. She drifted towards northern coast of Andros island, and anchored at around 1300 UTC to avoid grounding.

Vessel lost stability and capsized at Algiers Port, Algeria. It rested on bottom off pier, remaining partially above waterline and heavy starboard list. According to reports, stability loss was caused by water ingress on cargo deck.
Vessel experienced a technical failure at Aliaga, Turkey forcing delay to its departure  until the completion of repair works by the crew and an inspection by state surveyor.

Vessel suffered a blackout in Canale dei Petroli, Venice, Italy, while proceeding to Marghera, Venice, with pilot on board and 2 assisting tugs. The ship went out of control and moved towards Canal structures. Rapid response of f’castle crew and tugs meant that grounding was avoided.

Vessel in a laden condition experienced technical failure sheltered and dropped anchor at Akcay Bay, Turkey, 28 Sep 2021. Repairs are being carried out by crew the vessel remains stationary at anchorage position as of 28 Sep.

A firefighter & a crew of Ernir, were injured after an ammonia leak, while handling a cylinder during repair works, in the port of Las Palmas, 28 Sep 2021. Vessel berthed at the Reina Sofia Southeast jetty, 26 Sep.
Vessel had engine failure at the S entrance of Istanbul Strait, Turkey, 28 Sep 2021. Towed & anchored at Istanbul Anchorage. Completed repairs & Sd from Istanbul Anch, Turkey, 29 Sep.

Vessel reported being disabled & drifting due to engine problems, in lat 50 13 06N, long 128 15 03W, at about 14.06 NM WNW of Solander Island, British Columbia, Canada, 28 Sep 2021. The crews subsequently carried out repairs. Sailed, 28 Sep

Reports of sick Chief Officer in deteriorating condition with breathing/lungs issues requested medical assistance. The ship was  en route from Gibraltar to China. Chief Officer was airlifted by helicopter in the afternoon Sep 28 and transported to the hospital.
Oil leaked from vessel into port waters, at Temryuk, Russia, on 28 Sep 2021. Investigations underway.

Reports that carbon dioxide leaked in engine room while berthed at Changtu Shipyard terminal in Daishan, Zhoushan, China. Accident occurred reportedly, during firefighting system inspection, and was caused by crew erroneous procedures. 3 crew members died and 2 are treated in hospital.

Reports that vessel was approached by the Malaysian Authorities for anchoring without permission while en route from Mauritius. During an inspection, the Captain had failed to present specific documents for anchoring within the country’s waters. This carries potential fines not exceeding RM100,000 ($24,000) or an imprisonment term of not more than two years.
Vessel towed to Tuzla with after unsuccessful attempts to repair a technical fault at Oristano. Further survey and repairs to be carried out in Tuzla.

Vessel was reported NUC, due to main engine problems during the changeover, in lat 54 43 18N, long 005 38 25W, at Belfast Lough, 27 Sep 2021. The vessel confirmed the issue was resolved the same day. Ar in Belfast, 27 Sep & Sd same day.

A crew member was found dead in his cabin. Vessel agents made the report to Greek port authorities at Isthmia. Investigations ongoing shortly after autopsy was carried out at the Corinth General Hospital.

Vessel, while mooring at Berth-72 of Novoshakhtinsk Oil Products Plant, Rostov-on-Don, Russia, c/w tanker Lady Rania on 26 Sep 2021. A 9m deck rail damage to Lady Rania. No pollution. Investigation underway. Sailed on 28 Sep.

Vessel slowed down the engine as it had an issue with its cooling jacket, in lat 20 18 09S, long 117 32 27E, about 17.6 NM from Port Walcott Anchorage, Australia, 26 Sep 2021. The vessel rectified & continued its voyage.

Vessel collided with the starboard side of Caspian Sprinter (IMO 9211896), which was in the process of loading at the next pier. Lady Rania suffered damage to its deck rails and its fenders were deformed.

Vessel collided with unidentified fishing vessel while exiting Bosphorus and entering Black sea. It was enroute from Tekirdag Turkey to Azov Russia. Ship’s hull was reportedly breached, with water ingress. The ship was towed back to Bosphorus.

TAHSIN IMAMOGLU and RUSICH 10, collided in Bosphorus Strait in Beykoz area. Both ships were transiting the Strait. RUSICH 10 en route from Rodaport Turkey to Taganrog Russia, TAHSIN IMAMOGLU en route from Diliskelesi to Eregli Turkey, Black sea. Both ships after collision were taken to Buyukdere anchorage, and anchored.

Vessel contacted pier at Oshawa harbor, Lake Ontario, Canada on arrival from Montreal. Both ship’s stern and pier sustained damages. Reports that the accident took place when the ship was maneuvering to berth. 22-Jun-2021 : Vessel struck the lower ship arrester cable off Saint Lambert, Quebec. No damage to the vessel was reported and it sailed off for Annunziata 48 hrs later.

TAHSIN IMAMOGLU and RUSICH 10, collided in Bosphorus Strait in Beykoz area. Both ships were transiting the Strait. RUSICH 10 en route from Rodaport Turkey to Taganrog Russia, TAHSIN IMAMOGLU en route from Diliskelesi to Eregli Turkey, Black sea. Both ships after collision were taken to Buyukdere anchorage, and anchored.
Vessel suffered an engine room fire in the Port of Cristobal during cargo operations. The fire was extinguished by the crew and no injuries were reported.
Vessel capsized and sunk at Ormoc City Port, Cebu, Philippines while manoeuvring to berth. There were no passengers on board, but one of the 16 crew on board was reported to have died.

Vessel allided with the pier in Syros, Greece, with its port side stern during berthing. This occured while it was operating its scheduled route from the ports of Karystos, Andros, Tinos to Syros, with 31 passengers on board. It suffered damage to the port side impact of the water propulsion system. One member of the crew was injured during the incident and was taken to the general hospital at Syros. The Captain was placed under administrative arrest while an investigation was conducted, and the vessel was detained in port until the damage was repaired and a class maintenance certificate was issued by the attending classification society.
Vessel disabled due to engine problems in pos 52 11 00N, 128 34 20.4W, west north-west of Wurtele Island, British Columbia, Canada on 24 Sep 2021. Was towed to Shearwater for repairs.

Diana Wilhelmsen Management Limited (DWM) was sentenced to pay a fine of $2m, placed on probation for 4 years on 24 Sep 2021, by US federal court after pleading guilty to violations of the Act to Prevent Pollution on board Protefs.

Reports that vessel allided with the quay and suffered damage to its foreship while manoeuvring to berth No.11 at Mombasa port, en route from Dar es Salaam. It was banned from sailing until repairs were carried out.
Vessel was arrested in Singapore. The arresting solicitor is  Asialegal LLC. The vessel was located at Eastern Bunkering Anchorage C where it remained moored as of September 29th.
Vessel came in contact with Toei Maru at anchorage No.7 in Oita Port, Japan which was anchoring south of the anchorage around 0310 hrs, 23 Sep 2021. No personal injuries or oil spill occurred.

Vessel collided with fishing vessel in East China sea some 30 nm SE of Zhoushan, while en route from Ningbo-Zhoushan to Soviet Gavan, Russia. Fishing vessel sank, of the 7 crew on board, 4 were rescued, 1 recovered dead, and 2 are missing. XIN HAI ZHOU 26 was ordered to anchor near collision site for further investigation.

Vessel suffered cargo shift, after caught in stormy weather, in waters between south Iceland and Westman islands, while en route from Keflavik to Thyboron, Denmark. The ship reported developing list, turned to nearest shelter, Vestmannaeyjar Westman islands, and arrived there same day with some 10-15 deg list, escorted by offshore patrol tug THOR and harbor tug.

Vessel had an engine problem, in lat 43 43 06N, long 005 19 08W, about 11 NM from the Northern Spanish coast, 22 Sep 2021. The vessel needed assistance & subsequently was towed to Gijon, Spain. Remains moored at Gijon, as of 23 Sep.
Vessel placed under quarantine on arrival at Callao anchorage, Chile after one crew member tested positive for Covid-19.

Vessel suffered damage to the main engine before its scheduled route from Andros to the port of Rafina, Greece, with 431 passengers on board. It reached the port of Rafina unassisted and the passengers were disembarked. Port Authorities banned the ship from sailing until repairs are carried out.

A crew member needed immediate hospital treatment while vessel was anchored outside the port of Rhodes. A lifeboat was deployed to disembark the patient. He was transported to the General Hospital of Rhodes for treatment.

Vessel had loss of power in both engines & smoke, steam in engine room in position lat 54 52 36N, long 005 42 04W, off Larne, United Kingdom, on 20 Sep 2021. Power restored in both engines and returned to berth in Larne, as of 21 Sep.

Fire broke out aboard vessel approaching Constantza, Romania 20 Sep 2021. Incident investigation inspection was carried out by attended surveyor panel. Vessel remains  stationary at Tuzla shipyard area anchorage 01 Oct.
Vessel detained for undisclosed reasons while anchored at the East side of Gibraltar. It remained at anchor off Gibraltar as of October 16th.
Vessel arrested in Singapore on request of the Premier Law LLC. Further details not available as of now.

Vessel is under detention at Terneuzen Netherlands. She was sailing towards Borssele wind farm, with no signs of changing course. Attempts to find out what was going on was unsuccessful because the Captain of Azerbaijan nationality didn’t speak English well enough to understand. The ship berthed at Terneuzen same day, and was checked. Inspection found a number of deficiencies

Levantes (IMO 9244829) and Clipper Como (IMO 9486570) collided in the Aegean sea, about 10nm south-west of Bozcaada island, Turkey. No information on any damage to the Levantes, but the Clipper Como was  heavily damaged, breached in the portside cargo hold area and taking on water. The ships were sailing in opposite directions when the accident occurred; the Levantes laden with wheat en route from Russia to Egypt, while the Clipper Como was en route from Jorf Lasfar Morocco to Samsun on the northern coast of Turkey, with a cargo of phosphate.

Vessel was reported NUC due to a problem with the engine water cooling system, in lat 52 34 49N, long 002 50 55E, about 41 NM ENE of Lowestoft, 18 Sep 2021. Repair works were completed & it was underway to its destination on the same day.

Vessel had engine problem & was NUC, abt 19.46 NM from Terschelling, Netherlands, in the middle of the TSS, 18 Sep 2021. CG team is in vicinity of the vessel & asked it to leave. Remains anchored in lat 53 22 39N, long 004 40 20E, 22 Sep.

Levantes (IMO 9244829) and Clipper Como (IMO 9486570) collided in the Aegean sea, about 10nm south-west of Bozcaada island, Turkey. No information on any damage to the Levantes, but the Clipper Como was  heavily damaged, breached in the portside cargo hold area and taking on water. The ships were sailing in opposite directions when the accident occurred; the Levantes laden with wheat en route from Russia to Egypt, while the Clipper Como was en route from Jorf Lasfar Morocco to Samsun on the northern coast of Turkey, with a cargo of phosphate.
Fire erupted in superstructure while vessel was docked at Port of Spain, Trinidad. It was extinguished by the port fire team. Vessel to be sold once repairs completed.

Vessel detained at the Port of Buchanan, Liberia, for carrying about 200 metric tons of gypsum, a potentially hazardous waste. It arrived from Lome, Togo with intention to dispose off the hazardous waste in Grand Bassa.

Vessel reported engine trouble while transiting off the shoreline of Barangay Masaguitsit, Lobo, Batangas, Philippines on 16 Sep 2021; sister vessel Seaborne Cargo 5 towed it to anchorage off Lobo, Batangas. No oil spill.

Reports of fire outbreak in a container on board while vessel was at Catania port, Italy. Container was loaded with highly flammable yellow phosphate. Fire was taken under control by firefight and Coast Guard teams.
One crew member had to be medevaced after struggling to breathe and showing signs of distress. Vessel was en route from Dakar, Senegal to Valencia, Spain.
A fire broke out aboard vessel during welding works in 2 cabins, at Lisbon, Portugal on 15 Sep 2021. One worker sustain smoke injuries; fire destroy interior in some parts.
Vessel ran aground during a storm while operating in the Maldives. It was later refloated and scheduled for inspections.
Vessel ran aground during a storm while operating in the Maldives. It was later refloated and scheduled for inspections.

Vessel reportedly came in contact with a barge in Barito River in South Kalimantan, Indonesia on 15 Sep 2021, damaging a number of trucks onboard vessel. Vessel said to have already anchored at Port of Trisakti as of next day.

Vessel suffered engine failure while proceeding downstream on the River Danube in the Sulina Canal, enroute from Reni in Ukraine to Tripoli. It lost control and ran onto the bank in the Tulcea area of Romania, coming into contact with three berthed leisure catamarans. The catamarans sustained damage and canal traffic was blocked for abound 2 hours.
Vessel detained at Kalamata, Greece due to deficiencies in Annex X. of KO 2009/16/EC
One crew member had to be medevaced after suffering diabetes-related complications. Vessel was diverted towards Goa while the Indian Coast Guard assisted with the evacuation.

Vessel collided with LISA AUERBACH at Vung Tau anchorage, southern Vietnam. MY AN 1, loaded with some 10,000 tons of clinker, sank, 17 crew were rescued by LISA AUERBACH. Reports of 40 tons fuel on board but no leaks detected.
Vessel collided with anchored ship MY AN 1 at Vung Tau anchorage, southern Vietnam. MY AN 1, loaded with some 10,000 tons of clinker, sank, 17 crew were rescued by LISA AUERBACH.
Oil spill occurred during bunkering at Taman, Russia, on 14 Sep 2021. Fuel leaked into Black sea. Spill localized. Inspection underway.
Two crew members (Chief Officer and Bosun) were killed after being struck by large wave in rough weather conditions. Vessel was on laden voyage from Brazil to California.

Vessel was detained on September 14th with 24 crew members on board when about 27.5nm southwest of Sekincha. The Malaysian Maritime Enforcement Agency detained the vessel for allegedly anchoring without permission.

13-Sep-2021 : Vessel was issued with a fine for polluting the Gulf of Izmit with hydraulic oil leakage. Further inspections revealed that the leak was due to an explosion of a hose in the hydraulic system of a hatch cover. 29-Apr-2021 : Had structural failure in its cargo hold and pertinent equipment at Hereke, Turkey, 29 Apr 2021. Repairs will be carried out by stevedore duty teams upon completion of discharge operation. Ar in Zonguldak, Turkey, 03 May.

Vessel was in collision with loaded barge BG.1515, which was under tow of the MBP 3208. This occurred at the outer anchorage of Banjarmasin port in southern Kalimantan  upon vessel arrival from Jakarta. It was severely damaged at the bow, suffering a hull breach.

UPDATE: Vessel has been refloated, taken to Gronlandshavnen, and docked. There are still no reported damages. *11-Sep-21: Vessel ran aground in Limfjord, Denmark while en route from Aggersund, Limfjord to Falkenberg, Sweden. According to authorities, ship master reported the incident only in the morning of 12th September. Unknown if any damages and no leak was reported.*

Vessel was en route from Hakata to Fukuoka when it reported possible collision with smaller vessel. Sasebo Coast Guard checked the area and found a capsized boat. One person was found dead and another one missing. After a short stop at Bay of Sasebo, SEIZAN MARU 21 continued its voyage to Fukuoka.
Vessel encountered an engine cooling issue while in the Ionian sea and had to anchor in Greek waters north of Corfu. The ship was en route from Haifa, Israel to Koper, Slovenia when fault occured.

Vessel was caught in typhoon and suffered damages to her portside in cargo area near superstructure, while enroute from Shanghai to Yokohama Japan. Some containers were damaged forcing vessel to turn back and shelter at anchorage north of Shanghai.
Vessel ran aground in Volga, Caspian Sea Channel while en route to Astrakhan, Volga. No damage to the hull was reported.
Vessel suffered engine failure when transiting Bosphorus en route from Izmir, Turkey to Buyukdere, Istanbul. Vessel reported to be still at anchor.

Reports of a fire outbreak in the engine room while vessel was enroute from Livorno, Italy to Gabes, Tunisia. One crew member severley injured and airlifted to hospital while trying to extinguish the fire.
Vessel was reported to be NUC, due to the main engine problem, in position lat 49 35 02N, long 004 38 05W, 11 Sep 2021. Replaced the engine injector & is ready to continue its passage, same day.

Vessel had a problem with its watertight doors, 10 Sep 2021. Resumed its service after completion of repairs. Service will operate in shuttle mode to accommodate the accumulated vehicle traffic from the earlier sailing cancellations.

From Wismar to Cork Ireland vessel had rudder failure while transiting Kiel Canal 10 Sep 2021. Vessel left Voith Quay in Kiel after the end of investigations & surveys & renewal of class maintenance certificate 12 Sep. ETA at Cork, 15 Sep.

Vessel berthed at Moerdijk, Netherlands caught fire in cargo hold containing plywood. Emergency officials say the firefighting will last for several hours as they will have to remove containers from cargo deck to gain access to fire.

Vessel was en route from Denmark to Marin, Spain when it collided with a quay wall while entering Kiel Canal. She was berthed in Canal and then moved to Kiel and berthed in port on 11th September. Vessel suffered hull breaches in bow area and water ingress was reported and will be in need of repairs.

Vessel experienced water ingress into its hull, south of Sanremo, Italy on 09 Sep 2021, decide to return to Genoa for drydocking, inspection & repairs. Vsl safely arrived in Genoa, no assistance needed. Sailed Genoa 12 Sep.

Vessel suffered an explosion during tank’s degassing procedures, followed by white smoke. There was fire after the explosion but it was quickly extinguished by crew. The vessel was docked at Porto de Aratu, Bahia State in Brazil
Vessel reportedly caught fire and was towed to Port Elizabeth to shelter from wind storm. Vessel was en route from Lome Togo to Durban South Africa.

Vessel suffered a mechanical fault in Suez Canal, en route from Constanta, Romania to Port Sudan, Sudan. She was taken under control by Canal's tugs until she reached Great Bitter Lake where she started sailing under own power. Traffic was not affected.

Vessel reported NUC due to electrical blackout, in pos 54 35 25N, 000 31 48W on 08 Sep 2021. Issue identified & repairs underway. Repairs completed on 08 Sep. Test on main engine successful 09 Sep, vessel continued voyage.

Vessel attacked and boarded by 3 armed persons. The crew “engaged” with the pirates in a bid to repel the attack. Two crew members were confirmed to have sustained injuries and are understood to be receiving treatment in hospital. At least one individual is understood to have sustained a gunshot wound. One member of the crew was understood to be missing after the attack.
Vessel ran aground in the Congo river and stood still some 400m away from the navigation buoy. Reportedly there was no severe damage to the vessel, environment, and crew.

Vessel (IMO 9375898) touched bottom twice due to navigational error, east of Sogneoksen island on 08 Sep 2021. Structural damages reported. Vsl underwent repairs in Netaman Repair Group in Estonia from 06 Jan to 10 Feb. Sailed port 18 Feb.

Vessel was berthed at Botlek Rotterdam when cargo of lithium batteries caught fire. Firefighters reportedly had fire under control, but as of 9th September, firefighting was still continuing, with cargo hold closed in order to prevent hazardous fumes from spreading
Vessel had a mechanical issue with one of the main engines, 07 Sep 2021, forcing BC Ferries to cancel a round trip between West Vancouver (Horseshoe Bay) & the Sunshine Coast (Langdale) sailings.

Vessel had a technical failure at Nemrut Bay, Turkey, 07 Sep 2021. Dep permission cancelled by Harbourmaster until completion of repairs. Upon completion of repairs, state surveyors will attend on board. Stationary at Nemrut Bay, 08 Sep.

Vessel still adrift, previously disabled by explosion on 31st August. She will most likely be towed to Montevideo by RG WARRIOR, offshore tug, although, according to local sources, the ZILOS captain reported to MRCC that the crew will restart engine and vessel will arrive at Montevideo on its own
Vessel was seized by Nigerian Navy personnel on September 7th on the Koko River suspected of carrying contraband goods. It was later released on Nov 18th and handed back to owners.

Update - Abandonment alert has been cancelled. The vessel is still adrift but AIS is now on and it does not seem to be abandoned. ETA 7th September with Lae as port of destination. Previously - Vessel found abandoned and adrift in in Vityaz Strait between Papua New Guines and New Britain island. It was off radar from middle of August until 6th September.
Vessel was detained for investigation after a crew member was hit and killed by a broken mooring line on 7th September, at Livorno in Italy.
The vessel was drifting in lat 30 35 09N, long 140 05 07E, 07 Sep 2021. No other details are available.

Vessel in ballast condition experienced technical failure sheltered and dropped anchor at Datca Bay, Turkey, 6 Sep 2021. Repairs have commenced by crew. Vessel remains stationary at anchorage position 6 Sep.
Vessel was towed to Zonguldak, Turkey where it remains for potential shipyard repairs. It broke down on 4th September while en route from Istanbul to Poti Georgia
Vessel reported water ingress due to a leak after arriving in Mongla, Bangladesh on 06 Sep 2021; 87 vehicles in Deck-1 damaged. Leak plugged, water pumped out, all vehicles unloaded on 08 Sep.
Vessel found abandoned and adrift in in Vityaz Strait between Papua New Guines and New Britain island. It was off radar from middle of August until 6th September.

Due to lack of maintenance, vessel was detained at Ghent and after having been idled for fourteen months she was moved to the EDR Antwerp Shipyard on 23 Nov 2022 and was drydocked. She finally sailed Antwerpen on 16 June.

Reports of fire outbreak on the starboard bow while vessel was transporting fuel oil from Gorontalo to Pertamina Depot, Indonesia. It was swiftly extinguished by the crew but one of them suffered severe burns.

Vessel nuc experienced engine failure at 15nm E from Mablethorpe, United Kingdom, in position lat 53 14 54.0N, long 000 42 30.0E, 5 Sep 2021. The defect was rectified & the vessel is now underway to Moerdijk.
Vessel refused entry into port at Nova Scotia due to an outbreak of Covid-19 among its crew members.

Vessel was docked at Ben Nghe, Ho Chin Minh, Vietnam when one of the containers on cargo hold caught fire. It is believed to have been caused by sparks from wielding works happening close to the container. Fire was put away rapidly and there were no other casualties.
Vessel suffered fire damages at UMM Qasr Port. No casualties and fire was extinguished promptly.

Some port workers inhaled poisonous gas emitted by cattle feed on board. The gas was as a result of seawater coming in contact with the livestock feed. 2 workers survived  but unconscious for some hours. A third worker was already dead.

Vessel had a technical issue in its port main engine, 03 Sep 2021. Initially completed repairs. Sea trials discovered the issue with its hull which requires further investigations & hence sailings were cancelled, as of 22 Sep.
Vessel ran aground on the Volga-Caspian Sea Channel while en route from Astrakhan to Baku. No hull damage and no leaks were reported and it was refloated within hours.

Vessel broke down with engine issues, pulled out of Dutch Harbour, Unalaska, USA on 02 Sep 2021. Tug/supply Resolve Pioneer towing vessel to Seattle. According to AIS, convoy located in pos 50 13 42N, 136 54 11W doing 9 knots, as of 08 Sep.
Vessel suffered engine fault while transiting the Straits, in the Black Sea. It was en route from Tuzla Istanbul to Kherson Ukraine. Vessel is now anchored at Turkeli anchorage, Istanbul area.

Vessel detained by the Australian Maritime Safety Authority (AMSA) for allegedly defective cargo-securing arrangements. It was anchored at White Bay berths 2-6 in Sydney where repairs would take place in the coming weeks.
Vessel detained by the Indonesian Navy after it was alleged to have entered territorial waters without permission.
Vessel arrested and detained on the orders of a local high court in Chittagong, Bangladesh.
Vessel was in collision with the Alpha Hermes (IMO 9924352) on the River Volga. Russian authorities carrying out investigations to determine the root cause.

Vessel suffered an engine failure at the Suez Canal while proceeding in a northbound convoy. It was towed back to Suez anchorage. Vessel was en route from Saudi Arabia to Constanta Romania when incident occured.
Vessel had to be disinfected and cleaned after some of the crew members tested positive for Covid-19 and were taken to the hospital.
Vessel sustained major hull breach after being hit by hurricane Ida in the Gulf of Mexico. The Coast Guard responded and have aided the evacuation of crew from the vessel to safety.
Vessel in collision with offshore gas platform B phase 12 at the Pars Gas Field. Much of the damage on the AMPI while very little on the platform.
Vessel ran aground at Carcavelos beach, Lisbon Portugal. Arrangements to refloat the vessel and conduct surveys was made by the Portugese Maritime Forces.

Vessel & Rostov Velikiy came in contact with each other at 2664km mark of River Volga Russia in lat 48 39 44.0N long 043 47 56.0E 1 Sep 2021. Russian Western Interregional Maritime Investigation Department for Transport sent to investigate.

Vessel while scheduled to depart Genoa, had technical trouble, 31 Aug 2021. A representative of the passengers who already had tickets was informed of the serious inconvenience and the shift in schedule.
Reports from crew claiming that vessel has been abandoned by the owner (Liwa Petroleum Marketing, Dubai UAE) living them without wages, electricity, airconditioning, and food.

Reports that a technical superintendent on board fell to his death into an empty cargo tank during a cleanliness check while the vessel was at Canakkale anchorage, north-western Turkey. He died despite being given first aid by the crew. An investigation is ungoing with a public prosecutor on the case.
Vessel stranded at the San Francisco and had to make plans for a crew change after 19 of its crew were taken to the hospital. This was later confirmed as an outbreak of Covid-19
Vessel had engine fault and was disabled on entering the Bosphorus on route to Ukraine. It was later towed to anchorage awaiting further inspection and repairs.

Vessel suffered some damage after being hit by hurricane Ida. All crew aboard the PACIFIC SHARAV, NOBLE GLOBETROTTER I, & NOBLE GLOBETROTTER II have been accounted for according to Noble Corp press statement.

Vessel suffered some damage after being hit by hurricane Ida. All crew aboard the PACIFIC SHARAV, NOBLE GLOBETROTTER I, & NOBLE GLOBETROTTER II have been accounted for according to Noble Corp press statement.
Vessel contacted the Uruguay MRCC to report man overboard. SAR mission still ongoing as of Aug 30th but crew member not yet found.

Vessel reportedly nuc with 20pob stopped to replace the fuel bulb, in position lat 50 47 00.0N, long 52  00.0E, at Hastings, United Kingdom, 29 Aug 2021. The crew replaced the fuel bulb in 30 minutes and proceeded on its voyage.

Reports that 3 of the vessel's crew have tested positive for Covid-19 with two already taken to hospital while others remain in isolation. Vessel arrived Monteviedo interrupting it's planned voyage from Brazil to Argentina.
Vessel sank after her hull was breached when she struck rocks of small Vrak. Karavi islets, Greece. She was on route from Ukraine to Tunisia with 7,000 tons of wheat onboard.

A fire broke out in engine room of vessel while alongside at port of Livorno, Italy 28 Aug 2021. Crew noticed smoke coming from engine room, raised alarm to HM & fire brigade. A boat & port firefighters arrived & put out fire no injuries.

Six crew members needed emergency medical treatment after worsening health conditions. One already declared dead as of the 28th August. Vessel was due to arrive Stanley Falklands from Lagos, Nigeria when forced to anchor at Motevideo, Uruguay.

Vessel ran aground on a coast of islet Es Malvins, Balearic islands, while en route from Ibiza to Formentera island, with 35 passengers and 12 crew on board. Reports of water ingress hours later but all passengers evacuated.

A crew member needed immediate hospital treatment after deteriorating health conditions forcing the vessel to anchor at the port of Gythio. He was transferred to Laconia General Hospital for further treatment.
A crew member had to be medevaced after suffering severe fever and breathing problems. Vessel was sailing off the coast of La Plata when Argentine Navy was alerted to assist.
Vessel arrested by Irish port authorities on allegations of violating fishing regulations.

Vessel had engine failure at the entrance of Istanbul Strait, 27 Aug 2021. Tug Kurtarma-12 & fast rescue boats assisted the vessel. Dropped anchor & remains stationary at Instanbul anch, Turkey, same day.
Vessel NUC in TSS West Terschelling-German Bight, in pos 53 40 06N, 006 01 48E, according to Navigational Warning issued by Netherlands CG on 27 Aug 2021.
Vessel suffered engine failure while approaching the Bosphorus and had to be towed to Istanbul for further inspection and repairs.
Due to awaiting a crew member's COVID-19 test results, Isle of Mull, sailings on this route from Oban to Craignure are liable to disruption or cancellation at short notice.
Vessel ran aground while in transit from Liverpool to Belfast. Unconfirmed reports suggest problems with the rudders. It was later refloated and towed to Douglas, Isle of Man on the 27th August.
Vessel suffered mechanical fault and was disabled. After drifting for several hours, it is now under tow to Lavrio, Greece for inspection and repairs. **August 28th update**

Vessel experienced technical failure at Alexandria, Egypt on 26 Aug 2021. Repairs could not be carried out by crew. Towage to 21 Sep. Damage survey done. Permanent repairs & sea trails completed. Remains at Tuzla Anch., as of 30 Jan.
3 crew members including vessel captain lost their lives after falling into the tank during cleaning operations. Tragic incident occured at Cartagena, Spain.
Vessel experienced technical failure at Mersin, Turkey, 26 Aug 2021. Vessels departure permission cancelled by HM until completion further repairs. Vessel stationary at Mersin.
Described as operational issues, this vessel was forced to make several detours on it's regular crossings from Holyhead to Dublin. Details of the actual fault not yet disclosed.
A crew member died after a spy struck him, while vessel was docking at site 3, Puerto Ventanas, Chile, on 26 Aug 2021. Sailed. 01 Sep.
While towing a barge over the Gastineau Channel, Alaska, it struck the Douglas Bridge and suffered severe damage.

One crew member lost his life while being transferred to the hospital in Chios. He had been reported to be losing consciousness before the Greek authorities were alerted. Vessel was on route to Haifa, Israel from Varna, Bulgaria.

More than a dozen crewmen tested positive for Covid-19 on vessel's arrival to Hong Kong from Shanghai. Authorities have instructed the remaining crew to isolate while also trying to verify the vaccine status of each crew member.
OCEAN MANTA & OCEAN GOBY arrested and detained at Singapore on court orders with warrant obtained by Asialegal LLC.

Vessel had engine failure upon its departure from the Stazioni Maritime in Genoa, Italy, 24 Aug 2021. The passengers along with their respective cars were transferred onto Moby Wonder. After troubleshooting, the vessel was back in service.
Vessel suffered engine failure while in waters of More og Romsdal, Norway, en route from Kristiansund to Bergen. Disabled ship was caught in rough weather and dropped both anchors to prevent drift.

Due to a technical issue with the steering gear pump on board Arrow, is currently off service on 24 Aug 2021 & 25 Aug. After completion of repairs, the vessel will return to service with the 2230 hrs, freight sailing departing Stornoway.
Vessel suffered engine failure while in transit the Straits onwards Kavkaz. It was towed back to Ahirkapi anchorage for inspection and repairs.
Vessel had fire on board at Bredo Shipyard, Bremerhaven, Germany, on 24 Aug 2021. Fire put out by fire brigade. Extent of damages/cause unknown.
Fire erupted in the galley area and spread quickly around vessel superstructure while in anchor at Tabaco City, Albay, Philippines. No injuries reported among crew members.
Vessel detained by PSC in Savona after a number of navigation safety deficiencies and other violations were catalogued.
Recently declared 'missing' but according to the non-profit organization (UANI), vessel has been spotted off the coast of Iran suspected to be loading/discharging cargo at Bandar Abbas.
Vessel lost stability and began to list starboard due to a fault with ballasting operation. It was later restored to an even keel and no injuries reported.
Australian authorities have arrested vessel master after it was alleged to have damaged an underwater cable linking West Oz to Singapore.
Vessel experienced problems with its engine in position lat 36 07 30.0N, long 005 15 15.0W, at Spain, on 23 Aug 2021. The defect was rectified and the vessel continued on its voyage.
OCEAN MANTA & OCEAN GOBY arrested and detained at Singapore on court orders with warrant obtained by Asialegal LLC.
Reports of a fire outbreak onboard while vessel was approaching Valletta, Malta. Crew was able to use the onboard fire extinguishers to put out the fire. No injuries reported.

Vessel 362pob sustained mechanical damage 6.8nm S of Corfu Greece 22 Aug 2021. Port Authority of Igoumenitsa informed vessel able to sail to Igoumenitsa inspection team found defects in port axle of No.2 port main engine detained vessel.

Vessel while transiting the westbound lane of the Singapore Strait, Malaysia, was boarded by robbers in position 1 18 03.0N 104 14 31.0E, 20 Aug 2021. Four robbers, 2 with knives, threatened engineer alarm raised some engine spares stolen.

Vessel nuc with 13pob experienced problems with its engine in position lat 54 52 22.2N, long  000 16 31.2W, 33nm off Hartlepool, UK 22 Aug 2021. Engineers investigated issue shaft generator not affecting main engine vessel now underway.

Vessel engine was overloaded in position lat 50 24 18N, long 000 41 50W, 25nm SE of ST.Catherines Point, Isle of Wight, United Kingdom, 22 Aug 2021. All leakages in its engine space. No pollution reported. No estimated time for repairs.
Vessel came in contact with drawbridge between Jarzouna & Bizerte in Port of Bizerte, Tunisia, while manoeuvering to leave quay at berth No. 1, on 22 Aug 2021. Bridge traffic resumed after one hour.
Vessel's Chief Mate was found dead and his body floating three days after he fell overboard while inspecting the ships draft.
One crew member had to be medevaced after his health condition became critical. Vessel was on route from Ibiza to Mallorca at the time of incident.
Vessel spilled oil in the Gulf of Izmit after an overflow from the tanks. Authorities have issued a fine of $400K but clean up operations still ongoing.
Vessel arrested and detained for anchoring in Malaysian waters without permission. Some of the crew were taken to Selangor for further investigation and possibly to be issued with the fine!
The Majority of the crew tested positive for Covid-19, Rikitea, France, 20 Aug 2021. Vessel arrived at Rikitea 23 Aug. Medical team  examined crew vessel remains in Rikitea as of 24 Aug.
Passengers and vehicles had to disembark at port Rafina after vessel suffered engine malfunction. Planned repairs to take place at Marmarion after vessel allowed to sail.

Vessel had technical failure of pumping, piping system along with anchor handling device at Novorossiysk, Russia, 20 Aug 2021. Upon completion of repairs sailed from Novorossiysk, Russia, 23 Aug. ETA at Cartagena, Spain, 31 Aug.

Vessel (IMO: 9019573), had an engine failure in Tasucu, Turkey on 20 Aug 2021. Crews unable to carry out repairs. Tug Haktan 1 (IMO: 9899648) towed vessel same day & arrived Tuzla, 27 Jan. Permanent repairs underway after a damage survey

Vessel while transiting eastbound lane of Singapore Strait Malaysia boarded by 4 armed robbers with knives lat 01 15 13N long 104 6 27E 20 Aug 2021. Crew confronted by pirates alarm was raised crew conducted search engine spares were stolen
Reports that all 22 crew members tested positive for Covid-19 and forced into self isolation.
Vessel ran aground near fishing port in Yunlin county. Indonesian Coast Guard deployed and rescued all crew members onboard.

Vessel had technical failure during its Strait passage & dropped anchor at Buyukdere anchorage in the Strait, 19 Aug 2021. Repairs were commenced by the crew members and the vessel remains stationary at anchorage position, as of 19 Aug.

Vessel experienced propulsion failure due to turbo charger problem about 60Km in the south-west of  Pointe du Raz, France, on 19 Aug 2021. Vessel towed to Brest for repairs. Sailed Brest on 22 Aug, ETA at Hamina, Finland 28 Aug.

Vessel had an issue with engine crank, anchored in lat 53 42 28N, long 000 25 54W, in Humber river, near Humber bridge, 19 Aug 2021. The vessel was taken under tow by harbour tugs to Albert Dock, Hull. Reported alongside, same day.
Vessel found responsible for benzene leak during loading operations, at Haifa, Israel, on 19 Aug 2021. Vessel released after 100,000 dollars bail was paid. Investigation underway.
Vessel ran aground after an engine failure  on the Rasfaree Reef of the Kaafu Atoll, Maldives while en route from Tuticorin to Saldanha.
Vessel granted permission to drop off 165 rescued migrants in Sicily, Italy.

Vessel's landing platform was found to be unserviceable, 18 Aug 2021, as it was due to depart Myrina for Kavala. P Auth of Myrina detained the vessel in the port. After repairs, the vessel departed for its scheduled service.
Vessel in ballast condition experienced technical failure sheltered & dropped anchor at Bodrum Bay, Turkey, 18 Aug 2021. Crew doing repairs vessel remains at Bodrum anchorage.
Vessel allided with the Shatt Al Arab (IMO 9886316) in the port of Colombo while  berthed at the Bandaranyake Wharf for cargo operations. It suffered minor damage to its port side.

Vessel had engine failure, lost power & was drifting at Kepez point in Canakkale Strait, 18 Aug 2021. Tug Kurtarma-4 & fast rescue boat along with technical team assisted the vessel. Stationary at Karanlik liman anchorage, as of 19 Aug.

Vessel allided with the AS Sicilia (IMO 9430935) in the port of Colombo while  she was berthed at the Bandaranyake Wharf for cargo operations. Shatt Al-Arab was undergoing sea trials when the accident happened. The AS Sicilia suffered minor damage to its port side.

Vessel upon its arrival in Ardrossan, UK, had an issue with bow visor seal, 17 Aug 2021. Engineers boarded & carried out an inspection. Vessel intends to depart Ardrossan at 1230, 1520, 1800 hrs & Brodick at 1350, 1640, 1920 hrs, 18 Aug.
Vessel remained at the quay due to technical anomalies in Genova, Italy, on 17 Aug 2021. All the 750 passengers were stranded. Vessel remains stationary at the Stazioni Marittime as of 20 Aug.

Vessel while berthed at Beverello jetty in port of Naples, Italy reportedly came in contact with ferry Vesuvio Jet on 17 Aug 2021; no damage; ferry damaged above WL. No injuries. Ferry remains at Naples as of 18 Aug.
Vessel not under control following a mechanical fault. It was towed to La Coruna and moored for further inspections and repairs.

Vessel had a leak in the air valve exhaust fumes on a cylinder, abt 10 NM E of Cromer, 17 Aug 2021. Anchored to effect repairs estimating 3 hours for the completion. Completed repairs. Ar in Zeebrugge, 17 Aug & Sd same day.
Turkish port authorities issued vessel with a fine of $177,500 for illegaly discharging ballast water at port Mersin.
One crew member had to be medevaced after his health condition worsened onboard. The Indian Coast Guard received distress signal and responded with their own medic team.

5 crew members tested positive for Covid-19. Another 2 were rushed to the hospital when vessel arrived Santos, Brazil. As of August 23rd, one was declared dead while rest of the crew remain in isolation.
Vessel ran aground 4 weeks ago while transporting police officers from Apia to Savai'i in response to a human rights protest.

Vessel had damage to the port main engine while proceeding to Laurium at reduced speed, 16 Aug 2021. The vessel arrived safely at Laurium, where the vessel was detained in port until the engine was repaired.
Vessel departure permission withdrawn at port Dortyol following a mechanical fault. Arrangements had to be made for repairs and survey inspection.

Suspected case of suicide as fashion mogul (Kai Wunsche) is alleged to have fallen overboard on the 16th of August. Search team found his body washed up on the island of Terschelling, Netherlands on the 23rd of August 2021.

Vessel involved in migrant rescue mission in the Med Sea. Reports that the vessel may be stranded with no port allowing it entry as of August 19 2021. **Further update on August 23rd, vessel has now been given permission by the Italian authorities to berth in Augusta, Sicily with 322 migrants onboard.**

One crew member died due to Covid-19 on vessel moored at the Santana Anchorage, Brazil, 16 Aug 2021. Another crew member also tested positive, rest of the crew were tested with results pending. Ship put under quarantine.

Vessel while entering Istanbul Strait from S entrance for transit passage, had a technical failure during its Strait passage at Uskudar point in the Strait, 15 Aug 2021. Returned to Istanbul anch. Repairs were carried out by the crews.
One crew member had to be medevaced to hospital by Spanish Maritime Authorities after his health condition worsened.
Vessel had a technical issue, 15 Aug 2021, which was experienced after running routine safety drills. Hence the 0945 hrs, sailing departing Port Askaig will be delayed.
Vessel sailing has been canceled due to an electrical issue in Lochboisdale, United Kingdom, on 15 Aug 2021. A review will be made later in the day.

Vessel had an engine failure shortly after it departed Helsinki, 15 Aug 2021, interrupting the Helsinki-Aarhus freight service. Orion towing the vessel to Nynashamn, Sweden, for repairs. Sailed, 22 Aug.

Vessel in collision with a 30-metre yacht, 4 nm off Ponza, Italy in the Tyrrhenian sea on 14 Aug 2021. Yacht severely damaged at SB side, its passengers rescued. Yacht towed to shallow waters in bay of Cala Inferno where it sank.

Vessel while en route from Kavala to Laurium, Greece, with 375 passengers OB, reported engine failure at Kafirea sea area, Kavo Doro, near Evoia Island on 14 Aug 2021. Subsequently vessel arrived at Laurium, helped by a tug, same day.

Vessel had technical failure at Varna Bulgaria 14 Aug 2021. Vessel entered shipyard upon completion of formalities. Damage survey was carried out by class surveyor with Owner’s superintendent & shipyard duty engineers. Vessel at Tuzla.

Vessel collided with fishing vessel about 30 NM northeast of Con Co island, Quang Tri province, Gulf of Tonkin, Vietnam on 14 Aug 2021. Fishing vsl sank. Vsl rescued and disembarked fishermen at Cua Vet, Vietnam, 14 Aug. Vsl underway 15 Aug

International Health Personnel belonging to COEPRIS quarantined vessel off the Port of Tampico, Mexico due 26 cases of COVID-19 13 Aug 2021. Vessel dropped anchor in position 22 14 57.0N 097 36 45.6W, 43 crew are in mandatory isolation.
Vessel attacked by Pirates in the Indian Ocean. Unconfirmed reports suggest vessel may have been on humanitarian mission.
Fire broke out in the engine room while vessel was off Grimstad, Norway. The crew managed to use onboard extinguisher, disable the vessel and had it towed to Eydehavn.
One crew member reported dead and another 9 struck with Coronavirus while vessel was discharging it's cargo at Mauritius.
Vessel arrived in Belize this week reporting 27 cases of COVID-19, almost all among vaccinated crew members, according to Belize officials.

Noor 1 (IMO 7104441) struck an underwater reef off Suakin, 12 Aug 2021, which ripped up the bottom of the hull & it lost 1 of its 2 propellers. Owners calculated the repair expense to be high. It was declared as a constructive total loss.

Some migrants (4 confirmed) drowned at sea while vessel was carrying out a rescue operation for dozens who were stuck in their boat trying to cross the channel. Reports that 9 other migrants were found dead already before the operation began.
Vessel in collision with Providence (oil tanker) while in operation at Thessaloniki. It sustained damage to the starboard side and now awaiting repairs.
On Wednesday, vessel ran aground. 24hrs later it split into two and spills oil around the Hachinohe Port, Japan. All crew members were safely rescued.

Vessel nuc 11pob experienced problems with an input airwell of main engine & drifting 12.6nm 138 degrees from Beachy Head, United Kingdom,in position 50 34 39.2N 000 27 44.9E, 11 Aug 2021. Repairs were completed & continuing its passage.
Vessel allided with Tug boat Megalochari XII while departing from Thessaloniki, Greece. Damage to the side of the Tug forced it out of side pending repairs.

Vessel experienced machinery failure while transiting Strait of Georgia near Sand Heads, B.C. Canada, in position 49 05 15.0N123 20 58.8W, 11 Aug 2021. Vessel anchored to carry out repairs in English Bay.
Turkish Coast Guard responded to help put out fire onboard after vessel anchored at Iskenderun Bay from Benghazi.
Vessel forced to perform crew change in Mooloolaba following the death of a crew member who fell off pilot ladder during disembarkment.
On arrival at Helsinki, collided with a pier but no injuries or major damage reported.
A major explosion on vessel was docked in Port of Lattakia, Syria, 10 Aug 2021. Injured 2 people cause of fire is unknown.

Vessel while under the conduct of a pilot, reported being disabled due to a machinery failure in Vancouver, B.C. Canada in position 48 18 05.9N 123 04 46.2W, 10 Aug 2021. Vessel anchored with assistance of a tug.
Suspected outbreak of Covid-19 among crew members although vessel now enroute to Zhoushan, China.
A passenger onboard had to be arrested for unruly behaviour and for risking the lives of other passengers while vessel docked at Gdynia, Poland.
Worker aboard the FPSO had to be medevaced after his health conditions got worse. He was taken to hospital with the Taranaki Rescue Helicopter.
11 crew members tested positive for Covid-19 while the vessel after vessel arrived Port Tauranga, New Zealand.

Vessel allided with its stern on lower working double-leaf gate of lock No. 5 on Volgo-Don Ship Canal, 17 NM south of Volgograd on 09 Aug 2021. No injuries. Investigation underway. Arrived Rostov on 13 Aug.

Vessel had engine problems, 08 Aug 2021. Brimil was tasked to assist the vessel. Took about 19 hours to pull the vessel to the quay of the MEST shipyard in Torshavn, 09 Aug. The vessel sailed again, 15 Aug.

Vessel was intercepted by Spanish joint forces of police & customs, about 40 NM S of Fuerteventura, 08 Aug 2021, on suspicion of narcotics trafficking. The vessel had water ingress & engine breakdowns. Taken to Las Palmas & detained.
Vessel arrested and detained by Libyan Authorities for sailing inside the No Sail Zone.

Vessel came in contact with the dock while departing Sarnia, Ontario, Canada, in position 42 56 08.9N 82 26 45.6W, 8 Aug 2021. Vessel proceeded to anchor& to assess damages. Minor damage to vessel & the dock was reported.
Vessel crew reported a flooded engine room while vessel was in transit from Barranquilla to San Andreas. All of the crew members had to leave the ship during rescue ops conducted by the LUNA MAERSK.

Vessel experienced structural failure in cargo hold & pertinent equipment during cargo discharge at Hereke, Turkey 7 Aug 2021. Repairs will be carried out by stevedore duty teams on completion of discharge operation. Vessel is at Hereke.
Vessel issued a distress signal from position lat 05 23 04S, long 113 17 04E, in the Java Sea, 07 Aug 2021. Vessels in the vicinity are requested to keep a sharp lookout & assist if possible.
Vessel briefly ran aground at the Parana River then refloated with assistance from tug boats in the vicinity.
Crew member tested positive for Covid-19 forcing vessel to suspend sailing across Lake Michigan. Other crew members also in quarantine awaiting test results.

UPDATE: Vessel was photographed in abandoned state at the quay in the port of Tarragona on Aug 4, 2022, with no repairs having taken place after the fire. Tarragona port authorities report that firefighters managed to put out fire onboard which started in one of the lifeboats. Fortunately, no livestock onboard the vessel.
Vessel issued a $160K  fine by Turkish Port Authorities (Mersin) due to ballast water discharge violation.
Vessel itinerary cancelled after crew member tested positive with Covid-19. Replacement ferry used as a temporary backup.
Vessel ran aground shortly after transiting the Suez enroute from Ukraine to China.
One crew member with Covi-19 symptoms hospitalized while vessel was in berth at Santos Brazil

En route from Zeebrugge Belgium to Southampton UK vessel reported main engine problem with oil leaking from oil wheel in pos 50 39 30N 000 27 6E UK 6 Aug 2021. Vessel reached Southampton, 7 Aug and is estimated to reach Gibraltar,10 Aug.
Vessel issued distress signal to the Pakistani Maritime Authorities after experiencing a failure of it's propulsion system. It was later towed to Karachi, all crew members accounted for.
A crew member suffered breathing difficulties and collapsed. The USCG medics were contacted and went on to medivac the patient to the Corpus Christi Medical Centre.
Vessel reported at being risk of grounding and dragged anchor in pos lat 53 59 27N, long 128 40 46W, Kitimat, Canada, on 05 Aug 2021. Vsl repositioned with tug assistance on 05 Aug
Vessel reported dragging anchor and being at risk of grounding in position 53 59 25N, 128 40 67W, Kitimat, Canada, on 05 Aug 2021. Vsl repositioned with tug assistance on 05 Aug.
Vessel due to a technical issue with its onboard fire detection system delayed its sailing from Craignure on 4 Aug 2021.

Vessel not under command due to a defect at in pos 52 41 12N, 001 44 50E on 04 Aug 2021. Crew said 2hrs needed to effect repairs. Repairs completed. Vsl underway to Immingham Anch., United Kingdom, as of 04 Aug.
Vessel arrest status lifted after several years in detention following commercial payment dispute.
Vessel intercepted and detained by the Libyan National Army while sailing in a designated 'No Sail Zone' towards Misurata.

14th March 2021 : On arrival from Kavala in Mytilene, Greece, vessel informed Port Authority of Mytilene on 14 Mar 2021 that catapult was damaged. Authority issued a sailing ban until repairs done. 3rd August 2021 : Vessel Captain reports to port authorities that during depature, vessel allided with breakwater due to engine malfunction. Vessel now banned from sailing until it can present a certificate of seaworthiness by reputable class society.

LLI AIS tracking shows vessel, headed towards Oman after armed boarders who seized the vessel on Tuesday evening left vessel & declared as safe by UK military group. The crews disabled engines to prevent gunmen from diverting it to Iran.
Vessel Captain arrested and sentenced to prison after trial for sailing into disputed territory Boyazi, (Northern Cyprus) on two  occassions last year.

Vessel c/w the lock system in Brunsbuttel, Germany, 03 Aug 2021. Starboard side stern hit the port niche of the former central gate. Vessel sustained scratches at port side. Berthed at CTT in Hamburg. Vsl after repairs departed on 04 Aug.
One crew member was medevaced while vessel was out at sea near Cardenas. He was reported to have severe bleeding peptic ulcer and is undergoing treatment at a Mexican hospital
Vessel had an engine failure, loss of power & drifted off Ambarli, Turkey, 03 Aug 2021. Tugs assisted the vessel. Sailed 06 Aug.
Vessel ran aground at the Caspian channel while en route to Astrakan, Russia from Amirabad, Iran.

Vessel experienced technical issue on 02 Aug 2021. Route transferred to another vessel. Departure from Stornoway & Departure from Ullapool on 03 Aug cancelled. Repairs completed. Vessel back operating to timetable.
Vessel suffered engine failure, drifted and ran aground at Sulangan Island while enroute to China. All crew evacuated and no casualty.
In collision with the Bulk Shenzhen (208,000 Dwt bulk carrier) at the Yangtze River. Further investigations ongoing.
A crew member was medevaced by the USCG while vessel was sailing off Galveston coast. He is believed to be in stable condition at the University of Texas medical centre.
Vessel hull damaged at the bow following a collision with the bulk carrier (RB Lisa) at the Yangtze River
As many as 25 crew members tested positive for Covid-19 while vessel was at Batangas, Philippines.
Vessel (IMO 9007283) experienced technical failure docked at Dover, United Kingdom from 01 Aug 2021. Vsl sold and renamed as Sea Anatolia. Vsl berthed at Yalova, Turkey on 07 Feb. Repairs underway.

Vessel reported technical failure at Flushing, Netherlands on 01 Aug 2021. Fire fighting tug Sea Juliett towed vessel to Tuzla, entered shipyard on 29 Sep. Spares provided by owners. Repairs ongoing, as of 19 Feb 2022.
Vessel issued may-day alert after crew noticed ingress while on route to Chittagong. 18 crew members abandoned ship with lifeboat and were rescued by the MCC CHITTAGONG.

Vessel was reported NUC due to its main engine failure, in lat 49 48 16N, long 003 21 28W, in the English Channel, 01 Aug 2021. Repairs were being carried out by the crew. After about 3 hrs, defect rectified, vessel continued passage.
One passenger onboard vessel tested positive for Covid Bahamas, on 30 Jul 2021. The passenger was fully vaccinated.
2 crew members killed in a suspected case of piracy attack on the vessel while sailing off the coast of Oman.
Vessel ran aground while approaching Buenos Aires from Corpus Christi on a laden voyage. It was later refloated and anchored at La Plata for inspection.
Vessel ran aground at Akrotiri Papa Araxos while en route to Vassiliko. Arrangements for salvage still ongoing as of 2nd of August
One crew member medevaced to the General Hospital of Thira. No confirmed reports from the Greek authorities as to his condition.
Reports that vessel sank due to rough weather around 180 nautical miles off Kutch, India. 5 crew members rescued but another 13 still missing as of 29th July.

Vessel reportedly nuc with 20 pob reported problems with cooling in main engine in position 49 29 43.0N,006 45 39.0W, 29nm sw of Isles of Scilly, United Kingdom, 29 July 2021. Vessel disabled & adrift.

Vessel was reported NUC, due to an unknown fault, in lat 50 02 56N, long 002 30 58W, about 32 NM S of Portland Bill, 29 Jul 2021. Crews shut down the engines & found the fault to be low pressure. Resumed voyage, 35 minutes later.
The divers has been allowed to carry out minor repairs on Lord of the Isles, while at Armadale, Scotland, 28 Jul 2021. Subsequently, few sailings have been cancelled, 29 Jul.
One passenger onboard had to be airlifted to hospital following medical emergency. Vessel was on a 3-day cruise from Liverpool
In collision with a fishing boat (Commission). The later was seriously damaged while vessel was ordered to change course to Auckland for further investigations.
Following reports of scuffles among passengers, the local police at Greenock, Scotland were invited to remove the culprits from the vessel. They were later charged for unacceptable conduct.
Vessel was anchored when United Grace came in contact with it at anchorage area 4 of Sao Luis Roads, Brazil, 28 Jul 2021. Both vessels reportedly was damaged.
Vessel came in contact with CL Guilin at anchorage at area 4 of Sao Luis Roads, Brazil, 28 Jul 2021. both vessels damaged hull of vessel was reported damaged.
One crew member medevaced to Southland Hospital New Zealand after sufferring Covid-19 symptoms. Others were required to self-isolate onboard to avoid leaving vessel unmanned.
Vessel out of control after engine failure then proceeded to collide with the BBC Parana at the Kiel Canal
14 crew members tested positive for Covid-19 and had to isolate on board while 2 with more severe symptoms disembarked at Port Santos for hospital treatment.
Came in contact with the Orasund (9336701) while transiting the Kiel Canal. Reports that the Orasund was out of control following an engine failure.
Vessel suffered a breach and ingress after grounding at Lichadonisia, Greece. 5 passengers and 11 crew onboard all rescued.

En route from Oktyabrsk, Ukraine to Bandirma, Turkey, vessel reported technical failure, after entering Istanbul Strait from the northern entrance for transit passage on 26 Jul 2021, dropped anchor at Buyukdere anch. Crew commenced repairs.

Vessel had technical failure at Toros Gubre, Turkey on 26 Jul 2021, departure permission cancelled by HM until completion of repairs. Crews carried out repairs. Vessel sailed from Toros Gubre after its repairs, 27 Jul.
3 crew members including the Second Officer had to be medevaced to hospital for severe Covid-19 symptoms when vessel arrived Fremantle, Australia.
Vessel's fuel filters blocked due to sludge in position 50 19 49.0N 001 07 21.0W, 25 Jul 2021. Defect rectified & one of two main engines restored. Vsl arrived Falmouth, 26 Jul.

Vessel had a double engine failure in position 49 53 35.0N 005 12 10.0W, 4 NM S of Lizard Point, United Kingdom, 25 Jul 2021. Reportedly NUC standing by for assessment by an engineer. Rectified its defect & underway to its destination.

Vessel under the conduct of a pilot, had a machinery failure, in lat 48 21 27N, long 123 20 06W, abt 2.74 NM SSW of Race Rocks, while transiting the Juan de Fuca Strait, Canada, 25 Jul 2021. Anchored in Constance Bank to effect repairs.

Vessel ran aground in position 57 43 43N 006 18 16W off Eilean Trodday, Isle of Skye, UK on 25 Jul 2021. MRCC Stornoway alerted. Vessel arrived Stornoway outer anch same day, to be inspected by divers for any damage.
Vessel capsized off South China coast with 4 out of the 70 crew men still missing as of 28th July 2021.

Due to a technical issue on board Arrow on 24 Jul 2021, ferry Loch Seaforth will be operating the overnight freight service commencing from 25 Jul 25 to 28 Jul. Following sailings from Stornoway, at 2100 hrs, 26 Jul, have been cancelled.

Vessel while under the conduct of a pilot, had a machinery failure, in lat 54 11 467N, long 130 21 45W, while departing Prince Rupert, British Columbia, Canada, 24 Jul 2021. Crews carried out the repairs & the vessel resumed its voyage.
12 crew members tested positive for Covid-19. One declared dead while 11 others were in isolation for 14 days.
Lost towed barge (SINGA BESAR 2801) in rough sea conditions while sailing in the Andaman Sea.
Vessel NUC due to main engine problems in pos 50 11 56.0N 001 39 12.0W in UK waters on 22 Jul 2021. NUC again in pos 50 05 08N 002 18 48W on 23 Jul 2021. Few hours later problem resolved, under way.
Vessel experienced engine failure south of Alanya, Turkey in pos 35 58 30N, 032 11 30E on 21 Jul 2021. Repairs are being carried out by crew & vessel was drifting on 22 Jul.

Vessel sailings due to technical issues on the Lochboisdale-Mallaig route, UK, 21 Jul 2021. Undergoing repairs to its port side propeller, at Kennacraig. Sailings from Mallaig & Armadale cancelled on 23 Jul.
Vessel experienced blackout when the engine failed while enroute to Mumbai. Unconfirmed reports that vessel sank hours later
Vessel unable to leave Portsmouth because of a technical fault. Owner disclosed that they recently upgraded the onboard technology and this may have been part of the cause.

Vessel had a starboard main engine machinery failure while transiting Fitz Hugh Sound, in lat 51 39 24N, long 127 52 27W, off Hecate Island, British Columbia, Canada, 21 Jul 2021. Crews completed repairs & it resumed the voyage.
Crew member suspected of having a stroke was medivaced while vessel coasting off Galveston, Texas
According to Liberty Blue Shipmanagement, 8 of the crew members have tested positive for Covid-19. Arrangements are being made for those afftected to self-isolate on board.
Vessel listed dangerously starboard side due to water ingress in cargo hold. Tug boats with additional pumps used to rescue the vessel from sinking.
Vessel detained for 15 days at Sunderland, UK it has emerged after inspection authorities found 22 deficiencies. Reports that vessel was released on August 4th and proceeding to Ghent, Belgium.
Vessel detained at Chattogram, Bangladesh following a High Court order.
Crew member involved in a fatal accident during cargo operations while vessel was at dock in Liverpool. Authorities carrying out investigation into the death.
While bunkering with the Desna (IMO 8331510) there was an oil spill resulting from a broken hose.
Reports from the Malaysian Maritime Agency that the vessel caught fire at midday. Several hours later it was extinguished.
Vessel detained at Chittagong anchorage following a litigation at local high court.
Reported sunk at port of Aden
Two crew members were medivaced to the University of Texas Medical Branch at Galveston after developing breathing problems. Reports from the hospital confirm the two men are in stable condition.

Seiwa Maru after arriving at the Toyohashi Port, Japan, c/w the starboard rear side of Ananya Naree, 18 Jul 2021. Seiwa Maru sustained damage to its starboard handrail, while no damage was reported by Ananya Naree.
Vessel experienced mechanical problems and thereby was sidelined at the WSF terminal in Kingston, USA, on 17 Jul 2021. Remains sidelined as of 18 Jul.

Vessel ran aground off Venice, Italy, in position 45 31 00.0N 012 43 02.0E, 16 Jul 2021. Vsl was re-floated by tugs & went to Venice anchorage damage survey & underwater inspection is ongoing. Vsl stationary at Venice anchorage.
Vessel ran aground on River Don, 2nm from Azov, Russia in pos 47 07 48N, 039 27 24 on 16 Jul 2021. No reported pollution & River fairway traffic not blocked. Vessel refloated on 16 Jul.

Vessel 23pob reported problems with the exhaust valve on main engine,no power to the engine unable to manoeuver in pos 50 29 05.0N 000 02 43.0W, UK 16 Jul 2021. No pollution reported. Repairs done vsl was underway.

Vessel had an engine failure during its Istanbul Strait passage & urgently dropped its anchor at Umuryeri point in the Strait under the supervision of Strait pilot on board, 16 Jul 2021. Towed & it remains stationary at Turkeli anchorage.
Vessel nuc experienced problems with the engine off Mahebourg, Mauritius, 16 Jul 2021. Vsl expected to reach destination on 27 Jul.
Vessel ran aground at Vagsoy island, Vestland, Norway while en route from Sandnes to Vogra island. It refloated under its own means and then proceeded to Maloy.

Vessel was NUC, due to an issue with its propellers, in lat 43 01 03N, long 010 07 08W, about 36 miles from Madrid shore, 15 Jul 2021. Crews were able to complete the repairs, on the same day & it continued voyage.

Vessel sustained a starboard main engine failure in St.Lawrence Seaway off Sainte-Catherine Quebec Canada in pos 45 24 22.3N 073 36 00.3W, 14 Jul 2021. Vsl proceeded using its other engine to Sainte-Catherine, to assess problem  & to repair
Vessel nuc with 13pob experienced engine problem 41nm East of Bawdsey, United Kingdom, in position 52 00 52.1N 002 30 59.3E, 14 Jul 2021. Repairs were completed & underway to Hallstavik.

Vessel allided with pier at Seeland Quay, Germany, while trying to berth 14 Jul 2021. Vsl came in contact with walkway, which partially collapsed & fell into water after a dolphin was pushed aside. Vsl sustained slight damage to port side.
