Vessel ran aground onto shallows, while departing the Port of Mizushima, Japan, on 14 Jul 2021. Vsl refloated on 14 Jul and is anchored at Mizushima anchorage as of 15 Jul 2021. No injuries, flooding, or oil spills reported.

Vessel was expelled by water police from Port of Hamburg, Germany, after it turned out that it was carrying about 1000 tons of the dangerous chemical ammonium nitrate on 14 Jul 2021. Vsl diverted to Bremerhaven.
Lost some of the containers overboard during bad weather in the Arabian Sea. Vessel moored and discharged remaining cargo as of August 9, 2021 in Sokhna, Egypt.
In collision with Amaryllis (IMO 1010519) while it was berthed at Gunwharf Quays at Portsmouth, UK. The Constanze suffered damage to its railings and gel coat.
In collision with Constance (IMO 1003176) at Gunwharf Quays at Portsmouth, UK. The Constanze suffered damage to its railings and gel coat.

Vessel had a technical failure while entering Canakkale Strait from the southern entrance & anchored at Karanlik anchorage, 13 Jul 2021. Completed repairs which were carried out by the crews. Underway to Eregli.
Reports that half of the crew onboard tested positive for Covid-19. Some required hospitalization while vessel moored at port Nagoya.
Cruise voyage cancelled after a passenger on board tested positive 3 days after testing negative for Covid-19. Company policy provisions for this sort of scenario.

Vessel allided with the rocky islet Avgo at Kithira due to a damaged rudder. Later inspection found damage to the bow and the hull, including a 4m long breach in the transverse axis amidships. No pollution or injury reported.

Vessel had an explosion & subsequently an engine room fire, at the Aligas Metas Shipbreaking, Turkey, 12 Jul 2021. This mishap claimed the lives of two workers, who were in the process of dismantling the vessel.

Vessel reported fire in engine room, in pos lat 54 44 44N, long 05 38 38W, about 3.9 NM from Kilroot, United Kingdom, on 12 Jul 2021. Coastguard and lifeboats attended immediately and extinguished fire. Vsl being brought to Belfast, UK.

Vessel experienced mechanical issues, allided with barge on the Lower Mississippi River just below Algiers Point, about 1.7 nautical miles from New Orleans General Anch, USA, on 12 Jul 2021. Damage to both vessels. Investigation underway.

Vessel had the main engine breakdown off Le Morne Mauritius, in lat 20 20 59S, long 056 44 50E, 12 Jul 2021. It reached Port Louis under its own power; at anchorage for repairs, 14 Jul. Completed repairs & sailed from Port Louis, 14 Jul.

Vessel had an engine failure, inside northern lock of Kiel Canal in Brunsbuttel, Germany, 12 Jul 2021. 2 tugs towed it to railway station pilings in Brunsbuttel for inspections & repairs. Sailed from Brunsbuttel 18 Jul.
A crane fell onto deck at Shakhtersk during loading operations. No serious damage and the crane was promptly raised. It fell a second time onto the vessel. No injuries were reported.

Vessel was carrying two people infected with Covid-19 and will dock in Wellington, New Zealand. 20 crew members on board will be undergoing a comprehensive health check, including testing, on arrival.
In collision with ultra large container carrier (Zephyr Lumos, 9864227) while in transit through the Strait of Malacca. Reports of oil spillage from the Galapagos which was heavily damaged.
In collision with the Galapagos (9473169) while enroute from Singapore to the Suez. This occured after the Galapagos experienced technical fault with the steering sytem causing it to go off lane.
Vessel experienced engine failure at Las Palmas, Spain from 10 Jul 2021. Repairs could not be carried out by crew & a tug starting towing vessel on 15 Jul from incident scene to Istanbul, ETA 04 Aug.
Reports of fire outbreak on cargo deck which was later extinguished. Vessel recently completed drydocking at Indonesian dockyard.
The master and some crew members were arrested at Iskenderun, Turkey following allegations of drug trafficking.
This luxury yacht was cast off from MV Werften shipyard, Germany, on July 10th, sailing out of Stralsund with a fully vaccinated crew, en route to Reykjavik, Iceland, on July 15th.

Community of Cartagena warned of possible high risk contamination emerging from vessel which remains abandoned in Cartagena Shipyard, Colombia for last 18 months. Structural deterioration led to water entry into vessel. Oil spill feared.
Vessel arrived in Messina, Italy from Augusta, Sicily at dawn on July 9th with 148 migrants on board. Some reports of Covid-19 outbreak in the crowd.
Reports of a 23 year old crew member medivaced after sustaining serious injury following a fall. Vessel was at the port of Mytilene when this happened.

Vessel had technical failure, at the S entrance of Istanbul Strait, 09 Jul 2021. Returned to Istanbul anch to drop anchor under its own power to carry out repairs. Repairs are being carried out by crews. Stationary at Istanbul anch, 10 Jul.
Vessel was arrested in Singapore on the warrant from Haridass Ho & Partners. Arrest location to be confirmed but port agents report confirm it was at Changi Anchorage.
Vessel was issued with a release order by the Supreme Court in Singapore after months in detention.

Vessel while refueling, Matsuyama Port, Japan, when oil spilled from an air vent in FOT No.1 (P) overboard, 9 Jul 2021. Amount of oil spilled in the sea was estimated to be between 200 & 300 litres. Oil spill removal operations underway.

Vessel reported engine failure, loss of power and drifting in Ionian Sea in pos 36 27 06N 19 36 12E on 08 Jul 2021. Crew could not carry out repairs. Tug Christos XL towed it to Augusta. Convoy arrived at Augusta, on 12 Jul.
The vessel had a technical issue, 08 Jul 2021, hence it's sailing from Oban, United Kingdom, was delayed. Resolved the technical issue, same day & departed Oban, United Kingdom.
Vessel ran onto an embankment in the Kiel Canal while in enroute from Kaliningrad to Hamburg. Hours later the vessel booked into berth to check the extent of damage and for possible repairs.
In collision with coastal freighter (Palawan Pearl) while going through the Manila Bay Philippines. The Palawan Pearl sunk but all crew rescued.

Vessel lost control while proceeding to berth and struck the already berthed general cargo ship Rusich 6 (IMO 9345714). The Rusich 6 hull was breached on the port side in the cargo hold area. The extent of damages was under assessment and an investigation into the incident has begun. Both ships remain at Taganrog port, as of Jul 8.

Vessel was struck by the SV Knyaz Vladimir (9247613) while in berth. The Rusich 6 hull was breached on the port side in the cargo hold area. The extent of damages was under assessment and an investigation into the incident has begun. Both ships remain at Taganrog port, as of Jul 8.
Four crew members tested positive at Tarragona, Spain. The ship was placed under quarantine and two of the four who tested positive were taken to hospital after their health deteriorated.

Reports of the vessel issuing distress signal off the Hainan Island, China. Details later emerged of the report - massive cargo shift causing the vessel to list portside and forcing the crew to abandon ship. Chinese freighter (Ren Shun Da) was dispatched for the rescue ops.
Vessel diverted to Bermuda, after reporting a sick crew member with symptoms of blood clots. After disembarking, it continued its voyage from Corpus Christi to Fawley on the 9th of July.

Vessel reported technical failure at Mersin, Turkey, 6 Jul 2021. After repairs,state surveyors will attend to verify final repair status. Vsl left port after repairs on 07 Jul 2021 and bound for Iskenderun, Turkey.
Requests made by captain to anchor in any EU port following the rescue of over 500 migrants. Last sighting of the vessel on July 7th was about 16 nautical miles west of Malta.

Vessel had engine failure due to dirt in fuel pipe, blocked the pipe & starved the engine of gas oil, in lat 51 14 37N, long 001 45 57E,  about 5.4 NM & 072 degrees from East Goodwin LV, 06 Jul 2021. Rectified defect & underway.
Vessel with 18pob reported problems with piston No.4 in position 50 13 21.0N 001 39 43.0W, 25nm SW off St Catherines Point, United Kingdom, 06 Jun 2021. Completed & sailed on 06 Jul.
Vessel reportedly ran aground, while departing a dock in Thessalon, Ontario, Canada, in lat 46 15 13N, long 083 33 50W, 04 Jul 2021. No damage or pollution was reported.

Vessel a laden condition experienced engine failure approximately in position 35 47 05.0N 22 36 05.0E, W of Crete Island, Greece, 4 Jul 2021. Repairs being carried out by crew. Vsl drifting as regards the wind, current direction 7 Jul.

A crew member from vessel off coast of Geraldton, Australia, tested positive to COVID-19, 4 Jul 2021. Crew member transferred to Perth 5 Jul. Due to weather he could not be evacuated. All other crew members are well. Vsl it way to Kwinana.

Vessel had a steering gear failure, in lat 48 08 35N, long 069 48 12W, about 4 NM of W Tadoussac, Quebec, Canada, transiting the Saguenay River off Tadoussac, Canada, 04 Jul 2021. Crews carried out repairs & resumed the voyage.
Vessel ran aground off Norfolk while enroute to Rotterdam from Runavik. After successfully removing some of the ballast it was refloated and proceeded to destination for further inspection.

The vessel had a fire in the cargo hold, berthed at the NorStones AS in Ardal, Rogaland, Norway, 04 Jul 2021. Started to burn in an electric truck inside the cargo hold. Fire brought under control, early morning of 05 Jul.

Vessel had a fault on an engine air valve which was leaking, while in lat 53 17 33N, long 001 13 75E, about 22 NM from Trimingham, UK, 04 Jul 2021. Completed its repairs by two hours & en route to its destination.

Vessel caught fire while docked at PT. Multi Ocean Shipyard in Riau Islands, Indonesia, 3 Jul 2021. Repairs were reportedly being done when the incident occured. Two workers were seriously injured because of the incident.
Several crew onboard had reported not feeling well and subsequently tested positive for Covid-19. As of the 24th July, all crew stayed onboard while anchored at Conception Bay.

Vessel was under attack in the Indian Ocean, possibly by a missile, 03 Jul 2021. Vessel is said to be under partial Israeli ownership. Crews did not sustain any injuries & the vessel was not badly damaged & continued its journey.

3 passengers had to disembark vessel after testing positive for coronavirus. They were transferred to a hotel to continue mandatory quarantine while vessel departed with thousands of other passengers onboard heading for Naples.
On route to Alang for breakup it suffered power failure and became disabled. Vessel was later towed to Djibouti anchorage to prevent further drifting.
Vessel ran aground due to mechanical failure while off Nordaland in Norway. It was later refloated and towed away for further inspection.

Vessel at Callao inner anchorage Peru, duty able seaman sighted four to six perpetrators climbing up anchor chain cable starboard side vsl in position 12 00 00S 077 07 00W, 2 Jul 2021. Able seaman informed duty officer on bridge ship horn.

Vessel reported major gear problems, Canada, 2 Jul 2021. Vsl went emergency anchorage near Contrecoeur wharf. Vsl is expected to be towed to Montreal by a Groupe Ocean tug for inspection & repair in section 44.
Vessel with 30POB reported fire OB at port Wilmington, USA on 30 Jun 2021. No injuries. Fire contained later.
Vessel not under control after engine fault. It had to be towed after drifting dangerously towards danger point lighthouse, Cape Town.
Vessel nuc experienced problems with collant pipe in position 50 24 42.0N 000 33 43.0W, United Kingdom, 30 Jun 2021. Crew rectified the defect vsl underway using its own engine no pollution reported.

Vessel had a technical failure, off Moen Island, in the Baltic Sea, 30 Jun 2021. Tug Baltic towed the vessel to the port of Rostock Anch, Germany. Vessel moored in lat 54 14 01N, long 011 58 29E, as of 01 Jul.
Vessel capsized and sank in the port of Gilimanuk waters in Bali Indonesia. Death toll at 10 with the latest body recovered on the 9th of July

Vessel allided the breakwater, on the south side of the entrance while entering Kaiserschleuse, Port of Bremerhaven, Germany, 29 Jun 2021. The vessel has been temporarily banned from leaving the port by the water protection authorities.

Vessel had the main engine failure, in lat 45 18 15 N, long 073 55 34W, while entering the No.4 Lock in St.Lawrence Seaway off Beauharnois, Canada, 29 Jun 2021. Crews carried out repairs & it resumed voyage. Ar in Hamilton(CAN), 01 Jul.

Vessel reported NUC, as its copper gasket for main engine air starting system was leaking, in lat 49 32 05N, long 004 36 07W, about 34 NM SE of the Lizard Point, 29 Jun 2021. Rectified the defect about one hour & was underway same day.
Fire broke out in cargo area while vessel was berthed at La Coruna, Spain. Reports that the fire was triggered by wielding works.
Crew member had to be medivaced for urgent treatment while vessel was enroute from Rio to Bell Pass.
Boarded by robbers twice, while anchored, at Callao anchorage, Peru, on 28 Jun 2021 & 30 Jun 2021. Spares stolen. Incidents reported to port authority.
Vessel towed to Ahirkapi anchorage after suffering mechanical failure enroute to Istanbul.
Crew member had to be medivaced needing urgent medical attention while vessel was on route from Sfax to Volos.
Vessel seized by a patrol boat belonging to the Libyan National Army for entering into a no-sail zone.

Crewman had to be medivaced after port authoritiy Kalamata were alerted. Although lifted by helicopter to the hospital, he was later pronounced dead. Vessel subsequently detained for further investigations.
Following an engine failure, vessel collided with pier at port Iskenderun, Turkey. Authorities detained vessel afterwards pending the outcome of ongoing investigations.
Crewman had to be medivaced by the USCG upon receiving alert from vessel. The patient later diagnosed at hospital with abdominal pain.

Vessel experienced technical issues and had to be sidelined in Molde, Norway, 24 Jun 2021. The operator Boreal announced the cancellation of sailings on Molde-Vestnes route throughout the day. After troubleshooting, vsl sailed from Molde.
Fire broke out onboard engine room while vessel in transit from Port Blair to the Straits. All but one crew onboard accounted for but no electricity or fresh water available.
Ran aground off Sandbron, Sweden. Plans for refloating still ongoing as of the 27th of June 2021
Some passengers onboard the cruise vessel tested positive for Covid-19 and had to disembark at Freeport. Vessel was destined for Nassau when incident occurred.

Vessel went NUC due to leak in cooling system resulting in engine overheating on 24 Jun 2021, 40 NM E of Peterhead, UK, in pos 57 40 00N 000 30 54W. Estimated time for completion of repairs is about 2-3 hours.
Could be developed for sale
Reports of a fire outbreak onboard while vessel was in berth at Rotterdam. Minimal damage but all crew members unhurt.
Vessel ran aground off Tauranga, New Zealand in 2012 but is now suspeted to be the source of plastic waste appearing at Tairua Beach. Investigations ongoing

Cargo reported as pellets onboard caught fire while vessel was sailing the Kiel Canal enroute to the UK from Vyborg, Russia. Damaged cargo had to be offloaded at Kiel but vessel still moored as of 24hrs later.

Vessel reported NUC & drifting due to engine problems requiring changing broken head cylinder 6.5NM Isle of Wight UK in pos 50 34 06N 001 29 25W 23 Jun 2021. Vsl towed by GT Victory & proceeding to Poole Harbour pick up pilot now alongside.

Vessel detained in Port of Kingston, Jamaica, pending payment of costs incurred for clean up of an oil spill from one of its containers, 23 Jun 2021. Also served with a detention order by the Maritime Auth of Jamaica under the PSC Regime.
Vessel had engine damage and was prohibited from leaving port Syros until repairs carried out.

Vessel reported fire OB to fire brigade in More og Romsdal, Norway on 23 Jun 2021, all emergency services reach. Smoke, some flames from electrical cabinet noted, extinguished. No injuries. Investigation on.
Vessel ran aground soon after leaving Barranquilla, Colombia. Three tugs working to free it several hours and into the following day. No hull breach reported.
Vessel came in contact with tug Bomas Gold on Barito River in South Kalimantan, Indonesia on 22 Jun 2021. Vessel will undergo maintenance in Surabaya for one week after it came in contact with tug.
A fire broke out on board the car deck of vessel United Kingdom, 22 Jun 2021. Later the fire service had confirmed vsl safe to proceed to Castlebay.
Ship captain requested medivac for crew member who sustained injury to the head while underway from New Orleans.

Attempt to move vessel on 20 or 21 Jun 2021 for dismantling postponed, as it is too damaged for towing. Vessel in a state of dilapidation, thereby under detention in Sete, France since 2010. Hull in bad condition, leaking. To be fixed.
Vessel lost some of it's deck cargo (logs) while approaching Figueira da Foz, Portugal.
Details sketch but vessel detained following a warrant obtained by Haridass Ho & Partners. Reports that the Ocean Falcon (9399167) also detained in Singapore using same warrant.

Vessel reported a starboard engine failure while transiting Kwakshua Channel near Kwakume Point, B.C. Canada, in position 51 39 24.7N 127 54 27.4W,21 Jun 2021. The crew done repairs and vessel continued on its voyage.
Vessel ran aground along the river Parana, Argentina while enroute to San Antonio, Chile.
Vessel collided with a pier at port Merak, Indonesia during adverse weather. Damage to the pier and vessel reported to the port authorities.
Had fuel leak in its engine & was NUC, in lat 49 52 80N, long 004 35 41W, about 25 NM SE of Lizard Point, UK, 21 Jun 2021. Defect rectified, & vessel underway. Ar in Antwerp, 22 Jun.

Had technical failure, approx in lat 35 00 01N, long 027 44 05E, SE of Karpathos Island, 20 Jun 2021. Repairs are still being carried out by the crews & the vessel was drifting in the wind & current direction, as of 23 Jun.
Broke in two and sank following bad weather while enroute from Yemen to the Suez Canal.
Vessel reported engine failure, drifted, in Gulf of Aden in pos 13 25 35.4N 50 05 10.8E on 20 Jun 2021. Vanuatu flagged tug Hulk II took vessel in tow on 27 Jun, convoy en route to port Hamad, Qatar.

Reports of fire outbreak in the engine room shortly after sailing off from Pohang, South Korea. After several hours with fire response boats arriving the scene, vessel was declared safe to berth. Further investigation ongoing
Reported being disabled due to a seawater leak, in lat 49 49 25N, long 064 46 33W, about 16 NM W of Port-Menier, QC., 20 Jun 2021. The crews carried out the repairs & it resumed its journey.
Vessel nuc & adrift with 7pob, experienced failure of its main engine fuel injector, 20nm of Portland Bill, United Kingdom,in position 50 15 42.0N 002 05 36.0W, 20 Jun 2021.

Vessel while under the conduct of a pilot had a propulsion failure, in lat 46 30 15N, long 072 13 46W, about 1.20 NM ENE of  Batiscan, Canada, 20 Jun 2021. Crews carried out repairs. Ar in Pointe aux Trembles, Canada, 21 Jun & Sd 23 Jun.
Vessel also responded to mayday call from the sinking Pioneer Star (9120047) and rescued 10 crew members of the striken ship with the help of luxury yacht PLVS VLTRA
Yacht responded to mayday call from the sinking Pioneer Star (9120047) and rescued 10 crew members of the striken ship.
In collision with a passenger jetty at Santos in Brazil while on route to Paranagua. Vessel now moored at outer anchorage awaiting repairs as of June 21st 2021.

Vessel NUC due to defective STBD Azimuth Thruster requiring repairs 25 NM off Montrose in pos 5640 45.0N 001 46 31.2W, in UK waters on 19 Jun 2021. As per LLI AIS, vessel reached Montrose same day, sailed next day, bound for Seagreen OWF.
Vessel disabled and adrift for several hours following a fire that broke out in the engine room. It was towed back to port IIIichivsk terminating the planned voyage to Batumi, Georgia.

Eight crew on vessel were detected to have contracted Covid-19 virus, Mexico, 18 Jun 2021. Two crew members were earlier hospitalized in Tampico due to respiratory problems. Vsl remains at Port of Altamira.
Details sketch but vessel detained following a warrant obtained by Haridass Ho & Partners. Reports that the Ocean Rose (9166950) also detained in Singapore using same warrant.
Vessel ran aground between buoys 1 &  2 near Puerto Cortes, Honduras, on 18 Jun 2021.

Vessel with 229pob 49 crew members on board allided with quay in Port of Igoumenitsa, Greece, while mooring 17 Jun 2021. Vsl sustained breach at Portside 6m in length & about 20cm width about 1.5 to 2m above waterline no injuries reported.
Sank near Port Revdanda Mumbai after strong storms forced the vessel out of control. All 16 crew safely rescued.
Vessel ran aground in Lerstad Norway but was refloated by assist tugs and taken to Ellingsoufjord for further inspections.

Reported NUC due to main engine breakdown, in lat 50 25 12N, long 000 35 21W, 23.67 miles from Selsey Bill, UK, 17 Jun 2021. Successfully completed repairs by its engineer & now underway to its destination, 18 Jun.

Indian Coast Guard swiftly responded to SOS call from vessel with 14 crew following a total blackout due to power failure off Kasaragod India 17 Jun 2021. Defect rectified by ICG technical team. Vsl entered New Mangalore Harbour 19 Jun.
Strong winds forced vessel to break from its moorings and drift onto berthed general cargo ship Boras (IMO 8202953) – which reportedly had been decommissioned.
Hasan Şişik (IMO 7811446) possibly in lay-up or decommissioned, broke from its moorings and drifted onto berthed general cargo ship Boras (IMO 8202953) – which reportedly had been decommissioned.
Strong winds dragged anchor and forced vessel to drift towards shore. Resue tugs managed to intervene on time to avoid grounding.
Crew found a small crack in the fuel tank which led to an oil leak of about 10 metric tons. This occured while vessel was in the Bay of Bengal and the MRCC Colombo was informed.
Engine room fire reported while vessel was on route to Le Harve. The crew managed to extinguish the fire and carry on with the voyage.
Vessel allided with a berth while arriving at the port of Shimizu. Reports of no damage to the vessel hull but to the berth instead.
Vessel lost a life-raft overboard 8nm W of the Galle anchorage, Sri Lanka, in pos 05 33 36.0N 080 00 36.0E, 16 Jun 2021. Vsls in the area are advised to keep a good lookout to avoid an accident.

Vessel 27pob damaged its internal sewage pipe in pos 50 09 27.0N 003 28 58.0W, United Kingdom 15 Jun 2021,& needs engine to be cooled before repair can be done. After repairs completed engine could be started a few minutes vsl underway.
Several crew onboard tested positive for Covid-19 when vessel arrived Hamburg port, Germany. Authorities placed vessel under quarantine while awaiting crew replacement.

Vessel was detained by the Maritime Captaincy of Almeria Spain for an illicit discharge of hydrocarbons over an area of about 55 square kilometers. The pollution was detected by an EMSA satellite and surveillance aircraft of Salvamento Marítimo.
Vessel forced to handover rescued migrants to the Libyan Coast Guard. The migrants were on a stranded wooden boat and some had began swimming to the VOS TRITON when sighted.
Crew member reported dead and two others hospitalized after an outbreak of Covid-19 onboard. Vessel was on route from Chennai to Gibraltar when incident occured.
Fire outbreak in cargo hold while vessel in berth in Port Sudan. Firefighters brought it under control and no casualty reported.
Reports of fire outbreak in the cargo hold at Haifa port. Fire response team managed to put it out and no injuries reported.

Engine failure & lost power approx pos 39 42 12N 025 34 00E, N of Aegean Sea, Turkey, 12 Jun 2021. Vsl  arrived & berthed at Ambarli container terminal in order to discharge entire cargo. Entire discharge operation has been completed.
Vessel was instructed by MRCC Malta to rescue distressed migrants east of Sfax, Tunisia. 100 migrants boarded and were taken to Malta before vessel was able to continue it's planned trip.

A crew member needed to be medivaced when the vessel was in the North Sea en route from St. Petersburg, Russia, to Rotterdam. The patient was hoisted by an SAR helicopter of the Danish civil guard and taken to the Aalborg hospital for treatment.

Vessel in a laden condition experienced steering gear system failure loss of heading control at Nara point in Canakkale Strait, Turkey, 11 Jun 2021. Coastal Safety tugs fast rescue boat and technical team assisted vsl. Vsl fined.
Vessel reported technical failure at Antalya, Turkey on 10 Jun 2021, departure permission cancelled by HM until repairs. Crew carrying out repairs, as of next day.

Vessel with manure as cargo ran aground in Randers Fjord off Mellerup, Denmark on 10 Jun 2021. Refloated vessel detained on 11 Jun 2021. Vsl departed after repairs on 14 Jun 2021. Reached Frederikshavn, Denmark, on 15 Jun 2021.

Vessel ran aground in pos lat 55 54 44N, long 10 15 36E, about nine nautical miles from Snaptun, Denmark, today. Incident happened due to strong northbound current. Divers called in to investigate. Two departures canceled.
Vessel subject to court ruling in which 15 crew members are to be repatriated after an inspection report indicated that the ship was in a state of abandonment.

Vessel was transiting outbound on the St. Marys River when the vessel grounded on the north jetty of the St. Marys Entrance channel, south of Cumberland Island, Georgia.The three-person crew abandoned the vessel and were rescued by a nearby Good Samaritan vessel. The vessel later sank with about 2,300 gallons of fuel, engine oil and hydraulic oil on board. A crewmember sustained a minor injury and the vessel was declared a total loss at $1 million.
Vessel sidelined in Wellington, New Zealand since 09 Jun 2021, after vessel’s gearbox broke down; repairs to take up to 4 weeks; vessel expected to resume sailing early July 2021.
Had technical failure, during its Canakkale Strait passage & dropped anchor at Karanlik liman anchorage Turkey 9 Jun 2021. Repairs on vsl carried out by crew vsl was underway on 11 Jun.
Vessel ran aground on a beach Playa Migiom, Balearic islands, Spain, while on route from Avero Portugal to Alexandria, Egypt, carrying a cargo of pulp.
One crew member slipped and suffered a head injury as he handled the mooring rope.

Vessel nuc in ballast condition stopped to replace fuel filter at N-E Lane of Dover Strait Tss United Kingdom in pos 51 08 45.6N 001 43 35.0E on 8 Jun 2021. Vsl repaired in 15 mins & was underway. Arrived in Rotterdam 0n 10 Jun

Taking on water in lat 13 26 15N, long 53 25 40E, about 65.5 NM N of Socotra Island, Yemen, 07 Jun 2021. Patuxent proceeded to rescue the crew members of Falcon Line before it completely sank. It safely rescued 15 crews.

Vessel with 23pob experienced problems with the engine at approx 26nm SSE of ST Albans Head, United Kingdom, in position 50 12.4N 001 49.1W, 7 Jun 2021. Vsl reportedly nuc vsl while entering Casquettes TSS vsl back in command using engines.

Vessel blocked by Greenpeace activists upon its arrival at Saint-Nazaire. She was approached by activists in rigid hull inflatable boats who painted “stop deforestation” on the side of the ship’s hull.

Vessel came in contact with the fishing vsl Sirithanachai, off port Laem Chabang, in international waters, in the Gulf of Thailand, on 07 Jun 2021. No injuries or pollution. Investigation underway. Vsl moored at Port Klang as of 17 Jun 2021
Vessel banned from entering the port of Malta because a passenger tested positive for Covid-19
Vessel changed route  for Goa, India and made request for medical evac for the ship captain who showed symptoms of a stroke. He was evacuated to Vasco hospital India and is now in stable condition.

Shortly after its departure from Corfu on June 6th the captain requested its return to the new port after a 27-year-old crew member needed hospital treatment. After the ship had reberthed the patient was disembarked taken by ambulance to the General Hospital of Corfu.

Vessel experienced engine problems was disabled & drifting at approx 30nm S-W of Bamfield Vancouver Island BC Canada, in position 48 27 04.8N 125 43 02.4W 6 Jun 2021. Crew carried out repairs & vsl resumed its voyage.

Experienced a fire in its engine room, while at Napier Port, New Zealand, 06 Jun 2021. The vessel's crews activated a suppression C02 fire extinguishing system & brought the fire under control quickly. The fire was a minor one.
Reports that the vessel suffered water ingress near Gaspe harbour, Quebec. Local fire brigade provided assistance to the crew to pump water out of the vessel.
Vessel ran aground in Bushwick Inlet, in Brooklyn, New York, during the afternoon of Saturday June 5th while 107 passengers and 7 crew members onboard

OOCL Durban while approaching the dock in Kaohsiung, Taiwan, misjudged distances, c/w docked YM Constancy, & then the bridge wing of OOCL Durban allided the container crane servicing the vessel, 03 Jun 2021. Sd Kaohsiung, 04 Jun.
Seized by Italian authorities on June 3rd accused of carrying more passengers than it was certified for.

Had fire in its cargo hold, while anchored S of Stonecutter Island, Hong Kong, during cargo operations 02 Jun 2021. Took 15 hours to put out fire 03 Jun. Developed a heavy portside list, most likely due to water poured into the cargo hold.

Vessel in a laden condition experienced technical failure East of Rhodes Island, Greece, approximately in position 36 03 5.0N 28 40 00.0E, on 3 Jun 2021. Repairs are being carried out by crew while vsl is drifting.

Vessel reported trouble with oil cooling system on 03 Jun 2021, while River Elbe just after a stay in a yard at Antwerp previous two days. Tugs Sonke, Corvin, Wal and Wulf7 pulled vessel to Brunsbuttel and next day to destination Hamburg.

Reported NUC due to a defective pipe in the engine room, while in lat 60 31 49N, long 000 42 46E, about 48 NM E of Fetlar, 03 Jun 2021. The estimated time for the completion of repair works is said to be around eight hours.
Vessel in collision with two cranes and the Yong Hung vessel at Kaohsiung port. Investigations ongoing soon after the vessel docked at Pier 66.

Vessel while under the conduct of a pilot, reported being disabled due to an engine problem off Saturna Island,British Columbia, Canada, in position 48 45 02.2N 123 05 17.3W, 3 Jun 2021. Crew done repairs and the vsl resumed its voyage.
Sank in the waters off Albuera in Leyte, Philippines, 02 Jun 2021. The crews were able to evacuate before the vessel partially submerged due to the strong tropical storm
Vessel reportedly came in contact with fishing boats off Bagacay, Romblon in the Philippines on 02 Jun 2021. No injuries reported.

Vessel sank in the Gulf of Suez off Ras Gharib, on 02 Jun 2021. Captain, engineer missing and 11 crew rescued. Vsl struck an underwater wreck that caused the incident. Update: 05-Jun-21 : The body of vessel engineer found by the search & rescue team
Vessel seized by port authorities in Cobh Country Cork after being suspected for illegal trading. All 15 crew members later released while investigation ongoing.
Vessel requested medical assistance off Agrigento after Captain became ill. Unfortunately the casualty was fatal and his body transferred to the hospital for autopsy.

Vessel reported its propeller having made contact with a fishing rope, 16nm West of Bonilla Island, British Columbia, Canada, in position 53 28 25.0N 131 05 35.3W, 2 Jun 2021. Tugs assisted vsl to Port of Hardy to investigate the damage.
Pirates abducted 5 crew members, in position lat 04 33 20N, long 002 22 55E, 110 nautical miles southwest of Lagos, Nigeria, on 31 May 2021. Vessel arrived at Tema, Ghana, 01 Jun.
Vessel had engine failure, at Temryuk, Russia. Repair works could not be carried out by crew members. Tug Horoz towing it to Yalova, Turkey. ETA at Yalova, on the morning of 04 Aug.

Needed a change of its engine cylinder & was NUC in lat 09 36 31.2N, long 005 47 57W, 01 Jun 2021. The engine was stopped & repairs are underway. Completed its repairs, 02 Jun & proceeding to Flushing, Netherlands.

Vessel reported technical failure, at Oristano, Italy, on 01 June 2021. Crew unable to repair, vessel towed on 28 Oct to Tuzla shipyard on 14 Nov. Repairs were done & vsl sailed Tuzla 28 Mar & anchored in Kartal anchorage.

Vessel had technical failure at Ravenna, Italy, since 01 Jun 2021. Repairs could not be carried out by crew. A new set of spare parts was provided by owners. Repair is conducted at the Tuzla shipyard, 19 Jan 2022. Sailed Tuzla, 25 Jan.
Fire erupted in the cargo hold of ship on May 31st at Landskrona port, Sweden. Some scrap that was being loaded was understood to have caught fire. The fire was  extinguished by 18:00 HRS
Vessel experienced technical problems & had to stop all services, Scotland, United Kingdom, 31 May 2021. Technical issues with the vsl have resulted in disruption for the past two weeks.

Had an engine failure & requested assistance from the Portuguese authorities, while in lat 40 39 42N, long 010 06 21W, about 63 NM W of Aveiro, Portugal, 31 May 2021. A tug towed it to Lisbon, 02 Jun, for repairs.

Vessel capsized in the port of Castellón, Spain. 3 crew members were injured and a search is ongoing for two people that remain missing. The port has been closed for the search and rescue operation as of 30th May 2021. Update : June 17 2021 : Divers carried out additional underwater surveys and found the bodies of the two persons following the capsizing of feeder container ship Nazmiye Ana (IMO 8516598) in the port of Castellón, Spain at the end of May. The bodies were recovered and transferred to the morgue for an autopsy.

Reported NUC due to an electrical power outage to fuel filter, in position lat 49 50 24N, long 005 56 19W, about S of Lands End TSS, 30 May 2021. The vessel restarted the engine & is underway to its destination approx 15 minutes later.

Vessel had engine failure, loss of power, drifting before emergency-dropping anchor at Kilitbahir point in Canakkale Strait on 30 May 2021. Coastal safety tugs assisted. Incident scene declared as restricted zone. Salvage not started.

Vessel while under the conduct of a pilot, sustained a machinery failure in Vancouver, Canada,in position l49 17 54.0N123 15 10.2W 30 May 2021. Vsl anchored in English Bay in Vancouver,and the crew carried out repairs.
Vessel was disabled in the North Sea off the Norwegian coast near Husoy, Norway, after ropes got into the propeller while fishing on 30 May 2021. Divers removed obstructions continued its voyage.

The generator of the vessel had a fire & it was drifting southbound, while it departed Kaohsiung port, Taiwan, 28 May 2021. Harbour tugboat TIPM no.14401 has approached the vessel. Departed onsite 29 May, bound for Ningbo.

While proceeding in the Kafireas Strait, Greece, sustained mechanical damage, 29 May 2021. The Master of the vessel did not request assistance & crews completed repairs. The vessel continued its passage, same day.
Vessel reported technical failure at southern entrance of Canakkale Strait, dropped anchor at Yenikoy anch, Turkey on 28 May 2021. Crew have commenced repairs.

Reported NUC due to broken oil pump while in 55 19 06N 006 46 56W outside Lough Foyle 28 May 2021. Agents states the issue can not be fixed at sea. Vessel towed into Londonderry by tug in position 55 02 33.2N 007 15 45.0W.
Vessel reported engine failure at Mombasa, Kenya while embarking on voyage to Moroni, Comoros on 28 May 2021, secured, towed to Mooring M3 in port. Still at Mombasa as of 31 May.

Vessel grounded in the Suez Canal on Friday, but was refloated and ship traffic was able to continue through the waterway. Maersk has also now confirmed the incident in an emailed statement: “We hereby confirm that Maersk Emerald has been refloated and will be anchored at Great Bitter Lake, part of the Suez Canal, to proceed with the investigation about the causes that brought her to run aground on May 28th.

Vsl nuc experienced problems with fuel injectors 50nm NorthEast of Great Yarmouth, United Kingdom, in position 52 50.817N 003 02.850E,28 May 2021. Repairs were carried out and completed vsl continued its voyage to Togo.

Vessel in a laden condition during Istanbul Strait passage Turkey, experienced engine failure loss of power & dangerously drifted shore at Istinye Point 28 May 2021. Vsl able to re-establish power heaveup anchor safely with own engine power
Collided with small fishing vessel Hokko Maru No. 8 on 27th May 2021. Japanese authorities granted vessel permission to proceed to Mombetsu where it has discharged it's cargo. Investigations ongoing
An old projectile in cargo hold exploded, at Sidon, Lebanon, on 27 May 2021. Vessel was being loaded with scrap metal. No injuries. Vessel sustained some damages.
Albanian Stowaways discovered by the crew before vessel was due for depature from A Coruna port. The police were alerted and subsequently all four men were arrested.

Vessel suffered an engine breakdown while en route from Istanbul to Mangalia when it was about 20nm off Türkeli Feneri. The ship was disabled and asked for assistance. Coastal Safety authorities deployed tug Nene Hatun which established a towing connection and towed the vessel to the Türkeli anchorage for repairs.
Vessel suffered engine breakdown between Mauritius and Reunion. Port authorities later detained the vessel after it was towed by an assist tug to the east harbour in Reunion.
NUC due to an air tap leaking, in position 58 39 40N 006 26 40W, about 10nm NE of Butt of Lewis lighthouse, United Kingdom,27 May 2021. Crew carried out repairs,vsl resumed voyage.
Vessel was sailing at reduces speed on Ronne-Ystad, Denmark, route after an examination has revealed a damaged ring in a bearing, 27 May 2021.

In collision with the Ro-Ro vessel BYAKKO in which the later sank after 3 hours. 13 seafarers onboard safe and uninjured although some fatality among the crew of BYAKKO according to the Japanese media.
Three crew members missiing after vessel sank following a collision with the ULSAN PIONEER tanker. Search for missing crew still ongoing as of Friday 28th May 2021

In collision with Japanese fishing boat 15 nautical miles of Mombetsu, northern Hokkaido, Japan sea, around dawn on May 26th. The fishing boat capsized. Five fishermen on board were picked up by the Amur, but 3 of them later died. June 7th 2021 - crew member in charge arrested by the Japanese coea guard.
Experienced engine failure, loss of power & was drifting at Kepez point in Canakkale Strait 26 May 2021. Vsl was towed to Karanlik Port,Dardanelles by tugs of coastal security teams.

Had engine failure in the waters off Tanjung Berakit in the Riau Islands, Indonesia, 26 May 2021. A patrol boat was dispatched to assist the vessel. Repairs were completed on the same evening & it resumed sailing towards Java Island.

Water police station in Brunsbutte Germany, checked & discovered mixture of several substances had been illegally discharged from vessel into North Sea 26 May 2021. Vsl berthed officials boarded charged captain & officer of criminal offense
On arrival from Ho Chi Minh, vessel was arrested at Chittagong port on the orders of a local high court rulling on a litigation case.
Adrift in position lat 16 40 24N, long 082 24 19E, India, on 25 May 2021.
Adrift in position lat 16 40 24N, long 082 24 18E, India, on 25 May 2021.
Adrift in position lat 16 22 28N, long 081 58 34E, on 25 May 2021.
Touched bottom while approaching Grenaa, Denmark, on 25 May 2021. Banned from sailing by Danish Maritime Assistance Service for inspections.
While departing Yokohama Port, Japan, allided with the wharf on the opposite side, 25 May 2021. The vessel is scheduled for interrogation at the anchorage.

Reported NUC due to engine issue with regards to water in the fuel, while transiting Dover TSS, in lat 50 33 30N, long 000 18 58E, about 10.9 NM from Beachy Head lighthouse, 25 May 2021. Completed repairs & continuing its passage, 26 May.
Captain requested medical evacuation of Polish crew member when vessel was about 130 nautical miles southwest of Cadiz, Spain.

Vessel experienced problems with one of its generators in Welland Canal near Port Weller, Ontario, Canada, in position 43 13 33.2N 079 13 01.4W, 25 May 2021. Crew members carried out repairs & vsl resumed its voyage.
Crew member suffered abdominal pain and had to be medically evacuated according to the Vietnamese MRCC authorities. He was later diagnosed at hospital with acute appendicitis.

Vessel ran aground at on the Khuriya Muriya islands, east of Salalah, Oman, on May 23rd. The hull was breached in the engine room area and flooding ensued. The ship issued a distress signal and the Royal Oman Air Force sent a helicopter which evacuated all 12 crew, consisting of six Syrians and six Indians.

Vessel experienced an engine room fire, anchored off, at Mongla Port, Bangladesh, on 23 May 2021. One crew out of four injured died, and one crew in serious condition. Fire extinguished in a short time. Cargo remained intact.

Sank at the sea of Japan. Crew sent out  distress call to Japanese search & rescue authorities at about 11:00 local time on Friday May 21st, reporting sustained flooding in her cargo holds. All crew rescued by a North Korean tanker after 5 hours adrift.

Vessel breached its hull while being pushed by a supply barge in a fuel tank area at road of Boshnialovo port, North Sakhalin, Tatarskiy Strait, Russia, 22 May 2021. Reportedly some spillage tug sent to assist vsl.
Vessel detained off Gibraltar due to reasons yet to be ascertained.

Vessel detained in Tanjung Tuan after allegedly trying to escape from detention. Malaysian authorities confirmed reason for original detention was due to unauthorised anchoring in the waters of Tanjung Balau.
Vessel reported gear problems off Western Finnmark, Norway on 21 May 2021, requested assistance. Norwegian CG patrol boat Barentshav took vessel in tow to Tromso, safely berthed next morning.

Vessel in ballast condition experienced technical failure while entering Istanbul Strait, Turkey,from southern entrance for transit passage 21 May 2021. Vsl dropped anchor at Buyukdere anchorage. Crew doing repairs.

Crew member involved in an accident onboard with shoulder injuries had to be evacuated by Falmouth lifeboat. Vessel had to be diverted to Falmouth. After few hours and careful examination the crew member was back onboard.
Vessel came in contact with a pontoon which was entering port, at Boshnyakovo, Russia on 21 May 2021. Vessel holed, leaked fuel oil, booms set up. Both vessels afloat, not listing, no casualties.
Vessel is at Durban, South Africa as of 21 May 2021, for repairs to cracks in hull. Repairs have been completed and vessel expected to leave dock on 22 May 2021.
Vessel could not leave the Port of Ceuta, Spain on 21 May 2021 due to problems with its anchor, remained moored in North Bay for resolving the problem.

Reported NUC due to a problem with its delivery of fuel oil, while in lat 50 58 08N, long 001 15 55E, about  7.1 NM from Folkestone Harbour, 20 May 2021. Completed repairs within 30 mins & is underway to its destination.

Dock workers from the Italian base union of USB, operating at the port of Livorno, refused to load a shipment of arms onto container ship Asiatic Island (IMO 9366483) after discovering that the load was headed to Israel. The shipment included explosives and precision-guided munitions and the vessel was bound for the (currently theoretically closed) port city of Ashdod. The USB union said that the dock workers took the decision to stop loading the shipment because they feared that the weapons would be used to kill Palestinians.

Vessel came in contact with Roll On Roll Off Kvitholm at quay in Mosjoen, Norway on 20 May 2021, holed in hull at port side. Kvitholm sustained major damage to bow gate. Investigation on. Vsl sailed Mosjoen on 21 May.
Vessel though disabled and adrift, due to a severe cyclone, off Veraval, India, 19 May 2021. CG said vsl is safe and is being under constant monitoring vsl waiting for tug.
38 year old Ukranian Captain of the vessel was found dead in his cabin while vessel was sailing off the Central American coast en-route from Shanghai to Tampa via Panama.
Vessel unreported and possibly drifting in Malacca Strait in pos 003 23 51N 99 59 47E as of 19 May 2021. Status unchanged as of next day.
Vessel experienced mechanical failure,due to a severe cyclone, India, 19 May 2021. Indian CG reported vsl anchored and safe.

Vessel has been detained in Port of Castellon, Spain, after nine of its 25 crew members were tested positive for Covid-19, 19 May 2021. vsl remain in Port of Castellon until the end of the confinement.

Indian Navy helicopters were deployed to airlift the crew from offshore tug/supply ship about 3nm off Kaup coast in the Udupi district, after it had run aground at the Mulki Rocks during the Cyclone Tauktae. Speedboats of Indian Coast Guard Ship Varaha rescued five crew members and a helicopter of the Navy base in Goa hoisted the other four. All nine were taken to hospitals for treatment and examination.

Vessel reportedly lost part of its superstructure and a derrick in the cyclone “Tauktae” on 18 May 2021, in the Arabian Sea. No injuries reported. Vessel located in Panna Field off Mumbai, India in pos 19 34 42N, 71 23 06E as of 19 May.

Vessel ran aground at 316-km mark while navigating downstream on River Parana, Argentina, in pos 33 30 28.8S 59 52 25.2W on 18 May 2021. Later same day refloated by own means; proceeded to Ramallo roads, as instructed by CG for inspections.
Following cyclone Tauktae, vessel ran aground in Palghar and all 137 people on board were rescued. It then sank 20km from the shore during the evening of May 17th.

Anchor hoy Sangita (IMO 9080900) with a barge on tow and 10 crew members on board was disabled and had been adrift near drilling ship Sagar Bhushan (IMO 8407266) since around noon on  May 17th. The Sagar Bhushan had 101 people on board and was about 30nm northwest of Mumbai.
Vessel drifted aground near Satpati. The Indian coast guard, the Navy, and offshore tugs were trying to refloat barge, while simultaneously, evacuating the 137 people on board.

More than 90 people were missing after accommodation barge Papaa-305 (IMO 8784327) sunk off the coast of Mumbai. The Indian navy said it had rescued 177 of the 270 people aboard and that efforts to find survivors were ongoing.

Anchor hoy Sangita (IMO 9080900) with a barge on tow and 10 crew members on board was disabled and had been adrift near drilling ship Sagar Bhushan (IMO 8407266) since around noon on  May 17th. The Sagar Bhushan had 101 people on board and was about 30nm northwest of Mumbai.
Lost control due to cyclone “Tauktae”, approximately in position lat 20 11 48N, long 072 16 59E, India, on 17 May 2021.

Following cyclone tauktae, vessel got into distress in the Gulf of Khambhat, north of Mumbai, during the evening of May 17th. The ship had been en route from Nhava Sheva to Panna and had reported flooding in the adverse weather.
Following cyclone tauktae, vessel also got into distress in the Gulf of Khambhat during the evening of May 17th. The ship had been anchored off Mumbai and reported flooding in the adverse weather.
Vessel reported its lifeboat davit as non-operational in Prince Rupert, B.C., Canada, in position 54 05 40.0N 130 33 38.0W, 17 May 2021.
Experienced water ingress while towing barge stonebarge 1, near Sorfjord, Rodoy, on 16 May 2021. Towed to quay in Gjervalen, on 17 May 2021.
Had a technical issue, which required shipyard repairs, 16 May 2021. Due to the ongoing repair work,on vsl it has been necessary to cancel further sailings till 3 Jun.

Vessel suffered an engine failure while entering the Dardanelles, Turkey, from the Marmara Sea during the afternoon of May 16th. The vessel was taken to Sevketiye Anchorage, Marmara Sea, where it remained at anchor as of May 17th. The ship was en route from Istanbul to Algeciras, understood after repairs.

Vessel in allision with landing craft Lawrence Major during the morning of May 15th. The latter was moored alongside a floating dry-dock undergoing maintenance and repairs at the Suriname Drydock and Shipbuilding Shipyard in Paramaribo. Tropic Tide was en route from Georgetown while approaching a berth at the port of Paramaribo.

lost one crew overboard, with three other crew being injured, during the evening of May 15th in the Arabian Sea off Mangalore, India, as Cyclone Tauktae moved towards the Indian shoreline. The ship had left Mangalore on May 15th, bound for Hazira. The four crew were working on a cargo deck when a large wave struck. The ship returned to Mangalore the following morning and the injured crew were taken to hospital. The ship searched for the lost man for several hours before turning back. As of the morning of May 18th the vessel was still berthed at Mangalore.
Made a pit stop in Seaspan¿s Vancouver Drydock, about 15 May 2021 for repair works to one of its propeller hubs. The repair works are expected to be complete by 22 May, according to BC Ferries.

Vessel sustained machinery controls failure while transiting on Lake Erie, Canada, in position 42 48 10.2N 079 14 32.4W, 15 May 2021. Vsl anchored off Port Colborne, Ontario, to assess & carry out repairs.

Vessel capsized off Mangalore on May 15th while returning to shore with nine crew members on board. One body was recovered and two people were rescued near Kapu Beach, Karnataka, after swimming to the shore. Five crew members were reported missing. The vessel was located drifting bottom up near Padubidri, Karnataka, about 20 miles north of New Mangalore. Coast Guard boats were deployed for the SAR operation.
While berthing in Chiba Port, allided its port side of the bow with the quay, 15 May 2021. According to Lloyd's List Intelligence AIS, vsl sailed from Yokohama and reached Wakayama, Japan, on 17 May.

Vessel with 2850 tons of cargo, nine crew on board, ran aground in position lat 59 07 15N, long 38 21 44E, on Volgo Baltic Canal, on 14 May 2021. Vsl arrived at Cherepovets, on May 17 2021. No injuries. Master of the vessel summoned.

Vessel ran aground in the Falta stretch while heading for Syama Prasad Mookerjee Port Trust (former Kolkata Port Trust) in India on 14 May 2021. Refloated with help from several tugs on 16 May 2021, reached Kolkata port same day.

Ran aground in Lake Malaren near Koping in pos 59 27 34.2N, 016 10 15.6E, 14 May 2021. Swedish Sea & Air Rescue Center JRCC in Gothenburg is coordinating the response. Vessel berthed in Koping, as of 15 May.
Vessel crew contacted Coast Guard Sector San Francisco watchstanders at approximately 4:54 a.m., reporting an engine fire aboard the ship. There are 24 people onboard and no reported injuries.
Vessel sustained machinery failure W of Vancouver Island, British Columbia, Canada, in position 49 18 13.0N 123 06 31.0W, 14 May 2021. Crew carried out repairs & the vsl resumed its voyage
Vessel needed to change a reduction valve in the main engine in position 49 57 24.0N 003 08 20.8W,United Kingdom, 13 May 2021. The defect was rectified.

The Port Authority of Volos, Greece, said vessel ran aground inside Port waters of Volos, Greece, 12 May 2021. A CG and tug assisted vsl to refloat and was moored at pier,Volos. Vsl detained untill certificate of seaworthiness is issued.
Vessel reported engine trouble and adrift off NW coast of Honshu and SSW of Oki Shoto, Japan, in pos 35 46 54N, 132 56 42E on 12 May 2021.
Vessel allided with an oil platform, near Baku, Azerbaijan, on 12 May 2021. No pollution or injuries. Vsl is at Baku anch., since 13 May 2021 for repairs.
Vessel reported engine system failure at Novorossiysk, Russia on 11 May 2021, departure permission temporarily cancelled until completion of repairs. Repairs done. Vessel sailed on 13 May.

Forced to disconnect from the Tui oilfield off New Zealand. The FPSO had been marooned at the field since November 2019 when the field operator and owner Tamarind Taranaki, a subsidiary of Malaysia’s Tamarind Resources, hit financial difficulties.

Vessel suffered a broken rudder in the Bosphorus on May 11th while en route from Istanbul to Constanta and turned towards the shore off Kuruçeşme. The crew asked for assistance and Coastal Safety deployed tug Kurtarma 12 to the scene.

Experienced engine failure, during its Istanbul Strait passage, 11 May 2021. Subsequently, the vessel was shifted to Buyukdere anchorage & repairs are being done. Imposed fines due to breach of Strait safe passage regulation.

Vessel conducted repair of the fuel injector pump in position 50 11 03.0N 003 27 19.0W, 7.5nm ESE of Start Point, UK, 11 May 2021. Vsl underway still having issues with fuel injector pump. Vsl 15/20nm offshore conduct further investigation.

collided with inland cargo ship Bacchus in Outer Maas during the evening of May 11th in the Barendrecht area of Rotterdam. Nordersand was en route from Rotterdam to Moerdijk port, while Bacchus was en route from Dordrecht to Barendrecht, proceeding in opposite directions. The Bacchus bow was severely damaged and the vessel was taken to Europort and berthed. The Nordersand suffered a starboard hull breach several metres long above the waterline amidships. The ship remained at the collision site for some time. Later it was taken to Rotterdam, and berthed.

Ran aground just outside Stylida port, Greece, 11 May 2021. Later refloated with own means same day, moored in port. Initial inspection found no damage, a detailed inspection to be carried out by Classification Society.
Three kilograms of heroin were discovered by an anti-drugs unit and customers officers onboard in Port Louis, Mauritius after its arrival from Durban on May 11th, 2021.

Fire erupted on board UK Royal Fleet Auxiliary supply tanker during the morning of May 10th at Portland, UK, where the ship was berthed. Firefighting teams responded, but reportedly by the time they arrived the fire had already been extinguished by personnel on board. Four people were treated by medics. Extent of damage to vessel not yet unknown. As of May 12th the 1993-built, UK-flagged, 28.821 gt Fort Victoria was still berthed at Portland, UK.

Efforts to remove vehicles from grounded passenger/cargo RoRo Jembatan Musi II to lighten the vessel were being carried out as of May 10th. The local authorities were waiting for a high tide to make it easier to refloat the ferry. They have also instructed several large vessels to be on standby to render assistance, if required.
Two cruise line workers from India who were due to embark tested positive for Covid-19 as they were about to board the ship off Devon.
seized at Aviles, nearly 35 months ago for various deficiencies, now finally towed towards Yalova for repairs.

Reported NUC due to a stuck fuel injection pump in lat 54 29 33N, long 000 11 54W, 06 May 2021. Vessel stopped to investigate problem. Engineer deemed repairs not needed at this time. Remains moored abt 2.2 NM from of Tyne, UK, as of 09 May
Boarded by 5 perpetrators, from a Sampan, in position lat 01 14 16.2N, long 104 02 00.0E, Singapore Strait, on 09 May 2021. Nothing stolen. Ar in Kaohsiung Anchorage, Taiwan, 15 Mar.

police responders in Melbourne, Australia rescued a seafarer who had jumped over the side of his vessel and was found hanging onto a navigational buoy a few miles off the port. The survivor, a 31-year-old Georgian national, was spotted by a Victoria Police search aircraft at about 20:00 hours on Sunday night. He was rescued and taken to a hospital for treatment, and then placed in Covid-19 quarantine. The seafarer is believed to be a crewmember of tanker Kampur

Vessel ran aground late on May 9th at the 155km mark in Volga-Caspian Sea Canal, Caspian Sea, while en route from Astrakhan Russia to Port Amirabat, Iran, while in load. As of the afternoon of May 10th the ship was still aground with a tug at its side. By May 13th the vessel was in the Caspian Sea.

Reported not under command due to a fuel-related issue in the main engine, in lat 52 28 21N, long 025 52 09E, about 42 NM E of Lowestoft, 09 May 2021. The vessel was able to rectify the issue and is underway to its destination.
Had an unknown defect with its main engine & remains anchored in lat 51 12 22N, long 001 27 58E, 08 May 2021. Requires an assistance of a pilot for navigating to Dover port.

Vessel while under the conduct of a pilot, ran aground near Anchorage T4 off Sorel, Quebec, Canada, in position 46 03 19.0N 073 07 29.0W, 8 May 2021. Vsl was refloated after ballasting and the assistance of a tug.

Vessel had been in allision with the Banglar Shikha (IMO 8918478) at Chittagong Outer Anchorage on May 21st 2016, during the passage of the Cyclone Roanu, was still under arrest as of May 7th. A lack of interest from stakeholders was delaying the release of the vessel.

Vessel with supplies experienced engine damage sometime after having left the Port of Cuxhaven, Germany, 6 May 2021. Crew requested assistance, lifeboat Hermann Marwede towed vsl & safely moored at Heligoland foreport.

Vessel came in contact with bulk carrier Taho Australia in  Singapore Strait off Lagoi, northern Bintan Island, on 06 May 2021. Damage at starboard in main deck area & several containers damaged. Anchored near incident scene.

arrived at Port-la-Nouvelle, on France’s Mediterranean coast, from Terneuzen, Netherlands, during the evening of May 6th and was berthed on May 8th after the Master reported Covid-like symptoms among crew. After being tested while the ship was at anchor, 12 were found to be positive. As of May 11th it remained moored at Port La Nouvelle.

Fully cellular containership Sinar Solo came in contact with vessel in Singapore Strait off Lagoi, northern Bintan Island, on 06 May 2021. Several containers damaged on board Sinar Solo. Vessel experienced superficial damage only.
in collision with rowing boat Floris IV in the Netherlands at midday on May 5th.

A crew member was injured in a fall on board on May 5th and needed to be medevaced. South Australian paramedics responded with helicopters and safely hoisted the victim in remote seas in the Great Australian Bight. He was taken to shore for further treatment.

Experienced a fouled propeller, in lat 58 49 45N, long 003 28 41W, approx 14 NM N of Scrabster, 04 May 2021. Made its way to Scrabster harbour to offload passengers & cargo. Divers cleared the propeller. En route to Lerwick, 05 May.

Vessel reported engine failure on 05 May 2021 while leaving port of Barranquilla, Colombia to Vila do Conde, Brazil. Three tugs assisted vessel to outer anchorage of Barranquilla where it was located stationary as of next day.
Vessel which is under construction at Thyboron, Denmark caught fire on 05 May 2021 during some hot work in the cargo area. Fire brigade on scene. Vessel due for delivery in June 2021.

Vessel was understood to be unmanned and on tow to Aliaga scrapyard in Turkey, broke loose from its towline during the afternoon of May 4th in English Channel north of Cherbourg France. The tanker was taken on tow by French SAR ship Abeille Liberte, with assisting tugs Christos XXIV (IMO 7041625) and Mustang and towed inshore, west of Le Havre.

Had technical failure, during Istanbul Strait passage at Haydarpasa point, 04 May 2021. Vessel was shifted to Istanbul Anch & dropped its anchor under its own power. Repairs commenced by the crew members & remains stationary Istanbul Anch.

Vessel was loaded with dozens of containers full of hazardous materials in the port of Beirut, all of which were a hangover from last August’s devastating explosion. It was ready to sail for Germany on May 4th.

A man has died on May 4th after falling from suezmax crude oil tanker Bordeira in the Bay of Algeciras, Spain. The ship at the time was undergoing a crew change outside the anchorage of the port. One of the three people who were going to disembark fell into the sea and became hooked on the ladder.

drilling rig has sunk after one or more of its legs penetrated the seabed off the coast of Sarawak, Malaysia on Monday, Malaysia-based drilling contractor Velesto Energy has confirmed. All 101 personnel on board the Velesto Naga 7 were transferred to rescue vessels immediately after the incident and no injuries are reported. The Velesto Naga 7 was operating at the Salam-3 well for customer ConocoPhillips at the time of the accident. Velesto said the incident occurred due to rapid soil penetration, which caused the rig to list and subsequently sink. The company said the rig is now fully submerged at the location.

Vessel while transiting from Quebec to Tadoussac, Canada, without passengers, experienced problems with its propulsion in position 46 50 47.2N 071 01 21.8W, Canada, 3 May 2021. Vsl returned to Quebec to assess situation.

Sustained mechanical damage, while en route to the Port of Perama, 03 May 2021. The Port Authority of Perama has detained the vessel in the port until repair works are completed & the vessel is issued with a class maintenance certificate.

A crew member of bulk carrier Federal Montreal (IMO 9838474) fell ill while the vessel was en route from Hamilton, Ontario, Canada, to Spain. The vessel was diverted to Conception Bay once a doctor advised that he would need to seek medical assistance and the vessel dropped anchor on May 3rd. The man was taken to hospital in St John’s and diagnosed with Covid-19.
Had technical failure south of Istanbul anchorage, 02 May 2021. Was shifted to Istanbul anchorage. Repairs are underway. Arrived in the Ochakov Anch, Ukraine, 08 May.
Vessel has been confined in the Port of Bilbao, Spain, as of 2 May 2021 after three of its crew tested positive for coronavirus.

suffered a fire and explosion early on May 2nd that put the vessel temporarily out of action and caused it to drift. The vessel had been heading from Argentina to Marsden Point New Zealand with a cargo of soy, ETA May 22. By May 3rd some power was restored and the vessel had headed to port. As of May 6th the vessel had arrived at Talcahuano, Chile.
Vessel stopped to change its oil filter 21.0NM, Trevose Head,UK, 1 May 2021. Vsl was underway.
One passenger on vessel tested positive for coronavirus Japan, 30 Apr 2021. Passenger's health was stable and he was recuperating in a cabin that has been isolated.
Ran into Kiel Canal embankment at km-20, due to rudder issues, on 30 Apr 2021. Detained at Brunsbuttel. Sailed, on 30 Apr.

Vessel while preparing to sail from Piraeus for the Port of Kynthos, Greece,sustained damage to its port main engine 30 Apr 2021. The Port Authority of Piraeus detained vsl until engine repaired, a certificate of seaworthiness was issued.

collided with LNG tanker Bilbao Knutsen (IMO 9236432), which was leaving port, just outside Huelva, Gulf of Cadiz, Spain, early on April 30th, while the two vessels were in the port’s anchorage area. Both ships sustained damage and subsequently were anchored near the collision site.

Vessel while under the conduct of a pilot, reportedly sustained a machinery failure which caused a blackout in St. Lawrence Seaway off Lancaster, Ontario, Canada, in position 45 05 46.6N 074 29 23.3W,30 Apr 2021. Vsl repaired resume voyage.

collided with LNG tanker Bilbao Knutsen (IMO 9236432), which was leaving port, just outside Huelva, Gulf of Cadiz, Spain, early on April 30th, while the two vessels were in the port’s anchorage area. Both ships sustained damage and subsequently were anchored near the collision site.

Reported NUC as it needed to repair a gasket on the cooling system, in lat 52 24 23N, long 002 55 45E, about 46 NM of Southwold Lighthouse, 30 Apr 2021. Repair works completed within 20 minutes, same day & continued its voyage.

A number of the 512 cattle aboard livestock carrier LSS Success (IMO 6927092) were reported to have died during the vessel’s voyage from East London, South Africa,  to Port Louis, Mauritius, where it arrived on April 29th. The ship left Port Louis in the morning of April 30th. Some 40 carcasses were thrown into the sea during the voyage. Neel Industries Ltd imported the animals, but the high number of deaths was considered unusual.  As of May 4th the vessel was underway from Port Louis to East London.
Vessel allided with Buraiqa oil pier at Misurata port on 29 Apr 2021. Pier severely damaged & partially destroyed. Vessel sustained breaches and dents at the portside bow
Vessel collided with a fishing boat off Incheon Anchorage, South Korea, at 0312 hrs, 29 Apr 2021. Boat capsized and one crew on board was found dead. No reports of oil spill or pollution.

The emergency services of the Arkhangel region received a message about a fire on board vessel, while berthed at the port of Archangel, 28 Apr 2021. Firefighters observed black smoke coming from No.2 hold. The extinguishing work continues.

Master complained of breathing difficulties and fever. He was taken to hospital where he tested positive for Covid-19. All 23 Indian crew were tested and four of them were put into self-quarantine. As of May 6th the master remained in hospital. The other crew remained healthy.

collided with an unidentified anchored bulk carrier at Kandla Anchorage, Gujarat, Western India on April 28th, according to her track. A video was taken from what looks to have been a floating crane that was moored alongside the bulk carrier.

A U.S.-flagged containership, MV President Eisenhower, suffered a fire in California’s Santa Barbara Channel Wednesday morning and it appears to be drifting towards shore, but at this point there seems to be little concern over a risk of grounding.

Reportedly attacked in the port of Yanbu. Saudi Arabia intercepted an explosive-laden remote-controlled boat off the Red Sea port of Yanbu after maritime security firms cited “unconfirmed reports” of an attack on a vessel in the area, the country’s defence ministry stated on Tuesday April 27th
Vessel collided with an incoming vessel at Kandla port India 28 Apr 2021. According to Lloyd's List Intelligence vsl is expected to reach Suez Canal, Egypt, 17 May.

The U.S. Coast Guard is investigating a reported pier allision and vessel grounding involving the tug boat Don Jaime and the deck barge Marilin H in Culebra, Puerto Rico. At this time, the tugboat and barge have been refloated and there are no reports of injuries, oil discharge or sheening in the surrounding waters. The incident reportedly occured Tuesday afternoon, while the tug and barge were conducting docking maneuvers at the island’s Ensenada Honda auxiliary cargo dock.

While bunkering Chios Trinity, fuel spilled on Chios Trinity & port waters, due to fuel hose rupture, at Vanino, Russia, on 27 Apr 2021. Oil boom placed around Chios Trinity & area monitored for spill.

Reported NUC due to a cylinder fault in the main engine, in lat 49 37 05N, long 006 06 06W, SE of Isles of Scilly, 27 Apr 2021. The defect was rectified within 25 minutes of the initial time of breakdown, same day.

suffered an explosion followed by fire in one of its cargo tanks during welding works on April 24th while it was , while anchored off Baniyas, Syria. Three people were reported as killed in the explosion, including two crew members and one worker. A subsequent fire was extinguished the same day. Initial reports from local news agencies had been that the vessel was the victim of either an Israeli missile or drone attack.

(Bloomberg) -- Oil tanker 'A Symphony' met with an incident that caused a spill in the Yellow Sea off China, according to a statement by the country’s maritime safety administration. Nearby vessels have been instructed to move away from the area alls to the press office of Qingdao port went unanswered
While bunkering by tanker Siziman, oil spilled on the deck & port waters, due to fuel hose rupture, at Vanino, Russia, on 27 Apr 2021. Oil boom placed around vessel. Area monitored for spills.

A suezmax tanker controlled by Piraeus-based NGM Energy was damaged in a collision off the Chinese port of Qingdao on Tuesday. Goodwood Ship Management, the A Symphony’s Singapore-based technical managers, said the tanker was at anchor when it was struck by a vessel it described as bulk carrier named Sea Justice.

A crew member of fishing vessel Pino Ladra (IMO 9338436) was medevaced by helicopter 13nm northwest of Cabo Ortegal, northwest Spain, during the morning of April 27th. The chief engineer had suffered an eye injury that required external assistance. The victim taken to the airport in Culleredo  where an ambulance was waiting to transfer the fisherman to a hospital.
Wallenius Wilhelmsen car carrier ran aground in Chesapeake Bay early Tuesday as it departed the Port of Baltimore, but the vessel was refloated without pollution or injury, the Coast Guard reported.

Eleven international crew members left livestock carrier Polaris 3 (IMO 9441740) on April 27th when it docked in Townsville, Queensland, Australia and sought asylum. One of them temporarily disappeared, but subsequently handed himself in to police.

suffered an engine failure during the night of April 26th while transiting the Bosphorus Straits, Istanbul, in a southerly direction, en route from Nikolayev, Ukraine to Hekere, Gulf of Izmit, Turkey, with a cargo of steel. The ship was taken under control by two Traffic Control tugs and towed to Ahirkapia Anchorage, in the Marmara Sea, Istanbul. As of April 28th the ship remained at Istanbul anchorage. 12-Feb -21 : Engine failure, lost power & drifted in lat 41 18 00N, long 029 16 00E, Istanbul Strait, 12 Feb 2021. Towed to Tuzla, 13 Feb. Permanent repair works were commenced by technical teams. Stationary in Tuzla shipyard, 12 Mar.

General cargo ship Alica (IMO 8600868), which has container capacity, capsized at Ho Chi Minh port, Nha Be during themorning of April 26th, while about to set sail for Indonesia. The ship rested on bottom portside, with most of the hull and superstructure remaining above waterline. Of the 54 containers on board, 18 slipped into water, some floating in the area, and some taken away by the river stream.

Vessel came in contact with sailing vessel Beta at the North-East bound lane of the Dover TSS, in position 51 00 02.0N 001 34 55.0E, 26 Apr 2021. The sailing vsl was unlit & traveling against flow of traffic with in TSS. Beta towed Calais.

General cargo ship Saga Faith (IMO 9808651) had to divert to Montevideo, Uruguay while under way in Rio de la Plata during the morning of April 26th after a crew member passed out due to breathing problems. The MRCC Uruguay informed the Navy and a patrol boat approached the ship with paramedics on board, but unfortunately they were unable to resuscitate him and the 38-year old Indian national died. The ship had sailed from Sao Fransisco du Sul Brazil on April 23rd and was bound for Nueva Plamira. As of April 27th the vessel was at anchor off Montevideo.
1 crew member injured while bunkering vessel Seago Piraeus, after a heavy object from Seago Piraeus fell on the tanker deck, at Bremerhaven, Germany, on 25 Apr 2021.
Vsl broke lose from tug was presumed to have sunk 24 Apr 2021. Cause of the loss unknown. Debris was recovered,no risk of an oil spill vsls tanks been emptied prior to transit.
Vessel with 26 pob, experienced problems with cooling system to engine room in position 49 50 42.0N 003 19 30.0W, 26nm of Start Point, UK, 24 Apr 2021.

Vessel experienced problems due to low pressure in engine in position 49 39 18.4N 006 11 47.2W, at apprx 20nm S-E from the Isles of Scilly, UK, outside of TSS, 24 Apr 2021. Vsl underway using its own engines, next port of call Rotterdam.

had to be towed by five tugs from outer anchorage to the port of Le Havre, France on April 24th because of safety concerns. The ship was immobilized due to a mass outbreak of sickness on board. Sixteen of the 25 crew tested positive for Covid 19, but it was not certain that this was the cause of the vessel becoming immobilized. Two crew members were airlifted to hospital on April 20th. One of them, a Chief Engineer, was later moved to ICU, where he remained as of April 24th. The Boluda Towage Group was contracted for moving the tanker to the Quay de Osaka on at 10:00 on April 24th.

Vessel had a bottom touch during unmooring operations from Pier C of the port of Montevideo on April 24th, being fully loaded with 36,000 tons logs and bound for Sanshui. The vessel was subsequently shifted to the service area at Punta del Este and moored in position where an underwater inspection was carried out on April 26th. This revealed a misaligned rudder on the starboard side. As of May 18th the ship was at anchor off Recalada.

Vessel in ballast condition entered Canakkale Strait from the southern entrance for transit passage, experienced technical failure during the Strait passage 24 Apr 2021. Vsl dropped anchor at Karanlik anchorage vsl stationary at anchorage.

Experienced a mechanical failure in its port main engine, 23 Apr 2021. It was able to proceed independently to the port of Zante. Initially detained the vessel in port, after completion of repairs, it was allowed to sail.

Reported NUC, due to main engine defect, in lat 59 25 58N, long 000 12 39W, about 43 NM E of Fair Isle, late hours of 23 Apr 2021. Need 3 to 4 hours to complete. Completed repairs on the morning of 24 Apr.

was searched by Portuguese police on April 23rd at Viana do Castelo port, northern Portugal, after a tip from an unnamed foreign agency. The ship had arrived at Viana do Castelo on April 20th from Turkey via Gibraltar, reportedly carrying a cargo of blast furnace slag.

Sri Lankan authorities was reported to have expelled general cargo ship BBC Naples (IMO 9484223) on April 21st after it allegedly entered Sri Lankan waters without declaring a shipment of radioactive materials that were destined for China. The ship was asked to leave the port of Hambantota after the discovery, along with its shipment of uranium hexafluoride. The ship had not declared its cargo dangerous, the authorities claimed, and it was decided to order it to leave the waters immediately.

Reported NUC, due to a technical issue related to its engines, in lat 59 12 00N, long 000 47 00W, about 32 NM SE of Fair Isle, 23 Apr 2021. Crews had restarted the engines when contacted but needed time to fix the issue.

Vessel that was anchored at the Yokohama Anchorage, Japan,ran aground and came in contact with Yujin  22 Apr 2021. Vsl was damaged near the centre of the starboard side,no personal injury nor oil spill occurred.

Cargo ship Shoryu Maru was reported to have ran aground and allided with cargo m/v Yujin (IMO 9207156) during the evening of April 22nd. There was damage amidships on the starboard side to the Shoryu Maru. No injuries or pollution were reported. The Yujin was hit at port side and the extent of damage was unknown.

Vessel came in contact with a shrimp boat that sank off port Topolobampo Mexico 21 Apr 2021. about 14 tons oil leaked from wreck of boat off Sinalo bow was still protruding from the water boomed off, but oil slick could move to Maviri.
Vessel experienced technical failure at Mersin, Turkey, 21 Apr 2021.vsl's departure permission cancelled by HM until completion of further repairs. Vsl stationary at Mersin.

While at Tuzla shipyard area anch, dragged anchor due to adverse weather & ran aground off Tuzla, 20 Apr 2021. Steel replacement partly completed in the shipyard. Subject location tightness test in progress. Stationary in the Tuzla, 04 Jun.

Vessel experienced a sudden breakdown of main engine after it left Savona Italy 20 Apr 2021. Failure resulted in loss of propulsion staff of VTS Section contacted vsl which dropped anchors to carry out checks. Vsl safely berthed cargo port.

Vessel reported being disabled due to issues with its cooling system off Vancouver Island, B.C., Canada,in position 48 48 30.0N 125 58 24.0W, 19 Apr 2021. Crew members carried out repairs and vessel proceeded to the Victoria pilot station.

An explosion, followed by a fire, took place on vessel while at Weihai Port, China, 19 Apr 2021. passengers were safely evacuated, the cargo deck was sealed and flooded with carbon dioxide. Fire, was still raging, with black smoke 20 Apr.
April 18th landed onto breakwater at Catbalogan, Samar island, Philippines, when typhoon Surigae hit eastern Philippines islands.

General cargo ship Heinz G (IMO 9536521) reportedly collided with Mole 2 during the morning of April 17th when about to enter the Kiel Canal via a small lock in Brunsbuettel. The ship’s bow was reportedly damaged. The ship was berthed at Brunsbuettel, resuming transit early in the morning of April 18th and continued en route to Gdynia, Poland. As of April 20th the vessel was underway from Gdynia, Poland to Liepaja, Latvia.
After coming in contact with vessel, general cargo Lilleoere arrived at Orskov Yard in Frederikshavn, Denmark on 17 Apr 2021 for repairs. Damage to Lilleoere significant.

Vessel reported taking its No. 1 propeller shaft system offline,while docked at the Langdale Ferry Terminal, BC, Canada, in position 49 26.028N 123 28.319W, 16 Apr 2021. Vsl continued its scheduled sailing with No. 2 propeller shaft system.

Ran aground in lat 39 49 04N, long 26 04 03E, E of Bozcaada Island at the southern entrance of Canakkale Strait, 16 Apr 2021. Coastal safety tug Turkeli, fast rescue boats & technical teams attended. Vessel remains in grounding pos.

Sustained damage to its rudder mechanism, at the Piraeus anch, Greece, 15 Apr 2021. Without requesting any assistance, the vessel sailed to a berth at Piraeus. The vessel detained in port until the rudder is repaired.

suffered a loss of stability and developed a list first to port and then to starboard side at the Pasir Panjang Terminal in Singapore on April 15th. A salvage company was contracted to bring the ship back on even keel. As of May 4th, the vessel remained at berth 2 of the terminal. It had sailed from Pontianak on April 11th and arrived in Singapore on April 13th.
Vessel 7pob experienced electrical problems resulting in engine failure in position 54 03 25.0N 005 50 18.0W, UK 14 Apr 2021. Vsl was nuc Mourne Venture took vsl in tow to Belfast Anchorage.

reports that bulk carrier, AHU C, ran aground whilst navigating the Congo River on or about 14 April 2021. * Salvage services were rendered to the vessel by professional salvors acting under Lloyd's Open Form terms following the casualty. Subsequently, Salvage Security is required to be provided by cargo interests prior to the release of cargo and W K Webster may be able to assist. Security provided by WKW is acceptable to the Council of Lloyd's and widely preferred by professional Salvors.

Had a technical issue & its Stornoway to Ullapool service was disrupted, 14 Apr 2021. The ferry is in Ullapool awaiting repairs. Completed 50 hours of sea trials before arriving in Stornoway, 30 May, for further test which were successful.

Six people were rescued after the SEACOR Power lift boat capsized on Tuesday, April 13, around 4:30 p.m. approximately 8 miles south of Port Fourchon during severe weather. One deceased victim was later recovered and 12 were initially reported missing
Vessel reported mechanical trouble in Port of Spain, Trinidad & Tobago on 13 Apr 2021. Still at port as of next day.
