Vessel reported being disabled due to the loss of electrical power while anchored off Pointe-aux-Trembles, Quebec, Canada, in position 45 38 23.5N 073 28 43.0W, 13 Apr 2021. Power was eventually restored & vsl resumed its operations.

The captain of container ship Ital Libera (IMO 9322475) was reported to have fallen ill and subsequently died on board while the ship was in Indian ocean on a scheduled trip from Durban, South Africa to Singapore. The ship was banned from entering Singapore on April 13th. The captain had boarded the ship on April 1st at Durban, arriving there via Doha and Johannesburg. Covid-19 was reported as being the cause of death. As of May 5th the vessel remained at Jakarta Anchorage.
Fire on board during welding works, while berthed at Onne, Nigeria, on 13 Apr 2021. Extinguished. No injuries. Investigation underway.
Came in contact with fishing vessel Rabah, approx. in pos lat 12 48 55N, long 074 06 04E, India, on 12 Apr 2021. Fishing vessel sank. 3 of its crew dead. 2 rescued & 9 missing.

Vessel reportedly came in contact with FV Vencedor III in the channel of new port of Rio Grande, Brazil on 12 Apr 2021. FV sank, Pilot of Barra do Rio Grande rescue 3 crew, not injured. Navy investigates. Vessel sailed 13 Apr for Recalada.

During decommissioning at Shipbreaking yard, near Chittagong Port in Bangladesh, experienced a fire, 11 Apr 2021. 3 workers sustained burn injuries in an explosion while working at a shipbreaking yard. Workers were admitted to a hospital.

Crews on board sighted 4 perpetrators in the engine room, while underway in the Singapore Straits, about 7.6 NM, NW of Tanjung Pergam, Pulau Bintan, Indonesia, 10 Apr 2021. Master reported that some engine spares had been stolen.

Had a fire at Timaru, 09 Apr 2018. Preparation for scuttling is in progress. Authority confirmed the review, 05 May 2021, after Environment Canterbury made public its last-minute plea for it to reconsider how the vessel was disposed of.

A fire injured two crew members on board vessel, who sustained burns following exposure to fuel oil while on duty in the engine room, 08 Apr 2021. Vessel is still at the Jimah Energy Ventures (JEV) Terminal at Port Dickson, Malaysia.

https://splash247.com/oil-tanker-and-bulk-carrier-collide-off-cavite-city/  An oil tanker and cargo ship collided in waters off Cavite City, the Philippine Coast Guard (PCG) said Thursday. PCG personnel have responded to the collision of MTr Rich Rainbow

Detained in Tilichiki port area, due to three months of wage arrears to the crews amounting to 1.8 million roubles, 07 Apr 2021. Vsl moored at Petropavlovsk-Kamchatskiy, Russia, in position 52 59 37.0N 158 34 46.0E, 13 Apr.

Experienced technical failure at Ceyhan, Turkey, 07 Apr 2021. Vessel’s departure permission cancelled by Harbourmaster until completion of repairs. Repairs are being carried out by the crews & it remains stationary at Ceyhan, as of 08 Apr.

ESCAPE, experienced a steering gear failure whilst navigating in a position off Vlieland Island, Netherlands on 7 April 2021. * The vessel was later taken under tow by tug towards Rotterdam for inspection and repairs. It has been confirmed that salvage services are being rendered to the vessel by professional salvors on Lloyd's Open Form terms.

Four robbers armed with knives entered engine room of vessel in the Singapore Straits, 07 Apr 2021. Robbers hit motorman on head before escaping. Alarm was raised. Nothing was stolen. Ar in Qinzhou Anch, China, 12 Apr & Sd 20 Apr.
While trying to berth in Hakata Port, Japan, its anchor allided with the berth & damaged it, 07 Apr 2021.

RICH RAINBOW, came into collision with bulk carrier, IVY ALLIANCE (31,572 grt) in a position approximately 3 nautical miles off Cavite City, Philippines on 7 April 2021. * IVY ALLIANCE is reported to have been carrying a cargo of coal from Kalimantan, Indonesia to Zhenjiang, China at the time of the collision. * Both vessels sustained significant damage as a result of the collision. * RICH RAINBOW sustained a breach of its starboard side shell plating, over a length of approximately 20 metres, above the water line but is reported to remain stable and there is no reported leakage of cargo. * IVY ALLIANCE sustained a breach of its starboard foreship shell plating, over a length of approximately 15 metres, above the water line and is also reported to remain stable.

Vessel allided with Caland Bridge while entering Britannia harbour in Rotterdam, Netherlands, 7 Apr 2021. Hull sustained a crack, ballast water tank at starboard side bow was breached,water leaked out. Allision was probably strong wind.
Vessel broke loose from mooring in stormy weather at Vestmanna, Faroe Islands on 06 Apr 2021. Almost completely submerged after battering by swell, remains aground with heavy damage as of 08 Apr.

Reportedly targeted by limpet mines in the Red Sea, 06 Apr 2021. The vessel was stationed in the Red Sea for the past few years to support Iranian commandos sent on a commercial vessel anti-piracy escort mission.

Vessel anchored off Port-Cartier, Quebec,Canada, reported disabled due to problem with fuel oil supply to main engine in position 50 00 57.7N 066 46 30.7W, 6 Apr 2021. Crew done repairs vsl resumed voyage.
While trying to berth in Shimizu Port, Japan, vessel allided with a gantry crane on 05 Apr 2021. No injuries reported.

a fire was ignited in containers on board fully cellular container ship, INTERASIA CATALYST, on 5 April 2021, shortly after the vessel had departed from Port Klang. * Assistance to extinguish the fire was initially provided by four tugs and the vessel was later able to return to anchor at Port Klang under its own power, where additional fire fighting assistance was provided to the vessel by local emergency services. * It is reported that the fire remained burning in several containers as at 11 April 2021.

EEMSLIFT HENDRIKA, developed a heavy list as a consequence of a shift of deck cargo whilst navigating the Norwegian Sea in challenging weather conditions, approximately 60 nautical miles west of Alesund, Norway on 5 April 2021. * The vessel is reported to have been listing by up to 50 degrees to starboard and to have taken on water. The Master issued a distress signal as a consequence of the list and eight crew members were later evacuated from the vessel. The remaining four crew members remained on board to attempt to salvage the vessel.

Experienced technical failure of engine system along with emergency support pumps at Novorossiysk, Russia, 04 Apr 2021. Vessel's departure permission cancelled by Harbourmaster. Repair works ongoing. Stationary at Novorossiysk anch, 06 Apr.

Vessel which was docked at a local shipyard in Lower Jasaan for 5 years, sank due to a break in its hull on 04 Apr 2021. Oil Discharge confirmed. 2000 liters of oil collected by Philippines coastguard.

Vessel from United States to Panama Apr 4, when it encountered small boat approx 50nm off Grand Cayman. Vsl took aboard the dozen adults & two children vsl finds itself caught in standoff between refugees & government of Grand Cayman.

Container ship Sofia Express (IMO 9450404) reported a case of Covid-19 on board when the ship arrived in Tacoma, Washington State on April 4th. The crew member was taken ashore and the vessel was cleaned.

RHL Julia was involved c/w Aisha Sarwar, at Chittagong outer anch, Bangladesh 3 Apr 2021. Completion of temporary repairs, vessel has sailed towards Mongla Port, 09 Apr, with remaining cargo on board 22000 metric tonnes for final discharge.

Habco Pioneer c/w fishing vessel Barokah Jaya, NE of Jakarta in the Indramayu Regency waters, West Java, 03 Apr 2021. Fishing vessel with 32 aboard capsized after its collision. SAR undergoing for finding 17 people of fishing vessel.

RHL Julia was involved c/w Aisha Sarwar, at Chittagong outer anch, Bangladesh, 03 Apr 2021. Cargo discharging completed, 11 Apr & vessel will be sailing to Singapore, 12 Apr, without any temporary repair, upon completion of all customs.

Reported as disabled due to breakdown of main engine fuel supply system, 1.34 NM ESE of Stephens Island, 03 Apr 2021. Crew effected repairs & vessel continued voyage. Ar in the Port of Rizhao, China, 21 Apr & Sd 26 Apr.

Vessel 22pob, reported engine breakdown due to problems with fuel injector in posi 51 17 02.4N 001 51 25.8E, Dover Straits S-W bound lane S of Hastings 2 Apr 2021. Fuel oil leak on vsl has been repaired vsl underwayas of 3 Apr.

fully cellular container ship, MSC ARIANE, experienced an engine failure in a position south of Wakayama, Japan, whilst en route from Xiamen to Los Angeles on 2 April 2021. * The vessel was later taken under tow to Wakayama for repairs. * Operators of the vessel, MSC, report that the engine failure occurred as a consequence of the supply of poor fuel to the vessel.
Four robbers boarded at Conakry Anchorage, Guinea, on 02 Apr 2021. Money & crew belongings stolen. Robbers escaped. Crew safe. Sd from Conakry Anch, 03 Apr.

Vessel had engine failure, lost power and was drifting dangerously towards shore at Yenikoy point in the Istanbul strait on 01 Apr 2021. Being towed to Istanbul anch. Incident investigation file placed by HM and Strait Authority. Update *April 12 2021* vessel detained at Sheerness due to 19 deficiencies including 6 grounds for detention.
Vessel arrested at Hull, UK due to 8 deficiencies found by the port inspection authorities. It was later released on the 10th of April

Was involved in a collision with Z.85 ALEXIS II, about W of Borssele wind farm, in North sea, near Belgium, 31 Mar 2021. Both the vessels sustained minor damage to the starboard side above the waterline. No assistance was needed.

Vessel with 19 pob, needed to replace the sensor on main engine cylinder in position  51 15 00N, 001 39 49.8E, 2.5nm N-E of the East Goodwin Light Vessel, UK, 31 Mar 2021. Subsequently,  vsl completed repairs & continued Southampton.
Whilst towing barge Iholm II, Wismar, Germany, experienced an engine failure, on 30 Mar 2021. Convoy grounded. Pulled back to pier. Banned from sailing for damage assessment.

Ran aground extreme tides on sand sea basin in pos 56 50 24N 005 07 54W 30 Mar 2021. Divers assessment done vsl found minor scratches propeller blade 1 Apr. Class register cleared vsl to sail one-month complete repairs & proceeded Norway.
Severe starboard side list at Pella shipyard, Russia, on 30 Mar 2021. Holds flooded. 80 people on board, 78 rescued, 2 dead.

Vessel in a laden condition experienced technical failure, sheltered & dropped anchor at Kemer anchorage Antalya, Turkey, 29 Mar 2021. Repairs being done by crew.Vsl stationary at Kemer anchorage Antalya, Turkey.

Vessel caught fire in Mazatlan, Mexico on 29 Mar 2021, 100 workers were evacuated. Fire started in one of the cabins, reached the upper areas of the ship. Fire fighting forces from different sections involved, fire contained after 7 hours.

Baskop experienced loss of power & engine control & came in contact with vessel under cargo operation at Venice, Italy on 29 Mar 2021. Damage from side shell plating with various bent, indents & deformations. Investigation opened.
Vessel came into contact with a berth during berthing operations at Hakata Port, Japan, 29 Mar 2021.

Vessel experienced loss of power & engine control & came in contact with Cileen M under cargo operation at Venice, Italy on 29 Mar 2021. Vessel shifted to berth. Damage from aft starboard quarter with holes, cracks & deformation.

Vessel allided with pier at Marport container terminal in Ambarli, Turkey during berthing manoeuvre 27 Mar 2021. Initial damage surveys on vsl was carried out anchorahe area shifted Ambarli to Asyaport, Tekirdag to discharge remain cargo
Vessel reportedly came in contact with general cargo FENG YUAN 68 off Ningde in the Fujian Province, China on 27 Mar 2021. Cargo ship breached, sank, one crew rescued, 6 missing. SAR launched.
Vessel reported engine breakdown, sidelined in Bellingham, Washington, USA on 26 Mar 2021. Remains stationary at same place as of 30 Mar.

Vessel, under conduct of a pilot, ran aground at entrance to navigable access channel to port of San Andres, Colombia on 26 Mar 2021. Channel unobstructed, ship traffic continues, as of next day. An investigation launched.
Vessel had technical failure at Nemrut Bay, Turkey on 26 Mar 2021, departure permission cancelled by Harbour Master until completion of repairs. Crew carrying out repairs.

Had technical failure at Mersin, Turkey on 26 Mar 2021, departure permission cancelled by Harbour Master until completion of repairs. Repairs still being carried out by crews, vessel remain stationary at Mersin as of 28 Mar.

Vessel reported exhaust system failure near Shelburne, NS, Canada on 26 Mar 2021, needed assistance from local FVs. No injuries or fire, vessel anchored to investigate problem, towed to Shelburne for repairs.

Vessel involved in a collision with a FV, SE of Ravenna, Italy, Adriatic Sea on 25 Mar 2021. The FV sank, 4 fishermen rescued, probably by Bergfjord. Vessel continued voyage, arrived in Ravenna, same day.

Under arrest & remained stationary at Iskenderun anchorage since August 2013, dragged anchor due to prevailed adverse weather condition, drifted to shore & ran aground. Vsl to be towed to Iskenderun Anch in better weather.
Vessel while in the Singapore Straits, Singapore, 5 robbers armed with knives boarded vsl 24 Mar 2021. Master raised alarm, crew mustered,search conducted Nothing was reported stolen.

A fire broke out on vessel while at berth No.2 in the Pilbara iron ore Port of Port Hedland, Australia, 24 Mar 2021. Tugs & Department of Fire & Emergency Services called to assist in extinguishing fire. A smoke alert parts of Port Hedland.

Ran aground at Rodbergodden in Malangen, 23 Mar 2021, during stormy weather conditions & dense snow. It managed to refloat but reported large leaks & requested towing assistance. The damage is to be investigated after arriving in Tromso.

Vessel reportedly violated rules of navigation, made contact with stern of tanker (unspecified) Kola in Gulf of Suez on 23 Mar 2021. Crew of Kola not injured, it continued planned military task. Master of vessel reportedly pleaded guilty.

Vessel had engine failure S of Canakkale Turkey 23 Mar 2021. Vsl arrived Tuzla anchorage 28 Mar entered shipyard 29 Mar. Repairs done by shipyard technical teams as regards class surveyor further recommendations. Vsl remains Tuzla ship yard
Vessel had technical failure during Istanbul Strait passage, dropped anchor and moored at the Buyukdere anchorage for repairs on Mar 23. Vsl arrived at Tavsancil in Gebze on 25 Mar.
Ran aground KM-151 Suez Canal Egypt transiting northbound convoy 23 Mar 2021. Japanese owner 1 Apr declared General Average for vsl.
Had mechanical failure off Steno Kafireas, Greece in approx pos 38 03 48.0N, 24 36 08.4E, 22 Mar 2021. Port Authorities informed. Sd from the Port of Laurium, Greece, 23 Mar 2021.
Experienced mechanical problems 22 Mar 2021, dropped anchor approximately 50 NM E of Karlskrona, Sweden. Tug Karl took vessel in tow, convoy arrived at port of Karlskrona on 24 Mar, for repairs.
Fire in engine room, off Misurata, Libya, on 22 Mar 2021. Under tow to Tuzla, Turkey, ETA 09 Jun.
Vessel came into contact with a berth during berthing operations at Shimizu Port, Japan, 21 Mar 2021. Vsl left port same day headed to Nagoya & arrived 22 Mar.
Vessel ran aground off Cape Ubac in the Koromacno Bay on 20 Mar 2021. Refloated shortly after and resumed voyage. Vessel needs to undergo a survey, for possible hull damages, in Rasa.

Experienced an engine failure in the canal port of Brunsbuttel while approaching the small Southern lock, at the end of its westbound transit of the Kiel Canal on 20 Mar 2021. Damage rectified & continued its voyage.

According to Spanish Maritime Authorities vessel had engine problems 3nm off Las Palmas anch, Canary Islands, Spain on 20 Mar 2021. Crew repaired engine, Spanish pollution control vsl Miguel de Cervantes escorted vsl out of Spanish waters.
While unloading cargo of zinc concentrate from 2 dock workers died on vessel from poisoning in South Korea on Mar 19 after inhaling the gas released from concentrate from vsl's hold

Vessel got its propulsion fouled by own fishing net off Honningsvaag, Norway, requested assistance on 19 Mar 2021. Norwegian CG deployed patrol boat Jarl to assist, vessel safely towed into port Honningsvaag on 20 Mar.

Vessel sustained damage to starboard hydrofoil main engine 18 Mar 2021 . Vsl able to continue its journey to Piraeus on conventional engines 35 passengers were disembarked safely. Piraeus Port Authority detained vsl until engine repaired.

Ran aground W off Bozcaada Island S entrance Canakkale Strait, 18 Mar 2021. All salvage & re-floating attempts failed while additional tug & salvage have been appointed by coastal safety in order to provide further support.

Experienced technical failure at Gemlik, Turkey, 18 Mar 2021. Vessel’s departure permission cancelled by Harbourmaster until completion of repair. Repairs still being carried out by the crews & it remains stationary at Gemlik, as of 19 Mar.

CSCL Star, which was about to sail from Hamburg, Germany, was towed away from the Tollerort Terminal by several tugs, after it drifted & c/w Hanseatic Inspiration. CSCL Star was moored & after investigations left Hamburg.

Vessel presumably came in contact with a fiber-glass FV 46 NM off Kochi, India on 18 Mar 2021. Under investigation at Kochi Port. Boat damaged, all 6 fishermen safe. Arrived in the Port of Sikka on 24 Mar.

CSCL Star, which about to sail from Hamburg, Germany, was towed away from Tollerort Terminal by several tugs after it drifted & c/w Hanseatic Inspiration. Hanseatic Inspiration damaged its port side, at the compass bridge above wheelhouse.

Eight robbers armed with knives boarded vessel at Callao Anchorage, Peru in pos 12 00 56.0S 077 12 00.0W on 17 Mar 2021. Duty able seaman was taken hostage and tied up; later released. Incident reported to local port authorities.

Allided middle approach pier of the old Southern lock upon entering the Kiel Canal in Brunsbuttel, Germany on 17 Mar 2021. Police boarded after it moored in lock for investigations. Later vessel started its Eastbound transit.

Vessel requested Spanish authorities to medevac 3 sick crews with Covid-19-like symptoms on 16 Mar 2021. Requested to dock vessel at outer Port of Corunna for 7-10 days quarantine. Permission to dock granted, berthed at Langosteira.

Vessel while at the Callao Anchorage, Peru, unnoticed, robbers boarded, and broke into forecastle store, stole ship's properties and escaped  in position 12 01 09.0S 077 10 54.0W, 16 Mar 2021.  Theft noticed duty watch next routine rounds.

Robbers boarded vessel unnoticed while at Cam Pha Port, Vietnam on 15 Mar 2021. They broke into 2 crew cabins, stole crews' & ship's cash & escaped. Local authorities informed, investigation conducted.
Vessel experienced navigational system failure along with Gyro Compass failure on 14 Mar 2021. Vsl remains stationary at the Novorossiysk Timber Container Terminal 16 Mar.

Vessel experienced an engine failure when entering the New Northern Lock of the Kiel Canal in Brunsbuttel, Germany, 14 Mar 2021. Vsl has to berth at the railway station pilings in the canal Port of Brunsbuttel for investigations.
Allided with pier at Riga, Latvia, on 14 Mar 2021. Hull & pier damaged. Sailed after hull repaired, 18 Mar.
Vessel had engine failure in inner Port of Brunsbuttel, Germany while approaching locks on 14 Mar 2021; threatened to drift into another vsl; used emergency anchoring; entered lock, continued voyage.
Vessel with its prow midship c/w Afina I, at 10 NM W of Kythira Island, Greece on 13 Mar 2021. Work to detach the vsl from Afina I was completed on 28 Mar.

Vessel allided with a gate of large Northern lock of  Kiel Canal in Kiel-Holtenau, Germany, 13 Mar 2021. Vsl experienced a technical failure of engine and could not stop in time when entering lock. Vsl berthed at Lindenau Yard.
Vessel with its prow midship c/w Kiveli, at 10 NM W of Kythira Island, Greece, 13 Mar 2021. Vsl was detached from Kiveli 28 Mar.

Vessel was caught by a wind gust when leaving jetty in Butzfleth, Germany, and was pushed against the pierhead to its port side 13 Mar 2021. Dolphin was heavily damaged vsl not damaged to reach Sines 18 Mar.

Vessel experienced engine failure & dangerously drifted to shore due to adverse weather condition on 12 Mar 2021. Vsl completed cargo discharge operation Zonguldak HM gave towing & departure. Tug tow vsl to Tuzla.

Vessel berthed in Le Havare, France, after 2 sailors tested positive for Covid-19 12 Mar 2021. Both sailors disembarked in isolation. Vsl dropped anchor in Port-Jerome with a view to an escalation. Vsl remains stationary.
Vessel had fire on board in the central part of it, at the port of Corfu, Greece on 12 Mar 2021. One crew  on board, rescued immediately.
Allided with the berth in Oita Port, Japan, while berthing on 12 Mar 2021. Vessel sailed from Oita after an investigation was conducted by the Japanese Coastguard.

Had to stop main engine to replace damaged fuel pump, 12 Mar 2021; while it was able to resume passage following day, main engine had to be stopped again, 14 Mar for further investigation. Completed repairs & undergone sea trails, 01 Apr.
Vessel sank 7 nautical miles off the coast of Alexandria in the Mediterranean Sea, on 11 Mar 2021. 9 rescued. one missing & one is dead.

It is reported that chemical tanker, DAVIDE B., was boarded by 9 armed perpetrators in a position approximately 210 nautical miles south of Cotonou, Benin on 11 March 2021. * Ship managers advise that 15 crew members were abducted by the perpetrators, whilst the remaining 6 crew members were able to secure themselves in the ship's citadel.

Experienced fire on board, while in the Oslo Fjord west of the island Nordre Soster, 11 Mar 2021. Crew members were evacuated. Fire was extinguished, but there was no clarity about the batteries where a thermal runaway was feared.

Experienced technical failure to its hatch cover and pertinent system at Novorossiysk, Russia on 10 Mar 2021. Departure permission temporarily cancelled. Upon completion of repairs vessel granted departure permission, it sailed on 13 Mar.

Fire broke out onboard off the coast of Baniyas in Lattakia Anch, 10 Mar 2021. Firefighting underway. State-run shipping company said, 12 Mar, adding it would take legal action to identify the perpetrators of terrorism & naval piracy.

Vessel experienced a technical fault which caused engine failure on 09 Mar 20201 while underway between Vestnes and Molde, Norway. Vessel reached port, sidelined for troubleshooting by technicians of the operator.
Vessel experienced explosion onboard in pump house due to a grenade while moored in Delfzijl Harbor on 09 Mar 2021. No one injured. Extent of damage unknown.

Vessel, while on loaded passage from Yeosu, Korea to Jiangyin, China, came in contact with FV No. 98 IMSU, abt 12 NM SE of Geomun-do Island off Yeosu, S Korea on 09 Mar 2021. Lost PS anchor, damage at PS bow. Heavy damage to FV bow area.

A fishing vessel while catching fish in the waters near Dong Hoa Commune, c/w Olympia, 09 Mar 2021. F.vessel sank as a result & 9 fishermen fell into the sea. Olympia managed to save seven people & 2 fishermen still missing. SAR ongoing.
Vessel reported technical trouble during westbound transit of Kiel Canal at the height of Schacht-Audorf, Germany on 09 Mar 2021. Tugs towed vessel to Kiel, moored off Lindenau Yard.

Vessel under the conduct of a pilot reported being disabled due to machinery failure while berthing in Roberts Bank, BC, Canada, in pos 49 00 36.0N 123 10 00.0W on 08 Mar 2021. Vessel moored safely with help of tugs.

Vessel while at berth, came in contact with ferry Fernando Pessoa, which was departing passenger terminal Terreiro do Paco, Lisbon on 08 Mar 2021. No injuries or pollution. Portuguese maritime authorities investigating.

Vessel while departing passenger terminal Terreiro do Paco, Lisbon came in contact with berthed ferry Fernando Namora on 08 Mar 2021. No injuries or pollution. Portuguese maritime authorities investigating.

Had engine problem in pos 51 48 54N, 001 29 02E, about 11.5 NM from Harwich on 08 Mar 2021. Engine defect resulting the vessel to proceed at dead slow speed. Anchored in Sunk Inner Anchorage for investigation on 09 Mar.

Norah which was moored at Drapetzona, was blown by strong winds c/w Aqua Solution, which was moored port side aft of Norah, causing minor material damage, 07 Mar 2021. Keratsini Port banned departure of both vessels until it is seaworthy.
Vessel had engine control failure while approaching dock at Bedford Institute of Oceanography on 07 Mar 2021. Anchored and crew carried out repairs; arrived in Port aux Basques, Canada on 22 Mar.

Vessel 6pob, veered nine degrees to Port side & ran aground onto rocks, Norway, 7 Mar 2021. Vsls bow damaged & crushed from tip three metres down. Hole in bow vsl proceed to Husoy for further repairs. Investigation is ongoing.

Had main engine problem, anchored in pos 51 50 40N, 002 07 43E, abt 2.5 NM, S of Sunk E, UK on 07 Mar 2021. Dover CG will monitor vessel on AIS. Vessel stated that repairs may take approximately 3 hours.

Vessel notified Portuguese maritime authorities that while proceeding in Bremen Canal, Germany with a pilot embarked, allided with the jetty of a lock on 07 Mar 2021. No injuries or pollution resulted from the incident.

Norah which was moored at Drapetzona, was blown by strong winds c/w Aqua Solution, which was moored port side aft of Norah, causing minor material damage, 07 Mar 2021. Keratsini Port banned departure of both vessels until it is seaworthy.
Ran aground on reefs of Pointe-aux-Sables, west of Port Louis, Mauritius, 07 Mar 2021, probably being caught in rough seas. Refloated & detained in Mauritius, as of 11 Mar.

Experienced fire in its fish processing shop on board, abt 12 NM SW of Askold island, S of Vladivostok, Primorye, Russia, in Sea of Japan on 06 Mar 2021. SAR tugs responded & all crews evacuated. Firefighting ongoing.

Vessel had an engine failure upon entering the new Northern lock of Kiel Canal in Brunsbuttel on 06 Mar 2021. Was able to restart engine within a short time and safely berthed inside the lock. Could resume its voyage on 08 Mar.

Under conduct of pilot preparing to depart Quebec City Canada vessel reported as disabled due to  failure of one of exhaust valves in main engine in pos 46 49 38.3N 071 12 13.8W on 06 Mar 2021. Crew carried out repairs, vsl resumed voyage.
Boarded by thieves and had firefighting equipment stolen, while anchored at Douala, Cameroon, on 06 Mar 2021. Escaped unnoticed. Vessel sailed, 07 Mar.

Had engine difficulties while at Port Taranaki, New Zealand on 05 Mar 2021. Vessel meant to leave for China with a shipment of up to 4500 cows, 09 Mar. Repairs to one of the engines carried out with no cattle on board.

Vessel reported technical failure and went adrift, while sailing downstream on the Weser, en route from Bremen to Nantes in ballast on 05 Mar 2021. Tugs Baer and RT Emotion assisted and pulled it into Bremerhaven safely about 4 hrs later.

Vessel experienced bow thruster failure during Eastbound transit of Kiel Canal, Germany on 04 Mar 2021. Tug Stein towed vessel and berthed at Bominflot Quay for troubleshooting. Subsequently, vessel resumed voyage, ETA Ronnskar 07 Mar.

Reported NUC & was drifting SW at a speed of 0.2 knots, due to an economiser issue which led to main engine failure, in lat 49 49 07N, long 004 50 08W, about 16 NM bearing from Lizard Point, 04 Mar 2021. Vsl underway after repairs.
Vessel came in contact with quay of the Arman Shipyard in Gijon, Spain on 04 Mar 2021, sustained a breach, gaps and scratches at port-side bow, above waterline.
Vessel experienced engine failure while entering the new northern lock, Kiel Canal on the night of Mar 3. Subsequently entered the canal again and berthed for checks and repairs at 2345 hrs, Mar 3.

Experienced main engine problems & at anchor, 15 nm from Spurn point, on 03 Mar 2021. Issue fixed by replacing three of its engine cylinders, 06 Mar. It intends to wait for a pilot to enter the River Humber to proceed to the Immingham.
Experienced a mechanical breakdown, at the port of Preveza, Greece, 02 Mar 2021. The Port Authority of Preveza has detained the vessel in port until the engine is repaired.

Entangled a mooring rope around its bow auxiliary propellers, 02 Mar 2021. Entanglement caused a malfunction of bow auxiliary propellers; detained until repairs. After Class certification, permitted to sail on a single voyage to Piraeus.

Had a mechanical failure, in W Scheldt, while sailing downstream towards North sea, 02 Mar 2021. Immediately anchored & later relocated to Everingen anch, Netherlands, with three tugs assisting. Remains in same position, 03 Mar.

Allided with the embankment of the Kiel Canal, during the westbound transit of the waterway at Sehestedt, 02 Mar 2021. Unable to refloat with its own power, tug Flemhude was towed to Rendsburg. Complete repairs & resumed its voyage, 03 Mar.
Allided with the Dondang Bridge in Muara Jawa, Indonesia, 02 Mar 2021. The vessel reportedly hit a bridge pole which caused it to tilt and a part of the bridge sustained cracks.

Vessel had engine failure at Ambelaki, Greece. Arrived Tuzla shipyard, under tow, 08 Oct. Repairs underway, 12 Oct. Sailed from the yard on 26 May 2022, after completion of repair. Resumed its offshore activities.
Vessel had lost its starboard anchor while in the port of Arkoi, Greece, 01 Mar 2021. Proceeded back to the port of Kalymnos where it was prohibited from sailing until the anchor was replaced.

Ran aground after experiencing an engine failure, about 5.5 M WNW of Torre de Hercules & 5 M off Cape Priorino, 01 Mar 2021. SAR ship Salvamar Betelgeuse towed vessel to Oza dock in Corunna, Spain. Repairs completed & Returned to service.

CONTSHIP FUN, experienced a mechanical failure in a position approximately 15 nautical miles north of the island of Karpathos, Greece on 1 March 2021. * The vessel was later taken under tow by tug to Rhodes anchorage for inspection and repairs.

Experienced engine failure after entering the new Southern lock of Kiel Canal, in Brunsbuttel, 01 Mar 2021. Attempts to restart engine failed. Two tugs Bugsier 15 & Luchs towed it to the canal port of Brunsbuttel, where it is moored, 02 Mar

While departing Hakata Port, Japan, allided with the berth on its port side, 01 Mar 2021. Vsl left Hakata Port after the investigation conducted by the Japanese Coastguard was completed, and arrived in Hiroshima 2 Mar.
Experienced a fire in the engine room while operating on the Gothenburg-Fredrikshamn route, 28 Feb 2021. Fire was extinguished by the crew members and the voyage to Frederikshavn continued.

Kam Star while mooring at the port of Petropavlovsk-Kamchatskiy, Russia, c/w Yaropolk, 28 Feb 2021. No threat of pollution or water ingress. Extent of damage to the vessels is being investigated by Kamchatka Transport Prosecutor's Office.

Kam Star while mooring at the port of Petropavlovsk-Kamchatskiy, Russia, c/w Yaropolk, 28 Feb 2021. No threat of pollution or water ingress. Extent of damage to the vessels is being investigated by Kamchatka Transport Prosecutor's Office.

Vessel, probably contracted by owner to tow disabled bulk carrier Kapetan Sideris, also had mechanical breakdown, understandably while towing, south of Marbella, Spain on 27 Feb 2021. Both vessels drifting off Gibraltar on 28 Feb.

KAPETAN SIDERIS, experienced a mechanical breakdown and became disabled in a position south of Marbella, Spain on 27 February 2021. * Owners contracted a tug to take the vessel under tow towards Almeria, but the tug also experienced a mechanical breakdown during the towage, resulting in both vessels going adrift in a position approximately 11 miles north of Gibraltar. * It is reported that KAPETAN SIDERIS later arrived safely at Algeciras, Spain on 1 March 2021 for inspection.

Had an engine malfunction and a defect on its bow thruster, while serving in Lubeck-Travemunde route on 27 Feb 2021. Vessel assisted by port tugs Argus and Saturnus. Lataer, vessel proceeded to its next destination with reduced speed.

While escorted by 2 tugs, under the conduct of a pilot, vessel reported failure of main engine while berthing at Section 50 Port of Quebec, Canada in pos 46 49 07.4N 071 11 46.8W on 26 Feb 2021. Main engine restarted, vessel alongside.
During berthing operations at the port of Lagos, Nigeria, GH Meltemi with a pilot embarked c/w MSC Carmen, which was moored alongside, 26 Feb 2021. There were no injuries or pollution.
Vessel reportedly came in contact with a fishing vessel about 9 NM east of La Gi port, Binh Thuan, Vietnam on 26 Feb 2021. The FV sank on the spot. No injuries or casualties reported.
During berthing operations at the port of Lagos, Nigeria, GH Meltemi with a pilot embarked c/w MSC Carmen, which was moored alongside, 26 Feb 2021. There were no injuries or pollution.

Reportedly experienced an explosion on board, 44 NM NW of Muscat, Oman in pos 24 13 48N 58 19 48E, while en route from Dammam, Saudi Arabia to Singapore. No injuries reported. Investigations ongoing. Completed repairs, 03 Mar.
Fire on board at Total Terminal in Mardyck, Dunkirk, France, on 24 Feb 2021.  Extinguished and vessel remains berthed. Damage extent unknown.
Vessel reported crack on its hull plating at a ballast tank about 5.8 M below laden waterline; Nelson marine engineering company Aimex to begin repairs in Tasman Bay, New Zealand on 24 Feb 2021.

Vessel allided with wooden dock of Sint Maarten yacht club, 24 Feb 2021. Computer malfunction was the reason. When the yacht was being towed out of the marina, a huge gouge was spotted on the side of the yacht.
Ran aground near the island of Merak Besar in Banten Province, Indonesia on 24 Feb 2021. No injuries reported.

Came in contact with a fishing boat at Chiba Prefecture coast, NE Honshu, Japan on 23 Feb 2021. FV's bow  seriously damaged, crew injured. Cargo vessel had to interrupt the voyage and was diverted to Kashima.

Vessel with 13 pob NUC due to engine trouble, need to change fuel injection valve in pos 50 31 59.0N,  000 09 08.0W, approx 3.5nm off end of SW bound lane of Dover TSS on 22 Feb 2021. Subsequently repairs completed, vessel under way.

Crew sunk vessel by rapid flooding of all compartments, after an approach to seize vessel was conducted by Spanish patrol and customs. All crew members were arrested and 3 tons of cocaine was seized. Vessel was refloated in the Gijon port of El Musel on 11 February 2023.
Vessel in a laid up situation at Eleusis Port, Greece, experienced water ingress due to left inclination on 21 Feb 2021. Owners and Port Authorities were informed.

Reported NUC due to an electrical failure between engine & bridge, in lat 50 23 58N, long 001 58 38W, about 11 NM S of St. Aldheims Head, 21 Feb 2021. Needed 40 minutes for the repairs. Completed repairs & underway.

VEGA ALPHA, experienced an explosion in its main engine room on 21 February 2021, whilst in a position off the south coast of Vietnam. * It is reported that the vessel sustained major damage to the main engine and will be taken under tow to Batam/Singapore range for extensive repairs.

PHUC KHANH, experienced a blackout and drifted in the Saigon River, resulting in an allision with a tower crane on 21st February 2021 . * It is understood the crane structure fell on to the container stacks causing significant damage. * It is further reported that four containers fell overboard, of which three have been recovered from the river and the remaining container has sunk and requires removal. * PHUC KHANH has reportedly been towed to a terminal in Ho Chi Minh City where Authorities are investigating the incident.
Had engine failure near Nubbel, during the westbound transit of Kiel Canal, Istanbul on 21 Feb 2021, being towed to Brunsbuttel, next day. Sd from Brunsbuttel after repairs, 23 Feb.

Vessel had fire in switchboard room due to failure bow tunnel thruster autotransformer in pos 47 46 18.0N 054 02 00.0W, Canada 21 Feb 2021. Altera Infrastructure state:No fire on vsl; high current caused localized charring of paint & smoke.
Vessel started sinking in the Bay of Santa Marta, Columbia, 19 Feb 2021, 50 miles from the coast, after it began to show structural failures. Tug towed vessel to Dock 1 at Santa Marta.

Vessel  in ballast condition during the Strait passage, experienced technical failure at Uskudar point in Istanbul Strait, 19 Feb 2021. Vsl at Istanbul anchorage under its own power anchored. Vsl  stationary at Istanbul Anchorage.

After completing its cargo operations at Quang Ngai Port, vessel had an explosion and a fire, due to a short circuit in Quang Ngai waters, S.C. Vietnam on 19 Feb 2021. Fire extinguished by the crew members in about an hour.

Vessel had structural failure at SB bow on the forecastle deck external section, above waterline, at Istanbul Anch on 19 Feb 2021. Later vessel shifted to Tuzla Anch shipyard on 20 Feb. Repairs complete on 21 Feb; to sail after formalities.

Had an explosion on board, as it entered British Gibraltar Territorial Waters in Bay of Gibraltar, 19 Feb 2021. Explosion occurred around vessel's forecastle. No fire reported. Sd Gibraltar STS, Gibraltar, 22 Feb.
Vessel with 195 pob, experienced a blackout at the quay just north of Berghamn, Eckero, Sweden,18 Feb 2021. Touched bottom slightly, reached quay with own power. No damage found.
Vessel, sailing from Turkey with a cargo of Gypsum and 20 members on board, had engine failure, went adrift off Gythio, Greece in the Laconic Gulf, due to poor quality of bunker fuel on 18 Feb 2021.

Had main engine turbo charger failure 10 NM SW of St. Anns HD, 18 Feb 2021. Tug Welshman towing vessel & heading toward Cardiff. Attempts to resume towage failed due to adverse weather. Towed by tug Bever, it is to be taken to Avonmouth.

Vessel reported a fracture in one of its cargo holds while in Septlles, Quebec, Canada, in pos 50 11.889N 066 26.79W, 18 Feb 2021. Vsl proceeded to nearest anchorage to await further inspection by its Recognized Organization.
Came in contact with the dock, while berthing in Marystown, Canada, on 18 Feb 2021. It hit its starboard side in the corner of nearby dock which caused damage to frame 59. Still moored, 26 Feb.
Vessel reportedly sank while trying to avoid rough seas in the Gulf of Sidra, off Libya, 17 Feb 2021. The vessel's last AIS transmission was from lat 31 48 00N, long 018 44 00E.
Vessel capsized in port Trelleborg Sweden 17 Feb 2021. The salvage of vsl successfully completed 8 Mar.
Vessel lost their Port anchor with 9shackles at approx SE of Torquay Harbour, United Kingdom, in pos 50 26 45.6N 003, 31 9.0W on 17 Feb 2021. Vsl to undergo repairs in Portland Harbour.

Vessel ran aground after water ingress in engine room on Rauma waterway in Finland on 16 Feb 2021. However, vessel reached Rauma Container Terminalo with own power. CG and rescue services investigating.

Had loss of engine propulsion power for few minutes, lost containers overboard rough weather in pacific, 16 Feb 2021. Vsl departed from port & underway bound to APM Terminals Pier 400 Los Angeles ETA 13 Mar.
Vessel experienced problems with its propulsion near Batiscan, Quebec, Canada, in position 46 30 21.8N 072 13 55.4W, 16 Feb 2021. Vsl continued its voyage at reduced power.

Vessel under the conduct of a pilot reported was disabled due to problems with engine while berthed at Ridley Terminals, Prince Rupert, BC, Canada, in position 54 13 22.2N 130 20 09.6W on 15 Feb 2021. Crew carried out repairs.

Vessel did not run aground at 54-kilometre mark at Ballah, in pos 30 46 28N, 032 19 37E, Egypt, on 15 Feb 2021. It stopped due to engine trouble. Repairs were completed & vessel resumed voyage same day.

Reported as NUC due to unspecified problem related to a pipe in main engine, in lat 52 43 18N, long 002 11 16E on 13 Feb 2021. Needed one hour for repairs. Completed repairs within an hour, proceeding to its destination.

Vessel experienced fire onboard in pos 19 20 24N 071 12 36E 13 Feb 2021. Stability of vsl reportedly has not been affected due to the fire the convoy reached the anchorage of Mumbai with a weather-related delay on 15 Feb.
Vessel experienced engine failure while transiting the Kiel Canal 14 Feb 2021.Vslreached the waters of the North Sea and is estimated to reach Gibraltar 20 Feb.

Vessel  sustained mechanical damage 1.3nm off port of Sigri Lesbos Island Greece 12 Feb 2021. Permanent repairs on vsl has been interrupted from time to time due to the covid virus effects. Vsl stationary in the shipyard at Perama.

Vessel experienced fire on poop deck, superstructure, steering gear section & engine roomm, south of Mykolaiv, Ukraine, in pos 46 34 18N, 031 22 00E on 12 Feb 2021. Fire extinguished same day. No injury or pollution. Damages unknown.

Vessel stopped its main engine to investigate a lubrication system problem in St. Lawrence Estuary off Pointe des Monts, Quebec, Canada, in pos 49 13 18.7N 067 17 30.3W on 12 Feb 2021. Crew repaired, vessel resumed its voyage.

Vessel reported the failure of its starboard main engine in the sector of Haut-fond Prince, Quebec, Canada, in position 48 06 04.4N 069 35 04.3W, 12 Feb 2021. Vsl continued its voyage at reduced speed using the port main engine.

Fishing vessel Z18 SOETKIN was involved in a collision with Calypso.GR, in lat 50 27 25N, long 000 24 51W, about 22.3 NM from Selsey Bill, 12 Feb 2021. F.vessel sustained damage to its bow & currently recovering gear from the seabed.

Finished undergoing repairs when the explosion & fire occurred, anchored near PT Barokah Perkasa in East Kalimantan, Indonesia, 11 Feb 2021. A loud explosion heard before black smoke emerged from vessel. Incident reason unknown yet.

Vesssel came in contact with pier Agios Kyrikos/Ikaria Island Greece 11 Feb 2021. Vsl reportedly sustained a slight distortion of bulbous bow moored safely allowed to sail certificate of class maintenance for single voyage berthed in Perama

Experienced fire on its deck, west of Bozcaada Island, 11 Feb 2021. Extinguished fire, 11 Feb & cooling operation completed, same day. Vessel shifted from the ferry terminal to Sedef shipyard to carry out permanent repairs, as of 06 Mar.
Vessel in ballast condition experienced technical failure during the Strait passage and dropped anchor at Buyukdere anchorage in the Strait 11 Feb 2021. Vsl remains stationary at anchorage.

Vessel reported being disabled due to engine problem near Cowans Point, Bowen Island, British Columbia Canada in position 49 19 01.0N 123 22 17.0W 11 Feb 2021. Tug towed vsl to Constance Bank Anchorage & anchored at Anchorage 5 for repairs.
Vessel with 8pob while sailing at the sea area of Heraklion, Greece, experienced engine failure 10 Feb 2021. A tugboat is sailing to the area for assistance. Vsl has a cargo of plaster.
Experienced technical failure of firefighting system along with pertinent connections at Tuapse, Russia, 09 Feb 2021. Vsl  sailed from Tuapse on 11 Feb and arrived in Samsun port on 14 Feb.
Vessel was laid up at Kartal repair pier from 5 Feb 2017,mooring ropes parted and ran aground due to adverse weather condition in the area, 9 Feb 2021. Vsl stationary at grounding position.
Vessel experienced mechanical damage while sailing through South China Sea, on 09 Feb 2021. Damage in the engine caused a blackout and the vessel had to wait for a tug boat.
7 stowaways on board turned violent & attempted to take control of vessel, in south coast of England, were arrested by police after vessel arrived at Portland, United Kingdom, on 09 Feb 2021.
Fire on board in Caspian Sea, aprox in position 40 43 52N 051 06 22E, 34.4 nm from Chilov Island, Azerbaijan, 08 Feb 2021. Vsl undergoing repairs in Baku.

Experienced smoke in its engine room, shortly after departing from the Burchard Quay in Hamburg, 08 Feb 2021. Fire brigade entered the engine room & found out that there was an oil leakage causing the smoke which triggered the fire alarm.

Vessel veered off the fairway during transit with a pilot on board came in contact with dolphins at canal switch in Konigsforde, 8 Feb 2021. Vsl damage port side vsl berthed Athabaska Quay in Hamburg.
Experienced engine trouble in the waters off Vung Tau in Vietnam, 08 Feb 2021. Engine was repaired & vessel safely docked at Cai Mep International Terminal same day.

OCEAN ARTEMIS, was involved in a collision with a Japanese military submarine approximately 30 miles South of Kochi, Japan on 8th February 2021 * Reports suggest that the submarine surfaced and hit the bulk carrier whilst navigating to a training area off Cape Ashizuri.
Vessel experienced problems with its generator near PortCartier,Canada, in position 50 01 27.5N 066 47 06.0W, 8 Feb 2021. Vsl returned to Port-Cartier, for inspection.
Vessel was disabled due to engine problems, near Borkum, on the Northsea, on 07 Feb 2021. According to Lloyd's List Intelligence AIS, vsl arrived at Wilhelmshaven 9 Feb.
Vessel reported loss of astern propulsion near Port Renfrew, British Columbia, Canada, in position 48 30 25.0N 124 40 38.3W on 07 Feb 2021. Arrived in Vancouver anchorage for repairs on 09 Feb.
A steering gear system failure at Canakkale Strait, Turkiye, resulted in the cancellation of transit passage permission, causing the vessel to moor at Ambarli.

During berthing maneuvering with a pilot and tugs, reportedly lost engine power, and its stern allided with the breakwater at Haifa, Israel, The propeller was damaged. A tug towed it to Piraeus on April 7, arriving on April 14, where it remains stationary.
Vessel broke free from Pier 27 in San Francisco, USA, after three stern lines snapped, drifting to Pier 23 before returning to berth, causing one gangway loss.
Experienced a mechanical issue, while approaching Nanaimo from Horseshoe Bay, Vancouver, Canada, requiring the vessel to be pushed to the dock using a different steering method.
Suffered engine failure at Algeciras, Spain, Salvage tug Iraklis Z attended. A towage operation commenced on April 26 towards the Tuzla shipyard area, with an ETA in Tuzla, Turkiye, on May 9.
Starboard side collided with fishing vessel Do Cheong off Mokpo, South Korea, Vessel sustained hull damage, and temporary repairs are underway. No pollution was reported.
Work ship Pacific Guardian collided with the flare of Vessel's stern after pilot boarding in the Juan de Fuca Strait off Vancouver,  No damage was reported to Vessel.
Reported NUC off Lizard Point, UK, due to a defect with the No. 6 main engine fuel pump. The crew successfully carried out repairs, and vessel resumed its voyage, arriving in Brunsbuttel on April 2.
Allided with the wharf at the DBCT Coal Terminal, Australia,  The pilot reported no damage to the vessel, though the wharf sustained minor crush damage. Vessel was allowed to continue its voyage.

Vessel broke loose from its moorings after a pier bollard failed completely after securing the bow lines. The failure caused the vessel to drift and a gangway to detach. Crew members acted swiftly, utilizing thrusters and dropping anchor to stabilize the ship and prevent a potential allision with another pier. Winds were strong, so the decision was made to run thrusters to hold the ship firmly against the dock.

A fire broke out in the engine room and interior of the vessel at Walvis Bay port, Namibia, Damage was confined, and the fire was brought under control using foam. The cause was identified as heat buildup during a cutting process.

Reported as Non-Underway Capable (NUC) off Lizard Point, UK, due to a defect with the No. 6 main engine fuel pump. The crew successfully carried out repairs, and vessel resumed its voyage, arriving in Brunsbuttel on April 2.

A perpetrator was sighted at the starboard quarter of the ship causing an alarm and a search, nothing was stolen, and no injury. The incident was reported to Singapore VTIS and Indonesian authorities for further investigation.

After departing Kemi, Finland with ~200 passengers, the Polar Class 6 certified vessel became stuck in up to 70cm of ice in the Gulf of Bothnia. Finnish icebreakers Kontio and Polaris were deployed, creating a channel and escorting the cruise ship south out of the ice zone (near Lulea, ~200 miles).

Collided with bulk carrier Jiang Hai Zhi Da 66 (IMO 1030662), which subsequently sank, near Yangmao Island, Ningbo, China, Vessel was reported to be safe and anchored near Majishan/Zhoushan Anchorage as of March 31.

Vessel reported a leak originating from deck 5 worsened by March 30th, affecting decks 3, 4, and 5. Water fell near the main atrium’s chandelier lights, prompting closures, cancelled activities, and room changes for some passengers, who were compensated. The ship reached San Juan on March 31st.
Suffered propulsion failure southwest of Ile de Sein, Vessel was carrying 10 crew members and a cargo of nine wind turbine sections. It arrived at Brest on April 1 and departed on April 4.

Spilled oil near a wharf in Iwakuni City, Yamaguchi Prefecture, Japan, The spill covered an area of approximately 50m by 2m. Oil containment and adsorption measures were used for cleanup. An investigation is underway. Vessel sailed on March 31.
While under pilot conduct, experienced engine failure NNE of Poulier de la Longue Pointe, off Pointe-aux-Trembles, QC, Canada, Anchored, and the crew conducted repairs. Sailed on April 2.
Suffered total engine failure and lost propulsion under pilotage south of Pointe Fortier, QC, Canada, Anchored under its own power near lock 3, Beauharnois, for repair and sailed on March 29.
Reported having allided with a log and sustained water ingress in English Bay, Canada, Proceeded to a wharf in Vancouver where the crew assessed damage. Sailed from there on April 7.

A fire broke out in a cabin located on the lower deck while the vessel was moored in Kaliningrad fishing port, Russia, The fire was extinguished, but property in the cabin was damaged. A control agency is investigating the cause.

Technical issues were discovered during a refit in Portland, UK, These issues led to the deployment of a temporary replacement vessel. As of April 2, technical teams were still working to resolve the problems, with another update expected.

One of the crew members  was injured and needed medical evacuation while the vessel was on the Hudson River. The USCG New York Command Centre received a distress call from the vessel, which was southbound on the river near Catskill. The 23-year-old male Chinese national crew member had sustained a spinal injury while working.
Experienced a steering system failure in English Bay, BC, Canada, while under the conduct of a pilot. Vessel proceeded to an anchorage area to assess the issue.

Suffered engine failure southwest of Chios Island, while en route to the Eastern Mediterranean. As crew were unable to repair it, tug Haktan 1 (IMO 9899648) towed it to Izmir, arriving on March 31 for cargo discharge. Vessel arrived at Tuzla on April 5.
Had a technical failure in its control system while approaching Rohukula, Estonia, A faulty valve was replaced, the system was tested, and vessel returned to service at 2200 hrs.

Experienced a technical failure of its auxiliary engine and alarm systems at Tuapse, Russia, Departure permission was cancelled until repairs were completed. Repairs were finished, and vessel arrived in Haydarpasa on March 29.

While discharging a cargo of steel scrap in bulk at Chittagong Anchorage, Bangladesh, a heavy bunch of scrap fell onto the aluminum pilot embarkation ladder and guard rail on the vessel's starboard side. Vessel sailed on March 31.
Experienced technical problems and was taken out of service after its last departure from Ona. The vessel ended its service at the Smaage ferry pier, Norway, and was also out of service on March 26.

Released hydraulic fluid into the waters of Pearl Harbour, USA,  The release was attributed to run-off after flooding portable water tanks during maintenance. This is reported as the second such incident.
The No. 3 engine failed near the Strait of Kea & Kythnos, Greece, As of March 27, vessel remained moored near Kusadasi, Turkiye.

Fouled its starboard propeller with the anchor chain of buoy Q65 while performing aid to navigation service near Portneuf, Canada,  Vessel proceeded to Quebec using its port engine and sailed on March 26.

A technical issue led to the cancellation of several of the vessel's sailings from Southampton, UK, No further details regarding the nature of the issue or when vessel is expected to return to service were available.
Sank in the Karnaphuli channel within the Bangladesh port area, The wreck has been marked by a lit buoy, and vessels are advised to avoid the area.

Experienced a technical failure of its navigation system and pertinent alarms at Novorossiysk, Russia, Departure permission was cancelled by the Harbour Master until repairs were completed. Vessel sailed on March 27.
Reported as Non-Underway Capable (NUC) off the UK coast on March 21, 2025, due to a broken cooling pipe that caused the engine to stop.

Reported as idle due to a gearbox failure affecting the pitch function of the adjustable propeller blades while in berth at Aroskobing Harbour, Denmark, since March, This was stated by the Transport Director.
Reported NUC and drifting east of Lowestoft  due to a leak in a high-pressure pipe supplying fuel to the main engine. Repairs were completed the same day, and vessel arrived in Hamburg on March 24.

Suffered engine failure and ran aground on the border between Rauma and Pyharanta in Southwest Finland, 2025. Ballast tanks were emptied, and vessel was freed and moved to Rauma port on March 23. A hole in the hull was discovered and temporarily patched.

Experienced engine failure on the route connecting Buenos Aires, Argentina, with Montevideo, Urugua, Technicians are working on the issue, and all trips have been rerouted. The expected return to normal service has not yet been specified by the operator.
The main engine failed while transiting the Gulf of St. Lawrence, Canada, south of Anticosti Island, Crew members successfully carried out repairs, and vessel resumed its voyage.
While towing barge M8005, vessel became disabled due to a main engine fuel system problem south of Merry Island, BC, Canada, Tug North Arm Victor subsequently took vessel under tow.

Collided with general cargo Kosho Maru (IMO 8742290), which was moored at a wharf, during unberthing and towing operations in the Port of Kanda, Japan, No water ingress was noted on either vessel. Vessel sailed from Kanda the same day.

Experienced a failure to raise its right anchor in the sea area of Kakogremi, near Gavrion port, Greece, After the anchor was successfully released, Vessel sailed for its intended destination, Rafina port, arriving there on March 22.
A minor electrical fire occurred in its engine room while proceeding in the Port of Montreal, QC, Canada, The crew extinguished the fire, and Vessel resumed its voyage. No pollution was reported.

Suffered engine failure during berthing operations at Kepez Point, Canakkale Strait, Turkiye, resulting in loss of control and grounding. Vessel was refloated, towed to Canakkale Port, and departed for Bozcaada Island anchorage on March 26.

Four crew members sustained severe burn injuries while Vessel was located 230 nm off the coast of Goa, India, A Sea King helicopter evacuated three injured crew, who were transferred to a civil hospital in Goa. One crew member died.
Its mast allided with the Second Narrows Rail Bridge while transiting Vancouver, BC, Canada, Minor damage to equipment on Vessel's mast was reported, along with minor pollution.

Experienced a technical failure at the southern entrance of the Canakkale Strait while en route from Port Said, Egypt, to Yalova, Turkiye. Vessel entered a shipyard at Yalova on March 20, where repairs were ongoing as of April 2.

Reports of a norovirus outbreak affecting 224 passengers and 17 crew during its voyage from Southampton to the Caribbean and back (March 8th - April 6th). The CDC was notified on March 18th. The ship implemented enhanced cleaning and isolation measures.

Experienced a technical failure during its Istanbul Strait passage on March and dropped anchor at Buyukdere anchorage under the supervision of a strait pilot. The crew began repairs, and Vessel sailed on March 19.

Experienced a technical issue with its engine on the Oban & Lismore route, UK, requiring further investigation and leading to sailing cancellations on March 18. Repairs were completed, and Vessel returned to service as normal on March 19.

A fire broke out in the deep fryer of the galley near BUOY CW099 Hey River, Australia, The second officer sounded the alarm, and a fire squad utilized a portable foam extinguisher to fully suppress the fire.

Collided with a moveable bridge while attempting to dock at the executive pier of Merak Port, Banten, Indonesia, Passengers on board were safe. The bridge sustained damages but remained intact, with no impact on port operations. Vessel's ramp was damaged.
Caught fire in its engine room and subsequently sank in the Pacific Ocean, approximately 1000 Nm west of La Serena, Chile, The crew abandoned the vessel and were saved by fishing vessel Avo Musico.

Collided with bulk carrier AOM Julia (IMO 9544695) near Balikpapan, Indonesia, attributed to severe weather. Vessel sustained bow deformation. Indonesian patrol vessel KNP 349 responded, and no pollution was reported. An investigation is underway.

Collided with Liquefied Petroleum Gas Carrier (IMO 9275426) near Balikpapan, Indonesia, due to severe weather. Vessel suffered a hull breach on its starboard cargo hold No. 4. Patrol vessel KNP 349 was on scene, and no pollution was reported. An investigation is underway.
Sank while docked at Pier two East, Port of Veracruz, Mexico, prompting emergency protocols. Spill barriers were installed to prevent environmental damage. The cause of the sinking is unknown.

Experienced issues unloading cargo at Matarbari Port in Chittagong, Bangladesh, due to quality concerns related to imported coal. CPGCL rejected a 63,000T shipment due to soil contamination. Vessel remains stationary at the port as of April 5.

Seized by Yemen's Houthi group, was struck by two USA airstrikes at the port city of Hodeidah, Yemen, on March 16, 2025. The command cabin of Vessel was reportedly targeted. No further information was available.

Suffered engine failure at Eceabat Point in the Canakkale Strait, Turkiye,  Tugs Kurtarma 10, Kurtarma 15, Kurtarma 17, and a duty pilot were deployed and towed Vessel to a nominated anchorage area. Repairs were completed, and Vessel sailed on March 22.
Was contaminated due to an oil spill from fully cellular containership Kanway Global (IMO: 9167461) during refueling operations while Vessel was docked at Keelung Port, Taiwan, China,

Experienced a failure in the water cooling system of its electric motors at the southern port of Patras, Greece, Vessel had 165 passengers, 56 vehicles, and 65 crew members on board. Repairs were completed, and Vessel sailed on March 19.

Was contaminated due to an oil spill from fully cellular containership Kanway Global (IMO: 9167461) during refueling operations while Vessel was docked at Keelung Port, Taiwan, China, Vessel remained in port.

Suffered a main engine failure while en route from Piraeus to Souda, Greece, Vessel continued at reduced speed, safely disembarked passengers and vehicles, and resumed its voyage after an inspection was completed.

Experienced a technical failure while transiting the Canakkle Strait at Guzelyali point, Turkiye, Strait transit passage permission was cancelled. Vessel anchored north of Bozcaada Island for repairs and sailed out on March 19.

Damaged Pier No. 4 during mooring operations at Primorsk, Russia,  Vessel was detained for 72 hours until the shipowner provided guarantees for compensation for the losses. Vessel remained at Primorsk as of March 21.

Vessel is undergoing repairs at Tuzla shipyard as of March 26.Experienced engine failure at Kepez point in the Canakkale Strait, Turkiye, A Coastal Safety tug escorted Vessel, shifting it to Karanlik Liman An

Reported as Non-Underway Capable (NUC) off St Albans Head, UK, due to a faulty water pump. The main engine stopped, and Vessel was drifting and unable to manoeuvre. The issue was resolved the same day.
Suffered main engine failure in English Bay, BC, Canada, Tugs SAAM Saba & SAAM Volta assisted Vessel to Anchorage B in Vancouver Harbour. No pollution was reported. Vessel sailed on March 17.

Allided with a pier during berthing maneuvers at Yalova ferry terminal, Turkiye, Minor damage occurred to both Vessel and the pier. Vessel returned to Pendik for repairs, sailed to Tuzla on March 17, and later sailed from Tuzla on March 28.

Collided with chemical tanker Towa Maru (IMO 9832092) north off Shonai Peninsula, Japan, Vessel sustained damage to its starboard side, and a warehouse was flooded. Crew members were safe. Vessel sailed under its own power.
Collided with general cargo Naruto (IMO 9665865) north off Shonai Peninsula, Japan, Vessel's bow was damaged. Vessel sailed under its own power.
Sustained rudder damage caused by ice while departing the dock in Grande-Anse, QC, Canada, Vessel returned to the dock for repairs and was later moored near Quebec on March 23.

Three fire services from Lerwick, Shetland Islands, were called to extinguish a fire in the vessel's galley while it was berthed at Greenhead Base, Lerwick, on March 12, 2025. The fire was successfully put out.

Suffered a funnel fire at Trelleborg port, Sweden, The fire, initially feared to be engine-related, was isolated to the funnel and partly burned itself out. Vessel waited for the funnel to cool down before sailing out on March 12.
With 21 people on board, had a defect due to high temperature in the shaft generator off Cromer, UK,  posing a risk of it going out of order. Repairs were completed, and Vessel is now underway.

With 15 people on board, experienced a fuel filter issue and was reported as Non-Underway Capable (NUC) off Lizard Point, UK, while en route from Pointe-a-Pitre, Guadeloupe, to Le Havre, France. Repairs were completed, and Vessel resumed its voyage the same day.

Experienced problems with its engines and made an emergency anchoring southwest of Aland, Finland, Crew members performed temporary repairs. Vessel arrived in Mariehamn on March 11 for further repairs and sailed on March 25.

Reported as Non-Underway Capable (NUC) off the Casquets Lighthouse, UK, due to auxiliary engine 1 shutting down. Auxiliary engines 2 and 3 were started, and the main engine was turned on, allowing Vessel to resume its voyage. Auxiliary engine 1 is under investigation, and no pollution was reported.
Collided with an Oil tanker Stena Immaculate in the North Sea, causing fire and rescue efforts. No injuries reported, and environmental disaster is feared.
Experienced a complete loss of propulsion in the Gulf of Maine, Canada, The crew successfully resolved the issue, and Vessel resumed its voyage. No pollution was reported.

Experienced electronic problems in a propeller near Malaga, Spain,  causing delays while en route from Melilla to Malaga. Denia Ciutat Creativa temporarily took over the ferry service. Vessel departed Malaga on March 11.

Experienced a technical failure affecting its navigation systems, charts, radio communication systems, and alarm units at Bartin, Turkiye, Repairs were carried out by the crew with shore-based technical support at the anchorage. Vessel sailed on March 15.

Had a technical failure affecting its navigation systems and emergency alarms at Tuapse, Russia, Departure was cancelled until repairs were completed. Repairs were performed by the crew with shore-based technical support, and Vessel sailed on March 12.

Noticed fuel leaking from its No. 1 port fuel tank, running down the port side hull and into the water near the US coast, A visible sheen was observed. The amount of Heavy Fuel Oil spilled is unknown, and no reason for the leak was given.

Had an issue with one of its propellers while docked at Bear Cove Ferry Terminal in Port Hardy, BC, Canada, Vessel cancelled its sailing to assess the problem and carried out repairs. No pollution occurred. Vessel sailed on March 9.

Suffered engine failure and allided with the Water and Air Police pier in Telaga Punggur, Indonesia, Reportedly, Vessel also came in contact with several anchored vessels and other structures. An investigation is ongoing.
With 5 people on board, ran aground in the Fraser River off Steveston Bar, BC, Canada, Vessel refloated without assistance at high tide and proceeded to Annacis Island. No pollution was reported.

Experienced a malfunction in one of its main engines in the sea area south of Lagada, Greece, The Master informed the Port Authority of Chios, Greece. Vessel was prohibited from sailing but departed after repairs were completed.

Caught fire at a shipyard in the village of Turdeevsk, Russia, People on board evacuated on their own. Firefighters from the State Fire Service and Civil Defense Agency arrived at the scene, and the fire was extinguished.

Collided with fully cellular containership Orita (IMO 9318931) at Ambarli anchorage, Turkiye, Vessel sustained port side shell plating damage with water ingress and was leaking dirty water. Vessel sailed on March 12.

With 14 people on board, collided with fishing (general) 101 Hae Geum  off Maemuldo Island, Tongyeong, South Korea, Part of Vessel's hull was damaged, including the port stern plating. Vessel sailed under its own power to Yeosu anchorage.

Experienced a technical failure of its navigation system along with pertinent alarms at Novorossiysk, Russia, Departure permission was temporarily cancelled. After repairs were completed, Vessel sailed from Novorossiysk on March 10.

Crew have requested an inspection after, they say, remaining unpaid for several months.The crew members of the vessel comprise 13 Russian nationals and 12 Indonesians, according to reports. They are said to have written to the port administration of the port of Vostochny, requesting an investigation. They have also asserted that there are problems with insurance, and dwindling food supplies. The Russian Seafarers Union (RSU) has said that the Russian sailors have not been paid for 2.5 months, while the Indonesians have gone unpaid for 1.5 months. The total amount owed was said to be €179,000.'

A high court in Nigeria directed the Admiralty Marshal of Nigeria to arrest and detain tankship Ostria (IMO 9302671) until its owners provide a bank guarantee to cover the claims of NNPC Retail Ltd regarding the non-delivery of Premium Motor Spirit (PMS), i.e., petroleum. It was said by the court that much of the several million litres of what was meant to be pure PMS was, in fact, water – amounting to 75% of the cargo.

Experienced a technical failure at the southern entrance of the Canakkale Strait at Kumkale point, Turkiye, Vessel shifted to the anchorage north of Bozcaada Island, dropped anchor, and sailed from there the same day.
Suffered a failure in its cooling system and became disabled off Pointe-au-Pere, QC, Canada. The crew carried out repairs, and Vessel resumed its voyage the same day. No pollution was reported.
Water contamination in Low Sulphur Marine Gas Oil occurred off Selsey, UK, prompting repairs and its arrival in Calais the same day.
Collided with a wall in the Kiel Canal, causing minor damage. Despite the incident, the vessel arrived in Nakskov, Denmark, without crew injuries or pollution.

Went Non-Underway Capable (NUC) due to engine failure between Glensanda and the Isle of Lismore, Uk. The issue is believed to have been caused by air in the fuel injector system. Repairs were completed.

Experienced mechanical failure while preparing to depart from the port of Zea, Greece. The Master informed the Port Authority, which prohibited departure until the damage was repaired. Vessel sailed on March 5.
Technical failure occurred in Tuapse, Russia, leading to the cancellation of departure permission and a week-long delay in sailing.
Technical failure occurred at the Canakkale Strait passage in Turkiye, requiring temporary repairs and a fine payment for resumption.
Experienced a power failure off the coast, adrift without propulsion. Coast Guard and tugboat assistance provided, with no hazardous cargo or environmental risk.

Experienced a defect in its engine and was unable to manoeuvre off Bann Shoal Starboard Hand Mark, UK. Vessel recovered its gear, and all was safe. Vessel was towed to Newlyn by fishing vessel Admiral Blake.

Had a technical failure at Novorossiysk, Russia, Vessel's departure permission was temporarily cancelled by the harbour master until repairs were completed. Vessel sailed from Novorossiysk on March 8.

Went Non-Underway Capable (NUC) after experiencing issues with its fuel line needing repair off the UK coast, while en route from Portbury, UK, to Vigo, Spain. Repairs were completed, and Vessel was back underway.

Allided with beacon 28 on its starboard side while transiting inbound on the eastern side of the channel at Port Hedland, Australia. The Master immediately stopped Vessel and reported the incident. Vessel sailed from port on March 5.

Suffered engine failure south of Lesvos Island, Greece. Crew members were unable to complete repairs. Tug Pothitos assisted and towed Vessel to Lesvos Island. Vessel arrived in Sarayla, Turkiye, on March 5 and sailed on March 13.
Experienced propulsion failure and water ingress southwest of Penmarch, France. Fire-fighting tug Abeille Bourbon was dispatched to assist, and Vessel arrived in Brest, France.
Suffered a failure of its steering gear while leaving anchorage in Trois-Rivieres, Quebec, Canada, Vessel subsequently re-anchored for further investigations.

A shore mobile crane basket fell on cargo hatch covers and the main deck during routine maintenance at Dogruyol shipyard, Yalova, Turkiye, Vessel sustained slight structural damage, and a worker died in the incident. Vessel sailed on March 9. Note: Date in text (March 3) differs from header date (March 2), header date used for sorting.

Ran aground close to Gorgons Starboard Buoy, Republic of Ireland, The forepart of Vessel was affected, while the stern remained afloat. Vessel was refloated with the assistance of a tug and returned to the inner anchorage under its own power.

Ukrainian news outlets have reported that two commercial vessels sustained damage and two people suffered injuries as a result of a missile strike by Russian forces against the Port of Odesa on Ukraine's Black Sea coast on Saturday, March 1. Ukrainian government sources said that the damaged vessels are the Panamanian-flagged containership MSC Levante F and the Sierra Leone-registered bulk carrier Super Sarkas. The injured individuals were both port workers, who have since been given medical attention.

Ukrainian news outlets have reported that two commercial vessels sustained damage and two people suffered injuries as a result of a missile strike by Russian forces against the Port of Odesa on Ukraine's Black Sea coast on Saturday, March 1. Ukrainian government sources said that the damaged vessels are the Panamanian-flagged containership MSC Levante F and the Sierra Leone-registered bulk carrier Super Sarkas. The injured individuals were both port workers, who have since been given medical attention.
Collided with container ship ONE COLUMBA in Hong Kong, causing minor damage and loss of three containers. No injuries or pollution were reported.
Collided with berthed CLIFFORD MAERSK in Hong Kong, causing minor damage and loss of three containers. No injuries or pollution were reported.
Fire broke out on the bulk carrier, in Yumurtalık, Turkey, causing plastic raw materials to be damaged and authorities are still unsure of the cause.

Vessel was reported by the Turkish Directorate General of Coastal Safety (KEGM) to have suffered an engine failure, subsequently being towed to safety. The incident occurred near Kandilli while the vessel was en route from Ambarli to Novorossiysk, Russia. She was anchored in Büyükdere. The operation was carried out with the assistance of a Pilot Captain, along with the tugboats Kurtarma-7 and Kurtarma-12.
Experienced an engine failure near Westerhever, Germany. DgzRS escorted, but the captain managed to steer it to safety. A commercial tugboat brought it to port the next day.

The Vietnam Coast Guard rescued a Vietnamese crew member of LPG tanker Danisa (IMO 9172739) on February 26th. He was suffering from acute appendicitis. The tanker was 111nm southeast of Con Dao Island, Ba Ria-Vung Tau province, at the time.

A worker, who was on board the ship during loading operations, fell through an opening into a cargo hold of the vessel. He sustained life-threatening injuries and was immediately taken to a Rostock hospital by the emergency services.
Climate activists attempted to block cruise ship Ventura at the Passenger Terminal Amsterdam (PTA) in an attempt to highlight what they said was the impact of cruise ships on the environment.
Attacked in the Gulf of Aden, Yemen, by two missiles. The vessels was likely targeted due to perceived Israeli affiliation, affecting freedom of navigation and maritime commerce.

The cargo vessel was stopped  for allegedly damaging an undersea data cable near Gotland. The ship was released the same day due to lack of evidence, and authorities are awaiting definitive proof, such as an anchor being found.
Collision between a general cargo vessel, in the Black Sea, causing minor damage and no injuries.
Collision with an Oil Product Tanker in the Black Sea, causing minor damage and no injuries.

Fire broke out aboard vessel while she was sailing in the Atlantic Ocean. The fire was extinguished and safely arrived at Newport News Marine Terminals, USA, marking the second fire-related accident involving the vessel in recent days.
The U.S. Navy and Coast Guard successfully rescued seven crew members from the sinking Iranian cargo vessel in the Arabian Gulf, ensuring their safety and preventing further damage.
Fire broke out on the vessel during a voyage in the English Channel. Despite the fire being contained, the vessel lost propulsion and steering, and the crew deployed fire suppression systems.
Engine failure occurred off Aydincik, Turkiye,  It was towed to Yesilovacik Anchorage and later to Tuzla shipyard, Repairs are ongoing, and it remained stationary as of early February 2025.
Ran aground in Wild Cove, Newfoundland, Canada, after losing power in severe weather conditions, was safely evacuated by the Canadian Coast Guard.
Vessel hit by two explosions at the Italian port of Savona in what the operator described as a security incident. No pollution or injuries reported and vessel not at risk of sinking.
Turkey's Coastal Safety reported a fuel leak during bunkering operations involving oil product tanker GOKDENIZ, causing water contamination off Istanbul coast.
Turkey's Coastal Safety reported a fuel leak during bunkering operations involving crude oil tanker JAG, causing water contamination off Istanbul coast.
Fire broke out in the engine room at Port Everglades, USA, prompting rescue crews to swiftly extinguish the flames.
Experinced engine turbo failure, off Point Atkinson, BC, Canada, It was towed back to Vancouver by tugs.
Ran aground near the Dryna ferry quay in Norway, The ship was inspected for damage and refloated, with no casualties reported.
Experienced explosions as the tanker was preparing to depart, with three blasts reported, Remains afloat and no pollution has been reported. The cause of the casualty is under investigation.

Ran aground in Russia's Sakhalin Peninsula due to a heavy snowstorm. The vessel has 20 crew members and is carrying environmentally hazardous material, leading to a high alert and no clear rescue solutions.
Experienced an engine failure off Svolvaer coast, requiring emergency response and swift action from rescue boats and onshore winds, ensuring the safety of the crew.
Ran aground off Bergsoya Island, Norway, sustaining rudder damage and water ingress. Fortunately, it successfully refloated and was towed to MJOLSTADNESET.
Beset in ice after a fluid leak required the main engine to be stopped, on Lake Saint Clair, Canada, It was towed to Windsor for engine repairs.
Collided with moored boats in the Queen Charlotte Channel on Bowen Island, Canada, causing damage to the moored boats and dock structure,No injuries and pollution were reported in the incident.
Collided with the new north lock of the Kiel Canal in Germany, causing damage to the lock gate. Divers cleared obstructions, allowing the vessel to continue its voyage.
Norwegian authorities released vessel, detained for damaging undersea telecoms cable in Baltic Sea, after a day-long investigation.
Experienced engine failure, drifted off the port of MOHAMMEDIA, Morocco, with two crew members in dire medical condition.
Distress signal and medical assistance was requested. The Royal Navy of Morocco dispatched helicopters to evacuate injured crew members and provide assistance to the distressed vessels.
Fire broke out in its cargo hold. Firefighters are extinguishing the fire, which could take days, but the vessel and community are safe as the fire has been isolated.
Crashed into a pier at Tuscan Sea Resort, Italy, due to storm Herminia winds and waves. The 13 crew members were safely rescued, and no spillage or pollution was reported.
Fire broke out in the engine room, causing a generator failure. All 33 crew members were evacuated and reported safe, and no crew members were affected by smoke inhalation.

Crew abandoned vessel after a hazardous cargo explosion and fire in the southern Red Sea. She was drifting in the southern Red Sea about 122 nautical miles (226 km) north-west of Hodeidah, Yemen, during a voyage northbound towards the Suez Canal, according to Diaplous Maritime Services.
Collided with the cargo ship YAMAL KRECHET, in the Kara Sea, causing damage to its bow. Despite the damage, the icebreaker remains seaworthy and will continue operations on the North Sea Route.
Collided with the icebreaker 50 LET POBEDY   in the Kara Sea, there were no injuries aboard the vessel.
Due to cargo shift and the potential loss of cargo in the upcoming storm Herminia. The ship has been docked at the Transversal Pier, guarded by private security, port police, and civil guard.

Accused of damaging an undersea cable in the Baltic Sea. The incident, claimed to be another unintentional dragging of an anchor, occurred during inclement weather between Latvia and Gotland. The ship's CEO denies any sabotage claims.
Fire broke out in the engine room, causing no injuries or significant environmental impact, and the vessel is under observation.
Technical failure in the navigation system and other equipment in Eregli, Turkiye led to the cancellation of departure permission and the re-initialization of the flight.
Collided with a bulk carrier,LUMOSO HARMONI, at Muara Sampara Morosi Port, Indonesia, causing a scratch above the waterline. An investigation is ongoing to determine the cause and accountability.
Collided with a bulk carrier, PANCARAN GLORY, at Muara Sampara Morosi Port, Indonesia, causing a scratch above the waterline. An investigation is ongoing to determine the cause and accountability.
