Fire broke out on the wind turbine vessel in the Netherlands, causing no injuries to crew members. The fire broke out in the ship's batteries, which were disconnected and submerged to prevent further spread. An investigation is underway.
An oil leak occurred from the Vessel and barge in Duluth, USA, likely due to a bow thruster issue.
Fire broke out in the Bay of Islands, Canada, which was extinguished and resumed its journey a few days later.
Fire broke out in Westport, Nova Scotia, Canada, which was extinguished, repaired, and sailed after a few days.
Stuck in thick ice at Lake Erie, en route from Buffalo, New York, after dropping off wheat. The crew of 17 is safe and the ship is unharmed. A cutter is breaking the ice around the vessel.
Main Engine failure occurred at Piraeus port, Greece, and service was resumed the next day.
Main engine issue occurred near the dock in Quebec City, Canada, causing the vessel to moor with tug assistance.
Wharf collision occurred at the Newfoundland Transshipment facility in Canada, causing operations to be suspended pending damage assessment and ongoing investigation.
Technical failure occurred during its journey to Turkiye, resulting in its shelter at Datca anchorage, and after crew repairs, it sailed a few days later.
Main engine cooling system pipe split in the St. Lawrence Seaway, Canada, requiring repair and prompt arrival in Les Mechins.
Technical failure occurred in Zonguldak, Turkiye, leading to the cancellation of departure permission and the completion of repairs and subsequent sailing.
Experienced an engine room fire near Japan, causing it to be rendered unnavigable and towed to Hiroshima for inspection and repair, no injuries were reported.
Fire broke out in Trincomali Channel, BC, Canada, which was extinguished by the crew and reported as damage.

Collided with a barge, TB Sinhin 5, in Indonesian territorial waters. The ship sustained minor damage, but no injuries or hazardous materials were reported. The incident was coordinated by Indonesian maritime authorities.
Vessel in collision with stationery object while operating in Ushuaia, Argentina
Experienced a technical failure in Novorossiysk, Russia, leading to the cancellation of departure permission and the ship's subsequent sailing.
Vessel reported NUC in the Volga-Caspian Sea Channel.
Experienced an engine failure while transiting the Kiel Canal, Germany, Despite the incident, the vessel managed to free itself and was rescued by tugboat Parat.
Vessel was involved in a hull/machinery incident in the Ria de Vigo off Vigo. No further details
Reports of a fire onboard vessel while operating in Fosnavag, Norway
Experienced leaks and a 25-degree water intake, resulting in a 25-degree listing. All crew members were rescued and an investigation is underway to determine the cause and potential pollution.
Experienced a technical failure at Bartin, Turkiye, leading to the cancellation of departure permission and the ship's subsequent sailing.
Collided with Cape San Agustin in Cebu City, Philippines, without any reported damages.
Immobilized at Puerto La Cruz, Venezuela, suspending ferry service. It will undergo maintenance.
Main engine failure occurred in the Adriatic Sea, leading to reduced speed and sailing being banned until class certification.
Reported a machinery breakdown incidence at Gijon, Spain.

Reports of a drunken brawl that led to the death of a Filipino crew member. Vessel was docked in Kaohsiung port, Taiwan when incident occurred. Although the victim was rushed to the Kaohsiung Municipal Siaogang Hospital, it was too late to rescue him.
Contact incident occurred in the Kiel Canal at Brunsbuttel, Germany. Details sketchy
Experienced leaks and a 25-degree water intake, resulting in a 25-degree listing. All crew members were rescued and an investigation is underway to determine the cause and potential pollution.
A bow door fault caused delays on the Brodick-Troon route in the UK, causing sailings to be delayed for the rest of the day.
Collided with a Tug vessel while underway in Cebu City, Philippines, but the vessel's crew managed to prevent any damage.

Lost its cargo while navigating a deepwater route off Texel, Netherlands. The Coast Guard and Rijkswaterstaat collaborated to recover 14 items, including gears and a cog radar. A virtual buoy has been placed to warn passing vessels.
Technical failure occurred at Yesilyurt Samsun, Turkiye, leading to the cancellation of departure permission and the vessel being shifted for repairs.
Experienced a technical failure of navigation chart, VDR, alarms, and indicators, At Yesilyurt Samsun, Turkiye, in mid-January 2025. It shifted to Samsun anchorage and sailed after about a week.
Engine start was halted due to excessive lube oil in the sump off Caister, UK. Repairs were completed at sea and arrived at Moerdijk the same day.
Experienced an engine failure off South Africa, which was towed to Richard Bay and arrived in Durban in early February 2025.
Grounding on a large fixed fish farm net, off Takaoka Fishing Port, Japan, It sailed after a couple of days and remained at Ieshima as of late January.
A net caught in the propeller off the UK coast caused Non-Underway Capable status, prompting tow assistance as crew couldn't rectify the damage.
Experienced an electrical failure, Karasu, Turkiye. Repairs were performed and verified, and the vehicle departed the next day.
Capsized near PLASTUN Port, Russia, causing timber cargo to slide and fall overboard. Crew members escaped, but no casualties were reported.
Contact incident occurred in the Kiel Canal off Brunsbuttel, Germany. Details sketchy
Disabled and adrift due to a broken rudder in the South China Sea, off Vietnam, It moored near Phuoc Luong after about a week, and remained stationary as of late January.

Ran aground on the Kiel Canal's northern embankment, Germany, due to a hydraulic system defect. The vessel was refloated and berthed at Rendsburg-Osterrönfeld, where it was inspected and approved by DNVGL.
Fire and explosion onboard incidence occurred in Sept-Iles, QC, Canada
Reported a hull and machinery incidence in the North Atlantic Ocean off A Coruna, Galicia, Spain.
Grounded at Newgale Beach due to engine failure during cable work, causing inclement weather and high tide, with no pollution or injuries reported.
Vessel reported fire and explosion incident while operating in the Indian Ocean
Reported an incident in the English Channel involving illness, death, or injury.
Ran aground near Glasøya, Norway, causing no damage and refloating early on 15th January, with a length of 46 metres and 10 metres.
Reported a machinery breakdown on approach to the English Channel on 14 Jan 2025.
Reports that crew member was involved in an overboard incident in the North Sea off Flamborough.

Finland has extended a travel ban on a ninth crew member of the vessel, implicated in a December 25th subsea cable damage incident in the Baltic Sea. The vessel was diverted to Finland, seized, and all crew members detained for questioning. The incident is suspected of sabotage.
A crew/passenger required urgent medical attention while vessel was in the North Atlantic Ocean off Santa Cruz de Tenerife, Spain.
Vessel reported NUC in a stranding incident at Lysaker, Norway
Vessel was involved in a hull/machinery incident in the Norwegian Sea off Alesund, Norway.

Sank in Singaporean waters off Pedra Branca. All eight crew members were rescued after a search and rescue effort organized by the Maritime Port Authority of Singapore (MPA). The Singapore Navy and Police Coast Guard were also deployed.
Reports of a fire/explosion incident in the Johor Strait off Tanjung Piai, Johor, Malaysia
Ran aground on the St. Mary's River due to a mechanical failure, losing an anchor. The vessel pulled free and was later rescued by tug Wilfred M. Cohen. No injuries or pollution were reported.
Fire broke out onboard vessel in the engine room. Crew rescued, extinguished after 12 hours, and an administrative inquiry is underway.
Maritime incident occurred southwest of Vung Tau, Vessel sank with cargo onboard. All 18 crew members were safely rescued by the container ship NICOLAI MAERSK
Vessel reported fire and explosion incident which occurred while operating in Cork, Ireland
Reports of a hull and machinery incident in the Baltic Sea off Putgarten, Germany.
Experienced a technical failure, In Novorossiysk, Russia, leading to the revocation of departure permission pending repairs.
An incident occurred in the Alboran Sea off Gibraltar involving illness, death, or injury.
Technical issues involving a gyro compass problem led to service cancellations off Southampton, UK.
Experienced a technical failure of pumping units, emergency alarms, and GMDSS system, Zonguldak, Turkiye. Repairs were completed, but the ship sailed soon after.
An incident occurred in the Celtic Sea involving illness, death, or injury.
Bullet damage from Houthi forces occurred off Yemen, No casualties were reported.
Air strikes targeting an oil jetty in Yemen led to a fire while berthed at the location.
Airstrikes targeting the oil jetty in Yemen caused damage to a cargo hose while it was berthed at the jetty.

Disabled vessel suspected to be part of Russia's shadow fleet has been brought under control off the Baltic Sea coast north of Rügen, Germany. Emergency towing vessel BREMEN FIGHTER secured the vessel preventing further drifting.
Stern allision with Dock 5A occurred during docking maneuvers at the Port of Callao, Peru, causing damage to the vessel and a gantry crane.
Starboard oil filter obstruction experienced in Portland Bill, UK. Investigation continued afterwards
Reported an incident in the Celtic Sea involving illness, death, or injury.
Declared (NUC) status due to lubricator and electronic issues, which arrived in Donges a few days later.
Reported a boarding incident in the Singapore Strait.
Reported a machinery breakdown occurring off Hanstholm, Denmark.
Ran aground off Punta Alvear, Argentina. Unconfirmed reports that she was later refloated
Reports of fire and explosion onboard vessel while she was operating at Incheon waters, South Korea
Reports that crew member was involved in an overboard incident in the Strait of Georgia off Nanaimo, BC, Canada
Vessel came in contact with object at Rostock, Germany. Details sketchy
Ran aground near the Ben Franklin Bridge in Philadelphia, Delaware. The Coast Guard and maritime agencies are responding, with no injuries or pollution reported.
Experienced a contact incident in North Vancouver, BC, Canada.
Vessel reported NUC and grounded at Tarva Island, Norway
Reports of an illness/fatality/injury incident in the Pacific Ocean off Isle of Pines, New Caledonia. Details sketchy
Reports of a hull and machinery incident in the Warnow River at Rostock, Germany.
Vessel ran aground in the Meuse River off Roermond, Netherlands. Later refloated
Vessel reported NUC and grounded at Orland, Norway. She was refloated on own power.
Man overboard incident in the Dover Strait off Eastbourne, UK. Unconfirmed if crew member was rescued.
Vessel was involved in a collision incident in River Tagus off Almada, Portugal
Vessel involved in a collision with unidentified object at Becancour, QC, Canada on 06 Jan 2025.
Machinery breakdown incident occurred in the Western Scheldt.
Ran aground east of Esancho, Japan, with initial attempts to refloat unsuccessful. Efforts are still ongoing.
Fishing vessel grounded off Somna, Norway. No reports on whether she was refloated
Machinery breakdown incident occurred in the North Sea.
Reported a machinery breakdown while vsl was in Lake Superior
Experienced a hull and machinery incidence in the Mediterranean Sea.
Suffered total engine failure on the Saguenay River near Tadoussac, Quebec, Canada, The vessel was assisted by Canadian Coast Guard vessel Cap Tourmente.
Single voyage to Eleusina was permitted after an emergency inspection due to failure to lift and seal the landing ramp.
Technical failure in Zonguldak, Turkiye caused a temporary cancellation of departure permission and a few days later, the vessel sailed.
Derelict and adrift status was reported off Puerto Colombia, Colombia, It remained adrift as of mid-January 2025.
Vessel had a machinery breakdown while transitting Lake Erie off Essex, ON, Canada
Experienced a hull/machinery incident in the Baltic Sea off Gotska Sandon, Sweden.
Breakdown extended a stopover in Arrecife, Lanzarote, Spain, but the engine room issue was resolved the same day.
Vessel ran aground off Ramallo, Argentina.
Reported an incident in Haiphong, Vietnam, resulting in illness, death, or injury.
The 20,000t ammonium nitrate fertilizer cargo was held offshore near Abidjan, Cote d'Ivoire due to safety concerns, with a planned offloading of 3,000t, remaining anchored as of mid-January 2025.
Machinery incident occurred in the South China Sea off Ca Na, Vietnam.
Engine failure occurred off Ucluelet Arm, Canada, causing the ship to sail to Brotchie Ledge using the remaining engine and escorted by a tug.
Fire broke out in the engine room, caused power loss and drift. 21 crew members extinguished the fire, but four suffered burns and one was injured.
Expirienced an incident in the Bay of Biscay off Luanco, Asturias, Spain, resulting in illness, death, or injury.
Vessel ran aground in Truro, MA, USA.
Reports that vessel was involved in a pollution incident at Petropavlovsk-Kamchatskiy, Russia
Experienced major engine issues off Tadoussac, Canada. The crew promptly addressed the issue and the ship resumed its voyage.
Experienced fire outbreak in Indonesian waters due to a failure of a fluorescent tube, causing superficial damage.
Experienced an incident in the Sea of Okhotsk off Magadan, Russia, resulting in illness, death, or injury.
Experienced an incident in the Oresund, resulting in illness, death, or injury.
Vessel came in contact with an object while at Brunsbuettel, Germany

A fire broke out in the engine room, causing heavy smoke and causing death. The incident led to the Danish Maritime Authority investigating the damage and seaworthiness of the vessel, with the timeline for the investigation remaining unclear.
Experienced engine failure off Cam Ranh Bay, drifting uncontrollably. Despite challenging weather, a naval crew managed to rescue 25 crew members and tow the vessel to safety.
Machinery incident occurred in the Norwegian Sea off Fosnavag, Norway.
Experienced a stowaway boarding incident in Lagos, Nigeria.
Reported a machinery breakdown while vsl was operating in Vestfjorden
Experienced an incident in the North Sea resulting in illness, death, or injury.
Crew member onboard was involved in an injury incident in the North Atlantic Ocean 100 nautical miles northwest of Cabo Raso, Lisbon, Portugal

Collided with tug Patrick J. Studdert,near the Hale Boggs Memorial Bridge in Luling, Louisiana. Five crew members were rescued and transferred to local emergency medical services. The tug has reportedly sunk, and no recoverable product was reported. The cause of the collision remains under investigation.

Collided with bulk carriers YANGZE 22 , On the Yangtze River in China. The YANGZE 22 suffered severe damage, spilling around 9 tons of fuel oil due to hull damage. Both vessels are stable and no injuries were reported. The Shanghai Maritime Safety Administration is currently cleaning up the oil spill.

Fire broke out on the vessel, in international waters near Cherbourg, France, causing no casualties. The fire was quickly extinguished by an air-sea response team, emergency tugs, and lifeboats, ensuring the safety of the ship and its crew.

Collided with Bulk Carrier VEGA DREAM, On the Yangtze River in China. Suffered severe damage, spilling around 9 tons of fuel oil due to hull damage. Both vessels are stable and no injuries were reported. The Shanghai Maritime Safety Administration is currently cleaning up the oil spill.
Experienced a technical failure near Split, Croatia, resulting in water in the fuel and an investigation by engineers.
Significant rolling incident near Karori Lighthouse in New Zealand resulted in vehicle damage and minor passenger injury, but the vessel safely berthed in Picton.
Experienced an engine failure, off Ambarli, Turkiye, at the southern entrance of the Istanbul Strait, causing the ship to drift to wind and current direction.
Experienced an Engine failure off Bozcaada Island, Turkiye, drifting with a tug. It was shifted to Eleusis shipyard for repairs in January 2025.
Propulsion loss occurred near Neptune terminal No. 1 in North Vancouver, Canada, leading to crew repairs and the vessel's sailing.

Experienced an engine failure in the Bosphorus, disrupting traffic. The Istanbul Vessel Service rescued the vessel, which was anchored at Istanbul Anchorage. The vessel was en route to Novorossiysk, Russia.
Finnish authorities detained a crew member after the Estlink 2 cable broke down, with the anchor suspected of damaging the cable.
Technical failure occurred in Tuapse, Russia, leading to repairs and the ship's sailing the same day after departure formalities.
Experienced engine failure at Canakkale Strait's southern entrance, anchored south of Bozcaada Island. Assistance was provided, and repairs are ongoing at Yalova.
Collision with crude oil tanker Seaviolet , in the south of Karystos Island in the Kafireas Strait, Greece,  Minor damage above the waterline occurred. It moored near Eleusis.
Navigation system failure occurred in Zonguldak, Turkiye, leading to the cancellation of departure permission and ongoing repairs.
Engine issues related to lubrication occurred off the UK coast, requiring no tug assistance and being resolved the same day.
Technical failure caused sheltering and anchoring at Datca anchorage. Crew repairs were underway, and the ship sailed after a few days.
Exeperienced an engine failure off the UK coast, prompting the crew to anchor, restart engines, and proceed to berth.

Ran aground on the St. Lawrence River, The Canadian Coast Guard is working with Transport Canada and the vessel's operators to free it, but rescue plans may be delayed due to the Christmas holidays. The vessel is currently outside the navigation channel and not blocking traffic. There are no immediate threats, pollution, water ingress, or injuries. The exact cause of the stranding is unknown.
Dent and hole in the hull on the starboard side were reported off France, may have hit an object. Onwards to Zeebrugge, Belgium.
Collision with the Greek vehicle carrier Neptune Avra, causing minor damage above the waterline prompting anchorage.
A truck capsized during loading operations off Terminal Varreux port in Port-au-Prince, Haiti, resulting in several deaths and injuries.
Ran aground near Azov, Russia, prompting a Russian tug to assist, resulting in no casualties or spills.
Eexperienced a technical fault in Trabzon, Turkiye, causing the temporary cancellation of departure permission and a few days later, the vessel sailed.

Capsized at AMBARLI Port, Turkey, causing numerous containers to fall into the sea. The ship listed due to imbalance load distribution, and emergency rescue teams evacuated 10 crew members. The incident is currently under investigation.
Main engine experienced major issues, requiring repairs and sailing the next day.
Experienced a drone attack near Chornomorske, Ukraine, causing damage above the waterline but not sinking.
Faulty fueling nozzle caused a NUC status off Land's End, UK. Repairs were completed, and the vessel resumed its voyage.

Sank in the Mediterranean off the coast of Spain after suffering an explosion in its engine room.Russian military took over the rescue operation,14 of the total of 16 crewmembers were rescued by the Salvamento Maritimo; two sailors are still missing.
Right main engine failed during its arrival at Patmos Island, Greece, but it berthed safely and sailed from Patmos the same day.
Experienced an engine failure near Aigina Island, Greece, causing the ship to return to Piraeus Port and sail from Zea the same day.
Deck crane failure occurred at Habas Port, causing a crane operator to be injured and causing cargo operations to be suspended.
Propulsion loss occurred near Neptune terminal No. 1 in Vancouver, Canada, leading to crew repairs and a few days of sailing.
NUC was declared due to engine failure and drifting off the UK coast. The cylinder head failure was identified and replaced, allowing the vessel to proceed
Equipment collapse occurred during extractive work off Trinidad's SW peninsula, resulting in the evacuation of most workers, one hospitalization, and one missing person.
Port main engine developed a fault while sailing from Piraeus to Greece, escorted by a tug, and disembarking passengers and vehicles.
Collided with the general cargo vessel KUALA MAS at an anchorage in Kupang. Fortunately, no crew members were injured in the accident.

Collided with the product tanker MARITIM KHATULISTIWA at an anchorage in Kupang. The ship drifted with current, causing a hole in its hull and causing it to list 10 degrees. The captain and crew tried to contain the leak but realized they couldn't. They ground the vessel to prevent sinking in deep waters. A tug rescued all 20 crew members, and the vessel sank around 8:34 AM.
Experienced a portside propulsion machinery failure, off Hecate Island, BC, Canada, requiring crew repairs.
Collided with port structures at Fishguard port in the UK, causing a hole to be torn in its hull. The cause of the incident is unknown, but no injuries were reported.
Propeller fouling and drifting incident occurred off the UK coast, prompting Falmouth Coast Guard assistance and a lifeboat being towed to Salcombe harbor the following day.
A refrigerated truck engine fire caused a vehicle deck fire in Porto Torres, Italy , resulting in its safe return. Investigation is ongoing.
Both anchors were lost off the UK coast, and the ship was deemed Non-Underway Capable due to engine failure, en route to Brofjordan, Sweden.

Ran aground at the Cristóbal Colón dock in Las Palmas Port, Spain, after colliding with the dock due to a strong gust of wind,no casualties have been reported in the incident. An investigation is underway, with experts retrieving data and divers inspecting the hull.
Targeted by Yemeni Houthi group, With drones, vowing to continue attacking Israeli targets. No report of any property damage or casualties
Encountered pitch control issues off Lanoraie, Quebec, Canada, and was sent to Montreal for repairs, arriving and sailing shortly after.
Fire alarm was activated in the engine room due to a short circuit in the auxiliary engine's No.2 alternator wiring, causing smoke.
Generator blackout caused vessel to drift off the coast. Despite resolving the issue and receiving assistance from Tug Mascalzone, the ship was out of service.
Ran aground and drifted due to fuel oil injection pump issues, requiring repairs and sailing the next day.
Service was canceled, due to forward engine issues on the Wemyss Bay & Rothesay route in the UK, but the issue was resolved and service resumed in late December.
Collided with a barge at Woodfibre LNG site, Canada, causing the vessel to sink and a hydrocarbon sheen to be observed.
Anchoring was delayed due to electronic control issues, but repairs were completed and the vehicle arrived in Felixstowe in late October.
Fire broke out on the forecastle upper deck of the Beylerbeyi ferry pier in Istanbul Strait, Turkiye, which was extinguished by crew and tug assistance.
Experienced engine issues, At Campbell River, Canada,  requiring the use of the other engine for repair before returning to Vancouver.
Distress signal was sent near Kavkaz, Russia, indicating cargo tank damage, but no leakage or compromise to the hull integrity.
Grounding occurred on the Volga-Caspian Sea Shipping Canal in Russia, ensuring the safety of the crew, providing sufficient food, and preventing any pollution or injuries.
Ran aground on the Volga-Caspian shipping canal in Russia, but the crew remained safe and independently refloated to its destination.
Experienced a technical failure at Guzelyali point in Canakkale strait, Turkiye, causing the ship to shift north of Bozcaada Island anchorage and sail in late December.
Emergency stop was made near Ust-Bolsheretsk, Kamchatka, Russia, after nets entangled around the propeller shaft, causing no reported damage to the vessel.
Custom officers discovered bunker declaration discrepancies in Diliskelesi, Turkiye, A fine was imposed, crew statements taken, and departure revoked until payment and formalities were completed.
Experienced an engine failure near the Kurile Islands, causing it to be towed to Melnik Bay by fish factory Mys Basargina and salvage tug Rubin.
650 gallons of MGO was discharged into the Neches River in Beaumont, Texas, USA, prompting the next day's response due to weather delays.
Ran aground on the Volga-Caspian Maritime Shipping Canal in Russia, causing no injuries or pollution, and the owner arranged for a tug to refloat it.
The crew off Australia resolved a minor flooding issue in the technical room after a motorman fractured multiple ribs while falling through a floorboard.
Generator issue caused power loss before docking at Westview Ferry Terminal in British Columbia, Canada, but the vessel docked safely under battery power.
Technical failure occurred at Sariyer point in the Istanbul Strait, requiring tug and strait pilot assistance. The ship was shifted to Buyukdere for repairs.
Collided with the approach wall in Canal de la Rive Sud, Canada, following bow thruster loss, sailing in the same month.
Engine power loss, causing anchoring outside Dover TSS, UK. The ship resumed passage the next day.
While departing the port of Mytilene, Greece, the starboard propeller and shaft became entangled with rope, Sailed to Keratsini port for repairs.
Experienced an engine failure, Causing it to arrive at Charlestown, Canouan, the next day.
Broke its lines during winter storms, Prompting tugs to secure it after an alarm was raised.
Experience a technical failure during Canakkale Strait passage in Turkiye, leading to crew repairs and a successful sailing from Karanlik Liman anchorage.
Experience a technical failure during a voyage from Karasu, Turkiye, to Kavkaz, Russia, requiring crew repairs and sailing from Sinop anchorage in late December.

Collided with a Ro-Ro passenger ship, TRIMAS FHADILA. The tanker was anchored in Tanjung Sekong, while the passenger ship drifted northward due to strong wind. Both vessels sustained partial damage. An investigation is underway.
Collided with an LPG tanker, GAS SOFIA,The vessel was anchored in the Tanjung Sekong area at the time of the incident.Both vessels sustained partial damage. An investigation is underway.

Collided with a smaller fishing vessel, Nine fishermen were rescued from their sinking vessel after it was struck  25 nautical miles off the Colachel coast ,The fishing vessel owner C Johnsonand has requested the Indian Coast Guard to intercept the vessel and investigate the accident.

Ran aground as it attempted to berth at the KEELUNG port in Taiwan. No crewmembers of the vessel were reported to be injured.The forepeak tank sustained damage, leading to water ingress. The vessel was pulled free in 20 minutes and berthed at Keelung West.

Collided with a boardwalk in the port of Veracruz, Mexico, due to strong northern winds. The ship broke its bow ropes, drifted, and hit the boardwalk. The ship hit Malecon wall, near the city's historic center. No injuries were reported. The area was cordoned off by the Mexican Navy, and three tugs supported the ship and assisted in docking.

Ran aground in Odense Fjord, Denmark, Despite multiple attempts to free it, the vessel remains stuck. The first attempt failed due to the tugboat's inability to pull the vessel free, and the second attempt failed. The ship is expected to be detained until its seaworthiness is attested by the flag state or classification society.

Fire broke out as the vessel was docked at the port of ARINAGA, Gran Canaria, Spain.   The fire started in the cargo hold, filled with scrap materials. Firefighters from the Gran Canaria Emergency Consortium arrived and doused the fire at 6:00 PM. The ship was evacuated and port operations were temporarily suspended. An investigation is underway.

Ran aground off the coast of Taiwan due to adverse weather conditions. The Taiwanese Coast Guard managed to rescue all but one crewmember, search for the missing crew member is still ongoing. The tanker was reportedly almost empty with around 110 tons of fuel onboard. The incident led to hull damage, pollution, and oil spill containment measures. The salvage team has sealed exhaust valves to prevent further pollution and authorities plan to finish pumping out the fuel by 10th December.

Caught fire in Elliot Bay, Washington, causing a rapid response from agencies like the Coast Guard, Seattle Fire Department, and Washington State Ferries, The sole person aboard was rescued and provided with emergency medical services. The vessel sank near the 32nd Ave Beach Access, containing 250 gallons of diesel fuel. Salvage operations are underway to remove any remaining fuel.

Dutch Coast Guard stabilized and secured the vessel in the North Sea after it drifted uncontrollably due to severe weather conditions. The vessel, with seven crew members in ballast condition, experienced technical issues and was unable to navigate independently. The emergency Tug Multraship Commander arrived to aid the distressed vessel, but the operation was called off due to an injury sustained by one crew member. The Dutch lifeboat Antoinette also assisted in the rescue efforts.

Lost two large gantry cranes due to a cargo shift. The incident occurred 58 nautical miles northwest of Cape of Ortegal, Spain. Spanish maritime authorities, responded with rescue boats, tugboats, and helicopters. The cranes caused damage to the ship's deck and hull, recovery efforts were hindered by inclement weather.

The Eunavfor Aspides rescued the crew of the container ship, After the ship began taking on water. The crew, including 20 Indian and Ukrainian sailors, were forced to abandon the ship and were dropped off at Djibouti. The cause of the incident remains unknown.

Collided with the general cargo ship SSI ERDOGAN BEY, At Kattegat Strait near Anholt, Denmark. The collision occurred at around 10:30 pm (CET) and involved a hole in the bow and side of the vessel. Fortunately, no crew members were injured and no pollution was released.

Collided with the bulk carrier TZAREVNA, At Kattegat Strait near Anholt, Denmark. The collision occurred at around 10:30 pm (CET) and involved a hole in the bow and side of the vessel. Fortunately, no crew members were injured and no pollution was released.

Fire broke out on the vessel, The fire started in the vessel's hold, causing intense smoke. The emergency service, firefighting teams, and Marin police were quickly dispatched. The fire was extinguished after several hours, with no injuries reported. The incident was likely caused by a welding spark.

Collided with the oil tanker GLORIA MARIS, Both vessels sustained damage to their lateral structures but were not in danger of spills or sinking. Both vessels are currently detained near Algeciras and will be allowed to depart after further safety checks.

Collided with the containership HMM ST PETERSBURG, Both vessels sustained damage to their lateral structures but were not in danger of spills or sinking. Both vessels are currently detained near Algeciras and will be allowed to depart after further safety checks.

Fire broke out on the vessel, carrying 19 crew members, The incident occurred near the vessel's fuel tank, requiring intense firefighting efforts. Fortunately, none were injured. The cause of the fire is unknown, and authorities are closely monitoring the situation.

The Houthi claimed responsibility for attacking three US supply vessels, the MAERSK SARATOGA and STENA IMPECCABLE, The US military confirmed the attack, but did not name the vessels. US Central Command destroyed missiles, drones, and cruise missiles in defense.
Experienced engine failure while navigating the southbound convoy through the Canal Towed to the Great Bitter Lakes, Egypt, and anchored for repairs.

Houthi claimed responsibility for attacking three US supply vessels, STENA IMPECCABLE, and LIBERTY GRACE. The US military confirmed the attack, but did not name the vessels. US Central Command destroyed missiles, drones, and cruise missiles in defense.

The Houthi claimed responsibility for attacking three US supply vessels, the MAERSK SARATOGA and LIBERTY GRACE. The US military confirmed the attack, but did not name the vessels. US Central Command destroyed missiles, drones, and cruise missiles in defense.
En route from Nassau to New Orleans, diverted for a medical emergency and faced propulsion issues, Engineers are actively conducting repairs.
Rendered NUC due to a No.4 high-pressure oil pump malfunction at lat 49°41′44″N, long 004°12′44″W, UK, Repairs are ongoing with status updates and checks scheduled every two hours.
Ran aground near Sandhamn in the Stockholm archipelago, Sweden, Refloated and anchored for hull inspection, revealing three holes in a ballast tank. No injuries or pollution were reported.
Encountered a technical issue with the echo sounder system at the northern entrance of the Istanbul Strait , Proceeded to Turkeli Anchorage, Türkiye, with repairs underway by 30 November.
A small fire broke out in the engine room while docked at Leirvik i Hyllestad, Norway, The fire was extinguished quickly, and no injuries or missing persons were reported.
Fire and an explosion occurred east of Bornholm, Denmark, forcing the crew to abandon the vessel. All five crew members were rescued, and the vessel was adrift the following day.

Firefighters responded to smoke emanating from the superstructure of the vessel at berth No. 43 in Vladivostok, Russia,  Approximately 15 cubic meters of a cabin were damaged. No injuries were reported.
An explosion on the starboard main deck near Playu outer Bar anchorage, Indonesia, occurred,A foreman fell overboard during unauthorized welding but was rescued promptly.
Encountered a mechanical fault while operating between Fishbourne and Portsmouth, UK, Repairs are in progress to restore service quickly.
Gearbox failure led to the cancellation of services between Troon and Brodick, UK, Contractors have been arranged for repairs, and the vessel resumed service on 29 November.
Collided with a cargo vessel,TRAPEZITZA , at the Caraguay dock in Guayaquil, There have been no reports of injuries to the crew of either vessel.
Stranded on a reef near Moala Island, Fiji,  while carrying 245 passengers and 33 crew. All passengers were safely transferred to another vessel the next day.

Ran aground due to inclement weather and a technical malfunction. The vessel crashed into a coral reef and sustained damage to the hull. Authorities are working round the clock, to contain the pollution caused by the vessel.
Lost propulsion during an eastbound Kiel Canal transit near Dukerswisch, Germany, on 27 November 2024. Subsequently, it drifted and allided with a dolphin structure before resuming its journey.
Scraped its stern against a pier during berthing at Adamantos, Milos, Greece, No injuries or pollution occurred, and the vessel proceeded to Piraeus for inspection.

Fuel transfer operation was halted due to an oil spill. The US Coast Guard responded promptly, securing the leak and containing it within the dock area. The Marine Spill Response Corporation is leading cleanup efforts, while other government agencies monitor the situation. The USGC warns residents and fishermen to stay away until clean-up is complete, and an investigation is underway.
Suffered engine trouble after departing Hoyer bunker station for Kiel Canal transit,Reduced speed and diverted to Kudensee for investigation.

Experienced an explosion in its cargo hold off the coast of North Carolina, causing damage to its No. 1 and No. 2 cargo hatches. Despite the explosion, the vessel managed to travel to Chesapeake Bay, US.
Collided with a smaller cargo vessel, PAOLA, at the Caraguay dock in Guayaquil, causing significant damage to the bow. There have been no reports of injuries to the crew of either vessel.
Fire broke out aboard a vessel undergoing repairs in St. Petersburg, Russia, The fire was extinguished the same day, with no injuries reported.
Technical issues required the vessel to anchor at Datca while en route from Romano, Albania, to Mersin, Turkiye, Repairs were completed, and the vessel departed Datca on 11 October.
Listed up to 15 degrees to starboard while stationed at Mersin Anchorage, Türkiye, Urgent assistance was provided, and the vessel remained stationary pending investigation
Radar issues restricted the vessel to daylight-only operations while on the Tobermory to Kilchoan route in the UK.
Immobilized at Santa Cruz de Tenerife, Spain, due to a breakdown. Repairs were delayed due to spare parts and logistical challenges.
Engine issues led to cancellations of sailings on the Porto Torres to Genova route in Italy. Passengers and drivers were rebooked, and the vessel resumed operations on 26 November.
Experienced a blackout approximately 14.5 nautical miles south of St Catherine's Point,  The issue was resolved within 10 minutes, allowing the voyage to resume.
Encountered a technical issue with its ramp while operating the Lochaline to Fishnish route in the UK .The problem was resolved the same day.

Reported steering issues and began drifting approximately 100 nautical miles northwest of Froya, Norway, Safely secured in Freifjorden, Kristiansund, awaiting tug assistance for transport to Kaliningrad.
An oil spill occurred during bunkering near Pier No. 5 at Novorossiysk Commercial Sea Port, Russia, Rescuers swiftly installed booms to contain the fuel spill.
Allided with the inner pier in Ronne Harbour, Denmark, while departing for Ystad, Sweden. Sustained hull cracks and was removed from service. No injuries were reported.
Experienced a technical failure near the northern entrance of the Canakkale Strait, Türkiye, Shifted to Gelibolu anchorage for repairs and resumed sailing the next day.
A distress alert was received from the vessel at sea near France, Nearby vessels were asked to assist, and further updates are awaited.
Collided with a Marshall Islands-flagged vessel departing Kobe, Japan, A tugboat capsized, leading to the captain’s death. Investigations are ongoing.
Aft engine problems at Southampton, UK, led to the cancellation of two sailings,The vessel resumed service on 25 November.
Reported a technical malfunction during the Canakkale Strait passage, Moved under its own power to Karanlik Liman anchorage, where repairs commenced.
Canceled two rotations between Algeciras and Ceuta, Spain,due to gangway breakdown. Passenger ro-ro Cecilia Payne substituted service while repairs continued.
Fire broke out onboard while preparing to dock at Ningbo port. Crew members extinguished the fire, but its location hindered critical passageways.
In contact with the offshore installation Valaris 120, approximately 150 nautical miles from Aberdeen, Sustained a pinhole on the forward port side and returned to Aberdeen under its own power.
Fishing nets tangled in the propeller rendered the vessel NUC and adrift near Dover, UK,  Towing operations were assisted by Abeille Normandie.

Ran aground while traversing the St. Lawrence River near Morrisburg, Ontario.  The cause is unknown, but no crew members were injured. The St. Lawrence Seaway Management Corporation is in stable condition outside the navigation channel and finalizing a plan to refloat the vessel.
A technical failure near Kumkale Point in the Canakkale Strait was reported on 23 November 2024. Moved under its own power to Bozcaada Island anchorage for repairs.
A fuel valve leak caused the vessel to go NUC 17 nautical miles south of St Catherine’s Point, UK, The defect was fixed, and the vessel resumed operations.
Lost control and approached the shore, but stopped a few meters short of running aground. The crew managed to prevent stranding,The vessel ended up disabled.

Toppled a 25-ton mobile crane onto a small barge at the Navantia Shipyard in Spain as it was preparing to depart , Fortunately, no injuries were reported, and the cab and base of the toppled crane remained above water.
Collided with towboat Shoei Maru in Osaka Bay near Kobe, Japan, The towboat capsized, resulting in one death. No damage was reported on the vessel.
Sailings between Oban and Craignure, UK, were canceled on 23 November 2024 due to adverse weather and suspected propeller damage. Operations resumed on 24 November.
Sustained damage during Storm Bert, impacting AIS functionality, Returned to Dublin for inspection the following day.
Encountered a technical failure and sought shelter at Kemer anchorage, Türkiye, Repairs were completed the same day.
Reported a technical issue and anchored at Bodrum anchorage, Türkiye, Repairs by crew members were ongoing as of 25 November.
Total engine transmission failure occurred near the Grand Banks of Newfoundland, Canada, on 21 November 2024. The vessel was towed to Burin by the Canadian Coast Guard.
Experienced a technical failure and anchored at Sinop Anchorage, Türkiye, Repairs were completed by the crew, and the vessel departed on 26 November.

On Friday November 22nd 2024, after a low-speed dogleg just offshore, the vessel drifted west and ran aground on a reef north of Al-Quseer (aka El Qosier) on Egypt’s “Red Sea Riviera” (IMN December 2nd 2024)

A pipe leak in the engine room caused the vessel to go NUC 24 nautical miles south of Berry Head, UK, on 22 November 2024. Repairs were completed by the crew, and broadcasts were made every 15 minutes. The vessel resumed operations the next day.
Experienced a blackout near Dover, UK, The issue was resolved the same day, and the vessel resumed its journey, arriving in Milford Haven on 27 November.
Fire broke out while anchored southeast of Kemaro Island, Indonesia, Cooling operations by a nearby vessel prevented reignition. No casualties were reported.
Went NUC due to engine sensor issues near the UK on 22 November 2024. The crew completed repairs, and its vthe vessel resumed oyage the same day.
Engine problems halted the vessel en route to Antarctica on 22 November 2024. It proceeded to Ushuaia, Argentina, at reduced speed for repairs, with an estimated arrival of 30 November.
Experienced water ingress while berthed at Sunda Kelapa Harbor, Indonesia, The vessel listed to starboard, and pollution occurred. SAR and Marpol teams ensured safety.
A small amount of water was detected in a tank upon arrival in Split, Croatia, on 21 November 2024. Toilets were locked as a precaution, and the ferry company investigated the issue.
Collided with general cargo vessel Marla Orca at Kartal Anchorage, Türkiye, Sustained damage to the side shell plating above the waterline.
Ran aground in shallow waters near Antirrion, Greece, Refloated and entered Patras port on 23 November. No pollution or injuries were reported.
Experienced a technical malfunction and drifted onto a quay while docking at Bozava Port, Croatia, Hull damage was noted, and inspections were awaited. All nine passengers were unharmed.
Allided with a streetlight on a wharf while returning to port from a lunch cruise in Kobe, Japan, The streetlight fell due to the impact. No injuries were reported.
Dragged anchor and collided with general cargo vessel DSK 1 at Kartal Anchorage, Türkiye,Sustained damage to the side shell plating above the waterline.
Collided with the quay while maneuvering at Lovund, Norway, causing damage to the port side. Arrived in Myre on 21 November.
Strong winds caused docking difficulties during a voyage between Forvik and Tjotta, Norway, A propeller entangled with a rope, delaying operations by 40 minutes.
Aft engine issues led to the cancellation of multiple sailings between Southampton and East Cowes, UK, on 20 November 2024. Two additional sailings were canceled the next day.
Lost an anchor and chain off the Belgian coast , Anchored at Westhinder Anchorage before resuming its voyage on 21 November.
Technical failure at Tuzla Anchorage, Türkiye, required tug assistance. The vessel remains stationary while repairs are conducted.
Ran aground near Ukishima Island, Japan, on due to a cooling water pump failure. All four crew members were safe
Collided with the lower gate of Nikolaevsky Hydroelectric Complex in Russia while en route from Kavkaz to Tatyanka, The gate sustained damage, but the vessel was unharmed.
Mechanical failure occurred 3.2 nautical miles south of Lipsi, Greece, The vessel was towed to Kalymnos for repairs and departed on 22 November.
Technical issues with the port main engine caused delays on the Uig to Tarbert route, UK, Repairs were initiated, and sailings resumed once the problem was resolved.
Reported NUC due to unspecified engine issues while transiting approximately 12 nautical miles southeast of Beachy Head, UK, in the Strait of Dover, Resumed sailing the same day.
Came into contact with an icebreaker while approaching for a fuel transfer off Pond Inlet, Nunavut, Canada, The vessel suffered a total failure of its air bubbler system at the time of the incident.

Fire broke out aboard the vessel, The fire was caused by sparks igniting insulation material during renovation work,The fire has since been extinguished, and no casualties have been reported in the incident.

Collided with a bank fortification of Pier 2 while carrying 2,824 tons of bulk waste. The ship sustained an 11-meter scrape, but no pollution or injuries were reported. Authorities detained the vessel for seaworthiness.

Attacks from Yemen's Houthi terrorists while traveling through the Red Sea and the Gulf of Aden, causing no damage or injuries, The ship's captain saw a missile splashed in close proximity to the vessel, 30 miles west of Yemen's port city of Mocha.
Anchor dragging at Tuzla Anchorage, Türkiye, prompted a tow by Tug Sark. The vessel was safely moored, and sailings were canceled.

A suspected broken cylinder or crankshaft caused technical failure en route from Paldiski, Estonia, to Kapellskar, Sweden, on 17 November 2024. The vessel sailed to Vene Balti shipyard in Tallinn for repairs on 19 November.

Collided with a quay carrying 157 passengers, crew, and vehicles between Patras and Ithaca. The vessel was damaged on the stern, and the Sami Port Department of Kefallinia Port Authority has banned it from sailing.
Approximately 39 cubic meters of wooden cargo fell overboard in rough seas outside Kasko, Finland, The logs are expected to wash ashore soon. Docked at Kasko Harbour

Authorities and the open-source intelligence (OSINT) community have zeroed in on the Yi Peng 3 as potentially responsible for cutting two undersea cables on her journey through the Baltic Sea, and Germany’s defense minister has already called this a hybrid attack.
Technical issues temporarily suspended operations on the Revsnes to Flesnes route, Norway, The vessel remained stationary in Harstad as of 19 November
Disabled and adrift near Spiekeroog Island, Germany, Towed to Bremerhaven by VB Bremerhaven and Fairplay-50.
Experienced engine failure near Kandili, causing the Bosphorus Strait to be closed. Authorities quickly dispatched tugboats KURTARMA 7 and 9, towing the vessel to ISTANBUL Anchorage.
Lost steering power and navigation equipment due to an external cooling system leak near St. Catherine’s Point, UK, Repairs were completed the same day. Arrived in Ringaskiddy on 19 November.
Experienced main engine failure while preparing to berth at Yangshan Port, China, Tug assistance and initial repairs were completed by 18 November.
Ran aground on Skardon River Bar, Australia, while towing barge TSA 3001. The vessel refloated under its own power and continued its journey. Investigations are ongoing.
Ran aground near Bracici Rocks, Croatia, Strong winds caused the vessel to sink by the stern on 16 November. All passengers were safely disembarked.

Ran aground due to a shift, causing the ship to list and water ingress. The vessel was en route from Taremba to Port Kijang. Oil booms have been placed around the vessel to mitigate pollution risks, and the cargo is being offloaded to stabilize it.

Engine failure occurred at Gelibolu Point in the Canakkale Strait, Türkiye, Tugs assisted, and the vessel moved to Karanlik Liman Anchorage for permanent repairs. Departed on 17 November and reached Port Said on 19 November.
Allided with a fender wall and charging tower at Horn, Norway, during mooring maneuvers, Bow ramp damage required repairs at Slipen in Sandnessjoen. Sailed on 22 November.
Technical issue arose while transiting Drake Passage, Australasia, The vessel arrived in Ushuaia, Argentina, on 18 November, where technicians worked on the issue.
Engine failure occurred at Dikili Anchorage, Türkiye, Towing to Piraeus, Greece, began on 26 November, with an ETA of 28 November.
An engine failure near Blanes, Spain,  prompted assistance from Salvamar Sirius. The vessel was towed to Blanes safely.

Experienced a technical issue with its thruster  while operating the Berneray-Leverburgh route. All sailings on the route were canceled, and the vessel operated on three engines with an amended timetable.
A fire broke out in the engine room off Fawley Oil Refinery, UK, The fire was extinguished with assistance from Tug Apex and Tug Phenix. No injuries were reported.

Ran aground around 3.5 nautical miles off of Punta Cochinos in Santa Maria Island, Chile.The Maritime Governorate of Talcahuano responded to the incident, deploying the patrol vessel Talcahuano. All 21 crew members were unharmed, and the vessel refloated and dropped anchor at CORONEL Anchorage.
Suffered a catapult failure during departure from Myrina Port, Greece, Returned to the port, where repairs and a class inspection were completed. The vessel sailed the same day with a delay.
Issued a distress message from waters near Canada ,The JRCC Halifax requested assistance from nearby vessels, with updates awaited.
Drifted in the waters of North Natuna, Indonesia, following a mechanical failure and rudder damage. Located by patrol vessels on 20 November, with authorities boarding on 21 November.
A fire broke out while the vessel was docked at Bognes, Norway, Emergency services extinguished the blaze, and police are investigating. No passengers were onboard.
Experienced a mechanical breakdown at Santa Teresa di Gallura, Italy, on 13 November 2024. The vessel remained stationary with no replacement ferry available.
Came into contact with a moored small boat at Mgarr Harbour, Gozo, Malta, due to a minor throttle issue. The issue was resolved on-site without further damage.
Suffered a technical failure at Tuapse, Russia, The vessel departed on 14 November, with an ETA at its destination of 16 November
Allided with a wharf while arriving at Tsurushima Island, Japan, No injuries were reported, and the vessel continued to Mitsuhama Port under its own power.
Suffered navigation system and GMDSS alarm failures at Novorossiysk, Russia,  Departures were canceled until repairs were completed the following day.
Experienced technical failure at Novorossiysk, Russia, After repairs, the vessel departed on 15 November, with an ETA at the destination of 21 November.

Collided with the Francis Scott Key Bridge, causing significant damage and resulting in six worker deaths and $1.7 to $1.9 billion in damages. The ship suffered extensive damage, including a bow replacement, and port officials struggled to bring it into port. Litigation against the owner and operator continues, with the authorities seeking remuneration for all damages incurred.

A fire occurred in the accommodation cabins while docked at Keratsini Port, Greece, One sailor was hospitalized for injuries, and material damage was reported. Sailing was banned until repairs were completed.
Encountered windlass and anchor handling issues at Tuapse, Russia, Repairs were completed, and the vessel departed on 14 November
Oil leaks and safety alarm issues occurred at Samsun, Türkiye, on 12 November 2024. Repairs were completed, and the vessel departed on 15 November, with an ETA of 17 November.
Reported technical failure at Iskenderun, Türkiye, Departure was canceled until repairs were completed, and the vessel resumed operations on 15 November.
Taken out of service for propulsion system repairs at Kragenaes Havn, Denmark, Services resumed on 14 November.
Experienced technical failure at Marmara Ereglisi, Türkiye, Departures were banned until repairs were completed, and the vessel resumed service on 22 November.
Taken out of service at Norddeich, Germany, due to a hydraulic cylinder defect on a ramp. Service cancellations were announced until 28 November, with the vessel expected to return by 5 December.
Ran aground near Holmon, Sweden, Passengers were evacuated safely, and the vessel was refloated and moored at Holmsund.
Ran aground near San Agustin, Romblon, Philippines, All 156 passengers and 38 crew members were evacuated safely.
Experienced rudder malfunction at Kalymnos, Greece,Repairs were conducted, and the vessel resumed service on 25 November.
Reported a broken seawater cooling pipe en route from Le Havre, France, to Casablanca, Morocco, Repairs were completed, and the vessel resumed its voyage the same day. No pollution was reported.

Combo tanker, AL Reem collided with assisting tug Atlantic Cedar in Halifax Harbour, Canada, The collision occurred as the tanker approached Sandwich Point. Both vessels were secured for damage assessments.

Experienced technical failure at the southern entrance of the Istanbul Strait, Türkiye, Towed to Bakirkoy Anchorage with assistance from Tug Kurtarma 11. Sailing was banned until repairs were completed.
Damage to a wheelhouse window was reported, while docked in Saint-Pierre, Miquelon. The vessel will remain at the dock for several weeks for repairs.

Collided with two anchored vessels near the port of Gresik , The ship suffered a system blackout, losing control, and colliding with the tankers. One tanker was damaged, but no crew was injured. The ship is expected to reach Singapore by 20 November.
Total engine failure resulted in a propulsion loss on the St. Lawrence River near Sorel, Quebec, Canada, The vessel resumed its voyage using its remaining engine.
A Hole appeared on the starboard forward hull,  possibly due to collision with an underwater object during berthing. The vessel has been offloaded to prevent water intrusion.

Ran aground on the southeast side of Makronissos Island, Greece, The vessel sustained a breach above the waterline and was accompanied to Piraeus Anchorage by a tug. The master was arrested following the incident.
Vessel required fuel filter replacement south of St. Catherine’s Point. Repairs took approximately one hour, after which it resumed its journey

A fire broke out on container ship, spreading to nearby ones. The crew quickly acted, but to fully extinguish it, the vessel diverted to the Port of Tenerife. Shore-based firefighters helped extinguish the fire, and the vessel resumed its journey after unloading the damaged containers.
Allided with a berth while docking in Kanda Port, Japan, The bulbous bow sustained damage. No injuries or pollution were reported, and the vessel sailed to Kanazawa the same day.
Reported a hydraulic ramp issue caused by an oil leak at Porozina Port, Croatia, The vessel was sent to a shipyard in Kraljevica for repairs on 10 November.
Went NUC due to engine issues near St. Catherine’s Point, Isle of Wight, UK, The issue was resolved without assistance, and the vessel arrived in Ipswich on 10 November.
Ran aground in the shallows at Hakata Port, Japan, The vessel adjusted its ballast water and refloated under its own power at high tide.
Went NUC while changing valves on its main engine 22 nautical miles from St. Catherine’s Point, Isle of Wight, UK, Repairs were completed, and the vessel resumed its voyage the same day.
Total engine failure caused propulsion loss northeast of the Strait of Belle Isle, Canada, The vessel restarted one engine and was escorted to Botwood, departing on 16 November.
Ran aground along the Currimao shoreline in the Philippines, due to strong winds from Typhoon "Marce." All 15 crew members were safely evacuated.
Service disruptions were reported on the Stornoway-Ullapool route, UK, due to main engine control system failure. The issue was resolved, and sailings resumed the next day.
Went NUC due to main engine calibration near Casiter, UK, The defect was resolved within an hour, and the vessel arrived in Immingham on 11 November.
Fire services responded to smoke and a burning smell as the vessel approached Frekhaug, Norway, The Nordhordland route was canceled until further notice. No injuries were reported.
Technical failure occurred near the Istanbul Strait, Türkiye, Coastal Safety Tug Kurtarma 5 assisted, and the vessel departed on 14 November.
Engine failure led to loss of power near Famagusta, Cyprus, Tug Vatan towed the vessel to Kalecik, where it moored on 11 November.
Went NUC due to engine power loss in the River Mersey, UK,  Peel Ports arranged assistance, and the vessel was repaired and departed for Liverpool on 11 November.
Engine failure resulted in loss of propulsion near Gabeiras Islands, Spain, on 7 November 2024. The vessel was towed to A Coruna by Salvamar Betelgeuse.
Main engine failure was reported near Piraeus, Greece, prior to arrival. Authorities halted the vessel’s sailing until repairs were completed.
Went NUC due to filter issues while navigating the Southwest Approaches, UK, The issue was resolved the same day, and the vessel resumed sailing.
Anchored after experiencing a loss of oil pressure in position 54 53 06N, 005 47 52W, A workboat was scheduled for towing assistance to Campbeltown, where the vessel arrived on 9 November

Encountered severe weather near Spain on , A sudden gust of wind caused movement aboard, resulting in minor damage. The vessel continued to Las Palmas, Spain, for the disembarkation of an injured individual.
Engine failure occurred near position 10 22 47S, 148 19 47E, Papua New Guinea, The vessel, carrying 800,000 liters of petrol, was towed to Port Moresby by a tug.
Technical issues affected the fuel system while serving the Oban-Coll-Tiree route, UK,  The issue was resolved, and the vessel was underway by 7 November.
Stern ramp failure occurred at San Sebastian de La Gomera, Canary Islands, The vessel sailed from San Sebastian the next day.
Went NUC due to engine damage requiring emergency repairs south of the Rampion Wind Farm, UK, Repairs were completed, and the vessel resumed sailing the same day.

Ran aground due to low water levels. The vessel has been refloated and should be able to navigate again soon. The grounding affected multiple ships, including EVA SHANGHAI(9863869) and INOI(9400928), and could have caused around eight more vessels to be stuck in the channel.
Ran aground in the Itapua channel in the metropolitan region of Porto Alegre. Reports indicate that  the vessel had not been refloated, around eight more vessels would have been stuck in the channel.
Technical failure at Tekirdag, Türkiye, The Harbour-Master canceled departure permissions until repairs were completed. The vessel shifted to anchorage on 7 November and sailed on 14 November.
A search has begun off eastern Australia for a bulker crew member feared lost overboard on Wed 6th Nov
Technical problems caused the vessel to break down at Yokohama, Japan,  leaving 500 to 600 Russian citizens onboard. The vessel was scheduled to arrive in Shanghai, China, on 9 November.
A vehicle collision onboard injured four individuals while docked at North Killingholme Dock, UK, An MCA surveyor was scheduled to board the vessel for investigation.
Ran aground as she was sailing close behind the MOUNT TARANAKI (9361782), due to low water level.
Experienced engine failure near Algiers, Algeria, The vessel drifted before being towed to Fethiye Anchorage by Tug Dionysios. ETA to the anchorage is 20 November.

USCG were alerted to an incident of a  crewmember who was experiencing symptoms of a stroke. He was evacuated and quickly transported to the Hospital La Jolla in San Diego by 2:30 PM. Reports indicate that the patient is currently in a stable medical condition.
Adverse weather caused the vessel and its tow, Barge Intan Kelana 26, to drift into a conveyor structure at Garda Tujuh Buana Jetty, Indonesia, Minor damage was reported, with no pollution.
Main engine failure left the vessel NUC at the entrance to Belfast Harbour, The vessel was towed to a repair jetty by Tugs Masterman and Merchantman.
Navigation system failure with alarms occurred at Eregli, Türkiye, Departure permission was temporarily canceled until permanent repairs were completed. The vessel sailed on 6 November.

Engine failure during westbound transit of the Kiel Canal, Germany, caused the vessel to veer off course and run into an embankment between Duckerswisch and Fischerhutte Refloated and sailed from Brunsbuttel on 5 November
Ran aground at the 452-kilometer mark on the Parana River, Argentina,blocking navigation. The vessel was refloated on 5 November and inspected at San Lorenzo Centre Roads

Main engine fuel system failure occurred approximately 20 nautical miles off the coast of Belmullet, Republic of Ireland, The vessel drifted northward and later arrived at Galway Port for further repairs.
Technical failure occurred at Eregli, Türkiye, Departure permission was canceled until repairs were completed. The vessel sailed from Eregli on 6 November and arrived in Tuapse on 9 November.
Technical fault repairs on the Halsa-Kanestraum service vessel in Norway were ongoing as of 4 November 2024. The vessel arrived at Kristiansund and resumed operations the same day.
Allided with a shore loader due to strong onshore winds in position 34 26 04S, 137 55 05E, Australia, on 2 November 2024. Tug assistance was requested.
Dragged its anchor at Anchorage No. 29 in Chatham Sound, Canada, The vessel was repositioned and re-anchored with a pilot’s assistance. Departed the same day.

ERA STAR collided with the cargo vessel Mizan. The collision caused significant damage to the Mizan, leading to water ingress and fears of capsizing. Caught up in the collision, a fishing boat capsized, and the sole person on board is still missing.

Serving the Skjervoy, Kvaenangen, and Vorteroy route in Norway, the vessel experienced technical issues, Operations were canceled, and the vessel remained stationary in Skjervoy. Departed on 10 November.
NUC due to a leaking pipe in the engine room in position 53 41 24N, 005 25 48W, 33 nautical miles northwest of South Stack,  Repairs completed the same day, and the vessel arrived in Belfast.
Fire broke out in the engine room, which was quickly extinguished by boat crews. Despite the quick containment, one crew member was injured, and an investigation is underway into the cause.

Vessel en route from Rostov-na-Donu to Alexandria encountered technical issues and anchored at Bodrum, Turkiye, for repairs. Crew members are handling the repairs, with departure expected once completed.
Fishing nets became entangled around the propeller, leaving the vessel unable to manoeuvre near Shoreham. The fishing vessel Eternal Light aided by towing to Shoreham later that day.
Engine failure left the vessel non-operational in UK waters. A tug was dispatched to assist and tow it into berth. The vessel was transporting vegetable oil at the time.

Pro-Palestinian protesters in Turkey have boarded a vessel alleged to be carrying explosives for Israel. The protesters believe the 8,000-dwt German-owned multipurpose Kathrin (built 2010) unloaded eight containers of Israeli missile components in Egypt at the end of October. https://www.tradewindsnews.com/containers/ship-carrying-israeli-destined-explosives-stormed-by-turkish-protesters/2-1-1734308
Fuel pump replacement was necessary while near St. Catherine’s Point. Repairs took around 1.5 to 2 hours, allowing the vessel to continue its course.

Crew member was rescued by the Indian Coast Guard while he was suffering from a Cerebrovascular disorder. He was taken to Mumbai to receive medical attention. The Indian Coast Guard has reported that although the seafarer made it to the hospital in time, his condition still remains critical.
Mechanical problems in position 49 26 02N, 123 28 19W, Canada, caused the cancellation of three morning sailings, Repairs were undertaken, and the vessel departed from Gibsons on the same day.
Sank off Libya in position 32 42 24N, 023 00 01E, Three crew members were reported missing; the shipmaster’s body was recovered.
Technical failure occurred at Novorossiysk, Russia, Departure was temporarily canceled until repairs were completed. The vessel sailed on 3 November.
Steering system failure occurred in the Passage de Lile aux Coudres, Quebec, Canada, The vessel proceeded to the wharf of L'Isle-aux-Coudres for repairs.

Rigging entangled in the propeller resulted in a loss of steering approximately 15 nautical miles northwest of Burela, Spain. The Spanish naval vessel Salvamar Alioth towed it safely to the port of Burela.

Collided with the chemical tanker SOUTHERN PUMA (9792008).Both vessels sustained damage, but no injuries were reported. Maritime Captaincy of Algeciras is being asked to assess the environmental impact.
Fire broke out in the engine room. While the rescue team managed to extinguish the fire and save 23 people, the lives of two crewmembers were lost.

Collided with bulk carrier Louisa Bolten 20 nautical miles from Punta Europa, Damage was reported to the starboard side and one cargo tank. Liquid paraffin spilled into the sea. The vessel arrived in Algeciras on 2 November.
Collided with two barges and a tug before being secured.Broke moorings during hurricane-like winds at Rauma Marine Constructions shipyard, Finland, on
Navy/Coast Guard, reported that three crew members remain missing.Vessel sank near Libya, approximately at position 32°42'24"N, 23°00'01"E. On 2nd November, MRCC Rome, on behalf of the Libyan

Technical failure occurred at Novorossiysk, Russia, leading to a temporary suspension of departure permission by the harbour master. The crew began repairs, with the vessel still in Novorossiysk as of 3rd November.

Engine room fire caused vessel to drift in waters about 40 nautical miles southeast of Lizard Point, UK. The fire was extinguished, and tug Abeille Horizon was en route to tow the vessel to Brest, with an estimated arrival of 2nd November.
Lost propulsion due to nets entangling the propeller shaft in Ugolnaya Bay, Russia, Functionality was restored, and the vessel resumed operations on 11 November.
Attempting to assist the grounded fishing vessel Kalam, the vessel became disabled due to nets entangling its propeller group in Glubokaya Bay, Kamchatka, Russia,  The nets were removed.
Partial collapse of a moveable crane onto the main deck occurred at Yenikapi Anchorage, Türkiye, Structural damage was reported. The vessel departed Tuzla shipyard on 7 November.
Total engine failure occurred in Halifax Harbour, Nova Scotia, Canada, Assisted by three tugs for berthing, the vessel departed on 1 November.

Ran aground in shallow waters near the breakwater lighthouse at Sakaiminato Port, Japan. After investigation by the Japan Coast Guard, a tug successfully refloated the vessel. No injuries or oil spill occurred.
Ran aground south of Tromso Bridge, Norway, after being pushed into an unmarked sandbar by a gust of wind. Both crew members and the vessel are safe, now docked at Imes quay.
Technical failure at the southern entrance of the Canakkale Strait led the vessel to move under its own power to an anchorage near Bozcaada Island. The vessel resumed its journey the same day.

Collided with Maersk Shekou (IMO 9466984), and its stern allided with a berth and the Maritime Museum roof edge while entering Fremantle, Australia. Damage to the mast and other parts is estimated at 2.5-3 million AUD.

Ran aground in shallow waters near IGOUMENITSA Port.carrying 16 passengers and crew, Despite mechanical failure, the vessel refloated with its own engines, accompanied by tugboats, Coast Guard vessels, and a passenger ferry, ensuring the safety of all onboard.
Technical failure forced vessel to anchor at Datca, Turkiye, where the crew initiated repairs. She departed the anchorage on 1st November.

Ran aground in Bukhta Glubokaya off the northeastern coast of Kamchatka, Russia, with 31 crew members on board. A rescue operation was launched, with the crew confirmed safe and no reported hull damage or oil spill.

During panel installation, a fire broke out on the lower accommodation deck near Australia, sparked by a grinder igniting nearby materials. The fire was extinguished, and work temporarily halted for safety assessments

Experienced a main engine failure while en route from Samsun to Aliaga. The Canakkale Ship Traffic Services Centre dispatched tugs Kurtarma 3 and Kurtarma 4 for assistance, towed to the Sevketiye Anchorage Area.
Lost its ability to navigate after facing the outer rim of the typhoon Kong-Rey. All crew members were successfully evacuated to the KEELUNG Port.
In distress in the North Sea near Montrose, the vessel sank approximately 140 miles east of Firth of Forth, UK. The crew of six was rescued by the ERRV Grampian Corsair.

Technical issues with the gear resulted in the cancellation of all sailings between Forvik and Tjotta, Norway, on 29 October 2024. A replacement vessel took over, while the affected ship proceeded to a shipyard in Sandnessjoen for necessary repairs.

Lost engine power approximately 28 miles west of Viana do Castelo, Portugal, during its journey from Portbury, England, to Setubal, Portugal, on 29 October 2024. Towed to Vigo by tugboat Ria de Vigo, arriving on 30 October for repairs.

Vessel is being repaired off the coast of Portugal after losing propulsion last week. The 319,000-dwt Nissos Rhenia (built 2019) broke down 36.6km from Viana do Castelo, the Lusa news agency reported. A tow line has been secured and the vessel will remain off the coast with its crew of 28 until repairs are completed. Okeanis has been contacted for further information.

A technical issue required attention at Eregli, Turkiye, on 28 October 2024, resulting in a temporary sailing ban until repairs were completed. Departed Eregli on 29 October, heading towards Constantza, Romania, with an ETA of 1 November
Damaged its port rudder while preparing for a scheduled ferry route from Kymasi , Operations halted until a class maintenance certificate was issued.
Potential disruptions and cancellations expected for the Mallaig-Armadale route in the UK due to an issue with mooring equipment, A spare part has been ordered, and updates will follow.
Experienced a technical failure in Novorossiysk, Russia, temporarily halting its departure. Repairs were completed, and the vessel left Novorossiysk on 28 October, arriving in Eren on 30 October.
En route from Venice, Italy, to Greece with 133 passengers and vehicles, encountered an auxiliary generator failure, Skipped docking at Igoumenitsa, proceeding directly to Patras.
Attacked by Yemen’s Houthi Rebels in the Red Sea, causing multiple explosions. The vessel and its crew are safe and are en route to Changjiangkou, China, according to UK Maritime Trade Operations.
Technical difficulties impacted speed while docked in Philipsburg, St. Maarten, Engineers addressed the issue, allowing departure on 28 October.
An oil spill occurred during bunkering with another vessel off Changi, Singapore, spilling approximately 5 tons of oil. Authorities are investigating the incident.
Encountered engine problems while transiting the Suez Canal with a northbound convoy, Initially towed to the west bank until the convoy passed, then moved south and anchored. Departed on 28 October.
Collided with a quay in KALUNDBORG, Denmark, causing minor damage. The door for debarking passengers was lowered prematurely, causing the hinges to be damaged. No injuries or pollution were reported.
Cancelled a 7-night cruise from Galveston, Texas, due to unspecified technical issues. The next departure on 3 November was also cancelled as repairs are ongoing.
Oil Spill During Changi Bunkering Operation Triggers Emergency Response. Reports indicated that approximately five tonnes of oil had overflowed into the sea.
Damaged in September due to hazardous cargo of explosives it is carrying, has been allowed to dock at the Port of Great Yarmouth on 28 October.
While transporting a barge, confirmed grounding at the Skardon River Mouth Bar in Australia, No damage or pollution was reported, and the barge continued outbound the same day.
Ran aground in Oprichnik Bay, Nakhodka, Russia, due to adverse weather , No injuries or pollution were reported.
Experienced a main engine issue on the Tarbert-Portavadie route in the UK, The issue was resolved on the same day, resuming normal service.
Came to a halt in the North Sea off the UK due to a problem with a single gas compressor, Engineers identified a dry gas seal failure in one of the gas compressors, with no oil or gas leaks reported.
Fire broke out onboard while en route to a refinery in Quebec, Canada, The fire caused damage that required repairs, and tugs moved the vessel to Pier 22. Departure timing remains uncertain.

Strong currents and large waves led to grounding approximately 300 meters from the shoreline of Barangay Linao, Aparri, Cagayan in the Philippines, Seven passengers and crew were rescued, while four crew members remained on board as monitoring continued.

En route from Alexandria, Egypt, to Novorossiysk, Russia, a technical failure prompted a stop and anchorage at Ayvalik, Turkiye, The crew undertook repairs, and the vessel resumed its journey on 29 October.

Allision with a trawl fishing boat occurred about 10 kilometers east of the Port of Hitachinaka, Japan, Both vessels reported no injuries, and the incident is under investigation by the Japan Coast Guard.

Experienced engine failure while navigating Grotsundet, north of Tromso, Norway, Although there was no immediate danger, the crew worked to resolve the issue. The vessel sailed out of Tromso on 25 October.
Operating on the Helsingor-Helsingborg route in Sweden, problems with the bow visor caused delays, The vessel was taken out of service in Helsingborg for a cylinder replacement.
Technical issues affected propulsion systems while docked in Progreso, Mexico, The vessel remained overnight to allow engineers to address the issue, departing Progreso on 25 October after repairs.

Came into contact with a fishing vessel in Saganoseki, Oita Prefecture, Japan, No damage was reported, and the vessel proceeded under its own power. After Coast Guard interrogation, the vessel continued to Sakaide in Kagawa Prefecture. No injuries occurred.
Collision with a tugboat during unberthing from berth CLB6 at Port Walcott, Australia,  caused a hull fracture near the dirty water tank on the port quarter, leading to water ingress.

Drifted and ran aground in Batangas Port, Philippines, reportedly due to Tropical Storm Kristine. The vessel allided with a multi-purpose berth at the port and awaits tow. The captain was not on board at the time of the incident; an investigation is underway.

A fire and explosion were reported by Kent Fire & Rescue, while docked at berth 2-3, Sheerness Harbour, UK. The incident, attributed to a malfunctioning motor in the pumping room, resulted in one casualty who was taken to the hospital.

Vessel ran aground at the entrance of the Eregli Iron and Steel Factories port in Turkey. She was refloated, and following inspections, it was declared to be unharmed. She was carrying 85,000 tons of iron ore when it ran aground.

Seized by the Bureau of Customs for transferring unmarked fuel, the vessel ran aground at Batangas, Philippines, after breaking from its anchor during Tropical Storm Kristine. The salvage operation may take a week, and oil spill cleanup is ongoing.

Ran aground into an embankment while navigating the Kiel Canal near Neuwittenbek, Germany, Fog and likely human error contributed to the incident. Anchored at the Roadstead off Holtenau, and arrived in Riga on 26 October.

While traveling through the Kiel Canal, Germany, struck the embankment due to low visibility conditions brought upon by thick fog. The vessel was able to free itself, and early reports indicate the vessel did not sustain grievous damage.
Experienced a technical issue in UK waters, leading to the cancellation of four sailings. The issue was identified as a generator problem.
Experienced a technical failure at Eregli, Turkiye, Departure permission was temporarily revoked, and repairs are ongoing as of 23 October.

Out of service at Port Ellen, UK, due to issues with the bilge system and passenger lift. The bilge system was repaired, and the vessel resumed its voyage on 23 October, though the passenger lift remained out of service as of 24 October.

Technical malfunction occurred near Russia on the Korsakov-Kuril Islands route with 78 people on board,Passengers were to be delivered to Iturup Island, Kuriles, and the vessel planned to return to Korsakov.

Capsized after colliding with a Greek bulker (9486013), which was damaged in the red Sea after being attacked twice by the Yemeni rebel group. The incident occurred at Pier 2 in Dakar, Senegal,no casualties were reported.
Ran aground at Solstrand, Norway, Tug Borg Parat assisted, refloating the vessel and moving it to the quay. No information on potential damage to the trawler.

The search for a 66-year-old female passenger who fell overboard from a Royal Caribbean cruise ship, ALLURE OF THE SEAS, was called off by the Royal Bahamas Defense Force after 15 hours of searching. The passenger reportedly fell off on the night of October 22, around 17 miles off of Nassau in the Bahamas.

Engine failure was reported after completing an eastbound passage through the Istanbul Strait in Turkiye, Dropped anchor at Constantza roadstead on 25 October, then arrived at Tuzla anchorage on 30 October, where repairs are ongoing.
Allided with a wharf while departing from the Port of Mizushima, Japan, Departed for Osaka following the incident.
While en route from Izmir, Turkiye, to Vlore, Albania, experienced a technical failure and took shelter, dropping anchor at Cesme, Crew undertook repairs, and the vessel sailed on 23 October.

The hydrofoil middle wing detached in Greece, The Skiathos Port Authority prohibited the vessel's departure until repairs and certification were completed, and passengers were transported to their destinations.

Suffered a technical failure in Poti, Georgia, Departure permission was temporarily cancelled by the Harbour Master. A state surveyor will attend after repairs are completed. The vessel remains stationary at Poti as of 24 October.
A navigation and communication system failure occurred in Zonguldak, Türkiye, Repairs were completed by the crew, and the vessel sailed on 25 November.

Reportedly anchored due to an inoperative anchor winch, in UK waters. No pollution or tug assistance was required, and repairs to the winch were completed, allowing the vessel to moor alongside in Inverness.

Allided with masonry when entering the new northern lock of the Kiel Canal after westbound transit in Brunsbuttel, Germany, Departed the locks and moored at Neufeld Anchorage on the Elbe before departing on 22 October
