Came into contact with the general cargo vessel Amadeus Saffier on the River Neene, UK. The vessel sustained a hole in the ballast tank, leading to water leakage south of the anchor. Pilots are assessing the damage, with no pollution reported.
Fire hits engine room in waters off Singapore, All 22 crew members have safely disembarked without injuries.The cause of the fire is under investigation.

A fault in one of the thrusters caused issues for the vessel en route from Kennacraig to Port Askaig, UK, The master deemed it unsafe to berth in Port Askaig or Port Ellen. The vessel returned to Kennacraig for repairs, departing again on 24 October.

Collided with the general cargo vessel Verena on the River Neene, UK, sustaining a hole above the waterline and a failure in the steering gear. Anchored off Kings Lynn, awaiting pilot assessment. No pollution reported.
Experienced a technical failure at Novorossiysk, Russia, leading to a temporary cancellation of departure permission. Repairs were completed, and the vessel sailed from Novorossiysk on 22 October.

A technical failure led to the vessel seeking shelter and dropping anchor at Datca anchorage, Turkiye, Repairs were carried out by the crew, and the vessel remained stationary at Datca, sailing on 25 October.

Ran aground twice in the Rosario harbor on the Parana River, Argentina, rendering it unable to continue its journey. Two tugs assisted in refloating the vessel, which anchored in Rosario harbor on 22 October for inspections.

Detected water contamination in low sulfur fuel oil approximately 10 NM from Lizard Point, UK, The defect was rectified, but the issue reoccurred and was resolved before arrival at Goteborg Anchorage on 24 October.

Emitted plumes of black smoke while traveling downriver from Port Weller to Quebec along the St. Lawrence River, Canada, The vessel stopped near Round Island to address the issue and resumed operations, reaching Waddington on 20 October.
A catapult failure delayed the vessel's departure from Neapolis port, Greece,  Repairs and class inspection were conducted, and the vessel resumed its schedule with delays.
Technical issues with the fuel pump interrupted service on the Barra-Eriskay route in the UK, A spare part was sourced, and the issue was resolved on the same day, earlier than expected.
Vessel ran aground on the northern side of St. Anne Island on October 19. The vessel was successfully refloated at 1:10 AM the next day without any reported pollution or water ingress.
Lost steering amid rough weather approximately 10 NM off La Push, Washington, USA, The USCG, Canadian Coast Guard, and tug Atlantic Raven towed the vessel to Port Angeles. The crew remained safe.

Suffered a technical failure involving the gyro compass and alarm systems while docked in Trabzon, Turkiye. Departure was delayed until repairs were completed the following day. The ship sailed to Tuapse, Russia, on 18 September.
Collided with Louis S. St-Laurent while approaching for fuel transfer off Pond Inlet, Nunavut, Canada, Minor damages were assessed, but the vessel remained operational.

Collided with the Quebec City wharf  causing injuries to four passengers. Ferry service was interrupted for a few hours, and the vessel sustained damage, awaiting assessment. The schedule will be affected until further notice.
Vessel overturned near Korsakov Port on Sakhalin Island on October 18, resulting in the loss of life of crewmembers.
Requested towage after fishing nets entangled in its propeller approximately 15 NM north of Sisargas Island, Spain, CCS Fisterra mobilized SAR vessel Gavia, which towed the vessel to La Coruna.
A rope fouled the propeller in the North Sea, The Norwegian Coast Guard deployed patrol vessel Sortland for assistance, and a tug later towed the vessel to a quay in Bergen.

vessel_name: CMA CGM ANTOINE DE SAINT EXUPERY
details: Collided with a fender wall at the ferry berth in Mindland, Norway, No injuries were reported, and the ferry MF Tjotta temporarily replaced the vessel on its route.
ship_name: CMA CGM ANTOINE DE SAINT EXUPERY

details: Collided with a fender wall at the ferry berth in Mindland, Norway, No injuries were reported, and the ferry MF Tjotta temporarily replaced the vessel on its route.
Damaged its starboard main engine while en route from Kea to Laurium, Greece, Port authorities in Laurium banned sailing until repairs were completed.
Experienced a total blackout, leaving it without maneuverability in UK waters, The vessel operated with one engine and was undergoing repairs in Belfast harbor.
Operating on the Uig to Tarbert route in the UK, encountered a technical issue affecting the starboard engine, After repairs, the vessel sailed from Uig on 18 October.
Lost its main engine approximately 1 NM southwest of The Nab Tower, UK, Planned repairs before moving to Nab Anchorage No.9, later berthing at Southampton docks.
Allided with a lock wall on the Kiel Canal in Brunsbuttel, Germany, while mooring, The vessel was detained for an hour before sailing, with no reported damage or injuries.
Collided with tug Total Spirit near Darwin, Australia, The tug lost position and turned sharply, causing minor hull damage with missing paint but no injuries among the crew.

While returning from Portland to Guernsey, experienced a steering failure and one engine failure approximately 26 nm southwest of Portland Bill, UK, Proceeded to Brixham under its own power, with assistance from a fishing vessel for berthing.

Malfunction in electrical installations near Zadar, Croatia, left the vessel unable to lower its entry landing platform. After circling for 40 minutes, returned to Zadar, where passengers were transferred to another vessel
A fire broke out while in position 50 11 14N, 003 14 42W, 15 NM ESE from Start Point. One crew member was injured and taken to the hospital. The vessel was alongside Brixham Harbour the same day.

Caught fire in the engine room while on the Lavik-Oppedal route in Norway, approximately 2.5 kilometers from Lavik quay, Passengers were evacuated; crew remained onboard, and the fire was extinguished. Towed to Brekke.

While on the Yell-Unst route in the UK, listed after hitting a wave, causing a cement mixer onboard to fall over, No injuries reported, and the vessel was taken out of service with the Geira ferry covering the route temporarily.
Lost several freight trailers and boxes of salmon overboard on the route between Lerwick and Aberdeen, UK, Although cargo was secured, some boxes of freshly packed salmon were lost at sea.
Sought shelter at Datca anchorage, due to a technical failure. Repairs were underway, and the vessel remained stationary until departure on 18 October.

Requested assistance after fishing gear became entangled in the propeller approximately 1.8 miles from Cape Higer, Spain,  Towed to port of Pasaia by tug Maria de Maeztu and departed later the same day.
While operating the Fiskebol-Melbu route in Norway, the vessel encountered technical issues, forcing it to be sidelined in Fiskebol. All scheduled trips were cancelled until further notice
Operational issues led to the cancellation of trips from Sao Vicente Island, Portugal, Crew and technical team addressed the problem, with operations set to resume from 21 October.

Reported non-operational condition with only one functioning air pipe in the English Channel, approximately 20.1 nm from St. Catherine's Lighthouse, UK, Solent Coast Guard checked the vessel’s status before it continued sailing.
Experienced a total engine failure on Lake Superior off Whitefish Bay, US, Repairs were conducted while adrift, allowing it to continue, arriving in Thorold on 18 October.

Collided with small ferry FB-30 during manoeuvres through the Santos port canal in Brazil. The incident happened near the maintenance pier in position 23°59'00''S, 46°17'27''W. There were no injuries reported, and the incident is under investigation.
Anchored to conduct engine inspection on turbochargers within the Dover-Calais TSS separation zone, UK, Remained at anchor overnight and later moved to Le Havre Anchorage as of 30 October.

Suffered a complete loss of navigational equipment, including ECDIS, AIS, and radar, while adrift approximately 3.145 nm from Dover Port Eastern Entrance, UK, Resolved the defect and proceeded to Dover.
Detected a crack in its No. 1 port ballast tank while secured in Superior, USA. Temporary repairs were made, and the vessel resumed operations, arriving in Port Colborne on 19 September.
Fire broke out in a cubicle during oxy-cutting work related to dismantling this disincorporated vessel at Puerto La Cruz, Venezuela.

Technical failure of the navigation system occurred at Zonguldak, Turkiye, Departure permission was temporarily revoked by the Harbour-Master, and the vessel sailed again on 16 October, reaching Bartin on 26 October.
Allided with the berth at Terminal Sovgavan in Sovetskaya Gavan, Russia, during mooring maneuvers, The vessel sustained a dent, and the berth corner was chipped. An investigation is ongoing.

Struck while moored at the port, together with the, General cargo ship, Optima (IM0 9528691), which sustained damage in a previous ballistic missile attack, Russian shelling of Odesa port resulted in one death and eight injuries, damaging grain storage facilities and port infrastructure.
After a mechanical failure, the ship collided with the wharf in Woods Island Harbour, Nova Scotia. The bow visor sustained damage, and the vessel is expected to return to service by 9 December.
Experienced engine failure in Mersin, Turkiye, Departure was temporarily canceled by the harbor master pending repairs, which are ongoing as of 28 October.
Fire broke out in garage No. 6 while loading near Greece, Crew quickly extinguished the fire, and the vessel resumed sailing after inspections.

The Liberian-flagged cement carrier BLUE CIMENT 1 experienced engine failure while en route from Norway to ZONGULDAK. The Turkish General Directorate of Coastal Safety dispatched tugboats to aid the disabled vessel. The vessel BLUE CIMENT 1 experienced engine failure when it was traveling near the area of Anadolu Hisari on the Bosphorus Strait.
Ran aground due to a main engine failure in UK waters, Tugs assisted, and the vessel was moved to deep water for minor repairs before heading to Nab Anchorage under its own power.

The Port of DAKAR authorities reported on 17 October the collision between the PRINCESSE JESSICA and the MV ZOGRAFIA on the night of 15 October. This collision led to the PRINCESS JESSICA's capsizing. Fortunately, there were no casualties in the incident. The incident occurred on the night of 15 October at Pier 2 of the Port of DAKAR in Senegal. The vessel, PRINCESS JESSICA, which was docked at Pier 2, was struck by an approaching vessel, the Malta-flagged MV ZOGRAFIA. The MV ZOGRAFIA was reportedly headed to dock at Pier 3. The collision led to the sinking of the PRINCESSE JESSICA.

Struck while moored at the port, together with the, General cargo ship, NS Moon (IM0 8919855 ), which sustained damage in a previous ballistic missile attack, Russian shelling of Odesa port resulted in one death and eight injuries, damaging grain storage facilities and port infrastructure.
Total engine failure occurred while preparing for berthing at Port de Sorel, Quebec, Secured by crew and resumed operations after repairs.
Encountered a technical issue while traveling between Ullapool and Stornoway, UK, Departed Ullapool the same day after resolving the issue.

While en route from Colombo to Tanger Med, the ship berthed in Richards Bay, South Africa, after smoke was detected in one of the cargo holds. Although no flames were present, the temperature was controlled, and the ship remained off Richards Bay as of 26 September.

Engine failure occurred during the first voyage , A tug assisted, and the vessel passed through the Canakkale Strait, heading east, arriving at Tersan shipyard in Yalova, Turkiye, on 30 October for technical inspection and further repairs.

Became non-operational due to a broken fuel injector and fuse defects approximately 20 nm south of Selsey Bill, UK, Repairs were completed the same day, and the vessel resumed its journey without pollution reported.
The ship with 41 passengers suffered an engine failure while arriving at Aegina port, Greece. It proceeded to Perama port for repairs, which were expected to be completed by 15 September.
Allided with a quay in Helsingor, Denmark, Taken out of service and subsequently traveled to Landskrona, Sweden, for repairs, where it remained moored until departing on 20 October.
Mechanical failure caused the vessel to drift approximately 7 nm north-northeast of Cabo Penas, Northern Spain, Salvamar Rigel, dispatched by CCS Gijon, towed the vessel to Gijon port.

Experienced engine failure en route to Ikaria Island, Greece, Returned to Samos Island due to adverse weather; a crew member sustained injuries. Following inspection, the vessel sailed the same day with no pollution.
While transporting three cranes, accidentally knocked over a crane onshore. The onshore crane toppled over five containers in the port. Fortunately, there were no casualties in the accident.

Experienced engine shutdown and became non-operational approximately 11 nm west of Dunnet Head, UK, Additional engine issues were encountered shortly afterward. Repairs were completed, and the vessel proceeded through Pentland Firth with full power on 15 October

Fire engulfed vessel approximately 60 nm off the coast of Gansbaai, South Africa, Although the crew was safe, the vessel drifted on fire 57 nm south of Gansbaai. It is presumed sunk, and investigations are underway.

Lost its rudder and became disabled on Whitefish Bay near Gros Cap Bluffs, Ontario, Canada,The vessel remained anchored until a tug assisted. Undergoing repairs in Superior; no injuries, damage, or pollution occurred.

Exploded during a cargo transshipment operation. The fires were extinguished by the navy and coast guard, The two vessels, Captain Nikolas and B-LPG Sophia, were identified as involved in the incident. The incident highlights the need for improved safety standards on ships transporting oil and gas.

Exploded during a cargo transshipment operation. The fires were extinguished by the navy and coast guard, The two vessels, Captain Nikolas and B-LPG Sophia, were identified as involved in the incident. The incident highlights the need for improved safety standards on ships transporting oil and gas.
Ran aground near tetrapods while en route from Toyamashiko to Niigata, Japan, The vessel refloated independently the same day, with 16 crew onboard and no injuries, damage, or pollution reported.
En route from Port Vila, Vanuatu, to Melbourne, Australia, a fire was detected by a single smoke detector, with heavy smoke reported. The fire was extinguished, and an investigation is underway.
While maneuvering to berth for fueling, lost control and allided with the outside berth pier at Bizerte Marina, Tunisia, Damage reported to the keel and hull; an investigation is ongoing.
Suffered engine failure at Cape Akintiburnu in the Istanbul Strait, Turkiye, Crew was unable to repair, and the vessel was towed to Yenikapi Anchorage by tug Kurtarma-5. It remains stationary.

Collided with general cargo vessel Solikamsk at Istanbul Anchorage, Turkiye, Sustained damage to side shell plating above the waterline. Repairs are ongoing, with the vessel remaining stationary as of 3 November.
Technical failure occurred during the passage through Canakkale Strait, Turkiye, The vessel anchored at Karanlik Liman and later sailed out on 12 October after crew repairs.
Collided with general cargo vessel United S at Istanbul Anchorage, Turkiye, Initial inspections showed damage to both vessels' side shell plating above the waterline.
Experienced engine failure and power loss while anchored in Belfast Lough, UK, Two tugs escorted the vessel to deeper waters, with no pollution reported. Departed the following day

Mechanical failure occurred in the starboard main engine while en route to Piraeus, Greece, The vessel berthed in Piraeus, with sailing banned until repairs were completed. Departed Piraeus on 13 October.
Total engine failure took place while approaching Duke Point in NanaIMO, Canada, The maneuver was aborted, and the issue was resolved before reaching Tsawwassen Ferry Port on 13 October
Encountered engine trouble and anchored in Wellington Harbour, New Zealand, Tug assistance was requested but later canceled as the engine issue was resolved. Departed Wellington on 12 October.

Crew members evacuated to safety after vessel issued distress call to the USGC. She was caught in a fierce storm off the coast of Alaska but managed to anchor and stay in position. No casualties reported.
Ran aground on the left bank of the Parana River while carrying out anchoring maneuvers in Lagos harbor, Argentina, Refloated on 15 October with assistance from Resolve and Tsavliris tugs.
A woman was found dead after falling overboard the MSC VIRTUOSA on 12 October as the vessel was traveling from the Channel Islands to Southampton.
Reports of an explosion northeast of Kühlungsborn, Germany. All seven crew members were safely evacuated, but the engine room remained ablaze.
Experienced technical issues at Novorossiysk, Russia,Repairs were carried out by the crew, and after inspection, the vessel was cleared for departure, leaving on 14 October.

With 123 passengers onboard, this vessel experienced a mechanical failure in the port main engine while near Greece, Reached Poros at reduced speed and was later allowed to sail to Piraeus without passengers.

An explosion of a pressurized system in the engine room was reported while docked in Saint John Harbour, New Brunswick, Canada, Crew assessed damages, and repairs were scheduled, with the vessel remaining stationary as of 25 October.
Hit twice hy the Houthi militants in the Red Sea, causing minor damage. The attack occurred 73 nautical miles southwest of Yemen's Hodeidah port city.

Technical failure occurred at Derince, Turkiye, Repairs were completed with shore-based technical support, and the vessel was granted departure permission, sailing for Burgas, Bulgaria, on 17 October.
A generator fire broke out near Birch Point in Baie des Chaleurs, New Brunswick, Canada, The fire was extinguished, and the crew assessed damages before resuming the voyage.

JI ZHE 7 and the MIMITSU, were involved in a collision. The JIZHE 7 had departed from Hattaro Pier in Hachinohe City when strong winds blew the vessel back towards the pier.  MIMITSU was berthed at the Hattaro Pier at the time. There have been no oil spills or flooding reported from either of the vessels. The crews onboard both vessels are also reported to be unharmed.

Engine failure and power loss occurred near Kithira Island, Greece, The vessel was towed by Pro Tug 85-1 and temporarily altered its course toward Syros Island, departing from Syros Anchorage on 20 October.
Engine failure occurred while towing barge Bran6, approximately 31 nm south of St Albans Head in the English Channel, UK, The vessel resumed its journey on 10 October after resolving the issue.

Vessel was damaged during a Russian missile attack in the Odesa region on Wednesday — the third such casualty this week and the fifth in a month. In a statement on his Telegram channel, Ukrainian deputy prime minister Oleksiy Kuleba identified the vessel as the Panama-flagged, 1,679-teu Shui Spirit (built 2000).
The vessel's ramp fell into the water due to hydraulic system issues while docking at Brestova, Croatia, No injuries were reported, and efforts are underway to address the problem.
Lost propulsion in English Bay, British Columbia, Canada, while under pilotage and assisted by two tugs. The vessel was towed to Anchorage U for assessment.

JI ZHE 7 and the MIMITSU, were involved in a collision. The JIZHE 7 had departed from Hattaro Pier in Hachinohe City when strong winds blew the vessel back towards the pier.  MIMITSU was berthed at the Hattaro Pier at the time. There have been no oil spills or flooding reported from either of the vessels. The crews onboard both vessels are also reported to be unharmed.
A fire alarm activated due to a generator fire in zone 4 on the fire panel at Port Hedland, Australia, Power blacked out, but the engineer used a foam extinguisher to control the fire.
Contacted a wharf while berthing in Harbour, British Columbia, Canada, Both the vessel and port installations sustained damage; the vessel departed on 18 October.
Ran aground near Meloy, Norway, causing minor grounding with no leaks or pollution. The vessel moored in Heroy on 10 October.
Issue with the alarm monitoring system led to a temporary suspension of service on the Sconser-Raasay route in the UK, Departed on the same day once resolved.
Had a failure in its right main engine while docked at Piraeus, Greece, with 44 passengers onboard. The vessel sailed again from Psittalia on 11 September after repairs.
Experienced a technical failure at Iskenderun, Turkiye, Departure permission was canceled and later reinstated after repairs, with the vessel departing on 13 October.
Technical failure caused drifting in Biscay Bay en route from Fowey, UK, to Izmit, Turkiye, The crew completed repairs, and the vessel anchored near Tangier, Morocco, on 25 October.

Technical failure reported while vsl at the southern entrance of the Canakkale Strait, Turkiye, The vessel shifted to an anchorage north of Bozcaada Island under its own power, departing on 11 October after repairs.
Allided with a wharf while berthing in Picton, New Zealand, due to strong winds on 8 October 2024. No vessel damage, though a wharf fender required repairs.
Technical problems affected service between Nordhordland and Bergen, Norway, The vessel resumed service from Knarvik on 9 October.

Vessel ran aground in the Kylerhea Narrows, a narrow strait connecting the Isle of Skye and the mainland in Glenelg, Scotland. The HM Coastguard notified the crew and sent lifeboats, with the Spirit of Fred Olsen arriving first. The vessel was refloated and anchored at Glenelg Bay. The strait is known for strong currents.
Ran aground in shallow waters near Koichi Island, Matsuyama City, Ehime, Japan, No injuries or oil spills were reported, and a tugboat was on standby.

A ship carrying Ukrainian cargo, was damaged in a blast at Odesa port, killing a 60-year-old Ukrainian worker. The ship, managed by Greece-based Usta Shipping Co, is listed under the Novolog Terminal in Odesa. Five non-Ukrainian seafarers are receiving medical care.

A crane collapsed on vessel while at the PARADIP Port in Odisha, India, causing damage to the vessel and injuries to the crane operator. The incident took place at the mechanized bulk cargo berth while the crane was unloading cargo from the vessel AMNSI MAXIMUS. During the operation, the boom of the crane unexpectedly snapped and fell atop the vessel
Total failure of astern propulsion occurred while the vessel approached its anchorage in English Bay, BC, Canada, Departed on 19 October after repairs.
Technical failure reported at Samsun, Turkiye, led to the cancellation of departure permission. The crew began repairs, and the vessel departed on 9 October.
Technical failure reported while vsl at the northern entrance of the Canakkale Strait near Gelibolu, Turkiye, The vessel anchored at Gelibolu and sailed on 10 October.
Engine cooling system failure while vsl was off the coast of Espiguette, France, about 25 nm from Sete, The SNSM Sete lifeboat towed the vessel to Sete after a challenging 7-hour tow.

Ran aground while en route to Pontianak port. Authorities reported the incident and warned nearby vessels to maintain safety. The ship refloated the next morning and resumed its journey, partially laden, on October 6.
The vessel experienced a technical failure and anchored at Sinop anchorage, Turkiye, on 06 September. Repairs were carried out, and it sailed from the anchorage on 07 September.

Russian military attacked the Pivdennyi port in Ukraine, damaging the civilian ship, carrying 6,000 tons of Ukrainian corn for export. All 15 crew members, Egyptian and Syrian citizens, were unharmed.

Vessel caught fire near Telaga Punggur ferry terminal, all 17 crew members were unharmed and the fire was extinguished within four hours. The incident was reported by a nearby vessel, the crew evacuated with the help of various vessels,the fire is believed to have been caused by a short circuit on the ship's bridge.
Engine failure at Kepez point in the Canakkale Strait, Turkiye, on, The vessel was moved to a designated anchorage with tug assistance, remaining stationary as of 30 October.

Listed to port at 7-8 degrees due to water ingress in the cargo hold, 13 miles south of Tongyeong, Korea, Korean Coast Guard conducted a water-tightening operation, and the vessel arrived in Busan on the same day.
Collided with a chemical tanker off Kota Kinabalu, Malaysia, Sustained water ingress and lost containers; remains stationary in Kota Kinabalu as of 17 October.
In a laden condition, collided with a fully cellular containership off Kota Kinabalu, Malaysia, Departed Kota Kinabalu on 15 October after assessment.
Technical issue affected the Halsa-Kanestraum route in Norway, Route C was canceled, and the vessel resumed service on 8 October after technical repairs.
Partial collapse of a movable crane onto the main deck occurred at Mersin,  The vessel received permission to proceed to Yalova for repairs, departing on 16 October.
Allided with the wall of the new southern lock of the Kiel Canal in Brunsbuttel, Germany, Suffered minor scratches but continued sailing the same day.
Mechanical issue delayed a crossing from Port aux Basques, Newfoundland, to Sydney, Nova Scotia, The vessel arrived in North Sydney on 8 October.
Experienced a blackout due to an engine room electrical control panel failure, 54 nm northwest of Busum, Germany. Tug assistance was provided, and repairs were completed by 12 October.

Two crew workers suffered severe burns to their faces and hands as they were attempting to repair the fuel tank of the diesel icebreaker, KAPITAN KOSOLAPOV. The workers were rushed to the hospital and are reported to be in a stable condition.

Gas leak in the holds of the vessel, which was loaded with slag, while berthed at Copenhagen, Denmark. Due to the danger of an explosion, the vessel was cordoned off, and the hold was ventilated by authorities on the same day.

Ran aground on a reef off the coast of Upolu, Samoa, in position 14 01 28S, 171 49 32W. Caught fire, and evacuation was led by the commander. All crew members and persons on board were rescued and transferred to a rescue vessel. One lifeboat capsized, and two persons were injured

Fire broke out on the funnel stack at Potash Terminal, Teesport, UK. Engineers shut down the boilers, and fire services found no fire onboard. The vessel continued to load cargo and set to sail. No injuries or pollution.
Gyro compass and connection failure occurred at Novorossiysk, Russia, resulting in a temporary sailing ban. The crew completed repairs, and the vessel departed on 11 October.

During anchor maneuvering, experienced a power loss, drifted, and ran aground at Amasra inner port, Turkey. Re-floating works are ongoing. Damages are currently unknown. The vessel remains stationary at the grounding site.

Fire broke out on the tanker at the outer anchorage of Chittagong Port, Bangladesh, in position 22.11.36N, 091.46.50E. The general steward was deceased. Coast Guard rescued 46 people, 22 from the water and 24 from the tanker. One fatality was confirmed.

All sailings on the Tayinloan-Gigha UK route were canceled due to a technical issue affecting the turbocharger on the main engine. The shore engineer could not be transported to Gigha, where the vessel was berthed, due to weather conditions.
Engine damage led to a stoppage on the Elbe in Wewelsfleth, Germany, The vessel was towed by tugs to Hamburg, where it moored on 8 October. Departed on 16 October.
Propulsion issues limited the vessel to a reduced speed of 6.8 knots two days after departing Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, The vessel resumed normal speed the same day.
Declared a fault in one of two electric engines after anchoring off Piraeus, Greece, Inspection revealed both engines were out of order, and the master was arrested on 6 October.
A small fire broke out in cargo hold No. 2 while berthed at Wharf M-4 in Newcastle, Australia, The crew extinguished the fire, resulting in minor damage to a few cement bags but no injuries.
Ran aground near Frekhaug, Norway, while en route from Moerdijk, Netherlands, The vessel refloated and continued under its own power with NSSR lifeboat support. Departed for Bergen on 11 October.
Experienced a failure in navigation systems, charts, and other pertinent connections in Bartin, Turkiye, The crew completed repairs, and the vessel arrived at Constanta Anchorage on 8 October.

Experienced technical problems with the auxiliary engine, leading to a total blackout and failure of the main engine in waters north of Sakala Island, Sapeken Islands, Sumenep, Indonesia. Dropped anchor at position 06 28 51S, 116 14 42E.
A fire broke out on the upper deck near the stern in waters off Lasalimu, Indonesia, reportedly due to a cigarette butt. The crew extinguished the fire, and the vessel docked safely with no injuries.

Smoke was reported with five crew members onboard while en route for an operation approximately 30 nautical miles west of Kristiansund, Norway. The cause of the smoke was identified as heat from the exhaust pipe igniting furnishings in the skipper’s cabin. The crew was safe, and the vessel was towed to shore.

Two cargo vessels slightly collided off Istanbul’s Üsküdar district along the Bosporus on Thursday, causing material damage. One of the vessels drifted toward the coast following the collision. The ships were navigating closely off Istanbul's Üsküdar coast. The 80-meter cargo ship named AYED 1, traveling from Batumi, Georgia, to Saudi Arabia, and the 180-meter bulk carrier named BUNUN ACE, en route from Spain to Batumi, brushed against each other. The damaged ships will be towed to the Ahirkapı Anchorage Area.
Collided with a dock at BARRANQUILLA Port, Colombia, due to a mechanical failure. The ship sustained damage, including a punctured hull and ballast tanks, and its extent is being assessed for repair.

Two cargo vessels slightly collided off Istanbul’s Üsküdar district along the Bosporus on Thursday, causing material damage. One of the vessels drifted toward the coast following the collision. The ships were navigating closely off Istanbul's Üsküdar coast. The 80-meter cargo ship named AYED 1, traveling from Batumi, Georgia, to Saudi Arabia, and the 180-meter bulk carrier named BUNUN ACE, en route from Spain to Batumi, brushed against each other. The damaged ships will be towed to the Ahirkapı Anchorage Area.

Operating on the Arasvika-Hennset route between Heim and Aure, Norway, had a technical malfunction, leading to suspension of service. Moored in Hennset for repairs. The technical fault was still under repair as of 04 Oct 2024.

Barge Nautica 13, towed by tugboat TB Alpine Marine 13, collided in waters of Tanjung Buyut, Indonesia. Bow was struck by the barge during an STS transfer, causing a leak on the bow. Remains anchored off Tanjung Buyut
En route from Mortavika, allided with a ferry quay in Arsvagen, Bokn, Norway. No injuries reported. Sidelined for inspections but resumed service on 04 Oct 2024.
Broke anchor in rough seas, drifted, ran aground, and partially submerged north of Bhavnagar anchorage, India, Three tugs were deployed, and the vessel was refloated without injuries or pollution.

Collided with a sailing yacht in the North Sea near buoy No. 5 on Outer Elbe, approximately 5 nm WNW of the island of Scharhorn, Germany. The yacht sustained severe damage to its hull and rigging, while remained almost undamaged

Fire broke out in cargo hold 2. carrying scrap metal, the crew immediately called for help, and the Avon Fire and Rescue Service was called. The fire was contained, but the cause is yet to be determined. Hellas Confidence Ship Management confirmed that all crew members were safe and no environmental pollution was identified during the loading operation.

Experienced internal pipe damage on the way from Naantali, Finland, to Kapellskar, Sweden. Water flooded into the technical compartment in the forward section. Arrived and berthed in Kapellskar for repairs.

Suffered an engine blackout while entering a small lock of Kiel Canal in Brunsbuttel, Germany, and allided with the dolphins of Jetty 2, which were partially destroyed. Was towed to station pilings in the canal port of Brunsbuttel.

Collided with a barge (LLI 11066277), which was towed by a tug (LLI 13564558) at position 03 32 37S, 114 29 22E, while navigating a busy channel near Banjarmasin, Indonesia. The incident caused a leak in the stern post and damaged the forepeak tank.

Allided with a dolphin while transiting through Hutten Port towards Oslebshauser lock, Germany. Damaged over a length of approximately 30 meters on the port side foreship with a breach above the waterline. Banned from leaving the port.

Ran aground in Russia's Oblast region, causing a sandbar accident. The ship, carrying 14 Azerbaijani citizens, was not severely damaged. Local authorities refloated her without traffic incidents, and operations continue without significant delay.

Became unnavigable due to engine failure in Ago Bay, Japan. The issue occurred after slowing down to avoid a farmer near the route; problems arose when attempting to accelerate again. All 131 persons onboard were safe.

Ran aground while towing TK Kan I between Buoy No. 5 and 6, approximately 65 meters from the centerline of the northern channel in waters off Pontianak, Indonesia, at position 00 04 57.5N, 109 08 03.0E.

Serving the Castellammare-Capri route with around 200 passengers onboard. Experienced a technical issue during docking maneuvers, making slight contact with one of the piers at the main quay in the port of Marina Grande, Capri, Italy.
Serving on the Gourock-Dunoon route, UK. Removed from service for repairs to its exhaust. A single vessel timetable was operated by the ferry Ali Cat.

Experienced a blackout on board in position 51 15 17N, 001 49 13E, about 231 degrees from Interbank Buoy. The air system was charged to test the engine. Completed repairs and resumed voyage on the same day.

NUC due to a malfunctioning fuel pump in position 50 24 09N, 001 09 14W, south of the Isle of Wight, UK. No pollution was reported. Repairs were made to the fuel pump, and the vessel resumed its passage the same day.

Lost five empty containers (two yellow, three red) overboard while sailing along the west coast between Mossel Bay and Stillbaai, South Africa, Efforts to locate and recover the containers are ongoing, with a navigational warning issued.

Taiwanese authorities evacuated crew after it ran aground during a super typhoon on Orchid Island, Taiwan. The ship, carrying 39 tons of marine oil, 227 tons of fuel oil, and 67,500 tons of ore, was reportedly filled with oil.
Experienced a total steering system failure in the St. Lawrence River off Saint-Tite-des-Caps, Quebec, Canada, The crew carried out repairs while adrift, and the vessel resumed its voyage.

Reported NUC due to a crankcase problem on the port engine at position 55 45 51N, 005 12 34W, 3.5 nm north of Cock of Arran, UK. Attempted to get underway using the starboard engine. Escorted to Greenock by a tug.
Engine failure occurred at Marmara Ereglisi Anchorage, Türkiye,Crew repairs were unsuccessful. Tug Esenkiyi towed the vessel to Izmir, where it anchored on 21 November.

Crack found in the port-side propeller shaft of the port-side main engine during a propulsion check by a professional diver at the port of Gaios Paxos, Greece. Banned from sailing until repairs are completed.

Fire broke out due to an explosion on the bow while repairing at anchor at Dolphin Jetty 7 of Chattogram Port, Bangladesh. The fire was controlled, but 5 people were killed. Once the cargo is offloaded, the vessel will be moved for repair and overhaul.

Grounded in the waters of Linau, Indonesia, due to a leak in its hull. The ship, carrying 7,300 tons of iron ore, was traveling from Tapak Tuan, Aceh to Surabya. The captain decided to ground the vessel to prevent further damage. The UPP Linau is in contact with the crew to ensure safety.

Suffered a technical failure in Novorossiysk, Russia. Departure permission was temporarily canceled. Repairs were completed by the crew, verified by a state surveyor. The vessel sailed on 03 Oct 2024.

Broke free from its mooring while alongside in Tromsø, Norway. The rope attachment at the quay broke, causing the vessel to drift. A port tug was dispatched to tow the vessel back to its berth. The vessel sailed the same day.

Vessel targeted by the Houthis. Was hit by a missile 64 nautical miles northwest of Yemen's Hodeidah port. 'Maritime security firm Diaplous offered a different account of the incident, saying the ship in question suffered “severe damage” from a sea drone.'

At 05:00 GMT, a sea drone punctured a ballast tank of the 163,300-dwt tanker Cordelia Moon (built 2013) as it was sailing north-west of the Houthi-controlled port of Hodeidah in Yemen, the United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations (UKMTO) said on Tuesday. The damaged part of the ship is the port ballast tank No 6.'

Experienced an engine failure while en route from Singapore to Rotterdam. The Atlantic Maritime Prefect instructed the ship's owners to seek help from tugboat Abeille Bourbon. Abeille Bourbon secured the ship and towed it to Douarnenez Bay, where it remains anchored.

Three crew members are reported to have died in the explosion and subsequent fire that ripped through vessel in Bangladesh. The accident happened at Patenga on the River Karnaphuli in Chattogram on Monday morning.
All departures from Soby and Fynshav canceled due to technical problems after strong winds forced the vessel to remain in port at Soby, Denmark. Corrosion was detected in the battery system.

Lost propulsion and anchored at Herforlernna, a little north of Herfol marina, Norway. No injuries were reported. The vessel was towed to Skjaerhalden by a lifeboat. Remained stationary while the reserve vessel Skate Ternen was inserted.
In distress due to water ingress at position 33 50 31N, 034 23 10E. The vessel resumed its voyage to Tripoli, Lebanon, and arrived on 30 Sep under its own power, though at reduced speed.
Suffered engine failure near Pennant Point off Sambro, Nova Scotia, Canada, The vessel was towed into the harbor by the Canadian coast guard patrol ship Hare Bay.
Shortly after departing Naxos for Piraeus with 12 POB, damage was found to the port external water thruster near position 37 06 11N, 025 20 59E, Greece. The vessel berthed in Piraeus.

Suffered a blackout while transiting the Kiel Canal near Brunsbuttel oil port, Germany. Drifted diagonally across the fairway toward Brunsbuttel station dolphin. Tugs towed the vessel to the western end of the station. Sailed the same day.
Allided with an arrester wire between locks No. 4 and No. 5 in the Welland Canal, Ontario, Canada, The vessel was secured in lock No. 4, and damage was assessed.
Drifted from the berth while under repair in Ampelakia, Greece. Came into contact with an adjacent port tug, which subsequently allided with the wharf. Position: 37 57 16N, 023 33 23E.

Hit a coral potato off the coast of Hitia'a, French Polynesia, approximately 50 meters from a reef on 30 September 2024. Major engine failure required the vessel to remain stationary in Papeete for an estimated six-month repair period.
Engine failure occurred during the westbound transit of the Kiel Canal at the Duckerswisch switch, Germany. The vessel was towed to Brunsbuttel and berthed at pilings in the canal port.

Experienced technical failure while transiting the Canakkale Strait, Turkiye. Shifted to Karanlik Liman anchorage under its own power. Repairs were done by the crew, and the vessel sailed the same day.

An electrical fire broke out while the vessel was proceeding in Johnstone Strait off Port Neville, BC, Canada, on 28 September 2024. The crew extinguished the fire and assessed the damage before resuming the voyage.
In ballast condition, suffered a technical failure and sought shelter, dropping anchor at Datca Anchorage, Turkiye. Sailed from Datca on 01 Oct 2024.
Suffered a technical failure at position 42 03 00N, 036 13 00E, Turkiye. Dropped anchor at Sinop Anchorage. The crew carried out repairs, and the vessel sailed out of Sinop on 02 Oct.
Allided with the wharf while leaving Oita Port, Japan. The incident occurred at position 33 14 53.1N, 131 46 29.0E. The extent of the damage to both the hull and the wharf is unknown.
Collided with the tug PLOTOVOD-610 towing Barge No.1501 on the Volga River near Narimanov, Astrakhan, Russia. A hole was detected above the waterline, though no casualties were reported.

Suffered a technical failure while transiting the Canakkale Strait at Nara Point, Turkiye. Shifted to Karanlik Liman anchorage under its own power for repairs. Sailed from Istanbul anchorage the same day.
Ran aground in shallow waters off Bakirkoy anchorage, Istanbul, Turkiye. Refloated with assistance from tugs. Must pay salvage expenses.

Experienced a structural failure in cargo compartments and relevant spaces during cargo discharge operations at Hereke, Turkiye. Repairs were underway. The vessel was moored on 29 Sep and sailed on 02 Oct.

With 383 passengers on board, experienced a malfunction in the port-side main engine while in position 36 31 20N, 028 06 32E, Greece. The vessel sailed under its own power back to Rhodes, where passengers disembarked.
Had engine trouble while serving on the Gjermundshamn - Varaldsoy - Arsnes route, Norway. Service was canceled by the operator, and the vessel berthed in Gjermundshamn.

Experienced engine issues northwest of Ushant Island, France, near position 48 41 30N, 005 40 00W. The vessel was taken under tow by the firefighting tug Abeille Bourbon en route to Douarnenez Bay for repairs.
Suffered a total electrical system failure while docked in Paspebiac, Quebec, Canada,  Repairs were carried out, and the vessel sailed on 27 September.

Emitted smoke while drifting near the AOR border between Norway and the UK at position 60 16 52N, 002 02 10E. All 5 crew members were safe. The fire reignited the next day, and the vessel was deemed a total loss.
Operating on the Tarbert to Portavadie route, UK, had an overheated generator issue. The service was suspended pending investigations and repairs
Operating on the Svendborg - Drejo route, Denmark, canceled several departures on 26 Sep due to the need for immediate repairs. Departures from Svendborg, Skaro, and Drejo were canceled.
Vessel reported dragging its anchor about 3.50 NM south of Clover Point, near Constance Bank, British Columbia, Canada. The vessel was repositioned and re-anchored.
Ongoing issue with the prop shaft serving the Troon-Brodick route, UK, caused cancellation of departures from Troon and Brodick. Sailed from Troon on 27 Sep 2024.
Unloading boom damaged by loading chute at CN Dock 6 in Duluth, USA. Fully loaded vessel remained at Duluth Port Terminal 1 for further service since it could no longer unload itself
Ran aground in Geiranger due to a technical failure. Lost control while docking and ran into rocks near the old ferry quay. Refloated and scheduled for towing to a workshop the following week.

Required essential repairs to the forward main engine on 25 Sep 2024. Repairs completed on 26 Sep during the night. Departures from Barra and Eriskay were subject to potential disruption or cancellation on 27 Sep.

Engine power loss occurred while en route from Averoy to Norwegian fish farms, Norway. Drifting in position 64 05 50N, 009 37 30E. Tug assistance was requested, and the vessel was underway again as of 26 Sep.

Serving the Kennacraig-Islay route, experienced cracks in the finger flaps of the stern ramp. A 5-tonne weight limit was imposed to protect the ramp. The vessel arrived in Troon on 25 Sep for repairs.

Suffered a blackout affecting generators and two main engines while berthing at Kyllini Port, Greece, with 223 passengers, 50 cars, and 3 buses on board. The vessel drifted and rested its bow in shallow waters but was freed under its own power. Sailed the same day
Operating between Tjotta and Forvik, Norway, experienced a hydraulic issue that led to the cancellation of its sailing on 24 Sep 2024. Sailed from Tjotta the same day.

Suffered a failure of its mechanisms, and the crew of tug Fanagoriya prevented it from alliding with the embankment berth in Rostov-on-Don, Russia. The tug subsequently allided with the wall of a summer veranda restaurant.

Fire broke out in the superstructure, accommodation block, poop deck, and steering gear room in position 41 19 00N, 029 51 00E off Sile, Turkiye. The fire was extinguished, and the vessel was moved to Eregli shipyard as of 02 Oct 2024.
Royal Caribbean announced unplanned maintenance due to mechanical issues while docked in the USA. The vessel canceled its stop in St. Thomas, and repairs were scheduled to continue for several days

Experienced a technical failure at Karasu, Turkiye. Departure permission was temporarily canceled by the Harbour Master. The crew and shore-based technical support carried out the necessary repairs. The vessel sailed on 24 Sep
Technical problems led to the cancellation of two departures between Soby and Faaborg, Denmark. The vessel sailed from Soby on 24 Sep.

Delayed in returning to Ardrossan-Brodick service due to an issue with its port-side gearbox. Operators confirmed the vessel would remain out of service for at least another 10 days as of 02 Oct 2024.
Fire occurred inside the funnel while departing from the port of Genoa, Italy,The fire was contained, and the vessel was cleared to depart on 24 October, arriving in Palermo on 25 October.

Operating on the Osnas-Ava route, Finland, the vessel had technical problems on 23 Sep that forced it to operate at reduced speed, preventing it from sailing as scheduled. The operator announced repairs were completed on 26 Sep
Experienced engine failure approximately 18 kilometers off Point Nepean. Svitzer Albatross and Tingari assisted, and the vessel was under tow into the Port of Melbourne.

Experienced engine issues while at Caribou Harbour, Canada, on 23 Sep 2024. No ferry service was operating on the Northumberland Strait connecting Prince Edward Island and Nova Scotia. The vessel was expected to return no earlier than 19 Oct.
Disabled approximately 20 NM northwest of Cape Prior, in Ferrol, after a fishing net became entangled in its propeller. Sar Gavia was towing the vessel to A Coruna. ETA was 24 Sep.
An electrical fire occurred in the accommodations while secured in position 54 19 09N, 130 16 07W, in Prince Rupert, British Columbia, Canada. The crew contained the fire and assessed the damage.

Sailings on the Smage-Orta-Finnya-Sandoya-Ona route were cancelled due to a technical problem. A passenger boat was inserted on the connection. The vessel remained sidelined in Finnoy, Norway, the same day.

Technical failure while operating between Bodo and Gildeskal, Norway, led to the vessel being taken out of service for repairs. The operator deployed a smaller ferry, Nordic Lady, on 24 Sep. The vessel sailed from Bodo on 03 Oct.

En route from Bergen, the vessel struck a power cable in Sognefjord, Norway. The extent of the damage caused to the cable is not yet known. Investigations are underway. The vessel sailed to Ardalstangen where the police questioned the crew before continuing its voyage.

Mechanical damage occurred to the port main engine while approaching Kyllini, Greece, with 79 passengers and their vehicles. The vessel sailed under its own power to the port of Kyllini and completed repairs.

While in ballast condition, the vessel experienced a technical failure and sheltered at Cesme, Turkiye, where it dropped anchor. The crew conducted repairs, and the vessel sailed from Cesme on 28 Sep.
Mechanical issues led to the cancellation of trips from Hamilton to Dockyard and from Dockyard to Hamilton, Bermuda, on 23 Sep.

A technical failure occurred north of the Canakkale Strait at position 40 32 00N, 027 06 05E. The crew conducted temporary repairs, and the vessel resumed its voyage under its own power. It berthed in Tuzla shipyard for permanent repairs on 23 Sep.

Allided with Vicentin dock in San Lorenzo, Argentina, due to adverse weather conditions. The vessel allided with the dock using its port-side bow, affecting the dock hopper, gangway, and conveyor belt. It sailed out on 29 Sep.

Collided with customs vessels moored at Quay E in Port Louis, Mauritius. Several Mauritius Revenue Authority vessels were damaged. The captain indicated that a failure in the engine automation system caused the incident.

While nearing Nansha Phase III terminal, China, and arriving from Hong Kong on its maiden voyage, the vessel collided with fully cellular containership Vladivostok (IMO 9130145). It was anchored at Nansha and remained stationary as of 30 Sep.

With 30 POB, allided with the Great Yarmouth south breakwater, causing minimal damage to paintwork. The incident occurred in position 52 34 12N, 001 44 29E, UK. The vessel was taken back to investigate alongside in Great Yarmouth and sailed on 22 Sep.

Ran aground in position 08 04 52.8S, 119 05 09.5E, approximately 30 nm from Bima Harbour, Indonesia, while en route from Dili, East Timor, to Bima, West Nusa Tenggara. The vessel had a leak in Ballast 2, and Bima authorities coordinated the incident.

During loading and unloading operations at Nansha Phase III terminal, China, collided with fully cellular containership De Xin Shang Hai (IMO 1061843). Three containers were lost in the water and recovered on 22 Sep. The vessel sailed on 26 Sep.

Experienced a technical failure while passing through the Istanbul Strait, Turkiye. It was shifted to Turkeli Anchorage under the supervision of a strait pilot and an attended tug. An investigation file was placed by the Harbour Master, and the vessel remained stationary at Turkeli Anchorage.

Experienced a technical failure during passage through the Canakkale Strait at Kumkale Point, Turkiye. The vessel was shifted to Karanlik Liman Anchorage under its own power, supervised by a strait pilot. Repairs were ongoing, and the vessel sailed on 23 Sep.

En route from Mykonos to Syros, Tinos, and Piraeus, Greece, with 26 POB, experienced mechanical damage to the starboard main engine in the maritime area SW of Tinos, approximately in position 37 31 00N, 025 08 00E. Sailed to Piraeus under its own power, but sailing was subsequently banned.

En route from Samsun, Turkiye, to Rostov-na-Donu, Russia, experienced a technical failure and sheltered at Sinop anchorage. Repairs were carried out by the crew, and the vessel sailed from Sinop on 22 Sep.
Experienced engine failure in position 34 27 12.0N, 006 42 06.0W, approximately 7 miles from the coast of Morocco. The vessel anchored, and the company is addressing the issue.

While docked at Martapura Baru Port, Banjarmasin, Indonesia, two workers were injured due to an issue with the crane. Preliminary findings indicate a mechanical failure of the crane. Investigations are ongoing.

Experienced a technical failure of the navigation system, including nautical charts and related equipment, at Eregli, Turkiye. After repairs, the vessel was granted departure permission and sailed from Eregli on 24 Sep.

En route from Tsingeli, Greece, to Tuzla, Turkiye, experienced a technical failure during passage through the Canakkale Strait at Kumkale Point. The vessel shifted to Karanlik Liman Anchorage under its own power, and repairs were initiated by the crew.

Collided with one of two country fishing vessels, causing damage to the vessel and fishnets, in position 08 37 24N, 078 18 27E, approximately 9 nm southeast of Tuticorin Port, India. The vessel strayed from its course, ran over fishnets, and damaged 30 nets. It did not stop to offer assistance.

A Russian missile strike has damaged infrastructure and vessel in the Ukrainian port of Odesa, the regional governor said on Friday. Four people were wounded in the airstrike, Governor Oleh Kiper said on the Telegram messaging app.

Under the conduct of a pilot and assisted by tugs for berthing, the vessel experienced an astern propulsion failure in position 54 13 59N, 130 20 12W, in Prince Rupert, Canada. The crew assessed the issue, and the vessel sailed from Prince Rupert on 26 Sep.

Experienced a supply failure one hour into the scheduled voyage to Cherbourg, France, in position 52 31 29N, 001 50 51E, UK. The vessel was forced to turn back and arrived at Richard's Dry Dock in Great Yarmouth. Repairs were expected to take 10 days.

While anchored in the Madura Strait, Rede Waters of Surabaya, collided with YULIAN 88, which had drifted uncontrollably, in position 07 10 00S, 112 42 00E, Indonesia. The vessel sustained a tear in its left side hull. No injuries or pollution were reported.

Carrying 20,000 liters of diesel fuel, the vessel allided with a reef, ran aground, and sank off the coast of Greenland near Nanortalik, in position 60 09 14N, 045 13 00W. Up to 20,000 liters of fuel were spilled.

En route from Bandirma, Turkiye, to Koper, Slovenia, the ship suffered a technical failure at the northern entrance of Canakkale Strait. It was anchored at Gelibolu and resumed sailing on 20 September after repairs.

Due to a mechanical breakdown, the vessel's operations were halted, leaving Whalsay’s ferry service with only one functioning vessel. As of this date, the ship remains stationary in Symbister, UK, awaiting repairs.

En route from Nemrut Bay to Tuzla, experienced a technical failure at the southern entrance of Bozcaada Island, Turkiye. Temporary repairs were carried out by the crew, and the vessel was expected to arrive at Tuzla shipyard for permanent repairs on 21 Sep.
Due to mechanical problems, the vessel was sidelined in Cullivoe, UK, resulting in the Bluemull Sound ferry service being reduced to a single vessel on 10 Sep 2024.
Ran aground while navigating near Lock No.11 on the White Sea-Baltic Canal in Russia. The ship veered beyond the shipping channel and ran aground. Investigations into the incident are ongoing.

The vessel’s EPIRB was activated in position 43 22 09N, 064 07 01W, 40.80 nm southeast of Port Joli Head, due to a total engine failure. It was disabled off Shelburne and towed to Sambro by the CG vessel HARE BAY. The vessel sailed from Sambro on 23 Sep.

Came into contact with two other vessels alongside at berth 52 of the port of Constanta while maneuvering near the berth in position 44 09 03N, 028 38 43E, Romania. No injuries, pollution, or material damage were reported.

Experienced a technical failure of the navigation system along with forecastle deck maneuvering units at Novorossiysk, Russia. Repairs were completed, and the vessel sailed from Novorossiysk on 23 Sep.

En route from Bilbao, Spain, to Liverpool, UK, with 14 POB, experienced a fuel injector failure on station one in position 49 44 36N, 005 55 26W, approximately 17 nm southeast of the Isles of Scilly. Repairs were completed, and the vessel resumed its voyage the same day.

Experienced a power loss while sailing off the southern coast of Wellington in Cook Strait, New Zealand. The ship drifted for approximately two hours in position 41°22'18''S, 174°40'27''E before being towed back to Wellington. It was detained on 27 September but released the following day.

Came into contact with a fishing vessel around 22 NM from Con Dao, Vietnam. The fishing boat sank, leading to 12 crew members being rescued, one confirmed fatality, and one missing person. The vessel arrived at Vung Tau Anchorage on 21 September.

Collided with bulk carrier Rizabey (IMO: 9197117) at the Alpha Outer Anchorage of Chittagong Port in Bangladesh. Local agents and P&I clubs are managing the aftermath. The vessel sailed from its anchorage position on 20 September.

Allided with a wind turbine at the Hornsea 1 wind farm, located off England’s east coast. The vessel, with 72 people on board, sustained damage above the waterline and was berthed in Dunkirk for repairs on 24 September.
Experienced a chipped propeller approximately 46 NM northeast of Ly Son Island, Vietnam, posing a risk of further damage. The Coast Guard towed the vessel to the mainland for repairs on 18 September.

An engine room explosion occurred while the vessel was 490 NM off the Isles of Scilly, resulting in the death of the second engineer. After repairs to the main engines, the vessel continued its voyage toward Montoir, France, on 19 September.
Smoke was detected in cargo hold 3 during unloading operations in Kwinana, Australia. Fire teams responded promptly, extinguishing the smoke. An inspection revealed no damage to the vessel.
Ran aground approximately 200 meters from the shoreline off Barangay Tilik, Occidental Mindoro, Philippines. The hull sustained flattening on one side. The ship was successfully refloated.
The ship with 12 crew members experienced engine failure and was swept ashore by strong waves near Koh Mai Si, Thailand. It grounded on rocks, suffering damage to its starboard side hull.

Collided with a ship-to-shore crane at Yantian Port in southern China, causing operations to be suspended. The crane collapsed onto the ship, causing some containers to fall into the sea. No injuries were reported.
Listed while in the port of Vigo, Spain, and required tug assistance to regain stability. The ship hit a portion of the dock before stabilizing, with further assistance waiting for the tide to rise.

Collided with vessel Benua 999 (IMO: 8597712) in Indonesian waters. The vessel sustained damage on its right side, from the bridge to the stern, while under anchor. Authorities continue to monitor the situation, with no injuries reported.

Technical issues affecting the navigation systems and alarms occurred while the vessel was in Tuapse, Russia. Departure was temporarily cancelled, but repairs were completed, and the vessel sailed on 17 September

While towing a pontoon barge, the vessel suffered an engine failure and dangerously drifted under a bridge in the Canakkale Strait, Turkiye. It was towed to Sevketiye anchorage for repairs, with its departure postponed until it was seaworthy.

Took on water while off the coast of Sinop, Turkiye. The ship was towed to Sinop anchorage and granted a single voyage permission. It resumed its journey on 27 September and arrived in Eregli on 30 September, where it remains stationary.

A malfunction with the fuel pump occurred while the ship was in position 37°53'51.1''N, 23°34'08.8''E near Piraeus, Greece. The issue was resolved, and the ship continued its journey from the Piraeus Anchorage on the same day.

While serving on the Oban-Craignure, UK route, the vessel had an issue with the sewage plant. The scheduled departure from Oban was delayed, but after the issue was resolved, the vessel sailed the same day.
The vessel anchored at Datca, Turkiye, for repairs after suffering a technical issue. The crew carried out the necessary work, and the ship resumed its journey later the same day.

Operating between Piraeus, Aegina, and Agistri, the ship with 145 passengers and 23 cars experienced a mechanical fault while docked at Piraeus, Greece. The passengers were forwarded to their destinations via alternative transportation arranged by the operator.

A 7-night Southern Caribbean cruise departing from San Juan, Puerto Rico, was cancelled after one of the vessel’s lifeboats was damaged. The lifeboat could not be repaired or replaced in time for the scheduled cruise.
Experienced technical problems while operating on the Bodo-Sandnessjoen route in Norway. Sailings were cancelled, and the ship remained out of service in Bodo as of 16 September.
Technical problems in the navigation system were detected while at Novorossiysk, Russia. The crew repaired the system, and the vessel was granted departure permission, sailing on 16 September.

Collided with a fishing vessel 8 km south of Matsushima Island, Hyogo Prefecture, Japan. None of the crew on the vessel were injured, but the master of the fishing vessel suffered serious injuries. The vessel arrived in Himeji on 14 September.
The vessel encountered a technical issue affecting its engine while on the Lochboisdale-Mallaig route in the UK. Following investigations, the ship sailed from Lochboisdale on 15 September.
The navigation system and alarms malfunctioned while the vessel was docked in Novorossiysk, Russia. Departure was delayed, and repairs were completed before the ship sailed on 19 September.
Ran aground about 100 meters off the coast near Amami Setosaki Lighthouse in Kagoshima Prefecture, Japan, while attempting to evade the winds and waves of an incoming typhoon.

A technical issue occurred while the vessel was carrying 20 people on board in position 50°23'30''N, 000°51'17''W, approximately 20 NM south of Selsey Bill, UK. The issue was resolved, and the ship continued its voyage.

Suffered a power failure after shutting down the main engine to investigate an exhaust deviation alarm. The vessel was not under command in position 56°38'48"N, 0°06'18"E, UK. Ongoing repairs were made, and it resumed its voyage on 14 September.

Serving the Jektevik-Nordhuglo-Hodnanes route in Norway, the ship was taken out of service due to a battery pack issue. The vessel remained sidelined in Jektevik for troubleshooting, suspending the service temporarily.
In ballast condition, the ship experienced a technical failure and took shelter by anchoring at Finike, Turkiye. Repairs were made by the crew, and the vessel sailed from Finike on 16 September.

While trying to moor at the Port of Yokohama, Japan, the vessel sustained hull damage after it allided with the wharf. The vessel resumed its journey to Tokyo on 15 September. The extent of damage to the berth remains unconfirmed
Ran aground near Kilang Mandiri Beach in Balikpapan City, Indonesia, due to large waves breaking the cargo rope, causing the vessel to list. The crew was safely rescued.

A Russian missile strike on a Greek-operated bulk carrier off Romania has been condemned internationally, marking the first confirmed strike on a merchant ship in the Black Sea this year. The ship was carrying grain bound for Egypt. Ukrainian president Zelenskyy and US ambassador to Ukraine condemned the incident, urging Russia to stop commercial ship attacks.

A 15-strong crew was rescued off South Africa's southern Cape seas after their supply vessel, caught fire. Two vessels, Angelic Peace and Thunderbird, responded, and PetroSA helicopter helped retrieve eight seafarers.

Overturned at Hasslo Yard in Hasslo, Sweden. Although there were personnel from the shipyard and the shipping company onboard, no injuries were reported. The vessel was tilting 20 degrees on the slipway of the yard.

Experienced a technical failure while passing under the bridge at the northern entrance of the Canakkale Strait, Turkiye. The ship was shifted to Gelibolu anchorage under its own power for repairs and sailed the following day.
Encountered a technical issue affecting the port main engine while serving on the Kennacraig-Islay route. The issue was resolved, and the vessel departed from Port Askaig.

Vessel had a technical failure at Novorossiysk, Russia. After repairs by the crew, the state surveyor re-inspected the vessel, verified the repairs, and granted departure permission. The vessel departed from Novorossiysk on 13 Aug.

A broken hydraulic pipe in the steering gear caused the ship to divert course abruptly to starboard in the middle of the south-westbound lane near the UK. Repairs were made, and the vessel arrived in Jorf Lasfar anchorage on 17 September.

Experienced engine issues southeast of Las Palmas, Gran Canaria, and had to be towed by the pollution control vessel Miguel de Cervantes. The ship berthed at Las Palmas on 13 September and sailed again on 23 September.

Carrying 20,000 tons of ammonium nitrate, is seeking permission to repair at Lithuania's Klaipeda port after experiencing damage to its propeller, hull, and rudder. The local port authority is assessing the application.

Vessel caught fire and sank near Lido del Sole, Olbia, Italy. Sixteen persons onboard were safely evacuated. The blaze, which spread from the aft portion of the vessel, was extinguished by the tug Mascalzone Scatenato.

Suffered an engine failure and power loss off Sulina, Romania. The tug Tedy (IMO: 9059200) started towing the ship on 27 September, bound for a shipyard in Unye, Turkiye. The estimated time of arrival is 4 October.
Collided with a fishing vessel approximately 10.25 NM east-northeast of Son Tra Cape, Da Nang City, Vietnam. The fishing vessel sank, but all crew members were rescued and safe.

After a blackout, the vessel ran aground in Skatestraumen in Nordfjord, Norway. The vessel continued under its own power toward Floro for damage inspection and sailed from Gunhildvagen the following day.

A fire broke out in the engine room while the ship was moored at Ishigaki Port, Japan. The engine room was unoccupied at the time of the fire, which was extinguished after three hours. The cause is under investigation.

The vessel ran aground on the shallows near Birou Island, Kochi Prefecture, Japan. The vessel refloated the same day, with all four crew members safe. No oil spills, injuries, or damage were reported.

During departure maneuvers in Delos, Greece, and after a gust of wind, the vessel made contact with passenger vessel Zefyros (IMO: 9837078), slightly scraping the antifouling paint. The vessel’s seaworthiness was not affected.

Fire broke out aboard the vessel in position 50°06'12.7"N, 005°32'39.9"W near Newlyn, UK. Cornwall Fire & Rescue extinguished the fire. One person suffered smoke inhalation. Reports indicated that the master and the casualty were under the influence of alcohol.

South African authorities are investigating an oil spill from an MSC Mediterranean Shipping Company container vessel, in Algoa Bay. The spill, believed to have originated from the vessel, has left oil-like blobs in the water and an oily sheen.

The vessel experienced a cooling system leak while located in position 49°53'48"N, 005°13'51"W, 5 NM south of Lizard Point, UK. It was declared not under command (NUC) but completed repairs and resumed its journey the same day.

The bulk carrier was left dead in the water 1.7 NM northwest of Apo Island due to mechanical issues with its controllable pitch propeller (CPP), which caused a loss of propulsion. The vessel was towed to a safe area.
The vessel experienced total engine failure while anchored off Port Weller, Canada. The crew addressed the issue, and the vessel sailed to Hamilton with tug assistance for berthing.

The master reported that the vessel was unable to provide its scheduled service from Dapia, Spetses to Kosta, Argolis, Greece, after damage to the port main engine. The Spetses Port Authority prohibited the vessel from sailing until repairs were completed.

Ran aground while navigating the Sulina Channel in Romania, position 45°10'37"N, 029°16'07"E. Tug Sulina 2 was unable to refloat the vessel. A second tug, Galati, arrived to assist on 11 September. The vessel remained aground as of 12 September, with no injuries or pollution reported

Allided with the 17th Street Bridge in Fort Lauderdale, Florida. The vessel drifted with the outgoing tide and struck two protective arms of the bridge on the starboard side. The exact cause remains unclear, with a suspected power loss.

Collided with passenger vessel Orca (IMO: 8744054) in the port of Delos, Greece. The vessel sustained damage to its left side rails, and the Port Authority of Mykonos prohibited its departure until a seaworthiness certificate was issued.
failure at Kepez Point in the Canakkale Strait, Turkiye. The vessel was towed to e on 26 September.Karanlik Liman Anchorage and later sailed on 25 September, reaching Istanbul AnchoragSuffered engine
During mooring maneuvers, vessel collided with a wharf in Rhodes, Greece. The starboard float above the waterline was slightly damaged. The Rhodes Port Authority banned the vessel from sailing.

Explosion and fire at the SN Corporation shipbreaking yard in Chattogram. A 38-year-old man died, and 12 people were injured. Operations at the yard have been suspended due to violations of environmental clearance conditions.
Smoke was detected, activating two smoke detectors in the valet area on Deck 2. The fire in a dryer drum was extinguished, and the cause was identified as a bathrobe and other textile materials.

Collided with the bulk carrier Young Harmony (IMO 9686546) at Alpha Outer Anchorage of Chittagong Port Authority, Bangladesh, causing some structural damage. The local agents are handling the matter, and the vessel remained stationary in the same position as of 23 Sep.
Collided with general cargo vessel Knidos (IMO: 9214173) in the Persian Gulf. The vessel sustained limited structural damage and rescued the crew of Knidos, which later sank.
Reported an oil spill near Phuket deep-sea port, Thailand, due to an improperly closed port-side oil valve. The spill was contained, and the vessel sailed on the same day.
While towing a barge in Johnstone Strait, Canada, the vessel experienced a steering system failure. It was eventually towed to Bellingham, USA, by the tug Capt.Cae.

Experienced a technical failure at the northern entrance of the Istanbul Strait and anchored at Turkeli andAnchorage under its own power. The vessel remained at anchor while repairs were Odongoing  reached esUkraine, on 21 a, September.
Withdrawn from the Reinoya-Hansnes route in Norway due to technical problems. The vessel sailed from Hansnes later that day after repairs.

Collided with part of a quay while turning around at the ferry berth in Omo, Denmark. The rack holding the liferaft at the stern was broken, and the vessel sailed to Svendborg for repairs, where the broken rack was welded.

The vessel broke free from its moorings and drifted within the port waters of Olbia, Italy. The tug Alessandro Onoraoto assisted in bringing it back to its berth. The vessel later sailed out of Olbia the same day.

The vessel suffered a leak and lost electrical power while off the port of Rosas, Spain. The rescue vessel Salvamar Lyra assisted in controlling the leak, and the vessel was towed to Rosas port on 09 September.

Lost its propeller, causing a spill of hydraulic oil off Canada's West Coast. was taken out of service due to a propulsion system issue. Divers discovered the starboard propeller had "sheared off" from its shaft, releasing 800 litres of hydraulic oil into the water.
Went missing while anchoring in Hang Bo Nau, Vietnam, during a storm. The vessel sank, and one body was initially recovered. Divers later retrieved two more bodies from the wreck on 12 September.

The vessel experienced technical failure while passing through the Canakkale Strait near Kepez Point. Tug and fast rescue boats attended, and the vessel was moved to Karan Liman Anchorage. Temporary repairs were completed, and the vessel berthed at a repair pier in Tuzla on 11 September

The vessel experienced engine failure while transiting the Istanbul Strait, Turkiye. A safety tug, fast rescue boat, and a duty pilot were appointed to secure the vessel. It anchored at Yenikapi Anchorage and later sailed from Istanbul on 09 September.
The pollution prevention system, including alarm units, failed at Tuapse, Russia. The vessel's departure was delayed until repairs were completed. It sailed from Tuapse Anchorage on 11 September.

Dragged anchor and collided with bulk carrier Friendly Islands (IMO 9615042) at Alpha Anchorage near Chattogram, Bangladesh. Both vessels' propellers became stuck but were freed, and the vessels eventually sailed out of the port on 21 September.
Collided with bulk carrier Navios Celestial (IMO 9496226) after Navios Celestial dragged anchor at Alpha Anchorage, Chattogram. The vessels were freed and sailed out on 22 September.
Experienced a mechanical fault while at Horta, Azores, Portugal. The vessel required intervention by the manufacturer’s technicians and remained out of service at Horta as of 13 September.

The vessel had a fire in the starboard engine fuel system in the engine room in the UK. The starboard side main engine was damaged. The vessel departed Greenock on 22 Aug and later arrived in Oban. Sailing was canceled due to a technical issue on 23 Aug. Repairs were completed, and the vessel sailed on 24 Aug.

The product tanker collided with bulk carrier Fu Tong in the waters of Nongsa, Batam City, Indonesia, due to a lack of communication. No information on vessel damage. The vessel continued its journey._

Suffered engine failure approximately 5 NM north of the Istanbul Strait. The crew performed temporary repairs, and the vessel shifted to Turkeli anchorage under its own power. It sailed on 07 September.
Withdrawn from service on the Lavik-Oppedal route in Norway due to a charging issue. A ferry from the Dragsvik-Hella-Vangsnes route was used as a substitute. The vessel sailed again on 07 September
Ran aground while sailing between San Nicolas and Ramallo on the River Parana, Argentina. After 12 hours, the vessel was refloated by the tug Candela S on 07 September and later arrived in San Pedro.
Allided with shoreside equipment while berthing at Port Moody, British Columbia, Canada. The vessel was secured, and damages were assessed before it sailed out of Port Moody on 09 September.
Distress signal received from Western South Atlantic. Vessels in the vicinity requested to assist if possible

Suffered a mechanical issue while docking at Jack Layton Terminal in Toronto, Canada. The crew performed an emergency stop, and the vessel allided with the dock. It was removed from service for repairs.

Had an emergency when the 6th cylinder of its main engine failed, forcing the crew to stop the engine while in the Kara Sea, Russia. The vessel dropped anchor, and the salvage vessel Murman began towing it to Murmansk on 19 September, with the vessel reaching port on 27 September.

Encountered a technical failure near the southern entrance of the Canakkale Strait. Tug Turkeli provided an escort. The vessel continued to Tuzla Shipyard and later sailed from Tuzla Anchorage on 07 September
Collided with the product tanker Maia (IMO 9417050) while navigating the River Don near Azov, Russia. No casualties or oil spills were reported, and an investigation is ongoing.

With 2,610 passengers onboard, the vessel made contact with a small piece of ice on its starboard side while navigating Tracy Arm Fjord, USA. The vessel sustained minimal damage and was inspected by a smaller vessel before continuing to Skagway without delay
Vessel ran aground on the right bank of the Sulina Channel, Romania. A refloating operation was successful, and the vessel sailed from Sulina on 06 September.
While navigating the River Don, the product tanker Maia collided with another vessel (IMO 8842583) near Azov, Russia. No casualties or spills occurred, and an investigation is underway.

Vessel experienced a power loss while approaching the dock in Tampa, USA. A Tampa Harbour Pilot helped direct the crew to safely manage the situation with a tug and bow thruster. No damages were reported.
Vessel experienced a total main engine failure while sailing in the St. Lawrence River near Sept-Iles, Quebec, Canada. The crew carried out repairs while the vessel was adrift.
Vessel ran aground near Buoy No. 3 while en route from Bontang to Pontianak, Indonesia. Assistance from Pelindo Jasa Maritim tugs was scheduled to refloat the vessel on 05 September.

While en route from Chattogram, Bangladesh, to Colombo, Sri Lanka, experienced a main engine problem and returned to Chattogram for repairs. Divers later cleared a net entangled at the vessel's bottom, and it sailed on 06 September.
An oily substance was reported in the waters near the vessel due to a hydraulic leak during loading operations in San Lorenzo, Argentina. The leak was addressed, and operations continued.

Experienced a fuel leak due to a connection transfer pipe failure while receiving fuel from Spabunker Treinta (IMO 9296638) at Las Palmas, Spain. Cleaning operations were carried out, and the vessel departed Las Palmas on 07 September.

A connection transfer pipe failure during fuel supply operations from this vessel led to a fuel spill of 3,000 liters at Las Palmas, Spain. Cleanup operations continued while the vessel sailed out on the same day
Lost 46 boxes and damaged 305 containers in South Africa's rough seas last week. SAMSA issued a navigational warning and called for public reports of cargo containers floating at sea.

Smoke detected in the ceiling cavity of Deck 4 boat embarkation room while anchored in Hobart, Australia. Source identified as a small paper document and a plastic tube from a thermal overload reset switch.
Issue affecting bow thruster while sailing Troon-Brodick, UK. Returned to Brodick to berth overnight. Repositioned to Troon for further investigations. Repairs completed, sailed from Troon on 06 Jul.
Reported a technical problem and was taken out of service on the Nesna-Levang route, Norway. It was relocated to Lonsdal and resumed services after repairs on 04 Aug.

Vessel NUC (Not Under Command) due to the need for fuel injector replacement while navigating the South West Lane of the Dover Traffic Separation Scheme. Repairs were completed, and the vessel arrived in Corcubion on 09 September.

Experienced fluctuations in its main engine RPM while on remote control, shortly after departing from anchorage near Lanoraie, Quebec, Canada. The issue was resolved, and the vessel resumed its journey on 03 September.
While sailing near Kotachiba Island in Matsuyama City, Ehime Prefecture, Japan, she collided with a tugboat. No injuries, flooding, or oil spills were reported.
Two projectiles and a third explosion hit a British military vessel, causing damage control and no casualties. The vessel is en route to its next port.
Houthi missiles target ships in the Red Sea, attempting to escape the war in Yemen and Iran's feud.  causing damage control and no casualties.
Ran aground onto surfacing blocks in Tomakomai, Japan. No injuries, flooding, or oil spill reported. Refloated and berthed in Tomakomai. Sailed on 04 Jul.
With 69 passengers onboard, suffered mechanical damage to its port main engine while moored in Meganisi, Lefkada, Greece. Permission was granted for a single voyage without passengers.

Vessel had an issue with its autopilot steering while entering the Minch area, UK. It continued on manual operation and moored in Mosjoen, Norway, on 05 September. It sailed out on 08 September after the defect was rectified.

Experienced a total failure of its steering system approximately 80.3 nautical miles southwest of Cape Sable, in the Gulf of Maine off Clarks Harbour, Nova Scotia. The vessel was towed to Lower West Pubnico by the Coast Guard.
Partially submerged and adrift in the Persian Gulf, off Kuwait. Six crew members were found dead, and three crew members remain missing.
Not under command due to a broken screw on the engine cylinder head, 6 NM north of Cape Wrath. Repairs completed and vessel sailed the same day.
Engine failure at Guzelyali point in the Canakkale Strait. Crew unable to complete repairs. Shifted to Karanlikliman anchorage and remains stationary as of 02 Sep.
