Experienced a technical fault on 31 August, almost doubling its transit time. It continued to operate with reduced engine power, resulting in the cancellation of all trip bookings from 03 to 07 September. It sailed from Penzance on 08 September.
Technical issue caused cancellation of sailings from Barra and Eriskay. After repairs in Barra, the vessel resumed its service.
Ran aground due to severe thunderstorms and adverse weather at Carters Beach, near Westport, New Zealand. Diggers creating anchor points and a tug was dispatched from Taranaki to assist.
Crossings cancelled due to a technical issue at Caribou, Canada. Problem related to an engine cylinder liner. Engine to be tested with plans to resume service.
Experienced total engine failure in Halifax Harbour, Nova Scotia , assisted by three tugs for berthing,additional tug was dispatched,  sailed from Halifax on 01 September.
Lost engine control, leaving it unable to maneuver off Burnie, Australia. Rescued 45 POB during severe weather conditions. Two tugs assisted and vessel safely arrived at Burnie.
Due to an engine breakdown, delayed its departure from Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, Spain, by five hours . A specialized workshop was called to address the issue.
Collision in the South China Sea, with China claiming damage and the Philippine Coast Guard alleging malicious damage.
Badly damaged by the Maersk Shekou, injuring two crew members. The ship's hull is intact, and an inquiry is ongoing.

Fire broke out in the engine room at EDR Antwerp Shipyard, Belgium. 25 people treated for smoke inhalation. Fire was brought under control, with the fire brigade remaining to ensure proper ventilation.
Allided with the southern jetty near Kavala, Greece, causing paint abrasion above the portside waterline. Vessel returned to Kavala, where sailing was banned. Sailed after certification.
Experience a technical failure in its pollution prevention and ballast management systems while in Tuapse, Russia. After repairs were made, the vessel sailed on 02 September.
One engine broke down near Sejero, Denmark. Vessel sailed at half power with the remaining engine. Docked in Havnso for repairs.

Experienced a technical failure at Taman, Russia. Departure was temporarily canceled by the harbour master until repairs were carried out. The vessel later arrived at Kavkaz OPL Anchorage on 23 September.
Collided with yacht A.MEY off Bodrum, Turkey. Sustained slight structural damage to the forward section. Vessel remains stationary north of Bodrum anchorage.
Lost propulsion after a failure of its electrical power supply system in Vancouver Harbour, Canada. It was towed to Anchorage C, and the crew resolved the issue. Sailed from Vancouver on 31 August.

Vessel sank following a distress call near the Okpobo River entrance in Nigeria. All 59 crew members were rescued, but a Lieutenant Commander died during the rescue operation. The approach to the vessel was challenging due to strong wave forces
Technical failure en route from Gulluk, Turkey to Novorossiysk, Russia. Anchored at Sinop for repairs. Vessel remains stationary at Sinop anchorage.
While serving the Largs-Cumbrae route in the UK, had an issue with its Voith unit. It was removed from service for investigation and berthed at Dales Marine Services in Greenock on the same day.
Fouled propeller serving on route Gourock-Dunoon, UK. Scheduled departures cancelled. Ferry Ali Cat operated single-vessel timetable for the rest of the day.
Technical failure before entering Canakkale Strait, Turkey, due to fuel return pipe leakage on main engine cylinder unit. Vessel moved to Karanlik Liman anchorage for repairs.
Technical problems while serving on route Kvanne-Rykkjem, Norway. Removed from service and resumed operations after trouble was resolved.
Main engine malfunction forced the crew to anchor at the 18th marine mile of the Danube River, Romania. Collided with combined chemical and oil tanker Mazu Xiao. Sustained stern damage.
Technical failure near the southern entrance of Canakkale Strait at Kumkale point, Turkey. Vessel shifted to Bozcaada Island anchorage under its own power. Repairs ongoing as of 31 Aug.
Vessel was NUC due to a leaking cylinder head off Lundy Island, UK. Repairs were completed within 60 minutes, and the vessel resumed its journey.
Collision with general cargo vessel Sundry (IMO 9045651) during maneuvering at the 18th marine mile of the Danube River, Romania. Vessel sailed and is scheduled for inspection at Tulcea port road.
Collision with bulk carrier Nord Singapore in the Parana River. Structural damage to port side shell plating, including main deck handrails and bulwarks.
Collision with bulk carrier Obahan C in the Parana River. Structural damage to the bulbous bow and fore side port and starboard sections.
Generator failure at Casamicciola, Italy, causing disembarkation issues due to jammed doors. Passengers evacuated through the side exit and invited to another vessel.
Engine failure off Bandirma in the Marmara Sea. Vessel berthed at Ambarli Ferry Terminal, and passengers disembarked. Shifted to Ambarli anchorage and remains stationary as of 01 Sep.
Technical failure of emergency communication system and alarm unit at Feodosiia, Ukraine. Departure permission canceled until repairs completed. Vessel remains at Feodosiia as of 29 Aug.

Vessel's anchor broke due to massive waves and strong currents, causing the vessel to shift 10 nautical miles and sustain significant damage to groynes along the Lagos coastline at Meiyegun Waterfront Scheme near Eko Atlantic City, Nigeria.
Technical failure while in ballast. Vessel sought shelter and anchored at Sinop anchorage, Turkey. Repairs are being done as of 27 Aug.
Not under command due to engine trouble in the English Channel. Defect rectified the same day and vessel resumed its voyage.
Explosion in the bow of the vessel where paint thinners were stored while docked at North Harbor, Manila, Philippines. One crew member died and two were injured.
Technical failure at the southern entrance of Canakkale Strait, Turkey. Vessel shifted to Bozcaada Island anchorage under its own power and sailed from Bozcaada on 27 Aug.
Power failure and loss of propulsion while heading towards Dover Strait Traffic Scheme, UK. Vessel completed repairs the same day and resumed its voyage.
Divers discovered damage to portside propeller blades of the vessel operating on the Vineyard Haven-Woods Hole route, USA. The vessel required drydocking. M/V Governor replaced it.
Brief blackout due to generator failure while in the Dover Strait Traffic Separation Scheme, UK. The vessel was not under command for 7 minutes but resumed its voyage after repairs.

Engine failure occurred en route from Piraeus port to Hydra Island, Greece. Vessel was ready to sail when the issue occurred. Waiting for repairs and class inspection. Sailed from Piraeus on 01 Oct 2024.

Vessel serving the Arvika-Voksa-Kvamsoyam route in Norway had to cancel its sailings following technical problems on 24 Aug 2024. Sidelined in Larsnes. As of 27 Aug, it was unknown when the route could resume.
Sudden list to port suspected due to cargo shifting in the Bay of Bengal. Water ingress reported in the portside crew cabin. One crew member died, and 11 were rescued. The vessel sank.
Engine trouble caused the vessel to run aground off Mantoh District, Indonesia. Vessel refloated and towed to Luwuk for repairs on 26 Aug.
Technical problems east of Bjornoya Island, Svalbard. Tow assistance was assigned to a civilian operator on 28 Aug to bring the vessel to Tromso, Norway.
Engine failure at the northern entrance of Istanbul Strait, Turkey. Tugs towed the vessel to Turkeli anchorage. Vessel sailed on 29 Aug.
Vessel operating between Swartz Bay and Tsawwassen, Canada, was pulled out of service due to an engine water leak. Repairs were completed in time for the 1400 hrs sailing.
En route from Saudi Arabia to Malta, the vessel experienced a main bearing malfunction near Greece. Vessel was towed and berthed at Gioia Tauro, Italy, on 29 Aug.

Fault with Voith propulsion and steering unit. Cross-Solent operator canceled sailings from Southampton and East Cowes, UK. Red Funnel canceled at least two vehicle ferry crossings due to additional technical issues.
Minor galley fire while alongside the wharf in Wyndham, Australia. PA announcement made to muster the crew. A team member extinguished the smoldering fire with a fire blanket.
Destroyed by the Ukrainian Navy while  carrying fuel in the port of Kavkaz, reports Reuters. Unverified footage shows the 4,533-dwt Conro Trader (built 1978) ablaze in the Black Sea port.
Vessel with 57 passengers and 15 crew had steering failure shortly after departing from Bredco port, Philippines. The captain issued a distress call, and the vessel anchored near the port. All safe.
Passenger ro/ro Wira Ono Niha reportedly collided with the stern of anchored vessel (IMO: 9740768) while docking at Sibolga, Indonesia. Injuries were reported. Both vessels sustained minor damage.
Vessel reportedly collided with the stern of anchored passenger ro/ro Wira Glory (IMO: 9740768) while docking at Sibolga, Indonesia. Injuries were reported. Both vessels sustained minor damage.
Fire broke out in the galley pantry during welding work on board while the vessel was drydocked at Las Palmas de Gran Canaria. Emergency protocol was activated, and the fire was controlled.
Catapult failure upon arrival at Kyllini port, Greece. No injuries or water pollution reported. After a class inspection, the vessel sailed according to schedule.
Ukraine Armed Forces attacked Kavkaz port using Neptune missiles, hitting the vessel with fuel tanks onboard. Fire broke out, and the vessel sank following the attack.
Vessel had engine failure 0.8 NM southeast of Hartlepool, UK, after towing the defective vessel Sancta Maria. Tug Duke of Normandy assisted both vessels to Hartlepool.
Total failure of one engine in Johnstone Strait off Thurlow, British Columbia, Canada. The vessel resumed its voyage using the remaining engine.
Vessel lost control during entry and docking maneuvers at Sorrento, Italy, damaging several moored boats in a local marina. No injuries reported, but extensive damage to several vessels.

Reported adrift on the Red Sea - After being hit by missiles fired from Yemen overnight. She is currently without power after explosions started a fire onboard and caused minor damage. There were no injuries among its 25 crew members. Vessel was initially approached by two small craft before being struck several times by missiles 77 nautical miles west of the Yemeni port of Hodeidah, UKMTO said Wednesday.
Mechanical failure caused the vessel to allide with the embankment and run aground near Montreal's South Shore Canal, Canada. The vessel was refloated with the assistance of two tugs on 24 Aug.
Technical failure at Novorossiysk, Russia. Departure temporarily canceled. Repairs completed, and departure permission granted after crew performed permanent repairs.

Vessel reported an explosion caused by an uncrewed vessel 57 nm south of Aden, Yemen. Minor damage reported. Vessel sailed to the next port of call. Houthi forces claimed they directly hit the vessel in the Gulf of Aden.

Gas leak from the cargo hold to the main deck while opening cargo hold manholes for sampling at Bandirma anchorage, Turkey. Two crew members died. Vessel berthed at Bandirma, and cargo samples were sent to the lab.
Vessel with 9 crew and cement on board had an engine failure in Indonesia. Mechanical components of the engine failed, causing the main engine to shut down. Vessel reported in safe condition.
Crack reported in the No. 1 port ballast tank while secured in Quebec, Canada. The vessel proceeded to Montreal, and the crew conducted repairs while underway.
Vessel with 3 POB ran aground after losing anchor and being unable to maneuver off Kames Bay, UK. Refloated and docked at its new position on 23 Aug.

Vessel had a failure in the starboard main engine while approaching Piraeus, Greece. The vessel disembarked its 40 passengers in Piraeus. Sailing was banned until repairs were completed. The vessel sailed on 24 Aug.

With 7 POB, a fire broke out in the galley while secured for the night in Blacks Harbour at coordinates 45 02 48N, 066 48 36W, New Brunswick, Canada. The fire was extinguished by the crew with local fire department assistance. Damage assessment and repairs are planned.

Vessel was attacked 77 Nm west of Hodeidah, Yemen. The vessel caught fire and lost engine power after being hit by gunfire from two small boats and struck by three unidentified projectiles. The vessel remained ablaze and appeared to be leaking oil.
Vessel experienced engine failure and lost power off Andros Island, north of Kafireas Strait, Greece. The vessel was adrift and towed by a tug to LimenasAgiou Georgiou, Piraeus on 24 Aug.
Vessel had a total electrical power failure, causing a loss of propulsion power upon arrival at an anchorage off Pointe-aux-Trembles, Canada. The crew assessed the issue.

Vessel was not under command due to a high fuel plunger alarm and required checks on the main engine off the UK coast. The estimated repair time was 1.5 to 2 hours, and the vessel confirmed to Solent CG that it was back underway after repairs.

Technical issues with the generator forced cancellations of services between West Cowes and Southampton, UK. At least six cancellations occurred. The vessel was moored while issues with the cooling system on the port generator were addressed.

Vessel with 139 passengers on board allided with the quayside while trying to berth at Heysham Dock, UK. Damage to the starboard quarter above and below the waterline. The vessel sailed the next day on 22 Aug.
Small ingress of water due to a crack found in one of the starboard ballast tanks while in the St. Marys River, US. The vessel moved to Port Colborne, Canada, for repairs and sailed on 23 Aug.

Vessel towing a barge with five persons on board ran aground on a reef outside Hoddevika, Norway. Water ingress and engine power loss were reported. The vessel was refloated and berthed at Stad Yard AS for repairs on 22 Aug.
Vessel lost explosives overboard off Blankenberge, Belgium. Ostend Radio announced the incident and requested that shipping avoid anchoring or fishing in the vicinity.
Vessel had a technical failure and sought shelter, dropping anchor at Cesme, Turkey. Repairs were underway, and the vessel remained stationary as of 21 Aug. It sailed from Cesme on 25 Aug.

Fire broke out in the engine room while the vessel was docked at Port of Spain, Trinidad & Tobago. Passengers were directed to Galleons Passage. The fire was brought under control by the crew, and the vessel remained out of service pending investigation.

Fire broke out in the engine room while the vessel was docked at Durban Container Terminal, South Africa. Terminal operations were halted, but the blaze was contained, and cargo operations resumed the next day. The vessel sailed on 26 Aug.

Fire started in the engine room after the vessel departed from Piombino, Italy. The vessel returned to port due to smoke in the engine room. Fire was nearly extinguished, and passengers were evacuated.

Vessel experienced technical failure in its emergency alarm unit and safety indicators while at Novorossiysk, Russia. A temporary sailing ban was issued. The vessel sailed from Novorossiysk after repairs on 25 Aug.

The Port Authority of Thessaloniki, Greece, was informed by the master of the moored vessel about an alarm triggered by the activation of a smoke sensor in the flue compartment, with overheating detected. Voyages were permitted after certification.

Oil spill occurred during bunkering at Kwai Tsing Container Terminals, Hong Kong. Vessel TS Kobe (IMO: 9868182) was being supplied by the tanker Yee Lee 2 (IMO: 9679804). It was unclear which vessel was responsible for the spill.

Began taking on water and had steering issues 200NM west of Palau. Crew reported a locked rudder at 10 degrees and flooding in the bilge. USCGC Oliver Henry towed the vessel to Palau, arriving and mooring on 22 Jul.

With 5 POB, experienced total failure of the fuel supply system off Nootka Sound at coordinates 49 28 35N, 127 27 58W, 26.40NM WSW of Bajo Point, BC, Canada. The Canadian Coast Guard's CAPE KUPER towed the vessel, with the tow completed by US tug MARSHALL FLOSS.
Some services of the vessel on Bluemull Sound were canceled due to bow thruster issues affecting travel to Unst, Yell, and Fetlar, UK. The ferry Geira continued to maintain the service.
Vessel sailing on the Oban-Lismore route, UK, had a technical issue with a coolant pipe. Repairs were completed, and the vessel sailed from Oban the next day on 20 Aug.
Vessel had engine failure during its arrival at Piraeus port, Greece. No water pollution or injuries were reported. The vessel sailed under its own power to the Perama shipyard for repair works.

En route from Gijon, had a main engine breakdown at coordinates 43 33 52.6N, 009 53 40.9W, Spain. Towed along Ria de Vigo to Vigo by tugs Helechosa and Gonzalo S. The vessel berthed at Comercio dock and sailed on 23 Jul.

Vessel had an engine failure and began sailing at 11 knots instead of 20 after departing from Barcelona, Spain. The vessel was originally scheduled to arrive on 19 Aug and was still sailing at the time. Repairs were planned to take place in Genoa.

Vessel serving between Fionnphort and Iona, UK, experienced a technical issue with the engine. The service was suspended but the problem was resolved, and service resumed from Fionnphort on the same day.

A throttle issue caused the cancellation of the vessel's departure from Woods Hole, US. Repairs were conducted overnight, leading to the cancellation of the early departure from Vineyard Haven as well.

Vessel had technical issues which disrupted services between Southampton and East Cowes, UK. The operator canceled sailings from Southampton and crossings from Cowes, with the aft engine blamed for the disruption.
Before departure from Sifnos, the starboard stern mooring rope severed due to adverse weather conditions. The rope hit two wheeled vehicles and two local passengers. An investigation is ongoing.
Vessel caught fire near the Bay of Bengal, India. As of 23 Aug, the vessel, along with its crew of 11, was drifting due to total power failure and a loss of propulsion.
Hit by two missiles at coordinates 11 45 10N, 045 55 25E, 83NM southeast of Aden. Despite strikes on the port side and accommodation area on the port side aft, all crew were reported safe.

MPA Singapore alerted about a fire on board and product tanker Hafnia Nile (IMO 9766217) about 55km northeast of Pedra Branca. Collided with Hafnia Nile and left the location. Located by Malaysia's CG with two tugs towing it, and detained on 21 Jul.

Vessel with 144 passengers had a mechanical failure while docked at Patras, Greece, due to a fault in the automatic voltage regulator distributor system. Sailing was banned, and passengers were shifted to another vessel. The vessel sailed on 26 Aug.

Speed dropped from 22 to 13 knots after developing propulsion difficulties at coordinates 20 47 42.0N, 086 42 42.1W, en route from Cozumel, Mexico, to Port Canaveral, US. Unable to arrive until 21 Jul.

Vessel with 22 people on board sank amid a tornado off Porticello in Palermo, Italy. One person was found dead, and 15 people were rescued. The hull was reported resting at 49 meters below the surface, with six bodies found by 23 Aug.

Forced to anchor after total failure of a stern tube seal in St. Lawrence River off Ile Dickerson at coordinates 45 02 27N, 074 35 32W, 0.61NM ESE of McGibbons Point, Quebec, Canada. Sailed on 24 Jul.
Vessel had a total failure of its main engine's starting air system while anchored in the St. Lawrence River off Pointe-aux-Trembles, Canada. The vessel sailed from its anchorage position on 21 Aug.

During a resupply mission, the vessel collided with Chinese CG vessel 21551 near Second Thomas Shoal. The vessel sustained a hole approximately 2.5 feet long and 3 feet wide, along with a 1-foot dent on the opposite side.

Vessel collided with Chinese CG vessel 3104 near Second Thomas Shoal during a resupply mission. The vessel sustained significant damage, including a gash measuring 3.6 feet and damage to the engine exhaust.
Lost 99 containers off the east coast of South Africa due to adverse weather conditions. SAMSA issued a navigational warning and urged sailors to report any sightings of the containers.

Vessel with 87 passengers on board reported mechanical damage to the starboard main engine before its scheduled departure from Volos to Skiathos, Skopelos, and back. The vessel sailed from Volos on 18 Aug.

Vessel allided with a temporary steel bridge in Island Garden City of Samal, Philippines. No major damage or oil spill was reported, but the bridge structure was deformed. An investigation was underway.

Vessel with 19 people on board was not under command due to a defective exhaust valve on the main engine cylinder. The vessel was drifting at the westbound exit south of the Scilly Islands, UK. It proceeded to its destination afterward.

Vessel allegedly caused water pollution on the Kiel Canal, Germany, between Duckerswisch and Kudensee sidings. The pollution contained an unknown substance with mineral oil. The vessel sailed to Hamburg and shifted to Norder Yard for repair.

The vessel experienced a complete propulsion failure in the St. Clair River, Michigan. The issue was addressed while the ship was anchored at position 42°43'59''N, 82°29'05''W. It arrived in Port Colborne on 20 September.

Vessel linking Ruhnu Island to the mainland port of Manilaiu, Estonia, was taken out of service due to a technical issue. The captain indicated that the vessel would not return to service before 19 Aug. The vessel sailed again on 22 Aug.

Vessel serving the Stornoway-Ullapool route had a technical issue with the software. Further investigation took place in Stornoway, UK. After resolving the issue, a problem with one of the vessel's bow thrusters was reported.

Vessel serving the Oban-Craignure route in the UK experienced issues with the sewage plant, leading to disruptions and cancellations of several sailings. Essential maintenance on the sewage plant was scheduled for 21 Aug.
Vessel had a total failure of one of its engine's cooling systems in the St. Lawrence River off Sorel, Quebec, Canada. The vessel anchored, and the crew assessed the issue.

Vessel was disabled after a total failure of its electrical power supply system, causing a loss of propulsion upon departure from Burgeo, Canada. The crew assessed the issue, and propulsion was restored.

Vessel sailing on the Svolvaer-Skrova-Skutvik route in Norway suspended service due to a technical issue. Passenger boat Hamaroy was deployed as a replacement. The vessel departed from Svolvaer on 21 Aug and arrived at the dry dock in Harstad on 22 Aug.
Had a technical fault and had to cancel its first scheduled trip on the Hadsel route, Norway. The vessel remains stationary in the port of Stokmarknes.
Vessel was reported as not under command due to an unknown issue at Campbeltown Loch, UK. It required assistance to move from the west side of the pier to the east side. An investigation is ongoing.

Vessel lost control and hit a wharf while conducting docking maneuvers and approaching ramp B27 B Paniran Marginal Wharf in the Philippines. Water ingress was reported, and the master filed a marine protest.
Vessel serving on the Oban-Craignure, UK route had a technical issue with the starboard main engine. The issue was resolved by 20 Aug.
Vessel reported being adrift following the total failure of its electrical power supply system, causing a loss of propulsion in Dixon Entrance off Masset, BC, Canada. Crew effected repairs.

Fire broke out in the cargo hold of the vessel moored in Amsterdam, Netherlands, at the Vlothaven Way in the Western Port Area. The fire was extinguished by a firefighting team. The vessel sailed from Amsterdam on 22 Aug.
Vessel had water ingress, listing, and required immediate assistance near Yemen. Vessels in the area were requested to proceed to the distress position, render assistance, and report to JRCC UK.

Vessel en route from Ashdod, Israel to Haydarpasa, Turkey, had a technical failure during passage through the Canakkale Strait and dropped anchor at Karanlik Liman Anchorage. Crew conducted repairs, and the vessel sailed on 16 Aug.
Vessel had an issue with the stern doors, leading to the cancellation of sailings from Southampton and East Cowes, UK. Further cancellations throughout the day were unclear.
Vessel caught fire in the engine room while anchored in Mizushima Port, Japan. Two Japan Coast Guard patrol boats were dispatched to investigate the incident.

Vessel had a technical failure at the southern entrance of the Canakkale Strait, Turkey. The vessel shifted to the north of Bozcaada Island Anchorage, and the crew carried out repairs. It arrived in Istanbul Anchorage on 22 Aug.

During routine operations, one of the vessel's tenders ran aground and stranded on Montgomery Reef due to a falling tide at coordinates 15 59 00S, 124 19 00E, Australia. There were no injuries, damage, or pollution. The tender refloated on the same day.

Vessel with 242 passengers on board caught fire in waters off Bawean in East Java, Indonesia. Passengers were evacuated and transported to Surabaya. The fire was extinguished, and authorities suspect it originated in the engine room.

Vessel sailing the Tarbert to Portavadie route had a technical issue. The issue was resolved on 17 Aug, and the vessel resumed service on 18 Aug. However, it experienced another technical issue on 18 Aug. Repair works were unsuccessful as of 27 Aug, and the vessel was relocated to Sandbank.

Fire broke out onboard vessel at Spetses port, Greece. No injuries or water pollution reported. Fire extinguished by crew. Vessel sustained material damages and remains at Spetses for repairs and class inspection.

Vessel had a mechanical failure after departing from Piraeus, Greece. It returned to berth and disembarked 76 passengers. A sailing ban was imposed until the vessel’s class certificate of maintenance was issued.

Vessel had an engine failure during its passage through the Canakkale Strait at Eceabat point, Turkey. The vessel was shifted to Karanlik Liman Anchorage under the supervision of a Strait pilot and attended by a tug. It sailed after repairs on 21 Aug.

Vessel had an electrical fault shortly after departing from Milos, Greece. The vessel returned to Milos and after inspection, the ship’s systems were found to be in good working order. The minor electrical fault was repaired, and the vessel sailed with 252 passengers.

Vessel operating on the Gourock-Dunoon route, UK, had a technical issue with its starboard main engine. Scheduled sailings canceled. Vessel sent to Greenock for repairs, arriving on 25 Aug, and sailed on 27 Aug.

Vessel with 2,430 passengers and 736 crew members on board experienced a fire in the engine room while berthed at Pier No.8 in Jeju, South Korea. Part of the engine room was damaged, and three engine crew members inhaled smoke. The vessel sailed the following day on 15 Aug.

Vessel was not under command due to the need to replace an engine part. It shut down the engine for 30 minutes for repairs in position 54 31 27N, 000 49 15E, 38NM northeast of Flamborough Head, UK. The vessel arrived in Foroy, Norway on 17 Aug.

Vessel canceled some scheduled sailings due to mechanical issues at Caribou, Nova Scotia, Canada. The departure from Caribou and Wood Islands was canceled. The vessel was operating as a replacement for MV Holiday Island.

Vessel had technical failure during Canakkale Strait passage and dropped anchor at Karanlik Liman anchorage under the supervision of a Strait pilot. Crew commenced repairs. Vessel sailed after repairs on 15 Aug.
Vessel towing an unnamed coal barge lost control and allided with a pillar of the Muara Tembesi Batanghari Bridge on the Batang Hari River, South Sumatra, Indonesia. Cause: coal barge uncontrollable.
Vessel sailing between Berneray and Leverburgh had a technical issue in Berneray, UK. The issue could not be resolved, and the scheduled sailings were canceled.

Vessel had a technical failure during Canakkale Strait passage at Kumkale Point and anchored at Karanlik Liman anchorage under its own power. Crew conducted repairs, and the vessel sailed after repairs on 14 Aug.
Vessel had total engine failure in the St. Lawrence River off Becancour, Quebec, Canada. Vessel anchored off Batiscan, Quebec, for repair works. Vessel sailed from Batiscan on 14 Aug.
Vessel with 364 passengers and several vehicles failed to raise its port anchor while departing Piraeus, Greece. Damage found in capstan port; after repairs, the vessel sailed.
Vessel sustained damage while exiting Tilbury docks inside locks. Berthed at Tilbury Landing Stage (London International Cruise Terminal) for emergency repairs. Vessel sailed on 18 Aug.
Vessel attacked in the southern Red Sea. The attack was confirmed by the JMIC reports, but no connection to the US, UK, or Israel. Vessels with Israeli, US, or UK associations are at highest risk.

Vessel reportedly collided with a moored navy vessel on Fremantle Wharf, Australia. The vessel was moved out of the area. An investigation will take place to determine the cause and actions to be taken.

Vessel collided with tug Nelly 31 at Port of Bitung in North Sulawesi, Indonesia. The vessel was reportedly seen almost colliding with another vessel before it collided with an anchored tugboat, which almost sank.

Fire broke out on vessel, berthed at Jaya Container Terminal in Colombo, causing an explosion below deck. Firefighters and port services quickly extinguished the fire and safely removed the affected cargo. Investigations into the cause and cargo status are ongoing. https://splash247.com/fire-on-msc-ship-berthed-in-sri-lanka/

Vessel en route from Itaqui, Brazil, to Eregli, Turkiye had a technical failure at the west part of the Black Sea. The issue was resolved, and the vessel resumed its voyage under the supervision of an attended tug.

Loading ramp of vessel collapsed on several sailors while docked at the port of Mali Losinj, Croatia. Three sailors were killed. The ramp was lifted on the same day. The vessel was docked at a nearby shipyard until further notice.

Vessel operating on the Brattvag-Dryna route, Norway, suspended service due to a technical issue. Shuttle boat introduced to maintain the route. Service was canceled again on 16 Aug. Issue resolved, and the vessel resumed service on 16 Aug.

Vessel with 21 crew caught fire near Tanjung Emas in Semarang, Indonesia. The vessel anchored for repairs during the fire, and the crew was evacuated. The presence of gas cylinders onboard complicated firefighting efforts. The fire was put out, and an investigation is ongoing.
Vessel had a leak in the waters of Tanjung Indramayu in West Java, Indonesia. The vessel listed up to 45 degrees starboard side due to a leak in the ballast tank. The crew was safely evacuated.
Vessel had a technical failure, sheltered, and dropped anchor at Ayvalik anchorage, Turkiye. The crew commenced repairs, and the vessel sailed from Ayvalik anchorage on 14 Aug.

Vessel collided with passenger ro/ro Labobar at Port of Bitung in North Sulawesi, Indonesia. Labobar was reportedly seen almost colliding with another vessel before it collided with an anchored tug, which almost sank

Vessel had a technical failure at Novorossiysk, Russia. After repairs by the crew, the state surveyor re-inspected the vessel, verified the repairs, and granted departure permission. The vessel departed from Novorossiysk on 13 Aug.

Vessel collided with tug Nelly 31 at Port of Bitung in North Sulawesi, Indonesia. The vessel was reportedly seen almost colliding with another vessel before it collided with an anchored tugboat, which almost sank.

Smoke was noticed coming from the hospital on the upper deck of the vessel in Australia. The fire was extinguished, and an investigation revealed it originated from a refrigerator due to a short circuit.

Vessel had technical failures of its navigation systems, charts, and nautical publications at Zonguldak, Turkiye. Departure permission was temporarily canceled. After repairs were done, the vessel sailed on 13 Aug.

The vessel stalled due to a power outage while in the vicinity of Denmark, causing it to drift. Power was restored, and the vessel resumed its journey to Gothenburg the same day. The cause is under investigation.

Vessel had technical failure at the southern entrance of the Canakkale Strait. Strait authorities temporarily canceled the vessel's passage permission, and the vessel was shifted to Bozcaada Island anchorage for repairs.

Due to a mechanical issue, the vessel’s early sailing between Vancouver Island and Lower Mainland, Canada, was delayed by 1.5 hours. The vessel was seen emitting thick black smoke but resumed sailing on the same day.

Vessel collided with general cargo Winds 3, which was unable to leave the wharf due to an entangled anchor in the port of Chiba, Japan. The vessel was berthed at the time of the incident, with no damage or injuries reported.

Vessel was unable to leave the wharf due to an entangled anchor and came into contact with nearby berthed general cargo Ever Felicity in the port of Chiba, Japan. No damage or injuries were reported for either vessel.
Vessel allided with an iceberg while navigating between two fishing grounds in dense fog in the North Atlantic Ocean, Greenland. The vessel arrived in Iceland for repairs and sailed on 14 Aug.
Vessel collided with navigation buoy X off Lake Erie, Canada. The vessel proceeded to a nearby anchorage where the crew freed the rudder before resuming its voyage.
Vessel had technical failures of its navigation system, charts, and pertinent equipment at Novorossiysk, Russia. Departure permission was temporarily canceled, and the vessel underwent repairs.

Vessel experienced mechanical damage due to sabotage by the First Engineer, causing a malfunction in the port main engine reducer in Greece. The vessel sailed to Tinos, and the engineer was arrested. The vessel sailed after repairs.

While leaving anchorage, the vessel collided with asphalt tanker Iver Blessing near Saint-Nazaire anchorage, France. The vessel had a hole above the waterline with no water ingress and sailed on 22 Aug.
Vessel experienced a technical failure of its ballast management system and alarm unit at Tuapse, Russia. Departure permission was temporarily canceled. After repairs, the vessel sailed on 16 Aug.

Collided with bulk carrier Nadeen (IMO: 9324710) in the Persian Gulf, position 26°26'51"N, 053°37'32"E. After the engine room began taking on water, the crew abandoned the vessel and were rescued by Nadeen. The vessel sustained structural damage and subsequently sank.
Vessel experienced a total failure of the main engine starting air system while anchoring off L'Isle-aux-Coudres, Canada. The crew assessed the issue while the vessel was anchored.

Due to container explosion. Surveillance footage showed smoke, fire, and debris scattered, but no casualties were reported. The Ningbo Maritime Search and Rescue Center has initiated an emergency plan, with patrol boats, fire tugboats, and shore-based fire department forces deployed. https://splash247.com/massive-explosion-rocks-yang-ming-boxship-at-berth-in-ningbo/

A fire broke out in one of the cargo hold compartments of the vessel at Niestern-Sander dock in Delfzijl, Netherlands. The fire was contained, causing only smoke damage. The compartment was sealed for 24 hours, and the cause remains unknown.

Vessel collided with bulk carrier Olga while leaving its anchorage near Saint-Nazaire, France. Five minor injuries were reported, and a breach was located above the waterline at the rear of the vessel.

Houthis attacked vessel four times in 24 hours, using rocket-propelled grenades. Private security teams successfully intervened. Vessel and crew are reported to be safe. https://splash247.com/delta-suezmax-attacked-three-times-in-24-hours-by-the-houthis/
Vessel had total engine failure in the St. Lawrence River off Matane, Quebec, Canada. It proceeded to an anchorage off Baie-Comeau for repairs.

The service from Ronne, Denmark, to Ystad, Sweden, was canceled due to technical problems that prevented startup of some machinery. Bornholm Line canceled the first double trip and transferred passengers to Express 1.

Vessel had engine malfunction and was removed from service at the outer port of Emden, Germany. It was moved to the inner port for further repairs. Sailings were canceled until 14 Aug. The vessel sailed from Emden on 14 Aug.

A fire broke out in the engine room, disabling the vessel while it was proceeding on Lake Ontario off Oakville, Canada. The crew extinguished the fire, and the vessel was towed to Toronto for repairs.

Engine trouble while serving between Bridgetown, Barbados, and Kingstown, St. Vincent & Grenadines & Saint Georges, Grenada. The vessel was taken out of service on 08 Jul and sidelined in Kingstown. It sailed after repairs on 09 Jul.

Experienced an electrical fault while serving Foroy-Agskardet, Norway. Service on Arhaug Fjord was canceled. Operators worked to bring external personnel onboard for troubleshooting and rectification. The vessel was sidelined in Agskardet.

Experienced a steering gear system failure off Heybeliada Island. It temporarily berthed at the Heybeliada ferry terminal with its own power. Repairs were conducted at the Kabatas ferry terminal the same day.

While en route from Symi to Rhodes with 52 POB had mechanical damage to its port main engine near Greece. The vessel sailed under its own power to Rhodes, disembarked passengers, and was prohibited from departing until repairs were done.

Collided with a dock ramp (linkspan) while arriving at Wellington berth, New Zealand. Hull damage was reported above the waterline, requiring new plating. The vessel resumed service to Picton on 10 Aug.

The vessel with 990 passengers and 79 vehicles onboard sustained damage to its starboard turbine while entering the port of Piraeus, Greece. The vessel sailed under its own power and disembarked passengers and vehicles. Departure was prohibited until repairs were completed.

A fire broke out in the engine room of the vessel at Midia Naval Shipyard near Constanta, Romania, killing four Romanian workers. The fire was extinguished, and permanent repairs started. The vessel remains stationary as of 01 Sep.

Vessel caught fire on Wednesday near Gili Tepekong on the island of Bali, leaving 15 other seafarers injured, AP reported. She which was en route to West Nusa Tenggara province, police said. A crew member was quoted as saying the ship suffered an explosion near the accommodation block.

The vessel experienced technical problems while serving the Bodo-Gildeskalroute, Norway. Troubleshooting commenced in Bodo, and the vessel NORDIC LADY was inserted as a replacement. Delays were expected.

The vessel experienced technical failure of its navigation systems, charts, watchkeeping alarm units, and related connections in Bartin, Turkiye. Crew repaired the issue with support from shore-based technical personnel. The vessel departed from Bartin on 11 Aug.

The vessel with six crew members onboard requested assistance due to propulsion failure about 19 NM south of Barcelona, Spain. A net had entangled the propellers, and the vessel was safely pulled to Barcelona.

The vessel with 21 crew members caught fire near Tepekong Island, Bali. Two large explosions from inside the vessel left the engine room inoperable. Five crew members died, and several others were rushed to the hospital

The vessel with 29 passengers onboard ran aground north of Halland's Vadero, Sweden. The coast guard monitored the situation to prevent oil spills. An inspection by the Swedish Transport Agency was awaited to decide on the towing procedure
Due to technical issues, the vessel was unable to depart from its overnight berth in Gourock, UK. Departures from Wemyss Bay and Rothesay were canceled, and the vessel remained stationary in port.
Attacked three times in the Southern Red Sea despite no links to the US, UK, or Israel, while the Joint Maritime Information Center advises caution for vessels with Israeli associations.

The vessel had a total failure of its electrical power supply system and lost propulsion in the St. Lawrence River. Propulsion was restored, and the vessel proceeded to anchor off Pointe-au-Pic to assess the issue.
The vessel collided with product tanker PVT Avira in the waters of Nongsa, Batam City, Indonesia, due to a lack of communication. The vessel anchored 1.8 NM north of Nongsa, Batam.

The vessel experienced technical problems with its generator, necessitating its removal from the Stangnes-Sorrollnes route, Norway. After undergoing repairs at the port of Harstad, the vessel departed for normal services on 07 Aug.
UKMTO reported that the vessel had a main engine malfunction off Somalia. The vessel's heading shifted to the northeast due to winds in the area. Assistance from the vessel Aylah 1 was awaited

The vessel serving the Largs-Cumbrae, UK route had a technical issue with the ramp. An amended timetable was implemented, and repairs were completed on 06 Aug. The vessel returned to service as a second vessel.

The vessel en route from Paxos to Corfu, Greece, with 76 passengers on board, experienced a failure in its starboard main engine. The vessel sailed under its own power at reduced speed to Corfu, where sailing was prohibited until the engine was repaired
The vessel had a problem with its cooling system and anchored about 12.5 NM from Greenwich LV. Repairs were completed, and the vessel resumed its journey
Allided with a fairway buoy and ran aground on the Scheldt River in Belgium. Multiple tugs, including Multratug 9, assisted in freeing the vessel. It berthed in Antwerp after being freed.
The vessel in ballast had a technical failure, sheltered, and dropped anchor at Sinop anchorage, Turkiye. Repairs were made by the crew, and the vessel sailed from the anchorage.

The vessel collided with another vessel (type unspecified) Padrino about 100 miles southeast of Punta Ninfas, Argentina. The vessel moored off Puerto Madryn harbour on 05 Aug, awaiting permission to enter port.
Disabled and drifting due to loss of gearbox oil pressure in pos 57 43 06N, 006 19 07W, 0.8 NM W of Eilean Trodday, Little Minch. Tug Aqua Reflex towed it to Uig, Skye. Engineer will investigate.

Experienced a malfunction in opening its landing platform while berthing at Piraeus, Greece. A crane vehicle was requested to assist. The vessel sailed to Ampelakia on 05 Aug and remained there, likely awaiting repairs.

Not under command (NUC) and drifting due to cooling system repairs and coolant replacement in pos 49 37 03N, 004 05 23W, 37.5Nm from Prawle Point, UK. Estimated 2-3 hours for repair. Repairs completed

With 22 people onboard, NUC due to fuel oil leak in the main engine in pos 49 41 58N, 004 42 10W, 25Nm SE of Prawle Point, UK. Effecting repairs. No pollution or tug assistance. Underway after repairs

Heavy ferry door came loose and hit a small vessel refueling at the port of Ischia, Italy. While disembarking passengers, the hatch and heavy chain came loose, hitting one side of a small sweeper vessel.

Vessel reported strong vibrations in the water thruster during its arrival at the port of Paros, Greece. Docked at Paros, the vessel was prohibited from sailing until repairs were completed. It sailed on 4 Aug, en route to Naxos.
Was hit by missile in the Gulf of Aden by the Houthi, resulting in fire out break, Estinguished by the crew, no injuries was reported.
Collided with bulk carrier Manta Nigar in the vicinity of pos 18 54 25N, 072 52 5E at Mumbai inner anchorage, India. All in and out vessel movements halted until both vessels securely anchored.
Reported NUC due to a faulty pipe leaking oil in the main engine in pos 51 19 37N, 003 33 40W, about 4.5 NM S of Nash Point. Completed repairs and resumed its journey to Zeebrugge.
Collided with bulk carrier Jag Radha in the vicinity of pos 18 54 25N, 072 52 5E at Mumbai inner anchorage, India. All in and out vessel movements halted until both vessels securely anchored
Serving on the Ardrossan-Brodick, UK route, had a technical issue impacting its main engine and was sidelined in Ardrossan. Engineers carried out repairs. Repairs completed on the same day.

While serving on the Lochboisdale-Mallaig route, had a technical issue requiring further investigation in the port of Lochboisdale, UK. Operator announced repairs completed. Vessel sailed from Lochboisdale the same day.
Had a mechanical failure in pos 38 37 29N, 025 02 15E, 21NM SE of Skyros Island, Greece. Tug Apollon towed the vessel to the anchorage of Laurium. Sailing banned until repairs are completed.
Collided with the cruise ship Lady Eleganza in the Pasman Channel, Croatia, causing damage to its railing and some deck equipment.
En route from Riga, Latvia to Warrenpoint, UK, with 8 people onboard, NUC following loss of RPM on the main engine in pos 54 10 07.8N, 005 41 32.4W, 3.7 NM bearing 198 degrees from St Johns Point.
Collided with general cargo vessel Teruho Maru No.22 in the port of Chiba, Japan. Incident reported as a minor collision; Teruho Maru No.22 sustained minor hull damage.
Had fuel pump issues and anchored in pos 50 40 38N, 000 25 48E, about 118 degrees, 7.5 NM from Beachy Head. Repairs were completed, and the vessel got underway using its engine the same day
A fire broke out in the vehicle deck while berthed in Hoek van Holland, Rotterdam. The cooling engine of a truck caught fire. The truck was taken off the vessel to extinguish the fire.
Collided with general cargo vessel SJ Honor in the port of Chiba, Japan, and sustained minor hull damage. Incident reported as a minor collision.

After an explosion onboard with 16 crew, 2 workers were killed and another seriously injured off Samalaju, Malaysia. Crew noticed thick smoke coming from the engine room. Upon inspection, found 1 injured and 2 dead.
Collided with Ro-Ro Laslovo in the Pasman Channel, Croatia. The vessel sustained damage to the hull above the waterline and its bow. Sailing was banned, but no injuries were reported.

At about 14 knots, lost steerage near Chesapeake Bay Bridge, US. The bridge closed for 6 minutes. Regained steering ability, transited under the bridge safely, and moored south of Annapolis for inspection.
Had a coolant issue while sailing between Woods Hole and Vineyard Haven, USA. Mechanical issue under investigation led to 6 cancellations. Vessel stationary at Woods Hole as of 01 Aug.
En route to Kokar, had a technical fault after departing from Langnas, Aland and returned to Langnas. Departure from Langnast and Kokarcanceled. Vessel sailed from Langnasudd on 02 Aug.

Caught in a blaze and sank at Marina Zea, Piraeus, Greece, along with vessel type (unspecified) (IMO 9948891). Flames originated on a tourist boat and rapidly spread. Floating barrier deployed to manage pollution; all safe.
Caught fire on the car deck, which contained trucks, private cars, and motorcycles, in waters of Masalembu Islands, Indonesia. Passengers and crew safe. Investigation ongoing.

Experienced a technical failure of its pollution prevention system, including the alarm unit and technical devices, at Tuapse, Russia. Departure permission was temporarily canceled, but the vessel sailed after repairs on 07 Aug.

Vessel collided with fishing vessel Isabella about 30 NM west of Hirtshals, Denmark. One of the ropes of Isabella became entangled with the vessel. The rope snapped, freeing Isabella, and the vessel continued on its course

MRCC Madrid reported that the vessel requested assistance in pos 02 51 29S, 008 30 48E, off Gabon, W Africa. Requested vessels in the vicinity to keep a sharp lookout, assist if possible, and report to MRCC Madrid. Reason unknown.

Caught in a blaze and sank at Marina Zea, Piraeus, Greece, along with Libra Y (IMO 8783555). Flames originated on a tourist boat and rapidly spread. All safe, floating barrier deployed to manage potential pollution.

Ran aground off Barangay Biaan in pos 14 30 52N, 120 36 34E, Philippines. Observed minimal oil sheens and light smell of diesel oil. PCG collected spilled oil and sent it to a waste disposal facility.

With hundreds of passengers, was stuck in the port of Marseille, France due to a navigational safety issue, held by government services. Situation resolved on 02 Aug; passengers able to take the vessel to Algiers with a 2-day delay.

Serving the Islay-Kennacraig, UK route, had a technical issue with the bow thruster requiring investigations. Repairs unsuccessful; sailings from Kennacraig to Ellen canceled. Morning sailing of 01 Aug liable to disruption/cancelation.

Fire broke out in the engine room while carrying out work in the Caspian Sea in pos 40 08 13N 051 09 04E, Azerbaijan. The fire spread to other parts of the vessel. No injuries reported. Investigation ongoing.
Listing to starboard when crew forgot to close the side door while sailing in Paliokaravo Bay in pos 38 26 18N, 020 35 20E, Greece. People safe. Deliberately run aground to prevent capsizing.
En route from Beirut, Lebanon to Aliaga, Turkiye, had engine failure, sheltered, and dropped anchor at Datca. Crew conducting repairs. Vessel remains stationary at Datca anchorage.
Serving between Digermulen and Finnvik, Norway, had a technical problem. Connection suspended until further notice. Vessel sidelined in Digermulen for repairs.

Vessel got into distress on the Okpobo River while working at the Okpobo Field, Nigeria, prompting a 10-hour rescue operation. One Navy officer fell overboard and died. A Navy vessel, drones, and helicopters were deployed for the search and rescue operation. All 59 people onboard were rescued
Disabled and rudderless after a steel wire fouled its propeller in pos 52 15 06.5N, 003 18 44.6E near Scheveningen, Netherlands. Fishing vessel Maarten Jacob towed it to port. Sailed on 31 Jul

In ballast with 21 people onboard, anchored due to mechanical failure and underwent high-pressure pump replacement in pos 49 44 29N, 005 31 49W, 18nm from Lizard Point, UK. Sailed to Milne, Canada after repairs.
Had engine failure off Silivri in pos 40 55 00N, 028 26 30E, Turkiye. Temporary repairs done. Vessel shifted to Bakirkoy anchorage and dropped anchor under own power. Stationary at anchorage.
En route from Vysotsk, Russia to Gibraltar, reported as NUC due to an exhaust valve defect in pos 52 47 54N, 003 02 27E. Sailed after repairs on the same day.

Had an electrical system fault, couldn't leave Palermo, Italy. Passengers and cars remained onboard overnight. Little light and no air conditioning onboard. Repaired and transferred passengers to another vessel. Sailed on 30 Jul.

Ran aground at Napier's inner harbor entrance, New Zealand. Refloated when tidal conditions permitted and made its way to berth. No structural damage and no signs of pollution. Survey to be conducted.
Had engine failure off Yalova in pos 40 44 06N, 029 19 00E, Turkiye. Drifted towards shore and anchored in emergency at Yalova. Heaved up anchor and shifted from anchorage area to shipyard on 30 Jul.
Serving between Largs and Cumbrae, UK, had an issue with the Voith unit, requiring investigation. Removed from service. Loch Tarbert will operate as a single vessel service.
Had engine problems and was adrift in a northeasterly direction off Maloy in pos 61 49 43N, 004 11 37E, Norway. Patrol ship KV Bison stood by to assist if required. Crew attempting repairs.
Serving on the Oban-Castlebay, UK route, had a technical issue with the fuel pump. Scheduled departure from Oban delayed. A review to be conducted.

"Was boarded by five perpetrators armed with knives also off Pulau Cula. The suspects are reported to have escaped when the ship’s general alarm was sounded. Nothing was stolen and all crew members were safe."

Carries cement around N. Island from Fletcher’s Golden Bay Portland base. Broke down and docked at Northport, New Zealand. Breakdown expected to cost up to $30 million. Timeframe for completing repairs unknown.
With 19 people onboard, NUC due to a drop in oil pressure at pos 50 21 44N, 005 59 58W, UK. No pollution or tug assistance. Defect rectified. Vessel continued passage to Zeebrugge.

While under the conduct of a pilot, the vessel allided with the lock wall at Saint-Lambert, Quebec, Canada. The vessel was secured in the lock, and the crew assessed the damage. No pollution was reported
"Vessel was boarded by three unarmed men in the early on 29 July about 3.2 nautical miles (5.9 km) north-west of Pulau Cula, Indonesia."

Had a technical failure and anchored at Finike anchorage, Turkiye. Crew conducting repairs. Sailed with navigation status as Reserved for future use (2), on 29 Jul. Anchored in pos 36 49 24N, 030 37 19E, on 30 Jul.
Had a sewage system failure onboard, leading to the cancellation of sailings from Southampton and East Cowes, Isle of Wight, UK. Vessel underway on the same day.

With 28 crew onboard, caught fire and required medical assistance in pos 09 52 44N, 075 28 25E off Kochi, India. Third engineer died. Suspected oil spray leak from the lube oil filter area believed to have caused the fire
Had a fouled propeller due to obstruction while sailing from Mallaig-Small Isles, UK. Divers required to attend vessel in Mallaig. RoRo Loch Bhrusda to operate service to Eigg on 29 Jul.
En route from Varna, Bulgaria to Dunkerque, France, with 23 crew onboard, had engine failure in pos 35 58 00.6N, 022 23 14.9E, Greece. Crew conducting repairs. Sailed after repairs on 30 Jul.

Allided with breakwater while attempting to berth and ran aground in pos 35 07 07N, 129 03 24E, Busan, S. Korea. Remains anchored. Refloated off breakwater by CG. No injury or leak. Investigation ongoing.
Had engine failure in Samsun, Turkiye. Crew unable to repair. Tug Esenkiyi secured the vessel. Towage to Tuzla started on 31 Jul, with ETA 03 Aug.
En route from Abu Kir, Egypt to Constantza, Romania, had a technical failure, sheltered, and dropped anchor at Datca, Turkiye. Repairs performed by the crew. Resumed voyage on 27 Jul.

Due to a technical problem, the vessel had been waiting for over 10 days to dock at Vadinar Anchorage in western India. The issue was related to the main engine. Other reports stated that the captain was seeking permission for a trial docking.

Spotted partially capsized at the mouth of the river in Annapolis, USA. Natural Resources Police responded to the incident. Five crew transported to shore safely and did not require medical treatment.

Reported two capacitors failed in the charging system for UPS supplying emergency power to X and S band radars in pos 33 51 34S, 151 12 40E, Australia. Power isolated to the charging system, and smoke emanated from capacitors.

Serving between Bridgeport and Port Jefferson, USA, had a loss of propulsion and collided with a construction barge while coming into Bridgeport. Vessel had minor damage. No injuries. Cars onboard not damaged.
Ran aground about 0.1 NM northwest of Xingda Port, China, amid typhoon "Gaema". The crew members were safe, and the hull had no oil leakage.
Had a technical failure of the navigation system along with the alarm unit at Tuapse, Russia. Upon completion of repairs, the vessel was granted departure permission and sailed from Tuapse on 29 Jul.

Driven ashore and stuck 1.8 miles southwest of Zengwen River, Kaohsiung, Taiwan, China, during typhoon "Gaemi". Last recorded pos 22 56 00N, 120 05 00E. Crew safe. No leak. Vessel under continuous monitoring.

In laden condition, had engine failure at the northern entrance of Istanbul Strait at Anadolukavagi point, Turkiye. Tug Kurtarma-6 taken the vessel to Buyukdere anchorage. Cause and extent of damage under investigation. Sailed from anchorage on 26 Jul.

With 9 crew onboard, in distress taking a severe list, sank approximately 19 miles off Kaohsiung coast, China, during typhoon "Gaemi". Last recorded pos 22 30 00N, 120 02 00E. Four crew rescued, four missing, one dead.
With 8 crew onboard, ran aground in Pingtung, 0.5 miles southwest of Donggang, Taiwan, during the storm as typhoon "Gaemi" swept across Taiwan. Coast Guard rescued all eight crew members.

Driven ashore at An Ping Anchorage, Taiwan, China, during typhoon "Gaemi". Stuck 1.7 miles south of Zengwen River, Tainan, 0.2 miles from shore, beach terrain. Crew safe. No leak. Vessel under continuous monitoring.
While carrying eight containers of frozen meat, ran aground 0.1 nautical miles southwest of Dapeng Bay Qingzhou Park in the Pingtung region, Taiwan, China.

Suffered fire outbreak in the engineering compartment while sailing in Canadian waters. "The fire reportedly damaged a starboard transformer as a result of which the starboard engine remains inoperable"

Vessel carrying 1.4 million liters of industrial fuel oil capsized and sank in waters off Manila, authorities said, as they sought to contain a spill. 16 out of 17 crews were rescued, one is missing," Transport Secretary Jaime Bautista told a briefing. The vessel sank in Manila Bay, nearly seven kilometers (4.3 miles) off Limay municipality in Bataan province, near the capital, An oil slick has been detected and marine environmental protection personnel mobilised to help contain it.

Had two breakdowns in pos 43 02 37N, 016 32 36E, Croatia. Technical problem to be resolved offshore. Owner confirmed the vessel will continue the journey with help of a tug. 300 people trapped. Vessel arrived in Vela Luka.
Smoke billowing from the funnel while berthed at Tranmere Oil Terminal on River Mersey, Birkenhead, UK, after an explosion was reportedly heard. Cause unknown. Vessel at pos 53 23 00N, 003 00 00W.

With 15 crew onboard, in distress, ran aground on rocks, adrift, and experienced flooding in the engine room amid stormy weather off Kolaba Fort in Alibag, India. All crew evacuated and disembarked at Alibag beach.
With 20 crew onboard, ran aground in Pingtung, 0.1 miles northwest of Jia Lu Tang Security Checkpoint during the storm as typhoon "Gaemi" swept across Taiwan. Crew safe. No pollution.

With 18 people onboard, NUC due to changing the fuel filter for the main engine after having a leak in pos 50 31 47N, 006 18 05W, 33.7 NM north of Isles of Scilly, UK. No pollution or tug assistance. Sailed the same day.
En route from Mersin, Turkiye to Sulina, Romania, had a technical failure and anchored at Datca. Crew commenced repairs. Vessel sailed on the same day.

Immobilized due to air conditioning system breakdown at Alicante, Spain. All crossings postponed due to repetitive damage and slow maintenance operations. Reported 29 Jul. Badji Mokhtar 3 will operate on 30 Jul.

With 121 people onboard, had an oil leak and ultimately lost steering control off Tateyama, Japan. Three people onboard felt unwell. Coast Guard dispatched a rescue team. Two patrol boats towed the vessel to Okada Port.

Had an irreparable leak and began to list on one side before sinking while docked at Pier 2, Pangkalan Sultan Abdul Halim Ferry Terminal in pos 05 23 41N, 100 21 49E, Malaysia. Part of the vessel sunk due to low tide.

Vessel with 15 crew & 8 expedition members on board had a fire & smoke filled the engine room for technical reasons near Somlobala, Russia. One person was injured, the rest are safe; heavy smoke complicated locating the fire source.

Vessel serving the route Southampton-East Cowes, UK, had a technical issue. Sailing from Southampton & crossing from East Cowes were canceled. Canceled two sailings after having an issue with the generator, 26 Jul.

Vessel had a technical issue at Tarbert quay, UK; repairs to the pipeline associated with the fire main completed; sailed on the same day; rest hours of crew affected; sailing & arrival of Uig & Tarbert delayed; Uig sailing canceled.
Vessel ran aground while entering Setubal, 30m from Pescadores dock, Portugal; refloated by three tugs; berthed at SADOPORT Multi-Purpose Terminal; investigation ongoing to determine the cause.

Vessel sailing between HalsaKanestraum (E39), Norway, had a technical error in the propulsion system; withdrawn from service; technicians sent to Kanestraum. Vessel arrived at Kristiansund on 25 Jul. Sailed on 26 Jul.

Vessel, en route to Geirangerfjord, Norway, had smoke & heat development in the aft engine room. Port side propulsion system overheating. Strong heating triggered cooling & foaming. Sailed back to Alesund, docked at Stornes Quay.
Vessel was not under command due to a broken engine cooling system approximately 15Nm from Mull of Galloway Lighthouse, Isle of Man. Drifting into anchor position. Tug towed the vessel to Ramsey.

Vessel had mechanical damage to the port main engine while proceeding 4.7 NM north of Iraklion, Crete, Greece; arrived at Iraklion, sailing prohibited. After relevant certificates issued, the vessel sailed on the same day.

According to the General Staff, Ukraine Armed Forces, vessel was severely damaged by the Ukrainian Navy, along with Ukrainian defense forces, at Kavkaz, Russia. Reportedly, dead & wounded among the crew & port workers.
Vessel collided with general cargo Seisen Maru in the Port of Chiba, Japan; no injuries reported; no oil spill observed.
Iran’s Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) seized vessel after it left the Khor Al Zubair port in Iraq loaded with 1,500 tonnes of gas oil. https://splash247.com/product-tanker-seized-off-iran/

Vessel had a fuel oil leak in Satsukawa Bay located in Amami Oshima in Kagoshima Prefecture, Japan; Coast Guard did not identify any floating oil; cause under investigation; no info indicating the vessel had an accident or hull damage.
Vessel had a technical failure while passing through Canakkale Strait, Turkiye& dropped anchor at Karanlik Liman Anchorage under the supervision of a strait pilot. Crew did repairs. Sailed on 25 Jul.

Vessel had to be taken out of service on the Sovik-Brasoy connection, Norway after the life raft accidentally released. Vessel towed to the shipyard in Sandnessjoen for installation of a new life raft. Vessel sailed on 24 Jul.

Vessel under the conduct of two pilots, assisted by two tugs, had a total engine failure upon departure from section No. 66 of Port de Montreal, Quebec, Canada. The vessel was secured; crew addressed the issue.
Vessel collided with bulk carrier CSSC Yuan Jing in North TSS of Sunda Strait, Banten, Indonesia; front hull damage on the vessel; anchored north of Bakauheni, awaiting examination.

Vessel with 23 people on board went not under command due to an issue with the engine 22nm from Beachy Head at a bearing of 123 degrees, UK; intends to anchor while repairs carried out; sailed on the same day.
"Was boarded by five intruders armed with knives in the Straits of Malacca."

While serving between Oban & Craignure, UK, had an electrical issue with its navigational equipment, limiting the vessel to daylight operations only. One departure from Craignure & one from Oban have been canceled after daylight.
Vessel collided with bulk carrier Viet Thuan 56-05 in North TSS of Sunda Strait, Banten, Indonesia; damage to the rear hull; anchored north of Bakauheni, awaiting examination.
Vessel collided with general cargo Hong Jia 11 in the Port of Chiba, Japan; no injuries reported; no oil spill observed.

Vessel serving on the route Seivika-Tommervag, Norway, had to be taken out of service due to technical problems. As a consequence, large queues built up in Tustna. The vessel resumed its service from Seivika on the same day.

Vessel sailing between Pargas &Nagu, Finland, had an electrical fault, power failure & was taken out of service in Prostvik. Ferries Elektra & Sterna running between Prostvik&Lillmalo; traffic jams may occur.
Vessel had a leak in the engine room while docked at Merak Port in Banten, Indonesia. The vessel’s propeller shaft was reportedly damaged which caused the leak and is currently undergoing repairs.

Broke down in Suva, Fiji. A mechanical fault with the drive shaft was detected, with a fishing net found wrapped around one of its propellers. The vessel is undergoing repairs and is set to arrive in Tonga by 06 Aug.

En route from Zarzis, Tunisia to Rijeka, Croatia, experienced engine failure in the Ionian Sea at coordinates 35 46 00N, 016 09 00E. Tug Captain Dimitris I towed the vessel to Astakos, Greece, arriving on 31 Jul.

Vessel was reported to have been hit by two missiles. After been involve in the rescue of crew from the Rubymar vsl which was badly damaged, The attack started a fire on the ship that was put out by the crew. The seafarers on board were safely evacuated after leaving the vessel at anchor with the help of the Lobivia.
Reported attacks from three small Houthi vessels, an uncrewed aerial vehicle, and missile fire off the coast of Mocha, Yemen, resulting in minor damage. All crew are safe.

En route from Portbury to Bristol, experienced a leak in the scrapper system and anchored at coordinates 51 18 14N, 003 52 52.5W, approximately 5 nautical miles northwest of Foreland Point, UK. The vessel sailed the same day.

Arrived in Huelva for orders and caught fire at coordinates 37 06 00N, 006 55 00W, Spain. Fire extinguished with assistance from Maria Zambrano and Salvamar Alkaid. Firefighters inspected, and the vessel sailed to its next destination on 29 Jul.

UK Coast Guard reported water ingress and sinking in the Western South Atlantic at coordinates 52 21 56S, 052 50 39W, Falkland Islands, South America. Of the 27 crew, 14 survived, 9 died, and 4 are missing. Search and rescue operations for the missing were called off.

From Scarborough port to Port-of-Spain, Trinidad & Tobago, experienced engine damage with only one engine operating, causing the vessel to circle in Chaguaramas waters. The electronic bridge control broke down.

The ship caught fire and reignited elsewhere on the second day after the blaze was suppressed in one part of the ship, as smoke continued to billow from the vessel’s container sacks. “The fire in the forepart has been suppressed, but heavy smoke persists and has reignited midship,” the agency said.

Technical problem in Larsnes, Norway, suspended service on the Larsnes-Aram-Voksa-Kvamsoya route. Work began at the quay in Breivika. The vessel sailed on 24 Jul but experienced another shutdown on 25 Jul.

Master reported strong vibrations on the starboard side near coordinates 39 27 30N, 020 06 25E, Greece. The vessel sailed to Corfu, passengers disembarked, and sailing was prohibited until repairs and seaworthiness were verified.

The Houthi military spokesman claimed an attack on the vessel, a container ship that he described as “American”. Saree said the group used ballistic missiles and drones in the attack, achieving a “direct hit on the ship” in the Red Sea. The United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations (UKMTO) confirmed that the Liberia-flagged MV Pumba sustained damage.

Vessel collided with Hafnia Nile oil tanker and caught fire near Singapore, the world's biggest refuelling port, with two crew members airlifted to hospital and others rescued from life rafts, authorities and one of the tanker owners said.

Experienced an unexpected event while conducting repairs with the cooling system for engines at coordinates 60 08 13N, 009 36 02W, approximately 140NM northwest from Butt of Lewis, UK. Attempts to make repairs were unsuccessful until 23 Jul, then sailed on 24 Jul.

Vessel collided with  Ceres I oil tanker and caught fire near Singapore, the world's biggest refuelling port, with two crew members airlifted to hospital and others rescued from life rafts, authorities and one of the tanker owners said.

Caught fire at coordinates 14 11 50N, 073 05 50E, India. The blaze was doused on 23 Jul. Small fires in containers continued to be reported. An in-depth investigation will determine the cause. The vessel remains structurally stable.

Malfunctioned in the starboard main engine near coordinates 37 07 01N, 024 24 34E, Greece. Sailed to Serifos, disembarked one passenger, and was allowed a single voyage to Laurium without passengers and cargo.

Had a broken fuel pump to the main engine at coordinates 50 33 11.4N, 000 40 54.0E, UK. The vessel was underway after repairs on the same day. Channel navigation will monitor until the vessel is out of the responsibility area.
Total failure of the port engine while secured alongside in Cap-aux-Meules at coordinates 47 22 45.6N, 061 51 24.0W, Quebec, Canada.

With more than 1100 passengers on board, broke down while sailing from Alicante, Spain, towards Oran, Algeria, and became disabled and adrift in open sea with all generators on 17 Jul 2023. Managed to sail but returned to Alicante and sailed again on 22 Jul.

Experienced technical failure at Novorossiysk, Russia, on 17 Jul 2024. A sailing ban was imposed until repairs were completed by the crew. State surveyors reattended on board to verify final repairs status. Sailed from Novorossiysk on 19 Jul.

A group of 5 men armed with guns and knives targeted vessel, the singapor police coast guard boarded the vessel on its arrival at the anchorage and conducted a search, but no perpetrators were found. The crew were held hostage temporarily and in some cases, they suffer injury and physical violence. However, there were no reported injuries on this occasion.

Had an engine failure and loss of power, drifting towards shore at Rumelifeneri point while passing through Istanbul Strait, Turkiye. Coastal Safety tug and fast rescue boat assisted, and the vessel anchored at Turkeli anchorage. Sailed on 19 Jul.
Vessel was targeted by robbers while underway in the SOM, 4 perpetrators are said to have been spotted on the stern of the vessel, alerm were raised but no perpetators were found onboard.
Experienced technical failure at Tuapse, Russia. Departure was canceled until repairs were completed. Sailed after repairs on 18 Jul, bound for Samsun, Turkiye, with an ETA of 20 Jul.

En route from Ghent, Belgium towards Kiel Canal, Germany, collided with support vessel Aquarius-G (IMO:9697131) on the Elbe off Cuxhaven at coordinates 53 52 12N, 008 43 21.7E. The vessel berthed at Nobiskrug Yard in Rendsburg for repairs.

Tug-assisted vessel allided with the Brickell Avenue Bridge fendering system on the starboard side at coordinates 25 46 07N, 080 11 44W, Miami, US. The vessel had minor damage. The bridge structure and waterway were deemed safe for traffic. The vessel berthed at Miami canal and sailed on 22 Jul.
Collided with HL Eco due to power outage, it appears to have suffered damage to its atf side. No reports on cargo leakage. YM Serenity moved to an outer anchorage.

General cargo vessel Jongleur (IMO:9001825) collided with this vessel on the Elbe off Cuxhaven at coordinates 53 52 12.0N, 008 43 21.7E, Germany. The vessel had a hole in the starboard bow and berthed in the New Fishing Port of Cuxhaven. No injuries reported.

While outbound from Wilmington, NC, USA, ran aground on Cape Fear River at coordinates 34 07 51N, 077 56 15W. Tugs Erin McAllister, Cape Charles, Cape Henry, and G.M. McAllister assisted the vessel into the shipping channel.
Collided with YM Serenity due to power outage, it appears to have suffered damage to its atf side.No reports on cargo leakage. YM Serenity moved to an outer anchorage.

During departure from Piraeus port to Hydra Island, Greece, had a failure in the main left engine. The vessel is at Piraeus port awaiting proper repairs and class inspection. No pollution or injuries were reported.

Had engine failure and loss of power during the Istanbul Strait passage, drifting dangerously towards shore at Umuryeri point, Turkiye. Secured by tugs and anchored at coordinates 41 16 04N, 029 02 19E. The vessel sailed on 19 Jul.

With 375 passengers and 11 crew members, had engine failure while navigating between Sifnos and Paros Islands, Greece. Arrived at Paros Island at reduced speed. The Port Authority prohibited the vessel from sailing.
The Houthis used boat drones and missiles to attack the vessel, The Houthis claimed they targeted the ship because the owners violated the group's ban on calling in Israel.
A USV attacked  Tanker Vessel in the Southern Red Sea, causing minor damage. The vessel was reportedly targeted due to other vessels within its company structure making port calls in Israel.
Houthis claim mediterranean attack targetting vessel and 3 others. It released a statement on its official website that it worked with the Islamic resistance in Iraq to target the ship.

Experienced a main engine propulsion system issue and lost control while maneuvering at North Anchorage N8 at Hay Point, colliding with bulk carrier YM Serenity (IMO:9581758) at adjacent anchorage N7 in the vicinity of coordinates 21 11 12S, 149 26 18E, Australia.

Collided with fishing vessel Jueves Santo (IMO:8714487) approximately at coordinates 42 18 00S, 061 54 00W, 75 NM east of Valdes Peninsula, Argentina. The port bow railing was broken. No injuries were reported. The vessel arrived in Puerto Madryon on the same day.

Ran aground due to the watch officer falling asleep at coordinates 40 23 02N, 028 45 02E, off Mudanya, Turkiye. The bow was damaged, and the vessel was refloated. It sailed towards Gemlik, where temporary repairs were completed, and then proceeded to Yalova for permanent repairs.

En route from Limerick, Republic of Ireland to Swansea, UK, with six people on board, had a propeller issue and anchored at coordinates 51 30 12.0N, 005 07 31.8W. The vessel sailed on 17 Jul and moored at Swansea the same day.

Experienced a technical issue with the main engine in Oban, UK. Sailings between Oban-Coll-Tiree were canceled. Following repairs, the vessel was able to return to service after testing and sailed on the same day.

While departing Piraeus Container Station, allided with concrete blocks of Akrokeramos wharf at coordinates 37 56 54N, 023 35 57E, Greece. Proceeded to Piraeus anchorage. Sailing was prohibited until seaworthiness was verified.

Experienced engine failure at coordinates 37 34 24N, 010 08 00E off Bizerte, Tunisia. Tug Sea Dream commenced towage on 16 Jul. The vessel was pulled into Trapani, Italy, on 17 Jul, and sailed after repairs on 20 Jul.

NUC due to a technical issue with the main engine at coordinates 49 40 36N, 003 53 47W, in the English Channel. No immediate pollution was reported. The vessel arrived at its port of destination in Aveiro, Portugal on 17 Jul.

Towing barge CMI006 with six people on board experienced total engine failure in Discovery Channel at coordinates 50 06 35N, 125 18 22W, 2.50 Nm ESE of Stephenson Point, BC, Canada. Tug AMIX TUGGER and FV HAIDA CHIEF towed the vessel to Middle Point.

Experienced a technical issue with the engine, resulting in the vehicle linkspan berth at Mallaig, UK being obstructed. The departure from Armadale was returned back to Armadale port to discharge vehicle traffic.

Serving on the route Dunoon-Gourock, UK, experienced a technical issue impacting the starboard engine. Required further investigation. The vessel entered Garvel Clyde Shipyard in Greenock for permanent repairs on 13 Jul and sailed on 20 Jul.
Reported NUC due to a total loss of power and blackout at coordinates 56 54 58N, 001 48 45W, UK. The vessel regained full power and continued its voyage on the same day.

Collided with yacht Todo Bien in the vicinity of coordinates 27 50 27N, 097 03 06W near Port Aransas, Texas, USA. Three people were recovered from the water, of which two were pronounced dead. A fourth man on the yacht was reported missing.

Technical difficulties led to a temporary halt in service at Kingstown, St. Vincent & Grenadines. The vessel will be out of operation for approximately 6 to 8 weeks while an engine is found and replaced.
En route from Damietta, Egypt to Constanta, Romania, experienced a technical failure and sheltered at Datca, Turkiye. The crew conducted repairs, and the vessel sailed on 15 Jul.
Lost engine power and drifted at coordinates 57 05 42N, 000 04 24W, and 57 01 12N, 000 04 56.4W, UK. FV OCEAN ROSE FR86 towed the vessel towards Peterhead, where it arrived on the same day.
During cargo operations, mooring ropes parted due to adverse weather, causing the vessel to temporarily lose control and drift at Izmir, Turkiye. A tug assisted, and the vessel remains at Izmir.

RCC Miami, US, received a distress signal from the vessel with eight people on board at coordinates 25 19 54N, 078 00 30W, north of Andros Island, Bahamas. The vessel was flooded and sank. Three people were rescued, and the search for the rest of the sailors is ongoing.
Technical issue resulted in the cancellation of the sailing from Southampton to East Cowes, UK. It was unclear if further scheduled sailings would be affected.

Engine failure left the vessel unmaneuverable off Warnemunde, Germany, resulting in a complete blackout. Tugs brought the vessel back to Rostock from approximately 11 km offshore. The vessel's hatches couldn't be opened. It sailed again on 15 Jul.
Total failure of the main engine cooling system occurred in the Chenal des Grands Voiliers, Quebec, Canada. The vessel anchored for repairs and sailed after the repairs were completed.

Experienced two temporary electrical power losses while sailing southeast of Paxos Island, Greece. The vessel sailed to Patras, where it was inspected by Port Authority officials. Sailing was banned until repairs were completed.

CMA CGM has confirmed that one of its containerships lost 44 containers at sea due to adverse weather conditions off the coast of South Africa. No injuries to the crew, pollution, or damage to the vessel which remains fully seaworthy. After inspection, it was assessed that all containers lost at sea contained harmless goods and did not contain any dangerous cargo.
Fire broke out while fishing in the Indian Ocean. The fire was extinguished, and the vessel headed towards Port Victoria, Seychelles, arriving on 12 Jul. No victims among the crew.
Ran aground on a reef off Emirau Island, Papua New Guinea.
Ran aground on a well-charted coral reef east of Paxi, Greece. A pilot ship assisted. Refloating operation was underway on 18 Jul.
Failure of its catapult during arrival at Piraeus port, Greece. After class inspection, the vessel sailed as per its schedule on the same day.

The Houthis targeted vessel a drone while in the Gulf of Aden, operation was carried out by the Unmanned Air Force and achieved its goal successfully. Tracking data shows the ship's last loction at Somali port of Berbera.four days ago.

The Houthis targeted vessel with missiles while it was in Arabian sea, It was confired that the ship was targeted by a ''flying Object''  in the northermost part of the Gulf of Aden. No injuries to the crew or damage to the ship or cargo were reported, vessel is continuing her voyang towards her next poert of call.
Engine failure and power loss off Mallorca Island, Spain. Tug commenced towage on the same day. The vessel moored in DjenDjen on 18 Jul.

An 18-strong crew has been rescued after evacuating in a life raft from the general cargo vessel Ultra Galaxy, listing in the Atlantic Ocean near South Africa. Three ships closest to the casualty vessel diverted from their routes to assist. :SAMSA added that its efforts have now been diverted to salvaging the vessel.

The Houthis targeted vessel with a drone, it was hited because its owner defied the Yemeni militant group's ban on calling in Israel.
