The Royal Navy's UK Maritime Trade Operations said that the master of a merchant vessel 180 nautical miles (333 km) east of Nishtun, Yemen, reported an explosion nearby.
Attacked by missiles in Yemen Territorial Waters. The vessel was underway with AIS on and reported an explosion. Authorities confirmed the attack but found no links to the US, UK, or Israel.
Fire due to an explosion reported by MRCC Singapore. Vessels in the vicinity were requested to keep a sharp lookout, assist if possible, and report to MRCC Singapore.

Stern allided with wharf fenders while maneuvering in East Dampier Cargo Wharf, Australia. No damage was reported. Human error suspected, likely due to not pressing engine control buttons in the exact position on the control screen.

Fire in the accommodation block garbage station at Atakas port Sariseki Iskenderun, Turkiye. The cause and extent of damage were unknown. The fire was extinguished. The vessel moored on 16 Jul and sailed on 27 Jul.
Reported NUC due to steering damage and drifting at 0.6 knots. A trawler towed the vessel. It arrived off Oostende on 12 Jul.
Total engine failure in St. Lawrence River off Saint-Joseph-de-la-Rive, Quebec, Canada. The vessel proceeded to Pointe-au-Pic for repair and sailed from Pointe-au-Pic on 17 Jul.
Collided with yacht ACROBATICA SOLO SAIL during Quebec-Saint Malo race. The crew of the yacht was rescued.

Ran over a sandbank extending from Beacon Point, resulting in vibration from the port side. The helmsman reduced RPM and turned to starboard away from Beacon Point, stopping the vibration. The keel was scuffed with no damage.
Encountered severe weather and lost 44 containers with damage to 30 more off the southeast coast of South Africa. The vessel anchored on 12 Jul and sailed on 16 Jul.

Ran aground while at berth between Jetty 1 and Jetty 4 in Australia. The vessel started using its engine, and as per the pilot, it was supposed to move forward and swing to starboard but instead ran aground.
Total engine failure in the St. Lawrence River off Sainte-Anne-des-Monts, Canada. The crew conducted repairs while adrift and resumed the voyage. The vessel arrived in Montreal on 11 Jul.

Technical failure while en route from Izmail, Ukraine to Alexandria, Egypt. The vessel sheltered and dropped anchor at Datca anchorage, Turkiye. The crew carried out repairs, and the vessel sailed from Datca on 12 Jul.

Afloat with 10 POB at location 2.1 NM west of Tanjung Rhu, Sepang, Malaysia. The vessel didn't sink, and no pollution was reported. The vessel had a leakage forward of the port side ballast tank, and repair work was ongoing.

A Greek tanker delivering diesel suffered hall damage after grounding in cayman island. The tanker was involve in an incident that resulted in the damage of the hull of the vessel and seafloor. No injuries or pollusion have been reported. It was Sd that the ship has been refloated and was moored off cayman brac.

Adrift due to a fire in the engine room. The fire was extinguished, but hot spots remained. The vessel returned to Valencia on 09 Jul accompanied by a tug. Loads were disposed of after trucks were removed on 16 Jul.
Vessel ran aground in Basiliksk Passage in Papua New Guinea. Pacific Towing salvage team freed the vessel on 17 Jul and escorted it, likely to nearby Port Moresby.
Engine failure at Diliskelesi, Turkiye. Tug secured the vessel and commenced towage to Tuzla shipyard area. Vessel arrived the same day and sailed on 13 Jul.
Engine failure upon completing Istanbul Strait passage. Vessel remained stationary at the incident site along with tugs
Technical failure at Burhanli point in Canakkale Strait. Shifted to Karanlikliman anchorage under its own power and under supervision. Repairs completed, vessel sailed on 08 Jul.
Defect in the starting box of the main engine, anchored 35 NM from Berry Head. No pollution reported. Vessel underway using the engine and continued its passage.
Engine failure off Rhodes Island, Greece. Still under repair by the crew. Vessel drifted according to wind and current direction until regaining speed on 18 Jul.
Anchored due to engine trouble in pos 33 04 35.8N, 132 07 00.7E, Japan.
Mechanical issue while en route from Manitowoc to Ludington, USA. Arrived late at Ludington, and sailings on 07 and 08 Jul were canceled. Vessel remained at Ludington as of 08 Jul
Technical failure while en route from Sariseki, Turkiye to Sulina, Romania. Sheltered and dropped anchor at Bodrum anchorage. Crew conducting repairs. Vessel sailed on 17 Jul.
Technical failure at the southern entrance of Canakkale Strait. Shifted to Bozcaada Island anchorage. Vessel sailed from its anchored position on 08 Jul.
Allided with the middle wall of the new northern lock of Kiel Canal, Brunsbuttel, Germany, despite tug assistance. Berthed inside the lock. Allowed to continue its voyage on the same day

Mechanical trouble at the sea jetty of Zeeland Refinery on Western Scheldt, Borssele. Moored at Wielingen Anchorage and sailed on 10 Jul. Berthed at repair yard in Gdansk, 17 Jul, and sailed on 30 Jul.
Technical failure at the northern entrance of Istanbul Strait. Strait transit banned. Vessel anchored at Turkeli anchorage. Repairs ongoing in the shipyard at Yalova, Turkiye, and sailed on 27 Jul.
Main engine failure and NUC while attempting to exit the lane to anchor. Vessel anchored the next day.
Ran aground on coral heads near Cayman Brac Port. Damage to double-bottom hull and sea floor. No pollution or injury reported. Vessel sailed from Georgetown on 22 Jul.
Cancelled two sailings between Tsawwassen and Swartz Bay, Canada, due to a rudder issue. Repairs underway.
Vessel with 16 crew OB had leak in hull approx. 25.9 NM S.Tanjung Putting & sank in waters off Tanjung Putting in Central Kalimantan, Indonesia. MBS Bratan sailing near vsl evacuated crew.
Main engine failure and NUC. Lost power for 20 minutes and anchored in Margate roads.
Damage to starboard main engine shortly after sailing from Paxos, Greece. Returned to Gaios-Paxos under own power and disembarked passengers. Sailing banned until repairs.
Damage to port main engine while preparing to sail from Paros, Greece. Passengers transferred to an alternate vessel. Sailed to Perama for repairs on the same day.

Vessel had total failure of a generator in Pacific Ocean off Queen Charlotte Sound, in pos 49 27 36N, 132 01 48W, 165NM WSW of Cape Cook, British Columbia, Canada. Sailed to New Westminster, BC for repairs.
Total engine failure upon arrival at an anchorage off Longueuil, Quebec. Vessel anchored and crew assessed the issue.
Propulsion system failure and allided with the ferry quay at Eidsdal, Norway. Docked at Linge. Repairs underway.
Propulsion system failure and allided with the ferry quay at Eidsdal, Norway. Left in the middle of the fjord for several hours before docking at Linge. Repairs expected to take a couple of days.
Vessel taken out of service due to mechanical issues with propeller at Tsawwassen, Canada, on 05 Apr 2021. Sailed Tsawwassen on 09 Apr 2021.
Ran aground just off Moltenort during scheduled sailings on Kiel Fjord, Germany. Tug pulled the ferry off and safely berthed at Kiel port.
Propulsion system fault at SFK base, Kiel, Germany. Vessel shifted to Lindenau Shipyard for permanent repairs. Sailed from Kiel on 22 Jul.
Disabled due to total failure of fuel supply system off Seven Islands Bay, Newfoundland and Labrador. Sailed to Makkovik under own power.
Technical issue while sailing from Largs-Cumbrae, UK, requiring further investigation. Vessel taken out of service after scheduled departure from Cumbrae. Issue resolved the same day.
Passenger lift out of action and in need of repairs while sailing between Mallaig and Small Isles, UK. Lift repaired and fully operational.
Lost anchor and ran aground on River Don in Rostov-on-Don, Russia. No injuries or fuel spill reported. Refloated on 05 Jul with assistance from two tugs.
Sank on the border of Lirang Island, Indonesia and Atauro Island, Timor Leste due to strong waves and winds from a storm. All 15 crew members were rescued.
Smoke developed in turbocharger while serving on route Tjotta-Forvik, Norway. Removed from service and towed by tug to Sandnessjoen for repair. Sailed on 05 Jul.
Ran aground at the exit from Buzan River into Volga River in Astrakhan region, Russia. No casualties, pollution, or water leakage reported. Refloated on 04 Jul.
Collided with bulk carrier Dione upon entering Brake, Germany. Bulwark on forecastle pressed and dented. No injuries. Vessel berthed at Soby Vaerft for repairs on 05 Jul and sailed on 26 Jul.
Engine failure at La Goulette, Tunisia. Crew unable to repair. Tug Tedy commenced towage to Aliaga, Turkiye on 17 Jul. ETA Tuzla on 04 Aug.
Fire broke out in cargo hold at Moll d'Arago, Tarragona, Spain. Fire located in a loader used for distributing cargo. Fire brought under control. Vessel sailed from Tarragona on 06 Jul.
Total failure of power supply system causing loss of propulsion in Le Grand Chenal, Quebec. Anchored off Pointe-aux-Trembles. Crew assessed the issue.
Struck east berth of St Helier Harbour, UK, while en route from Portsmouth to Guernsey during strong winds. No injuries, described as light contact. Vessel sailed on 04 Jul.

Vessel had total failure of its propulsion system in Baie des Sept-Iles in pos 50 11 09N, 066 23 42W, 1.20 NM W. Pointe aux Basques Quebec, Canada. Vsl proceeded to a wharf and the crew addressed the issue.
Engine failure at Samsun anchorage, Turkiye. Crew unable to repair. Tug commenced towage on 09 Jul. Arrived at Perama, Greece on 17 Jul. Repairs ongoing, vessel stationary as of 02 Aug.
Technical failure at the southern entrance of Canakkale Strait, Turkiye. Shifted to Bozcaada anchorage and anchored under own power. Sailed from anchorage on 04 Jul.
Collided with general cargo vessel Nordwind in port of Brake, Germany. Safely moored and undergoing cargo discharge at the time of the incident. Vessel sailed on 05 Jul.

Technical failure of GMDSS and radio communication unit at Poti, Georgia. Crew conducted permanent repairs. State surveyor verified final repair status and granted departure permission. Vessel sailed on 04 Jul.

Vessel in laden had engine failure in W.part of Marmaris in pos 36 29 30N, 027 55 18E, Turkiye. Tug Akyel (LLI 13597053) secured vsl; towage commenced to Marmaris; anchored at Kartal as of 11 May. Sd on 18 May.
Ran aground in Salcombe, UK, stuck in mud while approaching fish quay. Floated free with the tide and proceeded to the fishing port. Sailed from Salcombe on 03 Jul.
Collided with the stern of Cap Jackson while berthing in Swanson Dock, Melbourne, Australia. No injuries reported
Fouled its propeller with a mooring line while berthing at Port de Montreal, Canada. Divers freed the propeller. Vessel sailed from Montreal on 11 Jul.
Collided with the stern of Cap Jackson while berthing in Swanson Dock, Melbourne, Australia. No injuries reported.
Went missing during Hurricane Beryl off the Grenadines. Last known position was in Canouan Island Harbour. Communication and GPS systems likely damaged.
Ran aground in Tyrrel Bay, St. Georges, Grenada due to Hurricane Beryl.
Ran aground along with another unidentified ferry in Tyrrel Bay, St. Georges, Grenada due to Hurricane Beryl.
Fuel spill of approximately 1000 liters of oil in Chacabuco, Chile. Investigative proceedings requested and samples collected.

Technical failure at the southern entrance of Canakkale Strait, Turkiye. Dropped anchor north of Bozcaada Island anchorage. Strait transit passage permission cancelled until repairs. Vessel remained at anchorage as of 14 Jul.
Engine failure and loss of power at Amaliapolis, Greece. Tug secured the vessel and commenced towage operations. Arrived at Lakkion on 18 Jul.
Lost power and ran aground near Cotonou, Benin. Listing to starboard on the beach. Diesel pumping from the vessel ended on the night of 01 Jul.
Engine malfunction en route from Aegina to Piraeus, Greece. Engine power restored after 10 minutes. Disembarked 130 passengers at Piraeus. Sailing ban issued.
Detected failure of starboard main engine during scheduled route from Gaios to Corfu. Sailing prohibited until repairs.
Technical failure of navigation system at Novorossiysk, Russia. Permanent repairs performed by crew. Departure permission granted and sailed on 03 Jul.

Vessel  had total failure of propeller & disabled in pos 47 56 19.8N, long 049 45 01.8W, 123 NM E.Cape St. Francis, NL, Canada. Vessel towed to St. John's by Canadian CG ships Ann Harvey and SACRED BAY.
Engine failure south of Chios Island, Greece. Crew unable to repair. Tug commenced towing and anchored at Laurium on 03 Jul. Sailed on 04 Jul.
Total failure of astern propulsion at entrance of Halifax Harbour, Canada. Resolved and proceeded to harbour for berthing with tug assistance. Sailed from Halifax on 02 Jul.
Briefly lost power as it departed Seagirt Marine Terminal at Port of Baltimore, US. Repairs completed. Arrived at Newark on 03 Jul.
Vessel had crack in fuel tank during fuel loading operations while fueling next to Alfau dock, Ceuta, Spain. 27,200 litres oil leaked due to crack in hull lining above waterline. Sailed on 12 May.
Technical failure of auxiliary engines at Novorossiysk, Russia. Departure banned until permanent repairs completed. Sailed on 03 Jul after state surveyor verified final repair status.
Crack in bow thruster compartment upon departure from Tsawwassen, British Columbia, Canada. Completed daily operations and crew performed repairs.
Allided with entrance light at pier of Folegandros, Greece. Five injured among crew and passengers. Master arrested. Single voyage permitted. Arrived at Piraeus on 02 Jul and sailed on 21 Jul.

UKMTO reported that the bulk carrier SUMMER LADY was approached by twelve small craft, including some fast boats and kayak-small boats that were operated unmanned. No casualties reported and she departed from Port Salalah Oman
Ran aground at 391 KM mark of Parana River, Argentina. Not obstructing navigation. Refloated on 02 Jul and proceeded to Villa Constitucion roads for inspection.
Severe weather and fuel depletion while towing barge in Indian EEZ, south of Nicobar Islands. Refuelled by MV Al Aqsa I and resumed voyage on 06 Jul.

Vessel had engine failure in the eastern part of the Mediterranean Sea. The product tanker Malburg (IMO 9035539) towed the vessel to the Turkish coast on 04 Aug. The vessel remained at Alanya Anchorage as of 01 Sep, undergoing repairs

A comms incidence was reported while transiting the Gulf of Aden, Yemen. Vessel was threatened by Yemeni authorities, who required the ship to email its details or face further attacks. The vessel complied and continued its transit out of the threat area. The JMIC has found no obvious links to US, UK, or Israel.
Allided with wharf in Port-Alfred, Quebec while berthing. Secured and crew assessed the damage.
Collided with yacht Belle Amie on outer Kiel Fjord, Germany. One minor injury. Sailing ban issued. Jib boom on bow broken. Reached Holtenau.
Collided with yacht Eye of the Wind on outer Kiel Fjord, Germany. One minor injury. Sailing ban issued. Reached Holtenau with side railing damage over 5 meters.
Technical failure at north entrance of Istanbul Strait, Turkiye. Shifted to Turkeli anchorage. Sailed on 29 Jun.
Attacked by three missiles in the Red Sea, causing no damage or injury to its crew. The incident is believed to be due to perceived threats.

Unable to approach Mykonos due to entanglement of its anchors while mooring manoeuvres in pos 37 27 42N, 025 19 27E, Greece, Proceeded to Syros anch with tug assistance, took steps to disengage anchors. Vessel sailed.
Total failure of port engine in Ungava Bay, Canada. Proceeded to St. John's, Newfoundland for repairs.
During the process of starting its main engines in the port of Piraeus, found it impossible to start the port main engine, Port Authority of Piraeus banned vessel sailing until repairs are done.
During the process of starting its main engines in the port of Piraeus, Greece, found it impossible to start the port turbine, Port Authority of Piraeus banned it from sailing until repairs are done.

Attacked by a waterborne improvised explosive device while transiting Red Sea, about 80NM SW of Hodeidah, Yemen. Crew safe, Vessel underway to its next port of call. Western military forces investigating.

Experienced a technical failure while passing through the Istanbul Strait, Turkiye. It was shifted to Turkeli Anchorage under the supervision of a strait pilot and an attended tug. An investigation file was placed by the Harbour Master, and the vessel remained stationary at Turkeli Anchorage.

Experienced a technical failure during passage through the Canakkale Strait at Kumkale Point, Turkiye. The vessel was shifted to Karanlik Liman Anchorage under its own power, supervised by a strait pilot. Repairs were ongoing, and the vessel sailed on 23 Sep.

En route from Mykonos to Syros, Tinos, and Piraeus, Greece, with 26 POB, experienced mechanical damage to the starboard main engine in the maritime area SW of Tinos, approximately in position 37 31 00N, 025 08 00E. Sailed to Piraeus under its own power, but sailing was subsequently banned.

En route from Samsun, Turkiye, to Rostov-na-Donu, Russia, experienced a technical failure and sheltered at Sinop anchorage. Repairs were carried out by the crew, and the vessel sailed from Sinop on 22 Sep.
Experienced engine failure in position 34 27 12.0N, 006 42 06.0W, approximately 7 miles from the coast of Morocco. The vessel anchored, and the company is addressing the issue.

While docked at Martapura Baru Port, Banjarmasin, Indonesia, two workers were injured due to an issue with the crane. Preliminary findings indicate a mechanical failure of the crane. Investigations are ongoing.

Experienced a technical failure of the navigation system, including nautical charts and related equipment, at Eregli, Turkiye. After repairs, the vessel was granted departure permission and sailed from Eregli on 24 Sep.

En route from Tsingeli, Greece, to Tuzla, Turkiye, experienced a technical failure during passage through the Canakkale Strait at Kumkale Point. The vessel shifted to Karanlik Liman Anchorage under its own power, and repairs were initiated by the crew.

Collided with one of two country fishing vessels, causing damage to the vessel and fishnets, in position 08 37 24N, 078 18 27E, approximately 9 nm southeast of Tuticorin Port, India. The vessel strayed from its course, ran over fishnets, and damaged 30 nets. It did not stop to offer assistance.

A Russian missile strike has damaged infrastructure and vessel in the Ukrainian port of Odesa, the regional governor said on Friday. Four people were wounded in the airstrike, Governor Oleh Kiper said on the Telegram messaging app.

Under the conduct of a pilot and assisted by tugs for berthing, the vessel experienced an astern propulsion failure in position 54 13 59N, 130 20 12W, in Prince Rupert, Canada. The crew assessed the issue, and the vessel sailed from Prince Rupert on 26 Sep.

Experienced a supply failure one hour into the scheduled voyage to Cherbourg, France, in position 52 31 29N, 001 50 51E, UK. The vessel was forced to turn back and arrived at Richard's Dry Dock in Great Yarmouth. Repairs were expected to take 10 days.

While anchored in the Madura Strait, Rede Waters of Surabaya, collided with YULIAN 88, which had drifted uncontrollably, in position 07 10 00S, 112 42 00E, Indonesia. The vessel sustained a tear in its left side hull. No injuries or pollution were reported.

Carrying 20,000 liters of diesel fuel, the vessel allided with a reef, ran aground, and sank off the coast of Greenland near Nanortalik, in position 60 09 14N, 045 13 00W. Up to 20,000 liters of fuel were spilled.

En route from Bandirma, Turkiye, to Koper, Slovenia, the ship suffered a technical failure at the northern entrance of Canakkale Strait. It was anchored at Gelibolu and resumed sailing on 20 September after repairs.

Due to a mechanical breakdown, the vessel's operations were halted, leaving Whalsay’s ferry service with only one functioning vessel. As of this date, the ship remains stationary in Symbister, UK, awaiting repairs.

En route from Nemrut Bay to Tuzla, experienced a technical failure at the southern entrance of Bozcaada Island, Turkiye. Temporary repairs were carried out by the crew, and the vessel was expected to arrive at Tuzla shipyard for permanent repairs on 21 Sep.
Due to mechanical problems, the vessel was sidelined in Cullivoe, UK, resulting in the Bluemull Sound ferry service being reduced to a single vessel on 10 Sep 2024.
Ran aground while navigating near Lock No.11 on the White Sea-Baltic Canal in Russia. The ship veered beyond the shipping channel and ran aground. Investigations into the incident are ongoing.

The vessel’s EPIRB was activated in position 43 22 09N, 064 07 01W, 40.80 nm southeast of Port Joli Head, due to a total engine failure. It was disabled off Shelburne and towed to Sambro by the CG vessel HARE BAY. The vessel sailed from Sambro on 23 Sep.

Came into contact with two other vessels alongside at berth 52 of the port of Constanta while maneuvering near the berth in position 44 09 03N, 028 38 43E, Romania. No injuries, pollution, or material damage were reported.

Experienced a technical failure of the navigation system along with forecastle deck maneuvering units at Novorossiysk, Russia. Repairs were completed, and the vessel sailed from Novorossiysk on 23 Sep.

En route from Bilbao, Spain, to Liverpool, UK, with 14 POB, experienced a fuel injector failure on station one in position 49 44 36N, 005 55 26W, approximately 17 nm southeast of the Isles of Scilly. Repairs were completed, and the vessel resumed its voyage the same day.

Experienced a power loss while sailing off the southern coast of Wellington in Cook Strait, New Zealand. The ship drifted for approximately two hours in position 41°22'18''S, 174°40'27''E before being towed back to Wellington. It was detained on 27 September but released the following day.

Came into contact with a fishing vessel around 22 NM from Con Dao, Vietnam. The fishing boat sank, leading to 12 crew members being rescued, one confirmed fatality, and one missing person. The vessel arrived at Vung Tau Anchorage on 21 September.

Collided with bulk carrier Rizabey (IMO: 9197117) at the Alpha Outer Anchorage of Chittagong Port in Bangladesh. Local agents and P&I clubs are managing the aftermath. The vessel sailed from its anchorage position on 20 September.

Allided with a wind turbine at the Hornsea 1 wind farm, located off England’s east coast. The vessel, with 72 people on board, sustained damage above the waterline and was berthed in Dunkirk for repairs on 24 September.
Experienced a chipped propeller approximately 46 NM northeast of Ly Son Island, Vietnam, posing a risk of further damage. The Coast Guard towed the vessel to the mainland for repairs on 18 September.

An engine room explosion occurred while the vessel was 490 NM off the Isles of Scilly, resulting in the death of the second engineer. After repairs to the main engines, the vessel continued its voyage toward Montoir, France, on 19 September.
Smoke was detected in cargo hold 3 during unloading operations in Kwinana, Australia. Fire teams responded promptly, extinguishing the smoke. An inspection revealed no damage to the vessel.
Ran aground approximately 200 meters from the shoreline off Barangay Tilik, Occidental Mindoro, Philippines. The hull sustained flattening on one side. The ship was successfully refloated.
The ship with 12 crew members experienced engine failure and was swept ashore by strong waves near Koh Mai Si, Thailand. It grounded on rocks, suffering damage to its starboard side hull.

Collided with a ship-to-shore crane at Yantian Port in southern China, causing operations to be suspended. The crane collapsed onto the ship, causing some containers to fall into the sea. No injuries were reported.
Listed while in the port of Vigo, Spain, and required tug assistance to regain stability. The ship hit a portion of the dock before stabilizing, with further assistance waiting for the tide to rise.

Collided with vessel Benua 999 (IMO: 8597712) in Indonesian waters. The vessel sustained damage on its right side, from the bridge to the stern, while under anchor. Authorities continue to monitor the situation, with no injuries reported.

Technical issues affecting the navigation systems and alarms occurred while the vessel was in Tuapse, Russia. Departure was temporarily cancelled, but repairs were completed, and the vessel sailed on 17 September

While towing a pontoon barge, the vessel suffered an engine failure and dangerously drifted under a bridge in the Canakkale Strait, Turkiye. It was towed to Sevketiye anchorage for repairs, with its departure postponed until it was seaworthy.

Took on water while off the coast of Sinop, Turkiye. The ship was towed to Sinop anchorage and granted a single voyage permission. It resumed its journey on 27 September and arrived in Eregli on 30 September, where it remains stationary.

A malfunction with the fuel pump occurred while the ship was in position 37°53'51.1''N, 23°34'08.8''E near Piraeus, Greece. The issue was resolved, and the ship continued its journey from the Piraeus Anchorage on the same day.

While serving on the Oban-Craignure, UK route, the vessel had an issue with the sewage plant. The scheduled departure from Oban was delayed, but after the issue was resolved, the vessel sailed the same day.
The vessel anchored at Datca, Turkiye, for repairs after suffering a technical issue. The crew carried out the necessary work, and the ship resumed its journey later the same day.

Operating between Piraeus, Aegina, and Agistri, the ship with 145 passengers and 23 cars experienced a mechanical fault while docked at Piraeus, Greece. The passengers were forwarded to their destinations via alternative transportation arranged by the operator.

A 7-night Southern Caribbean cruise departing from San Juan, Puerto Rico, was cancelled after one of the vessel’s lifeboats was damaged. The lifeboat could not be repaired or replaced in time for the scheduled cruise.
Experienced technical problems while operating on the Bodo-Sandnessjoen route in Norway. Sailings were cancelled, and the ship remained out of service in Bodo as of 16 September.
Technical problems in the navigation system were detected while at Novorossiysk, Russia. The crew repaired the system, and the vessel was granted departure permission, sailing on 16 September.

Collided with a fishing vessel 8 km south of Matsushima Island, Hyogo Prefecture, Japan. None of the crew on the vessel were injured, but the master of the fishing vessel suffered serious injuries. The vessel arrived in Himeji on 14 September.
The vessel encountered a technical issue affecting its engine while on the Lochboisdale-Mallaig route in the UK. Following investigations, the ship sailed from Lochboisdale on 15 September.
The navigation system and alarms malfunctioned while the vessel was docked in Novorossiysk, Russia. Departure was delayed, and repairs were completed before the ship sailed on 19 September.
Ran aground about 100 meters off the coast near Amami Setosaki Lighthouse in Kagoshima Prefecture, Japan, while attempting to evade the winds and waves of an incoming typhoon.

A technical issue occurred while the vessel was carrying 20 people on board in position 50°23'30''N, 000°51'17''W, approximately 20 NM south of Selsey Bill, UK. The issue was resolved, and the ship continued its voyage.

Suffered a power failure after shutting down the main engine to investigate an exhaust deviation alarm. The vessel was not under command in position 56°38'48"N, 0°06'18"E, UK. Ongoing repairs were made, and it resumed its voyage on 14 September.

Serving the Jektevik-Nordhuglo-Hodnanes route in Norway, the ship was taken out of service due to a battery pack issue. The vessel remained sidelined in Jektevik for troubleshooting, suspending the service temporarily.
In ballast condition, the ship experienced a technical failure and took shelter by anchoring at Finike, Turkiye. Repairs were made by the crew, and the vessel sailed from Finike on 16 September.

While trying to moor at the Port of Yokohama, Japan, the vessel sustained hull damage after it allided with the wharf. The vessel resumed its journey to Tokyo on 15 September. The extent of damage to the berth remains unconfirmed
Ran aground near Kilang Mandiri Beach in Balikpapan City, Indonesia, due to large waves breaking the cargo rope, causing the vessel to list. The crew was safely rescued.

A Russian missile strike on a Greek-operated bulk carrier off Romania has been condemned internationally, marking the first confirmed strike on a merchant ship in the Black Sea this year. The ship was carrying grain bound for Egypt. Ukrainian president Zelenskyy and US ambassador to Ukraine condemned the incident, urging Russia to stop commercial ship attacks.

A 15-strong crew was rescued off South Africa's southern Cape seas after their supply vessel, caught fire. Two vessels, Angelic Peace and Thunderbird, responded, and PetroSA helicopter helped retrieve eight seafarers.

Overturned at Hasslo Yard in Hasslo, Sweden. Although there were personnel from the shipyard and the shipping company onboard, no injuries were reported. The vessel was tilting 20 degrees on the slipway of the yard.

Experienced a technical failure while passing under the bridge at the northern entrance of the Canakkale Strait, Turkiye. The ship was shifted to Gelibolu anchorage under its own power for repairs and sailed the following day.
Encountered a technical issue affecting the port main engine while serving on the Kennacraig-Islay route. The issue was resolved, and the vessel departed from Port Askaig.

Vessel had a technical failure at Novorossiysk, Russia. After repairs by the crew, the state surveyor re-inspected the vessel, verified the repairs, and granted departure permission. The vessel departed from Novorossiysk on 13 Aug.

A broken hydraulic pipe in the steering gear caused the ship to divert course abruptly to starboard in the middle of the south-westbound lane near the UK. Repairs were made, and the vessel arrived in Jorf Lasfar anchorage on 17 September.

Experienced engine issues southeast of Las Palmas, Gran Canaria, and had to be towed by the pollution control vessel Miguel de Cervantes. The ship berthed at Las Palmas on 13 September and sailed again on 23 September.

Carrying 20,000 tons of ammonium nitrate, is seeking permission to repair at Lithuania's Klaipeda port after experiencing damage to its propeller, hull, and rudder. The local port authority is assessing the application.

Vessel caught fire and sank near Lido del Sole, Olbia, Italy. Sixteen persons onboard were safely evacuated. The blaze, which spread from the aft portion of the vessel, was extinguished by the tug Mascalzone Scatenato.

Suffered an engine failure and power loss off Sulina, Romania. The tug Tedy (IMO: 9059200) started towing the ship on 27 September, bound for a shipyard in Unye, Turkiye. The estimated time of arrival is 4 October.
Collided with a fishing vessel approximately 10.25 NM east-northeast of Son Tra Cape, Da Nang City, Vietnam. The fishing vessel sank, but all crew members were rescued and safe.

After a blackout, the vessel ran aground in Skatestraumen in Nordfjord, Norway. The vessel continued under its own power toward Floro for damage inspection and sailed from Gunhildvagen the following day.

A fire broke out in the engine room while the ship was moored at Ishigaki Port, Japan. The engine room was unoccupied at the time of the fire, which was extinguished after three hours. The cause is under investigation.

The vessel ran aground on the shallows near Birou Island, Kochi Prefecture, Japan. The vessel refloated the same day, with all four crew members safe. No oil spills, injuries, or damage were reported.

During departure maneuvers in Delos, Greece, and after a gust of wind, the vessel made contact with passenger vessel Zefyros (IMO: 9837078), slightly scraping the antifouling paint. The vessel’s seaworthiness was not affected.

Fire broke out aboard the vessel in position 50°06'12.7"N, 005°32'39.9"W near Newlyn, UK. Cornwall Fire & Rescue extinguished the fire. One person suffered smoke inhalation. Reports indicated that the master and the casualty were under the influence of alcohol.

South African authorities are investigating an oil spill from an MSC Mediterranean Shipping Company container vessel, in Algoa Bay. The spill, believed to have originated from the vessel, has left oil-like blobs in the water and an oily sheen.

The vessel experienced a cooling system leak while located in position 49°53'48"N, 005°13'51"W, 5 NM south of Lizard Point, UK. It was declared not under command (NUC) but completed repairs and resumed its journey the same day.

The bulk carrier was left dead in the water 1.7 NM northwest of Apo Island due to mechanical issues with its controllable pitch propeller (CPP), which caused a loss of propulsion. The vessel was towed to a safe area.
The vessel experienced total engine failure while anchored off Port Weller, Canada. The crew addressed the issue, and the vessel sailed to Hamilton with tug assistance for berthing.

The master reported that the vessel was unable to provide its scheduled service from Dapia, Spetses to Kosta, Argolis, Greece, after damage to the port main engine. The Spetses Port Authority prohibited the vessel from sailing until repairs were completed.

Ran aground while navigating the Sulina Channel in Romania, position 45°10'37"N, 029°16'07"E. Tug Sulina 2 was unable to refloat the vessel. A second tug, Galati, arrived to assist on 11 September. The vessel remained aground as of 12 September, with no injuries or pollution reported

Allided with the 17th Street Bridge in Fort Lauderdale, Florida. The vessel drifted with the outgoing tide and struck two protective arms of the bridge on the starboard side. The exact cause remains unclear, with a suspected power loss.

Collided with passenger vessel Orca (IMO: 8744054) in the port of Delos, Greece. The vessel sustained damage to its left side rails, and the Port Authority of Mykonos prohibited its departure until a seaworthiness certificate was issued.
failure at Kepez Point in the Canakkale Strait, Turkiye. The vessel was towed to e on 26 September.Karanlik Liman Anchorage and later sailed on 25 September, reaching Istanbul AnchoragSuffered engine
During mooring maneuvers, vessel collided with a wharf in Rhodes, Greece. The starboard float above the waterline was slightly damaged. The Rhodes Port Authority banned the vessel from sailing.

Explosion and fire at the SN Corporation shipbreaking yard in Chattogram. A 38-year-old man died, and 12 people were injured. Operations at the yard have been suspended due to violations of environmental clearance conditions.
Smoke was detected, activating two smoke detectors in the valet area on Deck 2. The fire in a dryer drum was extinguished, and the cause was identified as a bathrobe and other textile materials.

Collided with the bulk carrier Young Harmony (IMO 9686546) at Alpha Outer Anchorage of Chittagong Port Authority, Bangladesh, causing some structural damage. The local agents are handling the matter, and the vessel remained stationary in the same position as of 23 Sep.
Collided with general cargo vessel Knidos (IMO: 9214173) in the Persian Gulf. The vessel sustained limited structural damage and rescued the crew of Knidos, which later sank.
Reported an oil spill near Phuket deep-sea port, Thailand, due to an improperly closed port-side oil valve. The spill was contained, and the vessel sailed on the same day.
While towing a barge in Johnstone Strait, Canada, the vessel experienced a steering system failure. It was eventually towed to Bellingham, USA, by the tug Capt.Cae.

Experienced a technical failure at the northern entrance of the Istanbul Strait and anchored at Turkeli andAnchorage under its own power. The vessel remained at anchor while repairs were Odongoing  reached esUkraine, on 21 a, September.
Withdrawn from the Reinoya-Hansnes route in Norway due to technical problems. The vessel sailed from Hansnes later that day after repairs.

Collided with part of a quay while turning around at the ferry berth in Omo, Denmark. The rack holding the liferaft at the stern was broken, and the vessel sailed to Svendborg for repairs, where the broken rack was welded.

The vessel broke free from its moorings and drifted within the port waters of Olbia, Italy. The tug Alessandro Onoraoto assisted in bringing it back to its berth. The vessel later sailed out of Olbia the same day.

The vessel suffered a leak and lost electrical power while off the port of Rosas, Spain. The rescue vessel Salvamar Lyra assisted in controlling the leak, and the vessel was towed to Rosas port on 09 September.

Lost its propeller, causing a spill of hydraulic oil off Canada's West Coast. was taken out of service due to a propulsion system issue. Divers discovered the starboard propeller had "sheared off" from its shaft, releasing 800 litres of hydraulic oil into the water.
Went missing while anchoring in Hang Bo Nau, Vietnam, during a storm. The vessel sank, and one body was initially recovered. Divers later retrieved two more bodies from the wreck on 12 September.

The vessel experienced technical failure while passing through the Canakkale Strait near Kepez Point. Tug and fast rescue boats attended, and the vessel was moved to Karan Liman Anchorage. Temporary repairs were completed, and the vessel berthed at a repair pier in Tuzla on 11 September

The vessel experienced engine failure while transiting the Istanbul Strait, Turkiye. A safety tug, fast rescue boat, and a duty pilot were appointed to secure the vessel. It anchored at Yenikapi Anchorage and later sailed from Istanbul on 09 September.
The pollution prevention system, including alarm units, failed at Tuapse, Russia. The vessel's departure was delayed until repairs were completed. It sailed from Tuapse Anchorage on 11 September.

Dragged anchor and collided with bulk carrier Friendly Islands (IMO 9615042) at Alpha Anchorage near Chattogram, Bangladesh. Both vessels' propellers became stuck but were freed, and the vessels eventually sailed out of the port on 21 September.
Collided with bulk carrier Navios Celestial (IMO 9496226) after Navios Celestial dragged anchor at Alpha Anchorage, Chattogram. The vessels were freed and sailed out on 22 September.
Experienced a mechanical fault while at Horta, Azores, Portugal. The vessel required intervention by the manufacturer’s technicians and remained out of service at Horta as of 13 September.

The vessel had a fire in the starboard engine fuel system in the engine room in the UK. The starboard side main engine was damaged. The vessel departed Greenock on 22 Aug and later arrived in Oban. Sailing was canceled due to a technical issue on 23 Aug. Repairs were completed, and the vessel sailed on 24 Aug.

The product tanker collided with bulk carrier Fu Tong in the waters of Nongsa, Batam City, Indonesia, due to a lack of communication. No information on vessel damage. The vessel continued its journey._

Suffered engine failure approximately 5 NM north of the Istanbul Strait. The crew performed temporary repairs, and the vessel shifted to Turkeli anchorage under its own power. It sailed on 07 September.
Withdrawn from service on the Lavik-Oppedal route in Norway due to a charging issue. A ferry from the Dragsvik-Hella-Vangsnes route was used as a substitute. The vessel sailed again on 07 September
Ran aground while sailing between San Nicolas and Ramallo on the River Parana, Argentina. After 12 hours, the vessel was refloated by the tug Candela S on 07 September and later arrived in San Pedro.
Allided with shoreside equipment while berthing at Port Moody, British Columbia, Canada. The vessel was secured, and damages were assessed before it sailed out of Port Moody on 09 September.
Distress signal received from Western South Atlantic. Vessels in the vicinity requested to assist if possible

Suffered a mechanical issue while docking at Jack Layton Terminal in Toronto, Canada. The crew performed an emergency stop, and the vessel allided with the dock. It was removed from service for repairs.

Had an emergency when the 6th cylinder of its main engine failed, forcing the crew to stop the engine while in the Kara Sea, Russia. The vessel dropped anchor, and the salvage vessel Murman began towing it to Murmansk on 19 September, with the vessel reaching port on 27 September.

Encountered a technical failure near the southern entrance of the Canakkale Strait. Tug Turkeli provided an escort. The vessel continued to Tuzla Shipyard and later sailed from Tuzla Anchorage on 07 September
Collided with the product tanker Maia (IMO 9417050) while navigating the River Don near Azov, Russia. No casualties or oil spills were reported, and an investigation is ongoing.

With 2,610 passengers onboard, the vessel made contact with a small piece of ice on its starboard side while navigating Tracy Arm Fjord, USA. The vessel sustained minimal damage and was inspected by a smaller vessel before continuing to Skagway without delay
Vessel ran aground on the right bank of the Sulina Channel, Romania. A refloating operation was successful, and the vessel sailed from Sulina on 06 September.
While navigating the River Don, the product tanker Maia collided with another vessel (IMO 8842583) near Azov, Russia. No casualties or spills occurred, and an investigation is underway.

Vessel experienced a power loss while approaching the dock in Tampa, USA. A Tampa Harbour Pilot helped direct the crew to safely manage the situation with a tug and bow thruster. No damages were reported.
Vessel experienced a total main engine failure while sailing in the St. Lawrence River near Sept-Iles, Quebec, Canada. The crew carried out repairs while the vessel was adrift.
Vessel ran aground near Buoy No. 3 while en route from Bontang to Pontianak, Indonesia. Assistance from Pelindo Jasa Maritim tugs was scheduled to refloat the vessel on 05 September.

While en route from Chattogram, Bangladesh, to Colombo, Sri Lanka, experienced a main engine problem and returned to Chattogram for repairs. Divers later cleared a net entangled at the vessel's bottom, and it sailed on 06 September.
An oily substance was reported in the waters near the vessel due to a hydraulic leak during loading operations in San Lorenzo, Argentina. The leak was addressed, and operations continued.

Experienced a fuel leak due to a connection transfer pipe failure while receiving fuel from Spabunker Treinta (IMO 9296638) at Las Palmas, Spain. Cleaning operations were carried out, and the vessel departed Las Palmas on 07 September.

A connection transfer pipe failure during fuel supply operations from this vessel led to a fuel spill of 3,000 liters at Las Palmas, Spain. Cleanup operations continued while the vessel sailed out on the same day
Lost 46 boxes and damaged 305 containers in South Africa's rough seas last week. SAMSA issued a navigational warning and called for public reports of cargo containers floating at sea.

Smoke detected in the ceiling cavity of Deck 4 boat embarkation room while anchored in Hobart, Australia. Source identified as a small paper document and a plastic tube from a thermal overload reset switch.
Issue affecting bow thruster while sailing Troon-Brodick, UK. Returned to Brodick to berth overnight. Repositioned to Troon for further investigations. Repairs completed, sailed from Troon on 06 Jul.
Reported a technical problem and was taken out of service on the Nesna-Levang route, Norway. It was relocated to Lonsdal and resumed services after repairs on 04 Aug.

Vessel NUC (Not Under Command) due to the need for fuel injector replacement while navigating the South West Lane of the Dover Traffic Separation Scheme. Repairs were completed, and the vessel arrived in Corcubion on 09 September.

Experienced fluctuations in its main engine RPM while on remote control, shortly after departing from anchorage near Lanoraie, Quebec, Canada. The issue was resolved, and the vessel resumed its journey on 03 September.
While sailing near Kotachiba Island in Matsuyama City, Ehime Prefecture, Japan, she collided with a tugboat. No injuries, flooding, or oil spills were reported.
Two projectiles and a third explosion hit a British military vessel, causing damage control and no casualties. The vessel is en route to its next port.
Houthi missiles target ships in the Red Sea, attempting to escape the war in Yemen and Iran's feud.  causing damage control and no casualties.
Ran aground onto surfacing blocks in Tomakomai, Japan. No injuries, flooding, or oil spill reported. Refloated and berthed in Tomakomai. Sailed on 04 Jul.
With 69 passengers onboard, suffered mechanical damage to its port main engine while moored in Meganisi, Lefkada, Greece. Permission was granted for a single voyage without passengers.

Vessel had an issue with its autopilot steering while entering the Minch area, UK. It continued on manual operation and moored in Mosjoen, Norway, on 05 September. It sailed out on 08 September after the defect was rectified.

Experienced a total failure of its steering system approximately 80.3 nautical miles southwest of Cape Sable, in the Gulf of Maine off Clarks Harbour, Nova Scotia. The vessel was towed to Lower West Pubnico by the Coast Guard.
Partially submerged and adrift in the Persian Gulf, off Kuwait. Six crew members were found dead, and three crew members remain missing.
Not under command due to a broken screw on the engine cylinder head, 6 NM north of Cape Wrath. Repairs completed and vessel sailed the same day.
Engine failure at Guzelyali point in the Canakkale Strait. Crew unable to complete repairs. Shifted to Karanlikliman anchorage and remains stationary as of 02 Sep.

Experienced a technical fault on 31 August, almost doubling its transit time. It continued to operate with reduced engine power, resulting in the cancellation of all trip bookings from 03 to 07 September. It sailed from Penzance on 08 September.
Technical issue caused cancellation of sailings from Barra and Eriskay. After repairs in Barra, the vessel resumed its service.
Ran aground due to severe thunderstorms and adverse weather at Carters Beach, near Westport, New Zealand. Diggers creating anchor points and a tug was dispatched from Taranaki to assist.
Crossings cancelled due to a technical issue at Caribou, Canada. Problem related to an engine cylinder liner. Engine to be tested with plans to resume service.
Experienced total engine failure in Halifax Harbour, Nova Scotia , assisted by three tugs for berthing,additional tug was dispatched,  sailed from Halifax on 01 September.
Lost engine control, leaving it unable to maneuver off Burnie, Australia. Rescued 45 POB during severe weather conditions. Two tugs assisted and vessel safely arrived at Burnie.
Due to an engine breakdown, delayed its departure from Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, Spain, by five hours . A specialized workshop was called to address the issue.
Collision in the South China Sea, with China claiming damage and the Philippine Coast Guard alleging malicious damage.
Badly damaged by the Maersk Shekou, injuring two crew members. The ship's hull is intact, and an inquiry is ongoing.

Fire broke out in the engine room at EDR Antwerp Shipyard, Belgium. 25 people treated for smoke inhalation. Fire was brought under control, with the fire brigade remaining to ensure proper ventilation.
Allided with the southern jetty near Kavala, Greece, causing paint abrasion above the portside waterline. Vessel returned to Kavala, where sailing was banned. Sailed after certification.
Experience a technical failure in its pollution prevention and ballast management systems while in Tuapse, Russia. After repairs were made, the vessel sailed on 02 September.
One engine broke down near Sejero, Denmark. Vessel sailed at half power with the remaining engine. Docked in Havnso for repairs.

Experienced a technical failure at Taman, Russia. Departure was temporarily canceled by the harbour master until repairs were carried out. The vessel later arrived at Kavkaz OPL Anchorage on 23 September.
Collided with yacht A.MEY off Bodrum, Turkey. Sustained slight structural damage to the forward section. Vessel remains stationary north of Bodrum anchorage.
Lost propulsion after a failure of its electrical power supply system in Vancouver Harbour, Canada. It was towed to Anchorage C, and the crew resolved the issue. Sailed from Vancouver on 31 August.

Vessel sank following a distress call near the Okpobo River entrance in Nigeria. All 59 crew members were rescued, but a Lieutenant Commander died during the rescue operation. The approach to the vessel was challenging due to strong wave forces
Technical failure en route from Gulluk, Turkey to Novorossiysk, Russia. Anchored at Sinop for repairs. Vessel remains stationary at Sinop anchorage.
While serving the Largs-Cumbrae route in the UK, had an issue with its Voith unit. It was removed from service for investigation and berthed at Dales Marine Services in Greenock on the same day.
Fouled propeller serving on route Gourock-Dunoon, UK. Scheduled departures cancelled. Ferry Ali Cat operated single-vessel timetable for the rest of the day.
Technical failure before entering Canakkale Strait, Turkey, due to fuel return pipe leakage on main engine cylinder unit. Vessel moved to Karanlik Liman anchorage for repairs.
Technical problems while serving on route Kvanne-Rykkjem, Norway. Removed from service and resumed operations after trouble was resolved.
Main engine malfunction forced the crew to anchor at the 18th marine mile of the Danube River, Romania. Collided with combined chemical and oil tanker Mazu Xiao. Sustained stern damage.
Technical failure near the southern entrance of Canakkale Strait at Kumkale point, Turkey. Vessel shifted to Bozcaada Island anchorage under its own power. Repairs ongoing as of 31 Aug.
Vessel was NUC due to a leaking cylinder head off Lundy Island, UK. Repairs were completed within 60 minutes, and the vessel resumed its journey.
Collision with general cargo vessel Sundry (IMO 9045651) during maneuvering at the 18th marine mile of the Danube River, Romania. Vessel sailed and is scheduled for inspection at Tulcea port road.
Collision with bulk carrier Nord Singapore in the Parana River. Structural damage to port side shell plating, including main deck handrails and bulwarks.
Collision with bulk carrier Obahan C in the Parana River. Structural damage to the bulbous bow and fore side port and starboard sections.
Generator failure at Casamicciola, Italy, causing disembarkation issues due to jammed doors. Passengers evacuated through the side exit and invited to another vessel.
Engine failure off Bandirma in the Marmara Sea. Vessel berthed at Ambarli Ferry Terminal, and passengers disembarked. Shifted to Ambarli anchorage and remains stationary as of 01 Sep.
Technical failure of emergency communication system and alarm unit at Feodosiia, Ukraine. Departure permission canceled until repairs completed. Vessel remains at Feodosiia as of 29 Aug.

Vessel's anchor broke due to massive waves and strong currents, causing the vessel to shift 10 nautical miles and sustain significant damage to groynes along the Lagos coastline at Meiyegun Waterfront Scheme near Eko Atlantic City, Nigeria.
Technical failure while in ballast. Vessel sought shelter and anchored at Sinop anchorage, Turkey. Repairs are being done as of 27 Aug.
Not under command due to engine trouble in the English Channel. Defect rectified the same day and vessel resumed its voyage.
Explosion in the bow of the vessel where paint thinners were stored while docked at North Harbor, Manila, Philippines. One crew member died and two were injured.
Technical failure at the southern entrance of Canakkale Strait, Turkey. Vessel shifted to Bozcaada Island anchorage under its own power and sailed from Bozcaada on 27 Aug.
Power failure and loss of propulsion while heading towards Dover Strait Traffic Scheme, UK. Vessel completed repairs the same day and resumed its voyage.
Divers discovered damage to portside propeller blades of the vessel operating on the Vineyard Haven-Woods Hole route, USA. The vessel required drydocking. M/V Governor replaced it.
Brief blackout due to generator failure while in the Dover Strait Traffic Separation Scheme, UK. The vessel was not under command for 7 minutes but resumed its voyage after repairs.

Engine failure occurred en route from Piraeus port to Hydra Island, Greece. Vessel was ready to sail when the issue occurred. Waiting for repairs and class inspection. Sailed from Piraeus on 01 Oct 2024.

Vessel serving the Arvika-Voksa-Kvamsoyam route in Norway had to cancel its sailings following technical problems on 24 Aug 2024. Sidelined in Larsnes. As of 27 Aug, it was unknown when the route could resume.
Sudden list to port suspected due to cargo shifting in the Bay of Bengal. Water ingress reported in the portside crew cabin. One crew member died, and 11 were rescued. The vessel sank.
Engine trouble caused the vessel to run aground off Mantoh District, Indonesia. Vessel refloated and towed to Luwuk for repairs on 26 Aug.
Technical problems east of Bjornoya Island, Svalbard. Tow assistance was assigned to a civilian operator on 28 Aug to bring the vessel to Tromso, Norway.
Engine failure at the northern entrance of Istanbul Strait, Turkey. Tugs towed the vessel to Turkeli anchorage. Vessel sailed on 29 Aug.
Vessel operating between Swartz Bay and Tsawwassen, Canada, was pulled out of service due to an engine water leak. Repairs were completed in time for the 1400 hrs sailing.
En route from Saudi Arabia to Malta, the vessel experienced a main bearing malfunction near Greece. Vessel was towed and berthed at Gioia Tauro, Italy, on 29 Aug.

Fault with Voith propulsion and steering unit. Cross-Solent operator canceled sailings from Southampton and East Cowes, UK. Red Funnel canceled at least two vehicle ferry crossings due to additional technical issues.
Minor galley fire while alongside the wharf in Wyndham, Australia. PA announcement made to muster the crew. A team member extinguished the smoldering fire with a fire blanket.
Destroyed by the Ukrainian Navy while  carrying fuel in the port of Kavkaz, reports Reuters. Unverified footage shows the 4,533-dwt Conro Trader (built 1978) ablaze in the Black Sea port.
Vessel with 57 passengers and 15 crew had steering failure shortly after departing from Bredco port, Philippines. The captain issued a distress call, and the vessel anchored near the port. All safe.
Passenger ro/ro Wira Ono Niha reportedly collided with the stern of anchored vessel (IMO: 9740768) while docking at Sibolga, Indonesia. Injuries were reported. Both vessels sustained minor damage.
Vessel reportedly collided with the stern of anchored passenger ro/ro Wira Glory (IMO: 9740768) while docking at Sibolga, Indonesia. Injuries were reported. Both vessels sustained minor damage.
Fire broke out in the galley pantry during welding work on board while the vessel was drydocked at Las Palmas de Gran Canaria. Emergency protocol was activated, and the fire was controlled.
Catapult failure upon arrival at Kyllini port, Greece. No injuries or water pollution reported. After a class inspection, the vessel sailed according to schedule.
Ukraine Armed Forces attacked Kavkaz port using Neptune missiles, hitting the vessel with fuel tanks onboard. Fire broke out, and the vessel sank following the attack.
Vessel had engine failure 0.8 NM southeast of Hartlepool, UK, after towing the defective vessel Sancta Maria. Tug Duke of Normandy assisted both vessels to Hartlepool.
Total failure of one engine in Johnstone Strait off Thurlow, British Columbia, Canada. The vessel resumed its voyage using the remaining engine.
Vessel lost control during entry and docking maneuvers at Sorrento, Italy, damaging several moored boats in a local marina. No injuries reported, but extensive damage to several vessels.

Reported adrift on the Red Sea - After being hit by missiles fired from Yemen overnight. She is currently without power after explosions started a fire onboard and caused minor damage. There were no injuries among its 25 crew members. Vessel was initially approached by two small craft before being struck several times by missiles 77 nautical miles west of the Yemeni port of Hodeidah, UKMTO said Wednesday.
Mechanical failure caused the vessel to allide with the embankment and run aground near Montreal's South Shore Canal, Canada. The vessel was refloated with the assistance of two tugs on 24 Aug.
Technical failure at Novorossiysk, Russia. Departure temporarily canceled. Repairs completed, and departure permission granted after crew performed permanent repairs.

Vessel reported an explosion caused by an uncrewed vessel 57 nm south of Aden, Yemen. Minor damage reported. Vessel sailed to the next port of call. Houthi forces claimed they directly hit the vessel in the Gulf of Aden.

Gas leak from the cargo hold to the main deck while opening cargo hold manholes for sampling at Bandirma anchorage, Turkey. Two crew members died. Vessel berthed at Bandirma, and cargo samples were sent to the lab.
Vessel with 9 crew and cement on board had an engine failure in Indonesia. Mechanical components of the engine failed, causing the main engine to shut down. Vessel reported in safe condition.
Crack reported in the No. 1 port ballast tank while secured in Quebec, Canada. The vessel proceeded to Montreal, and the crew conducted repairs while underway.
Vessel with 3 POB ran aground after losing anchor and being unable to maneuver off Kames Bay, UK. Refloated and docked at its new position on 23 Aug.

Vessel had a failure in the starboard main engine while approaching Piraeus, Greece. The vessel disembarked its 40 passengers in Piraeus. Sailing was banned until repairs were completed. The vessel sailed on 24 Aug.

With 7 POB, a fire broke out in the galley while secured for the night in Blacks Harbour at coordinates 45 02 48N, 066 48 36W, New Brunswick, Canada. The fire was extinguished by the crew with local fire department assistance. Damage assessment and repairs are planned.

Vessel was attacked 77 Nm west of Hodeidah, Yemen. The vessel caught fire and lost engine power after being hit by gunfire from two small boats and struck by three unidentified projectiles. The vessel remained ablaze and appeared to be leaking oil.
Vessel experienced engine failure and lost power off Andros Island, north of Kafireas Strait, Greece. The vessel was adrift and towed by a tug to LimenasAgiou Georgiou, Piraeus on 24 Aug.
Vessel had a total electrical power failure, causing a loss of propulsion power upon arrival at an anchorage off Pointe-aux-Trembles, Canada. The crew assessed the issue.

Vessel was not under command due to a high fuel plunger alarm and required checks on the main engine off the UK coast. The estimated repair time was 1.5 to 2 hours, and the vessel confirmed to Solent CG that it was back underway after repairs.

Technical issues with the generator forced cancellations of services between West Cowes and Southampton, UK. At least six cancellations occurred. The vessel was moored while issues with the cooling system on the port generator were addressed.

Vessel with 139 passengers on board allided with the quayside while trying to berth at Heysham Dock, UK. Damage to the starboard quarter above and below the waterline. The vessel sailed the next day on 22 Aug.
Small ingress of water due to a crack found in one of the starboard ballast tanks while in the St. Marys River, US. The vessel moved to Port Colborne, Canada, for repairs and sailed on 23 Aug.

Vessel towing a barge with five persons on board ran aground on a reef outside Hoddevika, Norway. Water ingress and engine power loss were reported. The vessel was refloated and berthed at Stad Yard AS for repairs on 22 Aug.
Vessel lost explosives overboard off Blankenberge, Belgium. Ostend Radio announced the incident and requested that shipping avoid anchoring or fishing in the vicinity.
Vessel had a technical failure and sought shelter, dropping anchor at Cesme, Turkey. Repairs were underway, and the vessel remained stationary as of 21 Aug. It sailed from Cesme on 25 Aug.

Fire broke out in the engine room while the vessel was docked at Port of Spain, Trinidad & Tobago. Passengers were directed to Galleons Passage. The fire was brought under control by the crew, and the vessel remained out of service pending investigation.

Fire broke out in the engine room while the vessel was docked at Durban Container Terminal, South Africa. Terminal operations were halted, but the blaze was contained, and cargo operations resumed the next day. The vessel sailed on 26 Aug.

Fire started in the engine room after the vessel departed from Piombino, Italy. The vessel returned to port due to smoke in the engine room. Fire was nearly extinguished, and passengers were evacuated.

Vessel experienced technical failure in its emergency alarm unit and safety indicators while at Novorossiysk, Russia. A temporary sailing ban was issued. The vessel sailed from Novorossiysk after repairs on 25 Aug.

The Port Authority of Thessaloniki, Greece, was informed by the master of the moored vessel about an alarm triggered by the activation of a smoke sensor in the flue compartment, with overheating detected. Voyages were permitted after certification.

Oil spill occurred during bunkering at Kwai Tsing Container Terminals, Hong Kong. Vessel TS Kobe (IMO: 9868182) was being supplied by the tanker Yee Lee 2 (IMO: 9679804). It was unclear which vessel was responsible for the spill.

Began taking on water and had steering issues 200NM west of Palau. Crew reported a locked rudder at 10 degrees and flooding in the bilge. USCGC Oliver Henry towed the vessel to Palau, arriving and mooring on 22 Jul.

With 5 POB, experienced total failure of the fuel supply system off Nootka Sound at coordinates 49 28 35N, 127 27 58W, 26.40NM WSW of Bajo Point, BC, Canada. The Canadian Coast Guard's CAPE KUPER towed the vessel, with the tow completed by US tug MARSHALL FLOSS.
Some services of the vessel on Bluemull Sound were canceled due to bow thruster issues affecting travel to Unst, Yell, and Fetlar, UK. The ferry Geira continued to maintain the service.
Vessel sailing on the Oban-Lismore route, UK, had a technical issue with a coolant pipe. Repairs were completed, and the vessel sailed from Oban the next day on 20 Aug.
Vessel had engine failure during its arrival at Piraeus port, Greece. No water pollution or injuries were reported. The vessel sailed under its own power to the Perama shipyard for repair works.

En route from Gijon, had a main engine breakdown at coordinates 43 33 52.6N, 009 53 40.9W, Spain. Towed along Ria de Vigo to Vigo by tugs Helechosa and Gonzalo S. The vessel berthed at Comercio dock and sailed on 23 Jul.

Vessel had an engine failure and began sailing at 11 knots instead of 20 after departing from Barcelona, Spain. The vessel was originally scheduled to arrive on 19 Aug and was still sailing at the time. Repairs were planned to take place in Genoa.

Vessel serving between Fionnphort and Iona, UK, experienced a technical issue with the engine. The service was suspended but the problem was resolved, and service resumed from Fionnphort on the same day.

A throttle issue caused the cancellation of the vessel's departure from Woods Hole, US. Repairs were conducted overnight, leading to the cancellation of the early departure from Vineyard Haven as well.

Vessel had technical issues which disrupted services between Southampton and East Cowes, UK. The operator canceled sailings from Southampton and crossings from Cowes, with the aft engine blamed for the disruption.
Before departure from Sifnos, the starboard stern mooring rope severed due to adverse weather conditions. The rope hit two wheeled vehicles and two local passengers. An investigation is ongoing.
Vessel caught fire near the Bay of Bengal, India. As of 23 Aug, the vessel, along with its crew of 11, was drifting due to total power failure and a loss of propulsion.
Hit by two missiles at coordinates 11 45 10N, 045 55 25E, 83NM southeast of Aden. Despite strikes on the port side and accommodation area on the port side aft, all crew were reported safe.

MPA Singapore alerted about a fire on board and product tanker Hafnia Nile (IMO 9766217) about 55km northeast of Pedra Branca. Collided with Hafnia Nile and left the location. Located by Malaysia's CG with two tugs towing it, and detained on 21 Jul.

Vessel with 144 passengers had a mechanical failure while docked at Patras, Greece, due to a fault in the automatic voltage regulator distributor system. Sailing was banned, and passengers were shifted to another vessel. The vessel sailed on 26 Aug.

Speed dropped from 22 to 13 knots after developing propulsion difficulties at coordinates 20 47 42.0N, 086 42 42.1W, en route from Cozumel, Mexico, to Port Canaveral, US. Unable to arrive until 21 Jul.

Vessel with 22 people on board sank amid a tornado off Porticello in Palermo, Italy. One person was found dead, and 15 people were rescued. The hull was reported resting at 49 meters below the surface, with six bodies found by 23 Aug.

Forced to anchor after total failure of a stern tube seal in St. Lawrence River off Ile Dickerson at coordinates 45 02 27N, 074 35 32W, 0.61NM ESE of McGibbons Point, Quebec, Canada. Sailed on 24 Jul.
Vessel had a total failure of its main engine's starting air system while anchored in the St. Lawrence River off Pointe-aux-Trembles, Canada. The vessel sailed from its anchorage position on 21 Aug.

During a resupply mission, the vessel collided with Chinese CG vessel 21551 near Second Thomas Shoal. The vessel sustained a hole approximately 2.5 feet long and 3 feet wide, along with a 1-foot dent on the opposite side.

Vessel collided with Chinese CG vessel 3104 near Second Thomas Shoal during a resupply mission. The vessel sustained significant damage, including a gash measuring 3.6 feet and damage to the engine exhaust.
Lost 99 containers off the east coast of South Africa due to adverse weather conditions. SAMSA issued a navigational warning and urged sailors to report any sightings of the containers.

Vessel with 87 passengers on board reported mechanical damage to the starboard main engine before its scheduled departure from Volos to Skiathos, Skopelos, and back. The vessel sailed from Volos on 18 Aug.

Vessel allided with a temporary steel bridge in Island Garden City of Samal, Philippines. No major damage or oil spill was reported, but the bridge structure was deformed. An investigation was underway.

Vessel with 19 people on board was not under command due to a defective exhaust valve on the main engine cylinder. The vessel was drifting at the westbound exit south of the Scilly Islands, UK. It proceeded to its destination afterward.

Vessel allegedly caused water pollution on the Kiel Canal, Germany, between Duckerswisch and Kudensee sidings. The pollution contained an unknown substance with mineral oil. The vessel sailed to Hamburg and shifted to Norder Yard for repair.

The vessel experienced a complete propulsion failure in the St. Clair River, Michigan. The issue was addressed while the ship was anchored at position 42°43'59''N, 82°29'05''W. It arrived in Port Colborne on 20 September.

Vessel linking Ruhnu Island to the mainland port of Manilaiu, Estonia, was taken out of service due to a technical issue. The captain indicated that the vessel would not return to service before 19 Aug. The vessel sailed again on 22 Aug.

Vessel serving the Stornoway-Ullapool route had a technical issue with the software. Further investigation took place in Stornoway, UK. After resolving the issue, a problem with one of the vessel's bow thrusters was reported.

Vessel serving the Oban-Craignure route in the UK experienced issues with the sewage plant, leading to disruptions and cancellations of several sailings. Essential maintenance on the sewage plant was scheduled for 21 Aug.
Vessel had a total failure of one of its engine's cooling systems in the St. Lawrence River off Sorel, Quebec, Canada. The vessel anchored, and the crew assessed the issue.

Vessel was disabled after a total failure of its electrical power supply system, causing a loss of propulsion upon departure from Burgeo, Canada. The crew assessed the issue, and propulsion was restored.

Vessel sailing on the Svolvaer-Skrova-Skutvik route in Norway suspended service due to a technical issue. Passenger boat Hamaroy was deployed as a replacement. The vessel departed from Svolvaer on 21 Aug and arrived at the dry dock in Harstad on 22 Aug.
Had a technical fault and had to cancel its first scheduled trip on the Hadsel route, Norway. The vessel remains stationary in the port of Stokmarknes.
Vessel was reported as not under command due to an unknown issue at Campbeltown Loch, UK. It required assistance to move from the west side of the pier to the east side. An investigation is ongoing.

Vessel lost control and hit a wharf while conducting docking maneuvers and approaching ramp B27 B Paniran Marginal Wharf in the Philippines. Water ingress was reported, and the master filed a marine protest.
Vessel serving on the Oban-Craignure, UK route had a technical issue with the starboard main engine. The issue was resolved by 20 Aug.
Vessel reported being adrift following the total failure of its electrical power supply system, causing a loss of propulsion in Dixon Entrance off Masset, BC, Canada. Crew effected repairs.

Fire broke out in the cargo hold of the vessel moored in Amsterdam, Netherlands, at the Vlothaven Way in the Western Port Area. The fire was extinguished by a firefighting team. The vessel sailed from Amsterdam on 22 Aug.
Vessel had water ingress, listing, and required immediate assistance near Yemen. Vessels in the area were requested to proceed to the distress position, render assistance, and report to JRCC UK.

Vessel en route from Ashdod, Israel to Haydarpasa, Turkey, had a technical failure during passage through the Canakkale Strait and dropped anchor at Karanlik Liman Anchorage. Crew conducted repairs, and the vessel sailed on 16 Aug.
Vessel had an issue with the stern doors, leading to the cancellation of sailings from Southampton and East Cowes, UK. Further cancellations throughout the day were unclear.
Vessel caught fire in the engine room while anchored in Mizushima Port, Japan. Two Japan Coast Guard patrol boats were dispatched to investigate the incident.

Vessel had a technical failure at the southern entrance of the Canakkale Strait, Turkey. The vessel shifted to the north of Bozcaada Island Anchorage, and the crew carried out repairs. It arrived in Istanbul Anchorage on 22 Aug.

During routine operations, one of the vessel's tenders ran aground and stranded on Montgomery Reef due to a falling tide at coordinates 15 59 00S, 124 19 00E, Australia. There were no injuries, damage, or pollution. The tender refloated on the same day.

Vessel with 242 passengers on board caught fire in waters off Bawean in East Java, Indonesia. Passengers were evacuated and transported to Surabaya. The fire was extinguished, and authorities suspect it originated in the engine room.

Vessel sailing the Tarbert to Portavadie route had a technical issue. The issue was resolved on 17 Aug, and the vessel resumed service on 18 Aug. However, it experienced another technical issue on 18 Aug. Repair works were unsuccessful as of 27 Aug, and the vessel was relocated to Sandbank.

Fire broke out onboard vessel at Spetses port, Greece. No injuries or water pollution reported. Fire extinguished by crew. Vessel sustained material damages and remains at Spetses for repairs and class inspection.

Vessel had a mechanical failure after departing from Piraeus, Greece. It returned to berth and disembarked 76 passengers. A sailing ban was imposed until the vessel’s class certificate of maintenance was issued.

Vessel had an engine failure during its passage through the Canakkale Strait at Eceabat point, Turkey. The vessel was shifted to Karanlik Liman Anchorage under the supervision of a Strait pilot and attended by a tug. It sailed after repairs on 21 Aug.

Vessel had an electrical fault shortly after departing from Milos, Greece. The vessel returned to Milos and after inspection, the ship’s systems were found to be in good working order. The minor electrical fault was repaired, and the vessel sailed with 252 passengers.

Vessel operating on the Gourock-Dunoon route, UK, had a technical issue with its starboard main engine. Scheduled sailings canceled. Vessel sent to Greenock for repairs, arriving on 25 Aug, and sailed on 27 Aug.

Vessel with 2,430 passengers and 736 crew members on board experienced a fire in the engine room while berthed at Pier No.8 in Jeju, South Korea. Part of the engine room was damaged, and three engine crew members inhaled smoke. The vessel sailed the following day on 15 Aug.

Vessel was not under command due to the need to replace an engine part. It shut down the engine for 30 minutes for repairs in position 54 31 27N, 000 49 15E, 38NM northeast of Flamborough Head, UK. The vessel arrived in Foroy, Norway on 17 Aug.

Vessel canceled some scheduled sailings due to mechanical issues at Caribou, Nova Scotia, Canada. The departure from Caribou and Wood Islands was canceled. The vessel was operating as a replacement for MV Holiday Island.

Vessel had technical failure during Canakkale Strait passage and dropped anchor at Karanlik Liman anchorage under the supervision of a Strait pilot. Crew commenced repairs. Vessel sailed after repairs on 15 Aug.
Vessel towing an unnamed coal barge lost control and allided with a pillar of the Muara Tembesi Batanghari Bridge on the Batang Hari River, South Sumatra, Indonesia. Cause: coal barge uncontrollable.
Vessel sailing between Berneray and Leverburgh had a technical issue in Berneray, UK. The issue could not be resolved, and the scheduled sailings were canceled.

Vessel had a technical failure during Canakkale Strait passage at Kumkale Point and anchored at Karanlik Liman anchorage under its own power. Crew conducted repairs, and the vessel sailed after repairs on 14 Aug.
Vessel had total engine failure in the St. Lawrence River off Becancour, Quebec, Canada. Vessel anchored off Batiscan, Quebec, for repair works. Vessel sailed from Batiscan on 14 Aug.
Vessel with 364 passengers and several vehicles failed to raise its port anchor while departing Piraeus, Greece. Damage found in capstan port; after repairs, the vessel sailed.
Vessel sustained damage while exiting Tilbury docks inside locks. Berthed at Tilbury Landing Stage (London International Cruise Terminal) for emergency repairs. Vessel sailed on 18 Aug.
Vessel attacked in the southern Red Sea. The attack was confirmed by the JMIC reports, but no connection to the US, UK, or Israel. Vessels with Israeli, US, or UK associations are at highest risk.

Vessel reportedly collided with a moored navy vessel on Fremantle Wharf, Australia. The vessel was moved out of the area. An investigation will take place to determine the cause and actions to be taken.

Vessel collided with tug Nelly 31 at Port of Bitung in North Sulawesi, Indonesia. The vessel was reportedly seen almost colliding with another vessel before it collided with an anchored tugboat, which almost sank.

Fire broke out on vessel, berthed at Jaya Container Terminal in Colombo, causing an explosion below deck. Firefighters and port services quickly extinguished the fire and safely removed the affected cargo. Investigations into the cause and cargo status are ongoing. https://splash247.com/fire-on-msc-ship-berthed-in-sri-lanka/

Vessel en route from Itaqui, Brazil, to Eregli, Turkiye had a technical failure at the west part of the Black Sea. The issue was resolved, and the vessel resumed its voyage under the supervision of an attended tug.

Loading ramp of vessel collapsed on several sailors while docked at the port of Mali Losinj, Croatia. Three sailors were killed. The ramp was lifted on the same day. The vessel was docked at a nearby shipyard until further notice.

Vessel operating on the Brattvag-Dryna route, Norway, suspended service due to a technical issue. Shuttle boat introduced to maintain the route. Service was canceled again on 16 Aug. Issue resolved, and the vessel resumed service on 16 Aug.

Vessel with 21 crew caught fire near Tanjung Emas in Semarang, Indonesia. The vessel anchored for repairs during the fire, and the crew was evacuated. The presence of gas cylinders onboard complicated firefighting efforts. The fire was put out, and an investigation is ongoing.
Vessel had a leak in the waters of Tanjung Indramayu in West Java, Indonesia. The vessel listed up to 45 degrees starboard side due to a leak in the ballast tank. The crew was safely evacuated.
Vessel had a technical failure, sheltered, and dropped anchor at Ayvalik anchorage, Turkiye. The crew commenced repairs, and the vessel sailed from Ayvalik anchorage on 14 Aug.

Vessel collided with passenger ro/ro Labobar at Port of Bitung in North Sulawesi, Indonesia. Labobar was reportedly seen almost colliding with another vessel before it collided with an anchored tug, which almost sank

Vessel had a technical failure at Novorossiysk, Russia. After repairs by the crew, the state surveyor re-inspected the vessel, verified the repairs, and granted departure permission. The vessel departed from Novorossiysk on 13 Aug.

Vessel collided with tug Nelly 31 at Port of Bitung in North Sulawesi, Indonesia. The vessel was reportedly seen almost colliding with another vessel before it collided with an anchored tugboat, which almost sank.

Smoke was noticed coming from the hospital on the upper deck of the vessel in Australia. The fire was extinguished, and an investigation revealed it originated from a refrigerator due to a short circuit.

Vessel had technical failures of its navigation systems, charts, and nautical publications at Zonguldak, Turkiye. Departure permission was temporarily canceled. After repairs were done, the vessel sailed on 13 Aug.

The vessel stalled due to a power outage while in the vicinity of Denmark, causing it to drift. Power was restored, and the vessel resumed its journey to Gothenburg the same day. The cause is under investigation.

Vessel had technical failure at the southern entrance of the Canakkale Strait. Strait authorities temporarily canceled the vessel's passage permission, and the vessel was shifted to Bozcaada Island anchorage for repairs.

Due to a mechanical issue, the vessel’s early sailing between Vancouver Island and Lower Mainland, Canada, was delayed by 1.5 hours. The vessel was seen emitting thick black smoke but resumed sailing on the same day.

Vessel collided with general cargo Winds 3, which was unable to leave the wharf due to an entangled anchor in the port of Chiba, Japan. The vessel was berthed at the time of the incident, with no damage or injuries reported.

Vessel was unable to leave the wharf due to an entangled anchor and came into contact with nearby berthed general cargo Ever Felicity in the port of Chiba, Japan. No damage or injuries were reported for either vessel.
Vessel allided with an iceberg while navigating between two fishing grounds in dense fog in the North Atlantic Ocean, Greenland. The vessel arrived in Iceland for repairs and sailed on 14 Aug.
