Vessel  en route from MMK Metalurji to Diliskelesi, Turkiye. Had technical failure during Canakkale strait passage & dropped anchor at Karanlik liman anchorage, Crew doing repairs, sailed on 06 Apr.

Cruise ship AMBIENCE collided with container vessel GREY FOX while docking in Cape Town harbor in windy conditions assisted by two tugs and local pilot. Both vessels sustained minor damages. No reports of polution, water ingress or injuries.

Vessel had technical failure off Fethiye in pos 36 41 18N, 028 59 00E, Turkiye. Voyage schedule cancelled and it returned to Fethiye passenger ferry terminal under own power. After repairs, sailed on 06 Apr.
A fire broke out on board the vessel while undergoing repairs at Arkhangelsk, Russia. Six fire engines attended and extinguished the fire within hours. No injuries were reported.

Container ship suffered engine failure and started drifting towards Little Cayman, 60 miles northeast of Grand Cayman Island. Nearby tanker LEFKAS reached the vessel and towed her to a safe position before she ran aground. All crew are safe.
Vessel had mechanical failure in pos Falkland Islands. Workboat Services Limited notified Government, Vsl was brought to Port Stanley; found vsl had failure of its bow thruster makes unserviceable

Container ship suffered propulsion failure and lost control while approaching Verrazzano Bridge, soon after departing GCT New York terminal on Staten Island. Vessel slowed down and she almost came to a stop 1500 meters from the bridge. She was then diverted to a safe anchorage off Buono Beach where repairs were carried out. Vessel resumed voyage on 7 April, bound for Norfolk.

Cruise ship AMBIENCE collided with container vessel GREY FOX while docking in Cape Town harbor in windy conditions assisted by two tugs and local pilot. Both vessels sustained minor damages. No reports of polution, water ingress or injuries.
Vessel had technical failure at Samsun, Turkiye. Crew conducted repairs and state surveyors revisited vessel to verify final repair status. Departure permission granted and vessel sailed from Samsun.

Vessel had damage to its electric mooring cable winch at Piraeus, Greece. Immediate scheduled service from Piraeus-Aegina not carried out; Continued service after winch repaired. Passengers forwarded to another ship

Local media reported that the vessel was hijacked by a gang in the Varreux terminal neighborhood at Port-au-Prince, Haiti. They took all crew hostage and stole one sixth of the cargo. The next day, Haiti's National Police engaged in a five hours gun fight managing to retrieve the vessel. Two polive officers were injured and several gang members were killed. There were no reports on the wellbeing of the crew members.

Konosha in collision with  grounded vessel, on section of Don River in vicinity of pos, Russia. vsl got damaged; resulted in property damage more than 1.7million rubles to owner. Criminal case was filed.
Vessel in collision with grounded general cargo with container, on section of Don River in vicinity of pos Russia. Sormovskiy 3067 was damaged. Criminal case was filed.
Sailings of vessel on route Horn - Andalsvag, Norway had to be suspended until further notice due to technical reasons. Fault located, repairs underway. Vsl sidelined at Andalsvag.
Vessel had technical failure in pos, S entrance of Canakkale Strait,Kumkale Point, Turkiye. ;shifted to N of Bozcaada Island anch under own power.Moored at Marmara anch for repairs.

A young man jumped out of a window after being scolded by his father from being drunk. The vessel was en route from Dominican Republic's Amber Cove cruise port to Port Everglades. A search and rescue operation was launched, but the US Coast Guard says the man has not been found.

Brazilian Federal police together with Brazilian Navy found 212kg of cocaine on board the vessel, hidden in the sea box, below the waterline. The cargo ship was about to leave for Rotterdam, Netherlands from Santos, Brazil.

Vessel with 6 POB, disabled with a fuel supply system failure in Baie de Plaisance, in pos 47 19 59.4N, 061 45 54.0W, 3.50 NM SSE Pointe Basse,QC, Canada. Crew addressed issue & vessel sd to Cap-aux Meules on own.

Vessel had broken valve in pos lat 51 53 52N, 001 40 14E, U. Proceeding to SDWA to effect repairs, EST 8hrs for repairs. Vsl being monitored by Sunk VTS. Completed repairs & underway to destination, same day.

Vessel had engine failure & power loss in pos 40 43 30N, 029 11 00E off Yalova, Turkiye. Tugs Kurtarma-17 & Sark attended. Incident location declared restricted zone. Vessel berthed at Izmit Refinery, 06 Apr.
Vessel ran aground after dragging its anchor in pos 51 40 48S, long 057 50 23W, in entrance bay to Port Stanley, Falkland Islands. Tug Giessenstroom recovered, 08 Apr.

Vessel allided with wharf with its stern during port entry operations at Nishinoomote Port, in pos 30 43 48.4N,130 59 36.4E, in Kagoshima Prefecture, Japan. Vsl had 1.5m long dent damage. Sailed without problems.

Fishing vessel Yuenan Aoyu 36062 collided with the container ship off the coast of South China's hainan province. The fishing vessel sank and the 8 crew members on board went missing. A search and rescue operation is undergoing. The SITC DANANG anchored in Sanya, Hainan. The cause of the accident is under investigation.

3 pirates boarded berthed vessel in pos 03 22 18N,099 28 13E, at Kualatanjung port, Indonesia. Duty crewman taken hostage. Escaped with stolen engine spares. Indonesian Maritime Police HQ notified.SD on 12 Apr
Vessel serving on route Claonaig-Lochranza, UK had technical issue with generator impacting passage times. Departure from Lochranza & departure from Claonaig liable to disruption/cancellation.
Vessel collided with workship in pos 34 30 39N, 133 44 13E, off Mizushima Port, Japan. No injuries / oil spill / water ingress. Investigation into the cause of incident by Coast Guard is underway.

Vessel with 7 POB lost control of its engine while coming alongside in Lerwick harbour & ran aground in pos 60 10 0.9N, 001 09 41.8W, UK. Vsl was towed alongside in Lerwick by harbour vsls same day.No water ingress/injury.

During cargo discharge operations vessel  had structural failure involving cargo hold access ladder, side hatch coaming handrails, & associated equipment, at Hereke, Turkiye. Sailed after repairs on 07 Apr.
Vessel was NUC due to an unspecified fault with the main engine, The master of the vessel estimated an hour for repairs. Completed repairs & underway.
Vessel with 41 passengers OB collided with barge Krizza Rica near Verde Island, Philippines. Vsl was damaged on right rear portion. 1 passenger injured. Docked at Calapan Port, Oriental Mind.

Bulk carrier hit the quayside while mooring at the port of Lázaro Cárdenas, Mexico. The vessel suffered minor hull damages, above the waterline, while the quayside infrastructure was significantly damaged. An investigation is underway.
Vessel had trouble at harbour mouth in Hoek van Holland due to engine failure rendering it rudderless, Crew managed to restart engine & Sd to emergency anchorage area with help of tugs.

The cruise ship has successfully rescued seven migrants from a small boat drifting near Cuba. The migrants had been stranded at sea for five days, in an attempt to reach Mexico. They were brought aboard the cruise ship where they received medical care, food, water and accomodation. If they will not be accepted by any port authorities they will be returned to Fort Lauderdale and handed over to US Customs and Border Protection.

South Korean authorities detained the vessel which was allegedly en route from North Korea to Russia, with a stop in China. Vessel failed to stop when ordered but the coast guard managed to move the vessel to Busan. The crew is refusing to cooperate with the authorities. An investigation is underway together with the US as the vessel is involved in the violation of UN Security Council resolutions on North Korea.

Cargo ship collided with the Mud Lake Junction Light in Munuscong Lake, Michigan. The coast guard responded promptly with a helicopter and several vessels and the St Mary's River channel was temporarily closed. There were no injuries or pollution reported. An investigation is being carried out.

A mobile crane at the Infraestructura Portuaria Mexicana (IPM) terminal, Altamira, Mexico caught fire and fell on the vessel. The firefighters who attended the scene said that the fire might have been caused by an oil leak in the crane engine.
Cargo vessel was NUC due to an issue with main engine in the English Channel. Crew carrier out repairs and resumed voyage the same day. No tug assistance or pollution reported.

UPDATE: 1-May-2024 The body of one of the six workers who died when the bridge collapsed was recovered by the Unified Command from a red truck. Five of the six victims have now been recovered. UPDATE: 28-Mar-2024 Two bodies have been recovered from a pick-up truck which was under water where the bridge collapsed. Divers are not able to safely navigate the water anymore due to concrete and debris in the water. Sonar scans are now being used but it's believed that vehicles, which may contain the other missing bodies, might be encased in the debris that came down from the bridge. Container ship collided with one of the pillars of Francis Scott Key Bridge in Baltimore, while en route from Baltimore to Colombo, Sri Lanka. There were no casualties or injuries on board the vessel. The collision caused several spans to collapse in the Patapsco River and Reuters reported that as many as seven people fell in the water.  Emergency personnel, led by Baltimore Mayor Brandon Scott, immediately initiated rescue efforts, with no immediate reports of casualties.

Reports vessel sank in Tanjung Sibunga, in the waters of the Malacca Strait, en route from  Medan to Batam. She initially listed about 15 degrees during the afternoon and by night she was completely sunk. All crew were evacuated safely.

Vessel was targeted by a barrage of Houthi missiles on Saturday but continued its course despite a fire breaking out on board. According to the US military, the Yemeni rebel group launched five anti-ship ballistic missiles at the 115,500-dwt Huang Pu (built 2009) in the Red Sea between 02.50 am and 04.25 am local Sanaa time on 23 March.

Vessel had elevator failure while passing off Bulgarian waters. 1 crew member was heavily injured and later died. Authorities initiated an investigation. Vessel awaiting departure permission at Constanta anchorage, Romania as of 27 March.
Vessel had technical failure during Canakkale strait passage. She dropped anchor due to low performance of engine at Sevketiye anchorage. Crew carried out repairs.
Tanker suffered main engine failure, in the Mediterranean Sea, off the coast of Greece. She was towed by tug OTHELLO, but the destination of the convoy was unknown.
Vsl experienced mechanical damage shortly after departing Vado Ligure, Italy, and went adrift about 10 NM off the coast. Tug Palmaria (IMO 9540388) towed it back to port. Stationary at La Spezia.

Two crew members passed away after an explosion took place and flooded the engine room with steam, in Half Moon Cay, Bahamas. They tried to escape but the exit doors were hydraulically shut. It seems they died due to lack of oxygen and extreme heat. An investigation was launched.

Shortly after departing Vanino en route to Sakhalin, the ferry got stuck in ice floes. It's been reported that the vessel sustained serious damages from the collision with ice and was unable to navigate. Icebreaker Captain Khlebnikov has been dispatched to clear a path for the ferry.

Vessel had technical failure during Canakkale strait passage and dropped anchor in the Karanlik liman anchorage, en route from Nemrut Bay to Istanbul, Turkey . Crew did repairs and continued voyage the next day.
Assisting tug failed to control cargo vessel SANTANA and she collided with cargo vessel WAGON B at Ceuta, Spain. WAGON B sailed from Ceuta on 24 March.

Tanker was caught in inclement weather while en route from Himeji, Japan to Ulsan, South Korea. The crew alerted the coast guard  that their vessel was tilting and that they were heading towards Mutsure Island to take refuge, but their vessel turned over. The coast guard rescued nine crew members of which only one is still alive. Two other crew are still missing but the rescue operation is ongoing.
Vessel had technical issue and was sidelined in port of Tarifa, Spain. Ferry Ceuta Jet operated alone on route Tarifa-Tangier in Strait of Gibraltar for the day.
Assisting tug failed to control cargo vessel SANTANA and she collided with cargo vessel WAGON B at Ceuta, Spain. SANTANA sailed from Ceuta on 22 March.
Vsl ran aground on reef after its gear became entangled in propeller, lost propulsion & maneuverability off Romo, Denmark. Lifeboat FRB 12 towed vessel & pulled towards Havneby.Sd ,16 Apr.

Fishing vessel allided with jetty while mooring at No.1 berth at Petropavlovsk-Kamchatskiy, Russia. She suffered hull damage with water ingress in hold. No injuried reported. An investigation was initiated.
Vessel was NUC due to an unknown problem, while transiting TSS. A leak to the engine was discovered and fixed. Vessel continued voyage the same day

Migrant rescue ship was detained for 20 days after she arrived in Marina di Carrara, Liguria, Italy with 249 migrants on board. The captain was accused of not having called at the nearest safe port assigned, as instructed by the Libyan Coastguard.
MRCC Colombo reported the vessel was adrift in Bay of Benga, Sri Lanka. Vessels in the area were requested to keep sharp lookout and report to MRCC Colombo.
Bulk carrier suffered main engine failure while preparing to depart anchorage in Prince Rupert Harbour, BC, Canada. She sailed from anchorage on 21 March, after repairs were completed.

Tanker collided with docking pontoon of Le Havre gas terminal, France causing rupture of an empty gas pipeline which contained gas residues. No pollution was reported. Vessel berthed at Asia Quay on 21 March.

Fishing vessel sank off the coast of the Russian Baltic enclave of Kaliningrad, near Pionersky, after being hit by a Russian Navy missile, during a Baltic Fleet exercise. Three crew members were killed and other four were injured and recovered from the sea by another vessel.
Cargo vessel was NUC due to unknown engine issue, 27 nm SE of Star Point, UK. Issue in split gear oil hose. Vessel sailed after repairs, the same day.
Cruise ship suffered propulsion issue 5.5 hours after sailing from Sydney, Australia. Arrived at her destination port about 90 minutes behind schedule, on 22 March.
Vessel had an engine failure upon departure from Kvitsoy. She proceeded to Mekjarvik with the other 2 engines. Repairs were carried out at Mekjarvik.
A mobile crane fell onto the vessel during loading operations at the Seltaş Shipyard in Altınova. Reports that the crane operator lost his live after being caught under the crane.

Tanker dragged anchor and started drifting in strong winds in the waters of Sumenep Regency, Indonesia en route from Makasar to Gresik. She later ran aground in Kangean Island. An investigation into the cause of breakdown and the impact on the marine environment was started.

Fire erupted in aft cabin of vessel, while moored at Tekelazhnik pier in the waters of Avachinskaya Bay in Petropavlovsk-Kamchatskiy, Russia. Crew abandoned the vessel although fire area did not exceed 4 cubic metres. No injuries reported. Fire extinguished.

Vessel had technical failure at Novorossiysk, Russia. Departure permission was cancelled until repairs. She shifted to anchorage area where repairs were being done by crew. Vessel sailed from Novorossiysk on 23 March.
Vessel had mechanical issue affecting the forward ramp. Service between Fionnphort and Iona, UK was subject to disruption or cancellation at short notice.

WK Webster reported that vessel ran aground during berthing maneuvers at Alexandria Port. As of yet, no rescue operations have started, most probably due negotiations between the owners of the vessel and Egyptian authorities.

Bulk carrier allided with the loading wharf of a manganese mine in Northern Australia, due to being caught in the rough weather caused by cyclone Megan. Mining operations have been suspended to asses the damages suffered. There are unconfirmed reports that the vessel suffered damages to the hull and one of the ballast tanks.

Vessel was forced to flee from its berth in Haiti after coming under gunfire, reportedly hit by hail of bullets from small arms, at APN terminal in Port-au-Prince. She sustained bullet damage to her superstructure.
Vessel ran aground onto shallows, while leaving the shore, at Port of Sakaide in Kagawa Prefecture, Japan. No oil spills or water ingress reported. Cement carrier was refloated by a tug the same day.

Ferry had its propeller fouled by rope which became entangled in propulsion system in Abelnes, Norway. Traffic across Hidrasund between Abelnes and Andabeloy was suspended. Vessel was sidelined in Abelnes awaiting for diver service to become available.
While sailing on the route Ardrossan-Brodick, ferry had a technical issue and her sailings were delayed. The vessel has loaded traffic and departed as soon as possible, after resolving the issue.

Vessel alerted the authorities shortly before midnight with a report that shel was in difficulty. Hvidbjornen and police vessel Ilik attended the scene. Vessel eventually sank  and all crew rescued safely.
An Indian crew member was evacuated off Paradip in Odisha, India and handed to the shipping agent at Paradip for further medical care.
Cruise ship had a mechanical issue on her current sailing and was delayed for four hours back in New York, United States. This had a knock-on effect for embarkation on the next cruise.
A missile attack occurred in the Gulf of Aden off Yemen, causing no damage and allowing the vessel and crew to proceed to their next port.

Tanker ran aground after technical malfunction with its engine amid high waves on the shores of Waer Village near Kei Islands, Indonesia. Tug Wesley attended the scene, but refloating attempts failed. Local residents secured vessel.

Fire erupted on board the vessel while docked at Ashtabula, southwest of Erie, Ohio, on Lake Erie. US Coast Guard deployed boats and helicopters to assist. They also reported that all crew are safe. Unconfirmed reports state that the fire was soon extinguished and damage was being assessed.
Vessel had technical failure together with emergency alarm systems at Zonguldak, Turkey. Crew carried out repairs and sailed on 22 March.

A fire broke out on board vessel while undergoing repairs alongside at Livadiya, Russia. Fire was extinguished with the help of 10 fire appliances and 48 personnel. The interior of the vessel was damaged by fire.
Vessel allided with pier in Puerto Deseado, Argentina while entering port. She had minor hull damage on starboard side above waterline. Sailed on 18 March after a hull inspection.

Vessel allided with pier No.20 while attempting to berth in Keelung, Taiwan. She suffered gaping hole in stern, but sailed after emergency repairs on 20 March to Kaohsiung. Tug cable, cable piles were damaged on pier and cement on wharf came off.

Vessel had engine failure, loss of power and drifted South off Istanbul strait, Turkey. She dropped anchor at Bakirkoy anchorage with help of Coastal Safety tug Kurtarma-11. Resumed voyage on 17 March.

South Wales Police boarded the vessel at Port Talbot, UK, after they received a call about a possible safeguarding issue regarding an individual on board the vessel. After examining the ship, no evidence was discovered of anybody being at risk.

Container ship knocked over three large container cranes while attempting to dock at the Evyap Port in Istanbul, Turkey. Vessel was unable to stop in time and her deck collided with one of the cranes, which toppled over other 2 cranes. Several containers also fell into the water. Turkish media reported that one crane operator was seriously injured. An investigation is underway.

Vessel's service from Isle of Wight to Southampton was suspended due to an issue with starboard Jet room at Southampton, UK. Service was suspended until at least 22 March. Blue Funnel was inserted as a replacement.
Cargo ship was NUC due to broken pipe to fuel pump off Prawle Point, UK. Initially it was believed to be issue with filters. Repairs were carried out and she continued voayge the same day.
Bulk carrier reported an explosion 65nm west of Al Hudaydah, Yemen. There were no damages to the vessel and no injuries reported. The Houthis announced that they were responsible for the attack.

Vesel accidentally discharged approximately 500 gallons of diesel fuel, 30 miles offshore of Fort Bragg, California, while en route to Humboldt Bay. The US Coast Guard initiated an investigation and stated that they do not expect the shoreline to be affected.
Experienced a missile attack on the Southern Red Sea, causing no damage to the vessel and its crew.
Vessel allided with pier during berth manoeuvring at Mardas container terminal, Ambarli, Turkey. Suffered slight structural damage on fore part side shell plating above water level.
Vessel's departure was cancelled due to technical error as bow ramp did not fold up while departing from port of Stockholm, Sweden. She sailed from Stockholm on 16 March.
A crew member was evacuated by helicopter after falling ill 300nm from Galicia, en route to Rotterdam. He was taken to Alvedro, north-western Spain.
Vessel had total failure of its bridge propulsion control system in vicinity of Brooks Bay, 5.40nm SW Cape Cook, BC, Canada. She sailed to Victoria for repairs. No pollution reported.

Red Funnel UK announced the cancellation of six sailings on the vessel, on the West Cowes to Southampton route, due to issue with the port water jet system. Ferry was taken out of service at Southampton.

A crew member went missing in Singapore waters. The MPA, Police Coast Guard and Singapore Civil Defence Force craft were deployed to search for the missing person within Singapore Port Limits. Also, vessels in vicinity were requested to keep a lookout  and report to MRCC Singapore.
Cargo ship ran aground while berthing at Ribadeo port, Spain. Two tugs were dispatched to assist with refloating.
Bulk carrier was NUC due to clogged fuel filters, approximately 33nm off Portland Bill. Repairs were carried out by the crew and vessel continued voyage within one hour.
Cargo vessel had engine failure in the North Sea, while en route from Roytta, Finland to Terneuzen, Netherlands. No injuries reported.

Container ship collided with bulk carrier HUAHAI 78 off the port of Qingdao, while enroute to Shanghai. The bulk carrier was severely damaged with water ingress and was rendered unable to navigate. EVER LUCID remained at anchor in Qingdao, awaiting investigation.
Cargo ship experienced failure of bridge navigation systems, gyro compass and GMDSS communication equipment at Novorossiysk, Russia. Crew carried out repairs.
Reports vessel made bottom contact during icebreaking operation in St. Barbe Harbour, Stony Point, NL, Canada. She sailed to Corner Brook for damage assessment.

Vessel was struck by tanker CIMIL while moored at pier in S.Port of Wolgast, Germany. Starboard side was hit and suffered a dent in outer hull, which was found after pumping out ballast water. She sailed from Wolgast on 19 March.

Vessel collided with the quay in Enklinge and scheduled departures from Hummelvik and Torsholma had to be canceled. Human error was thought to be behind the incident. Vessel proceeded to Torsholma and sailed from the port the next day.
Fishing vessel experienced engine failure and was disabled in Bay of Fundy off Grand Manan, 3.30nm ENE of Fish Head, NB, Canada. She was towed to North Head by Canadian CG Ship SAMBRO.

Vessel collided with starboard side of cargo ship MAIKE during departure manoevre, at pier in S.Port of Wolgast, Germany. No injuries or leaks reported. CIMIL left Wolgast on 14 March, bound for Lubeck.
Ferry suffered a mechanical failure on departure from Valleta. Sailing to Gozo was cancelled and passengers were advised to board the next availabe ferry.

Ferry suffered mechanical issues and was taken out of Bodo-Gildeskal route, Norway. Ferry Nordic Lady was inserted as a replacement. FJORDSTROM was sidelined in Bodo for repair. She sailed on 20 March.

Vessel developed a list of several degrees to starboard side at its berth in Lunde port, Norway. The list was caused by masses of ice that piled up around the vessel. This caused water to enter one side. Rescue services attended with water pumps and stabilised the vessel.
The police reported smoke aboard vessel, at Lofoten Sveiseindustri in Svolvar. Fire crews worked to localise the fire on the boat, but it started to burn elsewhere in the yard.

UPDATE: 14-Apr-2024 The vessel has been released after the pirates received a ransom of $5.00m paid by the vessel's owner, the KSRM Group. Pirates ‘take 23 seafarers hostage’ after  hijacking the Abdullah off Somalia. Early reports suggest all 23 crew on board the vessel have been taken hostage following the incident 600 nautical miles (1,111 km), north-east of Mogadishu, Somalia.
Vessel had technical problem while sailing from Husavik to Sandvikvag, Norway. Service was suspended and ferry docked in Husavik for repairs. Sailed in the afternoon, the same day.
Ferry had engine breakdown while operating on Fjelberg - Sydnes - Utbjoa route, Norway. Vessel was disabled just outside Utbjoa and was towed to quay in Innbjoa by a farming vessel.
Vessel ran aground during icebreaking operation in Anse Saint-Jean, 1.10 nm South Pointe au Boeuf, QC, Canada. She was refloated with high tide and resumed operations after damages assessment.
Vessel had technical failure and dropped anchor at Edremit anchorage, Turkey. Crew carried our repairs and sailed from anchorage on 13 March, bound for Aquaba.

An underwater object damaged the ferry's propellers, which forced the operator to run a revised timetable on the Fishbourne-Portsmouth route. Passengers were offered alternative routes as close as possible to their original scheduled departures.

Vessel had vibration issue which required investigations at quay, Lochaline, UK;removed from service. LOCH LINNHE took over sailings between Lochaline and Fishnish. As of 28 March the vessel was under repairs at Greenock.
Attacked multiple times by missiles in the Gulf of Aden, Yemen. Coalition warships provided assistance, and the vessel and crew were safe.

Cargo vessel allided with public wharf after she broke off her mooring linesat Port Cartier, Canada. Tugs Ocean Ross Gaudreault and Ocean Yvan Desgagnes assisted. The vessel sailed from Port Cartier on 17 March.
Tanker was attacked by Ukraine's armed forces after she ran aground south side of Dnipro River, near Kherson. She suffered major damages.

Rescue ship was detained for 60 days in Reggio Calabria, Italy after she arrived with 145 rescued migrants on board. The Italian authorities claim that the vessel has taken the refugees on board even though the Lybian Coastguard was prepared to take them.

Vessel suffered starboard main engine failure while en route from Iraklion to Piraeus, Greece. She sailed to port of Piraeus under own power and was detained by local port authority until repairs were completed.
Cargo vessel had technical failure at Novorossiysk, Russia. Departure permission was temporarily cancelled until repairs were completed on 12 March.
A fire broke out in the superstructure of the ferry under the wheelhouse, while in Biograd na Moru, Croatia. The fire emanated in the captain's cabin. Firefighters extinguished it quickly.

Oil tanker collided with a crude oil import facility in Gujarat, India, while en route from Sikka port to New York, US. Full extent of damages is yet unknown, but there are concerns regarding the damages this incident has caused to crucial links in the Indian energy supply chain.
Ferry ran aground off Romblon, Philippines. All passengers and crew were evacuated. No injuries or pollution reported.

Vessel ran aground while towing FV CARRIE LEE at harbor entrance, Saulnierville, 2.90nm NNE Pointe des Marechal, NS, Canada. She was soon refloated and completed towing operations before returning to Westport.
Sailings of vessel were temporarily cancelled due to a mechanical issue on Tobermory-Kilchoan route, UK. Repairs were carried out and sailings resumed the same day.
Ferry suffered engine failure while en route from Piraeus port to Aigina Island, Greece. The vessel sailed back to Piraeus port where it remained stationary for repairs.
Ferry suffered mechanical failure which caused disruptions on the route Mallaig-Small Isles, UK. Departures from Mallaig and Armadale were cancelled for repairs.

The vessel's captain fell ill in the Mediterranean’s Balearic Sea, en route from Barcelona, Spain to Fos sur Mer, France. He was evacuated by Salvamento Marítimo in Barcelona and later transferred o a hospital.
Bulk carrier experienced engine issues and had to drop anchor about 25 nm South from Portland Bill, UK. Repairs were carried out and vessel continued voyage to the Port of Damietta, Egypt.

Bulk carrier was targeted by two Houthi missiles while sailing southeast of Aden, Yemen. The captain of the vessel reported two explosions ahead of the vessel, but she didn't sustain any damages and continued voyage. No injuried reported either.

A crew member was medevaced by the Argentine Naval Prefecture after suffering severe abdominal pains, outside the Argentine Exclusive Economic Zone, 261nm from the city of Puerto Madryn. A helicopter was dispatched and the man was transferred to an ambulance which took him to Trelew Sanatorium.
Cargo vessel suffered technical failure and sheltered and dropped anchor at Datca anchorage, Turkey. Repairs were carried out by crew and vessel continued voyage on 10 March.
Fishing vessel suffered water ingress in St. George's Channel, UK. A Coast Guard helicopter attended with a pump which reduced the water level. Lifeboat Victor escorted the vessel to Ireland.
Ferry had issue with the radar system and was restricted to daylight opreations. Service will conclude in Castlebay rather than Lochboisdale. Engineer will join in Oban for repairs.

Cargo ship suffered engine failure at Ambarli anchorage, Turkey. She berthed at Ambarli container terminal where cargo was discharged. She was then granted single voyage to Yalova shipyard and berthed at Altinova on 16 March.
Ferry had technical issue and sailings on route Largs - Cumbrae, UK were suspended. Vessel moved to Garvel Clyde Shipyard in Greenock for repairs which were completed on 16 March.

Fishing vessel ran aground while approaching O Freixo port entrance, Spain. A vessel from O Freixo port evacuated the 20 crew members, while rescue vessel Salvamar Regulus evaluated the situation of the fishing vessel.
Cargo ship experienced failure of navigation systems along with alarms at Tuapse, Russia. Departure was canceled until repairs were completed on 12 March.

Cargo vessel ran aground off Masnedo, close to new Storstrom Bridge construction, Denmark. General cargo Anita Hagedorn attended to lighten cargo. ANTONIA B was refloated on 20 March and sailed from Masnedo on 24 March.

Container ship suffered main enginefailure to to a defect in the starting air system, while anchored in St. Lawrence River off Les Bergeronnes, 1.70nm SE Pointe a la Carriole, Canada. Crew carried out repairs.

Tug Chacopata struck the ferry while assisting her during a docking manoeuvre, at the Port of Guanta in the state of Anzoátegui Venezuela. The ferry had a large hole above the waterline on the starboard side.
Tanker suffered main engine failure upon departure from section No. 74 of Port de Montreal, QC, Canada. Vessel anchored off Pointe aux Trembles and sailed after repairs on 8 March.

Bulk carrier suffered engine failure and had rudder problems in the waters of the Santa Cruz de Tenerife port, Spain. Vessel was detained until the repairs were done and sailed from Santa Cruz de Tenerife port on 11 March.

Tug struck ferry Virgen Del Valle II while assisting her during a docking manoeuvre, at the Port of Guanta in the state of Anzoátegui Venezuela. The ferry had a large hole above the waterline on the starboard side.
Sea surge hit vessel before reaching Casamicciola Terme port entrance. Vessel to roll and shake breaking anchor chains to garage. No injuries or damages reported.
Vessel ran aground in Pozzuoli port, Italy,  probably due to low tide. Vessel Agata refloated her and towed her to port. Operations were resumed after technical checks by CG and RINA.

Vessel collided with general cargo vessel New Hampshire on Waal near Woudrichem, Netherlands. No injuries or pollution reported. Both vessels suffered significant bow damage. On 10 March EILTANK 70 berthed in Gertruidenberg for repairs.

Container ship suffered machinery failure of exhaust mounting screws due to vibration and went NUC. MCA duty counter pollution and salvage officer was informed. Vessel sailed after repairs on 7 March.

UPDATE: 22-Mar-2024 Reports that the vessel is being towed by by a UAE-owned tug that is sanctioned by the US for supporting Iran. The planned destination is Oman as she was denied refuge in the port of Djibouti. UPDATE: On 12 March 11 Filipino crew members were repatriated, and other two returned to Philippines two day later, after they were deemed fit to travel by medical authorities in Djibouti. Bulk carrier was hit by a Houthi missile 50 nm southwest of Aden. The ship was then set ablaze and started drifting. The crew members and the security guards abandoned the vessel. The British Embassy and a senior US official confirmed that three crew were killed by the strike.
Tanker suffered main engine issues and went NUC in English Channel UK. Vessel used backup propulsion system and anchored in Falmouth Harbour for repairs. She resumed sailing on 19 March.
Ferry serving on route Borgan-Ramstadlandet, Norway, had technical trouble and lifeboat had to assist it to quay in Ramstadlandet. Vessel was sidelined for repairs.

Vessel collided with fully cellular containership Blooming Earth and a gantry crane on shore, while approaching berth in Fukuyama Port, Japan. Crane derailed from moving rail. No injuries or pollution reported.

A crew member complained of pain while off the coast of Barfleur and was medevaced by a H160 helicopter from the French Navy base in Maupertus. He was sropped off at Tourlaville rescue centre and later admitted to the emergency room.

Patrol vessel collided with a China Coast Guard vessel during resupply mission to Filipino troops,  on a remote outpost in South China Sea. The collision resulted  in minor structural damages to the vessel.

Fishing vessel had technical issues near Skomvaer, Norway. Lifeboat Leif Erik Simonsen towed her to Vaeroy, then lifeboat Erik Bye towed her to Skarvik AS yard for repairs. She resumed sailings on 27 March.

Fire broke out inside battery compartment on board vessel moored at Pier 32 at Port of Catania, Italy. Catania Port Fire Brigade intervened. No injuries reported. Vessel sailed from Catania on 7 March.
Ferry had mechanical failure and was sidelined in Stavanger, Norway, for repairs. Ferry Fjord Viking was inserted as replacement vessel on route Stavanger - Byoyene - Hommersak, Norway.

Fully cellular containership Reflection collided with the vessel and the gantry crane on shore while approaching berth in Fukuyama Port, Japanon. Crane derailed from moving rail. No injuries or pollution reported.

Oil carrier suffered a technical failure, en route from Zonguldak, Turkiye to Rostov-na-Donu, Russia. Vessel sheltered and dropped anchor at Sinop anchorage for repairs. She resumed sailing on 8 March.
Cargo vessel had technical failure during Canakkale strait passage en route from Nemrut Bay to Istanbul, Turkey. She anchored in Karanlik liman anchorage for repairs.

A fire erupted on board the vessel after she was targeted by two Houthi missiles, one of which hit the water and the other struck the vessel's accomodation block, in the Arabian sea, while transiting the Gulf of Aden. There were no reports of injuries.

Cargo ship suffered propulsion fault while traversing the Baltic, en route from Saint Petersburg, Russia. She arrived at Rostock, Germany for repairs but after routine inspection it was discovered that the vessel was loaded with 251 containers of birch plywood along with uranium, destined for US. The birch plywood is included in the sanctions list imposed by the EU and vessel was detained by custom authorities.
Tanker had rudder failure and unnavigable, 25 KM SW of Irozaki Lighthouse, en route from Yokkaichi to Aomori, Japan. A tugboat arranged by owner of vessel went to incident location.
Bulk carrier suffered damages during cargo operations, alongside at Fraser Surrey Docks in Surrey, BC, Canada. Repairs were carried out and vessel continued voyage.

Cargo vessel allided with mobile bridge of Bizerte, Tunisia, during docking manoeuvre. The bridge reopened to port traffic, while the vessel suffered damages to bow and was in need of repairs. She sailed from Bizerte on 27 March.

Cargo ship ran aground on a sandbank in the estuary of the River Severn, when approaching the Sharpness docks. A tugboat from Portishead attempted and failed to refloat the vessel due to low tide. Another rescue will be attempted in a few days with high tide. No injuries, damages or pollition reported.
Cargo vessel experienced technical failure and had to drop anchor at Sinop anchorage, Turkey. Repairs were carried out by crew. As of 11 March vessel was at the Port of Nemrut Bay.
Fishing vessel ran aground on North side of Inis Mor, Aran Island, Ireland. The five crew members were rescued by R115. Vessel was taking on water, and developed list to port side.
Vessel was temporarily withdrawn from service due to an oil leak in its portside stabiliser while serving between Oban, Coll and Tiree, UK.
Cargo vessel had engine failure South off Canakkale Strait, Turkey. Tug Ramazan Bey towed her towards Tuzla and berthed at Desan Yardgem United Shipyard on 6 March.

Tuna fishing vessel ran aground after suffering engine failure off the coast of Kozushima Island in the group of Izu Islands, south of Tokyo. The engine stalled and vessel started drifting with strong winds and rough seas. She hit rocks and grounded northwest side of Kozushima Island. The coast guard attended and rescued the crew members by helicopter but one of them was pronounced dead at a nearby clinic.

A fire erupted on the engine room while near the mouth of the Saguenay River, en route from Montreal to Sines, Portugal. The vessel was disabled and started drifting but tugs attended and prevented her from drifting. Fire was extinguished within an hour. No reports of injuries or pollution. No cargo damaged.
Cargo ship suffered rudder damage, while sailing West of Ouessant Island, France. Tug Abeille Bourbon towed her to Brest. Vessel returned to the anchorage in Bay of Roscanvel on 20 March.

A crew member was arrested after a guest abord the vessel reported she had found a hidden camera in her bathroom. The Phillipines national was detained on the ship on the 25 February until the vessel arrived at port Everglades, Fort Lauderdale, Florida. All his electronics and digital devices were investigated and numerous videos of females undressing were discovered, as well as child pornography. The man admitted he had placed the cameras in the guests' bathrooms since he started working onboard the vessel in December 2023.

Cruise ship rescued 14 people who were stranded between Cozumel, Mexico and Western Cuba. A rescue vessel was deployed from the cruise ship and brough them aboard after a couple of trips. They were disembarked at Roatan, Honduras, one of the vessel's ports of call.
Cargo vessel suffered mechanical failure and had to drop anchor at Bodrum anchorage, Turkey. Repairs were carried out by crew members.
Cargo ship had technical failure during Canakkale Strait passage and dropped anchor at Karanlik liman anchorage for repairs by crew members.

Vessel suffered propulsion failure and ran aground on Weser at Moorlose church en route from Bremen, Germany to Dunkirk, France. Four tugs of Boluda refloated her and towed her back to industry port of Bremen.
Ferry suffered mechanical breakdown and required tug assistance to enter the port of Ceuta, Spain. Sailings between Ceuta and Algeciras were suspended until repairs were completed.

A crew member was medevaced by the US Coast Guard 100nm off Guam in the Pacific Ocean, while en route to Vietnam. He complained of severe abdominal pain and was airlifted to the Naval Hospital Guam. He was then transferred to the Guam Memorial Hospital in stable condition.

Tanker collided with an unnamed vessel in Danish waters, wn route to Primorsk. She dropped anchor south of Copenhagen on 16 March and then shifted to a repair station in Denmark. The Andromeda Star is part of the “shadow fleet” of Russia, a group of vessels that is used to transport Russian oil outside the scope of sanctions.
Vessel was NUC due to engine problems which led to restrictions in manoeuvrability. Crew members changed valve on cylinder head number 2 and were able to continue voyage the same day.
Vessel experienced fire on board, which was traced to electrical cables in the switch room. She later continued passage & underway to her destination.
Vessel was boarded by 8 perpetrators at Mongla Anchorage, Bangladesh. The horn was sounded and PA announcement was made. Perpetrators fled and escaped with stolen vessel's stores. All crew were safe.

Bulk carrier allided with pier causing damage to port structures in port of Vera, Russia, located S of Podyapolskiy, Russia. Vessel was detained for 72 hours and corresponding orders were signed on 4 March.

Passenger ship suffered technical failure while serving between Trondheim & Vanvikan, Norway. All her sailings were cancelled until the next day. Alternative transport was arranged for the passengers.
A fire broke out in the storage room on 1st deck of vessel during dismantling works in St. Petersburg, Russia. Welding work was being conducted on board.
Vessel experienced technical failure at Tuapse, Russia. Departure was canceled until repairs were completed on 7 March.

Vessel suffered total failure of one of the generators while secured in Botwood, NL, Canada. All operations were suspended while repairs were carried out. No reports of pollution. The ship sailed on 3 March.

Container ship suffered engine failure due to propulsion system breakdown and started drifting 300nm off the coast of Vigo, Spain while en route from Altamira, Mexico to Antwerp, Belgium. She was towed to Vigo by the VB HISPANIA, a unit from the Boluda fleet, where she arrived on 5 March.

Vessel suffered engine failure, west of Ouessant, France. Crew were unable to repair so fire fighting tug Abeille Bourbon was deployed from Brest to assist. The ship berthed at Damen Ship repair Yard in Brest.
Ferry experienced problems with the bow thrusters, resulting in cancellation of sailings on route Hofles-Geisnes-Lund, Norway.
A fire erupted on board the vessel in Dar Es Salaam, Tanzania. Seven crew members suffered injuried and one died. No reports on the cause of the fire.

Vessel's chief engineer was electrocuted while working in the engine room, at a harbor in Antigua. Emergency services attended and took him to a hospital where he was pronounced dead. An investigation is underway.
Oil tanker ran aground on Moselle at river km 74.2 in Ediger-Eller area between Fankel and St. Aldegund, Germany. She was refloated and continued her voyage on 2 March.

Two missiles flew into the 7,600-dwt Kuruoglu 3 (built 1990) as it was moored in Kherson — a port city right on the frontline of Russia’s war on Ukraine — and hit it from the starboard side, Ambrey Intelligence cited the vessel’s owners as saying on Wednesday.

Vessel experienced engine failure during West bound transit of Kiel Canal in switch Schwartenbek, Germany. Tug Parat attended and towed the vessel back to Kiel where it berthed at Voith Quay in North Port.

Cargo ship experienced engine failure as she was due to dock at Mekjarvik, Stavanger, in Randaberg, Norway. High winds caused her to drift away from shore and into the Byfjord. A tug was dispacthed to assist and vessel docked safely.
Bulk carrier dragged its anchor, in the Bay of Fundy off Saint John, Canada. Managed to heave up the anchor and proceeded southbound to avoid running aground.
Bulk carrier experienced main engine exhaust system overheating and was NUC in the English Channel, UK. Repairs were carried out by the crew and resumed voyage the same day.
Fire erupted on board the vessel while moored at Viking Quay for scrapping by Smedegaarden Ship Recycling, Denmark. Seven individuals were taken hospital due to heavy smoke inhalation.
Vessel was sidelined in port of Botnhamn due to a mechanical fault. Sailings between Botnhamn and Brensholmen, Norway were cancelled until repairs are completed.

Cargo vessel had technical failure of auxiliary engines pertinent equipment together with alarm units, at Bartin, Turkey. Repairs were done by crew and shore-based support team. Vessel sailed two days later.

Fire broke out on board the fishing vessel, 4 miles SSE of mouth of port of Castello, Spain. The five crew members were rescued by vessel Gregal Segundo de Cosulmar. Vessel suffered serious damages to port side and she sank the same day.

Vehicles carrier made bottom contact with an unidentified object off Matsuyama, Japan. Waters at the site were about 40-70, deep but some rocks or reefs could have been hidden. Vessel's bottom was inspected and was able to sail from Matsuyama the next day.
Cargo ship suffered main engine failure upon arrival at an anchorage in Vancouver Harbour, Brockton Point, BC, Canada. Vessel dropped anchor and crew carried out repairs.

Vessel allided with pier 2 when approaching old lock of Kiel Canal in Brunsbuttel, from the Elbe, Germany. She suffered minor damages to bow and was able to resume voyage the same day. Two wooden dolphins on the pier were significantly damaged.
Livestock carrier had technical failure, sheltered and dropped anchor at west part of Sinop anchorage, Turkey. Repairs were being carried out by the crew.
Sailings of vessel were cancelled due to a technical error while operating between Arasvika and Henneset, Norway. Vessel resumed sailings the next day.

Vessel was detained by the Nigerian Navy after she turned off AIS signal, which prompted the navy to dispatch a gunboat to investigate the suspicious vessel. The ship was located 174nm off Nigerian coast and after an investigation it was discovered she was transporting about two million litres of crude oil without approval from relevant authorities.
Fire broke out in forward storeroom, in bow of the vessel, while undergoing repairs in port of Voznesenye, Russia. Fire was taken under control and put out. No injuries reported.
An oil leak was found during routine check by the chief engineer in Helsingor, Denmark. Departures between Helsingor and Helsingborg were cancelled until repairs completed.
Tanker was NUC due to engine failure in the Strait of Dover, UK. Vessel dropped anchor to carry out repairs.
Ostend Radio, Belgium, reported that the cargo ship lost an anchorand its chain at Westhinder anchorage, Belgium.

According to US Central Command (Centcom), the USS Mason shot down an anti-ship ballistic missile fired from Houthi territory over the Gulf of Aden at about 14:00 GMT. The projectile’s likely target was the 49,700-dwt Torm Thor (built 2015). “Neither the USS Mason nor the Torm Thor were damaged and there were no injuries,” Centcom said.

Container ship allided with masonry while entering South chamber in Kiel-Holtenau, Germany, due to dense fo. Vessel suffered minimal damage and was able to sail after inspections.An investigation was underway.
RCC Norfolk, UK received a distress signal from the vessel sailing in western N Atlantic. Vessels in vicinity were requested to keep a sharp lookout, assist and report to RCC Norfolk.
Vessel experienced fault with engine fuel injector in the North Sea. Repairs were done and resumed voyage the same day. She arrived in Amsterdam on27 February.
Fire and smoke were spotted coming from funnel of vessel while heading for Wan Chai, Hong Kong. She berthed at Wan Chai pier for investigation. Fireboat and 2 police launches were deployed to assist.
Tanker ran aground about 160 metres from Mateshima Lighthouse, Japan. No oil leakage or water ingress. Tugboats towed her offshore on 27 Febraury.
Container ship was NUC due to a cracked fuel pipe, in the North Sea. Crew carried out repair works and vessel resumed her voyage.

Port authorities prevented the vessel from docking at Port Louis, due to sanitary concerns. Reports say that about 100 passengers on board complained of diarrhea and othe 15 were quarantined with more complicated symptoms. Health officials took samples for medical tests and once the results are out port authorities will make further decisions.
Sailings of vessel were cancelled due to mechanical issues, at Blacks Harbour, Canada. She returned to service on 26 February after repairs.
Bulk carrier ran aground while entering the port of Tripoli, Libya. Libyan Ports Company tugs assisted and refloated vessel the next day. She then berthed at Tripoli Seaport.

Cargo vessel had engine failure at mouth of Western Scheldt near Vlissingen, Netherlands. She anchored at buoy RV-4 near Commandoweg and the next day Multratug 22 escorted her to Ijmuiden for repairs.

Cruise ship had engine failure off the coast of Florida, en route from the Bahamas to Baltimore, Maryland. She had to make an unscheduled stop at Port Canaveral and later resumed her voyage to Baltimore.
A crew member was medevaced by the Brazilian Coast Guard after he sustained serious injuried while carrying out elevator maintenance repairs. He was transferred to a hospital in critical condition.

Vessel suffered main engine failure in Lerwick, UK. Local contractors and council engineers in Lerwick were mobilised to commence removal of engine for further investigation. Extent and timeline for repairs is unknown.
Research vessels HDMS ABSALON and ESBERN SNARE collided at port of Frederikshavn, Denmark due to hurricane like gusts of wind. Both vessels sufferd damages. An ivestigation was launched.
Research vessels HDMS ABSALON and ESBERN SNARE collided at port of Frederikshavn, Denmark due to hurricane like gusts of wind. Both vessels sufferd damages. An ivestigation was launched.
Cargo vessel suffered engine failure in First Narrows of Vancouver Harbour, Canada, while assisted by two tugs. Crew carried out repairs in English Bay and continued voyage the next day.
Bulk carrier suffered propulsion system failure and started drifting 12nm of Cape Espichel, S of Lisbon, Portugal. Tug Castelo de Sao Jorge towed her to Sines the next day.
Tanker was NUC and went adrift due to an engine fault in the English Channel. Repairs were completed by crew and vessel continued voyage the same day.
Fishing vessel rwuired assistance after a rope got entangled in the propeller, NW of Bleik, Norway. NSSR lifeboat Dagfinn Paust towed her to port and sailed the next day bound for Senjahopen.
Ferry suffered damages to starboard main engine was prohibited from sailing from port of Kyllini until repairs were completed.

Cargo vessel experienced structural failure of cargo hold access ladder, side hatch coaming handrails and pertinent equipment at Hereke, Turkey, during cargo discharge operations. Stevedore duty teams carried our repairs until 25 February.

Cargo ship suffered failure of auxiliary engines together with alarm systems at Diliskelesi, Turkey. She got permission for a single voyage to Constanta for repairs on 25 February and on 29 February she arrived at shipyard in Navodari, Constanta, Romania.

The ISLANDER was struck by a missile while transtiting the Gulf of Aden, 70nm off the southern coast of Yemen, en route from Thailand to Egypt. A fire erupted after being hit but there were only minor damages. No reports of injuries. The ship continued her voyage.

The Australian Maritime Safety Authority banned the 91,800-dwt KMAX Leader (built 2010) for 12 months for serious safety violations and the owner’s lack of willingness to communicate. 26-Oct-2023 : experienced mechanical issues while in the vicinity of the Port of Gladstone in Queensland on the east coast on 26 October 2023. The kamsarmax, which is listed under “chartered vessels” on the Cyprus Sea Lines website, reported unidentified engine room vibrations. According to AMSA, on 28 October the ship’s agent advised work had begun on the mechanical issues and would take eight to 10 days to complete.
Vessel was NUC due to cooling pump failure and cracked cylinder head, 24nm from Boulby, UK. She was towed to Teesport by Normand Sigma on 24 February.
Ferry experienced mechanical issues while serving between Belvika and Vengsoy, Norway. Service was cancelled and vessel was sidelined in Vengsoy for repairs until the next day.
Vessel's sailings between Southampton and Cowes, Isle of Wight, United Kingdom, were cancelled due to a technical issue. Teams were working hard to repair.
Ferry suffered rudder failure and had to cancel sailings between Swartz Bay and Tsawwassen, Canada. Divers investigated and replacement parts were ordered.
Cargo vessel suffered engine failure in the west part of the Black Sea, Romani. Tug HAKTAN 1 commenced towage to Tuzla shipyard on 29 February.

A construction worker fell off pier after the vessel allided with oil platform during repair works at Botlek in Rotterdam, Netherlands. A search and rescue operation was launched but the man's body was not found. An investigation was underway.

Cargo vessel allided with rocky masiff in area of Ksamil, Albania after steering system failure. She suffered cracks in her hull and capsized on her left side. Later she entered port of Limon for repairs.

Local authorities found three tons of cocaine hidden in several areas of the vessel, after they received a tip about a drug mafia member  being employed as a sailor on the ship. A forklift truck was needed to remove all the cocaine at the Oswald Quay in Hamburg, Germany. The vessel left Hamburg on 24 February, bound for Dakar, Senegal.

Ro-Ro cargo ship FREESIA SEAWAYS struck PETUNIA SEAWAYS while mooring at Arendal in Gothenburg on arrival from Immingham, due to strong winds. The impact was light with barely any damages. Tugs towed the vessel back to the right berth.

Ro-Ro cargo ship FREESIA SEAWAYS struck PETUNIA SEAWAYS while mooring at Arendal in Gothenburg on arrival from Immingham, due to strong winds. The impact was light with barely any damages. Tugs towed the vessel back to the right berth.
Spotted by a UAV while transiting in the southern Red Sea off Al Hudaydah, Yemen. The ship master reported the sighting, and all crew members were evacuated without injury.
Tug experienced a broken trailer while towing former French Navy frigate Cassard, at the entrance to the Gironde estuary, France. Tugs RM Thomas and TSM Dranec assisted.

Ferry ran aground outside Herfol, in Herforlenna, Norway. NSSR-lifeboat RS 172-Ragnar Stoud Platou attended and pulled vessel off ground after about one hour. Ferry sailed under own power and berthed in Skjaerhalden.
Ferry had a bent propeller blad which caused the vessel to vibrate, on Edmonds - Kingston, US route. The blade was straightened the next day.

The vessel's chief engineer died on board, two days away from the coast of Brazil, while en route from Vigo to Falkland Islands. The vessel arrived at Recife, Brazil the next day. An autopsy will establish the exact cause of death.

Houthi military spokesman Yahya Saree said the militia carried out a “targeting operation” against the “MSC Silver” in the Gulf of Aden with naval missiles, according to a machine translation of a statement. His comments were posted on the account of Houthi spokesman Ameen Hayyan on X, formerly Twitter.
Sailings between Revsnes and Flesnes, Norway were cancelled due to a mechanical fault. Ferry was towed to Harstad for repairs and sailed on 23 February.

Tanker was NUC due to a fault with the main engine crankpin bearing, 25nm SW of Portland Bill, UK. Temporary repairs were carried out and vessel sailed to Portland port with assistance from tug Fortitude.
One of the vessel's boilers suffered a loud explosion and black smoke came out, during repair works at Tamaulipas, Mexico. An investigation was launched.
Vessel suffered engine failure off the coast of the Shimane Prefecture, Japam, while en route from Port Klang to Hokkaido. She started drifting in the Sea of Japan, and was towed by patrol boat OKI.
Vessel suffered propulsion system failure upon arrival at section No. 58 of Port de Montreal,  Cap sur Mer, QC, Canada. Vessel was secured and crew assessed the issue.
An object gor stuck in the bow thruster and had to be removed by a diver, at Stornoway, UK. Vessel resumed sailing to Ullapool, UK the next day.

A fire erupted in the port side of the foreship during repair works at the Baramitra Sejahtera Shipyard in Batam City, Indonesia. Fire engines attended and extinguished fire in about two hours. No injuries reported.
Cargo vessel had technical failure of bridge navigation and communication systems at Novorossiysk, Russia. Sailing was banned until repairs were completed on 25 February.
Cargo vessel was NUC due to engine issues and started drifting in the English Channel, UK. Crew determined that the reduction valves needed changing. Vessel resumed voyage within an hour.

Two explosions happened in close proximity to the vessel, 100 nm East of Aden, Yemen. Vessel suffered damage to paintwork and some windows broke. All crew were safe. Houthi rebles stated that the attack was not intentional.

Vessel was hit by an Uncrewed Aerial System in Bab al-Mandab Strait, about 60 nm north of Djibouti, which resulted in superficial damage to accommodation superstructure. No reports of injuries. Vessel continued voyage.

Livestock carrier was blamed for causing a foul smell in parts of Cape Town, South Africa. The NSPCA inspected the vessel and discovered that animals were kept in abhorrent conditions, in extreme buid-up or faeces and urine. They also disclovered diseased and injured cattled and had to euthanise 8 of them due to serious injuries.
Smoke was observed soon after leaving Mgarr Harbour in Gozo, Malta. Firefighters attended and put the fire out. An investigation is underway.
Ferry suffered mechanical failure and sailings between Tayinloan and Gigha, UK were cancelled for the day.

British-owned bulk carrier was attacked by Houthi rebels while transiting the Strait of Bab el-Mandeb, 35 NM south of Al Mukha, Yemen, en route from Khorfakkan, UAE to Bulgaria. The master of the vessel reported there were damages to the vessel, but all crew are safe with no injuries. The UK Maritime Trade Organization (UKMTO) reported that om 19 February the crew abandoned vessel, assisted by unnamed military responders.
Vessel experienced mechanical failure and sailings between Fishbourne and Portsmouth, UK saw delays of up to two hours.
Oil tanker was struck by a missile 72 NM northwest of Mokha, Yemen,Red Sea, while en route to India. There were no injuries and the ship only suffered minor damages.

Ferry's sailings between Aberdeen, Scotland and Lerwick, Orkney were cancelled although she was due to return to service after beeing drydocked in Rosyth since 3 February. She resumed service on 20 February.
Container ship suffered engine failure, W of island of Ouessant, France. Tug Abeille Bourbon towed her the next day to sheltered Bay of Douarnenez. Anchored in bay.
Sailings between Wemyss Bay and Rothesay, UK were cancelled for the day due to a mechanical issue.
Reports vessel suffered water ingress in the bow and rudder damage after grounding northeast of Bergen, Norway. She was refloated with tug assistance and berthed in Stord, Norway.
Vessel experienced engine failure off coast of Karaada, Turkey. Patrol boat KIYEM-6 towed her to Bodrum ferry terminal where all passengers were disembarked. Investigation on.

Cargo vessel got stuck in ice at SMZ-Khabarka crossing, on Northern Divina River, N of Arkhangelsk, Russia and then got stuck again the next day. Vessels Kapitan Evdokimov and Kapitan Chadayev assisted.
Cargo vessel lost her anchor at anch No. 4A, St. Petersburg, Russia. On 4 March, Port of St. Petersburg notified Estonian and Kaliningrad shipping about their plan to lift anchor that sank.
Tanker was NUC due to main engine steam leak, about 35nm SE of Lizard point, UK. Repairs were completed by crew and vessel continued passage the same day.

Bulk carrier ran aground in a privately owned canal leading to the port of Alumar Company in Sao Luis, Maranhao. There were multiple attempts to refloat the vessel. There is no pollution and no structural damages to the vessel. An investigation is ongoing while the vessel is still grounded.
Ferry experienced mechanical failure of propulsion system. Service between Powell River and Comox, Canada was cancelled for the day.
Bulk carrier ran aground at 338KM mark of River Parana, Argentina and obstructed all navigation through channel.

Local reports said the two vessels — described as “a 5,900-ton cargo ship and a 9,000-ton, Panamanian-flagged LNG carrier” — collided 6 km southwest of Yeodo Island at 04:20 local time on 17 February.' Gas industry players named the LNG carrier as the 7,654-cbm LNGBV SM Jeju LNG1 (built 2019). A report on South Korea’s MBC News said the starboard side of the LNG carrier was “severely damaged” and said a gas leak occurred. All the crew and personnel on board both vessels — 19 on the LNGBV and 58 on the cargo ship — are reported to have been rescued safely.
Vessel suffered technical failure of navigation system along with compass and pertinent alarm units at Hopa, Turkey. Departure permission was cancelled until completion of repairs.

Vessel was NUC about 10km off Kodomarimisaki Lighthouse, Aomori Prefecture, Japan. She drifted southward in Sea of Japan but managed to anchor 4km off Tsugaru. Salvage was difficult due to rough weather.
A fire  broke out in the engine room, while secured in Sept-Iles, Quebec, Canada. Crew extinguished the fire and conducted damage assessment. Vessel sailed on 20 February.
Tanker was imposed a fine of about $108,000 for using her scrubber in an unauthorized area and for usinf engine fuel with a sulphur content above the authorised level.

Vessel allided and damaged a pole at Sas van Gent bridge, Netherlands. She berthed at quay in Gent, while being investigated by Rijkswaterstaat. On 25 February left port and berthed at Shipyard in Hansweert.

UPDATE: 17-Feb-2024 Divers found and brought to sruface the body of the vessel's cook. The search for the other five crew members continued. Vessel with six crew on board issued a distress call hours after she departed from Badalalan, Turkey amid strong waves as high as 10 feet. An hour after the call the vessel disappeared. A search and rescue operation was initiated.

Cargo ship carrying 6497 tons of urea ran aground off the coast of Kastamonu, Turkey. The cargo was poured into sacks and transported to Inebolu Port by tugs. Vessel will be assessed for damages once the unloading of cargo is completed. Inebolu Coast Guard patroled around the ship to minimise possible environmental risks.

A fire erupted on board the vessel while transiting near one of the piers in Kodiak boat harbour, United States. Kodiak Fire Department attended to vessel at Pier 3 and fire was quickly extinguished. No injuries reported.
Bulk carrier sustained minor damages after she was targeted by a naval missile in the Gulf of Aden. The attack was claimed by Yemen's Iran-aligned Houthi group.
Tanker experienced failure of auxiliary engines together with alarm system at Batumi, Georgia. Crew carried out repairs and vessel was allowed to sail on 17 February.

Vessel listed heavily due to flooding near the shores of Seogwipo, Jeju Island, South Korea, while en route rom Gwangyang, South Korea to China. A Coast Guard Patrol boat was dispatched and rescued all 11 crew members from the submerged vessel. There were no significant injuried. The cause of the flooding is being investigated.
The cargo vessel was fined after an illegal discharge of 3,675 litres of black water by into sea, during routine inspection by Brunsbuttel Water Police at Ostermoor, Brunsbuttel, Germany.

Cement carrier ran aground in the shallow waters of Akita City, Japan, near the Ohama quay of the port. She was refloated by two tugs the same day. Akita Coast Guard investigated the cause of grounding.
Vessel experienced engine trouble while dropping anchor in vicinity waters off Surigao Anchorage, Philippines. Crew carried out repairs and checks and sailed on 20 February.

A worker had to be taken to hospital for medical treatment after being injured during berthing manoeuvre at Douglas, Isle of Man. Ferry's departure was cancelled until 18 February. An investigation is ongoing.
The SAR lifeboat reported having made bottom contact while assisting FV CAPE CORDELL, in Fortune Bay off Fortune, 0.23 nm SE Cross Point, NL, Canada. She proceeded to wharf.
Fishing vessle suffered engine failure off Egersund, Norway, and was forced to return to port for repairs.Two days later she sailed to Hiorshals, where a new injector was installed.
Cargo vessel suffered technical failure at Southern entrance of Canakkale Strait at Kumkale point. She shifted from incident place to north of Bozcaada Island anchorage for repairs.

The fishing vessel ran aground off port of Fortune, Newfoundland Island, Canada and started listing to starboard side. All crew members were evacuated and taken to Fortune Harbour. Vessel suffered damages to the hull.
Tanker suffered main engine cylinder failure, 43 NM south of Lizard point, UK. No tug assistance was required and there were no reports of pollution. She continued voyage the same day.

Livestock carrier with about 16,000 sheep and cattle on board couldn't get to Israel through the Red Sea, and had to return from South Africa back to Australia. The livestock was moved into trucks and taken to appropriate premises to be quarantined.

Vessel started taking on water about 9nm northwest of Kuala Kemena off Bintulu, Malaysia and issued distress signal. Patrol vessel BOT KILAT 44 was diverted to assist, but upon arrival, BOS AZLINA was half submerged and all crew members still onboard. They were all evacuated safely
Ferry had a problem with the stern ramp in Langnas.  After repairs and a successful test vessel continued her planned voyage to Stockholm.
The tug ran aground due to navigation error at Kob Bastuhallan, east of Norrbyskar near Holmsund, Sweden. Tugs Karl Astrid and Rojvik assisted. No injuries or damages reported.
Vessel experienced mechanical failure at Tuapse, Russia. Departure permission was temporarily cancelled while repairs were carried out.

Vessel ran aground in the area of the Tulcea bend of the Danube in Romania and got stuck with her bow outside the navigable channel. She was en route from Galati, eastern Romania to Barletta, south-eastern Italy. A tug was deployed to tow the bulk carrier and was anchored at mile 36 for inspections.
Cargo vessel suffered failure of auxiliary engines along with alarm units and was detained at Iskenderun, Turkey, with 13 deficiencies. She was released the next day and moved to Tuzla for repairs.
A fire erupted in the engine room, 10 nm off Le Treport, France. All crew were evacuated. Vessel suffered another fire on 17 February which was put out. ALEXIS IV will be dismantled.

Vessel suffered engine failure shortly after passing Hoyer bunker station in Brunsbuttel and drifted towards southern embankment of Kiel Canal, Germany.Tug Fairplay IX pushed her back. The ship sailed after troubleshooting.

Bulk carrier was targeted by two Houthi missiles while transiting the Red Sea, ransiting the Bab al Mandab strait, en route from Vila do Conde, Brazil to Bandar Imam Khomeini, Iran. Vessel suffered damages to starboard side. No reports of injuries.
Ferry had problems with the bow ramp during her stay at the ferry terminal of the Color Line in Oslo, Norway. Vessel sailed to Kiel after repairs.

Livestock carrier lost rudder 13nm southeast of Skyros, Greece. Vessel was towed by two tugs and taken to Ampelakia in Salamina. Piraeus Central Port Authority prohibited the sailing of the ship until the repair of the rudder damage.
Ferry suffered engine failure and ran aground due to strong currents, off Capul town, Northern Samar, Philippines. MV Reina Immaculada tried towing but failed.
Vessel had technical failure, sheltered and dropped anchor north of Datca anchorage, Turkey. Repairs were carried out by crew and continued voyage on 13 February.

Barge Dewi Iriana 8 under tow by tug MARINA 21 collided with barge under tow by tug BRAHMA 3, while entering Batang Banyu Nagara River channel towards Margasari River, Indonesia. Dewi Iriana 8 suffered dents on right bow.

Ferry arrived at Cammel Laird in Birkenhead for an extensive assessment of the required repairs. CalMac confirmed that the the vessel will be out of service for a further four months due to structural strengthening and steelwork issues, as a large area of severely corroded and weakened steel was discovered in an awkward location beneath the engines.
Fishing vessel ran aground close to Makuluvu Islands, Fiji. No reports of injuries or oil spill. The fuel and fish was transferred to another vessel so she could be towed to Suva the next day.
Container ship, assisted by two tugs, suffered main engine failure causing a loss of propulsion, while in section No. 50 in Port de Montreal, Canada. She sailed from Montreal on 13 February.

Barge Dewi Iriana 8 under tow by tug MARINA 21 collided with barge under tow by tug BRAHMA 3, while entering Batang Banyu Nagara River channel towards Margasari River, Indonesia. Dewi Iriana 8 suffered dents on right bow.

Reports vessel ran aground south of the Tanjung Pasir beacon, in the waters of the Bali Strait. A SAR team was deployed to evacuate passengers and assist the vessel with manoeuvering. There were no injuries, all passengers were taken to Gilimanuk Harbour.

A fire broke out on board the vessel in Arnhem, Netherlands and was given temporary shelter at City Office. The fire was under control but police were considering it to be arson. Passengers were trasnferred to other vessel nearby.
Ferry had fire detercion system failure and cancelled sailing between Oban and Craignure, UK. Ferry LOCH FRISA was inserted on the route.

Cargo ship ran aground at the mouth of Cumbrian Harbor in SILLOTH, UK, on arrival from Bremen, Germany. She was refloated with high tide. No reports of injuries or damages. Divers are to inspect the hull.

Tanker ran aground in Inner-Gleðivík at Djúpavog, eastern Iceland, due to propeller and rudder issues, while en route from Gothenburg, Sweden. Tugs were unable to reach the area at high tide so the vessel had to be refloated with the help of excavators from the land. She berthed at Gleðivík the same day. Divers insepcted the hull and there were no obvious damages.
Vessel suffered forward main engine failure in Barra while serving on the route Barra-Eriskay. Repairs were completed and she resumed voyage the same day.

Cargo vessel suffered main engine cooling fault in Humber estuary, UK. She was towed to King George dock and then moved to Damen Ship Repair yard in Harlingen, Netherlands for permanent repairs. She sailed on 24 February from the repair yard.

LNG Carrier had steering issues due to propeller loss and went adrift off the Victorian coast, en route from Vanuatu to Australia. Tugs SVITZER LYNX and SVITZER ALBATROSS towed her near Flinders. Divers conducted inspections and confirmed that the vessel sheered off her propeller. Extensive repairs are necessary.
Vessel experienced mechanical failure in the starboard main engine before she departed from Piraeus to Aegina, Greece. Repairs were carried out and vessel resumed sailings the same day.

Fishing vessel suffered water ingress and started sinking, 9 miles off coast of Pasaia, Spain. Maritime Rescue vessel Orion and Civil Guard's Rio Sella assisted with rescuing crew safely. The vessel sank.

Ferry allided with ferry berth at Skaro, Denmark and suffered a hole in bow. She had to be taken out of service and was sent to Soby shipyard for repairs. Ferry Hjortoboen replaced her on Svendborg - Drejo - Skaro route.
Vessel suffered port side main engine failure. She reusmed sailing the next day after repairs were carried out.

Tourist boat ran aground near Punta Vicente Roca, Galapagos Islands after she came dangerously close to the shore. Nearby boats assisted and the nine passengers on board were evacuated safely. No reports of injuries.
Cargo vessel ran aground while passing Friedrichsort Lighthouse, Germany. Tug Stein assisted with refloating. No leaks reported. Vessel sailed from Friedrichsort the next day.
Vessel suffered water ingress in welding area and tipped over to portside, while undergoing maintenance repairs at Desan Yardgem United Shipyards,Turkey.

Cargo ship turned to starboard side and damaged lighting on tail unit when entering old S.lock of Kiel Canal in Brunsbuttel, Germany. She suffered scratches at hull and had to move to Gdynia Shipyard for repairs.
Vessel suffered mechanical issue was held in dock at Sidney, Canada. Remaining sailingswere cancelled. Oil leak was reported but was contained to the car deck and did not leak into port waters.

Unpowered fuel barge Gulfstream was being towed by the vessel when it capsized 200 metres off coast of Cove Industrial Park, Trinidad and Tobago. The incident caused national emergency and growing oil disaster onshore and in the Caribbean Sea.
Reports vessel allided with crushed ice in Baltic Sea and suffered propeller damage. Divers of the Kaliningrad branch fixed issue continued voyage on 11 February.
Ferry suffered malfunction of 1 of rudder propellers and was taken out of service for repairs in harbor mouth on Texel, Netherlands. There was a minor oil spill and restrictive measures were taken.
The yacht experienced steering loss and was disabled about 25 NM S. Malaga, Spain. They requested assistance and SAR vessel Salvamar Alnitak, sailed from Malaga and towed vessel towards port.
Vessel had mechanical issues and had to suspend the service on the route Levang-Nesna, Norway. She was sidelined in Nesna for repairs.
Ferry experienced a bow ramp issue in Kennacraig. This affected ferry FINLAGGAN, which couldn't berth on arrival from Islay. Cal Mac personnel was working on the issue.
Fishing vessel was hit by a giant wave and sank about 20 NM SW of Vagur, Suduroy Island, Faroe Islands. 14 crew members were evacuated safely while two went missing.

Ferry ran aground at jetty of Diakoftiou port of Kythira, Greece. She suffered hull breached with water ingressbut was promptly taken under control. Tug Apollon tow her to a shipyard at Syros Island, Greece.
Tanker was NUC and started drifting at Westhinder anchorage, Belgium. Vessels in the area were requested to keep a sharp lookout.

According to a statement by their military spokesman Yahya Saree, the Houthis repeatedly targeted US-listed Star Bulk Carriers’ 82,200-dwt Star Nasia and the 12,000-dwt cargo ship Morning Tide (both built 2006).

"According to a statement by their military spokesman Yahya Saree, the Houthis repeatedly targeted US-listed Star Bulk Carriers’ 82,200-dwt Star Nasia and the 12,000-dwt cargo ship Morning Tide (both built 2006). Incidents against the two vessels were corroborated by US and UK authorities. According to the US Central Command (Centcom), the Star Nasia was attacked three times over a span of 13 hours while it was sailing south of Aden — at 0020 GMT, 1100 GMT and 1330 GMT. The first two missiles only just missed the ship, causing no injuries among the crew. The third missile was shot down in mid-air by the US warship USS Laboon."

Cruise ship collided with pier due to strong winds in Jamaica. The ship was knocked against the docks and cracks appeared in the concrete. There were also extensive dents and scrapes on the starboard side of the hull. She was moved out to sea until a alternate pier becomes free. An investigation was launched and a team of experts will assess the damages.
Cargo vessel had steering gear system failure and lost control at Nara point in Canakkale strait, Turkey. Coastal Safety tugs Kurtarma-3 and Kurtarma-14 towed her to Karanlik Liman anchorage.

A crew member suffered a stroke on board vessel 550 nm off the coast of Saipan. A US Navy helicopter was dispatched to evacuate the man but was out of range and it wasn't until the 9 February when the man was evacuated and delivered to the Naval Hospital in Guam in stable condition.

Fish carrier suffered water ingress while docked at Fiskerstrand shipyard in Sula, Norway. The fire department attended and managed to stop some water ingress. Booms were deployed in case of any oil leaks. Vessel will remain afloat until leak sealed.
A fire erupted on board the vessel while undergoing dismantling work at ship repair plant of JSC in Murmansk region, Russia. Firefighters attended and took fire under control.
Cargo vessel suffered rudder failure during transit of Kiel Canal near Claustal, Germany. She turned around inside fairway and tug Stein towed her to Voith Quay in North Port for repairs.
Vessel suffered mechanical failure at Aqaba, Jordan. Sailing was banned until repairs were done. Departure permission was granted on 7 February.

A crew member was found dead in the car deck, on arrival at Algeciras, Spain from Tangier Med. The captain and other crew members have tried to resuscitate him but couldn't save his life. An investigation into the circumstances leading up to the man's death is ongoing.
Vessel lost 24 shipping containers SW of Monterey, USA.  There were no hazardous materials inside the containers. The ship arrived at Oakland for cargo operations and sailed on 17 February.
A passenger on board the vessel fell ill and was evacuated by helicopter 150nm of San Diego, USA and transferred to a local hospital . She was reported to be in stable condition.

Vessel had speed log out of order and windlass possibly overheating while anchored in UK. There were concerns it will burn out windlass while heaving anchors. Repairs were carried out and sailed on 7 February.
Tug suffered electric generators failure and was disabled, 167nm SE of Pakistani port city of Karachi. PMSS KASHMIR secured tug alongside and repairs were carried out.
Vessel was NUC due to problem with piston and liner leaving no manoeuvrability, about 20nm south of St Katherines Point, IOW, UK. She requested permission to anchor so repairs can be carried out.

Master of the vessel was arrested for marine pollution caused by the crew painting the exterior of the vessel with oil paint, ,at PPC pier maritime area, Keratsini, Piraeus, Greece. An area of approximately 150 sq metres had to be decontaminated.

Reports vessel was fined for an illegal and careless discharge of oil in the Sri Lankan maritime zone, leaving an oil slick of about 11km long over and area of 1 square km. After inspecting the vessel, Sri Lanka’s Maritime Environment Protection Authority (MEPA) decided to detain the ship and imposed the maximum fine of $48,000. The fine was paid on 9 February and steps were taken to release vessel.
