Tanker was detained by the Malaysian Maritime Department after transferring diesel onto oil products tanker SCORPIO. Two crew members from each vessel were also detained for further investigation as they failed to provide oil transfer permits.

Tanker was detained by the Malaysian Maritime Department after transferring diesel from oil products tanker Tuah Sejagat. Two crew members from each vessel were also detained for further investigation as they failed to provide oil transfer permits.
Tanker experienced mechanical fault and had to moor at Datca anchorage, Turkey. Repairs were carried out by the crew.
Reports vessel had debris in propeller, while secured in Grande-Anse, Quebec, Canada. Divers freed the propeller and she sailed on the next day.
Vessel's service between Gourock and Dunoon had to be suspended to allow further investigations, after a technical issue.
Container ship was NUC due to engine failure in North Sea waters, UK. She resumed voyage the same day and arrived in the Port of El Dekheila, Egypt on 18 November.
Search and rescue vessel had breakdown while transferring canoes accumulated in La Restinga to Tenerife. She left 3 towed boats adrift and returned to La Estaca for repairs.
Perpetrators boarded vessel at Vung Tau anchorage, Vietnam. Alarm was raised, crew mustered and search conducted. The incident was reported to Vung Tau port authorities.

Container ship suffered leakage of main engine exhaust valve and was NUC 18 NM South Berry Head, UK. Repairs were carried out and vessel resumed voyage the same day. She arrived in Tangier 8 November.
Vessel had a total failure of its bow thruster's generator, about 2.10 NM N of Ile du Grenadier, on Lac Saint-Fran?ois, Canada. She anchored off Saint-Zotique and crew carried out repairs.
Vessel ran aground onto small islet off Larymna port, Phthiotis, North Euboean Gulf, Greece, Aegean sea, en route from Istanbul. No reports on leaks or damages.
Vessel (experienced mechanical failure and sheltered and dropped anchor in Sinop anchorage, Turkey. Repairs were carried out by crew.
Cruise ship had her propeller entangled in mooring lines, as she was about to leave Piraeus, Greece, bound for Palermo, Italy. Departure was postponed until next day.
A crew member was medevaced by US Coast Guard helicopter, 250nm northeast of Nassau, Bahamas, after suffering with severe stomach pain. He was handed over to emergency medical services in Nassau.

A crew member was in need of immediate hospital treatment  while moored at the anchorage of the port of Nafplio, Greece. The man was taken to the General Hospital of Argos Argolida for further medical examinations.
Bulk carrier experienced main engine failure while on departure from Trois-Rivieres, Canada. Crew assessed issue on the spot and sailed from Trois-Rivieres on 5 November after repairs.
Bulk carrier suffered exhaust system failure, about 1.80 NM SSW of Pointe a Page, in the St. Lawrence River off Donnacona. Repairs were carried out by crew.

A fire broke out after an explosion in void tank at bottom of pump room, while shipyard workers were welding hull, at Dung Quat Shipyard in Quang Ngai Province, Vietnam. 9 people suffered burns in CO2 cylinder explosion.

A fire broke out on deck no 7 while en route from Balikpapan to Pantoloan port, Indonesia. Vessel suffered some damages but no injuries were reported. Vessel was berthed at Pantoloan, for repaira and sailed the same day, bound for Bitung port.
Tanker had mechanical fault due to issues with injectors in main engine and drifted from NE lane to SW lane in Dover Straits. Repairs were carried out and vessel continued passage the next day.
Eight Nigerian stowaways were found inside the vessel's rudder compartment. They were apprehended by Nigerian Navy ship NNS Beecroft.
Vessel was NUC due to main engine issue with the fuel pump, about 33 NM from Southwold. An engineer on board rectified the issue.
Tanker suffred cooling system failure, about 32.40 Nm NW of Rochers aux Oiseaux, Canada. The crew assessed the issue and resumed the voyage.
Bulk carrier ran aground at 104.2 kilometer mark in Martin Garcia channel, Rio de la Plata,  while sailing to Villa Constitucion port, Argentina. Reports say she grounded on Channel's edge.

Cruise ship was caught in storm Ciaran and had flooded cabins, broken windows and injured passengers. She has to take refuge in Getxo, Spain. Deck four suffered some damages as well. She sailed from Getxo on 5 November.

Cargo ship experienced mechanical failure at Canakkale strait near Kepez point, Turkey. She shifted and anchored at Karanlik liman anchorage. Sailing was prohibited until repairs and sea worthiness certificate issued.
Cargo ship experienced main engine failure due to a fault in the fuel supply system, in Halifax Harbour, Canada. Vessel dropped anchor and crew carried out repairs. She sailed on 4 November.
Bulk carrier had starboard windlass failure, while heaving up anchor about 2.10 NM SSE of Point Atkinson, in English Bay, Canada. Crew carried out repairs.
Vessel suffered port windlass failure while heaving up anchor, about 2.60 NM SSE of Point Atkinson, in English Bay, British Columbia, Canada. Crew assessed the issue.

Vessel suffered water ingress due to technical error and developed sheavy list to port side at port of Ockero, Sweden. Water was pumped and vessel was straightened. The cause of the incident was water ballast flowing from one side to another.

Hospital ship, which provides aid in Lautoka, Fiji, suffered mechanical issues related to the tail shaft. YWAM Ships is appealing for help with the cost of repairs. They pais an initial $100k but need another $200k before the end of the month.
Cargo ship experienced mechanical failure and sheltered at Cesme anchorage, Turkey. Crew carried out repairs by crew and she sailed on 5 November.
Fishing vessel suffered engine failure and berthed about 4 NM from Stockholm. ALB towed her to Dale anchorage and handed over to tug Forth Trojan.
Danish maritime authorities reported that vessel ran aground off Logstor, in Limfjord, Denmark. Channel was closed due to silting and mariners were advised to keep well clear.
Vessel had engine failure at Tekirdag, Turkey . Crew couldn't carry out repairs and tug Ayaz Bey towed her to Tuzla shipyard. Damage survey was in progress.

Six French military tanks have falled overboard 60km west of the Hague, in extreme weather conditions. A massive search force including a French Navy helicopter and an aircraft were deployed. One of the tanks was soon located and crew tried to tow it towards Cherbourg, but the tow line broke in high winds. The tank was again located near Raz Blanchard and four clearance divers hoisted it on the rear deck of the vessel.

Vessel discharged soot from Exhaust Gas Control Systems into water, after power outage, while preparing to depart pier in Grand Turk,Turks and Caicos Islands.Her departure was delayed. Investigation underway.

General cargo ship had mechanical fault in the Northern entrance of the Istanbul Strait, en route from Trabzon to Tuzla, Turkey. Vessel continued transit with tug assistance and sailed to Desan Yardgem United Shipyards for permanent repairs.

Cargo ship experienced engine failure at W of Istanbul anchorage, off Bakirkoy, Turkey. Tug Kurtarma 12 and technical team attended as vessel was drifting with wind. She was later anchored at Ahirkapi.
Ferry was removed from route Stokkvag-Onoy-Lovund-Sleneset, Norway due to mechanical failure. She was sent to Sandnessjoen for repairs and ferry Lovund replaced her.
A leak was discovered on starboard side of vessel and had to be removed from route Barra - Uist, UK. Repairs were carried out and she resumed service the next day.

Reports of vessel taking on water east of Bjornoya, Norway, between Norwegian Sea and Barents Sea. Two bilge pumps were brought on board by helicopter to pump water out from engine room. Vessel docked later in Breivika.

General cargo ship was caught in rough weather en route to Marina di Carrara, west of La Spezia, Italy. She suffered water ingress in engine room, but was taken under control. The vessel was allowed to shelter at La Spezia due to deteriorating weather.
Vessel suffered failure of communication unit together with emergency public address system at Novorossiysk, Russia. Repairs were carried out and she was granted permission to sail on 3 November.

Bulk carrier experineced mechanical failure due to a fault in the electrical supply system, in the St. Lawrence River off L'Isle-aux-Coudres, Canada. She arrived in Baie Comeau, Canada and sailed on 5 November after repairs.

Ferry was out of service since 30 October until 7 November due to a technical issue. She sailed from Rosslare to Fishguard at reduced speed, then sailed from Fishguard  on 6 November for around 2 hours of trials.

Vessel had a technical issue and had to be sideline until 6 November. She was berthed in Otternish and ferry Loch Bhrusda replaced her.
Vessel's deck crane allided with a bridge in the Portwert area of Duisburg-Ruhrort, while attempting to lift a car from the vessel onto the quay. No reports of injuried or damages.
Vessel experienced engine failure in the St. Lawrence River off Deschambault, Quebec, Canada. She was anchored and crew carried out repairs.
A passenger fell into water while vessel was en route from Barcelona to Florida. The voyage was interrupted and the vessel turned back to conduct a search. He was successfully rescued within an hour.
Ferry had engine trouble on her route between Marstal and Rudkobing. She remained docked at Marstam and was expected to be out of service until 6 November.

Reports vessel had steering failure after leaving Brake, Weser river, bound for Hamburg, and ran aground onto Harriersand island coast. She was refloated and towed back to Brake. She was permitted to sail after inspection and class safety confirmation, on 31 October.

Vessel was seized at the Federal Ocean Terminal in Onne, Eleme Council Area of Rivers State, Nigeria after it's been reported that she was laden with 300,000 litres of illegally refined diesel, stored in large black plastic tanks. Two crew members were arrested.
Ferry sailing between Endelave and Snaptun, Denmark, had technical problems and had to sail to shipyard after last scheduled trip. She will be docked at the shipyard until 5 November.

Reports that approximatley 400 migrants blocked the ferry ramp, which led to conflict between them and the passengers of the ferry. The migrants were demanding they be transferred out of Rhodes. Vessel's service between Aegeon and Pelagos resumed shortly.

Deck cargo ship ran aground on Carabao island coast, Tablas Strai, central Philippines. She suffered dents and scratches to hull, but still seaworthy. No injuries reported. As of 30 October vessel was probably refloated.
Reports tug was disabled with a fouled propeller, while towing barge M6001 in the9157105South Arm of the Fraser River. Vessel was towed to Richmond, by tug Captain Cook.

Cargo ship sufered mechanical failure at Kilitbahir poin, Canakkale Strait, Turkey. A tug assisted and shifted to Karanlik liman anchorage. A fine was imposed and departure permission cancelled until repairs were carried out.
A fire broke out in the accommodation area, in Belaya Rive, Russia. 3 cabins burned. No reports of casualties or pollution.
Crankshaft of the main engine broke and vessel had to drop anchor off the coast of Falkenberg. She was towed to Halmstad for repairs.
Ferry had engine failure due to a broken rod. Service between Kingston and Edmonds was reduced as vessel had to be sidelined due to signigicant damage. As of 1 November she was docked at Bermerton.
Fishing vessel ran aground in Vigra Fjord, Norway. Crew evacuated the vessel into life raft as they believed there was water ingress, and they were picked up by a nearby vessel.

Vessel was detained in Tampico, Mexico by Mexican authorities, under allegations that she was involved in some kind of illegal commercial activities. Owner deniee and said vessel entered only for dredging works.

UPDATE: 30-Oct-23 A crew member of the barge was critically injured after he fell off the barge during the incident. He was airlifted to Ottawa and is in stable condition. About 20 containers and other freight items fell into water during cargo operations at Iqaluit port anchorage, Frobisher Bay, southeast Baffin Island, Canada. Reports say the cargo fell from lighter barge that was handling cargo from vessel. Canadian Coast Guard and Nunavut Eastern Artic Shipping (NEAS) were deployed to recover the lost cargo.
Vessel had seaweed stuck in propeller in waters off Mamolo, Nunukan, Indonesia. Nunukan Navy assisted vessel to Liang Bunyu Ferry Port as it was unable to operate on its own.
A fire erupted on board the vessel, in battery compartment, while at Vard shipyard. No reports of injuried. Fire was put out after a lot effort due to a series of batteries in proximity igniting.
4 crew members have been injured and hospitalised, one of them in critical condition, after an explosion occured on board the vessel, at Fethiye Bay, southwest Turkey. Cause of explosion unknown.

Acetylene cylinders exploded on board vessel during wielding works in one of the compartments, 25 nm east of southeast Hokkaido, while en route from Busan, Korea to Bering Sea. The compartment door was torn off and hit a worker in the head, which killed him on the spot. Vessel sailed to nearby Yuzno-Kurilsk port, Kunashir island, and anchored at Yuzhno-Kurilsk anchorage.

Bulk carrier suffered mechanical failure at Gladstone, Australia and was left disabled. AMSA banned vessel for 12 months to enter Australian ports for violation. On 20 Feb 2024 she sailed under tow towards Philippines.
Bulk carrier ran aground, about 1.70 NM E of Brockton Point, in Vancouver Harbour, Canada. She was refloated by tugs and secured to the wharf. The crew assessed the damage.
Dredger had a total failure of generators while secured in Quebec, Canada. Repairs were carried out and sailed from Quebec on 28 October.

Fishing vessel suffered mechanical failure off port of Calais, France, while en route from Boulogne-sur-Mer. Local SNSM boat towed her and moored at Quay de la Colonne in Calais. She sailed from Calais on 29 October.
Vessel allided with wharf after having lost propulsion on one engine while berthing at Toronto Island, Ontario, Canada. A crew member suffered a minor injury.

Livestock carrier had technical failure at  southern entrance of Istanbul Strait during transit passage at Sarayburnu point. Passage was baned and she was moved to Yenikapi anchorage and dropped anchor under own power. She sailed on 26 August.

Port Authority was informed that vessel had damage to landing platform, rendering it unable to lift and secure. Drums and attendants disembarked. No reports of injuries or pollution. Sailing was banned until repairs are carried out.

Vessel rescued 29 migrants sailing on a a fibre-glass boat, off the coast of Libya and transported them to the Italian port of Ravenna, 1,613km or six sailing days away, as Italy now requires rescue boats to proceed directly to a designated port. Most of the migrants were from Sudan and Syria.
Ferry lost port anchor while trying to secure it, after leaving the port of Piraeus. She had to return to port for repairs and sailed after seaworthiness certificate was provided.
Reports vessel allided with Kiel-Holtenau Lock Gate, while leaving Kiel Canal, en route from France to Sweden. She was allowed to resume voyage next day, after damages assessment.
Tug Seaspan Raptor collided with port forward anchor of vessel while assisting her for departure in Roberts Bank, BC, Canada. She sailed the same day.
Fishing vessel net got entangled in propeller and had propulsion failure, 5 NM of Burela, Spain. SAR vessel Salvamar Alioth towed her to Burela.

Fishing vessel ran out of fuel and disappeared from radar while sailing in Gulf of Guinea, Nigeria. AIS track was off and contact via satellite phone was also lost. Contact was made by Den Helder on 16 November.

Vessel collided with bulk carrier POLESIE in German Bight, 16 nm north of Langeoog island, East Frisian Islands, while en route from Bremen to Immingham. She sank soon after collision and so far only one crew member was rescued, while more than 10 others are missing. POLESIE stopped to take part in SAR together with a number of other rescue and auxiliary vessels.

Vessel collided with general cargo ship VERITY  in German Bight, 16 nm north of Langeoog island, East Frisian Islands, while en route from Hamburg to La Coruna, Spain. VERITY sank soon after collision and so far only one crew member was rescued, while more than 10 others are missing. POLESIE stopped to take part in SAR together with a number of other rescue and auxiliary vessels.

A crew member was medevaced by the Romanian Agency for Saving Life at Sea, while the vessel was located near the Port of Constanta. SAR ship ARES picked up the patient and handed him over to a medical team on shore. No details on the man's condition.

Spanish law enforcement agencies trailed behind vessel as she passed Gibraltar, en route from Cartagena, Colombia to Malta, after a tip-off. They filmed 2 apparent stowaways as they threw packs of cocaine into the water and then they jumped in as well. They were promptly picked up the authorities. The vessel was diverted to Algeciras for investigation, but was allowed to continue voyage the next day.
Ferry suffered mechanical failure in Tuapse, Russiawere. Departure permission was temporarily cancelled until repairs were done. The vessel resumed voyage on 25 October.

Ferrry ran aground in shallow waters off Santa Fe town, in vicinity of Bantayan Island at northernmost tip, Cebu, Philippines. Rescue boats and personnel were deployed to assist with the transfer of the 287 passengers on board.

Research vessel started drifting 35 NM off Paradip, India due some ropes that fell over board and got entangled in the propellers. Indian Coasat Guard deployed vessel AMOGH to take her on tow to Paradip Port on 25 October.
Ferry came to rescue of stranded travellers on Largs-Cumbrae, UK struck down by electrical fault. Spare parts were ordered and service was cancelled as of 28 October.

Port Authority, Hydra, Greece reported that the vessel suffered starboard main engine failure. She sailed to Hydra where all passengers disembarked and was then allowed a single voyage to Piraeus for repairs.

General cargo ship was placed under a list of sanctions by the Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC), as she has historically been used to carry weapons exports for Iran’s Ministry of Defence and Armed Forces Logistics. This comes in a attempt to target Iran's ballistic missile and unmanned aerial vehicle export programmes.
A bilge suction problem was found in Rothesay, UK, during an inspection. Vessel was expected to return to service on 27 or 28 October.

Bulk carrier suffered water ingress in engine room due to a cracked sea water cooling pipe, in the Haro Strait, British Columbia. Crew carried out repairs and continued voyage to Donghae, South Korea.

Ferry was scheduled to launch service between Guernsey and Jersey, but experienced mechanical failure due to forward bow thrusters issue. Vessel was temporarily pulled from service and dry docked at Cammell Laird, Birkenhead.
Vessel experienced failure of emergency alarm unit, fire detectors and pertinent systems at Novorossiysk, Russia. Sailing was banned until repairs. She later sailed to Diliskelesi.

Cylinder lining failed on starboard main engine in Bay of Fundy, Canada and had emergency engine shutdown. Investigation is on to determine root cause. Repairs will take place be tween 1 November and 12 December.

Ferry ran aground 5 nm SW of her destination port, Karlshamn, Sweden, in Pukavik Bay, Baltic, en route from Trelleborg. All passengers were evacuated. Several rescue and patrol boats were deployed. Reports say vessel suffered hull breach and oil leak.
Fishing vessel's gear entangled with own propeller and started drifting about 4 NM SW of Hilswick. AITH lifeboat towed her back to West Burrafirth harbour.
Container ship had engine failure and drifted dangerously close to cape Punta Almina, Ceuta, Alboran sea. SAR vessel LUZ DE MAR towed the vessel to Algeciras for repairs.
A fire erupted in engine room while serving Largs - Cumbraie, UK route. Ferry returned to Largs and was taken out of service until repairs. Ferry Loch Riddon took over the service.
Cruise ship was caught in rough weather and could not return to Southampton as scheduled. Subsequent sailings were also delayed. As of 23 October, vessel was moored at Southampton.

Reports vessel experienced engine fault and started drifting in North sea, while en route from Murmansk to Rotterdam. She came dangerously close to Norwegian Ekofisk oil field and patrol ship NOGGV BERGEN was sent to assist. She was later towed, but destination not reported.

HM Coastguard was alerted after a crew member disappeared from the vessel off Ramsgate, off the coast of Kent, south-east England, UK. A helicopter and several RNLI lifeboats were deployed to search for the man, but after nine hours the search ended without him being found. AIDAPERLA resumed her voyage to La Coruna in north west Spain.

Fish carrieri experienced engine failure in Dala Sound shortly after she left dock in Kristiansund, Norway. NSSR lifeboat Erik Bye pulled her slowly back to quay. Safely berthed at Teistolhmen Industry Park for repairs.
Vessel collided with a piece of equipment on board crane barge ORION as she was sailing from a wharf in Dartmouth, NS, Canada. Vessel assessed damages and resumed operations.
Fish carrier suffered failure of one of the generators, about 0.49 NM south from Davey Rock, in Gordon Channel, BC, Canada. She proceeded to Port Hardy for repairs.
Heavy load carrier GPO SAPPHIRE collided with a piece of equipment on board ORION, upon departure from a wharf in Dartmouth, NS, Canada. Damages were assessed and vessel resumed operations.
Drilling platform 4 anchors snapped in storm Babet, in North sea, 123 nm E of Aberdeen UK and started drfiting. 89 crew members were evacuated by helicopters, while 44 remained on board.

Bulk carrier collided with fishing vessel KM Sumber Rejeki 03 in waters of Tanjung Pemali, Buton Regency, SE Sulawesi, Indonesia, en route from Banjarmasin to North Maluku. A fishing vessel crew member went missing.
Bulk carrier experienced electrical fault in central part of Dardanelles, while en route from Bulgaria to Egypt. Tugs escorted vessel to Karanlik Anchorage for repairs.
A piece of cargo-handling equipment fell and damaged cargo hold bottom plates, in Vancouver, British Columbia. Vessel continued voyage after temporary repairs were carried out.
Vessel suffered engine failure while sailing downstream on Elbe near Brunsbuttel, Germany. She was taken to NE anchorage of Kiek Canal for repairs and sailed the next day.

A fire occured in central hub area, reportedly because a lithium battery of water scooter self-ignited, while berthed at Southampton. The fire was not a mojor one and was extinguished by the vessel's fire fighting system. All passengers in the atrium were evacuated but did not leave the vessel. She left Southampton as scheduled.

Reports vessel broke off her moorings and collided with jack-up oil rig NOBLE RESILIENT, at Frederikshavn, Denmark, due to strong winds. Tugs and auxiliary boats responded and took her under control. 26 crew members of drilling rig were safely evacuated.
Ferry ran aground 2km from port of Bensersiel, Germany. She was refloated the same day with high tide and traffic returned to normal by 21 October.

A truck caught fire on cargo deck of ferry, as she was berthing in Bakauheni, southeast Sumatra, Sunda Strait, on arrival from Java’s Merak port. Firefighters together with crew managed to extinguish fire. No injuries were reported.
Ferry allided with quay while leaving Copenhagen, Denmark assisted by tugboat in strong winds. Danish Maritime Authority had to inspect the vessel before leaving the port. She sailed on 22 October.

Floating production tanker Zafiro Producer broke loose from quay during rough weather, in Frederikshavn, Denmark. She was wedged between platform NOBLE RESILIENT and Orskov Yard's dock 5. No reports of injuried or damages.
Cement carrier suffered engine failure on her way out of Trondheimsfjord and went adrift, at Brekstad, Norway. Lifeboat Horn Flyer established towing until Njord took over.

A passenger was stabbed with a bar glass by a fellow passenger on board vessel, while en route to Norfolk, Virginia from eight-day cruise to Canada and New England. The victim was treated by the medical team on board ship, while the attacker was confined to their room and was banned from sailing on a Carnival cruise ship again. Once the vessel arrived at Norfolk, she was boarded by Federal investigators and local law enforcement services.

A Romanian crew member fell 6 metres into the cargo hold, at kilometre mark 138 of the Paraná River, province of Buenos Aires, en route from Singapore to Punta Alvear. He was medevaced with severe injuries to his arm and head, and trasnferred to the Argerich Hospital for medical care.
Fishing vessel suffered water ingress 60nm east of Shetland, UK. Crew took the ingress under control and remained on board. Support vessel VOS FAITHFUL towed vessel to Lerwick.
Cruise ship had to sail early from Douglas, Isle of Man due to the tender boats not being able to operate in the choppy waters caused by storm Babet. As of 21 October she was moored in Cork, Ireland.
Vessel suffered a blackout in North Sea. 3 tugs were deployed to assist and take her on tow. She berthed at Malmo Container Terminal and sailed on 22 October bound for Helsinki.

Tanker collided with Indian fishing vessel Mercy Annai, 45nm off the Kannur coast, Kerala, southern India, while en route from Kabil to Nhava Sheva, south of Mumbai. The fishing vessel suffered significant damage being dragged for several metres. Two people on board the vessel were thrown into the sea.

Ferry experienced mechanical failure and had to be taken out of service between Oban and Craignure, UK. Spare parts needed for repairs have been ordered, but couldn't reach the vessel due to rough weather.
Vessel had mechanical failure en route from Constantza, Romania to Tripoli, Lebanon and dropped anchor at Datca, Turkey. She sailed on 20 October after crew carried ou repairs.
Ferry was delayed by four hours after suffering mechanical failure at Majnabbe Port, Gothenburg, Sweden. Repairs were carried out and she sailed to Sweden Quay, Kiel, Germany.

A fire erupted on board after a generator exploded at Portland, USA on arrival from Halifax. Fire was extinguished fast but one crew member suffered burns and was taken to hospital. All passengers were evacuated, awaiting to return to ship once investigation is completed.
Outboard engine was reported stolen by the Master at Sandakan anchorage, Malaysia. A search was conducted on board after the discovery but there was no sign of perpetrators.
Bulk carrier was NUC due to an issue with fuel injectors, aboutt 33 NM SSW of Lizard Point, UK. Tug Mercia escorted vessel to Falmouth, for repairs.
Ferry suffered mechanical issue and had to cancel 6 morning sailings on the Yarmouth-Lymington, UK service.
Vessel experienced engine failure due to a fault in the hot water circulation pump due to no power in North Sea, UK. Repairs were carried out by the crew and continued voyage the same day.
Ferry suffered mechanical failure and had to cancel sailings on Stokkvagen-Onoy-Sleneset-Lovund, Norway service. The ship was taken to Sandnessjoen for repairs.

A fire erupted in the engine on Alor-SW Maluku route, Alor Regency, Indonesia, due to a spark between engine room and cargo hold. The fire spread to bow deck of vessel. She docked at Wetar Island and sea crossing was stopped temporarily.

After many efforts to leave the port of Ashdod, Israel, four crew members of the vessel returned to Sofia, Bulgaria. There were 17 more crew who remained on board. ROJEN was expected to leave the area in the near future.

Vessel was delayed at Vizhinjam Port because the technical staff were unable to secure emigration clearance and the authorities didn't allow them to go ashore to unload cranes. The ship was scheduled to leave the port on 21 October but sailed on 26 October.

UK Coast Guard reported they received a distress alert from vessel, in pos 49 49 43N, 011 59 16W, Republic of Ireland. Vessels in the area were requested to proceed to distress position, assist and attempt to contact vessel.

UPDATE 06-11-2023:  A local resident filmed the ship showing her bottom hull resting onto rocks. She may be considered a total loss. AIS has been off since grounding. Due to being caught in stormy weather, vessel ran aground on the coast of Karelinskaya Guba inlet, Kola Peninsula. All crew have been evacuated by helicopter. Awaiting weather improvement before attempting salvage. No leaks reported.
The bulk carrier came in contact with a mine in the in Danube Delta area, Black Sea. She suffered damaged and had to sail to Odesa region for repairs.
Cement carrier suffered mechanical failure at Zonguldak, Turkey. Repairs were carried out and she was granted departure permission on 20 October.

Cruise ship had significant flood on Deck 7, while on a four-night cruise out of Long Beach, California. Several crew members were involved in the cleanup using specialised vacuums and squeegees. All passengers in the affected area were moved to different cabins. The water didn's spread outside deck 7. Vessel returned to Long Beach on schedule.
Ferry ecountered issues with a generator and had to be withdrawn from the Hasvik-Loppa, Norway route. She was sidelined at jetty, Oksfjord for repairs and sailed on 21 October.

Reports vessel was caught in rough weather and had cargo shift off Portugal coast, while in her maiden voyage from Shanghai China to Rauma Finland. Some of the cargo on deck had to be thrown overboard in order to stabilise the vessel. Port authorities of Algeciras, Sines and Huelva refused entrance, and the ship managed to shelter at Cadiz on 20 October.

Yacht ran aground onto a reef near marina in Sentosa island, Singapore. Her hull was breached , had water ingress and developed a portside list. She was refloated 6 hours later and moved to anchorage for repairs.

Vessel collided with mooring dolphin while berthing in Horseshoe Bay, Canada. One of the passengers suffered minor injuries and was assisted by crew before he disembarked. Ferry resumed operations the same day.

Reports vessel ran aground in shallows near beacon, off Maltepe, southeast Istanbul, Marmara sea, heading to Bosphorus Strait, en route from Turkey to Sulina, Romania. A tug was deployed to assist with refloating. No leaks reported.
Vessel collided with the tails of old locks in Kiel Canal, Brunsbuttel on Elbe side, Germany, and then went on and collided with 2 dolphins. Vessel and installations suffered damages.
Ferry had mechanical failure at L'Isle-aux-Coudres-Saint-Joseph-de-la-Rive crossing. Repairs were carried out and Transport Canada allowed her to sail next day.

Reports fishing vessel ANTONIO MARIA came close to colliding with trawler, 18 miles east of Unst. A DEFIANT crew member declared that the fishing vessel altered course and came dangerously close to the trawler. He attempted to contact the vessel without any response. An investigation is on.

Reports vessel came close to colliding with trawler DEFIANT, 18 miles east of Unst. A DEFIANT crew member declared that the fishing vessel altered course and came dangerously close to the trawler. He attempted to contact the vessel without any response. An investigation is on.
Fishing vessel was disabled due to transmission failure in Gulf of Maine, off Shag Harbour, Seal Island, Canada. Coast guard ship CHEDABUCTO BAY towed her to Pubnico for repairs.
Fishing vessel had her trawl nets entangled around her propellers in Barents Sea, Russia. On 17 October tug MIKULA towed her to Murmansk for repairs.
Bulk carrier experienced failure of starboard windlass upon arrival at Anchorage C in Vancouver Harbour, BC, Canada. Port anchor was lowered and crew carried out repairs.

Vessel had mechanical failure and had to cancel scheduled sailing from Cuxhaven to Helgoland, Germany. She was sidelined in ferry port. Ferry Fair Lady took over operations. Helgoland sailed on 18 October after repairs.
Vessel ran aground 146 km mark in Volga, Caspian Sea Canal, while en route from Astrakhan, Russia, to Caspian port, Iran. A tug was deplyed to assist. No leaks reported.
Ferry experienced mechanical failure at Novorossiysk, Russia. Permanent repairs were carried out and she was granted departure permission after a state surveyor verified repairs.

UPDATE: As of 31-Dec-2023 vessel was at Varna for permanent repairs. Tanker had an explosion on starboard external bottom section off Sulina, Romania. She suffered structural damages with water ingress in starboard ballast tanks. Two tugs assisted vessel along Danube. No injuries reported.
A fire erupted on board the vessel in 1st Binnenhaven in Flushing, Netheralnds. The fire brigade attended and extinguished fire. No reports of injuries.
Fishing gear got tangled in the propeller, off Kramppenes-Krampinen, on coast of Finnmark, Norway. Patrol vessel JARL towed her to Kirkenes the same day.
Ferry had mechanical issues and had to cancel trip from Woods Islands, Prince Edward Island to Caribou, NS, Canada. All passengers were disembarked. Vessel remained at Woods Islands as of 15 October
Ferry, caught in strong winds, collided with linkspan, while moving away from berth, at the port of Ulsta, UK. She suffered damages to bow visor. Repairs were carried out in Mossbank.
Bulk carried experienced steering failure in Bosphorus Strait, while en route from Bulgaria to Spain. Tugs assisted and vessel was underway some 4 hours later, after repairs.

Another fire erupted on board the vessel at Cape Town harbour, South Africa. Reports say the fire was under control and the City's Fire and Rescue Service will be providing assistance until the vessel leaves the harbour.
Vessel experienced rudder problems in North Atlantic Ocean, nearby Brest, France. Tug Multratug 18 towed her from Brest to Cuxhaven for repairs and cargo unloading.
Ferry was caught in strong gusts of wind and collided and overturned a light mast in Turku harbour. No damages or injuries were reported. Vessel sailed the same day.
A crew member was medevaced by the Indian Coast Guard, 40km off the coast of Mumbai as he was suspected to have a stroke. He was taken to Mumbai for medical treatment.

A fire erupted on board vessel while en route from Scotland, Rosyth to Harwich, UK. Fire was caused by damage to the switch board for de-icing system. Fire was extinguished and the ship moored at Harwich Cruise Terminal.
Ferry's service between Homer, Kodiak and Unalaska, USA was cancelled due to a leaking tail shaft. She drydocked in JAG shipyard in Seward for repairs and was back in service on 24 October.
Car shelf collapsed during loading operations in Grisslehamn, Sweden due to a broken wire in the shelf's mechanism. Repairs were carried out and vessel resumed sailings the next day.

A fire broke out in cargo hold at Amager, Copenhagen, Denmark, during loading operations. Emergency services were deployed, but can't use too much water so as to not destabilise the vessel. No leaks were reported but floating booms were placed around the ship.
Ferry had at least 4 cancelled sailings between East Cowes and Southampton, United Kingdom due to technical issue in aft main engine.

JUTLAND was struck by shuttle ferry BERLIN, near Brunsbuettel Lock, Kiel Canal, en route from Klaipeda to Bremerhaven. Extent of damages is unknown, but she was turned from Lock and berthed in the Canal.
Container ship was NUC following blackout in Strait of Dover, UK. Apparently blackout was caused by emergency switchboard failure. Crew carried out repairs and continued voyage on 14 October

Tanker suffered engine failure NW of Floro, Norway. Norwegian Coast Guard deployed Bergen to assist and towed vessel to Floro on 14 October. Repairs were carried out and sailed to Egersun on 16 October.
Bulk carrier had engine fault in the Marmara Sea, south of Istanbul, while en route from Djen Djen, Algeria, to Novorossyisk, Russia. Tug Kurtarma 6 assisted vessel to Ahirkapi Anchorage for repairs.
Bulk carrier collided with a fishing vessel near Ushi Island, Japan. No reports on injuries or pollution. An investigation was started.

Bulk carrier collided with a fishing vessel some 27 nm E of Naozhou island, NE of Hainan, en route from Zhanjiang, Guangdong province, South China to Zhangjiagang, Yangtze river. One fisherman was taken to hospital with serious injuried while another fell overboard but was rescued and was safe. An investigation was on, so FRONTIER YOUTH was anchored near collision site and allowed to sail after 2 days.

Bulk carrier struck general cargo ship HAJE HALIMEH in Marmara sea north of Marmara island, while en route from Kavkaz port Russia to Haifa. Both vessels sustained damages and were diverted to Tekirdag for inspection. ASOMATOS had dents and scratches on starboard forecastle and bow.

C|ontainer ship was caught in strong gusts of wind while maenouvering in port of Tanger Med, Morocco and allided with corner of dock. The impact caused a hole of considerable size but vessel still sailed same day.
Vessel was NUC due to leaking gasket in main engine, after exiting S reporting line of Dover TSS. Repairs were carried out and she resumed voyage the same day.
Vessel was partially aground after total failure of its steering system in St. Lawrence River off Batiscan, Quebec, Canada. Tugs assisted with refloating. No reports of pollution.

Vessel experienced steering gear system failure and lost control during Canakkale Strait passage at Camburnu point, Turkey. She was towed to Karanlik liman anchorage. A fine was imposed and sailed from anchorage on 19 October.

TURBA was NUC and drifted for two days in a busy shipping lane, 200 miles west of Aceh in Indonesia, Indian Ocean. Repairs were carried out and vessel started moving at about 5 knots, bound for Tanjung Pelepas, Malaysia.
ARAMIS suffered mechanical failure in Aegean Sea, Greece.No pollution. Tug Vernicos Scafi One assisted amd vessel anchored in Agnontas.
Container ship had engine failure in Elbe River, near Glückstadt, en route from Hamburg to Antwerp. Tugs were deployed and towed vessel back to Hamburg where she berthed.
General cargo ship had engine failure off Rhodes Island, Greece. Repairs were carried out by the crew and resumed voyage the next day.

A fire was lit in a washroom, while vessel was sailing from Tsawwassen, Canada. The suspect was a young man who was initially arrested but then released on an undertaking to appear in court at a future date on charge of mischief.
SALLY M suffered rudder failure at Canakkale Strait in way of Kepez point, Turkey. She shifted to Karanlik liman anchorage with tug assistance. Vessel was fined and sailed on 13 October.
Ferry experienced a fault in fire alarm system and had to return to Turku, Finland. Her evening departure and return sailing were cancelled. Repairs were being carried out by technicians.

Container ship allided with wall of new southern lock of Kiel Canal in Brunsbuttel, Germany. Some bricks were damaged, but vessel continued passafe despite damages. An investigation into the incident was on.

More than 70 people on board the cruise ship reported norovirus symptoms, during a cruise that took in Cozumel in Mexico, and Bimini, Commonwealth of the Bahamas. They were all isolated and enhanced sanitising procedures were initiated, including additional cleaning of cabins and high-contact areas around the ship.
Ferry suffered cooling water leak on starboard main engine, nearby Belfast port. Engine was turned off and tug was deployed to assist her to berth at Belfast. Repairs were completed by the crew.
Vessel had mechanical issues due to a piston fault in its propulsion engine, while fishing approx 300 kilometres from the Breton coast. She headed to Brest, France for repairs.

Container ship was detained by the Malaysian Maritime Enforcement Agency for anchoring without permission, 17nm west of Muka Head in Penang. She was permitted to sail on 12 October, bound for Pasar Gudang, Malaysia.

Vessel experienced engine failure at Canakkale Strait near Kumkale point, Turkey. Coastal Safety tug Kurtarma-14 towed her to Karanlik Liman anchorage. A fine was imposed, repairs were carried out and the ship sailed on the same day.

Reports vessel had engine fault, drifted and ran aground while entering Mombasa port, Kenya, on arrival from Port Louis, Mauritius. She was refloated on 12 October and taken to port for inspection. No reports on extent of damages.

Vessel collided with general cargo ship KUNIKI 28 off Kikuma coast, Imabari, Shikoku island, Japan Inner sea, while travelling in the same direction. They were diverted to Matsuyama port, Shikoku for repairs. Both vessels suffered damages of unknown extent. No leaks reported.
Reports vessel was NUC due to problems with two fuel injectors 47nm WSW of Bishop Rock Lighthouse, UK. Repairs were carried out by crew and continued voyahe to Brake.

Vessel collided with LPG tanker GAS BROADWAY off Kikuma coast, Imabari, Shikoku island, Japan Inner sea, while travelling in the same direction. They were diverted to Matsuyama port, Shikoku for repairs. Both vessels suffered damages of unknown extent. No leaks reported.
A fire broke out on board vessel off Koufonisi island coast, Aegean sea, Greece. She burned out and sank by 10 October. All 22 people on board left the yacht safely.

Ferry suffered mechanical failure due to lubricating oil cooling system causing oil release at sea alongside a wharf in Saint-Ignace-de Loyola, Canada. Vessel sailedd to Sorel for repairs. Minor pollution was reported.
Cruise ship ran aground in the vicinity of Kisiria Fournon Strait, Greece. No reports of water ingress or injuries. Three Coast Guard vessels attended.

Vessel dragged her anchor in river Don near estuary, Russia, Azov sea, drifted downstream and collided with ore/oil carrier NEFTERUDOVOZ-52M. Her propeller entangled in the anchor chain of NEFTERUDOVOZ-52M and they started drifing together, struck general cargo ship VIKING, and pushed her aground. As of 9 October all vessels had tugs working on them. No leaks reported.

SORMOVSKIY 3067 dragged her anchor in river Don near estuary, Russia, Azov sea, drifted downstream and collided with ore/oil carrier NEFTERUDOVOZ-52M. Her propeller entangled in the anchor chain of NEFTERUDOVOZ-52M and they started drifing together, struck general cargo ship VIKING, and pushed her aground. As of 9 October all vessels had tugs working on them. No leaks reported.

SORMOVSKIY 3067 dragged her anchor in river Don near estuary, Russia, Azov sea, drifted downstream and collided with ore/oil carrier NEFTERUDOVOZ-52M. Her propeller entangled in the anchor chain of NEFTERUDOVOZ-52M and they started drifing together, struck general cargo ship VIKING, and pushed her aground. As of 9 October all vessels had tugs working on them. No leaks reported.

Collision between bulk carriers SKIPPER PLANET and CUMA 12 nm west of western tip of Ikaria island, Greece, Aegean sea. They were sailing in opposite directions, and remained under way at reduced speed, probably will drop anchor for inspection. SKIPPER PLANET's status was NUC, which means she may have suffered more serious damages. She was en route from Egypt to Istanbul.
Vessel ran aground at 150.4km mark of Volga-Caspian Sea canal, Russia. No reports on damages, injuried or pollution. She was able to refloat independently continued her voyage.

Collision between bulk carriers SKIPPER PLANET and CUMA 12 nm west of western tip of Ikaria island, Greece, Aegean sea. They were sailing in opposite directions, and remained under way at reduced speed and probably will drop anchor for inspection. CUMA was en route from Bulgaria to Indonesia. No reports on damages yet.
A fire erupted in laundry room of vessel in Newhaven Harbour, UK. No reports of injuried or damages.

Ferry had propulsion issues and had to reduce speed after departure from Douglas, Isle of Man to Heysham, UK. Crew were unable to fix the problem and started drifting. She sailed to Douglas on 10 October.

Vessel struck berthed tanker YAMAYURI at Tsuruga port, western Honshu, as she was leaving port en route to Kanazawa. She was taken back to berth. Both vessels suffered damages. No injuries or polution reported.

Cargo ship had engine failure off the Mediterranean Egyptian coast, en roue from Malta. She drifted into Egyptian waters and dropped anchor. Egyptian authorities imposed several fines for violating the border, unauthorised anchorage and even for not operating its AIS. As of 28 October vessel was still anchored due to some bureaucratic issues. She was sold and was supposed to sail for the last time under the old owner.

Around 20 crew members were poisoned with sulfuric acid, when a barrel with chlorine fell from forklift onto cargo deck at Cebu port, Philippines, during loading operations. They were taken to hospital with nausea and vomiting, where 10 of them received further treatment. Vessel sailed on 9 October to Surigao.

Reports of collision between the general cargo ship and fishing vessel Hiroyu Maru No. 8 in Toyama Bay 7 nm off Himi, northwest Honshu, Japan sea. The fishing vessel capsized and partially sank. Alll 4 fishermen were safely rescued. Oil leak was reported. It;s believed that the cause of the accident was extreme weather.

Finnish authorities suspected vessel has caused damage to Balticconnector gas pipeline. An investigation into the damage found a dragging trail on seabed leading to the point of damage in the gas pipeline.

Bulk carrier suffered an engine failure at southern entrance of Canakkale Strait, Turkey. She shifted to North of Bozcaada Island anchorage with tug assistance. A fine was imposed. Sailed on on 8 October.

YAMAYURI, berthed at Tsuruga port, western Honshu, was struck by ro-ro cargo ship SANSTAR DREAM as she was leaving port bound for Kanazawa. Both vessels suffered damages, no injuries or leaks reported.

Vessel ran aground after suffering engine failure and lost control in pos 38 25 18.0N, 027 02 18.0E, Turkey. Tugs attended and vessel was refloated and berthed same day. Repairs were carried out by crew and was granted permission to sail on 1 November.
Ferry ran aground near Torsholma Brando, Aland after being caught in strong winds. She was refloated and escorted to Lappo by Coast Guard.
Vessel suffered failure of navigation system together with VDR at Tuapse, Russia. Repairs were carried out and she was granted permission to sail on 10 October.

Reports of engine failure while approaching old lock of Canal in Brunsbuttel at pier 4, Germany. Vessel was towed by tugs Parat and Helmut and was berthed at Lindenau Shipyard Kiel-Friedrichsort for repairs. She saild again on 25 October.

Vessel had water ingress and developed heavy starboard list, in northern Taiwan Strait east of Fuzhou, while en route from Keelung Taiwan to Wenzhou China. She limped into Dongju island waters, Lianjiang County, and drfited onto southern breakwater of Mengao port. She was later berthed, no injuries or leaks reported.
Ferry ran aground on sandbank in Rio de la Plata, 2.5 Kms from Uruguayan coast. She was promptly refloated and arrived at destination more than two hours late.
A fire broke out in clothes dryer on deck 2 at Blohm + Voss shipyard in Hamburg, Germany. Fire brigade attended and extinguished fire.
Vessel collided with a mooring dolphin while unloading in Windsor, Ontario, Canada. She suffered minor damages so was able to resume operations. No reports of pollution.
Tanker had engine failure during Strait passage at Poyraz point. She shifted to Yenikapi anchorage under supervision of tugs. Repairs were carried out and she sailed on the next day.

General cargo vessel collided with cruise boat KLM SEHAT ELONA in Flores sea, in strait separating Sembawa and Sangeang islands, Bima Regency, West Nusa Tenggara, Indonesia. The cruise boat starboard sustained heavy damages, while WIJAYA KUSUMA 1 sustained bow damages and probably lost portside anchor. No injuries reported.

Reports vessel was struck by sea mine at Danube Delta anchorage, Black sea as she was entering Sulina Sea Channel. Ballast tank suffered damages but vessel was able to resume sailing, bound for Vilkovo port, Ukraine, Danube Delta.
Vehicles carrier was hit by strong winds and allided with berth when leaving Port of Toyohashi, Japan. No damage were reported and vessel departed Toyohashi, bound for Korea.
En route from Augusta, Italy to Istanbul, Turkiye, had an engine failure in pos 38 03 00N, 018 28 00E, Ionian Sea. Repairs carried out by the crew. Arrived in the port of Venice, Italy, on 14 Jun.
Reports LPG tanker had to drop anchor after having issues with unit 2 of main engine, due to electronic fault, bearing and range from Dover 240 at 14.6 NM, UK. She sailed on the same day.

Offshore supply tug ran aground south of airport, southern coast of St. Thomas island, US Virgin islands. Her hull was breached and had water ingress in engine room. US Coast Guard rescued all 12 crew members.
Vessel collided with general cargo with container capacity BOTHNIA FIN during docking manoeuvre in Brunsbuttel, Germany. No major damages reported. She sailed from Brunsbuttel next day.

The captain was in critical condition and needed to be medevaced. Vessel had to return Rethimnon, northern Crete as she was heading to Sitia. The man was taken to hospital but was declared dead from natural cause.

Cruise ship had to interrupt her voyage to Auckland, New Zealand, as she was requested to assist in the rescue of an Australian man who was rowing across the Pacific Ocean trying to set a world record. She was diverted 100 miles off her original route. The man was spotted by a French navy aircraft that was dispatched from New Caledonia and, shortly after, the cruise ship arrived and rescued the man from his capsized vessel. He received treatment for dehydration and sunburn and was otherwise in good health.

Vessel suffered mechanical fault at northern entrance of Canakkale Strait at Gelibolu, Turkey. She shifted to N entrance of Sevketiye anchorage under own power. Repairs were carried out by crew and sailed next day.
Ferry had a technical problem in Jetvik, Norway. She sailed to Sandnessjoen for repair works.

A fire erupted in engine room, half an hour after sailing from Darwin, en route to Indonesia. The fire was extinguished quickly, without any injuries to crew or cattle. Vessel dropped anchor and was to return to Darwin to offload cattle, but as of 5 October she was in the same position, probably trying to restart engine and resume voyage from there.
Tanker collided with a smaller boat in Siak River in Riau Province, Indonesia. Incident was investigated by HM & Port Authority. No injuries reported.

BOTHNIA FIN allided with bulk carrier BONTRUP AMSTERDAM during docking manoeuvre in Brunsbuttel, Germany. Her bow was caught in stern moorings of the bulk carrier. Both vessels suffered material damages.
Vessel had mechanical failure, while departing from Volos bound for Sporades Islands, Greece. She remained at Volos port waiting for repairs and class inspection.

Bulk carrier was caught in very strong wind at Uglegorsk anchorage, Sakhalin, Russia. Reports say she dragged her anchor and came dangerously close to shore. MRCC Sakhalin confirmed vessel drifted but managed to stabilise at 10-20 meters depths, with ship’s 7 meter draft. Tugs couldn not help due to the extreme weather.

Bulk carrier had engine failure off the coast of Türkeli Lighthouse while en route from Constanta, Romania to Kocaeli, Turkey. Tug Kurtarma 8 assisted the vessel and moored safely at the Türkeli anchorage. She was underway the next day, bound for Derince, Turkey.
Bulk carrier had engine failure, near Roberts Bank, BC, Canada. Tug assisted andproceeded to anchorage to assess issue. Sailed from Roberts Bank the same day.

Reports vessel suffered engine failure during entry maneuver into S lock chamber of Kiel Canal in Brunsbuttel, Germany. She stopped in lock using mooring lines, engine was restarted and continued voyage on 5 October.
Container ship had mechanical fault when about to enter Dardanelles, en route from Aliaga to Burga. Vessel had to turn back and was escorted to Bozcaada anchorage for repairs.

A fire broke out in engine room, 25 NM west-south-west of Karwar, India, en route from Hazira India to Colombo. Fire was extinguished by crew. No injuries or pollution reported. Vessel was disabled but work continues to restore power to main engine. Cause of fire is being investigated.
LARISSA B was NUC due to engine failure, which required a change of gasket and oil filter, off Tynemouth. Repairs were carried out and arrived at Dundee the next day.
Ferry suffered minor damages after hard docking at Oak Bluffs Terminal, USA. She required repairs and a US Coast Guard  inspection before next voyage.

A crew member was medevaced from platform crane vessel by the US Coast Guard, 35 miles south of Grand Isle, Louisiana. The man was suffering acute chest pain and was hoisted aboard a MH-60 Jayhawk helicopter and transferred to University Medical Centre in New Orleans.

Reports of fire in one of the containers on board vessel, 12.5nm north of Kea island, Aegean sea, while en route from Piraeus to Thessaloniki. Crew took fire under control nad vessel returned to Piraeus at high speed. No injuries reported.
Vessel was NUC due to problem with thermal heating oil, about 14.5 NM from sunk centre, UK. No reports of pollution. Repairs were carried out by crew within one hour.
Bulk carrier experienced mechanical failure during Canakkale strait passage, Turkey. She dropped anchor at Karanlik Liman anchorage  for repairs. She resumed strait passage on 4 October.
Ferry had to cancel two sailings to and from Arran through Lochranza, UK after experiencing mechanical issues.

Fishing vessel was struck by a tanker 85 nm NW of Scarborough Shoal, South China sea. Vessel sank and of the 13 fishermen on board, 3 died and 10 were rescued. According to the fishermen's description the vessel that struck them could be crude oil tanker PACIFIC ANNA which was en route from Korea to Singapore. Tanker will be checked once she arrives at Singapore.

Powder carrier ran aground onto shallows about 300M South from Ishikawa Coal Fired Power Plant, in Okinawa Prefecture, Japan. She was pulled off shallows the same day by a work ship sailing in the vicinity.
Ferry allided with quay at Porta di Massa, Italy during berthing operations. The hard impact caused injuries to 8 people and one woman had serious injuries. Coast Guard personnel intervened.
Ferry experienced mechanical issues and had to cancel service between Hofles, Geisnes and Lund, Norway. Vessel was back in normal operation one hour earlier than initially expected.

Fire erupted in engine room, some 18 nm off eastern coast of Honshu, Japan, en route from Yokohama to Osaka. Crew extinguished fire but vessel was disabled and went adrift. Crew managed to restart the engine and continued voyage 16 hours after the fire started. No injuries reported.

A fire broke out on board while in Island chain off Froya when leaving Oyrekken, Norway. The fire was extinguished and vessel headed to shore under own power. She berthed at Kvernhusvik Shipyard. Repairs were carried out and sailed on 9 October.
Container ship had steering systems failure, 35.60 NM WSW of Cape Beale in vicinity of Loudoun Canyon, Canada. She continued voyage to destination using redundant steering.
Reports vessel struck her stern on lock wall at Saint-Lambert, Quebec, Canada. Pilot boat VILLE-MARIE assisted and vessel resumed voyage. No reports of pollution.
Vessel suffered steering system failure in Strait of Georgia, BC, Canada. Tug SEASPAN RAPTOR assisted vessel to anchorage. Crew carried out repairs and sailed on 7 October.
Ferry's stern ramp allided with a pier in Fynshav, Denmark. Sailings were canceled for rest of weekend and vessel was moved to Soby for repairs.
Ferry suffered engine failure and was sidelined in Tobermory, UK. Tobermory lifeboat towed her to Tobermory.
Vessel experienced mechanical failure and had to shelter and drop anchor at Sinop anchorage, Turkey. Repairs were being carried out by crew.
Ferry allided with stern right part of pier during berthing maneouvers at Skiathos port, Greece. No reports of injuries or pollution. Vessel had minor damages and scratches.
Tanker suffered mechanical fault at Taman, Russia and departure permission was cancelled. Repairs were carried out by crew and vessel sailed on 13 October.
Container ship had total failure of propulsion system, in Chenal Racine, off wharf No.66 of Port de Montreal, Canada, while assisted by 2 tugs. She sailed from Montreal port the same day.
Bulk carrier had propulsion loss due to engine failure, while departing anch No. 16 in English Bay, Canada. Engine was restarted and vessel proceeded back to anchorage, She sailed on 3 October.

Fire erupted on cargo deck in Mediterranean north of Lampedusa, while en route from Lampedusa to Porto Empedocle. Italian Coast Guard coordinated the rescue of all 177 people on board and trasferred them to Porto Empedocle. No reports on damages or injuries. The fire was apparently extinguished or at least taken under control.
A fire erupted in engine room due to overheating in propeller shaft, while in Amrum,Germany. SAR ship ERNST MEIER-HEDDE was deployed to assist. RUM HART replaced the vessel.
Container ship had a crack in No. 5 double bottom water ballast tank at Grand Banks of Newfoundland, Canada. Crew carried out temporary repairs and sailed to Montreal.
Vessel experienced mechanical failure during Canakkale Strait passage and dropped anchor in Karanlik liman anchorage, Turkey. Repairs were carried out by crew.
Vessel ran aground onto shallows about 350 metres SE off from Numazu Port, Japan. There were no damages to hull and no leaks reported.
A fire erupted in heating system near smokestack, while at Helgoland Quay in Wilhelmshaven, Germany. No reports of injuries. Fire department extinguished fire and police launched an investigation.

Reportedly, an accident occured on board vessel during pressurization test of buoyancy pontoon deployed in underwater pipe-laying, when a sudden decompresion injured 4 crew members. They received medical attention but not sure if they were medevaced or not. There are no official reports, it's just presumed the accident happened on this vessel as she left her working area and moved to a position or anchorage close to shore.

Vessel (IMO:9030682) found had cracks in hull by divers;did temp repairs,Sidney,Canada,28 Sep 2023. It will be pulled for repairs after Thanksgiving weekend. Reach dry dock for permanent repairs from 10 Oct. Out of service from 10 Oct-18. Divers found crack in vessel's hull in Sidney, Canada. Temporary repairs were carried out amd since 10 October she has been out of service awaiting dry dock repairs.
Tanker lost propulsion during a manoeuvre to enter the port of Mangalia, Romania. A tug was deployed and towed vessel to port.
Ferry experienced technical problems and was out of service, while Calmac was seeking spare parts to fix the problem.

Two stowaways were found aboard vessel after she moored in the Zandvliet lock, en route from Lagos, Nigeria to Antwerp, Belgium. The local fire brigade were called to remove the two Africans who have been hiding in the rudder compartment. They were taken by ambulance to a nursing station.

Vessel experienced main engine failure due to oil pipe fault, 8nm NW of Pendeen/Lands End, UK. She was NUC and drifted NE of TSS. Repairs were carried out by the crew within an hours. No pollution reported.

Ferry had port side main engine fault during scheduled service from the port of Kyllini to the port of Poros, Greece. She returned to Kyllini where all passengers were transferred to another vessel to take them to their destination. KEFALONIA was sidelined until repairs and presentation of class maintenance certificate.
An auxiliary boiler exploded on board vessel, causing fire in a garbage compartment. Crew extinguished fire and assessed damages before resuming voyage.

Drilling ship was boarded by nince Greenpeace activists in Manzanillo Bay, Mexico, 2km from the coast where vessel was anchored since November 2022, awaiting permit to extract minerals. The activists placed a yellow blanket on a metal structure displaying the phrase  “Destroyer Of The Oceans”.
MORPHOU ran aground onto shallows during trial operations, 400m off Oshima Shipbuilding in Saikai City, Nagasaki Prefecture, Japan. She was refloated after 4 hrs, by own means.
Reports vessel made bottom contact, about 0.43 NM S of Farlingers Point, in St. Lawrence River off Cornwall, ON, Canada. Crew assessed damages and resumed voyage.

A crew member has gone missing while the vessel was transiting Kiel Canal, en route from Delfzijl to Rostock. An extensive search with drone and helicopter was on but the man couldn't be found. It is not clear as of yet how he disappeared, the only clue being a pair of shoes on deck. His identity remains undisclosed. The ship continued her voyage.
Reports of collision with combined chemical and oil tanker Kivalliq W, while providing icebreaking assistance in Ikpiarjuk, NU, Canada. Both vessels resumed voyages the same day.
RSC San Juan, Puerto Rico reported that vessel was disabled and adrift in Caribbean Sea. She arrived in Cabo Rojo on 26 September for repairs.
General cargo ship had mechanical fault  and dropped anchor at Sinop anchorage, while en route from Tuapse, Russia to Bartin, Turkey. Repairs were carried out by the crew.
FALKBRIS ran aground at Olaskjaer in Kalvag, Norway. Tug Polaris was deployed to assist with refloating. Vessel moored in Gunhildvagen.
Icebreaker Pierre Radisson struck vessel, while providing icebreaking assistance in Ikpiarjuk, NU, Canada. Both vessels resumed voyages the same day.
A fire erupted on board and filled with dense smoke, while in drydock in Kaiser Dock II of Lloyd Yard, Germany. Fire brigade extinguished fire and vessel shifted to German Dry Docks MWB Bremerhaven.
Ferry's cables entangled with a fishing vessel's anchor in strong winds. She was held up for several hours between Buckley Bay and Denman Island, Canada.
A fire erupted in the engine room in the waters of Tanjung Pemancing, Sarang Tiung Village, Pulau Laut Sigam District, South Kalimantan, Indonesia. One crew member died and other two were injured.
Vessel had starboard main engine fault while en route from port of Corfu to port of Gaios Paxos, Greece. Passengers disembarked at Paxos. Sailing was banned until repairs were done.
Vessel ran aground near Shell Bay, New Zealand, on SE side of peninsula. All crew were evacuated by helicopter. An investigation was launched. No leaks reported.
Vessel had steering gear system failure at Gelibolu point in the Strait, Turkey. Repairs could not be carried out by the crew so Coastal Safety tug Kurtarma-15 provided further assistance.
Cement carrier ran aground in St. Lawrence river just above Cornwall, Ontario, Canada, en route from Montreal to Oshawa. Traffic was blocked in the area. No leaks reported.
Vehicles carrier was NUC due to engine failure in English Channel. No tug has been tasked as repairs were carried out by the crew and vessel continued voyage the same day.
A fire erupted in engine room, at Bandar Lampung anchorage, East Sumatra, Sunda Strait. 26 crew members were evacuated and tugs and firefighter boats assisted and took fire under control.
Container shi was NUC due to engine problems, with polymer unit which had high temperature, in UK, North Sea. Repairs were completed within an hour and vessel continued voyage.
Ferry had gearbox issues and had to cancel sailings to and from port of Ardrossan, UK. She sailed from port of Ardrossan on 27 September.

Freighter had engine fault and started drifting NE of Istanbul in Black sea, while en route from Tuzla-Istanbul to Novorossiysk. Vessel contacted Turkish MRCC on 26 September to as for assistance. Tug KURTARMA 9 was deployed and towed the vessel.

NAVIN EAGLE had steering gear system failure during Canakkale Strait passage at Kilitbahir pt, Turkey. She shifted to Karanlik liman anchorage under supervision of a tug for repairs to be carried out.
Patrol vessel suffered damages to bulwark while manoeuvring alongside a wharf in Halifax Harbour, Nova Scotia, Canada. No pollution reported.
Vessel had failure of MARPOL units together with pertinent alarms at Tuapse, Russia. Repairs were carried out and she was allowed to sail on the next day.
Ferry had malfunction in air conditioning system in vicinity Egina, Greece. She was replaced by Nissos Aegina and was banned from sailing until repairs were carried out.
Trawler collided with combined chemical and oil tanker Duzgit Harmony, off Rotterdam, Netherlands. She entered port of Stellendam with significant bow and forecastle damages above water line.
Tanker had engine failure in front of the Canakkale Martyrs’ Monument, while en route from Istanbul to Kalamata. She was assisted by two tugs to shift to Bozcaada Anchorage for repairs.
Tanker collided trawler JERKI, off Rotterdam, Netherlands. Sheemtered Caland Port of Rotterdam. No reports on damages.
While anchored at Constanta anchorage, Romania, vessel was struck by bulk carrier GENCO COLUMBIA, which was leaving anchorage. No reports on damages for now.

ARIF AMCA dragged anchor and started drifting, after she anchored at Everingen anchorage area near Ellewoutsdijk, Western Scheldt upstream from Vlissingen, on arrival from St Petersburg, Russia. A tug assisted and held vessel in stable position, as she couldn't heave up anchor.
Bulk carrier collided anchored bulk carrier R SKYWALKER as she was leaving Constanta anchorage. No reports on damages as of yet.

Vessel ran aground in Talknafjordur fjord northwest of Iceland. Of the 20 people on board, 8 were evacuated and 12 remained on board. The ship was refloated and sailed under own power to port in Talknafjordur.
Ferry suffered mechanical issues and service between Foroy and Agskaret, Norway was cancelled. She was sidelined in Agskaret for repairs.
A fire broke out in engine room area, while vessel was being broke up at ship repair plant in Polyarny, Murmansk region, Russia. No injuries were reported. Fire was put out the same day.
Vessel suffered mechanical failure at S entrance of Canakkale Strait at Kumkale point. She shifted to N of Bozcaada Island anchorage. Repairs were carried out an sailed on 22 September.
PRIMA experienced mechanical failure at Novorossiysk, Russia. Permanent repairs were carried out and vessel was granted departure permission on 23 September, bound for Constanta, Romania.

Bulk carrier suffered structural failure, machinery safety system, alarms and navigation system faults, at Nemrut Bay, Turkey.Temporary repairs were carried out by the crew and was allowed to sail to Tuzla shipyard for permanent repairs.

UPDATE: 14-Feb-2024 The captain of the vessel was arrested for abducting three people who had come on board the vessel as inspectors for a buyer in Turkey. They were told the ship will have to be moved to an anchorage in Izmir when in fact the captain was intending to sail to Egypt. The Hellenic Coast Guard ordered the vessel to head into the anchorage at Chios where she was boarded by a Special Missions Unit. UPDATE: 05-Feb-2024 Inspectors at the port of Kiel found 42 deficienecies and detained the vessel. An agreement was reached to end the detention in Germany after three months and the vessel was supposed to call at a Dubai repair yard. She failed to do so and was banned from European ports. Tanker suffered engine fault after entering Holtenau locks of Kiel Canal, Germany. She was unable to reverse engine so tugs pulled her out of lock and berthed at N Jetty of Kiel. Later she was towed to Shore Port of Kiel.
Bulk carrier was NUC due to fuel oil pump fault, in pos 49 36 46N, 005 09 28W, UK. Repairs were carried out by crew and resumed voyage same day.
Ferry experienced engine failure during departure from Piraeus port, Greece. Repairs and class inspection were carried out in about 2 hours and vessel sailed for Souda port.
MELITA ran aground on river Volga, Russia. An inspection was carried out for navigation safety. No reports of injuries or polution.

Bulk carrier had propulsion fault west of Ushant in south west English Channel, en route from Bayonne France, Bay of Biscay, to Skagen Denmark. She started drifting towards the north of Ushant where she was towed by SAR ship ABEILLE BOURBON and taken to Brest anchorage.
Vesse was struck by bulk carrier Xin Hai Tong 32 at Chittagong’s outer anchorage, due to a faulty propeller. As of 1 October both vessels were still at Chittagong Anchorage.
Vessel collided with bulk carrier Cycas at Chittagong’s outer anchorage, en route to Chittagong Shipbreakers, due to propeller fault. No reports on damages.

Port Authority of Alonissos, Greece was informed that the vessel had sarboard main engine failure after sailing from port of Alonissos. She returned to Alonissos under own power and repairs were carried out.

Vessel collided with cargo ship ASTROL-5 in the Rostov region, at the 2,998km mark of the River Don, at the Sukhoi-Donetsk riffle of the Don River, while travelling in opposite directions. She suffered damages to port side. No reports of injuries or polution. An investigation is on.

A fire erupted in the engine room and spread to the accomodation block and superstructure of vessel, at Tuzla Shipyard, Turkey. Parts of the shipyard have also been affected by the fire. The fire brigade attented and extinguished fire within a few hours. A detailed inspection will be carried out to assess damages.
A fire erupted in engine room NW of Asaer in Nordland, Norway. NSSR lifeboats assisted and fire was put out. Vessel entered the port of Sandnessjoen the same day.
Cruise ship had propeller fault en route from Gdynia to Warnemunde and had to enter the port a day earlier for divers to inspect and carry out repairs. Vessel sailed on the next day.
Container ship suffered mechanical fault at Hamilton harbour, Bermuda, US. Maintenance work was carried out by crew and technical team.
Bulk carrier allided head on with quay, during berthing manoeuvre in Imbituba, Brazil, while en route from Guayaquil, Ecuador. Both vessel and quay suffered damages.

Vessel collided with VOLGO-DON 225 in the Rostov region, at the 2,998km mark of the River Don, at the Sukhoi-Donetsk riffle of the Don River, while travelling in opposite directions. She suffered damages to port side. No reports of injuries or polution. An investigation is on.
Vessel was struck portside by general cargo ship Volgo-Don 225 at 2998 KM mark on River Don, Russia. She suffered damages to hull, bow and guard rails. No injuries or pollution reported.

AVONTUUR was caught in rought weather conditions, N of English Channel, while en route from Hamburg, Germany. She requested assistance and tug Abeille Normandie pulled her into port of Dunkirk, France.

A female crew member disappeared from the dredger in the waters of Dénia, Alicante. The Spanish Civil Guard are linking her disappearance with a complaint she had recently filed for a sexual assault that happened on board the vessel between 2018 and 2019. As of 19 September, the vessel was listed as with restricted manoeuvrability off Barcelona, Spain.
Ferry ran aground in Bali Strait, while en route from Ketapang, Java, to Gilimanuk, Bali. All 114 passengers were evacuated, but the vessel is still aground, no AIS for several months.
Passenger ship experienced engine failure while on route from Poros to Hydra, Greece. She sailed back to Poros Island for repairs.

Ferry rescued 6 migrants off Mona Island's Sardinera Beach. Their vessel capsized near Playa Sardinera, where the park rangers heard cried for help and contacted US Coast Guard, which deployed the cutter "USCGC Margaret Norvell" and an Ocean Sentry aircraft for search and rescue operations. KYDON was sailing nearby and promptly provided assistance. All 6 migrants were safe and will be returned to their home country.
A fire erupted in cargo hold while in the Central Channel in Placentia Bay, Canada. Vessel was towed to Arnold's Cove, by tug Placentia Hopeand arrived in Argentia on 22 September.
Vessel had internal damage to engine room, off Calais, France. French SNSM rescue vessel SNS077 escorted her to port of Calais for repairs.

Unconfirmed reports of vessel being struck by cargo ship SOHOM IV, while anchored at Diamond harbor anchorage, Kolkata, Hooghly river, India.SOHOM IV had suffered engine failure and drifted with strong current, causinf damages to the bulk carrier, which are yet to be estimated.
Reports the fish carrier had gearbox issues, 0.7nm SE of Mousa, UK. She was towed to Lerwick by Lifeboat. Lerwick CRT assisted with berthing. Vessel was safely alongside Shetland catch pier.

A stowaway of Tanzanian origin was found on board vessel, after a strange noise on the deck attracted the attention of a crew member. Port police attented and Passport and Immigration Officers placed him in police custody.
Ferry suffered engine failure and her departures from Nesna, Traena were cancelled. She was taken to Sandnessjoen for troubleshooting and repairs.
Vessel ran aground, in S Canakkale,Turkey. She was refloated using own power. No leaks, pollution or injuries were reported and permanent repairs will carried out in Tuzla.
Reports vessel suffered engine fault and started drifting in pos 41 26 06N, 140 28 58E, Japan. She was removed from the sea area the same day.
Ferry expereienced engine failure and was sidelined in Mukran, Germany, as she couldn't operate at required speed. Awaiting delivery of essential spare parts.
Vessel had engine failure in Greece. She sailed back to Piraeus for permanent repairs.
Container ship anchored at Ahirkapi anchorage, Istanbul, Marmara sea, was struck by bulk carrier NEW LEGEND while maneuvering to anchor. Both vessels suffered damages and remained at anchor.

Bulk carrier collided with container ship ELBSUN at Ahirkapi anchorage, Istanbul, Marmara sea, while maneuvering to anchor, en route from Kerch Strait anchorage, Russia. Both vessels suffered damages and remained at anchor.

Vessel suffered propeller failure and dropped at Miscou Banks, 3.8 NM NNE Birch Point, NB, Canada. Research vessel M. PERLEY provided assistance and freed propeller. CAPT JACQUES CARTIER sailed on 21 September.

Container ship suffered engine fault, while approaching Vung Tau, Vietnam, on arrival from Tanjung Pelepas, Malaysia. She was anchored at Vung Tau anchorage. Two days later tugs towed her to Cai Mep container terminal.
Vessel suffered mechanical failure at Icdas port, Turkey. She sailed after repairs and arrived at Saraylar on 21 September.

Tanker ran aground East of Moucha Island offshore Djibouti. She caused significant damage to coral reef off Moucha Island but no fuel leaks were reported. The ship was refloated on 19 September and proceeded to Djibouti anchorage.
Ferry suffered mechanical fault and sailed to port Vasiliki, Greece due to malfunction as reverser of port main engine. Sailing was banned until repairs.
Ferry had electrical supply system failure, which caused propulsion loss in Strait of Georgia, 2.90NM NE Georgina Point, Canada. Repairs were carried out while adrift and resumed operation.
Ferry had propeller damage while sailing to Bremerton, USA. She was taken out of service for up to 4 weeks. Cause of damage unknown.

Expedition vessel suffered mechanical failure in Fönfjörður fjord, southeast Greenland coast. Icelandic Coast Guard ship THOR was deployed to assist and reached POLARFRONT on 22 September. Vessel was towed to Reykjavík.

Romanian authorities are invastigating an explosion that took place on board vessel. It was initially believe to be a sea mine attack, but the damage suffered by the vessel would have been far greater if this was true. Also crew members declared during the initial investigation that the explosion took place inside. The hull was damaged causing water ingress and aft tilt. Vessel had arrived at Sulima Anchorage from Turkey, and next destination was Izmail, Ukraine.

Vessel experienced engine failure while approaching Kiel Canal, Brunsbuttel, Germany. She then had a blackout next day. Tugs assisted and resumed voyage on 17 September. She arrived at Gdynia on 20 September.

Ferry struck the starboard side of bulk carrier Yasa Pioneer, while en route from Pendik to Trieste. Both vessels were taken to Ahirkapi anchorage. No injuried or polution reported. As of 16 September vessel was berthed at Desan Yardgem United Shipyards.

Reports of steering failure in Yenikoy area, while transiting Bosphorus, en route from Bartin, Turkey to Hartlepool, UK. Vessel was escorted by tug and anchored at Ahirkapi, Istanbul, Marmara seafor repairs.
After repeated thruster issues, vessel had technical issues again in Cairnyan, UK. Sailing from Loch Ryan to Belfast was delayed for more than 2 hours.
A fire erupted in a vehicle on car deck while proceeding in Hecate , 21.70 NM E. Cape Ball, BC, Canada. Fire was extinguished and vessel resumed voyage. No reports of injuried or pollution.

Ferry Patria Seaways struck the starboard side of vessel which was en route from Jebel Ali to Novorossyisk. Both vessel were taken to Ahirkapi Anchorage. No injuried or polution reported. Yasa Pioneer remained moored at Tuzla.
Bulk carrier suffered engine failure in Alexandria, Egypt. Tug Christos XXXIV attended. Vessel was towed to Tuzla shipyard areaon 18 September.
A fire erupted in cargo hold, west of Cape Town, en route from Santos, Brazil to Qingdao, China. Vessel was taken to Saldanha Bay where firefighters assisted.
Vessel had engine failure in Republic of Ireland. She was towed to Rushbrooke by Ocean Challenger and DSG Alex for repairs.

2 crew members, Chief and Second Officer, were hit by a trailer truck that broke free from lashing points, at Salerno, Italy, during cargo operations. The Second Officer died on the spot and the Chief Officer suffered serious injuries and was transferred to hospital.

LADY ALINA ran aground in waters off Coron Island, Palawan, Philippines. Philippines Coast Guard, Department of Environment and Natural Resources, and Palawan conducted a damages assessment. No oil spill was reported. The ship was refloated the next day.
Reports vessel suffered engine failure and was NUC 6.9 NM from Tiumpan head, UK. She was towed and anchored in Arnish the same day.
Ferry experienced generator issues while sailing between Edmonds and Kingston, USA. She was sidelined while crew tried to determine whether vessel needs to go into a shipyard for repairs.
Cruise ship suffered blackout while approaching the port of Copenhagen. This impacted the engines and the technical systems such as the bow thruster and propeller.

A fire erupted on board the fishing vessel and was disabled at Browns Bank, NS, Canada. Crew extinguished fire and fishing vessel HANNAH MAE and Coast Guard vessel CHEDABUCTO BAY towed her to West Pubnico, NS.
Ferry had turbojet system failure due to a foreign object, while sailing from Mykonos to Paros, Greece. She sailed back to Mykonos for object removal and class inspection.
