Captain of vessel reported port main engine failure, while about to sail to Agistri, Greece after having had maintenance work at Perama yard repair zone. She eventually sailed on 16 September.

CHIAPAS STAR developed starboard list as she was about to depart Mazatlan port, Mexico bound for La Paz, Baja California Sur. Reports suggest ballasting was the cause of loss of stability, which led to heavy list and capsize. All crew have been evacuated. Vessel awaiting salvage.

Cargo ship had technical fault at Novorossiysk, Black Sea, Russia. Her departure was cancelled until completion of repairs and an inspection by a state surveyor. She sailed the next day, bound for Ambarli, Turkey

UPDATE: As of 13 September, vessel was still aground, as was not able to refloat with high tide. Danish Joint Arctic Command (JAC) deployed patrol ship, which is to arrive at site on 15 September. Meanwhile, fishing support vessel and other local work boats are trying to assist, All passengers are safe. Cruise ship ran aground in Alpefjord, Northeast Greenland National Park while leaving fjord. SAR vessel was deployed to assist, but vessel might be able to refloat with high tide. No injuries, leaks or water ingress reported.

Ferry experienced trouble with turbocharger on 1 of its engines causing delays on crossings between Ystad,S weden and Ronne, Denmark. She was taken out of service in Ronne for repairs and resumed sailings on 25 September.
Vessel ran aground due to a blackout, in the sea area of Megara, Greece. She was refloated using towing assistance and moored in the port of Eleusina, Greece.
Ferry had main engine failure when about to sail from Piraeus port to Heraklion, Greec. She remained at Piraeus port waiting for repairs and the class inspection.
Bulk carrier suffered mechanical failure at S. entrance of Canakkale Strait, Turkey. She anchored at Bozcaada Island anchorage under own power. Crew carried out repairs and sailed on 13 September.

SAPPHIRE had mechanical failure at southern entrance of Canakkale Strait, Turkey. She shifted to north of Bozcaada Island anchorage, under own power. Repairs were carried out by crew and vessel sailed on 13 September.

General cargo ship suffered mechanical fault at southern entrance of Canakkale Strait, Turkey. She shifted to North of Bozcaada Island anchorage and dropped anchor under own power. As of 22 September she was stationary in the same position.
Ferr lost anchor while en route from Naxos to Paros, Greece. She arrived safely and berthed at Paros. Class inspection was carried out and sailed with delay to Piraeus port.

Container ship touched bottom near Akurey islet, while en route from Rotterdam to Reykjavík. Coawst Guard observed a thin oil film outside harbor area but it hasn't been confirmed if the vessel is the source of the leak, as her hull is to be checked by divers.

Port Authority of Pounta reported ferry experienced mechanical failure, due to a cable jammed in starboard propeller, during berthing at Pountas, Greece. Sailing was banned until repairs and seaworthiness certificate issued.

Sailings to Vineyard Haven and return trips to Woods Hole, USA were cancelled by Steamship Authority, after a small internal leak from fuel strainer was observed. Repairs were carried out and vessel was brought back to service.
A fire occured in an emergency backup battery charger compartment, about 11.40 NM NE of Johnson Point, Canada. Fire was extinguished the charger was replaced. Vessel continued voyage on 10 September.
Vessel ran aground after breaking off tow line while assisting the grounded Vis Ingraham, in Providence Rapids, Canada. She proceeded to wharf with water ingress controlled by the crew.

The anchor of the ferry tangled with the anchors of the Ekaterini P and the Superferry as they were sailing from Rafina, due to bad weather. Collision was just avoided. Fast Ferries Andros was moored at Paloukia Port, Athens as of 14 September.

Vessel had her anchor tangled with anchors of the Fast Ferries Andros and the Superferry during departure from Rafina, due to bad weather. They were close to collision but it's been avoided. Ekaterini P was stopped at Tinos as of 15 September.

The anchor of vessel got entangled with anchors of the Fast Ferries Andros and the Ekaterini P during departure from Rafina, due to bad weather. The Super Ferry lost her anchor and was denied sailing until class maintenance certificate was obtained. She was stopped at Gavrio as of 15 September.
AHMAD B had technical failure at Novorossiysk, Russia. Her departure was canceled until repairs were done. She sailed on 11 September.
Ferry had engine fault which caused her to sail at slow speed between Liverpool, UK and Douglas, Isle of Man. Engine will require full rebuild at end of the season.

Tanker collided with Muroto city based coral fishing boat Tenryu Maru six kilometres south of Muroto-misakim, Cape Muroto, while en route from Tokuyama to Kochi. The fishing vessel had cracked hull and partly sank. Tanker berthed in Kochi. Investigation is on to determine the cause of incident.
Bulk carrier experienced engine failure and was disabled and adrift in South China Sea, Indonesia. She arrived at Port of Tanjung Uncang, Indonesia on 14 September.
Reports vessel suffered engine fault, which caused total loss of propulsion, in Dixon Entrance, 13.60 NM NNW of Rose Point, BC, Canada. Crew carried out repairs and sailed to Brown Passage.

Superyacht was attacked by activists for the second time in two months. Vessel was sprayed with red paint in Barcelona and the activists displayed a banner saying "Billionaires should not exist". They were initially arrested but released after 3 hours.
Passenger ship allided with a wharf in Sandusky, USA. She was secured to the wharf to assess damage.

A passenger died after attempting to board the ferry via the car ramp. He previously disembarked for unknown reasons but when he tried to board again, a crew member pushed him back. He tried a second time and he was pushed into the water as the ferry started moving away. Some witnesses claim that one of the propellers struck him on the head as he fell into the water. The coronary report indicated that the passenger had drowned and had a small contusion on his head, probably from hitting the dock or the ramp. An investigation is underway to determine why the passenger was refused boarding to the point that he had to be pushed off the vessel. The captain was charged with dangerous navigation for failing to halt the ship when the man went overboard. The crew member who pushed him over was charged with manslaughter and other two are accused of complicity to manslaughter.
Ferry experienced engine failure in Fulford Harbour, British Columbia, Canada. She resumed voyage with the remaining engines.
Tanker suffered total engine failure and was disabled on Scatarie Bank, 8.50 NM E of Howe Point, NS, Canada. Canadian Coast Guard ship LA POILE BAY assisted while vessel was repaired.

A fire errupted in starboard engine while tug was towing barges CRT- 001 and CRT-002 in St. Lawrence River, QC, Canada. Fire was extinguished and vessel sailed to Port de Gros-Cacouna using remaining engine.

Ferry collided with sailboat on her way out from Halhjem, Norway. Sailboat sank but her captain was rescued by the ferry. He was drunk and sailboat did not have lanterns on. Investigation was launched.
Ferry had bow thrusters failure when was about to enter Heysham, UK. Operations were not impacted, passengers disembarked safely and repairs were carried out by service engineers.
BOROYSUND ran aground in Oslofjord off Oslo. All passengers were evacuated by other vessels She was refloated next day. No water ingress or injuries reported.
Vessel ran aground in Stromstad, Sweden. She suffered a scratch of 8 metres to hull but it wasn't considered serious. No injuries reported.
Fishing vessel suffered engine failure about 58 km from Channel coast, off Bay de Seine, France. ALB Amiral de Tourville towed her to Port en Bessin for repairs.
Reports vessel had technical failure at southern entrance of Canakkale Strait, Turkey. She anchored at Bozcaada Isl, anchorage, where repairs were carried out by crew and sailed on 13 September.

Reports vessel collided with a work and towing ship in the Osumi Strait, en route from Kashima, Japan, to Kaoshiung, Taiwan. The bulk carrier continued voyage, while the other vessel had bow damages and captain was injured.
Cruise ship had propulsion system failure and had to return straight to Port Canaveral, skipping her planned visit to Castaway Cay, to remain on schedule.

Cargo ship had engine failure in the southern Bosphorus while transiting from Tuzla to Novorossyisk, Russia. She was towed by tugs Kurtarma 6 and Kurtarma 10, and moored at Ahırkapı anchorage for repairs.
Ferry had automation system failure and cancelled departure from Turku, Finland. Repairs were carried out and resumed sailings from Turku to Stockholm the next day
Battery system overheated and vessel had to be taken out of scheduled service between Skye and Raasay, UK. Scottish Fire and Rescue Services attended to monitor battery system.

Superyacht was stuck in Rotterdam due to bridge over the Noord in Alblasserdam having a technical fault. The bridge had experienced a fault earlier in the day which apparently had been fixed, but the hatch would not open for the superyacht. Road traffic was also blocked due to barriers being already down.
Tanker suffered engine failure and was disabled and adrift in Bay of Bengal 210 nm east of Sri Lanka, en route from Saudi Arabia to probably China. No reports on SAR.
A number of sailings on Fishbourne-Portsmouth route, UK, have been cancelled due to a technical fault. Exact issue was not disclosed.

Fire erupted in aft section, probably on cargo deck of vessel berthed at Merak port, west Java, Sunda Strait. There was thick, black smoke. All passengers have been evacuated without any injuries or casualties. Fire engines on land and tugs with water cannons have been deployed to fight the fire.

Reports of collision between vessel and container ship LIBERTAS-H, 2 nm south of Kefalonia island, Greece, Ionian sea, while en route from Patrai, Greece to Aliaga, Turkey. Both vessels anchored at Kefalinia bay.

Reports of collision between vessel and general cargo ship SEA LEADER, 2 nm south of Kefalonia island, Greece, Ionian sea, while en route from Piraeus to Durres, Albania. Both vessels anchored at Kefalinia bay. Reportedly LIBERTAS-H caught fire but this has not been confirmed.

Car carrier had steering failure in Bass Strait, Victoria, Australia. Two tugs have tried to assist but were damaged due to rough weather. Vessel was moving in SE direction but in a chaotic manner. Crew were tring to repair while awaiting for the weather to improve to allow tugs assistance.
Bulk carrier suffered mechanical fault and dropped anchor at Yenikapi anchorage, Turkey, after completion of strait passage. Repairs were don by crew. and continued voyage on 8 September.

Two crew members suffered serious burns in a work accident, about 175nm southeast of the southern province of Ba Ria-Vung, while en route from Singapore to China. Captain requested medevac of the two men, but the ship was redirected towards the city of Vung Tau. An SAR vessel provided initial assistance and then transferred the men to the Vietnam-France Hospital in Ho Chi Minh City.

Tug's tow line broke away while it was towing a barge loaded with with two 300-ton steam generators for reactors 5 and 6 of Kudankulam Nuclear Power Plant, India. The barge ran aground grounded on coastal rocks near Kudankulam cargo terminal. Awaiting high tide and weather improvement to refloat.

Bulk carrier collided with FEDERAL CLYDE while transiting Côte-Sainte-Catherine Locks, St. Lawrence river, upstream from Montreal, bound for Hamilton. The vessels were sailing in opposide directions, and continued voyage after inspection. No damages were reported.

Bulk carrier collided with ALGOMA HARVESTER while transiting Côte-Sainte-Catherine Locks, St. Lawrence river, upstream from Montreal, bound for Montreal. The vessels were sailing in opposide directions, and continued voyage after inspection. No damages were reported.

Reports of three crew members being found unconscious in cargo hold, off Taiwan eastern coast. Vessel was about to berth at Hoping port. The three men were transferred to Hualien hospital, where they were pronounced dead. The probable cause of dead is inhalation of toxic emission.

A fire errupted on board research vessel, in the exhaust stacks, during operations off American Samoa. The fire was extinguished but affected the ship’s propulsion and other systems. All systems were restored by next day and vessel continued voyage to Pago Pago, American Samoa.

Ferry experienced anchor failure when departing from Skiathos port, Greece. She berthed at port of Agios Konstantinos where  passengers and vehicles disembarked. Sailing was banned until damage was repaired.

Pusher tug touched bottom in Mackenzie River near Fort Providence, Canada due to low water levels. Bottom plates of forward cofferdam were punctured.  Temporry repairs were carried out and vessel continued voyage.

Reports vessel had technical failure at southern entrance of Canakkale Strait, Turkey. She shifted to N of Bozcaada Island anchorage and dropped anchor under own power. Repairs were carried out by crew.
Fishing vessel suffered engine failure in Detroit d'Honguedo, Quebec, Canada. Coast Guard ship CAP AUX MEULES and then fishing vessel A.J. CHIASSON towed her to Caraquet.
A fire broke out in engine room on Lek near Bergambacht in South Holland, Netherlands. Fire was extinguished but one crew member suffered burns, smoke inhalation and was taken to hospital.

General cargo ship experienced mechanical failure, off Bandirma, Turkey and started drifting with wind and current direction. Crew carried out repairs and vessel's satutus was changed to underway as of 17 September.
LADY ZEHMA suffered engine fault off Ambarli, Turkey. Coastal Safety tug Kurtarma-12 assisted and vessel anchored at Ambarli anchorage. A fiine was imposed and departure canceled.
Container ship was disabled and adrfit due to engine failure in Gulf of Mexico. Repairs were carried out and vessel arrived in the Port of Pascagoula, US on 7 September.
Kun Yuan ran aground onto shallows in Nanano Bay, Ishikawa Prefecture, while en route from Ulsan to Nanao. A tug was deployed and helped refloating her. She berthed in Nanao port the same day.
MASHA D had bow thruster breakdown before leaving port of Setubal, Portugal. She returned to port with Sertosa tugs assistance, and was docked at Celeiro pier for repairs to bow propeller.
Bulk carrier experienced mechanical fault during Canakkale Strait passage and anchored at Karanlik liman anchorage. Crew carried out repairs and sailed next day.

A ramp collapsed with a loaded heavy truck on it during the discharge operation of trucks from the upper deck of ferry due to failure of ramp hydraulic system at Famagusta, Turkey. The truck driver was seriously injured and taken to the state hospital by ambulance. The Chief Officer and Captain of the ferry were arrested by the Public Prosecutor and vessel was not allowed to depart until the completion of investigations. Repairs were started by the crew with shore based technical support teams.

Tug suffered hull damage on steering portion inside engine room at Naga anchorage, Cebu, Philippines. The steering room flooded and vessel sank. Oil spill has been reported. Phillipined Coast guard responded.
Ferry was withdrawn from Emden - Borkum route, Germany due to technical fault. She was sidelined at cargo terminal in Emden port for repairs and sailed from Emden on 15 September.
Reports ferry had to cancel 2 crossings because of a fault with main engine exhaust at Southampton, UK. Staff worked hard to catch up.

UPDATE: Inspection found that the vessel had no significant damage and was in seaworthy condition. A fine and salvage expenses were paid and vessel was granted departure permission. As of 14 September she was moored at Ashdod. UPDATE: Vessel was refloated by tugs on 6 September and towed to anchorage where divers carried out a detailed underwater inspection. As of 11 September she was at Kos Island anchorage. Container ship  ran onto sandy bar and grounded at Cape Ammoglossa, Kos island, Greece, Aegean sea, en route from Aliaga to Ashdod. No tugs were seen around.

Reports of oil spill into Koh Sichang – Laem Chabang waters, Thailand, during offloading operations due to a faulty pipe. Tanker was not officially identified but according to charts and photos it is VLCC KALLISTA. Vessel was surrrounded by booms and cleansing is under way.

Vessel ran into embankment on Kiel Canal, Germany, due to rudder system failure. She refloated and berthed at railway station pilings in Brunsbuttel. She sailed on 6 September, after inspection and repairs.
Cargo ship had mechanical fault at southern entrance of the Canakkale Strait at Kumkale Point, en route from Gulluk to Yalova. She moored at Bozcaada Island anchorage and crew carried out repairs.
Vessel had technical fault, South of Istanbul Strait at Sarayburnu Point, Turkey. She then shifted to Yenikapi anchorage under own power. Repairs were done by crew.
Ferry had main engine failure and sailings between Ardrossan and Brodick, UK were delayed and even cancelled. Sailing resumed after repairs.
Reports vessel had main engine fault and was NUC and drifting, about 58 NM NE of Norfolk. Engine running in engine backup mode and was underway the same day.
Bulk carrier experienced engine failure while crossing the Suez Canal,at kilometre 25. Crew crried out repairs and vessel continued voyage the same day.

Reports vessel ran aground due to skipper falling asleep, in Aland Archipelago, while en route from Godby Aland to Naantali, Finland. She suffered hull breach with water ingress. Finnish Coast Guard and rescue boats assisted crew with pumping water. No leaks were reported.
Vessel had technical fault at southern entrance of Canakkale strait. She shifted to North of Bozcaada Island anchorage under own power. Repairs were carried out by crew.
Cruise ship had mechanical failure and cancelled departure from port of Seward, USA. She eventually sailed from Seward on 18 September.

Vessel ran aground in Ramparts of Mackenzie River, 9NM SW Fort Good Hope, NW, Canada. She had water ingress in a ballast tank but it did not affect seaworthiness and continued voyage after refloating.
Reports vessel ran aground and collided with part of Parola Ferry Terminal, Philippines, due to being caught in strong winds. She was towed to Lapuz Lapaz.
Master of vessel notified Port Authority of Piraeus, Greece, that the rear starboard wing of vessel was damaged. Sailing was prohibited until repairs were done.

A crew member went missing from the vessel, southwest of the island of Megistis, Eastern Mediterranean. Vessels in the vicinity were alerted and asked to keep a sharp lookout. SAR operation involved lifeguard boat, patrol boat, 3 sailing ships and a helicopter, but the man has not been found.
Vessel rescued lost crew member of container ship MSC NADRIELY, who has falled overboard the night before. He was later transferred to a hospital on shore.

Bulk carrier suffered engine failure and went adrift in South China sea, 290 nm E of Vung Tau, Vietnam, while en route from Ust Luga, Russia, to Caofeidian China. Vessel was towed 3 days later by a Coast Guard ship  and as of 5 September, she was approaching Vung Tau outer anchorage at a reduced speed.
Reports vessel had mechanical failure off Finike, while en route from Azov, Russia to Mersin, Turkey. Repairs were carried out by crew while vessel was drifting with wind.
General cargo ship had power failure and was listing 15 degrees to PD, outer roadstead, Constanta, Romania. Tug BRIZO assisted and managed to restore electricity.

A crew member (Chief Officer or 2nd Captain) fell overboard off Turkish coast in Black sea, while en route from Poti, Georgia to Tekirdag, Turkey. He was saved the next day by general cargo ship MOONLIGHT and then trasferred to hospital.

Cargo ship ran aground  due to steering failure, in Kiel Canal at 32 kilometer mark, while en route from Denmark to Spain. She was refloated by own means and was towed or escorted by tugs to Brunsbuettel for inspection.
Ferry had propeller fault while berthing at Harwich International, UK. Tugs Svitzer Kent and Inchcolm assisted with berthing.
Ferry was NUC due to seawater cooling system fault, 14nm SW of Isle of Wight, UK. Crew carried out repairs and sailed on the same day.
Fish carrier ran aground in the Kylerhea and Glenelg, Isle of Skye, Scotland. Awaiting for high tide to refloat. Kyle RNLI Lifeboat is nearby. No spills reported.

A pregnant woman was medevaced from the vessel  which was unable to enter the port due to weather conditions. She was taken to Bastia airport, Corsica and then transferred to hospital. Three hours later, during unloading at Bastia, a car drove off the ship, went off the pier and into the water. Seaport security guards jumped in to save the passengers. Three of them were rescued but one died. An investigation is on.
EARL GREY suffered electrical fault, which caused a loss of propulsion, in Rocky Bay, Canada. Emergency generator started automatically and vessel dropped anchor to carry out repairs.
Bulk carrier allided with a shore crane at a wharf in North Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada. Repairs were carried out by the crew.
Cruise ship had engine failure in pos 37 55 19N, 023 37 05E, Greece. No other details available.

Reports vessel almost broke loose from moorings as she was caught in gale-force winds in port of Civitavecchia, Italy. Tugs were deployed and pushed the vessel against quay. She sailed on the next day.
A heavy trailer truck lost control and collided with starboard shell plating of vessel, during loading operations at Mersin, Turkey, causing indents above water level. Vessel sailed on 28 August.

Ferry had mechanical fault and had to be sidelined on Belle-Ile - Quiberon route, due to a damaged part. This caused disruption to timetables on the Lorient to Ile de Groix service. Vessel resumed service on the 30 August.

A Nigerian Navy patrol team arrested seven people suspected of illegal bunkering aboard the vessel, 4nm from Lagos fairway buoy. They were said to have transferred Premium Motor Spirit from the vessel into hundreds of 200-litre drums and 50-litre jerry cans.

Ferry was caught in strong winds and contacted pier when trying to berth at Ibiza, on arrival from Valencia. Her hull was breached above waterline. All passengers were disembarked and vessel was not allowed to sail until repairs were done.

Cruise ship broke off her moorings in strong winds at Palma de Mallorca, started drifting in port basin and collided with moored tanker CASTILLO DE ARTEAGA. Port tugs were deployed and took her under control. Both vessels suffered minor damages and were moved to outer port anchorage.
Cruise ship experienced engine fault which impacted her cruising speed and caused delays to her scheduled return to Port Canaveral, United States.

Tanker was moored at Palma de Mallorca when cruise ship BRITANNIA broke off her moorings in strong winds, started drifting in port basin and collided with it. Port tugs were deployed and took her under control. Both vessels suffered minor damages and were moved to outer port anchorage.

Romanian maritime authorities were informed that vessel encountered problems while sailing in Black Sea, en route from Ukrainian Kiliya to Tekirdag, Turkey. She did not request assistance and refused the help offered by Romanian SAR. It seems vessel suffered water ingress in fore starboard side. She anchored off Romanian coast for some time then started sailing along Bulgarian coast, some 0.8 nm off the shore.

Reports of fire in the fore area of vessel berthed at Sunda Kelapa Harbor, Jakarta. Fire services deployed about 15 engines and 70 firefighters. It took them around 12 hours to extinguish fire. The cause of fire is being investigated. No reports on the extent of damages.

Vessel collided with fishing vessel Yenu, 35 NM from Peninsula Valdez, Argentina.She suffered hull breach just above waterline. Both vessels were ordered to Puerto Madryn to be inspected and repaired.

Vessel collided with fishing vessel LANZA SECA, 35 NM from Peninsula Valdez, Argentina. LANZA SECA, suffered hull breach just above waterline. Both vessels were ordered to Puerto Madryn to be inspected and repaired.
Tanker was NUC due to a false alarm on the main engine, about 13 NM from Hartlepool Bridge. Repairs were carried out by crew and vessel arrived in Vlissingen, Netherlands on 26 August.
Tug collided with port forward anchor of bulk carrier CSK UNITED while assisting vessel for departure in Roberts Bank, Canada. Crew assessed damage and resumed operations.

The ferry collided with tug TIPM NO.13302 while leaving Fuao port, Matsu islands, Taiwan bound for Keelung, Taiwan. The tug's hull was breached and sank in about 30 minutes after incident. No injuries were reported. Ferrycontinued voyage a few hours later.
Fishing vessel was NUC and started drifting without power, N of Lastres, northern Spain. Spanish rescue vessel Salvamar Rigel towed her to port of Gijon for repairs.
Reports of mechanical fault at southern entrance of Istanbul Strait at Uskudar point, Turkey. Vessel shifted to Yenikapi anchorage for repairs.

Vehicles carrier had hydraulic oil leak into the sea during car loading operations at Yenikoy Ford vehicle port, Turkey. An investigation was opened and a fine of $1.850.000 was imposed for the pollution.

Anchor chain of vessel entangled with bulk carrier Chitral's propeller at the outer anchorage of Chittagong, Bangladesh. Sarwar Jahan lost her anchor in the incident, while Chitral had her propeller cut away.

Reports vessel had total failure of propulsion system while leaving from Valleyfield, 2NM East Tete du Canal, QC, Canada. She dropped anchor to restart engines, then sailed to Beauharnois for inspection.

Bulk carrier's propeller was entangled by the anchor chain of bulk carrier Sarwar Jahan at Chittagong, Bangladesh due to rough weather. The propeller had to be removed but vessel was under stable condition. She will be shifted to Mongla Port after underwater surveys will be carried out.
Ferry experienced engine failure in Wellington and had to cancel 5 sailings between Wellington and Picton, New Zealand. Repairs were being carried out at Wellington.
Vessel collided with container ship CONTSHIP UNO in Kii Strait, eastern Honshu, Japan and then capsized. There were 5 crew members on board, 3 were rescued and 2 are still missing.

Container ship collided with general cargo ship IZUMI MARU in Kii Strait, eastern Honshu, Japan, while en route from Osaka to Keelung Taiwan. She remained in the area, probably involved in SAR for the capsized Izumi Maru.

Container ship had engine fault and ran aground in front of town of Bocachica on island of Tierrabomba, during departure from Cartagena,Colombia.A tug assisted and refloated and released vessel. She arrived in Manzanillo on 26 August.

Ferry hit a reef just outside Azolimnos while serving the route Syros-Serifos-Sifnos-Kimolos-Milos. Vessel returned to Syros where divers identified the damage which caused a leak. All passengers were transferred to another vessel.

Fire erupted in bar at Wrangell, US, right before vessel's departure from Ketchikan. She was filled with smoke and 11 people on board were taken to hospital but later discharged. There were no serious damages, except dirt, debris and ashes in bar. Cause of fire is unknown.
Ferry suffered generator fault in Tanger Med, Morocco. She was towed out of the port to main wharf in Gibraltar, for repairs.

A fire broke out in engine room shortly after vessels sailed from the port of Scarborough, Trinidad & Tobago. Crew managed to extinguish fire and the vessel returned to Scarborough, as some passengers needed medical attention. Ferry's sailings were cancelled and she will be towed to Port of Spain for investigations. Damages extent not known yet.
Fishing vessel had engine failure in vicinity of pos 22 28 00N, 017 19 00W and went adrift. MRCC Rabat, Morocco requested vessels in the area to keep sharp lookout.
Fishing vessel had propeller and rudder fault and was disabled in Laurentian Channel, 117 NM ESE Howe Point, NL, Canada. She was towed to North Sydney icebreaker/tender Kopit Hopson 1752.
Tanker had engine failure at North entrance, Istanbul Strait off Turkeli point,Turkey. Tugs KURTARMA 7 and KURTARMA 11 towed the vessel towards anchorage off Kisirkaya.
Vessel experienced mechanical failure during Istanbul Strait passage and dropped anchor at Buyukdere anchorage. Crew carried out repairs.
Vessel was NUC and drifing in the northern Indian Ocean. MRCC Colombo, Sri Lanka requested vessels in vicinity to keep a sharp lookout, assist if possible and report back.
Vessel had engine fault near Tunisia. Crew couldn't repair. Tug Seabuffalo towed her to Aliaga for repairs.
Reports ferry caused water pollution at Zeytinburnu, Turkey. Turkish Coast Guard and Turkish Environment Agency investigated and imposed a fine of about $477,000.

Ferry was turned into a temporary hospital due to a hospital on land being threatened by the wildfires in northern Greece. The hospital had to be evacuated overnight. All patients were taken to the port of Kavala and then transferred to other hospitals.

General cargo ship had mechanical failure at southern entrance of Istanbul Strait at Sarayburnu point, while en route from Tuzla to Eregli, Turkey. She shifted to Yenikapi anchorage, under own power. She sailed next day after repairs.
Vessel's propeller hit an unidentified object near Akureyri, Iceland. Reports of oil leak. Vessel was sidelined for about 2 days for repairs.
Ferry was taken out of service between Dover, UK and Calais, France due to mechanical failure. She resumed service next day, after repairs.

Tanker caught fire in the Gulf of Tonkin at around 2:30 PM Beijing time on Tuesday. She was loaded with 6,858 tons of diesel oil. Reports that she caught fire in the cargo tanks area and it spread aft to the rest of the ship. "Qinzhou Maritime Authorities responded, sending search and rescue vessels as well as the coast guard. Current reports suggest that of the 17 crew on board, 15 were rescued while the remaining two are still missing." The blaze was extinguished within hours. Reports suggest that the fire was probably triggered by an explosion.

BURRI tanker collided with the giant 295 m long BW Lesmes LNG carrier, on the Suez Canal. "MarineTraffic issued a time-lapse of the accident which suggests it was the gas carrier which broke down. The video shows the Burri turning to port and colliding with the BW Lesmes which was already lying across the waterway."

BURRI tanker collided with the giant 295 m long BW Lesmes LNG carrier, on the Suez Canal. "MarineTraffic issued a time-lapse of the accident which suggests it was the gas carrier which broke down. The video shows the Burri turning to port and colliding with the BW Lesmes which was already lying across the waterway."

Cargo ship had technical fault at the northern entrance of the Istanbul strait, while en route from Constanta, Romania, to Tuzla, Turkey. A coastal safety tug together with a pilot supervised vessels's passage. She moored at Tuzla shipyard area anchorage for repairs.
The ferry collided with barge PT-8208 on Sheksna River at 624km mark of Volga-Baltic waterway, but both vessels continued their voyage as there were no casualties, damages or oil spills.
Vessel's starboard side bow door was damaged by a large wave, en route from Picton to Wellington, New Zealand. Sailing was cancelled and returned to Wellington for repairs. Sailed on 2 days later.
Reports of fuel supply system failure in St. Lawrence River off Marsoui, Quebec, Canada. Crew carried out repairs and resumed downbound voyage.
Ferry had mechanical failure while sailing between Strangford and Portaferry in County Down, UK. Crew carried out repairs and resumed service on 23 August.
Vessel was caught in exrtreme winds and had technical issue after departing from Rosslare, Republic of Ireland. Her sailings were cancelled and vessel moved to a shipyard in Dunkirk for repairs.

Came in contact with floating crane at Kaiserhafen, Bremerhaven, while on depature. She contacted crane by her foremast yards, and then by stern. She was due depature voyage with some 100 passengers on board, but had to remain at port, to undergo inspection and assess damages. No injuries reported.
Vessel ran aground on reef near Salelologa, Savai'i, Samoa. All passengers were evacuated into small boats and transferred to shore. No injuries reported.
An electronic fault was reported during routine maintenance checks. Sailing between Strangford and Portaferry in County Down, UK was cancelled until repairs.
Ferry ran aground and had to cancel service. After refloating vessel returned to Orcas Island ferry terminal. She had damages to propeller and a small hole above waterline. Investigation ongoing.

Vessel had mechanical failure in the starboard side main engine due to a malfunction in the exhaust gas compressor during its scheduled service from the port of Paros to the ports of Tinos, Andros and Rafina. She sailed to Mykonos and was banned from sailing until repairs and certificate of maintenance of class was presented. All passengers were taken to their destinations on other ships.

Bulker had technical failure at the north entrance of Canakkale Strait at Gelibolu point, Turkey. She moved to Sevketiye anchorage and anchored under own power. Repairs were being carried out by crew.
A crack was discovered in weld between fore peak and anchor box, 2 metres above waterline at Great Nore Anchorage. Repairs were carried out and vessel sailed on 21 August.
Vessel had technical fault off Karatas, Turkey. She shifted under own power and dropped anchor. Repairs were carried out and sailed on 29 August.

A crew member fell on board and suffered injuries to the head, neck, legs and arms, about 1.5nm southwest of the port of Newhaven. A rescue helicopter evacuated him and he was transferred by ambulance to Royal Sussex County Hospital.

Reports of fire outbreak at the Engine room while vessel was at the Yellow sea, some 43 nm west of Gunsan, Korea. Vessel was ballasting from Changshu China to Taesan, Korea. Korean Coast Guard responded and all 16 crew were evacuated. Fire was extinguished, after firefighting system was activated. Disabled tanker towed to Yeosu.
Bulk carrier experienced engine failure on departure from an anchorage off Longueuil, Quebec, Canada. She had to return to anchorage for repairs.
Barge Ashtabula allided with the wharf upon its departure from Sault Ste Marie, Ontario, Canada while being pushed by DEFIANCE. She was secured to wharf for repairs. No pollution reported.
Non propelled barge collided with wharf on departure from Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario, Canada, while being pushed by tug Defiance. Barge was secured back to wharf for repairs. No pollution reported.
Ferry experienced machanical failure and had to cancel the service from Boston to Witch City. She was sidelined in Boston, US for repairs.
Fishing vessel had steering system fault, about 46.50 NM ESE of Queen Elizabeth Foreland, Canada. Tugs towed her to St. John for repairs.
FAZAH 1 had a mechanical failure during Canakkale Strait passage and anchored at Karanlik liman anchorage for repairs.

UPDATE: Investigations made by the Maine Department of Transportation and the US Coast Guard have concluded that the grounding of vessel was caused by human error. The cost of repairs was about $150,000 and returned to service towards the middle of November. Vessel ran aground on ledge while pulling away from Vinalhaven, Canada. She was taken to Rockland Marine Corp. shipyard for repairs. Starboard rudder had damages and port rudder was broken off.

Passenger ship ran aground on sandbank off E Frisian Island, Borkum, Germany at low tide. Was able to continue about 7.5 hours with rising flood. Apparently, fairway was no longer navigable, less water under keel.

Vessel suffered fire in engine room while en route from Travemunde to Trelleborg, Sweden. Some 130 people were on board. Crew managed to extinguish fire, but ferry was disabled some 20 nm off Travemunde. 16-Jan-2022 : Vessel (IMO: 8618358) leaked oil inside port Trelleborg, Sweden, 16 Jan 2022, for a number of hours. Rescue Service South alerted. Docked at Bremerhaven, Germany, 22 Jan for repairs. After completing repairs, it Sd from Bremerhaven, 25 Jan.
Vessel had engine failure, North of Turkeli Point upon completion of Istanbul Strait, Turkey. She shifted to Turkeli anchorage under own power. Crew carried out repairs and sailed on 17 August.
CORAL C experienced engine malfunction at beam of Turkeli light station in Strait. Crew couldn't repair and tug Kurtarma-8 towed vessel to Buyukdere anchorage. She sailed on 29 August.
Cruise ship had engine malfunction in lock No. 4 of Welland Canal, Ontario, Canada. She remained secured in the lock to be inspected and repaired.
Ferry had failure of her No 2 drive motor and sailing between Vancouver Island and Lower Mainland, Canada, had to be cancelled. She will be out of service until 23 November.

A crew member was evacuated by the Indian Coast Guard as he suffered of severe chest pains and showing symptoms of a heart attack. He was airlifted into a helictopter and taken to a medical facility located in Daman. Vessel was en route from China to the UAE.
Tanker had steering system failure in the St. Lawrence River off Tracy, Quebec, Canada. The vessel resumed voyage after crew carried out repairs.
A few hours after leaving Libreville on her scheduled service to Port-Gentil, Gabon, vessel had to return to port and sailings were cancelled by the operator.

NEPTUNE ran aground 16nm from the Sea Reach 1 North buoy within Shoeburyness ranges in the Thames Estuary while transiting to anchorage, en route from Ridham to Antwerp. She was shortly refloated and moored. Inspections were carried out and she headed to Dover for further investigations.

Vessel had a mechanical fault at southern entrance of Canakkale Strait, Turkey, while en route from Chalkis, Greece to Varna, Bulgaria. She shifted to N of Bozcaada Island anchorage under own power and sailed on 16 August.
Vessel had engine failure, abt 48.80 NM SW of Cape Beagle, in vicinity of Loudoun Canyon, British Columbia, Canada. Repairs were carried out by crew and vessel resumed voyage.

Two crew members were evacuated in the Karimata Strait, Riau Islands, Indonesia, while en route from Singapore to Balikpapan. They had suffered burns due to a fire in crew's accomodation. SAR Karna transferred the victims to Pangkal Balam Port then they were taken to the Siloam Pangkalpinang Hospital to receive medical treatment.

General cargo ship ran aground off Kepez in Canakkale strait, during berthing manoeuvre, Kepez port, Turkey. A tug assisted her to refloat and berthed at Kepez. No leaks, pollution or injuries were reported. Vessel sailed from Kepez on 20 August.
Vessel had mechanical failure due ti cooling water leak in port engine off port of Alonissos, Greece. She arrived in port under own power and disembarked 155 passengers.

14-Aug-23 : The 3,270-dwt Sukru Okan (built 1989) was said to have been fired upon after Russia said the ship’s captain failed to respond to a request to halt for an inspection. Reports said Russian military personnel then boarded the Palau-flagged vessel with the help of a Ka-29 helicopter. 02-Aug-2017 : Had engine failure off Turkeli 31 Jul 2017. Repairs could not be carried out by crew. Taken in tow 02 Aug, ar Tuzla same day. Subsequently ar Istanbul Anch 16 Aug & sd 17 Aug.

An explosion occured in the slop tank of vessel during maintenance works at the Kıran Shipyard in Tuzla Port, Turkey, due to gas build-up in the waste storage area. The explosion produced a small fire which was quickly extinguished. Reports say one crew member has died and another one was injured and taken to hospital. An investigation was launched nad permanent repairs will be carrried out following the recommendations of the class surveyor.

Vessel lost some dozen liters diesel fuel in Norddeich, Germany during pumping operations. Traffic in and out of port was stopped. Fire brigade was alerted and laid out oil booms to keep marine diesel from spreading.
Vessel was NUC due to main engine cooling system failure in Belgium. She anchored, crew completed repairs and continued passage the same day.
Ferry had generator fault while alongside in Riviere-du-Loup, Quebec, Canada. Vessel was secured at wharf and repairs started. She sailed on 15 August.
Vessel had technical problems off Ailsa Craig, UK. Tug CMS Wrestler assisted her with berthing at Loch Ryan Port. Sailings were delayed.
Container ship had failure of one of the generators in Queen Charlotte Sound, 43.40 NM NNW Triangle Island, BC, Canada. She proceeded to Vancouver for repairs and sailed on 17 August.

Vessel had mechanical fault while approaching port of Kapellskar, Sweden, en route from Naantali, Finland. She arrived with delay in port and was taken out of service for the rest of the day. She sailed next day after repairs.

A crew member suffered a heart attack and had to be evacuated by the Indian Coast Guard, while the vessel was en route Colombo, Sri Lanka, to Suez. His condition was stabilised on the way to the port, before being transported to the NIMS Hospital in Neyyattinkara for medical care.
Reports anchor dragged and vessel was at risk of grounding in English Bay, 1.70 NM SW Ferguson Point, BC, Canada. Vessel dropped a second anchor to hold position.

Vessel caused oil pollution during fuel transfer operations due to overflow from fuel tank breather (IFO 380) which caused leakage on deck in Inner Bay of Santa Marta port, Colombia. Oil boom was placed.
Several containers on board vessel caught fire, some 8 nm off port of destination, Port Klang, arriving from Hng Kong. Vessel started drifting. Tugs and emergency vessels responded.
Reports vessel ran aground in Baie des Escoumins, Quebec, Canada. She was towed off rocks by pleasure craft SUFIX and resumed voyage.

MISTRAL ran aground on the coast of Funen island in Little Belt, Denmark, en route from Samso to Kiel. She was refloated some 13 hours later and headed to Assens for inspection. The ship master was fined 10,000 DKK for failing to alert authorities when the ship grounded.
Ferry carrying 760 migrants from Lampedusa to Porto Empedocle, Italy, allided with quay during docking manoeuvre. She was unable to open hatch for hours. She sailed from port on 13 August.
Vessel had engine failure, while sailing at the sea area of Kavo Doro, Greece. Vessel arrived at destination, Rafina port, by own means, with 1.5 hrs delay. No injuries reported.

General cargo vessel had technical failure of navigation system systems together with alarm units and pertinent connections at Bartin, Turkey. Repairs were carried out by crew and state surveyors reattended and granted permission to sail on 17 August.
A fire erupted in cargo hold at Arkhangelsk port, White sea, Russia. Fire services responded. Crew were evacuated with no injuries reported.
Vessel was NUC North of Santander, Spain, shortly after its departure. Spanish SAR tug Maria de Maeztu assisted. She sailed on same day.
Vessel had a hole in its bulbous bow while exiting Welland Canal, 0.50 NM E. Port Weller, Ontario, Canada. Repairs were done and sailed on 14 August. No pollution reported.
Ferry had engine failure while on her way from Stangnes to Sorrollnes, Noway. She was sent to Harstad for troubleshooting and returned after repairs the same day.
Tug ran aground in Sikeli Waters, Indonesia, while towing barge, due to leak in lower hull of barge. Pumps were unable to drain water hence barge was listing to starboard.
Vessel was NUC due to a faulty exhaust system, in SW Dover Strait TSS. Limped into Eitz to anchor for repair works.
Ferry had steering fault in Lochaber, UK and was withdrawn from service. A specialist engineer was called to assess fault which might take a few weeks to be fixed.

Vessel had technical failure at southern entrance of Canakkale Strait and shifted to North of Bozcaada Is. anchorage and dropped anchor under own power. Repairs were carried out and sailed from anchorage on 14 August.
Vessel had engine fault in pos 35 20 00N, 026 34 00E, Greece. Repairs were carried out by crew and sailed next day.
Ferry had technical problem and was sidelined in Oskarshamn, Sweden due to fault in propeller shaft. Repairs ongoing at Fayard shipyard, Odense, Denmark. Departures were cancelled until 24 September.

Man overboard while vessel enroute to Hawaii. Surveillance footage revealed that Kenneth Schwalbe fell from the ship's "deck 9".  Deck 9, also known as the Dolphin Deck, is an exposed area exclusively accessible to passengers with adjoining suites.
Vessel had a technical fault and while en route from Izmir to Benghazi and had to drop anchor at Cesme, southern Turkey. Repairs were carried out by crew.
Bulk carrier had technical failure of navigation system and passage plan at Eren, Turkey. Repairs were done by crew and sailed on 13 August, bound for Novorossiysk, Russia.
Cruise ship had propulsion fault and came to an unexpected stop while heading back to Port of Galveston, Texas, US. This led to a slightly delayed arrival and departure at homeport.

Cargo ship rescued seven Sri Lankan fishermen from trawler Ruhunu Kumari 6 after their vessel caught fire off the Galle Lighthouse, west of Sri Lanka. The men were transferred to to Galle harbour by SLNS Gajabahu.
Media reports tanker suffered fire in Persian Gulf off Iranian coast. Five tugs were deployed and all crew were evacuated, according to Assalouyeh Port officials.
Tug had cooling system fault, while towing a barge in St. Lawrence River, 8.5 NM SSW Tibbets Point, NY, USA. Vessel anchored in Lake Ontario S. Grenadier Island for repairs and sailed next day.
Reports of starboard main engine failure during departure from Corfu to Paxos, Greece. Sailing was banned until engine repaired.
Vessel had issue with gearbox caused by rubber gasket perishing and had to drop anchor in position 53 42 07N, 000 42 17W, UK. Tugs to assisted her back to port for repairs. No pollution reported.
Reports of cracked cylinder liner on port engine. Vessel carried out slow turn while assessing engine issue, off Loch Ryan, UK.
Ferry collided with fishing vessel Alemax II about 2nm off Capo Figari, Sardinia shortly after departing from Olbia, Italy. The fishing vessel sank and one crew went missing.

It's been reported a crew member has committed suicide while the vessel was in the Sicilian channel, assisting a small boat loaded with migrants. The ship had to stop the rescue activities and OCEAN VIKING was authorised to carry out rescue operations.
Vessel had of electrical system fault, which led to propulsion loss and ran aground in South Arm of Fraser River, BC, Canad. She was refloated with rising tide and sailed to Tilbury.
Vessel had technical failure, sheltered, and dropped anchor at Sinop Anchorage, Turkey. Repairs were carried out by crew and vessel sailed on 23 August.

Vessel collided with bow section of floating tank when entering port of Syros, Greece. She had breach of approximately 4m length and 1m height at port side above bulbous bow. All passengers disembarked safely, no injuries reported.
Fishing vessel ran aground N.Tower of Hercules Lighthouse near La Coruna, Spain. Spanish rescue Salvamar Betelgeuse helped to refloat and vessel proceeded independently to La Coruna.

34 crew members had food poisoning symptoms and vessel had to interrupt voyage from Santander Spain to Plymouth UK. She docked at Brest and emergency services boarded the ship to monitor crew. No passengers were affected.
Bulk carrier collided with wharf structures during docking manoeuvre, in Vancouver Harbour,Canada. Vessel was secured with minor damages to its gangway.
Vessel collided with 2 steel plates on pier, while berthing at Brunsbuttel-Ostermoor, Kiel Canal, Germany. There was a breach about 2-3m above waterline, which affected 2 ballast water tanks.

Ferry collided with quay in Odden, Denmark while approaching port in strong gusts of wind. Sailings between Jutland and Zealand  where suspended for 3 days while Danish Maritime Authority investigated.
Reports of a technical failure at Tuapse, Black Sea, Russia. Departure permission was cancelled until repairs and inspection by a state surveyor.
General cargo vessel was NUC  and started drifting at 0.7 knots in position lat 53 33 19.0N, long 004 45 44.0W, UK. It was required to change filters.
Ferry was caught in strong winds and allided with the fenders of the quay, in Ronne. She suffered damages and had to cancel sailings between Ronne and Ystad.

A crew member was evacuated by Salvamento Maritimo and transported to Almería Airport, Spain, so that he could be treated at a hospital, after he fell 7 metres while cleaning inside the ship's hold. The vessel was off Cabo de Gata, en route from Eren, Turkey to Ust-Luga, Russia.

Passenger vessel had propeller damage in Bremerhaven, Germany due to wooden beam or rope floating around, which caught in. Seal got damaged. Vessel shifted to Fassmer Yard, Berne for permanent repairs.
Dredger came in contact with a steamboat, in position lat 33 59 43.8N, long 132 44 55.1E, Japan. The steam boat sank, but all crew members were rescued.
BOSON had technical failure at Novorossiysk, Russia. Departure permission was canceled until repairs. She sailed on 8 August, bound for Suez Channel.

Tanker collided with fishing trawler MFV EXCEL while en route from Milford Haven to Port Everglades. An helicopter was on standby but there was no need for assistance. There were no injuries, water ingress or pollution reported

LPG tanker CHINAGAS LEGEND collided with tug FAHD at 52 kilometer mark, Suez Canal. She then continued transit and later anchored at Port Said. Tug sank and traffic in the canal was closed as tug FATEMA was working at the collision site, trying to remove wreck. Reports that one crew member died.

General cargo ship ran aground in waters of Sheksna reservoir, Russia. No spills or damages reported. Vologda Transport Prosecutor's Office is checking implementation of legislation on navigation safety.

UPDATE: Repairs were done and vessel sailed on as of 21-Dec-2023. Vessel had engine failure and lost power, off Gabes, Tunisia. Tug Christos XL towed her to Alicante on 19 August. Repairs commenced and remained stationary as of 1 September.

UPDATE: As of 4-Dec-2023 repairs were done and vessel was en route to Karazu, Turkey. Vessel had engine failure at Catania, Italys. Crew couldn't repair fault. Tug HAKTAN 1 attended and towed to Tuzla shipyard on 14 August. As of 1 September vessel was still at Tuzla.

SIG damaged by drone attack near the Kerch Strait in the Black Sea. No injuries or a spill were reported from the attack on the SIG, which was in ballast at the time of the attack early Saturday morning. She was towed to Novorossiysk port, the Novorossiysk Maritime Rescue Coordination Centre was quoted by the RIA news agency as saying.
97 kg of cocaine were discovered hidden below the waterline to the hull of vessel at Malta Freeport in Marsaxlokk. After inspection the ship was given permission to depart, bound for Gioia Tauro.

LPG tanker collided with tug FAHD at 52 kilometer mark, Suez Canal. She continued transit after collision and later anchored at Port Said. Tug sank and traffic in the canal was closed as tug FATEMA was working at the collision site, trying to remove wreck. Reports that one crew member died.

04-Aug-2023 : Developed engine failure while on depature from Heraklion to Thira in Greece. Repairs and further inspections carried out before she could resume voyage. 20-May-2021 : Vessel struck an underwater object at midday on May 15th, 15 minutes after leaving the port of Thira, with 129 passengers on board. The vessel returned to port and the passengers were disembarked safely.

Vessel had technical failure of internal communication system alarm units and pertinent connections at Novorossiysk, Russia. Repairs were carried out by crew and vessel sailed to anchorage on 6 August.
Vessel ran aground after electrical system fault which caused propulsion loss, in St. Lawrence River off Deschaillons-sur-Saint-Laurent, Canada. She was refloated by rising tide.
Cement carrier had failure of main engine's cooling sys, while proceeding downbound in the St. Lawrence River off Le Bic, Canada. She anchored South of the traffic lanes to asses issue.

04-08-2023 : Developed a technical fault in Oskarshamn port, Sweden. Sailings delayed until after repairs. 29-Jul-2019 : Vsl allided with the quay in Nynashamn 29 Jul 2019. Vsl damaged must be repaired reportedly, no passengers or crew injured. Sailings cancelled by operator Destination Gotland.
Vessel, assisted by tug OCEAN CHARLIE, had main engine failure, causing loss of propulsion, upon departure from wharf No. 20 in Trois-Rivieres. She anchored nearby.
Tug ran aground near mouth of South Arm Fraser River, 0.31 NM ESE Garry Point, BC, Canada. She was refloated and proceeded to Steveston for inspection. Sailed next day.
Ferry had mechanical fault and was taken out of service in Langdale, Canada, leading to lengthy delays and long trips from Sunshine Coast. QUEEN OF COQUITLAM took over the remaining sailings.
Ferry was sidelined due to engine turbocharger replacement in New Bedford, US and was unavailablle until 4 August. Ferry Governor made additional sailing from Woods Hole and Vineyard Haven.

A 9 metre Sorrentine charter motorboat collided with vessel, off Amalfi in waters of the Fiordo di Furore, Italy. A 45-year-old woman from boat died. Master of boat returned positive results for alcohol and drugs and failed sobriety tests.
Bulk carrier suffered engine failure on Lac Saint-Louis, Quebec, Canada. She stopped at Ecluse de Cote-Sainte-Catherine, QC for repairs.
Fire broke out in engine room, at shipyard Royal Niestern Sander in Farmsum, Netherlands. All employees disembarked on time, no injuries reported. Fire was extinguished within one hour.
Cargo ship allided with a wharf in Tokyo due to being caught in strong winds. An investigation was conducted by the Japanese Coast Guard then the vessel sailed for Yokohama.
Bulk carrier ran aground at 311 kilometer mark, Parana river, while en route from San Martin. She was able to refloat without any help and continued voyage to Zona Commun.
Ferry had loss of propulsion due to electrical system failure, while approaching a wharf on Fogo Island, Canada. Vessel was anchored while the power was restored.

General cargo ship struck pier while berthing in Naoetsu Port, central Honshu, Japan sea, as she arrived from Busan, Korea. Vessel got stuck but tug assisted and was able to moor. No leaks reported and no reports on damages.
Ferry was sidelined in New Bedford, United States, due to propeller shaft seal requiring replacement at Thames Shipyard New London, Connecticut. Ferry Sankaty took over vessel's schedule.
Fuel started leaking offshore from 5th Avenue Beach, Lake Michigan, US. Crew managed to plug tank and stop leak. The remaining diesel fuel was transfered to another vessel.

ASUNCION B ran aground in Parana river between 913 and 914 kilometer, en route from Terport Villeta, Paraguay to Montevideo. A tug was deployed to help. After refloating, vessel was taken to Puerto Mal Abrigo, 919 kilometer mark.
Vessel had technical failure at northern part of Istanbul strait, shifted to Istanbul anchorage and dropped anchor. Repairs were carried out by crew.
SCANLARK ran aground off Aeros. Police boarded the vessel after grounding and before JRCC took over. Vessel was refloated and moved away from Aero under own power.

A drum of gasoline was punctured releasing its contents onto vessel's deck while off-loading cargo alongside Honolulu Harbour Pier 2A, USA. About 3 gallons of gasoline were spilt overboard port waters. Crew cleaned spill.
Vessel was detained in Piombino, Italy, for spilling sewage water in the sea in front of Tuscan Archipelago National Park, Pelagos Marine Mammal Sanctuary. She sailed on 5 August.
Vessel had technical failure at Southern entrance of Canakkale Strait. She anchored at Bozcaada Isl anchorage under own power. Repair works were carriedout by crew and sailed the same day.

Container ship ran aground onto right bank of Hugli river while en route from Port Klang to Kolkata, India. Vessel ran onto bank while trying to avoid collision with cargo ship sailing from opposite direction. According to other reports, the two vessels collided and MTT SINGAPORE grounded intentionally to avoid capsizing.
Bridge navigation system along with pertinent alarm units failed at Novorossiysk, Russia. Departure permission was cancelled by Harbour-Master until the completion of repairs.
General cargo ship was NUC due to engine fault, about 40 NM from Southwold Lighthouse. Repairs were carried out ans sailed on the same day.
Cement carrier was NUC due to faulty temperature indicator in main engine cooling system, while en route from Plymouth, UK to Dublin, Ireland. Repairs were completed by crew the same day.
Ferry had engine failure North of Samsun, Turkey in Black Sea. Crew couldn't do repairs and RORO with container capacity Liana N attended and towed vessel to Gerze anchorage on 3 August.

General cargo vessel had technical failure, sheltered and dropped anchor at Ayvalik, Turkey, en route from Nemrut Bay to Izmit, Turkey. Tug Ayaz Bey provided assistance. Repairs were carried out. She sailed on 9 August and moored in Hereke on 11 August.
Vessel had a technical failure, sheltered and dropped anchor at Cesme, Turkey. Repairs were carried out by crew members.
General cargo ship had engine failure West off Sile, Turkey, Black Sea. Tug Dilburnu towed her to northern entrance of Istanbul strait for repairs.

General cargo ship ran aground at the south end of the Isle of Jura, western Scotland, en route from Belfast to Corpach. She was refloated within 40 minutes and escorted onward from the Gulf of Corryvreckan. She arrived Corpach some 12 hours later.

Tanker had technical fault at the southern entrance of the Canakkale Strait, Turkey, while en route from Valletta, Malta, to Tuzla, Turkey. Some hours later she was given permission to enter under the supervision of a strait pilot and Coastal Safety tug Nazim Tur.

Cruise ship was caught in strong winds while docked at Civitavecchia, Italy and broke off her moorings. Tugs were deployed and secured the vessel. No injuried were reported and both forward and aft gangways collapsed. Vessel had minor damage but continued her voyage to Valencia where she was inspected for further damages.

Lightering barge NDE-9 allided with the vessel at Kutubdia and was awaiting for the resolution of litigation case and arrest. PRIDE discharged 53,274 tonnes of sugar at the outer anchorage of Chittagong and as of 15 August she was anchored in the Bay of Bengal, off Chattogram.

Oil was spilled during transfer of fuel from vessel to LPG carrier Gas Venus at southern end of Western Anchorage. Captain of Port of Gibraltar suspended operations and Spanish authorities were notified.

Reports of oil spilt from the vessel at the southern part of the Poniente anchorage, in the Rosia Bay area. The amount of oil has not been confirmed yet. Cleaning operations are still ongoing with no significant free floating sheen patches. Rocks containing marine life were cleaned manually on-site to minimize disruption to the coastal environment. Department of Environment officials from Gibraltar have been at the scene, supervising works.
Ferry had fault in cooling system of engine and service from Seivika to Tommervaag, Norway, was cancelled until further notice. She had departed from Seivika when incident occured.
Cruise ship collided with Strom Quay Bremerhaven, Germany, while leaving Columbus Quay due to strong wind gust currents. A line deflector of port was damaged. Vessel sailed from port the same day.

Fishing vessel had engine failure and went adrift near Cies, Spain. Fire fighting tug Maria Pita and SAR vessel Salvamar Mirach were deployed to assist. Vessel dropped anchor then returned to port again.
Fire errupted in accommodation quarters, while anchored in Baie des Sept Iles, Quebec, Canada. The crew extinguished the fire. Vessel sailed on 3 August.

Fire erupted in engine room of vessel while in sailing in North Sea Canal, halfway between IJmuiden and Beverwijk, Netherlands. She berthed at Beverwijk the same day and land firefighters were deployed. Reports say the fire was not major.
Container ship had bow thruster fault while berthing in Vancouver Harbor, BC, Canada. She manoeuvred  to berth with tug assistance.
Tug required immediate assistance in Laccadive Sea, due to taking on water through hole in engine room. 3 pumps  were used to control water ingress.
Tanker had engine fault north of Orkney islands, while en route from Rafnes Norway to USA. Vessel was disabled and started drifting. As of 1 August, tug IEVOLI BLACK towed her to Lerwik.
Fire errupted in engine room, at Gothenburg's archipelago, Sweden. All passengers were evacuated to another vessel. Fire was extinguished and vessel towed and berthed in Ockero.
Reports that vessel leaked dirty ballast water at Bartin, Turkey. A fine of $142,000 was imposed and departure permission cancelled until fine payment together with cleaning expenses.

Cruise ship had air conditioning failure between 24 and 29 July, creating excessive temperatures on board the vessel, en route to Miami, USA. Passengers received partial refunds. Unclear when issue began.
General cargo ship was NUC due to leak in main engine, 18.9nm from St Catherines Point, UK. She was underway using engine the same day.

Ferry had starboard side engine fault during berthing at port of Heraklion. Sailing was prohibited until repairs done and sea worthiness certificate provided. As of 31 July, vessel was en route form Piraeus to Syros.
Vessel stuck wharf while arriving at Kitakyushu Port, Japan. Both wharf and vessel suffered damages. Extent of damage to hull unknown.
Bulk carrier had technical failure during Canakkale strait passage and dropped anchor at Karanlik liman anchorage. Repairs were carried out by crew.
Vessel had engine failure during its arrival at Piraeus port, Greece. Tug assisted vessel moored.

Vessel had technical failure at southern entrance of Canakkale Strait, Turkey, while en route from Haifa, Israel to Galati, Romania. She anchored north of Bozcaada Island anchorage under own power. Crew carried out repairs.
Container ship ran aground in Lillegrund shallows some 10 nm SE of Aarhus, Denmark, while en route from Fredericia to Aarhus. No leaks were reported, she's awaiting high tide to help with refloating.
Ferry ran onto rocks at Salerno Port, Italy while leaving for Medina. No injuries reported. Vessel finally sailed next day.

She had a technical failure forcing her to drop  anchor at Sinop anchorage. Repairs were carried out by the crew members & remain in a stationary position, at the anchorage. 23-Nov-2015 : Had emergency system failure together with fire pump connections at Gemlik 23 Nov 2015. Repairs being effected by crew. Shifted to Gemlik Anch 25 Nov. Sd 27 Nov & ar Tuzla 28 Nov.
She broke lose from Woods Hole terminal, dangerously adrift to neighbouring Oceanographic Institution dock. Vessel moored, not in service at time. Scheduled to sail again on 28 Jul.

had technical failure while enroute Canakkale Strait passage & dropped anchor at Karanlik Liman anch in Strait. Repairs carried out by crew, vessel remains stationary as of 27 Jul. 02-Jan-2021 : Vessel issued distress signal on 02 Jan 2021 off Xiamen, China while en route to Shanghai. Vessel had water ingress in a cargo hold, and developing a list. Vessel reached Xiamen Ocean Gate Container Terminal just in time. Cause unknown.
Crude oil tanker had engine fault and dropped anchor 13 nm north of Rugen island, Germany, Baltic sea. She was en route from Primorsk Russia to Mundra India. SAR tugs were deployed to assist.
Tanker lost her anchor and chain at Oostdyck Anchorage, Belgium while en route from Antwerp. She was underway as of 31 July but no designated destination.

Container ship had propulsion loss as she was entering Golden Gate, San Francisco, en route from Los Angeles to Oakland. Several tugs responded and helped vessel pass Golden Gate and anchor at San Francisco anchorage.
Tug suffered total failure of electrical systems and propulsion loss while towing barge POLNAV I in St. Lawrence River. She was towed to Quebec by tug OCEAN CATATUG I.

Vessel with 72 rescued migrants on board was unable to enter port of Naples due to strong winds and waves of more than 3 metres high. Italian authorities granted permission for vessel to dock at Salerno instead.

Vessel experienced technical failure of bridge communication system & EPIRB units while in waters around Novorossiysk, Russia. She was banned from sailing by Harbour-Master. State surveyor verified final repair status after repairs by crew. 26-Mar-2022 : Vessel (IMO: 8519942) had a technical failure during its Istanbul Strait passage & dropped its anchor at the Buyukdere anch, Turkey, in the Strait, 26 Mar 2022. Repairs commenced by the crews & it remains in Buyukdere anch, as of 26 Mar.

COSCO container ship broke off her moorings at Slovenia’s Koper container temrinal due to strong gusts of wind. She drifted towards opposite berths and  was about to collide with berthed ships when two tugs managed to stop her just in time. No damages reported.

The Canadian Coast Guard responded to a bunker fuel spill at the Port of Nanaimo on Vancouver Island in British Columbia. They reported that an unknown amount of heavy fuel oil spilled during fuel transfer operations involving bulk carrier MAIPO RIVER,

Vehicles carrier had rudder failure while leaving Kingston, Jamaica. She veered 45 degrees to port side and allided with crude oil tanker ELLI. She suffered heavy damage to bow and moved Curacao Dry Dock for repairs.
Tanker was struck by vehicle carrier Hoegh Caribia after a rudder failure in Kingston, Jamaica. She docked at Grand Bahama yard and sailed on 15 September after repairs were carried out.
Tanker had technical failure, sheltered and dropped anchor at Sinop anchorage, Turkey while en route from Yalova, Turkey to Rostov, Russia. Repairs were carried out by crew.
A crew member died after a part from the crane broke off and fell on him at Biringkassi Port, Indonesia. He was watching the process of transporting jumbo cement. Investigation is on.
Crane ship suffered mechanical failure less than 12miles from port of Montevideo, Uruguay, in vicinity of Isla de Flores lighthouse. She returned to pier in Montevideo.
Vessel was disabled and had to drop anchor in the eastern Arabian Sea. Indian authorities requested vessels transiting the area to give her a wide berth.
Research vessel had engine fault 55 nm west of Mormugao, India, Arabian sea. An Indian Coast Guard vessel towed her back to Mormugao.
Cargo ship had technical failure during Canakkale Strait passage and dropped anchor at Karanlik liman anchorage. Crew carried out repairs and vessel sailed same day bound for Martas.
Cracks were found in vessel's No. 1 portside ballast tanks, above waterline, while heaving up anchor in Port-Cartier, Canada. The ship moved to Baie-Comeau for repairs and sailed on 1 August.

Fire erupted on cargo deck of vessel in North sea, off Dutch coast, while en route from Bremerhaven to Egypt. She was NUC and started drifting. It's possible that fire spread to other decks. Tugs and SAR ships responded but avoiding to use water so not to destabilise the ship even further. Reports say she has already developed a list. 23 crew members were rescued.
Reported disabled following a broken loading ramp due to rough weather in St of Georgia off, BC, Canada. Canadian Coast Guard  assisted & towed her to Fanny Bay.
Research ship ran aground in waters of Franz Josef Land Archipelago, halfway between Komsomol island and Wilczek island. No reports on hull breaches as of yet.
Vessel ran aground on sandbar shortly after departure in harbour waters amid NW winds, en route from Neuwerk island to Cuxhaven, Germany. There were 394 people on board. She refloated on 26 July.

FSO LEONIS suffered fire 10 nm south of southern Sicily coast. FSO personnel and Italian agencies responsible for safety at sea extinguished fire. It seems fire was caused by maintenance hot works, igniting oil residue in cargo tank/tanks. CO2 firefighting system was activated. No reports on damages.

Bulk carrier lost steering while leaving Tauranga, NZ en route to China. Tugs assisted and towed her to Tauranga outer anchorage. Vessel had lost her rudder which was found later on seabed. Rudder needs to be refitted but drydocking is required.
Container ship struck pier during berthing at Canical port, Madeira, on arrival from Leixoes. she suffered starboard bow damages. No reports on extent of damages or breaches.
Bulker had total loss of electrical power causing propulsion loss, while proceeding downbound in the St. Lawrence River off Saint-Joseph-de-la-Rive, Canada. Engine was restarted and continued voyage.

A fire erupted in vessel's engine room, while in the Astrakhan region, on the Bakhtemir River in the Ikryaninsky district. Four fire boats and seven emergency personnel were deployed to extinguish the fire.
Tanker had a breakdown due to fault with generators. LPG transfer had to be suspended and vessel was stuck in port until 27 July. Other vessels were also blocked in the outer channel as a result.
MSC ANS had a complete failure of its bow thruster and breakage of a fairlead while berthing at Deltaport Container Terminal, Canada, assisted by tugs. She sailed from Roberts Bank on 25 July.

A crew member needed immediate hospital treatment and Port Authority of Thiras, Greece deployed a Coastguard vessel to transfer patient to the port of Athinios in Thira. He was then taken to a private clinic.
Reports vessel got stuck due to some technical snag in Arabian Sea in Palghar district, India. Coast Guard and Palghar district administration monitored situation.

A crew member suffered severe abdominal pain together with numb arms and legs. He was medevaced by the Argentine Naval Prefecture. A helicopter hoisted the man and transferred him to Trelew airport. He was then taken to hospital.

A woman failed to disembark the ferry at Guernsey. SAR operation was launched involving aircrafts from UK and France together with Channel Islands Air Search. The woman's body was found a week later on a beach in Seaford in East Sussex.

Ro-ro cargo ship ran aground on Madagascar reefs (Arrecife Madagascar), 20 nm off northwest Yucatan, Mexico, while en route from Altamira Mexico to Brunswick USA. An offshore tug was deployed to help. The reef was most probably damaged. No leaks reported.

Ferry was sidelined in Ludington due to mechanical failure of its ramping system. One of lifting structures collapsed into water. Service between Ludington and Manitowoc, USA, has been cancelled. Repairs are underway.
Tug had total failure of main engine while pushing barge St.Marys Cement, in position 42 53 37.0N, 079 14 50.2W,ON, Canada. She stopped at Pier No.17, Port Colborne for repairs and sailed on 23 July.
Fire errupted in engine room of vessel at St. John Harbour, NB, Canada. Crew managed to extinguish fire and the vessel was towed to St. John by Canadian CG Ship Shediac Bay.
Cargo vessel had navigation systems and magnetic compass units failure at Novorossiysk, Russia. Repairs were completed on 24 July and she shifted to Novorossiysk anchorage. She sailed on 25 July.
Bulker had technical failure during Canakkale Strait passage and dropped anchor at Karanlik liman anchorage. Repairs were underway at the anchorage.
SING had technical failure during Canakkale Strait passage and anchoedr at Karanlik liman anchorage. Repairs were carried out by crew and vessel sailed next day for Diliskelesi.
Stern of vessel contacted berthed brand-new offshore wind installation vessel GREEN JADE at Kaohsiung. Both vessels suffered damages including dents and broken railings.
A Panamax crane in harbor of Rijeka, Croatia fell on stern of vessel, due to heavy storm. Some containers were damaged, but no injuries were reported. Vessel sailed on 25 July.
Vessel had main engine fuel injection valve failure, while proceeding in Chenal du Nord, Canada. She anchored off Sault-au-Cochon for repairs and sailed for Quebec on 23 July.

Vessel ran aground onto shallows in position 33 22 18.4N, 129 34 08.3E, Japan. She was refloated by tug the same day. No injuried, no water ingress or oil spill reported. She sailed on 24 July bound for Nandan.
Tanker HUA YUN collided with the berthed GREEN JADE at Kaohsiung, Taiwan, China. Both vessels sustained dents and broken railings.
Container ship had engine fault and was towed the next day to Izmir, Turkey by tug SEABUFFALO. She rrived Izmir on 28 July and as of 31 July she was still moored there.

Container ship reported water ingress and heavy portside list. All 19 crew were evacuated and trasferred to port. Many empty containers fell over board. Several tugs were deployed for salvage operations but the vessel capsized and sank as of 21 July.

Vessel had propulsion loss after fishing gear entangled into the propeller while fishing at Vannoya, Karlsoy, Norway. She was disabled and a support vessel towed her to shore. She safely berthed in Skjervoy to remove obstruction.

A crew member was medevaced in the Irish Sea about 25nm north of Llandudno, by  all-weather lifeboat William F Yates, as he required urgent hospital treatment. The patient was trasnferred to an ambulance for further treatment at Ysbyty Gwynedd Bangor.
MRCC Mumbai reported that 5 containers had fallen overboard in position 19 29 20N, 072 27 48E, India.  Mariners in area were requested to exercise caution.
Vessel had maine engine fault off east coast of Sri Lanka. MRCC Colombo requested vessels transiting area to keep wide berth and navigate with caution.
A fire errupted in the emergency generator at Belfast Harbour VT4. MRCC Belfast contacted NIFRS and Belfast Harbour. Fire was extinguished and vessel sailed on 27 July.
Three perpetrators armed with knives boarded the vessel through ventilation pipes, at Batam Anchorage, Indonesia. They fled the vessel once the alarm was raised. Nothing was stolen.
Tanker had water ingress an engine room, while en route from Saudi Arabia to South Korea. She was towed to Zhoushan anchorage in China for STS Operations.
Vessel had to undergo cleaning of main engine filter, 30 NM S of Salcombe, UK, while en route from Ust-Luga, Russia to Jebel Ali, UAE. Estimated repair time 3 to 5 hours.

Vessel was arrested on the order of the local High Court in Chittagong, Bangladesh, after offloading cargo. The litigation was related to a single container box being damaged during cargo operations. As of 20 July the ship was underway.
Bulker allided with wharf while departing from Grande-Anse, Quebec, en route to Liverpool, UK. Vessel had gangway damaged.

MAERSK HOUSTON broke off her moorings at Koper Port, Slovenia due to strong winds with gusts of up to 130km/hr. She drifted towards passenger terminal. Several tugs were deployed and ship was taken back to berth. Slight damages reported.

Landing craft was caught in strong winds and waves when it was about to dock at Gilimanuk Harbour, and ran aground. All passengers were evacuated. She was successfully refloated and towed towards Gilimanuk. The hull was to be inspected once she arrives in port.

VIA MARE ran aground in the inner port of Tasucu after she suffered an engine failure and loss of power during unberthing manoeuvres. She was en route from Tasucu to Kyrenia. Port tugs were deployed and refloated her. The ship was safely berthed, and all passengers along with their cars were disembarked. Divers carried out inspections of the hull.
Vessel had total failure of main engine and was disabled in St. Lawrence River off Riviere-au-Renard, 0.73 NM ENE Pointe au Renard, QC, Canada. She was towed to Riviere-au-Renard.
Port Authority of Mykonos, Greece, was informed that during departure, vessel had difficulties retrieving anchor, which was stuck in rocky bottom. Following manoeuvres, anchor was released.

Vessel was NUC and drifting in vicinity of pos 53 39 00N, 005 25 00E, Netherlands. Netherlands Coast Guard issued navigational warning. Vessel anchored about 10.3 NM from Westhinder Anchorage on 19 July.

General cargo ship ran aground east of Aarhus in Kattegat, in Danish waters, en route from St Petersburg to Sibenik, Croatia. It seems she is hard aground as she was at full speed and she sailed into shallow waters. Awaiting salvage operations to begin.

Vessel had propeller fault one hour after leaving Ostsee Quay, Kiel, Germany. She sailed in legs in Kiel Bight and anchored off Langeland Isl. Crew couldn't fix damage and was towed to E Shore Port on 21 July.
Vessel suffered mechanical failure during Canakkale Strait passage and dropped anchor at Karanlik liman anchorage.Crew carried out repairs and she continued voyage the next day.

Sailings were suspended due to a rope getting tangled in the propeller, at Trana, Norway. Ferry Luroy took over service. Vessel resumed service to Stokkvagen, Stangen and Innerkvaroy after obstruction removed the same day.
Vessel broke down and started drifting around 280nm north-east of Port Douglas, Australia, en route from Pengerang to Lyttelton. She was waiting for tug assistance in the Coral Sea.
Vessel mechanical fault, sheltered and anchored at Datca anchorage, Turkey. Repairs were carried out by crew and continued voyage on 18 July.

Container ship collided with a sand carrier, shortly after leaving Ningbo, China, bound for Xiamen. The sand carrier sank and XIN YUAN LONG 6 suffered hull breach, developed heavy portside list and capsized. About 40 containers fell over board. All crew were evacuated.
Electrical fire erupted in engine room while leaving Riviere-au-Renard, 0.28 NM NNW Pointe au Renard, QC, Canada. Crew extinguished fire and vessel returned to wharf.
Vessel had engine fault approximately 40nm west of Faroe Islands's westernmost Island of Mykines. SAR boat towed her to Skopunarfjord Strait,where another SAR pulled her to Sund.
Sailings of vessel between Metro Vancouver & Vancouver Island, Canada were canceled due to oil leak from propeller hub on 17 Jul 2023. She sailed from Vancouver on 27 July and moored in Sidney.

A crew member fell more than 10 feet from a ladder in Chesapeake Bay, eastern USA. He was evacuated by helicopter and transferred to the R Adams Cowley Shock Trauma Centre in Baltimore, Maryland, for treatment.

Vessel had a total failure of generator's cooling system causing a blackout, while approaching the lower wall at Snell lock in Massena, US. Repairs were carried out and she arrived in Hamilton next day.

Ferry had technical damage shortly after leaving Sinabang Port in Simeulue Regency, Indonesia. She proceeded to Kolok Harbor where passengers were transferred to another vessel. She resumed operations on 19 July.
