Bulk carrier was disabled and adrift 235nm east of Trincomalee, north-east Sri Lanka, while en route from Tianjin, China, to Hambantota, Sri Lanka, due to fishing nets becoming entangled in its propellers.
Vessel had total failure of main engine while proceeding upbound in St. Lawrence River off Baie-Trinite, 12.70 NM ESE of Pointe des Monts, Canada. Crew carried out repairs and resumed voyage.
A small fire erupted in engine room from auxiliary generator for bow thruster in Goole Docks, UK. Fire was extinguished. No pollution reported.
Fire erupted on one of the main engines turbocharger's lagging while leaving St. John's Harbour, NL, Canada. Crew extinguished fire and vessel resumed voyage. No pollution reported.
Vessel collided with mooring dolphin at Port of Miami, USA. She suffered a dent and hull perforation at starboard aft side, above waterline. Repairs were completed and vessel sailed on 17 July.
Vessel was towed by tug TIM MCKEIL which collided with vessel in vicinity of Baie de Plaisance, 0.32 NM N Cap Noir, QC, Canada. Tug proceeded to Cap-aux-Meules for repairs.

A crew member was reported to be suffering from acute appendicitis 55nm southwest of INS Shikra, the helibase of Western Naval Command in Colaba. A helicopter was deployed and the patient was trasferred to naval hospital Asvini for further treatment.
With 342 passengers onboard, had engine malfunction due to a broken cooling pipe while navigating Baluk-Baluk Island, Hadji Muhtamad, Basilan,Philippines. Crew where able to conduct repairs.
During discharge operations, fire broke out  in accommodation block, superstructure, and other spaces at Ambarli, Turkey. Fire was extinguished at around midnight. No injuries or pollution reported.
While towing tank barge Niagara Spirit, 0.32 NM N Cap Noir, QC, Canada, vessel collided with another barge and sustained severe damages to forebody. She proceeded to Cap-aux-Meules for repairs.

Cruise ship had total failure of an azipod's steering pump while transiting in Queen Charlotte Sound, BC, Canada. Crew temporarily isolated the issue and continued voyage. Repairs will be carried out at destination.

Supply vessel ran aground in Persian Gulf off Bahrain, shortly after leaving Khalifa Bin Salman Port, Bahrain. Tug SVITZER PELLA was nearby. The ship was refloated after more than 9 hours nad taken to Khalifa Bin Salman Port anchorage.
Vessel was blocked in Puerto Angamos after a shore-based crane had a mechanical failure and had arm resting on the vessel's containers. She sailed on 18 July.

Cruise ship was caught in strong winds at Zeebrugge, Belgium and broke off her moorings. Gangways were dragged and fell into water. Tugs took cruise ship under control and put her back to berth. No injuries reported. She continued scheduled voyage to Southampton and arrived late at night same day.
Vessel had total failure of one of its steering systems while approaching Nanaimo Harbour, Gallows Point, BC, Canada. She berthed using its remaining system.
Vessel had total failure of one of its main engines, while proceeding downbound in St. Lawrence River off Godbout, Canada. She continued voyage using the remaining engine and repairs were done.

General cargo ship had mechanical fault at southern entrance of Canakkale strait, en route from Nemrut Bay, Turkey to Azov, Russia. She shifted to north of Bozcaada Island anchorge under own power. Crew carried out repairs.

Departure of vessel was delayed until completion of repairs, due to navigation system failure. Repairs were carried out by crew and, as of 23 July, vessel was en route from Tuapse to Giurgulesti, Moldova.
Ferry had total failure of its main engines, while departing Portugal Cove, Newfoundland and Labrador, Canada. Vessel proceeded back to the wharf.
Bulk carrier had mechanical failure at the northern entrance of the Canakkale Strait. She shifted to Sevketiye anchorage and dropped anchor under own power. Repairs were carried out by crew.
Contact incident occurred in Houston, TX, USA. Details sketchy
Tanker ran aground close to shoreline of Morong,Philippines. PMC and USMC were supposed to sink vessel but cancelled due to weather and grounding. Retrieval operations were carried out by MARFORPAC.
Tanker had engine failure off Cape Turkeli, in the northern entrance of Istanbul Strait. Tug Kurtarma 7 towed her to Turkeli anchorage the same day.

ran aground in waters off Pasir Padi in Bangka Belitung Province, Indonesia forcing a leak in its hull. Engine reportedly failed & ran aground after it tried to maneuver.SAR team evacuated all 151 passengers on board.
Experienced total failure of exhaust system, while transitting St. Lawrence River in Port de Montreal, Canada. Proceeded to a wharf for repairs. Sailed on 17 Jul
Experienced failure of its starboard main engine, upon departure from Skidegate, Canada, to Prince Rupert. Forcing her to use the port engine.

Bitumen tanker suffered mechanical failure in Alboran sea, while en route from Dakar to Tarragona, Spain. Vessel was towed to Malaga on 17 July. She was berthed at Malaga and repairs are ongoing as of 25 July, awaiting spare parts.

Vessel was struck by container ship WAN HAI A02, while berthed at Interflour Terminal, Cai Mep, Ho Chi Minh, Vietnam. The jolt and pressure on pier cause the collapse of some 46 meters of pier, and destruction of conveyor and suction cargo handling equipment. No reports on damages.

The brand new container ship was out of control while maneuvering in Thi Vai river curve, Cai Mep, Ho Chi Minh, Vietnam, en route to Shenzhen. She struck bulk carrier VASSOS 2, berthed at Interflour Terminal, causing the collapse of some 46 meters of pier, and destruction of conveyor and suction cargo handling equipment. WAN HAI A02 suffered portside stern dent with possible breach. Anchored at Vung Tau outer anchorage.

General cargo ship had mechanical fault during Istanbul Strait passage. She anchored at Buyukdere anchorage and repairs were being done by crew. Vessel sailed after repairs on 13 July, bound  for Tekirdag.
Vessel ran aground, 5 NM south of Methoni, Greece. She refloated by own means and headed to anchorage in Finikountas Bay escorted by Greek patrol vessels. No pollution reported.
Container ship had mechanical fault during Canakkale Strait passage. She anchored at Karanlik Liman anchorage. Vessel sailed after repairs were done by crew, on 13 July.

Cargo ship had engine failure while approaching Tower Road bascule bridge, leaving Birkenhead and bound for Warren Point, UK. She dropped anchor and stopped, resting startboard on the embankment. There none or slight damages to both vessel and bridge.

Fire errupted on board vessel while in the waters off Taboneo in Banjarmasin, Indonesia. Reports of explosions heard from portside stern of vessel before fire seen. Navy vessel patrolling in the area safely evacuated crew.

Vessel had technical failure of firefighting system together with safety alarms, at Tuapse, Russia. She was banned from sailing until repairs. Crew carried out the repairs and sailed from Tuapse on 13 July.
Vessel ran aground in mud bank with port side list, west of Ljungsbro. 2 tow trucks pulled vessel free from ground and she resumed voyage the next day.
Vessel had engine failure off Ambarli, Turkey. Crew could not do repairs. Tug Kurtarma 2 attended. Dropped anchor at Ambarli anchorage.

Tanker ran aground while approaching port of destination Skhira, Tunisia, Gulf of Gabes, Med, with 70k tons of diesel on board. Salvors had to lighter the ship in order to refloat her. She was refloated on 22 July and anchored near grounding site. No leaks reported.
Vessel had total failure of electrical systems and loss of propulsion on 2 engines, about 18.50 NM W of Cap a la Baleinea, QC, Canada. She resumed voyage using other 2 engines.

Battery compartment of vessel caught fire and disabled her. Fire was quickly extinguished by the foam automatic firefighting system. Trips connecting Danish ports Soby Havn and Fynshav were cancelled until 17 July, due to batteries needing replacing.
Vessel's listed and heavy lift crane jib located at portside, fell on warehouse, at Havana port, Cuba during discharge operations of marine engine.No pollution was reported. Awaiting repairs.

Container ship contacted waterfront embankment at Kaohsiung Port, as she was leaving Kaohsiung with tug assistance. She caused damages to port infrastructure, like navigational marks and street lamps. Vessel anchored at Kaohsiung anchorage awaiting damages assessment.

RoRo MAZARINE was NUC due to mechanical issue in Celtic sea south of Wolf Rock, en route from Ireland to Zeebrugge.. After about one hour and a half she started drifting onto Wolf Rock. She was refloated an hour later and proceeded on tow towards Penzance, Cornwall, UK.
Ferry collided with rock wall in Lysefjord, Norway, after captain fell asleep on bridge. No injuies or major damages to vessel. Norwegian Maritime Directorate received preliminary report.
Vessel was caught in rough gust wind and broke off her moorings in Bremerhaven. She drifted away and contacted Lloyd Werft pier, knocking off gantry crane and inflicting other substantial damages.

A part of the cargo of liquid solvent leaked into sea and on deck at Limas Port, Gulf of Izmit, south of Istanbul, Turkey, while discharging cargo.  Local environmental protection office teams and duty patrol boats attended the scene. An investigation file was opened and a fine of $975,000 was imposed. Departure of vessel was prohibited until fine is paid together with cleaning expenses.

Bulk carrier allided with pier, during berthing at Sariseki, Turkey. Damage inspection revealed structural damages on bulbous bow. No injuries or pollution reported. She sailed after repairs, on 4 August.
Ferry had engine problems and was withdrawn from service Stokkvagen-Onoy-Sleneset-Lovund, Norway. She sailed towards Stokkvagen and was sent to Sandnessjoen for repairs.

Reports cement carrier suffered propulsion failure or propeller issue, off southern Hainan island coast, while en route from Vietnam to Hong Kong. She was towed next day to Sanya anchorage, southern Hainan.

Cargo ship collided with bulk carrier BW MATSUYAMA at Constanta, Romania. There were damages in side shell plating together with various deformations. No injury or pollution reported. She sailed from Constanta on 17 July, bound for Navodari for permanent repairs.
Vessel was NUC due to leak in auxiliary engine, 30NM SW of Lizard Point, UK. Crew carried out repairs and reported they will needt approximately 8 hours.
Cargo ship had mechanical failure during the transit of the Istanbul Strait, en route from Alexandria to Reni. She moored at Buyukdere Anchorage and crew carried out repairs.

Reports of vessel colliding with a cargo ship at Constanta Port, Romania while maneuvering to shift the berth. The cargo ship has not been identified but it's probably WHITE STAR. The collision caused damages totaling up to 1.4 million euro, including freight loss and both ships' cranes being destroyed or collapsed.
Reports of vesel breaking down in Dover, UK. Two Dover Harbour tugs assisted vessel back to berth in Dover Eastern Docks.

Vessel allided with its Catapult at pier during berthing maneouvers at Chios port, Greece. No injuries were. Pier suffered several damages, but there were no damages to vessel. She sailed after inspection and arrrived in Piraeus on 9 July.
Tanker had technical failure at southern entrance of Canakkale strait. She shifted to north of Bozcaada Island anchorage under own power. Repairs were carried out by crew.
Vessel was NUC due to gearbox leaking in pos 49 58 41N, 005 37 46W, UK. Electrical technicians assessed the engine after repairs were completed and she continued voyage the same day.
Vessel had propulsion damage and went alongside Ship Repair Quay of Harland and Wolff in Belfast, while en route from Liverpool, UK. She later relocated to dry dock of shipyard.
Fire broke out on board of vessel in vicinity of pos 20 21 50N, 071 53 50W, Dominican Republic. She returned to port of Amber Cove. No injuries reported.

Vessel collided with pier while mooring at port of Agnontas Skopelos, Greece. She suffered dents to portside sheet metal guard. No injuries or pollution reported. Departure was prohibited until repairs.

Vessel had engine damage during eastbound transit of Kiel Canal at canal kilometre 5.2 near Brunsbuttel, while en route from Hamburg, Germany to Norrkoping, Swede. Repairs were carried out and resumed voyage on 8 July.

Reports vessel caused water pollution at Diliskelesi Port, Gulf of Izmit, Turkey. Local environmental protection office teams and duty patrol boats attended the scene. A fine of $710,000 was imposed and departure was prohibited until fine is paid together with cleaning expenses.

UPDATE: As of 11 September, efforts to recover containers from vessel are ongoing. All recovered containers be taken to Pangaon Port and opened in the presence of a representative of the importer. Some of the containers won't be recovered due to difficult underwater location. Reports of vessel having capsized or even sunk in strong waves in Bay of Bengal, while en route from Chittagong to Pangaon Inland Container Terminal in Keraniganj. The cause is probably some collapsed containers. 14 crew members have been evacuated and some containers went overboard.
Cargo ship experienced a leak and lost oil in seaport in Wismar, Germany. Fire brigade was deployed ashore and on water and oil boom was laid out. Vessel was shifted to Soby for repairs.

Thick blue smoke emerged from vessel's funnels in Akureyri, which drifted over town and into Eyja Fjord. Pollution was caused by damage in heating system but not harmful. Engineers fixed trouble and vessel continued voyage.
Cruise ship contacted pier at San-Francisco while mooring, en route from Alaska. She suffered a dent on portside stern.
Cargo ship collided with fishing vessel, about 4 km off from Takami Island, Japan. Both vessels were able to sail under their own power. No oil leaks or injuries reported.
Reports of cocaine being found on board vessel at Lagos, Nigeria, after she arrived from Brazil. The vessel and all crew have been detained and an investigation was underway.

Reports of complete steering failure, while en route from Ellesmere to Eastham, north-west England. Vessel was grounded on a sandbank on purpose and dropped anchor when 2.1nm from the Eastham Locks. Autopilot was switched off and manual steering was regained. A tug helped vessel to Runcorn.

Port Authority of Alexandroupolis, Greece was informed of malfunction in starboard main engine while vessel was departing Alexandroupolis. She was prohibited from sailing until repairs and certification. She sailed the same day.

Ferry had technical errors and scheduled sailings from Sandefjord, Norway to Stromstad, Sweden were canceled. There were faults found in 12 fire dampers and leak from a thruster. Repairs were done and she resumed sailings on 7 July.
Vessel had a total failure of its starboard engine lubricating oil pump while secured in Prince Rupert, 0.15 NM SSW Pillsbury Point, BC, Canada. Crew carried out temporary repairs.
Fire erupted on board of vessel at Newark, USA, during offloading operations. She was surrounded by tugs on water and fire engines on land. 2 firefighters died in fire.

LNG bunkering tanker got stuck into embankment at Velsen-Noord, North sea Canal, Ijmuiden area, en route from Amsterdam to North sea, due to being caught in stormy weather. Vessel had to return to Amsterdam after she was set free. She suffered minor damages.

Vessel ran aground at Calapan Port in Oriental Mindoro, Philippines. She touched bottom approx 100M away from its designated ramp due to low tide, but was able to dock safely soon after.No major damages to hull.

In contact with general cargo Sivumut (IMO:9501253) while escorting through heavy ice conditions in Hudson Strait. Vessel had minor damages. 22-Jan-2022 : Bulk carrier FEDERAL CRIMSON hit the stern of the ice breaker while it was clearing its way on the St. Lawrence river, near the bridges connecting Quebec City and the south shore. The ice breaker has suffered damages but is not taking on water, and there has been no pollution resulting from the incident. There was no one injured in the accident.
Vessel had water ingress and flooded all compartments below main deck, at Mooring Cove, NL, Canada. Compartments were pumped out, ingress was found and controlled.
Tankship suffered an engine malfunction off the Dardanelles coast near Uzunburun. Tug Kurtarma 13 towed vessel to the Sevketiye Anchorage. She continued voyage after repairs.
Experienced engine fault then ran aground while transiting Suez Canal, Egypt. S.C.A Tugs refloated vessel, engine fault fixed same day.
Pierre Radisson (IMO:7510834) came in contact with SIVUMUT while escorting her through heavy ice conditions in Hudson Strait,  Cap de NouvelleFrance, Canada . No pollution reported

Tug went NUC while towing barge from Maldives to Tutikorin, India. She drifted to Mannar island, northwest Sri Lanka, Gulf of Mannar and on 7 July the barge broke off and ran aground the beach of southern coast of Mannar island. Tug is trying to refloat barge.
Container ship had scrubbers defect 20 NM S Eddystone Lighthouse, UK, while en route from Cork, Ireland to Rotterdam, Netherlands. Defect was rectified and vessel was underway using own engine.
Tug suffered engine failure while departing Burnaby, BC, Canada. She was sent to Anchorage K under tug assistance for repairs.
Two crew members have been found dead in cargo section, when the vessel was abeam of Varna Bulgaria, en route from Burgas to Constanta. Cause of death is under investigation.
Vessel had mechanical failure before departing Piraeus, Greece. Port Authorities prohibited sailing until repairs and certification. All  passengers were boarded onto another vessel.
Fishing vessel disabled and adrift off Salvora, Spain,  Spanish rescue vessel Salvamar Sargadelos towed her to Ribeira afterwards.
Vessel experienced technical failure of navigation systems & radio communication units at Novorossiysk, Russia. Departure permission revoked until repairs completed.
With 10 crew onboard, barge caught fire in Bangka Strait, Indonesia. Her crew evacuated. Fire started from engine room. Investigations begun. Extinguished after 2 hrs with the help of 2 tugs.

A fire erupted on board vessel, 165NM SW Lands End, Celtic Sea, UK. The 15 people on board were evacuated onto another fishing vessel. Ships in vicinity were requested to lookout and report to UKCG. Fire was extinguished the same day.
Ferry collided with a sailboat in St. Lawrence River, throwing four people overboard and injuring two of them. TSB of Canada was investigating.

Bulk carrier collided with general cargo ship ES VANQUISH at 313 kilometer mark in river Parana, downstream from Ramallo, en route from Bahia Blanca to San Lorenzo. Both vessels suffered damages above and below waterline

Cargo on board vessel caught fire, while berthed at KOEN Yeosu Power Plant, Jungheung-dong, Yeosu. Fire was raken under control within 4 hours, but there were some smoldering hot spots which firefighters monitored. No injuries reported.

General cargo ship collided with bulk carrier ARGENMAR MISTRAL at 313 kilometer mark in river Parana, downstream from Ramallo, en route from San Lorenzo to Callao, Chile. Both vessels suffered damages above and below waterline.
Tug collided with quay at West-Terschelling, Netherlands. Bow of tug was damaged, breached above waterline. She arrived at Harlingen same day and remained stationary since.
A Polish mother and son went overboard from the vessel, while en route from Kariskrona, Sweden, to Gdynia, Poland. This was seen as a potential murder and suicide, according to local media.

Bulk carrier KLC ERCIYES struck portside of berthed vessel, while maneuvering to berth at Izmail port, Ukraine. Both vessels sustained some damages.  JASMIN QUEEN left Izmail, bound for Alexandria Egypt, but was berthed or anchored upstream from Tulcea, Danube.
Vessel struck portside of berthed general cargo ship JASMIN QUEEN while maneuvering to berth at Izmail port, Ukraine. Extent of damages is not known. She remained at Izmail as of 5 July.
Cargo ship allided with a buoy in Kitakyushu Port, Japan. Extent of damage to the hull is unknown. The vessel sailed from Kitakyushu Port after investigations.
General cargo ship had problems with fuel pump cylinder no. 6 which needed changing, about 6.4 NM from North foreland radio site. No tug assistance was required. Repairs were done in about 16 hours.
Container ship had total failure of a fuel pump, at Anchorage A in Vancouver Harbour, BC, Canada. Repair were carried out and she sailed from the port on 14 July.
Reports of vessel having allided with navigation buoy while proceeding down bound in St. Lawrence River off Trois-Rivieres, Quebec, Canada. Damages to buoy were being assessed.

General cargo had technical failure at southern entrance of Canakkale strait, en route from Abu Kir, Egypt to Tuzla, Turkey. Shifted to north of Bozcaada Island anchorage and dropped anchor under own power. Crew carried out repairs.
The Port Authority of Aegina was informed that the ship had port main engine failure, in position 37 53 27N, 023 30 29E, Greece. Vessel continued her journey to Aegina.
Bulk carrier had technical failure during Canakkale Strait passage. She anchored at Karanlik liman anchorage for repairs.
Vessel had technical failure at north entrance of Canakkale strait, Turkey. Shifted to Sevketiye anchorage and dropped anchor under own power. Repairs were carried out by crew.
Ferry had oil leak and had to cancel service between Olhammeren and Seierstad, Norway. She sailed to Ronningen and was still stationary as of 13 July.
Vessel had issues with one of its propellers in Vancouver Harbour, BC, Canada. She completed its daily runs before proceeding to wharf to investigate.
Vessel collided with a small boat, off Bodo, Norway. Small boat sustained unknown damages. No injuried reported. Vessel arrived and moored in Bodo same day.
Vessel had engine failure, South of Bodrum, Turkey, en route from Izmail, Ukraine to Alexandria, Egypt. She started drifting with wind, current. Crew carried out repairs.
Vessel had engine failure, south west off Kas, Turkey. Repairs were carried out by crew. She was drifting with the wind and current direction as of 30 June.
Container ship had engine failure in Malacca Passage, in the vicinity of Agnew Bank, Canada. She proceeded to Anchorage No.8 where issue was resolved and sailed on bound for Seattle.

Tanker allided with quay wall when entering Zandvliet lock, Antwerp, Belgium, most likely due to technical defect affecting its rudder which made vessel unmanageable. She moored in Zandvliet the same day.

Vessel had unexpected complications in propulsion system as she was to return to service between Tsawwassen and Swartz Bay, Canada, from annual refit. She was still in drydock at Vancouver as of 1 July.
A fire broke out on car deck of vessel, while en route from Hirtshals, Denmark to Bergen, Norway. Fire was extinguished and she resumed voyage. An investigation is on.
Vessel collided with fish farming service vessel FROY LOKE in Edoyfjorden, Norway. 3 people sustained minor injuries. All passengers were evacuated to shore by nearby vessel.
Vessel suffered engine failure in Vancouver Harbour in vicinity of Neptune Bank, 2.10 NM E. Brockton Point, BC, Canada. She anchored and repairs were carried out.
An alarm was triggered due to an engine overheating and vessel had to be removed from service between Finnoy and Ombo, Norway. She docked in Mekjarvik, Randaberg, for repairs on 29 July.
VIRAK allided with quay on its way to dock at Agskardet, Norway. Both quay and ferry suffered damages. No injuries reported. Norwegian Maritime Directorate launched an investigation.
Vessel had engine damage and shifted to Mutzelfeldt Shipyard in Cuxhaven, Germany for repairs. Scheduled Heligoland trips from Bremerhaven, Cuxhaven and Busum were cancelled.
Vessel was unable to start port main engine, while preparing to depart the port of Kos bound for Nisiros. Port Authority of Kos banned her from sailing until repairs were done.
Tanker was struck by general cargo ship A COOP NO.7 at Kashima Port anchorage, Ibaraki Prefecture, eastern Honshu, Japan. Her stern portside was breached but was allowed to sail to Shimizu.
Bulk carrier was NUC due to fuel failure defect in English Channel, en route from Gdansk, Poland to Dakar, Senegal. Engine was restarted within two hours and vessel continued voyage.
Smoke was spotted coming out from cargo, as vessel arrived at Lorien France from Riga, Latvia. Fire services were deployed and offloading of cargo started to easily extinguish fire.
A caution was issued by Pakistani Navy reporting that vessel had lost six containers overboard in the vicinity of pos 12 36 04N, 060 11 00E, in the Arabian Sea.

Vessel contacted anchored tanker KIRISHIMA MARU NO.11 at Kashima Port anchorage, Ibaraki Prefecture, eastern Honshu, Japan. She suffered starboard damages in cargo holds area near superstructure and berthed at Kashima.

BERGE NISHIKAWA ran aground in Rio De La Plata Gulf in Martin Garcia Channel, en route from Montevideo to Nueva Palmira port, blocking traffic. Two tugs refloated her almost 12 hours later and she resumed voyage. No damages reported

General cargo ship broke of her mooring ropes and lost control. She suffered water ingresse to engine room and partly capsized. No crew or watchman on board. She had been stuck in Kherson, Ukraine since June 2022, due to Russia-Ukraine war.
PLUTO collided with general cargo with container capacity SALAR on Blexen Roads, Germany. SALAR anchor chain entangled with rudder and propeller of PLUTO. They collided at starboard side stern.

SALAR collided with general cargo PLUTO on Blexen Roads, Germany. SALAR's anchor chain entangled with rudder and propeller of PLUTO. They collided at starboard side stern. Vessel was then taken to Bremerhaven for repairs.
Bulk carrier had technical failure while en route from Bartin, Turkey to Rostov-na-Donu, Russia. She sheltered and anchored at Sinop anchorage and crew carried out repairs.

Cruise ship was slammed by heavy rain and violent winds when it was about to sail from Port Canaveral, Florida, USA to Bahamas. The extreme weather didn't last for too long. No injuries reported. Vessel arrived safely at Coco Cay.
BOLERO IV had jammed tension pulley board net generator in Amsterdam, Netherlands. Smoke was observed and she moored at waiting dock. Fire brigade assisted investigating the source of smoke.
Bulk carrier had total failure of engine and proceeded to anchorage off Longueuil, Quebec, Canada. Issue was resolved and she continued voyage to Hamilton.

Vessel was disabled and adrift due to steering loss in vicinity of pos 08 55 21S, 145 17 13E, Papua New Guinea. MRCC Port Moresby/JRCC Australia requested vessels in vicinity to lookout, assist and report back.
Container ship allided with berth while arriving at Osaka Port, Japan. No leaks reported. Fence on south side of wharf was damaged. Vessel sailed from Osaka on 26 June.

Vessel had technical failure at the south entrance of Canakkale strait. She shifted to N.Bozcaada Island anchorage and dropped anchor under own power. Repairs were carried out by crew. She was stationary at anchorage position as of 26 June.
Reefer suffered engine failure shortly after unmooring at Zhoushan-Ningbo, China, and started to drift towards Jintang Bridge. She dropped anchor and was later towed to a safe anchorage.
Vessel had technical failure, sheltered and dropped anchor, at Sinop anchorage, Turkey. Repairs were carried out by crew.
Vessel had main engine fault in St. Lawrence River, 13.40NM South of Pointe du Bout, QC, Canada. After inspection she moved to anchorage off Les Razades for investigation.

A crew member passed away on board of vessel, en route from Algeciras to Lome, Togo. She interrupted voyage and sailed to Santa Cruz de Tenerife, Canary islands. None od the parties involved were willing to give any details about the death, but reportedly, no violence was involved. Vessel sailed from Tenerife on 27 June.
ORION OCEAN ran aground in vicinity of 33 24 7S, 060 04 56W at 337-km mark on River Parana, Argentina. She was refloated with the help of tugs Dumar and Coopor II and anchored at Ramallo port.

Reportedly, vessel contacted pier at Rostock port, while maneuvering to berth, as she arrived from Rauma. 20 metres of pier steel constructions were damaged and fell into water. The ship also sustained some slight aft damages.
Starboard main engine had damage when the vessel was near the port of Corfu. Port Authority of Corfu banned her sailing, until the repairs were done.
Vessel had technical failure off East part of Rhodes Island, Greece. She shifted to first convenient anchorage area and anchored off Rhodes. Repairs were carried on by crew.
Vessel allided with quay in port of Morro Jable, Spain, in S of Fuerteventura, during mooring manoeuvre. No injuries reported. She proceeded to Las Palmas on 26 June.

Reports that a mine or mines had been attached the hull of vessel, which arrived from  Novorossiysk, Russia, at Zonguldak anchorage on 11 June. The Zonguldak Port authorities on the Black Sea coast of Turkey were alerted, crew was evacuated and port activities stopped during the search. Not clear if any mines were found.
Vessel had engine problems, about 5.1 NM 196 degrees from Worthing pier, UK. 2 engineers attended but repairs were unsuccessful. The ship was towed to Burnley Wharf, Southampton.
ALVER had engine failure off Tuzla, Turkey. Tug Sark towed her to Kartal anchorage where it remained anchored as of 24 June.

Port Authority of Tinos banned vessel from sailing due to a mechanical failure and an error in the control panel of the port main engine while departing from Tinos. She sailed after repairs the same day.
Fire erupted in engine room some 50 nm E of Paranagua, Brazil, en route from Santos to Itapoa. Firefighting system was activated but fire still spread to containers in aft stacks.
Vessel had technical failure of navigation systems together with GMDSS radio communication units, at Novorossiysk, Russia. Crew carried out repairs and sailed on 24 June.
Fishing vessel had total failure of main engine fuel system in vicinity of Alexander Bay, NL, Canada. She was towed to Glovertown. No pollution reported.

It's been reported that vessel lost port side anchor before sailing from the Vathy port of Samos to Piraeus, Greece. She was prohibited sailing until repairs and presentation of a class maintenance certificate and a seaworthiness certificate from the monitoring classification society.

Bulk carrier had technical failure of auxiliary engines together with pertinent systems at Poti, Georgia. Vessel's departure permission was temporarily canceled. Repairs were carried out by crew and sailed on 24 June.

Forward bow of vessel collided with starboard midship of fully cellular containership TAMANRASSET in Oran port, Algeria, during shifting maneuver. Containers stowed on starboard deck suffered some damages. No hull damages reported.

Starboard midship of vessel collided with forward bow of bulk carrier BLUE FIN, during its shifting maneuver in Oran port, Algeria. Containers stowed on starboard deck suffered damages and some fell overboard. No hull damages reported.

Morning departure from Holyhead, UK was significantly delayed due to technical fault. Vessel was unable to berth in Dublin, Ireland with tug assistance, so drydocked in Birkenhead for repairs of shaft.

Reports of vessel being boarded by four armed persons at Conakry Anchorage, Guinea. They broke into the safe, took all the money inside and then fled the ship. Several crew members suffered minor injuries.

Vessel had structural failure during discharge operations of steel products at Hereke, Turkey. Damages to be repaired by stevedore with technical booklet before sailing. She sailed from Hereke on 22 Jun.
Vessel had engine breakdown on Fafjord, Norway. Service between Oldeide and Maloy was cancelled. Speed boat was deployed to help and take situation under control. Vessel berthed at Maloy.
A fire broke out on board vessel in pos 60 44 36.6N, 003 24 32.4E. She was disabled and towed by tug/supply Normand Ferking. She safely berthed in Hanoytangen, Norway.
ORUBA had engine failure and loss of power in Central Aegean Sea. Tug Apollon towed her Aliaga anchorage.
Vessel had main engine failure and started drifting, 10 NM SW of Rampion wind farm, UK. Anchored about 3.9 NM from Bembridge Port as of 23 June, repairs underway.

Vessel requested the evacuation of a sick crew member while  en route from Nouadhibou, Mauritania, to Ponta da Madeira, Brazil. A helicopter hoisted the patient and transported him to Tenerife for further medical care.

A crew member noticed 2 men who were injured, hidden among the cargo, while vessel was sailing in the Mediterranean, en route from Izmir, Turkey, to Swinoujscie, Poland. The garrison inspected their phones and found photographs in which the two were carrying Kalashnikovs, increasing suspicions, which were later confirmed by the Syrian authorities, that they were wanted for terrorism.

Bulk carrier ran aground on De Britto Bank, 10 nm off Binh Thuan Province coast, southern Vietnam, en route from Korea to Vung Tau. Attempts to refloat have failed, so lightering began as of 10 July. Part of the cargo was being offloaded on general cargo ship PHUONG NAM 98. No reported on damages or leaks.
Vessel ran aground near Padangbai Harbour in Bali, Indonesia, probably due to low tide. She was refloated and towed to Padangbai port.

Reports of issues with one of the bow thrusters in Skagway, USA. Crew also noticed leaks in pipes that carry salt water for fire suppression system. Vessel was taken to Ketchikan for repairs, out of service for at least a week.

Sailing of vessel was banned for expired navigation certificates and extremely deteriorated furnishings by General Directorate of Customs of Argentina, following an inspection at Puerto Madero terminal.
Reports of main engine issues in pos 51 17 44.4N, 01 48 46.8E, UK. Vessel departed SW lane and entered inshore to anchor and conduct further investigations.
Vessel was reported disabled and adrift in the Caribbean Sea. Vessels in the vicinity were requested to keeo a sharp lookout, assist and report to the Dutch Caribbean Coast Guard.
ALTUS sustained severe damages to its bow after having drifted in ice and rough weather in White Bay, NL, Canada. She was cleared to proceed to Montreal for repairs.
Vessel had engine issues and had to cancel sailings between Hellesylt and Geiranger on Geirangerfjord. She was sidelined in Hellesylt, Norway. Hydraulic system needed changing, but not available.
Crew members found smoke coming from its bow thruster compartment, en route from Nantucket to Hyannis, USA. Vessel was withdrawn and sidelined for a few hours.
Vessel had an explosion of component on its sewage treatment unit while anchored in Mahone Bay, 1.60NM SSE Hyson Point, NS, Canada. An inspection was scheduled.
A car deck collapsed in Swinoujscie, Polanden, while en route from Trelleborg, Sweden. She entered the Szczecin Ship Repair Yard Gryfia on 13 July and was stationary as of 8 August.
Vessel collided with a Galt Buoy at Kirkwall port. No injuries or water ingress reported. Investigation ongoing.

Vessel suffered fire in engine room while sailing in Shanghai approach channel, en route from Nakhodka, Russia to Shanghai. MRCC Shanghai responded and sent SAR ships. 14 crew were evacuated and 8 remained on board. The ship was towed to a safer place and anchored to not obstruct traffic.
Vessel had main engine disabled after  machinery breakdown approximately 25 NM off Genoa, en route from Genoa to Olbia. She was towed back to Genoa.
Vessel had to return to the port of Funchal, Madeira Islands, Portugal, shortly after leaving the port due to a medical emergency. She left port three hours later bound for Barcelona.

The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) reported that more than 10% of the passengers on board vessel suffered abdominal cramps, vomiting and diarrhoea, en route from New York to Boston. Some crew members also experienced gastrointestinal illness (GI).

It's been reported that vessel ran aground in Great Bitter Lake, in southbound channel off buoy No.1, as she was transiting Canal in southern direction, en route from Canada to, understood, Japan. Grounding hasn't been confirmed officially.
Vessel suffered technical failure and moored at the Datca anchorage, south-west Turkey, en route from Izmail, Ukraine to Alexandria, Egypt. Repairs were carried out by crew.
Vessel had technical failure, sheltered and dropped anchor at Datca anchorage, Turkey. Repairs were carried out by crew. She sailed on next day.

Ferry services between Prince Edward Island and Nova Scotia, Canada were cancelled due to technical issues. Replacement parts needed but unavailable and will need to be manufactured. Service to resume from the 1st July.

Vessel had engine failure at norht entrance of Canakkale Strait at Gelibolu Pt, Turkey. She moved to Sevketiye anchorage with supervision of tug Kurtarma-10. Repairs were carried out by crew. She berthed at a jetty near Galati Feneri on 22 Jun.
Vessel struck berthed bulk carrier KARPATY at Tarragona port, Spain, while proceeding to berth with tugs assistance. She sustained bow damages.

Vessel ran aground in Kiel Canal, halfway between Rendsburg and Kiel, while transiting Canal in western direction, en route from Poland. A tug was deployed and working on her. She was refloated over 3 hours later and resumed transit.
Vessel was struck by bulk carrier ELENA VE, while berthed at Tarragona port, Spain. She sustained serious damages, as her portside hull was breached in cargo holds area.

A crew member suffered of severe abdominal pains and was medevaced by a Portuguese Air Force helicopter when the vessel was about 41nm west of Cabo Carvoeiro, in Peniche, Portugal. He was transferred to Figo Maduro Airport from where he was transported by ambulance to hospital.

Vessel suffered technical failure at the southern entrance of the Canakkale Strait, Marmara Sea, Turkey, en route from Alexandroupolis, Greece, to Varna, Bulgaria. She was shifted to the northern Bozcaada anchorage and moored under its own power. Repairs were commenced by the crew.

Vessel had bow thruster issues and was taken out of service in Kirkwall, UK. She returned to service on 17 June. A part was taken from Earl Sigurd after she taken out of operation following an allision.

Vessel ran aground shortly after a complete loss of power and propulsion, as she was departing section 67 of the port of Montreal, Quebec, Canada, about 1.6nm north-north-east of Poulier de la Longue Pointe, en route to Barcelona. She sailed on 20 hour later after inspection and repairs.

A fire started on board vessel at Pare Pare in S Sulawesi, Indonesia. Investigators stated fire originated in the kitchen, due to electrical short circuit. Vessel was permitted to continue voyage to Makassar. No injuries reported.
Vessel had engine failure while transiting Suez Canal with northbound convoy, at the mouth exit of the Suez Canal By-pass Channel.

Vessel suffered fire in engine room, while 40 nm south of Nakhodka port, Russia, Japan sea, en route from Chine to Vostochniy port. 2 crew members were injured and transferred to hospital. Patrol ships and tugs have responded.
Portside bow of vessel made bottom contact while berthing in Calumet River, Chicago, Illinois, US. Bow thruster was used to free vessel and completed docking manoeuvre.
Vessel was disabled and adrift due to a mechanical issue, while en route from Bequia’s Port Elizabeth to Port Kingstown, St. Vincent & Grenadines. Mechanical malfunction has been remedied.
Vessel had technical failure of navigation units and charts at Bartin, Turkey. Crew carried out repairs and sailed on or after 17 June, bound for Sochi.
Sea scallop survey was cancelled due to mechanical problems on vessel at Lewes, USA. Repairs were carried out but she had further mechanical failures and returned Lewes. Mission was rescheduled.
Vessel needed repairs related to cooling system and was out of service from 18 to 21 June. Sailings on Sandefjord, Norway to Stromstad, Sweden cancelled.

UPDATE: Vessel was refloated with the assistance of the four tugs on 20 June and ship navigation was reinstated with a new maximum draft at the grounded area of 9.45 metres. Vessel ran aground near 311.5 kilometer mark, in Parana river, while sailing downstream from San Martin, bound for Las Palmas. No tugs seen around as of yet.

Vessel ran aground between Island Neuwerk and Cuxhaven, Germany, due to low water levels caused by strong eastern wind. 17 passengers were taken by another vessel to Cuxhaven. The ship was refloated by own means.
Vessel could not start starboard main engine and had to cancel scheduled route of transporting heavy cargo vehicles. Igoumenitsa port authority banned its sailing until repairs.
Vessel had major failure of portside engine, 6nm from St Catherine's Point, Isle of Wight, UK. She was towed by two tugs, berthed and sailed from Portsmouth on 15 June.

Vessel had fire in the fore part, probably in forecastle area, at Jurong Port Tank Terminals (JPTT), Singapore. Fire was extinguished within 2 hours by city firefighters, Terminal emergency response team, and other parties. No injuries reported.
Vessel was disabled on Tysfjord, Norway, while serving the route between Drag and Kjopsvik. She was towed by fast ferry STADDA to Kjopsvik and sailed same day.

Vessel had engine failure during Istanbul Strait passage, en route from Saraylar,Turkey to Reni,Ukraine. She resumed Strait passage under supervision of tugs. A fine was imposed due to engine failure and tugs attendance.

Vessel suffered a fire in its accommodation block during routine maintenance at a shipyard in Yalova. The fire was controlled and extinguished within a couple of hours, by the crew together with shipyard duty fire-fighting team and subsequently, the local fire brigade. Extent of damages unknown, slight pollution detected and no injuries.

Reports of portside main engine control failure, before departure from new port of Corfu, Greece. Vessel was moored under own power at Pier No. 2 and towed to adjacent berthing position. Sailing was banned.

Vessel was reported capsized by locals, in Karimunjawa waters. She had left Jakarta on 9 June, bound for Maluku, loaded with heavy machinery. Contact was lost on 12 June when she was some 70 nm off northern coast of Java, halfway between Jakarta and Surabaya. There were 11 crew on board, 6 were rescued and 5 are missing.

Vessel had technical failure during Canakkale Strait passage and dropped anchor at Karanlik liman anchorage in Strait under supervision of Strait pilot. Repairs were carried out and vessel sailed from anchorage on 14 June.

Vessel was observed to be polluting the sea in the Gulf of Izmit during a patrol flight of the Kocaeli Metropolitan Municipality, Turkey. During discharge operations, palm oil leaked through ventilation hole onto the deck and then into the water. Cleaning works have commenced and the Turkish Environment Agency was informed.

Vessel had failure of rudder system and allided with center tail unit on Elbe side of New Southern Lock of Kiel Canal, Brunsbuttel, Germany. Dolphin was damaged. Steering gear was put back into operation, and vessel berthed in Emden.

It's been reported that vessel suffered total failure of its starboard engine while operating in the area of Sault-au-Cochon, Quebec. She dropped anchor for investigations and was then permitted to proceed to a wharf in Quebec for repairs.
Vessel ran aground onto an island, located in pos 33 52 16.8N, 132 04 00.5E, Japan. She was refloated the same day. No injuried and no pollution observed.
Vessel had technical failure, sheltered and dropped anchor at Cesme, Turkey, while en route from Nemrut Bay, Turkey to Tripoli, Lebanon. Repairs being carried out by crew.

Jack-up rig issued distress signal 60 nm west of Mundra, India, Arabian sea. Indian CG helicopter airlifted 11 personnel from the rig. It seems there was no accident on board but the evacuation was requested due to approaching cyclone Biparjoy.
Port Authority of Khora Sfakion was vessel had damage to electric fresh water pump, during preparations prior to sailing. Port Authority prohibited vessel departure. She sailed on 13 June.
Vessel was disabled and adrift in Indian ocean, some 950 nm west of Australian coast. She requested the evacuation of a crew member. Details unknown.

An explosion occurred on board vessel, docked in Llaquepe sector in Reloncavi Estuary, Cochamo commune, Chile, during welding work. Bow store exploded, one person died and one was seriously injured. Vessel shifted to Puerto Montt on 14 June.

Vessel was struck by gantry crane after floating dock accident, at Cindemir Shipyard in Tuzla, Turkey. She is undergoing repairs at the shipyard since last year. No injuries reported. Extent of damages unknown.
A sick crew member was evacuated by Coastal Safety lifeboat Kiyem 9 and transferred to a medical team in Lapseki.

Vessel had technical failure at northern entrance of Canakkale Strait off Gelibolu, Turkey. She was shifted to Gelibolu anchorage and dropped anchored. Crew carried out repairs and continued voyage the same day.

Vessel struck dock at WSF Terminal in Port Townsend, USA, due to strong currents as she arrived from Coupeville. Some passengers and  crew members suffered minir injuries. Dock was not damaged. Vessel was back in service same day.
Container ship had main engine fault, approximately 195 NM off France. Repairs were carried out and vessel was underway next day, using own engines.
Port side of vessel allided with wall while entering lock No. 4 in Canal de Beauharnois, ON, Canada. She suffered minor hull damage and sailed to Montreal for a complete inspection.
Port Authority of Corfu was informed that vessel had port main engine failure while on her scheduled route from port of Gaios, Paxos to Corfu, Greece.
Vessel had technical failure of navigation at Novorossiysk, Russia. Departure permission was cancelled until repairs. Crew carried out repairs and vessel sailed on 19 June for Giurgiulesti, Moldova.
Tanker had engine failure off Yarimca, Turkey. Tug SARK towed her to Yarimca LPG terminal. Crew carried out repairs.

Vessel's departure was delayed by 90 minutes by activists who blocked the mooring posts with tripods and lock-ons so that the ship’s mooring ropes could not be disconnected, on the Wilhelminakade in Rotterdam. The demonstration continued without disturbance and the police did not have to intervene.
Vessel got in trouble near Fredrikstad, Norway after losing control in Glomma on its way down river from Alvim in Sarpsborg to Trondheim. She anchored at Fredrikstadt Bridge, towed to quay at Ora.
Vessel had engine failure off Pescara, Italy. Repairs couldn’t be done by crew. Tug CHRISTOS XXXIV attended and towed her towards Alexandria, Egypt.
A crew member was detained by police during routine checks of passenger and crew lists at the port of Kiel. The man was taken off the ship and transported to a prison.
A crew member was detained by police during routine checks of passenger and crew lists at the port of Kiel. The man was taken off the ship and transported to a prison.
Cargo ship had technical failure at Fatsa, Turkey. Departure permission was temporarily cancelled by the Harbour-Master until completion of repairs.

Vessel suffered engine failure shortly after entering Suez Canal with southbound convoy, in Kilometer 5 mark area, en route from Novorossiysk to Ulsan Korea. Canal Traffic Control tugs responded and towed her back to Med and anchored at outer anchorage.
A dent was found on the port side near the loading line, before vessel departed Rafina, Greece. She was allowed to sail after she was declared seaworthy.
A crew member was having breathing difficulties. The CCS Palma of Salvamento Marítimo mobilized an SAR helicopter, which hoisted the patient and took him to the Hospital Son Espases.

Vessel ran aground at Kogochi Island tip, Okayama Prefecture, Inner Japan sea, while en route from Takasago, Hyogo Prefecture to Kure, Hiroshima Prefecture. No damages, injuries or leaks reported. Tug is already nearby, waiting for high tide.
A crew member was medevaced to a hospital on the mainland by an air ambulance from Longyearbyen. Due to the long distance, the helicopter had to refuel several times along the way.

suffered a leak in its engine room while at the Rotterdam Anchorage N. About 200 litres of water entered into the engine room. The damage was repaired and the ship was waiting to enter the port of Rotterdam.
Reports of total failure of one generator while preparing for departure from Langdale, BC, Canada. Ferry service was maintained using two other generators.
Vessel made bottom contact with water ingress in ballast tank, while proceeding downbound in lock No. 2, Welland Canal, ON, Canada. Damage was assessed in Port Weller.
Reports of fire in engine room, 30 mins after leaving port of L'Ile-Rousse, France. Crew extinguished fire and sailed at low speed. She arrived in Marseille for inspection.
Vessel had technical failure and anchored at Bodrum anchorage, Turkey. Crew carried out the repairs. Vessel stationary at anchorage position.
Vessel was NUC due to engine defect and oil pipe issue, about 20nm SSE of Prawle point, UK. MRCC Falmouth awaiting update from vessel regarding defect.

Three crew members needed immediate hospital treatment at Piraeus anchorage. One of them was picked up by a patrol boat and taken to the Zeas marina, from where he was transferred by an ambulance to the Piraeus General Hospital. The other two were evacuated by a Navy helicopter and transported them to the Elefsina military airport, where they were picked up by an ambulance and also were transported to the Piraeus General Hospital.

Vessel suffered fire in UAE waters. One crew member was medevaced by NSRC UAE. As of 7 June, there were no tugs or firefighting boats nearby, fire was probably extinguished. The ship left Dubai on 5 June, bound for Abu Dhabi.
Container allided with wharf while berthing in Argentia, NL, Canada. Ballast tank was cracked. No pollution reported. She sailed from Argentia on 9 June.
Vessel had engine failure while en route from Piraeus to Heraklion, Greece. No assistance was required. She sailed on her own and arrived at Heraklion the same day.

Vessel ran aground for the second time within a few days, after leaving the port of Dapa, Siargao Island, Surigao del Norte province, Philippines en route to Surigao City. The PNP Maritime, Philippine Coast Guard (PCG) Rescue Team from LGU Dapa and other rescue teams came to assist

Vessel had fire in engine room, in Glacier Bay National Park, Alaska. US Coast Guard and nearby cruise ship SAPPHIRE PRINCESS quickly responded and evacuated all passengers and non-essential crew. Fire was extinguished by sealing off engine room and activating CO2 system, but vessel was disabled and she was towed to Ketchikan by tug TAKU WIND.

Vessel collided with sailboat in waters of Lipari in front of Punta Castagna, Italy. Sailboat sank but no injuries reported. Vessel reached Lipari at reduced speed and was then transferred to Trapani.

Vessel was disabled due to main engine failure, off Nesna, Norway. She was towed to Nesna by fire fighting tug Boa Brage and berthed for repairs. She was replaced by ferry Rosund on route Nesna-Levang for time being.
Service between Woods Island Harbour, PEI and Caribou, NS, Canada was cancelled due to vessel having a technical issue.

Vessel suffered engine failure, shortly after entering Dardanelles from Aegean sea, en route from USA to Kocaeli Turkey, Marmara sea. She was taken to Karanlik anchorage, western Dardanelles by a Canakkale Traffic Control tug.

Vessel suffered engine fault in Suez Canal, in Port Said area, shortly after she started transit en route from Russia, probably Murmansk, to China. She was taken under control by tugs and berthed in Canal in Port Said area.

General cargo with container capacity Rix Voyager collided with vessel on Blexen roads, Germany before ran aground at Weser. Anchor was dragged and torn off along with parts of chain. She suffered propeller damages.

Research vessel ran aground south of Floro, Norway. Lifeboat Bergen Kreds and patrol vessel Sortland proceeded to scene. Vessel was pulled off and arrived in Maloy same day. She was then towed to Stadyard AS shipyard, Raudeberg.
Vessel had technical failure, sheltered and dropped anchor at Sinop anchorage, en route from Zonguldak, Turkey to Rostov-na-Donu, Russia. Crew carried out repairs.
Vessel ran aground on Weser River, in Blexen bends on Bremerhaven side of river, Germany, en route from Sodertalje, Sweden. Tugs refloated and towed to Bremerhaven and berthed in connecting port.

Vessel had engine trouble and started drifting, 30 NM from Nangan off Matsu Islands in Lienchiang County in East China Sea. A repair team was flown in from Taiwan. Vessel berthed in inner port of Keelung on 5 June.

Vessel suffered flooding through the bow ramp while sailing from Banyuasin Regency to the Bangka Regency, caused by a rubber rampdoor that was impermeable to the bow and was unable to dispel the swift sea water. She managed to return to dock at Tanjung Api-Api Port, Banyuasin. The sea water flooded

Vessel ran hard aground off Dursey Island at the coast of west Cork with 14 people on board. The Valentia Coast Guard was notified and deployed a Coast Guard helicopter and evacuated 10 of them. Subsequently, the vessel was refloated and towed to Casteltownbere

CHAMPION JET 1 collided with EKATERINI P while manoeuvring, at Tinos, Greece. No injuries and no marine pollution reported. Both vessels were allowed to sail after preliminary investigation. Sailed from Tinos the same day.

CHAMPION JET 1 collided with EKATERINI P while manoeuvring, at Tinos, Greece. No injuries and no marine pollution reported. Both vessels were allowed to sail after preliminary investigation. Sailed from Tinos the same day.

Vessel was disabled by electric failure which affected several systems of the ship, near  Puerto Bolivar, Colombia, Caribbean, while en route from Brazil to Cartagena Colombia. She drifted dangerously close to coast for about 20 hours. Tug MRS DOROTY towed her to Cartagena.

Fire erupted in cargo hold while berthed at Dordrecht, Netherlands, during scrap loading and spread to scrap piled at quay. Fire was taken under control by massive fire response and was declared extinguished more than 3 hours later.

Vessel was struck by general cargo ship POTENTIA,  9 nm north of northwest tip of Chios island, Greece, while en route from I Egypt to Reni, Ukraine. POTENTIA struck ANT starboard in cargo hold area, inflicting hull breach. No injuries reported. All crew remained on board.

Vessel collided with general cargo ship ANT, 9 nm north of northwest tip of Chios island, Greece, while en route from Izmir to Dieppe, France. Both ships headed towards Turkish ports with presumably serious damages. No injuries reported. All crew remained on board.

Dive support vessel suffered fire after an explosion in Porto do Açu. Multiple tugs and firefighters were at the scene for several hours. The cause of fire in under investigations. No injuries reported.
Vessel had electrical fault with propulsion system while at port of Hasvik, Norway. She was berthed in Oksfjord. Troubleshooting was done, awaiting spare parts.

Vessel ran aground off Buenos Aires in Canal Brown, while proceeding to Parana river, en route from Bahia Blanca to San Nicolas. She was refloated more than 4 hours later and resumed her voyage to Ramallo anchorage, Parana river. No damages reported.
Vessel suffered total engine failure on the northeast Newfoundland Shelf in the Labrador Sea. She was towed to Twillingate by the Canadian Coastguard vessel Ann Harvey.
Vessel had technical issues which impacted her maximum cruising speed, at Mazatlan. Repairs were carried out by crew after inspection. She docked and sailed from Cabo San Lucas the same day.

An undeclared chemical unit which was transferred by the vessel to an agent boat during its stay at Derince anchorage, caught fire at an open storage in the port during the night. An investigation was launched by the Harbour Master and the local court as the contents of the materials were not declared properly by the vessel. Vessel departure was cancelled.

The Chief Engineer was working on the upper deck and fell from the ship into the sea, while vessel was anchored at the Galle Harbour, south-west Sri Lanka. The staff were able to rescue him and take him to hospital, but he didn't survive. Galle Port Police are investigating.

Fire errupted in engine room of vessel moored in Naples. Fire fighters and Port Authority intervened and 15 passengers and all truck drivers were evacuated safely. No injuries reported. Cause of fire is under investigation.

Vessel sank 310nm NW of Ilha das Flores, Portugal. MRCC Ponta Delgada coordinated salvage operations. Nearby fishing vessel and merchant vessels were diverted to site. Portuguese Navy Corvette and airforce C-295 aircraft mobilized. 12 crew mmbers were rescued.
Vessel was NUC due to an exhaust pipe leak, abt 6 NM from the Sunk East buoy. Dover Coastguard conducted welfare checks. Vessel was underway to Hamburg after repairs were completed

Vessel suffered fire in cargo hold  in Ulsan Port, Korea. Several firefighters and fire engines are at the scene, pouring large amounts of water onto fire. Vessel has a cargo of 5,700 tons of PTA, used in plastic production. No injuries reported.

Reports of fire outbreak in the engine room while vessel was enroute to Canada. Incident occured at Lake Erie, Great Lakes and a fire response team from the Ohio Dept of Natural Resources was able to respond. 08-Jul-2007 : Lost power and grounded in 42 05.01 N 83 06.54 W 08 Jul 2007. Refloated 09 Jul with tug assistance and proceeded. No damage to vessel. Ar Owen Sound 11 Jul and sailed 12 Jul after minor hydraulic problems.

Vessel's status was "Not Under Command" and appeared to be drifting in the vicinity in the Sri Lanka SAR zone. MRCC Colombo attempted to make contact but failed. Vessels in the vicinity were asked to try and make contact via radio as well.

A 35-year old man fell overboard while returning to port in Norfolk, Virginia. He was reported missing by his companion and the ship’s security footage confirmed that he had leaned over the railing of his stateroom balcony and dropped into the water. The ship continued  voyage while the USCG carried out searched from both air and water 186 miles east of Jacksonville, Florida.
Pakistani Navy reported that vessel ran aground in Sonmiani Bay, Pakistan. A security alert for vessels in vicinity was issued.

Vessel suffered a fire strike by the Syrian Coast Guard south of Iskenderun Bay, in international territorial waters, en route from Karatas, Turkey. to Iskenderun, Turkey. She suffered structural damage to the bridge and accommodation block, and two crew members were injured. The ship returned to Karatas and an investigation file has been placed by the Turkish Coast Guard and Maritime Authority.
The sailing between Anacortes and San Juan Islands was disrupted as the vessel had to be docked due to a steering control problem. She was sidelined in Anacortes since.
Reports of fire outbreak in one of the cabins not long after departure from Sydney Australia. It was put out with by the crew using extinguishers onboard and all passengers safe in mustered areas.

Vessel had engine failure at northern entrance of Canakkale strait off Gelibolu, Turkey. Tugs and a fast rescue boat were appointed. The ship was shifted to Doganaslan and anchored. Crew started repairs.
Tanker had technical failure at Yenikoy point in the Strait, Turkey. Coastal Safety tug Kurtarma-8 attended. Vessel was anchored at Buyukdere anchorage and crew carried out repairs.

A participant in the Norwegian Cup in wing foil collided with vessel on her scheduled route between Filtvet, Drobak and Aker Brygge in Oslo, Norway. The participant was admitted to hospital but was later discharged.

Vessel was unable to completely raise port side anchor at anchorage No.5 in Nanaimo, 0.70 NM ENE of Angle Point, BC, Canada. Temporary repairs were carried out by crew. She sailed from Nanaimo Anchorage on 31 May.

Vessel had failure of fire-fighting systems together with pertinent connections at Novorossiysk, Russia. Departure was cancelled until repairs. Repairs were carried out by crewand sailed from Novorossiysk on 29 May.
Ferry, with 38 people on board, had engine malfunction, drifted due to strong winds and ran aground in vicinity waters off Dapa town, Philippines. Passengers are all safe, no casualties.

CARNIVAL SUNSHINE was rocked by storm and delayed her return to Port Charleston, S Carolina, USA. She had leaks and minor damages. Due to the rough weather in Charleston which delayed arrival, departure of next voyage was also delayed.
Vessel taken out of service after she contacted pier at Hirtshals, North Jutland, Denmark, on arrival from Larvik. She suffered hull damages above waterline.
Vessel ran aground at 143.4 KM mark of Volgo-Caspian Shipping Canal, Russia. No damages or spill reported. She was refloated with the help of a tug on 28 May and anchored.
EXPRESS 5 collided with a barge in Ystad Harbour, Sweden. Evening departure from Ystad to Ronne, Denmark was canceled. She had bow damage and returned to Ronne for repairs.
Vessel had technical failure, sheltered and dropped anchor at Sinop anchorage, Turkey. Crew carried out repairs. She remained stationary at Sinop anchorage as of 28 May.

UPDATE: The tug owner has been accused of violating Pakistan’s territorial water limits and defaulting on supplying a vessel to a foreign firm in India. The High Court of Sindh, Pakistan, has set a tentative date of 21 December for the hearing of the case. Tug reported an engine stop and started drifting during voyage from Ghadani Beach in Balochistan to Karachi Port. Vessel was rescued by Pakistan Maritime Security Agency.

Vessel suffered engine failure and went adrift in Mediterranean sea some 45 nm southeast of Karpathos, while en route from Damietta Egypt to Reni Ukraine. Meanwhile her cargo has also shifted due to uncontrolled pitching and rolling, causing her to develop list.
Fire broke out in aft engine alternator of vessel, alongside CalMac pier at Lochaline. It was caused by failure of bearings and extinguished same day.

It's been reported that oil has spilled from the laid up vessel in the port waters of the Sukhyi Estuary in Chornomorsk. The State Environmental Inspection was calculating the damage caused to the environment.
Port Department of Poros of Port Authority of Kefallinia was informed that vessel cancelled service on scheduled route from Poros to Kyllini, Greece, due to damage to port main engine.
Vessel was NUC due to problem with turbocharger in Netherlands SRR and later drifted into UK SRR. Repairs were carried out and resumed voyage the same day.
Vessel had a fire in its forecastle workshop while secured in St. John's, NL, Canada. Crew extinguished fire.

Vessel suffered engine failure and went adrift in the Med, while en route from Damietta Egypt to Reni Ukraine. She also encountered another problem caused by uncontrolled pitching and rolling – cargo shifted, followed by a list, maybe critical. 26-Sep-2021 : Vessel was intercepted and detained by a Libyan National Army (LNA) patrol vessel  while proceeding from Misrata and heading east for orders. It was detained for breaching the LNA ‘No Sail Zone’ and was escorted to the Ras el Hilal anchorage for administrative procedures.

A norovirus outbreak affected more than 175 people on a voyage to Bermuda from 15 to 25 May. Vessel's crew increased cleaning and disinfection procedures according to the ship’s outbreak prevention and response plan and notified current guests of the situation onboard and encouraged illness reporting and good hand hygiene.

Vessel ran aground in Suez area, shortly after entering Suez Canal from Red sea, en route from Duba Saudi Arabia. She got stuck in embankment by stern. Several tugs are around. Understood traffic is blocked.

Vessel suffered engine failure in the Thi Vai – Cai Mep channel in Vietnam. Seven tugs were deployed to tow her to deeper waters in the Vung Tau Sea. The crew carried out repairs to the main engine, and the ship continued its journey to Hong Kong.
Vessel suffered a technical failure and sheltered at Cesme anchorage,while en route from Samsun, Turkey to Alexandria, Egypt. Repairs were carried out by the crew.

Vessel collided with oil products tanker VF Tanker 14 south of Pointed Island in the Marmara Sea. Tugs Kurtarma 5 and Kurtarma 9, as well as the lifeboat Kiyem 3 were deployed to assist. The ship was later anchored at Ahırkapı Anchorage Area.
The container ship suffered main engine failure and went adrift, while en route from Tokyo to Nagoya. She was towed by tug Seiwamaru on 25 May.
Vessel had engine blackout on Sodertalje Canal. Tug ARNE secured her and towed to port of Sodertalje.
Bulk carrier collided with a wharf at section No. 100 of the Port de Montreal, Quebec, Canada. Minor damages were assessed.

Vessel collided with crude oil tanker Beks Iron south of Pointed Island in the Marmara Sea. Tugs Kurtarma 5 and Kurtarma 9, as well as the lifeboat Kiyem 3 were deployed to assist. The ship was later anchored at Ahırkapı Anchorage Area.

Vessel suffered fire in engine room in Lake Erie, Great Lakes, north of Pelee island, while en route to Kingsville, Canada. Fire was contained and most probably, already extinguished as of 24 May. Vessel has been anchored and remains at anchor.
Vessel was struck by bulk carrier Odelmar at a berth in Hakata Port, Fukuoka, Japan. The Odelmar suffered slight damages and left Hakata the next day, en route to Mizushima.
A fire broke out aboard vessel, in the port of Brest, France, while being deconstructed in 5th basin, during a cutting of the interior equipment. The firefighters contained the blaze the same day.
Vessel had technical problems when it was in dry dock at the Cammel Lairds Yard in Birkenhead. She was shifted to Belfast, UK, on 24 May and remained in the port as of 26 May.
Reports of presence of smoke in the steering gear compartment at wharf, Roberts Bank, BC, Canada. Fire alarm activated. Investigation is on.

Propeller of vessel was damaged mid-sailing en route from Portsmouth to Isle of Wight, UK, due to debris in solent. She was withdrawn from service for inspection and repairs and taken to Trafalgar Wharf to replace propeller.
Vessel was NUC, disabled and adrift in the eastern north Pacific Ocean. Vessels in the vicinity were requested to keep a sharp lookout, assist if possible and report to the RCC Alameda.
Vessel allided with the smaller cargo ship Shunei in Hakata Port, Fukuoka, Japan, She suffered slight damage but left Hakata the next day, en route to Mizushima.
Vessel collided Ludinghausen railway bridge at canal KM 36 of Dortmund-Ems Canal, Germany. Wheelhouse crashed into substructure of railway bridge, windows broken.

Master of vessel informed Port Authority of Rhodes, that it had malfunction in port main engine 10 minutes after departure from Mandraki, Rhodes, bound for Symi Island, Greece. She sailed under her own power back to Mandraki.

Vessel suffered engine failure near Sultan Selim Bridge, northern Bosphorus, while transiting the strait in northern direction, en route from Yalova to Reni Ukraine. Tug responed and towed her to Buyukdere anchorage, Bosphorus.
It's been reported that vessel collided with fender No.2 while approaching lock in Saint-Lambert, QC, Canada. She was inspected and authorised to resume voyage. No pollution reported.

General cargo ship BRO STAR had technical failure of navigation systems together with the echo sounder unit at Novorossiysk, Russia. Departure permission was temporarily cancelled. Repairs were carried out by crew and she sailed on 24 May.

Vessel had mechanical issue off Genkelkoy, Bosphorus, while transiting the Strait in southern direction, en route from Romania to Lebanon. Tanker was assisted by tug and safely reached Ahirkapi Anchorage, Istanbul, Marmara sea. Traffic wasn’t affected.

Vessel collided with cargo vessel LCT Poseidon 23 on starboard side, while sailing Mactan Channel, Philippines, due to steering and engine problems. Damages to foreship both SB side hull and amidships. The ship was towed to Cebu. 25 people were injured.

Vessel suffered engine failure during the transit of the Dardanelles off Nara Cape, en route from Alexandria to Constanta. Tug Türkeli was deployed to assist. Vessel moored safely at Şevketiye Anchorage.

Vessel was struck by fastcat ferry M V ST JHUDIEL in Cebu waters near Cebu-Mactan bridge. She was carrying 17 vehicles and some 20 passengers, drivers and cargo movers. Collision, reportedly, was caused by ferry steering and engine failure. 30 to 35 passengers sustained injuries and 13 of them had to be taken to hospital.

A crew member needed immediate hospital care, while vessel was sailing south of Paleochora, Crete. She sailed into the bay of Kalen Limeni, and the patient was transferred to the Hospital of Heraklion for medical examinations, while the ship continued its scheduled route.

Vessel suffered engine failure while transiting Dardanelles, south of Canakkale, en route from Syria to Novorossiysk. Tugs responded and took her to Karanlik Anchorage, Dardanelles. Allegedly the ship is deployed in arms transportation.

A crew member suffered severe abdominal pain some 260km from the port of Rawson (Chubut). The Argentine Naval Prefecture medevaced the patient and taken him to an ambulance at the Trelew airport. He was then taken to the local hospital for further care, with suspected acute appendicitis.

Vessel suffered fire at Busan port, where the ship was docked, probably undergoing repairs. 6 hours later fire was under control or extinguished, due to massive fire fighting force. No injuries reported.
Vessel had technical failure, sheltered and dropped anchor, at Bozburun anchorage, Turkey. Crew carried out repairs.
Vessel capsized in dry dock slip in Cape Town, as she was about to move from slip into water, after completing maintenance works. One crew member was injured and taken to hospital.

Vessel allided with rock, during mooring operations at floating platform dock, in Balou Island area. 1 propeller was damaged and sailing was banned. 386 passengers on board were transferred to another vessel.

Vessel had engine failure off Ambarli, Turkey. Tug Kurtarma-12 towed her to Ambarli anchorage where she dropped anchor. Fine was imposed and had to pay salvage expense. Repairs were carried out by crew.
Vessel had technical failure at Novorossiysk, Russia. Departure permission was temporarily cancelled by Harbour Master. Crew carried out repairs and she sailed on 21 May, bound for Istanbul.

Bulk carrier DONNA JUDI had technical failure during Canakkale strait passage and dropped anchor at Karanlik liman anchorage in strait, under supervision of strait pilot. Repairs were carried out by crew and she sailed from anchorage the same day.
Vessel had engine failure while fishing off Cabo Fisterra, Spain. CSS Fisterra mobilised fire fighting tug Don Inda and towed vessel to port of Muros.
Vessel had technical failure, sheltered and dropped anchor in Datca anchorage, Turkey. Crew carried out repairs.

Vessel requested the medevac of a sick crew member, wjile en route from Izmail to Irakleion, at the northern entrance of the Dardanelles. Coastal Safety lifeboat took the patient off the bulker and delivered him to medical teams in Gallipoli.

Vessel reported fire in engine room, hours after arriving at Kucukcekmese anchorage, Istanbul, Marmara sea from Aliagai, Turkey. Tugs and aux boats responded and took fire under control. No reports on damages.

2 crew members of Indian nationality were badly burned in a working accident in engine room, in Arabian Sea, en route from UAE to Chennai, India, Bay of Bengal. Vessel had to call at Kochi Anchorage, India, where Indian Coast Guard ship with paramedics team performed medevac and transferred them to hospital.

Vessel contacted pillar of Rokko Ohashi Bridge at Kobe Port, Japan. Tugs responded and took her to berth. Both pillar and vessel sustained damages, but extend unknown. Tanker was taken to Kobe anchorage 5 hours later

Vessel was hijacked by 2 young people in port Kiel, Germany, and allided with dolphin of the bridge. There were damages to rudder blades, bow and stern areas. Police arrested the hijackers and handed them over to their legal guardians.
Vessel suffered a navigation system failure at Eregli, Turkey. She wasn't allowed to depart until the completion of repairs and an inspection by a state surveyor.
Vessel had a rope entangled in its propeller, so service between Oban and Lismore, UK has been suspended . Divers removed the rope from propeller in Oban Harbor and she resumed service the next day.

Vessel ran aground on shallows, in pos 33 58 50N, 132 32 54E, Japan. A crack approximately 10 metres long and up to 3cm wide was found in engine room bottom and flooded. Captain was reportedly asleep. No injuries or oil spill reported.
Vessel was NUC due to issue with pitch, about 13 NM North of Puffin Island, UK. Crew carried out repairs and was underway using own engine, the same day.

A crew member had suffered a leg injury, 11NM southeast of Southwest Pass, Louisiana. The US Coast Guard medevaced and trasnferred him to awaiting emergency medical services personnel at USCGStation Venice. He was then transported to Ochsner Medical Centre Westbank Campus in Gretna, Louisiana, in stable condition.

Vessel ran aground on Belle island, Canadian site, in Detroit river, while proceeding from Detroit to Milwaukee. She was refloated some 4 hours later and anchored in front of Detroit. No damages reported.

A crew member experienced heart attack-like symptoms about 13nm south of Port Fourchon, Louisiana. Coast Guard Air Station New Orleans MH-60 Jayhawk helicopter aircrew hoisted him from the vessel and transported him to University Medical Centre in New Orleans. The patient was reported to be in stable condition.

Vessel reported a gas leak off Brønnøysund on the Norwegian west coast. More than 80 employees had to be evacuated into lifeboats twice that day. No injuries were reported and production was soon resumed.
Vessel capsized in Indian ocean south of Maldives, while en route from Cape Town to probably Busan. All 39 crew members are missing. China sending available forces to facilitate SAR.
Vessel reported a punctured ballast tank found during an inspection at dock No.16, while moored in Port Weller, ON, Canada. Crew did temporary repairs before proceeding downbound.

Vessel allided with yacht Sokny and tender Andy in the port of Argostoli, Greece, in adverse weather conditions, and causing damage to all three vessels. Two slight injuries were reported, one of whom was taken to a medical facility. Sailing was prohibited until the presentation of a certificate of seaworthiness and maintenance of class by the attending classifiers. No polution reported.

Vessel suffered mechanical fault in Fourth Kurilskiy Strait, while en route from Vladivostok to Petropavlovsk. She was underway 2 hours later but interrupted voyage after entering Pacific ocean and anchored off Paramushir island east coast. Tug SPRAVEDLIVYJ towed her to Petropavlovsk.
Vessel ran aground South of Marmara Island, Turkey, en route from Larymna, Greece. No leaks, pollution or injuries reported. Tug Nazim Tur towed her as unable to refloat on its own.
Vessel ran aground approx 2.5NM SW of Kuala Perlis, Malaysia. Reportedly a rope caught in propeller and caused vessel to be stranded for about 5 hrs. Tug safely towed her to Kuala Perlis.
Vessel had engine failure, close to Langeland Island, while en route from Vysotsk, Russia to a position off Ceuta. Crew managed to get engine working and voyage resumed in about 6 hours.

Vessel broke down after being loaded at Darwin Port, Australia, with cattle destined for Belawan, Sumatra, Indonesia. The cattle spent 6 nights on board before the Australian Federal Department of Agriculture (DAFF) ordered the animals to be unloaded. Repairs were delayed due to waiting for replacement part.
Vessel had auxiliary engine fan burnt out and had to be replaced, 27.5NM SE of Southwold, N Sea. Vessel at anchor. Repairs done. Vessel adrift, awaiting pilot.

Vessel ran aground in Tromso Sound close to old ferry inn, Tromsdalen, Norway. No injuries reported. Vessel had damages to hull, water ingress, SB list and damages to propeller. Tug Borg Parat towed her to Tromso.
Vessel accidentally released its anchor 14NM SE of Hambantota, Sri Lanka. Crew engaged in recovery process. Vessel failed to recover anchor.
Vessel had total loss of propulsion while proceeding upbound and maneuvering inside lock at Saint-Lambert, Quebec, Canada. Tied up in lock for repairs. Sailed from Quebec on 16 May
Vessel suffered fire in the accommodation area, at port of Murmansk, Russia. 17 crew were evacuated. No injuries reported.
Vessel was NUC due to a defective lubrication system, in pos 50 16 13N, 001 17 25W. The crew carried out the repairs and was underway the same day.

Vessel ran aground near E.Jetty, Emden, Germany, after steering wrong course while approaching large sea lock. Foreship stuck in mud at slow speed. She was refloated and berthed at Ems Quay. Detained, captain was fined.

Vessel was struck by general cargo ship Seven Star while berthed at Kawasaki, Japan. She suffered scratches at the starboard side foreship and the Seven Star sustained cracks to a lifeboat on its port side.
Vessel allided with berthed cargo ship Anna, at Kawasaki, Japan. She sustained cracks to a lifeboat on port side. The Anna suffered scratches at the starboard side foreship.

Vessel suffered technical failure at the southern entrance of the Canakkale Strait, Turkey, while en route from Mersin to Izmail. She was shifted to the northern Bozcaada Island anchorage and dropped anchor under its own power. Repair were carried out by the crew.
Vessel had technical failure, sheltered and dropped anchor at Finike anchorage, en route from Iskenderun, Turkey to Rostov-na-Donu, Russia. Repairs were carried out by crew.
Vessel suffered loss of power and steering and started drifting in NE direction, in rough weather conditions, while en route for Singapore. Offshore tug SKANDI EMERALD was preparing to tow her.

Vessel suffered main engine fault when 12nm west south-west of Sennen Cove. She anchored in the Land’s End TSS to replace the high pressure injection pump in cylinder nine. Voyage was resumed after repairs on 14 May.
Vessel had technical failure during Canakkale Strait passage and dropped anchor at Karanlik liman anchorage. She sailed from anchorage the same day.
Vessel had technical failure at Novorossiysk, Russia. Departure permission temporarily cancelled by HM, until repairs. Crew carried out repairs and vessel sailed on 13 May for Ashdod, Israel.

Vessel suffered a technical failure during the transit of the Istanbul Strait, while en route from Izmail, Ukraine to Istanbul. A Coastal Safety tug was deployed to assist and towed her to the Büyükdere anchorage. Repairs were carried out by the crew.
