Vessel was NUC due to a leak in main engine, while underway in SW Lane Dover TSS, UK. Repairs were completed, restarted its engine and continued voyage to Port Said.

Vessel allided with pier due to adverse weather during mooring maneuvers at Iraklion port, Greece, causing its distortion and partial detachment. No injuries or pollution reported. Vessel sailed after class inspection.

Vessel suffered a collapse of the main engine steam valve on the boilers in the Strait of Dover. The Solent Coastguard monitored the passage and conducted welfare checks every two hours. Repairs to be carried out once open waters were reached.

Vessel collided with general cargo ship Pinheiro, in bad weather, strong winds, rain, currents at Sao Joaquim Terminal, Salvador, Brazil. No injuries, no major damages. Vessel withdrawn until the weather improves.

Vessel struck ferry pier ramp at Ternate port, western North Maluku, Indonesia, while maneuvering to dock, due to strong current and high speed of vessel. Ramp with one of the towers collapsed. Ferry was taken to anchorage. No injuries reported.
Vessel suffered engine failure at Praia, Cape Verde. Crew couldn't carry out repairs so tug VB Hispania towed the ship to Las Palmas.

Vessel had steering gear system failure at Cape Nara pt in Canakkale Strait, Turkey. She anchored in Sevketiye anchorage, supervised by tug Kurtarma 16. She sailed after repairs on 11 May for destination Taman.

Vessel has anchored without permission in the waters off Sekinchan. The captain and crew were taken to the Selangor MMEA Headquarters for further investigations. As of 13 May the vessel was at Singapore anchorage.
A Filipino crew member was crushed to death by a steel plate in engine room. Vessel called at Banda Aceh anchorage, to disembark body and resumed voyage from China to Ennore, India a few hours later

Vessel ran aground between islets Grande and Marambala, Itaguai, Brazil, while leaving Itaguai bound for Singapore. Extent of damages unknown, she might be breached as she developed starboard side list or it might be the result of tides. Still aground as of May 17, with at least 1 tug responding.

Vessel collided with fishing boat ELTONI-I, about 4 NM distance from Durres port, while en route from Durres, Albania to Bari, Italy. Fishing boat sank, but all crew were rescued. Authorities are investigating the incident.

Vessel collided with stern of berthed ferry Tyrving at Askvoll, while en route from Vaerlandet, Selje, Norway. She suffered minor damages but incident caused some delays in Nordfjord route. Tyrving sailed same day.

Stern of berthed vessel was in collision with Roll On Roll Off Nordfjord that was en route from Vaerlandet, Norway, at Askvoll. Minor damages were produced and incident caused some delays in Nordfjord route.

Vessel collided with a 34-ton Korean fishing vessel. The fishing vessel was seriously damaged but managed to get to her home port under own power. SWAN was allowed to continue voyage, bound for Nakhodka.
Vessel collided with a 39-ton fishing vessel. The fishing vessel remained under way and returned to home port under own power. SM NAVIGATOR also  continued voyage.

Vessel had rudder problems during East bound transit of Kiel Canal, in the switch Kudensee. Tug Luchs towed her to southern navy pilings in Brunsbuttel for repairs. She sailed on 11 May, bound for Vaasa.
Vessel was disabled due to a fouled propeller off Canso, NS, Canada. She was towed to Mulgrave by Canadian Coast Guard Ship Chignecto Bay.
Vesel had a rough docking at the Bouzas terminal in Vigo, due to gale force winds and had some stern damage during the approach manoeuvre. Blow had affected the platform of the stern fin.
Vessel ran aground on a sandbank off coast of Scheveningen near Kurhaus, Netherlands. KNRM lifeboat Kitty Roosmale Nepveu together with EH15 Gerrit Senior, refloated her the same day.
Vessel ran aground near Svinoya N of Rorvik, Norway. Nearby vessel helped to refloat. No pollution or injuries. After refloating she was taken in tow.
Vessel had engine failure during strait passage at Istinye point, Turkey. Tug Kurtarma-8 towed her to Pasabahce Bay anchorage.
Vessel reported having a cracked ballast tank while alongside in Swartz Bay, BC, Canada. Daily crossings were cancelled and divers were ordered for repairs.
Vessel was NUC due to cooling issue caused by water lines to scrubber, 44 NM SSW of Salcombe, UK. Crew carried out repairs and vessel continued passage on 8 May.
Vessel had electrical power failure, 1.7NM SW of Lizard Point, UK. Trawler Custos Deus towed her towards Zeebrugge, Belgium.
Vessel had issues with one of its main engines in Strait of Georgia, 5.90 NM S. Tsawwassen, USA, while towing barge M8003. Crew shortened tow line and awaited tug to hand over barge.
Vessel suffered engine failure 3 nm off South Korea coast north of Pohang, while en route from Donghae to Masan. She anchored and is waiting for weather improvement, to be taken on tow by tug.

Vessel ran aground on Santa Cruz islet, 3 nm off Zamboanga port, southwest Mindanao, Philippines, while en route from General Santos to Leyte. Extent of damages not yet reported. No injuries or leaks.

Vessel was struck by mega container ship EVER GLOBE on Western Scheldt in front of Bocht van Bath, Netherlands, while proceeding downstream towards sea, en route to Primorsk. They both suffered slight damages and anchored off Vlissingen in outer anchorage.

Vessel had technical failure of navigational system and Voyage Data Recorder unit at Novorossiysk, Russia. Departure was ancelled by Harbour Master until repairs. She sailed from Novorossiysk on 9 May.

Vessel had technical failure during Canakkale strait passage and anchored at Karanlik liman anchorage in Strait under supervision of strait pilot. Repairs were carried out by crew and vesel continued voyage the same day.
Vessel had engine issues while traveling upbound on Lac Saint-Pierre, 3.10NM SSW of Pointe de Yamachiche, QC, Canada. She proceeded to anchorage near Yamachiche for repairs.

Vessel contacted tanker KRITI EMERALD on Western Scheldt in front of Bocht van Bath, Netherlands. Damages were slight, one of the ships lost her gangway (EVER GLOBE, probably). Both were anchored off Vlissingen in outer anchorage, and while EVER GLOBE resumed voyage to Hamburg next morning, KRITI EMERALD was still at anchor. She was en route to Primorsk.
Fire broke out on cargo deck in Sunda Strait, shortly after ferry left Merak port, Java, bound for Bakauheni, Sumatra. Apparently a truck caught fire. Passengers are being evacuated.
Vessel had technical failure, sheltered and dropped anchor at Datca anchorage, Turkey. Repair were carried out by crew. She resumed voyage the next day.
Vessel was disabled and adrift after engine failure more than 2 miles from Ons Islands, Spain. Tug Maria Pita transferred her to tugs Perin and San Martin, which towed her and docked at port of Vigo.
Vessel ran aground in strong easterly winds upon arrival at Asko, Denmark.  She was refloated and towed to Bandholm.

Nagasaki Port pilot fell in water while boarding the vessel. He was rescued by DIAMOND PRINCESS rescue boat but has been decared dead 2 hours later. Vessel docked at Nagasaki and left same day bound for Yokohama.
Vessel touched bottom next to deep fairway to Jakobstad, Finland, after engine failure and drifting outside fairway. She sailed Jakobstad on 6 May for Kiel Canal.
Vessel was disabled and adrift in Bay of Bengal. MRCC Colombo requested vessels in vicinity to keep sharp lookout and report back.
Fire erupted in engine room in Singapore Strait, while en route from Singapore to Batam. Fire was extinguished by crew but was disabled. All passengers were transferred to ferry MERBAU ERA.

Vessel was vandalised in Nice, France during civil unrest. Garbage, paint and edibles like fruits and vegetables and projectiles, were hurled towards the vessel. Dents and damages to painting were possibly sustained.
Third engineer was injured on board vessel and had to be transferred to a private hospital in Athens, Greece for treatment. Investigation underway by Port Authority.
Vessel was disabled shortly after leaving Antwerp, Belgium, en route to Bremerhaven. She was taken to Flushing and berthed in outer port for investigations.
Vessel had engine failure at Cape Guzelyali point in Canakkale Strait, Turkey, en route from Djibouti to Odesa, Ukraine. Vessel shifted to Karanlik liman anchorage and sailed on 5 May.

The Chief Officer reported the vessel's Captain was found unconscious in his cabin. An official of the Port Authority and a doctor immediately went to the scene, who provided first aid, tbut he was pronounced dead. Vessel was denied departure until another captain on board.
A fire broke out while moored at the shipyard in Vladivostok. 10 people on board were evacuated safely. The fire brigade attended with nine vehicles and extinguished fire within 90 minutes.

Fire broke out on board vessel, which is being converted into a workboat, at Vagneset in the Sula municipality, Norway. Heavy smoke developed. Fire service responded and extinguished fire the same day. Damages unknown.
Vessel had engine failure off Alicante, Spain. Tug Sar Mesana towed her from incident place to Sagunto on 4 May.

A crew member suffered burns while using the ship’s incinerator, approximately 173 miles east of Morehead City, N.C. A helicopter crew arrived on scene, hoisted man and took him to Norfolk Sentara Hospital for further medical care.

A fire broke out in the living quarters of vessel. She was undergoing maintenance repairs at a shipyard in Aydıntepe Mahallesi in the Tuzla district of Istanbul. The fire was extinguished by the fire brigade.

Vessel collided with Engine Dinghy Ganga Sagar mid-sea near Madhuban in South Andaman. Ganga Sagar sank. The 2 people on board swam to Madhuban shore and were  rescued by CG Helicopter. FIR registered against vessel's Captain.
Vessel allided with pier several times while trying to moor at berth in Sassnitz city port, Germany. Hull and pier damaged. Master and deckhand were found under influence of alcohol.

Vessel ran aground at the port of Katakolon, Greece. She was leaving Piraeus during poor weather conditions when it became stuck in a muddy area. The ship was refloated with the assistance of a port tug and moored at the Katakolon anchorage. Sailing banned until inspection and a class maintenance certificate was presented.
Vessel ran aground at ferry landing, Lauvstad, Norway due to what appears as missed turn/approach. She suffered a small damage to propeller. She sailed to Vegsund Slip AS, Reitehaugen for repairs.
Vessel suffered fire in cargo hold at Langosteira harbor, La Coruna, Spain. Crew and port fire fighters extinguished fire in about one hour.
Vessel had engine issues and was disabled on Constance Bank, 3.20NM ESE William Head, BC, Canada. The crew resolved the problem while adrift and the vessel resumed voyage.

1600 UTC UPDATE: 25 crew were rescued by nearby ships, 3 crew are missing. No details on fire and its’ cause yet. Vessel earlier reported to be on fire in South China sea at Singapore outer anchorage.
Vessel made contact with the bank at bank houseand refloated on the same tide, at Bank House Staith, UK. No damages or injuries reported. She arrived in Goole the same day.
Vessel had engine trouble in English Channel. Fire fighting tug VB Panda and tug Union Jade towed her to Antwerp on 03 May.

A crew member suffered an accident on board 180nm north of Madeira, en route from Barcelona, Spain to Funchal, Madeira Island. He was airlifted to Madeira International Airport, where he was met by a Medical Rapid Intervention Team and by a fire ambulance.
Vessel had fire in cargo compartment during stay at shipyard at Tuzla, Turkey for routine maintenance. Damages and cause unknown. Vessel sailed on 28 May for Cartagena, Colombia.
Barges broke off their moorings and hit vessel at San Lorenzo anchorage, Parana river, Argentina. She sustained hull breach in portside fore area, at waterline level.
Vessel allided with light beacon while departing Yokohama, Japan. She had a minor damage to handrail in bow section and departed for next destination, the same day.
Vessel had technical failure en route from Iskenderun, Turkey to Galati, Romania. She anchored at Datca anchorage, Turkey same day. Crew carried out repairs and sailed from Datca on 2 May.
Vessel had an engine failure during passage through the Bosphorus strait and dropped anchor. Traffic was suspended.
Fire broke out in engine room in Gioia Tauro, Italy. No injuries or pollution reported. Port tugs and fire Brigade extinguished fire. Vessel was towed from Gioia Tauro to Tuzla.
Vessel suffered an engine failure and became disabled and adrift when south of Sri Lanka, while en route from Motril, Spain to Singapore. She was towed to Hambanthota port, Sri Lanka by tug Yewin.
Allided with the quay in the port of Ystad, Sweden, on 08 Jun 2024. Sustained damage which was being repaired. Expected to sail according to schedule on 09 Jun. Vessel underway on 09 Jun.
Vessel had technical failure during Istanbul Strait passage at Sariyer point in Strait. She anchored at Buyukdere anchorage. Repairs were carried out by crew and she sailed on 30 April.
Vessel had technical failure at Novorossiysk, Russia. Departure permission was temporarily cancelled by Harbour-Master until completion of repairs. She sailed on after repairs on 2 May.

Tanker PETITE SOEUR reportedly collided with MV HONG HAI 189, at around 2200 LT Apr 28 north of Corregidor island, Manila Bay. HONG HAI 189 capsized and sank, of 20 crew 16 were rescued, 1 found dead, 3 remain missing.
Vessel ran aground near buoy 245 in Lake Ontario of Cape Vincent, 1 NM SW of Tibbetts Point, New York, US. Vessel was cleared to proceed to Quebec to conduct further inspections.

Vessel suffered fire in engine room and ran aground near pier at St Margaret's Hope, Orkney Islands, north coast of Scotland. All passengers on board were safely evacuated. She suffered hull breach with minor water ingress, fire is understood to be extinguished

Tanker PETITE SOEUR reportedly collided with MV HONG HAI 189, at around 2200 LT Apr 28 north of Corregidor island, Manila Bay. HONG HAI 189 capsized and sank, of 20 crew 16 were rescued, 1 found dead, 3 remain missing.

UPDATE: Vessel was refloated on 9 May with the assistance of three tugs, then towed to the sheltered waters of Trachia off Chalkis, where it anchored safely, in order to start the inspection of its hull and welding works by a specialized diver. ATLANTA ran aground on northwest tip of Ag Theodoros islet, northwest Rhodes, Aegean sea, while en route from Nea Karvali, northern Greece, to Iskenderun. 14-Dec-2019 : Vessel experienced mechanical failure and anchored, off Ambelaki, Greece. Dragged its anchor due to adverse weather conditions and drifted towards the shore, 14 Dec 2019. Towed to Ambelaki port. Detained in port until repairs.

A pilot on board vessel needed medical assistance in the German Bight. A rescue helicopter from Northern Helicopter was flying nearby and hoisted the patient and transferred him to a clinic on the mainland.
Vessel had technical failure during Canakkale strait passage and dropped anchor at Karanlik liman anchorage, while en route from Nemrut Bay, Turkey to Novorossiysk, Russia. Crew carried out repairs.
Vessel had mechanical issue and her scheduled departure from Nassau, Bahamas was delayed until 30 April. Engineerig team worked to resolve issue overnight.

Vessel capesized after a collision with combined chemical and oil tanker Petite Soeur, off Corregidor Island, Philippines. She sank on 05 May, aboutt 400 yards from Sisiman Lighthouse in Mariveles, where it was towed.
Vessel had steering gear failure in Kola Bay, Russia. Tug Mikula was mobilised and took vessel in tow to port of Murmansk, where she was handed over to port tug for berthing alongside.
Vessel had technical failure, sheltered and dropped anchor at Bodrum anchorage, Turkey. Repairs were carried out by crew and she sailed from Bodrum anchorage on 4 May.

DIAMOND HIGH WAY caught fire again on Apr 28, at Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu, Philippines. She is considered a total loss since major fire in Jun 2019, in Philippines waters. Later wreck was towed to Cebu, probably for dismantling or sale as scrap, but in 2021 she was grounded by typhoon Odette, her status and condition, and future, unknown. 16-Jun-2019 : Vsl experienced fire near Reed Bank in the South China Sea, 16 Jun 2019. Vsl abandoned. On fire, as of 17 Jun.
Vessel suffered fire at Sassnitz port, Germany. Fire brigade but no fire was found when they arrived. Automatic fire extinguishing system in engine room was triggered.
Vessel colided with Yacht Idyllic, off Dapia near Spetson, Greece. Patrol boat found hull damage to both vessels. No pollution reported. Sailing was banned.
Vessel collided with bulk caried DEEP BLUE at Istanbul anchorage,Turkey. Inspection was made by crew. No injuries or pollution reported. Investigation file was opened and fine was imposed.

Vessel suffered engine failure off Diliskelesi, Marmara Sea, Turkey. Crew couldn't carry out repairs. Tug Yenikay X towed her to Hereke anchorage. After the vessel dropped anchor a detailed damage survey began.
An unknown number of perpetrators boarded anchored vessel at Callao anchorage, Peru. They tied up 2 duty crew, stole personal properties and fled.
Vessel collided with product tanker Lindos off Dapia near Spetson, Greece.. Patrol boat found hull damage on both vessels. No pollution reported. Sailing was banned.

Vessel was seized and detained by the Iranain navy authorities. Claims that she hit an Iranian boat in the area around the Strait and failed to stop. The seizure however was believed to be retaliation for the U.S. court action to seize an Iranian cargo aboard the tanker Suez Rajan. Update: Released in July 2024

Vessel collided with general cargo ship Chorumsky 19 at Istanbul anchorage, Turkey. Inspection was made by crew. No injuries or pollution reported. Investigation file was opened and a fine was imposed.
Smoke was detected in cargo hold and Waasland Emergency Service was alerted, Verrebroek Dock, Waasland harbour, Belgium. Fire was extinguished but the cause remains unknown.
Vessel reported 1 of the generators as not operational while moored at Horseshoe Bay Ferry Terminal in W Vancouver, BC, Canada. She remained moored while crew effected repairs.
Vessel had engine failure, sheltered and dropped anchor in pos 36 49 30N, 022 15 12E, Greece. Repairs couldn't be done by crew. Tug Hermes provided assistance and started towing to Piraeus.
Vessel dragged anchor due to having issues with its windlass preventing it from raising anchor while in Chatham Sound, anchorage No. 17, Prince Rupert, Canada. Crew carried out repairs.
Vessel was NUC due to leaking fuel pump 40NM, 207 degrees from Lizard Point, UK. Crew carried out repairs and voyage was resumed. No pollution reported. She arrived in Mobile on 18 May.

Vessel caught fire in Njarovik port, Iceland. 1 person died and 1 is seriously injured. Vessel was severely damaged and is most likely a total loss. Investigation will begin as soon as vessel is cooled enough to enter.
Vessel ran aground and suffered water ingress near East Headland Island on the Lake Ontario. The crew was evacuated from the vessel, while salvage operations were carried out. No pollution reported.

Vessel serving on the route between Langnas, Overo, Sottunga, Kokar & Galtby, Finland, allided with the quay, at Kokar in Gulf of Bothni. She suffered bow damage and was withdrawn from operation to carry out repairs.
Vessel ran aground off Aeroskobing, en route from Svendborg to Aeroskobing, Denmark. Tug refloated her and she sailed to Aeroskobing under own power. No injuries reported.
Vessel suffered mechanical breakdown east of Diaporia in the Saronic Gulf, Greece. Rescue ship Episkopi was deployed to assist. Repairs were carried out and vessel resumed voyage.
Vessel had fuel pump issue and required replacement of the suction valve, 18nm from Skerryvore Lighthouse, UK. Parts were available onboard so she resumed voyage the same day.
Crew on board anchored vessel noticed perpetrators boarded their vessel at Luanda inner anchorage, Angola. Alarm was raised, resulting in perpetrators fleeing vessel.

Vessel ran aground at Muskegon Lake entrance fairway, Great Lakes, the same place she ran aground a year earlier. She was refloated and safely reached Muskegon where she was berthed. No leaks or damages reported. The ship grounded on sandy bottom at position where depth should be safe.
Vessel caught fire at Shipyard Repair in Perama, on deck 5, Greece, during conversion works. Fire brigade extinguished fire with 3 vehicles. No injuries reported.
Vessel had engine failure South off Kriti Island, Greece. Repairs couldn't be carried by crew. Tug Chrsitos XXXIII provided assistance. Towage operations to Piraeus commenced.

Vessel collided with wind turbine at Godewind wind farm, NW of Norderney, Germany, North Sea, while en route from Poland to Merksem Belgium. Both vessel and wind turbine suffered damages. The ship called at Emden with breach in fore hull. Remains berthed as of 26 April.
Vessel suffered technical issues and had to cancel 4 sailings between Craignure and Oban,UK . She was back to service after sea trials, the same day.
Vessel lost all engine and electrical power due to fault with 24V control system. She drifted SE at 1.3 knots in pos 49 56 13.7N, 005 33 32.6W, UK. Defects were rectified and arrived in Greenock.
Vessel's cargo of container cranes had lashing failure/damage and called at the port Honolulu, United States. It was reported that the vessel departed Oita, Japan, but its destination is unknown.

A crew member was suffering from severe abdominal pain about 15 miles south of Port Fourchon, Louisiana. USCG helicopter hoisted the patient and transported him to University Medical Centre in New Orleans. He was last reported in stable condition.
Vessel had engine trouble, off Selje, Norway and was disabled. Tug Stadt Aardal was deployed from Alheim to assist vessel.
Vessel collided with ferry Maurice Maeterlinck, while sailing between Oostakker and Langerbrugge, Ghent-Terneuzen canal, Belgium. Repairs were carried out by crew and continued voyage same day.

Vessel lost an anchor and chain, between positions lat 51 23 00N, long 003 07 00E and lat 51 20 00N, long 003 06 00E, Belgium. She was berthed in Zeebrugge the same day and remained stationary as of 25 April.

Vessel had engine issues and anchored about 2NM from the Varne light vessel, en route from Rotterdam to Galveston, Gulf of Mexico, USA.  Repairs were completed a few hours later and she resumed voyage but had to anchor again within the Dover Traffic Separation Scheme, and had to change its exhaust gas recirculation valve. UK Coastguard issued the vessel with an intervention warning.
Vessel allided with the moored barge Scow GL6 while berthing in the Welland Canal, Ontario, Canada. Both vessels were repaired on site and cleared to continue their respective voyages.

Vessel had fire in engine room on Rhine near Rheinberg at river KM 801, at Orsoy near Eversael, Germany. Isolated hot spots were found and extinguished. Exhaust pipes insulation was alight. Vessel was towed to Duisburg-Rheinhausen.

Vessel had technical failure during Canakkale Strait passage and dropped anchor at Karanlik liman anchorage, en route from Chalkis, Greece to Diliskelesi, Turkey. Crew carried out repairs and sailed on 24 April.
Vessel had technical faultand was sidelined in in Lerwick for repairs. Pilot boat Knab took over service from Lerwick to Bressay, UK on 1st come 1st serve basis.
Vessel drifted aground at Shakhtersk, central western Sakhalin coast, Tatar Strait after her anchor dragged. No leaks were reported.

Vessel arrived for assessment of technical issue at Southampton, UK. Issue type was not disclosed but she was unable to sail. Sailings scheduled to New York on 30 April were cancelled due to delays in receiving proper replacement parts.
While trying to berth, vessel allided with wharf facility, in Kinuura Port, Japan. The facility sustained minor damage. No damages to the vessel reported.

Vessel hit an uncharted reef which pierced her forward ballast tanks on the starboard side at Misool island east coast, Raja Ampat Regency, Southwest Papua, Ceram sea, Indonesia, en route to China. She suffered water ingress but was contained to the ballast tanks. Divers are conducting underwater repairs. No injuries or pollution reported.
Vessel allided with oil platform off Hull, UK. No injuries. She suffered damages and headed, under own power, to Great Yarmouth for inspections
Vessel was stopped and dropped anchor due to engine trouble, while transiting the Sunk TSS, UK. Vessel was underway again and reached its destination on 21 April.

Vessel caught fire some 28 nm SE of Ulsan, Korea, Japan sea, en route from Busan to Russia. Ulsan Coast Guard responded and sent CG and SAR ships. Of 25 crew, 21 were rescued and 4 went missing. Vessel was towed to Ulsan while the search continues for the 4 crew members
Vessel made contact with pier with its starboard side forward, while berthing at Chios. She sustained crack in starboard side hull measuring 30x30Cm.No injuries or pollution reported.
Vessel had engine problems between Salvora Island and Cabo San Vicente, O Grove peninsula, Spain, and started drifting. Salvamar Sargadelos towed vessel to port of Ribeira.
Vessel collided with product tanker Splendour  while berthed at quay A, Louis, Mauritius. She suffered 8M railing bent inward. Splendour had dent and remained stationary.
Vessel had technical failure during Canakkale strait passage and anchored at Karanlik liman anchorage. Crew carried out repairs. Vessel sailed the same day.
Vessel was struck by bulk carrier Hake at quay A, Louis, Mauritius. She suffered dents from frame 102 to 105, above water line. She was anchored and stationary as of 27 April.
Vessel had issues with its starboard windlass at Anchorage 3 in Trincomali Channel, BC, Canada. Vessel anchored using port side anchor.
Vessel ran aground off Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, while approaching Ozamis, en route from Iligan. There were 85 passengers on board and have all been evacuated.
Vessel allided with a wharf, while departing Kobe Port, Japan. No damages or injuries reported, she departed the same day.
Vessel contacted and damaged three gantry cranes at Athabaskakai, Container Terminal Burchardkai (CTB), Hamburg, while berthing, on arrival from Rotterdam.

Vessel had engine malfunction in front of Gocuk Cape while transiting Canakkale Strait, Turkey. Tug KURTARMA 13 along was deployed to assist. Vessel moored at Karanlik Liman anchorage for repairs and sailed on the same day.
Vessel had fire in engine room while being repaired at PT dok, next to Jamrud Pier, Tanjung Perak Port, Surabaya, Indonesia. Tanjung Perak Port Police launched an investigation.

Vessel captain requested permission for an emergency stop at Phuket Deep Sea Port on Cape Panwa as a crew member was injured and needed medical assistance. He was medevaced and taken to the OrBorJor hospital in Phuket, Thailand.
Vessel had technical failure, sheltered and dropped anchor at Ayvalik anch, Turkey. Repairs were carried out by crew. She sailed on 26 April.
Vessel had a technical failure at the quay in Sandnessjoen. She had to be assisted out of the ferry berth with a tugboat and was sidelined.

Vessel had damages at port side hull while hard landing on a dolphin amidst strong easterly winds in Holyhead, UK. Breached at port side foreship above water line. No injuries reported. She sailed on 22 April.
Vessel had technical error and was sidelined in Bodo for repairs.

Vessel had blackout, lost power, drifted out of fairway and ran aground in shallow water at PBM Port Odesos, Varna, Bulgaria, during departure manoeuvre. She pulled out under own power and proceeded to inner anchorage.
Vessel reported restricted manoeuvrability due to water pump failure on 1 engine in the Irish Sea, alongside Holyhead Port. Waiting for tug assistance.

Tugboat MTUG Surigao Strait submerged while assisting vessel in its undocking manoeuvre, off Berth 1, Surigao Base Port, Surigao del Norte, Philippines. PCG rescued 4 crew members. Oil spill booms were placed as precaution.
Vessel had a technical failure, sheltered and dropped anchor at Anamur anchorage. Repair works were carried out by the crew. She sailed from anchorage on 23 April, bound for Kavkaz, Russia.

Vessel ran aground on a rocky bottom, north of Hvammstangi, northwest Iceland, while en route from Hvammstangi to Holmavík. Fore ballast tanks were breached with ensuing water ingress. Patrol ship FREYJA  is on the scene, divers will inspect ship’s bottom trying to refloat. No leaks reported.
Vessel had increase in temperature of inverter of its port main engine, en route from Igoumenitsa to Corfu. Malfunction of reducer-inverter system of port main engine was found.

Vessel had engine failure during East bound transit of Kiel Canal amidst switch Oldenbuttel, Germany. 2 tugs towed her to Rendsburg. She was then shifted to Voith Quay, Kiel for inspection and repairs.
A crew member was medevaced when the vessel was about 45nm from the island of Ushant, off Brest, western France. He was transferred to Cavale Blanche hospital in Brest.

Vessel ran aground off southeast Samar island coast, Guiuan, Philippines, due to stormy weather. She was en route from Emir Mining, Philippines to Caofeidian China. The ship ran onto reefs when trying to shelter. Reefs may have suffered damae or may have been destroyed. Salvage company was assigned but it requires partial offloading of cargo.

Vessel struck red navigational buoy No.2 at Noshiro harbor, northwest Honshu, while maneuvering to berth. Her propeller got entangled in buoy chain. Tug and patrol ship are nearby awaiting to tow her to berth after chain is cut off.
Vessel collided with SNS 133 Gema C in Port-La Nouvelle, France. SNS 133 Gema C damaged, vessel twisted railings. CAP CROISETTE had malfunction and accidentially diverted to berth of SAR boat.
Vessel had technical failure during Canakkale Strait passage and anchored in Karanlik liman anchorage under the supervision of Strait pilot. Crew carried out repairs and arrived in Tuzla on 19 April.
Vessel reported parting of towline while towing an equipment barge in Goletas Channel, 0.55NM WSW of Slave Island, BC, Canada. Crew carried out repairs and resumed voyage. No pollution reported.

Vessel had fire in engine room in Riau Archipelago waters, South China sea. According to track she was en route from Johor, Malaysia to unknown destination. It's been reported that there were casualties, 5 dead according to some sources or 1 dead and 2 missing according to others.

Syros Port Authority, Greece was informed of a crew member suffering a fatal injury on board vessel which was docked at a repair yard in Syros. The man was picked up by an ambulance and transferred to Syros General Hospital, but he was reported to have died during surgery. An investigation is being carried out by the port authority.
Vessel had engine failure at Gelibolu point in Canakkale Strait, Turkey. Crew couldn't repair and sailed to Sevketiye anchorage for repairs. She arrived in Constanta on 20 April.

Vessel had technical problems while serving route Sandvikvag-Halhjem, Norway. She was idle on water for several hours after the incident and reached Halhjem port around midnight. She remained stationary since.
Vessel capsized during mooring and rested starboard on pier and on bottom at Surat Thani port, Surat Thani Province, Thailand, Gulf of Siam. No injuries were reported.
Vessel had technical failure of navigation system together with pertinent equipment at Bartin, Turkey. Repairs were carried out by crew. Vessel sailed on 19 April.
Vessel had main engine breakdown minutes after departing Traena island, Nordland county, Norway. She was towed by tugs Bukkholmen and Boa Balder. Main engine repairs under consideration.
Vessel contacted general cargo ship POLA ALEXIA, while maneuvering to berth at Rostov-on-Don port, Russia, Azov sea. Both vessel sustained some damages but there were no leaks or injuries reported.
Vessel was struck by general cargo ship KAMILLA while berthed or anchored at Rostov-on-Don port, Russia, Azov sea. Both vessels sustained some damages. No injuries or leaks were reported.
Vessel ran aground in Rich Passage while en route from Bremerton to Seattle. Tugs and CG boats were deployed, probably waiting for high tide.

US Navy combat ship USS Cleveland collided with vessel during its launch into Menominee River, Fincantieri Marinette Marine, Marinette, Wisconsin, US. USS Cleveland suffered minor damages. No injuries reported. Investigation on.
Vessel suffered engine failure while navigating in Wellington Harbor, and had to drop anchor. 2 tugs were deployed and took her back to berth. The ship was heading to Napier.
Vessel suffered engine failure off Tobruk, Libya. Crew couldn't carry out repairs. AHTS Aigaion Pelagos and AHTS Aegis towed her and headed to Gulf of Lakonikos, Greece.
Vessel was denied to berth at Paradeep Port, Odisha, , north-west India, due to sand being exported to foreign countries without the knowledge of the administration.

Vessel struck and destroyed three pilings at Calais port, either while being engaged in dredging, or leaving port. She sustained serious damages including lost overboard suction pipe, which now presents a navigational obstacle. She was berthed and left Calais the next day.
Vessel collided with Algoma Mariner during manoeuvres to dock at Becancour, Canada, after a sudden gust of wind.
Vessel collided with Thamesborg during manoeuvres to dock at Becancour, Canada, after a sudden gust of wind. She sailed from Becancour on 18 April.

Vessel suffered fire south of Cape Point. All shipping traffic in the area had been alerted of the vessel ablaze to keep a lookout and to render assistance. Fishing vessel UMFONDINI rescued all crew from a lifereaft and safely transferred them onto NSRI Rescue craft DONNA NICHOLAS. No injuries or polution reported.

Vessel struck anchored inland cargo ship COSMINA 1, in front of Reni Port, Ukraine, Danube, arriving from Istanbul. She didn't sustain damages. COSMINA 1 sustained starboard hull breach with water ingress. Port tug pushed her to river bank shallows to avoid sinking.

Vessel allided with quay wall of N.lock in Kiel Holtenau chamber, end of E bound transit of waterway, Germany. Edge protection lock was torn off and concrete layer destroyed. Investigation was launched. She resumed voyage on 16 April.

Vessel had high temperature after fuel changeover and was NUC, en route from Suez to Ust-Luga, Russia, 36NM SE Lizard Point, UK. Repairs were don by crew and she resumed voyage. No pollution reported.

One of vessel's main engines required emergency repairs. She had to be taken out of service from Ronne, Denmark to Ystad, Sweden. The engine was taken apart for repairs. Vessel sailed Ronne on 20 April.

Vessel collided with pilot pontoon while entering northern lock, Kiel Canal, Germany for West bound canal transit. Installation was damaged beyond repair and vessel had deformations and scratches at bow above water line. No technical defects reported.
Vessel had a rudder problem and ran aground onto shallows, right after departing Yokkaichi Port, Japan. She was refloated with help from tug boat and arrived in Tomakomai, Japan on 20 April.
Vessel was removed from service, for safety reasons following a leak of gases from the exhaust system into the engine room.

RCC Alameda reported that vessel sent a distress signal from eastern N Pacific, in vicinity of pos 05 14 27N, 101 02 0W,Ecuador. Vessels in vicinity were requested to keep sharp lookout and assist if possible.
Vessel had a technical failure at Novorossiysk, Russia. Departure permission was cancelled by Harbour-Master. Repairs were carried out by crew and she sailed from Novorossiysk on 13 April.
Vessel reported a bottom contact, while  approaching Valleyfield dock, Canada. Proceeded to the nearest anchorage to assess damage. She continued voyage later that day.

Vessel had engine failure at edge of fairway in Randzelgat off Borkum, Germany. She was disabled and ran aground.Strong current pushed it in direction of adjacent sandbanks. The ship was refloated and towed to Eemshaven.
Vessel broke down and went adrift due to computer glitch. Engines restarted about half an hour after troubleshooting. She reached destination port at reduced speed.
Vessel was disabled due to main engine problem, while approaching Sault Ste, Marie Locks, US. Power was restored to engines and she was secured to Marie lock wall. Sailed on 13 April.

Vessel almost broke off mooring while berthed at Cherbourg France, sheltering from stormy weather. She was en route from Ireland to Hornfleur. Tugs were deployed and secured her at berth. There were some damages to starboard hull. Next day she headed to Tilbury, UK, instead of Hornfleur.
Vessel had a technical failure and anchored at Sinop anchorage, en route from Kavkaz, Russia to Karasu, Turkey. Crew carried out repairs.
Vessel's captain had heart attack symptoms, while vessel en route from New Orleans to Fort Lauderdale. He was airlifted and taken to a hospital in New Orleans. Vessel resumed voyage.
Vessel had engine failure at SE part of Lesvos Island, Greece. She was secured and towed to Yalova shipyard.Detailed damage survey was under progress.

Vessel, serving route Hundeidvika-Festoya, Norway, had technical problem and was removed from service for troubleshooting. Scheduled departure from Hundeidvika was operated by Roll On Roll Off Kvernes.
Vessel had engine failure and rudder breakdown at South Entrance of Istanbul Straight, Turkey. Crew couldn't repair. Tug Kurtarma 6 towed her to Istanbul anchorage.
Vessel had technical failure at southern entrance of Istanbul Straight, Turkey. Tug Kurtarma-2 attend. A tug was standing by as repairs were carried out by crew.

Vessel had technical failure of navigation system along with pertinent equipment at Zonguldak, Turkey. Departure permission was temporarily cancelled. Completed repairs and sailed from Zonguldak the next day.

Vessel ran aground in Great Bitter Lake, while en route from Gibraltar to Dhamra Port, India. Three tugs were deployed and managed to refloat her about 4 hours later. She resumed transit and was later anchored at southern anchorage in Suez port.

Three crew members were poisoned by hydrogen sulfide at Son Duong port, Vietnam, Gulf of Tonkin, while opening holds hatches, in preparation for cargo offloading. All three were hospitalized. One died, one is in coma, another one is stable. The ship arrived at Son Duong from Vancouver USA.
Vessel was NUC due to broken lube oil pipe, in pos 49 39 34N, 004 11 50W, UK. She was underway the same day and arrived in Terneuzen on 12 April.
Vessel collided with bollard on SB side, while mooring in Primorsky Territory, Russia, due to strong wind gusts. She suffered two holes in hull’s upper part. Repairs to complete in 1/2 days.
Vessel had port azipod thruster disabled due to fouled line on Lake Ontario, 21NM S. Cobourg, Canada. Using starboard azipod, she sailed to Burlington for repairs.
Heater caught fire in ventilation room in stern of vessel at Slavyansk Shipyard, Russia. Firefighters extinguished fire. No casualties or injuries. Area damaged by fire 40sqm.
Vessel had an engine failure at Trapani, Italy. The crew members were not able to carry out repairs. Tug Paul commenced towing it from Trapani bound for Valletta.
Bow mooring lines of vessel broke in Southampton port, UK, during storm with strong gusts of wind. Tugs assisted and vesse; was pushed back to Pier 47 of Ocean Cruise Terminal.
Vessel had problems with engine control system. Several sailings between Stornoway and Ullapool, UK were cancelled. Vessel was back in service on 12 April.
Vessel collided with part of pier at Port of Merak in Banten, Indonesia due to strong waves and huge winds. She failed to dock at pier and had to be assisted and evacuated from where it was.
Vessel went NUC, in pos 49 51 00N, 005 31 00W, UK. She engaged backup engines and travelled to Falmouth dry dock at very slow speed.
Vessel had technical failure at Novorossiysk, Russia. Repairs were carried out by crew and was permitted to depart after verification, on 11 April, bound for Tekirdag, Turkey.

A crew member was believed to have suffered  stroke in Solent, southern England. A life boat was deployed to evacuate the patient. He was transferred to Portsmouth Camber, where an ambulance was waiting.
Vessel suffered technical failure at Novorossiysk, Russia. Permission to depart was cancelled until repairs and State surveyor inspection.
Vessel was NUC 37nm S Salcombe, UK. One-hour updates to MRCC Falmouth and further investigation into fault, requested.

Vessel collided with tanker FORTUNE PACIFIC XLIX at oil terminal anchorage, Merak port, Java, Sunda Strait, while approaching oil terminal, arriving from Saudi Arabia. She suffered bow damages and was berthed at terminal on 12 April.
Vessel was NUC due to starboard engine defect and fuel filter system needing cleaning. She dropped anchor in pos 50 26 14N, 03 22 55W awaiting for spare parts. Sailed on 12 April after repairs.
Vessel collided with general cargo Lady Monique on approaching Emden, Germany. Rising tide caught stern and pushed its bow against Lady Monique. Both vessels suffered damages.

Vessel collided with tanker SINAR MALAHAYATI at oil terminal anchorage, Merak port, Java, Sunda Strait, while leaving port. She suffered superstructure damages in starboard area with bridge wing broken and dangling. As of 13 April she was still at anchor.
Vessel collided with general cargo Breb Trader that was approaching Emden, Germany. Rising tide caught stern and pushed its bow against Lady Monique. Both vessels suffered damages.

Fire broke out on board of vessel berthed at Tacoma, USA. All crew members were evacuated safely and residents in the neighbourhood were advised to stay indoors because thick smoke, probably toxic. Firefighting boats took fire under control.

RCC Guam reported that it had received distress signal from vessel in vicinity of pos lat 02 19 00N, long 157 41 00E. Vessels in vicinity were requested to keep sharp lookout, assist if possible and report to RCC Guam.
Vessel was NUC due to pump issues associated with engine, 32 NM NW of Point of Featherland, Shetland, UK.
Vessel had the starboard anchor windlass broken, while heaving up anchor in Chatham Sound, Canada. Crew carried out repairs. She arrived in Prince Rupert on 10 April.

Vessel lost control while transiting Kiel Canal, en route from Finland to Spain. She got stuck between Canal embankments, blocking all traffic. Approximately 3 hours later she was freed with the help of a tug but sailed in opposite direction, towards Kiel, probably because of damages.
Vessel had engine failure at Guzelyali point in the Canakkale Strait. She was shifted from incident place to Karanlik liman anchorage and safely anchored.

Vessel was NUC due to engine trouble, in pos 50 38 06N,  000 41 13E, IN TSS. She was required to stop main engine to repair a water-cooling leak. Repairs were completed and she continued voyage the same day.

Vessel was NUC due to piston No. 5 being damaged, in pos 50 19 54N, 000 35 33W, UK. It required to be replaced so she headed to Exmouth for repairs. Anchored in Torbay Anch effecting repairs as of 10 April.

Vessel suffered fire on lifeboats deck at Bastia, Corsica, during tests of new lifeboats equipment. Crew managed to extinguish fire before firefighters arrived. The ship left Bastia the same day, bound for Nice.

Fire broke out in garbage station in galley of vessel, en route from Kapellskar, Sweden to Mariehamn, Aland Isl. Fire was prevented from spreading to adjacent fan room. The ship berthed in Mariehamn on 8 April.
Vessel had technical failure, sheltered and dropped anchor at Datca anchorage, Turkey. Repairs were carried out by crew. She sailed on 13 April.
Vessel was NUC due to a leak in gearbox, approximately 29 miles south-east of Selsey Bill, UK. No pollutionreportes. No assistance required.

Vessel suffered an engine malfunction off the Türkeli Lighthouse at the entrance of the Bosphorus, while en route from Batumi, Georgia, to Port Said, Egypt. Tug Kurtarma 8 towed her to Büyükdere anchorage.
Vessel had engine failure off Sile in pos 41 13 03N,029 36 02E. Tug Dilburnu attended and towed her to Yalova shipyard, escorted by tug Mehmetcik.
Vessel had issues with its controllable pitch propeller, while preparing to lift anchor. Crew carried out repairs and continued its intended voyage.

Vessel collided with Negishi No.5 light beacon and broke it, while leaving Yokohama, Japan. The hull sustained slight damage but no problem with its navigation. The vessel sailed out from Yokohama after being interrogated.
Vessel collided with wharf no. 16 while departing from Port Colborne, Ontario, Canada. Vessel was cleared to proceed downbound after assessing minor damages to hull.

Vessel sank off Kumluca, Antalya Province, NW of Cyprus, while en route from Iskenderun Turkey to Izmail Ukraine. 5 crew members were rescued and 9 are still missing. Rescue operation is under way. Cause of accident unknown as of yet.

Vessel reported accidental loosening of port side anchor upon arrival in Las Palmas, Spain. Maneuver carried out to collect 13 shackles with help of experts. Docked safely in Santa Catalina. Sailed out same day.
Vessel was NUC due to small engine leak in pos 51 17 03.0N, 001 48 13.8E, UK. Crew did repairs and sailed same day bound for Bayonne. No pollution reported.

Multiple sailings were cancelled due to extended shipyard stay at Valletta, Malta. The exact issue was unclear. Reportedly, extensive engine work ongoing. She was expected to resume operations on 03 May.
Vessel ran aground in approach to Rost Port, Norway.Lifeboats refloated her as she leaned over to SB side. Entered port under own power. She berthed in Kvernhusvik Skipsverft for repairs on 10 April.

A crew member experienced severe abdominal pain about 60 miles south of Southwest Pass, Louisiana. The US Coast Guard medevaced the patient and transferred him to University Medical Centre in New Orleans. He is in stable condition.
Vessel had technical failure of emergency support systems at Novorossiysk, Russia. She sailed from Novorossiysk on 7 April, bound for Istanbul, Turkey.

Vessel collided with dock at Refa, Breivika/Tromso,Norway. It was assumed it happened due to fault with manoeuvring system.Quay and vessel had damages estimated to cost several millions. Repairs may take 4 weeks.

Vessel collided with moored Aframax tanker LYRIC MAGNOLIA in Suez Canal, in Great Bitter Lake waiting area, en route from Libya to an unknown destination. ALIGOTE was anchored near LYRIC MAGNOLIA. Both ships suffered superficial damages, but remained anchored. Canal traffic was suspended for some short time.

Vessel was struck by product tanker ALIGOTE in Suez Canal, in Great Bitter Lake waiting area. ALIGOTE was anchored near LYRIC MAGNOLIA. Both ships sustained superficial damages and both remained anchored. LYRIC MAGNOLIA is en route from Denmark to Saudi Arabia. Canal traffic was suspended for some short time.
Vessel was NUC and adrift with Injector No.2 needing repairs in English Channel. Repairs were carried out and continued voyage. She arrived in Paradip on 3 May.

Vessel was caught in rough weather, suffered massive water ingress and sank in Celebes sea in Sitaro Islands Regency waters, North Sulawesi. 5 days later FV MENTARI 888 found rubber boat with 9 crew members on board,  off Morotai island, North Maluku. 2 crew are missing.
Vessel had fire in engine room, steering gear station and pertinent spaces during stay at Tuzla shipyard, Turkey for routine maintenance. Fire brigade extinguished fire promptly.
Vessel struck chartered wreck while entering Thessaloniki port, and suffered portside hull crack. Vessel was berthed the same day, investigation underway.

Vessel had engine failure at South entrance of Canakkale Strait at cape Kumkale point, Turkey. She anchored at Karanlik liman anchorage. A fine was imposed and departure permission was cancelled till repairs. She sailed same day for Gemlik.
MRCC Singapore reported a distress signal was received from vessel in South China Sea. Vessels in vicinity were requested to keep sharp lookout, assist if possible and report to MRCC.
Vessel collided with mooring pin while approaching Nisiros, Greece due to adverse weather. Port loading platform arm was damaged. Port Authority was informed and got approval for single journey.
Vessel had engine trouble near Al-Kibrit at Great Bitter Lake in Suez Canal. She was towed by SCA tugs to Suez anchorage and resumed passage after repairs, same day.
Vessel had water ingress and sank in pos 43 35 00N, 03 45 00W, Spain. She was only located on 9 April. Fire fighting tug ALONSO DE CHAVES continued search for master.
Vessel ran aground due to steering gear trouble, in Randers Fjord, Denmark. She was refloated and continued voyage to Randers the sameday.
Vessel had engine cooling issues while proceeding downbound in St. Lawrence River, 1.70NM South of Ile aux Foins, QC, Canada. She anchored off Tracy for repairs.
Vessel had rudder problems during transit of Kiel Canal. She moored at dolphins in switch Duckerswisch, Germany. Other ships were advised to sail with caution.

Vessel struck anchored ferry LABITRA KARINA at Merak port anchorage, Java while leaving the anchorage. LABITRA KARINA hull was breached in several places with ensuing water ingress, but managed to run aground on coastline, to avoid sinking.

Vessel allided with berthed passenger/vehicle RoRo Fior di Levante at Kyllini port, Greece, due to being caught in strong winds. She suffered a minor dent. Both vessels remained at Kyllini, awaiting a class inspection.
Vessel has been detained for three days in Kocaeli, Turkey, until several minor deficiencies were rectified.
Vessel had technical failure at Bartin, Turkey. Departure permission was temporarily cancelled. Crew carried out repairs and vessel sailed next day, bound for Sochi, Russia.
Vessel had technical failure, sheltered and dropped anchor at Sinop anchorage, en route from Bandirma, Turkey to Temryuk, Russia. Crew carried out repairs.

Vessel was struck by passenger ship MABUHAY NUSANTARA at Merak port anchorage, Java, Sunda Strait. She suffered hull breach in several places with ensuing water ingress, managed to run aground on coastline, to avoid sinking. Crew were partly evacuated with some remaining on board to assist salvage operation.
Vessel was struck by passenger/vehicle RoRo Kefalonia while berthed at Kyllini port, Greece, due to being caught in strong winds. Both vessels remained at Kyllini, awaiting a class inspection.

UPDATE: 20.11.2023 - The local authorities have granted permission for the dismantling and removal of the vessel which will begin by the end of November, weather depending. Vessel ran aground on Turkish coast in Black sea, west of Sinop, while en route from Piraeus to Poti Georgia, due to rudder failure. A tug was deployed to assist.

Vessel was boarded by pirates and was discovered and rescued in the Gulf of Guinea after five days. The ship issued distrass signal which was picked up by chemical/oil products tanker Monjasa Sprinter. They alerted the IFC and Monrovia Regional MRCC. A navy patrol vessel was deployed and succesfully boarded the SUCCESS 9.

Vessel ran aground in Marghera Canal, Venice Lagoon, during departure towards Ashdod. She managed to free herself by own means half an hour later and was escorted by two tugs to outer Marghera Anchorage. No damages reported yet.
Vessel had engine failure at Baku, Azerbaijan. Tug Orlan was deployed to assist, as crew couldn't repair. She was towed to Tuzla Shipyard on 31 August for permanent repairs.
Vessel had engine cooling issues, while proceeding down-bound in St. Lawrence River, QC, Canada. Vessel anchored off Trois-Rivieres, QC, for repairs.
A crew member fell into water and died after trying to help pilot board vessel in rough weather conditions. SAR boats and helicopter were deployed but his body couldn't be found until next day.

Vessel interrupted her voyage from Korea to Singapore, and called Nha Trang anchorage, Vietnam, to transfer to hospital a crew member suffering from abdominal pain, headache and cough. The ship resumed voyage within hour and a half after reaching Nha Trang anchorage. The crew member was disembarked and was in stable condition.

Vessel had propeller entangled with ropes in waters of Milos, Greece resulting in malfunction of 1 of main engines. Subsequently, she collieded with anchored fishing vessel Kapetan Giannis causing damages. No injuried or pollution.
Steel cable attached to one of the lifeboats snapped during training and equipment test exercise. Vessel was moored off coast of Isle of Wight. She sailed to Dunkirk, France for repairs.
Vessel allided with lock gate of New Northern Lock of Kiel Canal, Brunsbuttel, Germany. She touched with SB side and had few scratches. Lock gate undamaged. Cause believed to be navigational error.
Vessel had failure of navigation system together with pertinent systems at Eregli, Turkey. Crew carried out repairs, vessel sailed from Eregli on 2 April, bound for Constanta, Romania.

Vessel lost at least 4 containers overboard in Bay of Biscay some 12 nm off Cape Busto, Spain en route from Bilbao to Vigo, being caught in rough weather. The ship was diverted to Gijon, probably to secure shifted container stacks.
Vessel had engine failure off Morocco coast, Atlantic Ocean. Crew couldn't carry out repairs. Tug Boka Sherpa towed her to Algeciras.

Vessel temporarily lost control while leaving the port of Santos and she nearly ran aground at the Southern bank of Estuario de Santos, opposite Ponta da Praia. She dropped anchor and four tugs pulled her back to the channel, and berthed at the Tecon Container Terminal. Traffic was delayed.
Vessel lost propulsion in the St. Clair River off Sarnia, 1.40NM NNE of Stag Island, Ontario, Canada. She dropped her anchors to avoid grounding.

Vessel was intercepted by officers of the Ministry of Fisheries in Port Louis, Mauritius after being alleged to have entered Mauritian territorial waters illegally. The ship captain is accused of not providing the required documentation 24 hours before arriving in Mauritian waters. He faces a fine of $20,000.
Vessel allided with anchored vessel off coast in pos 51 10 21.7N, 002 23 33E. Shipyard Padmos Machinefabriek in Stellendam, Netherlands, repaired bow damage of vessel. She sailed on 02 May.

Vessel collided with passenger/vehicle RoRo Lider Express while approaching Kartal anchorage, Turkey. Lider Express suffered damages and was taken to Tuzla anchorage area. Skymoon King was moored at Kartal.

Vessel was on fire shortly before arrival at Mgarr, after huge sound similar to explosion was heard, followed by plumes of thick smoke near coast of Ghajnsielem, Malta. 222 people on board rescued. Vessel towed to Valletta the same day.
Vessel had technical failure during Istanbul strait passage. She dropped anchor at Buyukdere anchorage, Turkey. Repairs were done, and departure permission was granted.
Vessel ran into an embankment at Konigsforde. She managed to refloat and berthed at Voith Quay, Kiel. She resumed voyage next day, bound for Zeebrugge.
A crew member died after falling over board in Westdorpe, Netherlands. The cause of the accident is unknown. Divers from the fire service recovered the victim's body.

Vessel had engine failure in pos 58 30 34.9N, 008 55 34.0E, Norway. Support vessel Ragni Berg assisted and kept her stable. Lifeboat Inge Steensland taken over tow. Vessel taken under control and towed to Arendal.

Vessel was struck by general cargo ship Skymoon King while waiting at the Kartal anchorage, Turkiye, en route from Izmit, to dock at the Dentaş Shipyard. Lider Express suffered damages and was taken from Kartal to the Tuzla anchorage area and berthed in Tuzla.
Vessel had technical failure at Eregli, Turkey. Departure permission was cancelled until repairs were carried out by crew. She left port and headed to Ismajil the next day.

Vessel had steering gear system failure and collided with yacht KAPTAN STAVROS. Both vessels suffered material damages so sailing was banned until seaworthiness certificate is issued. No injuries or pollution.

Vessel suffered fire while docked at Baluk Baluk island pier, as she was about to set sail bound for Jolo island, Sulu sea, Philippines. There were more 200 people on board, including crew. At least 5 passengers died, but majority of people managed to disembark. SAR undergoing, no reports on damages yet.
Vessel diverted from her course to Wellington and anchored in Marlborough Sounds, New Zealand, after minor technical glitch, due to rough weather.
Vessel lost steering gear operations about 4.4nm from the Southern breakwater of Dover, while en route from Rotterdam to Porsgrunn, Norway. Tug Eems Wrestler was deployed and towed her to Rotterdam.
Vessel had engine failure in Aspra Spitia, Greece. Tug Pantakrator towed iher to Tuzla shipyard area.

Vessel, sailing at low speed, collided with quay in Kleppen, Denmark. Flap hinges were bent, hydraulic hose ruptured and about 20L of oil leaked into water. She was to be taken to Thyboron for repairs. Ferry Veno Sund had to be put into use.
Vessel had technical failure, sheltered and dropped anchor at Edremit anchorage, Turkey, en route from Reni, Ukraine to Aqaba, Jordan. Crew carried out repairs.

Vessel collided with passenger ro/ro DIMITRIOS that had steering gear failure while arriving at Faneromeni Salaminas, Greece. Both vessels suffered material damage so sailing was banned until seaworthiness certificate was ssued. No injuries or pollution.
Bauna production, including from Patola field, shut-in in safe, controlled manner, due to loss of containment incident associated with high-pressure flare on vessel. Full inspection to be undertaken.
Vessel collided with lower approach wall of lock no. 3 in Beauharnois, QC, Canada, Vessel was secured in lock and inspected.

Vessel had fire in port shaft generator and port engine was out of service in pos 57 35 54N, 006 27 30W. She was berthed alongside in Uig and service suspended. Passengers and vehicles were discharged. No pollution reported.
Lifeboat crashed down into water during drill at Chittagong outer anchorage. Of 16 crew in lifeboat, 15 made it back on board, but 1 of them went missing. Vessel arrived at Chittagong from UAE.
Vessel had engine failure off Gokceada Island, Turkey. Tug KURTARMA-3 towed her to Canakkale strait.
Vessel had technical failure at Novorossiysk, Russia. Crew carried out repairs and vessel continued voyage to Bandirma, Turkey after state surveyor attended.
Vessel struck docked tug PETER and pier, while berthing at Harlingen Netherlands. Pier suffered damages but there are no reports on damages sustained by vessels.
Vessel had technical problems with maneuver stations at Lisbon and could not be unmoored. Departure was delayed until next day and she continued to port of destination, Praia da Vitoria, Portugal.

A crew member lost left leg in an accident on board as the vessel was leaving Buenos Aires. He was evacuated by helicopter and transferred to hospital. The ship was anchored at La Plata Anchorage and her next port of call is Montevideo.
Vessel collided with general cargo with container capacity Hagland Carrier, while moored at jetty in Harlingen, Netherlands. No injuries reported.
Vessel had technical failure, sheltered and dropped anchor at Sinop anchorage, Turkey. Repairs were carried out by the crew.

Fire broke out in forecastle compartments of vessel, off Ampenan, Lombok island, Lombok Strait, while she was going to anchor, on arrival from Surabaya, loaded with fuel. There were 17 crew members on board. 14 of them abandoned vessel and are safe, while the other 3, who were on forecastle, jumped into water and went missing. Tug and 2 rescue ships responded and engaged in firefighting and SAR.

Vessel suffered engine failure, went NUC and ran aground on Turneffe Atoll reefs, 8 nm due east of Belize City, Belize, Caribbean,  en route from Honduras to Fort Lauderdale, USA. She will be detained after refloating until assessment of reef damages is completed. No leaks were reported.
Vessel impacted field’s catenary anchor leg mooring buoy at Wassana in Gulf of Thailand, damaging certain offloading components during startup preparations. No injuries or leaks reported.
Vessel had technical failure of Voyage Data Recorder together with speed indicator unit at Novorossiysk, Russia. Departure was cancelled until repairs were carried out.

Vessel was NUC and adrift due to sea water ingress to stern tube and contaminated lube oil, 20NM west off Bardsey island, UK. Repairs were done and she resumed voyage to Greenock. No pollution reported.
Vessel was NUC due to alarm on lube oil reduction gear, about 10 NM  from Flamborough Head, UK, en route to Peterhead. Repairs were carried out and she continued voyage next day.
Vessel broke down after arriving in Guayaquil, Ecuador, according to Ministry of Transport and Public Works, Ecuador (MTOP). Last AIS from vessel was on 26 March.
Vessel had engine failure off Sile, Turkey. She drifted and anchored off Sile. Repairs were carried out by crew. Sailed on 27 March.
The sailings of vessel have been canceled for the day in order to complete its unscheduled corrective maintenance on right-angle drive.
Vessel had engine problems in Lochmaddy, UK  and was detained until repairs were done. Next day she was back in service towards Ullapool, apparently after repairs.
Vessel experienced engineering issue and was undergoing repairs in Wellington, New Zealand. Sailings resumed on 26 March.

Vessel struck pier while berthing at Puerto Plata port, Dominican Republic, on arrival from St. Rose, USA. She suffered large portside hull breach right above bulbous bow, while pier lost a big chunk of concrete.

Vessel contacted berthed bulk carrier DIVA while unmooring at Ust Luga port, Russia, bound for Tallinn. DIVA portside hull suffered large dent and most probably breach. MARCO also sustained some damages too, but no information yet. She was anchored at Ust Luga outer anchorage, for inspection and investigation.
Vessel  had engine failure in pos 49 55 42.0 N, 006 03 18.0W, UK and stopped outside TSS to change fuel filters. She docked at A&P Falmouth Ltd. Shipyard on 27 March. No pollution reported.

Vessel was struck by bulk carrier MARCO, while berthed at Ust Luga port, Russia. SHe suffered large dent, and possible breach, on portside hull, in cargo holds area. MARCO also suffered some damages but no official reports on it as of yet.
Vessel was NUC due to rudder defect which affected steering in pos. 49 27 02.0N, 06 44 21.0W, UK. Vessel was under tow and proceeding to Le Legue Harbour. MRCC Corsen monitored her progress.
Vessel suffered fire in the port of Boston, Massachusetts. Firefighters worked to extinguish the fire. There were no people on board.
Vessel had technical failure, sheltered and anchored at Sinop anchorage, Turkey. Repairs were carried out by the crew.

Fire broke out on board the decommissioned vessel at Hoeben Metaal at Oslo Quay in Kampen, Netherlands. Due to complexity of fire and the size of vessel it scaled up to major fire spreading on 3 decks. Fire brigade tried to extinguish.

Vessel went NUC after main reduction gear broke, about 80 NM W of Lerwick, UK. Repairs were completed on 27 Mar and tug ETV Ievoli Black escorted her to Minch. She arrived in Lorient, France for repairs on 28 March.

A diver who was doing underwater work in the Bay of Algeciras, suffered breathing difficulties and needed to be medevaced. He was taken to the port of Algeciras where he was transferred to the hospital.
Vessel dragged anchor in Western Channel off Come By Chance, NL, Canada. SB Bow stopper windlass was damaged. Crew repositioned vessel using port anchor.

Vessel had fire on board while in floating dock of shipyard for maintenance in Cuxhaven, Germany. Washing machine caught fire in foreship but taken under control in 30 mins. 1  person suffered smoke inhalation.

Vessel ran aground on northern coast of Rugholmen island, Norway, north of Trondheim. All people were evacuated, Captain and Chief Mate remained on board to assist in salvage. The ship was refloated was under way, on tow, bound for Rorvik. No damages reported.

A crew member suffered a seizure and died en route from Helsinki to Stockholm. Evacuation by helicopter was not possible due to dense fog. A rescue ship was sent by Finnish Coast Guard. Other crew members, medical personnel as well as passengers with a medical background participated in the efforts to save the man’s life. However, he died on board the ship.

Vessel was NUC and started drifting due to dirty water in cooling system in pos 50 46 09N,00 50 18E, UK. Cylinder head No.3 leaked water and was unrepairable. Tug EDT AEOLUS towed her to Uniport Terminal,Netherlands on 27 March.

Vessel had technical problems in final stages of scheduled maintenance at Lindoe Shipyard Fayard in Odense-Vigeroe, Denmark. She was towed to Hjortnes Terminal, Oslo, Norway on 26 March and sailed on 27 March.
Vessel was struck by motor hopper Liberty which was hit by cargo ship Gala A while manoeuvring in the port of Izmail on the Danube. The embankment of the Izmail sea station was also damaged.

Vessel was struck by cargo ship Gala A which was manoeuvring in the port of Izmail on the Danube. In turn, Liberty came in contact with dredger Pilgrim. The embankment of the Izmail sea station was also damaged.

Vessel collided with motor hopper Liberty, which in turn came in contact with dredger Pilgrim, while the Gala A was manoeuvring in the port of Izmail on the Danube. The embankment of the Izmail sea station was damaged.
Vessel had foreign object stuck in one of its Schottel jet propulsion units Sound of Mull, UK. She moored alongside in Tobermory Harbour and all passengers disembarked.

Vessel capsized in dry dock in Edinburgh Scotland, probably due to gusts of strong wind. She is resting starboard on dock’s wall at 45 degree angle and several people were injured. PETREL was undergoing refit or maintenance dry docking.

Vessel collided with fishing vessel in Gulf of Siam 33 nm NW of Koh Samui island, Thailand. Fishing vessel reportedly sank. 3 fishermen were rescued, one was recovered dead and another one is missing.
Vessel had failure of emergency system and fire detection units at Novorossiysk, Russia. Crew carried out repairs and vessel sailed on 24 March for Istanbul, Turkey.

Vessel damaged quay edge, in allision during mooring manoeuvre in Mukran, Germany, while under tow of tug SEA JULIETT. Bracket of fender was damaged. On 23 March she sailed under tow towards Swinoujscie.
Vessel collided with oil tanker in English Channel off Boulogne-sur-Mer, France. One of SB sheerlegs was bent and fishing gear damaged. Moored at Oostende where she unloaded catch.

Vessel was NUC after main engine injector needed changing in pos 50 31 38N, 00 07 12E, UK. She continued voyage after repairs but was NUC again due to injector failure and started drifting. Issues due to low quality fuel.

Vessel  was towing drill platform JB 119 which damaged quay edge, in allision during mooring maneuver in Mukran, Germany. Bracket of fender was damaged. Extent of damages unknown. Investigations ongoing.

Vessel suffered fire in engine room and went adrift, while approaching Leixoes port, Portugal, arriving from Sines. Tugs immediately responded and firefighters monitoring possible smoldering spots and cooling fire area. No injuries or leaks reported.
Vessel had propulsion loss and allided with upper approach wall in Saint-Lambert, QC, Canada. Crew secured vessel to lock wharf for inspection.

UPDATE: Vessel was refloated on 1 June and towed to an anchorage. Divers carried out additional damage surveys and underwater inspections. Temporary repair works were commenced from the holed bottom section. Vessel ran aground in the northern part of the Datca peninsula, Turkey. She was en route from Reni to Mersin. The ship remained stationary as of 27 March .
Vessel struck pier while berthing at Kaohsiung Port. She suffered hull cracks and berth was also damaged. The pilot on board was found to be intoxicated.
Vessel had technical problem and was withdrawn from service on route Eidsdal - Linge, Norway. Operator Framferries deployed replacement ferry. Vessel was sidelined in Eidsdal as of 20 March.
Vessel suffered an engine failure in Rotterdam. Crew tried to carry out repairs unsuccessfully. On 3 April tug Protug 75 towed her and headed to Tuzla shipyard.
Vessel was reported as being disabled with steering issues in Burrard Inlet, BC, Canada. Tugs moved her to anchorage the same day for repairs.

UPDATE: Vessel is expected to stay out of service after sand was found in seals of 2 rear thrusters during an out-of-water inspection. Vessel made bottom contact while approaching Leamington, ON, Canada. She was still able to maneuver but at reduced speed.
Vessel had  technical failure, sheltered and dropped anchor at Datca anchorage, Turkey. Repairs were carried out by the crew.
Vessel had engine failure off Bozcaada Island anchorage, Turkey. Tug Ocean Ergun commenced towing on 21 March, bound for Tuzla. Coastal Safety tug Kurtarma-3 provided escort service for the vessel.

Vessel collided with tanker KERALA at STS transfer area north of Amuay, Venezuela. Both vessels suffered slight or no damages. KERALA was allowed to continue voyage after inspection. BUENO is a sanctioned tanker trading in Venezuelan waters only.
Vessel had technical failure when automation system was to be updated, en route from Naantali to Turku, Finland. She did not return to service.

Vessel collided with tanker BUENO at STS transfer area north of Amuay, Venezuela. Both vessels suffered slight or no damages. KERALA was allowed to resume sailing after inspection and continued voyage in NE direction in the Caribbean, north of Aruba.
Vessel had technical failure and anchored at Sinop anchorage, Turkey. Repairs were carried out by crew. She sailed Sinop anchorage on 23 March, after repairs.
Vessel was beached at Alang, India, for breaking-up. The vessel had recently plied the South Asian routes.
Vessel was NUC and went adrift due to engine trouble in position lat 51 13 30.6N, long 001 47 19.8E, UK. Crew carried out repairs and resumed voyage same day. No pollution reported.
Vessel collided with quay during mooring manoeuvre at Platygiali port, Astakos, Greece. She suffered a few scratched and minor damages. No injuries or pollution reported.

Vessel collided with fish carrier Aqua Havsoy which was caught by strong winds of SE gale after leaving berth in port of Sandnessjoen, Norway. Both vessels suffered slight damages. No injuries reported.
Vessel had oil leakage from a steering tube seal while in the Bell Isl Tickle, Canada. The crews isolated issue and monitored the oil levels to ensure no further loss occurred.
Vessel had propulsion trouble off Haugesund, Norway. She was towed by another fishing vessel towards Rovaer, where NSSR lifeboat Kristian Gerhard Jebsen took over and towed her to Haugesund.

A crew member experienced stroke-like symptoms while vessel was 32 miles off Corpus Christi, Texas. A Coast Guard helicopter evacuated the patient and transferred him to awaiting emergency service personnel at a local hospital.
Vessel, escorted by tugs, had intermittent engine issue 0.45NM ENE Berry Point, Canada. Altered course to Anchorage "M" in Indian Arm, BC for analysis.

A crew member needed immediate hospital care, 38nm southsouthwest of Paleochora, Crete. A Greek Air Force helicopter picked up the patient and transported him to the University General Hospital of Heraklion, for medical treatment.
Vessel collided with ferry Folgefonn after being caught by strong winds of SE gale, in port of Sandnessjoen, Norway. Both vessels suffered slight damages. No injuries reported.
Vessel had technical failure while en route from Azov, Russia to Bandirma, Turkey. She dropped anchor at Sinop anchorage, Turkey and crew commenced repairs.
Vessel had engine problems and started taking on water, while fishing off Hvide Sande, Denmark. She then started drifting in gale force winds. SAR Emile Robin towed her to Hvide Sande.
Vessel had gear become entangled in the propeller, 7.5NM N of Cudillero, Spain and requested towing assistance. Salvamento Maritimo deployed a tug which towed her to Avilos port.
Vessel had fouled propeller causing engine failure while assisting disabled fishing vessel Atlantic Sea Clipper off Sambro Harbour, NS, Canada.
Vessel suffered engine room flooding during her stay at Lyttelton, New Zealand. Flood damaged electric switch board and the ship is operating on an auxiliary generator.

It was reported that vessel damaged a coral area situated between two protected nature reserves off the Mexican coast. The anchor was dropped and fell on top of many sponges, displacing the entire chain by several metres. As the ship moved it dragged the chain and began to break off several corals. The vessel was removed from the affected area and was currently stationed near Cozumel island.

An Italian crew member's family contacted vessel's captain to report he has not been in contact with them for a while. They were told the man was not responsive and was in what appeared to be a psychotic distress. He became violent towards other crew members and had to be mobilised to his bed and later transferred to a hospital in Italy. An investigation in under way.

Vessel had engine failure off FSM Bridge at Kanlica point in Bosphorus, Turkey. She was assisted by tugs and towed to Turkeli anchorage for troubleshooting. She continued voyage to Novorossiysk next day.
Vessel reportedly crashed into a reef and ran aground near Hari island in Southeast Sulawesi Province, Indonesia. She refloated by herself with own power and safely reached port Kendari same day.
Vessel ran aground on the Elizavetinskiy shoal in the Azov district. Rise in water level on the shoal allowed it to refloat and proceed to Azov, Russia, independently.

Vessel was disabled due to fouled propeller in Emerald Basin, 26.2 NM SSE of Stone Island, NS, Canada. She was assisted by FV SEAMAN'S TOY I and tug Atlantic Fir. CG vessel HARE BAY towed her to Halifax.
Vessel had to anchor in front of Vigo in Vigo Bay, Spain, on arrival from Charleston USA because of navigational system failure. As of 16 March she was still at anchor.
Vessel had to drop anchor at Sunk Anchorage, UK. She was required to change from diesel 0.1% to different fuel type as engine was not receiving fuel. Moored at Felixstowe, UK next day.

Water ingress occurred in engine room while in Gulf of Siam. There was an explosion which caused the death of a crew member. There are 400,000 barrels of oil on board so Navy and Ministry of Transport are to assist by all means possible to prevent and contain possible spill.
Gantry crane of Ashkelon coal terminal in Israel collapsed together with jetty section during squall and fell on the vessel funnel, causing structural damages. No injuries reported.

Vessel suffered generator damage and was removed from service between Rendsburg and Schacht-Audorf on Kiel Canal, Germany. She was berthed in Rendsburg for repairs. Defective units were removed for investigation.

Vessel was caught in strong winds, sustained damages and was sidelined in port of Poole, UK. Sailings of vessel between Jersey and France were cancelled. She sailed from Poole on 16 March and resumed service.
Vessel sank while en route from Vung Tau to Phu Quy island. There were 7 people on board, 5 were rescued and 2 remain missing. Rough weather is thought to be the cause of the disaster.
Vessel had technical failure of fire detection system together with alarm unit at Novorossiysk, Russia. Departure was cancelled until repairs were done by crew. Vessel sailed on 14 March.
Vessel caught fire on closed deck, in Oktyabrsky backwater, SE of the port of Nizhniy Novgorod, Russia. Fire was extinguished with the help of 21 firefighters and 9 appliances.

Vessel suffered a fire in the front hold while at the Bentinck Dock in King’s Lynn. The fire was extinguished by the crew and the fire brigade checked the area with thermal imaging cameras for remaining hot spots. The crew was advised to mount a 24-hour watch.
Vessel ran aground in Sao Francisco do Sul, Babitonga Bay, Brazil, shortly after she left port. Cause of grounding unknown, tugs working on her.
Vessel had engine issues in Boundary Pass, off Monarch Head, BC, Canada. She proceeded outside channel at reduced speed to investigate. Arrived and moored in Annacis Island on 13 March.
Vessel had main engine failure and was disabled in Barents Sea, Norway. Russian tug Mikula towed vessel to Murmansk. No injuries reported.

Fire broke out in the motor of a truck stored in car deck of vessel en route to Old City Port in Tallinn. Firefighting crew extinguished the fire. There were no damages to other vehicles and no passengers on car deck.

Vessel had engine failure at southern entrance of Canakkale Strait, Turkey. She anchored at Karanlik liman anchorage where crew carried put temporary repairs, She arrived in Tuzla shipyard on 12 March.
Vessel had motor problem with windlass and anchor stuck down at Sunk anchorage, UK. Repairs were carried out and ship heaved anchor same day. No pollution.

Vessel reported she was sinking due to hull water ingress, while en route from Can Tho to Quy Nhon. She was boarded by rescue team and brought to anchor 0.5 nm off coast of Binh Thuan Provines, north of Vung Tau.
Vessel, assisted by 2 tugs, was disabled due to engine failure while berthing in Roberts Bank, BC, Canada. No pollution reported.

Vessel had mechanical fault at Port of Ketapang in East Java, Indonesia. Her ramp broke in the middle, which caused truck loaded with flour to plunge into the sea. Shipping company provided crane to refloat truck. No injuries reported.
Vessel main engine failure while sailing at sea area of Milos Island, Greece. She arrived at low speed by its own means at Heraklion. No injuries or water pollution reported.

Vessel had technical failure during Canakkale Strait passage, en route from Izmail, Ukraine to Nemrut Bay, Turkey in a laden condition. She dropped anchor at Karanlik liman anchorage. Crew carried out repairs and continued voyage next day.
Vessel was disabled west of Vigo, Atlantic, while en route from Turkey to Netherlands. Salvament SAR tug DON INDA towed her to Vigo for repairs, as crew couldn't repair.
Vessel  had issue with fuel pump on main engine, about 15 NM East of Spurn Point, UK. Crew completed repairs and weighed anchor to resume passage. No pollution reported.
Vessel had engine failure during Canakkale Strait passage at Cape Kepez point, Turkey. She proceeded to Cape Kepez under own power, but supervised by tug. She resumed voyage next day.

Vessel suffered considerable damage to its deck when 1 of 2 rotorsail masts recently installed broken off and crashed, while berthed in Zeebrugge, Belgium. No injuries reported but loading and unloading was disrupted.

A crew member suffered a fracture to his right leg, about 90nm from the south Atlantic South Georgia Islands.
