Icebreaker ARA Almirante Irízar was tasked to provide health care but the medevac was delayed until the morning of 11 March due to poor light, adverse weather conditions and very low visibility. The patient was disembarked and transferred to a hospital in the city of Ushuaia.
Vessel had problems with propulsion system few NM north of atoll of Tahanea and started drifting. RPC Maroa was tasked to tow vessel to port of Papeete, which was expected to take a few days.

Vessel suffered a fire in its accommodation block and galley at a shipyard in Tuzla, where it was berthed for routine maintenance. The crew and local fire brigade managed to extinguish the blaze after three hours. H&M and P&I surveyors, along with class surveyors, were called to investigate the cause of the fire and the extent of the damage.
Vessel had propulsion failure at Barcelona, Spain. She headed to Genoa, Italy for repairs. Passenger ro/ro GNV Allegra replaced her.
Vessel was disabled and went adrift due to steering gear failure, in Bay of Bengal. Vessels in vicinity were advised to keep sharp lookout, assist if possible and report to MRCC Colombo.
Vessel had damage to its hull while anchored in the harbour at Sept-Iles, Quebec, Canada. Repairs were carried out and she sailed from Quebec on 12 April.
Landing craft Bato Twin 1 collided with vessel at Amlan in Negros Oriental, Philippines, due to strong wind and waves. Vessel had minor scratches to its bow. No injuries reported.
Vessel hit bulwark at high speed caused by low water when entering Vestero, Denmark. She had to be taken out of service due to hull damage. One of the rescue hatches was crooked, 7 were leaky.
Vessel had entangled rope around its propeller while fishing in pos 43 48 14N, 006 30 55W, and requested tow to port of Gijon, Spain. Salvamar Rigel and tug Alonso de Chaves were mobilised.
Vessel had main engine failure while assisting bulk carrier FEDERAL KIBUNE in Port-Alfred, Quebec, Canada. Incident was investigated.
Vessel reported mechanical issue related to her engine at Port Canaveral, USA. Crew carried out repairs.

Fire broke out on board vessel while moored in Duquesne basin of port of Dieppe, France. It was caused by sparks from grinder and was extinguished by workers before firefighters arrived. Damage was limited.

Vessel suffered fire in engine room off Salina island, Aeolian islands, Tyrrhenian sea, Italy. Fire was quickly extinguished by crew but vessel was disabled and started drifting. Assistance was sent to tow her to port. No injuries reported.
Vessel had engine failure after departing Devonport, Australia. Authorities briefly banned vessel from entering Tasmanian waters. Issue was resolved within 24 hours and ban was revoked.

Vessel collided with tanker Kadriye Ana at Istanbul anchorage, while en route from Haifa, Israel to Constanta, Romania. Both vessels sustained structural damage above the water line on their side shell plating. No injuries or pollution were reported.
Vessel had generator issue while alongside a wharf in Vancouver Harbor, 0.92NM SE of Brockton Point, British Columbia, Canada.
Vessel, escorted by icebreaker/supply VINCENT MASSEY, had engine and propeller issue while leaving Port Alfred, QC, Canada. Sailed downbound on Saguenay River, under escort at low speed.

Vessel collided with cargo ship Ocean Legend at Istanbul anchorage, while en route from Ambarli, Turkiye, to Derince, Turkiye. Both vessels sustained structural damage above the water line on their side shell plating. No injuries or pollution were reported.
Vessel was reportedly disabled with engine failure while berthing in Roberts Bank, BC, Canada. Crew solved issue while vessel drifted. Completed docking manoeuvre soon after repairs

Vessel ran aground on Punta Delgada access ramp due to low tide, stuck in pos 52 29 05.4S, 69 30 25.8W, Chile. Primera Angostura crossing was suspended. She was to be refloated once the water reached a suitable level.

Vessel  allided with pier at Karpathos, Greece. Cavity found on portside aft of hull. She was allowed to sail with passengers, vehicles after seaworthiness certificate and maintenance. No injuries or pollution reported.
Vessel  had engine failure while navigating via channel which separates Tenerife and Gran Canaria. Tug Punta Salinas towed her to Santa Cruz de Tenerife, Spain for inspection and repairs.
Vessel reported port side anchor malfunction, while en route from Turkey to Greece. No injuries or pollution reported. She sailed from Piraeus Anchorage on 7 March.

Vessel suffered breakdown while transiting Suez Canal in northern direction, en route from Malaysia to Portugal. She got stuck in Lake Timsah, Ismailiya, blocking the way for northbound caravan. She was refloated several hours later and resumed moving, transiting Canal.
Vessel a technical problem and had to be withdrawn from service between Helsingborg, Sweden and Helsingor. She was sidelined at North Harbour of Helsingborg.

Vessel developed heavy starboard list at Antalya anchorage, Turkey, after her cargo of timber shifted. All crew donned lifejackets, mustered in stern area, fearing the ship should capsize. She was towed and heading to port of Antalya.

Vessel had gearbox problems and had to be taken out of service from Wellington, NZ. She arrived in Picton for repairs on 19 March. No reports on when she will return to service due to complex gearbox failure.

Vessel suffered engine failure in Gibraltar Strait, shortly after leaving Algeciras, bound for Primorsk Russia, Baltic sea. She was disabled and started to drift. SAR tug LUZ DE MAR responded although crew managed to fix problem and re-start engine.

Vessel had engine failure at South Entrance of Istanbul Strait, Turkey. Tug Sark towed her to Tuzla anchorage. A fine was imposed and needed to pay salvage expense. Departure permission was cancelled temporarily. Investigation on.
Vessel collided with shore structure with its gangway while manoeuvring alongside in Port Moody, BC, WNW of Rocky Point, Canada.

Vessel ran aground early morning, in Buenos Aires approach channel while approaching Buenos Aires, en route from Montevideo. 2 tugs and a dredger helped to refloat. She was berthed at Buenos Aires later in the evening
Vessel had technical problems and was sidelined in Nesna for repairs. Its service on connection Nesna-Nesnaoyene, Norway was suspended. Ferry Legona carried out passenger transport from Vikholmen.

Vessel suffered fire in engine room in English Channel, while en route from Dover to Calais, with 94 passengers and 89 crew on board. Fire was quickly contained and lifeboats from Dover, Ramsgate and Dungeness responded, Later they were joined by French SAR tug ABEILLE NORMANDIE and port tug. Ferry was towed and positioned 6 nm west of Calais.
Vessel drifted off coast requesting entry to port of Klaipeda, according to Lithuanian Transport Minister, but it was denied entry. Vessel arrived in port of Kaliningrad, Russia on 5 March.

Vessel requested the medical evacuation of a crew member suffering of possible stroke,  60nm northeast of Las Palmas, Canary Islands, en route from Leixoes, Portugal, to Walvis Bay, Namibia. SAR helicopter Helimer 205 hoisted the patient and transferred him to Doctor Negrín Hospital.
Vessel had engine damage off Skardsoya, Norway. Salvage tug Somvaer 3 established towing connection in rough seas and towed her in Kristiansund for investigations and repairs.
Vessel was NUC due to an issue with a rail valve control unit and multiple alarms on No.2 engine, about 34 NM  from Spurn Point. Injector was replaced and vessel resumed voyage the same day.
Vessel reported missing porthole while proceeding on Browns Bank, Nova Scotia, Canada. Crew temporarily sealed opening. Arrived and moored next day at Shelburne port for repairs.
Vessel was NUC due to main engine failure, and was anchored about 5.1 NM from North Foreland. Repairs were completed the same day and she continued her voyage.
Vessel allided with Bergsoysund bridge, Tingvoll municipality, Nordmor en route from Rogne, Norway. Bridge suffered damages. Vessel taken to Ramsvika, Norway for inspection and repairs.

Vessel suffered engine fault in the Barents Sea, northern Russia, near Severny Island. Salvage vessel Spasatel Karev towed the icebreaker to the port of Arkhangelsk in challenging ice conditions, accompanied by another icebreaker.

Vessel was pounded by massive waves of cyclone "Judy" and pushed onto the shore of Honiara, Solomon Islands. The captain and crew members abandoned the vessel, which had experienced engine problems before.
Vessel had engine failure during Canakkale Strait passage, en route from Hereke, Turkey to Durres, Albania. Crew could not repair so vessel was towed to Karanlik liman anchorage same day.

Vessel collided with general cargo ship MISAKI MARU in front of Higashi-Ogishima port, Yokohama, Japan. Both ships were en route from Tokyo to Yokohama. She suffered portside stern breach above waterline but reached destination port under own power.

Vessel interrupted her voyage from China to Singapore and called Nha Trang anchorage, Vietnam, South China sea, to medevac an Ukrainian engineer, believing to suffer from heart attack. He was then disembarked into SAR boat, and transferred to Nha Trang hospital. MARAN THETIS resumed voyage.

Vessel colided with container ship HAI SU 6 in front of Higashi-Ogishima port, Yokohama, Japan. She sustained starboard side bow damages was anchored near collision site. Both ships were en route from Tokyo to Yokohama.

A crew member was evacuated by an SAR Sar helicopter escorted by Sasemar 102 plane while 183 miles from A Coruña, en route from Swinoujscie, Poland, to New Orleans, Lousiana, USA. He was transfered to the Alvedro airport in A Coruña for further treatment in hospital.

Vessel had problems with one of the main engines, while serving between Victoria and Port Angeles, USA. She was pulled from service and sidelined at Port Angeles Ferry Terminal for repairs to faulty turbo.
Vessel had engine failure at Ampelakia, Greece. Crew couldn’t repair. Tug BAS VIKING towed her to Yalova shipyard. During Canakkale strait passage, tug Turkeli escorted.
Vessel had oil leak issue which caused smoke in generator room while proceeding in Sydney, 0.75 NM NNW Edward, Nova Scotia, Canada. Vessel was secured alongside N Sydney.
Vessel had mechanical failure affecting navigation system at Wellington terminal, New Zealand, during routine checks. She resumed sailings on 4 March.

A crew member became unwell 40nm west of the Cíes Islands, en route from Vada, Italy to Rafnes, Norway. He was evacuated by helicopter Pesca 1 transferred to the Álvaro Cunqueiro hospital, Vigo, Spain, for medical treatment.
Vessel had steering failure on Elbe while approaching locks of Kiel Canal, Germany, and ran into embankment. She was refloated and berthed at navy pilings N. in Brunsbuttel. Sailed same day.
Vessel reported containers loss some 350 nm east of Bermuda due to rough weather, while en route from Boston to Caucedo, Dominican Republic.
Vessel had technical failure during Canakkale strait passage and dropped anchor at Karanlik liman anchorage. Repairs were carried out by crew.
Vessel dragged anchor at Anchorage No.4 in Prince Rupert Harbour,  0.54 NM ESE of Bacon Point, BC, Canada. A pilot was embarked to reposition vessel.
Vessel ran aground at Rystraumen in Tromso, Norway, at 5.5 knots after a blackout. Some port installations were damaged at Straumhella. She was towed to Tromso for inspections.
Vessel had loss of engine electrical power due to fuel starvation issue. Anchored about 19NM  from Spurn Point for repairs. Repairs were completed and she continued voyage the same day.
Vessel ran aground in Limfjord, Denmark. She was refloat oby own means but banned by Sofartsstyrelsen for investigations. She was released in short time and berthed in Thyboron next day.

Vessel had engine failure and damage to port main engine while in the area of Agios Efstatios, Greece, without Master assistance. She arrived at Lavrion by own means. Sailing was banned until engine repaired.

Vessel capsized and sank in Indian ocean south of Bali island, Indonesia, in stormy seas. There were 15 crew members on board. 4 were rescued, 1 was found dead, and 10 went missing, SAR still continues.
Vessel had rudder failure during westbound transit of Kiel Canal at canal KM-9, Germany. She ran aground shortly past Hochdonn road bridge. Berthed in Brunsbuttel.

Vessel responded to distress signals coming from product tanker PRINCESS EMPRESS off northeast coast of Mindoro island, Philippines. All crew members were rescued by EFES, while the tanker reportedly sank with 800 tons of oil on board.

Vessel  had technical failure of auxiliary engines together with emergency alarms at Novorossiysk, Russia. Repairs were completed and state surveyors re-attended vessel and verified final repair status.
FV Vibima got stuck underneath towing wire of vessel, which was pulling barge in Skagerrak N of Hirtshals, Denmark. FV came between tug and barge and sank.

UPDATE: Vessel was refloated on 1 March. Crew restarted engine and she arrived at Pier 5 in Cebu City the same evening, under its own power. The starboard propeller and the hull suffered minor damages. Vessel ran aground in the waters of the Danajon Bank in Talibon, Bohol while sailing from Surigao City to Cebu City. BRP Filipino Flojo and BRP Enrique Jurado were dispatched but were unable to come close to the ship because of low tide, so rescue operations finally started about 2 hours later.
Vessel suffered fire in engine room, at Port Colborne, Ontario, Canada. It was extinguished by fire fighting systems. She was undergoing maintenance repairs.
Vessel was disabled due to engine issues off Port-Cartier, QC, Canada. She was assisted by harbour tugs and was secured alongside and repairs were carried out.

Vessel suffered steering issues while towing a barge in the south arm of the Fraser River while approaching a wharf in Richmond, British Columbia, Canada. The barge overtook the tug and collided with its port quarter.
Vessel allided with briccole lagoon pole structures due to strong gust of wind in Marghera, Italy. No damages were reported. Port captain was alerted and arranged tech checks on vessel.

Vessel broke off mooring ropes in bad weather as she was about to leave the port of Durrës, Albania, for Ancona, Italy. The ship went adrift and allided with the jetty of the port. The port tug was called to assist. No injuries reported.
Vessel had engine failure in Atlantic Ocean. Tug Boka Sherpa towed her to port Algeciras, Spain on 22 March. Vessel remained stationary as of 28 March.
Vessel was unable to anchor and had unresponsive steering, in pos 50 43 17N, 000 12 54W, UK. Requested HMCG assistance for towing to port. No pollution reported.

Vessel had structural failure of cargo hold access ladder, side hatch coaming handrails and pertinent equipment at Hereke, Turkey, during cargo discharge operation. Repairs were carried out by stevedore duty team.
Vessel ran aground after anchor dragged in Prerow beach, new pier construction site, Germany. Salvage was complicated due to storm.

Vessel suffered water ingress about 260 miles west of Dingle. Pumps were provided by the nearby vessel Kings Bay. Later on fishing vessel Gunnar Langva and trawler Hargun transferred 3 more pumps on board. The ship headed to Killybegs to find more suitable pumps to pump out the remaining water and attempt to identify the source of the water ingress. The water level was reduced significantly and the situation was stabilised. As of 27 February vessel was approaching Killybegs.

Vessel suffered engine failure in South China sea north of Riau islands, while ballasting from Singapore to Ningbo China. The ship was adrift until 5 March, when SAR ship NAN HAI JIU 115 towed her to Hong Kong outer anchorage. As of 15 March she was still anchored.

Vessel suffered main-engine damage, 100nm west of Paphos, Cyprus, en route from Livorno, Italy to Beirut, Lebanon. She headed to Vassiliko, Grece, at a reduced speed and resumed its voyage to Beirut on 6 March assisted by the tug Apollon.

Vessel suffered methane gas leak on board while berthed at Korsakov port, Sakhalin, Russia since February 2022. Methane is leaking from faulty valve of 20-ton flexitank, stored on upper deck and surrounded by empty containers. All crew were evacuated and emergency services have been called but awaiting a specialised team and equipment.

Vessel was NUC and stopped 3.5nm from Gabeiras Island, Spain for filter change. SAR ship SAR Gavia remained on standby until crew had changed filters, started engine and moved away from coast. Vessel arrived in Tilbury on 27 February.
Vessel had boiler issues while proceeding westbound in St. Lawrence River off Sault-au-Cochon, QC, Canada. Problem resolved while underway.
Vessel had engine failure in northwest part off Pantelleria Island, Italy. Crew couldn't repair. Tug Christos XXXIV towed vessel to Turkey.
Vessel had issues with one of its thrusters in Discovery Passage, BC, Canada. She returned to Quathiaski Cove and tug was ordered to assist berthing. Had to unload cargo for repairs.
Vessel collided with general cargo ship with container capacity Maj Richard Winters, while breaking ice around vessel in Grande Anse, Quebec, Canada. No pollution reported.
Vessel had technical failure, sheltered and dropped anchor at Sinop anchorage, Turkey. Repairs were carried out by crew.
Vessel had technical failure of navigation together with faulty Voyage Data Recorder at Novorossiysk, Russia. Departure permission was temporarily cancelled. Crew carried out repairs.

UPDATE: Vessel was refloated hours later and was taken and anchored to eastern coast of Tilos. Vessel ran aground onto west coast of Tilos island, Greece, Aegean sea, while en route from Piraeus to Syria. Sister ship MED CORLU interrupted voyage and is approaching MED CERKEZKOY, Greek offshore tug was also deployed.
Vessel stopped due to engine trouble while transiting the Canal with the northbound convoy at 66 kilometres and was towed by S.C.A tugs to outer anchorage in Port Said, Egypt.
Vessel collided with Icebreaker Louis S.St-Laurent which was breaking ice around her, in Grande Anse, Quebec, Canada. No pollution reported.

Vessel ran aground when its bow lodged on mud bank side in river Nene, UK. She was refloated with assistance of tugs Fenlander and Conservator. No pollution or damages reported. She continued voyage under own power.
Vessel colided with an Asian vessel in waters outside Argentine jurisdiction in South Atlantic. No injuries were reported. She sailed to Montevideo, Uruguay for damage evaluation.
Vessel had engine issue while proceeding westbound in St. Lawrence River, QC, Canada. She was anchored off Lanoraie, where it had blackout due to running out of fuel. 2 tugs towed her to Contrecoeur.
Vessel was NUC due to high level of oil in main engine sump, while en route from Rotterdam, Netherlands to Barranquilla, Colombia. Repairs were carried out and she was under way 3 hours later.

UPDATE: Salvage operation was unsuccessful and vessel sank on the 1st of March at 253 meter depth. Vessel suffered hull breach starboard, in Hold 1 area, with ensuing mass water ingress at anchorage in Tatar Strait south of Vanino. Ferry SAKHALIN-8 rescued 21 crew members. They’re to be disembarked at Vanino. Reportedly breach was caused by ice. YONG XING 56 and other vessels in the area are drfting in ice floes waiting for icebreaker.
Vessel had sensor error on the battery system and had to cancel the sailings on route Seivika-Tommervag. She was sent to Kristiansund for repairs. Issue was resolved and vessel back in operation.
Vessel suffered an engine failure in the Sea of Japan.  A Japanese Coast Guard patrol vessel towed her to keep her from drifting. Later a rescue ship arrived at the site.

Vessel had technical problems with ramp, just before scheduled departure from Gothenburg, Sweden to Frederikshavn, Denmark. Ramp allided with quay, but was fixed vessel arrived in Frederikshavn on 25 February.
Vessel suffered damage to starboard side thruster while berthed in Bermuda. She unloaded cable on board the cargo m/v Thorco Legacy and headed to Charleston for repairs in drydock.

Vessel had main engine issue and returned to N Sydney, Canada. Repairs were carried out and she re-entered service on 24 February. Simmilar problem happened on 27 February and was taken out of service again until 2 March.
Vessel was struck by a general cargo vessel at Erlecom, on Waal, Netherlands. Her hull was breached and gas oil leaked. Vessel completed its repairs in Antwerp and berthed in Moerdijk on 19 March.

Vessel suffered fire in engine room, which spread to superstructure, in Gulf of Riga, Baltic sea, Latvia, en route from Klaipeda to Riga. Crew went into lifeboat and were later rescued by nearby cargo ship KAIRIT, and disembarked at Riga. The ship started drifting and 2 tugs and an SAR ship are by her side.
Vessel had a radar hitch, while on passage from Oban to Barra and was unable to sail. She came back into full service on 23 February after repair works of its broken gyro.

Vessel broke in two and sank at Novorossiysk anchorage. She had arrived at Anchorage on from Istanbul. There were 11 crew members on board, one died on board of rescue vessel and another one is in critical condition.
Vessel ran aground in Volga, Caspian Sea Channel, east of buoys NN 17, 15, near 170 kilometer mark while ballasting to Astrakhan or other Russian port. No damages were reported.
Vessel ran aground  in Volga, Caspian Sea Channel, east of buoys NN 17, 15, near 170 kilometer mark, while en route to Astrakhan, with cargo of salt and 5 vehicles. The ship suffered hull breach.
Vessel collided with fishing vessel Fatima, about 10NM off Bari, Italy. She sailed to destination Yeysk, Russia, while Fatima suffered damages and had to return to Bari.
Vessel allided with the bulk loading/discharging installation Buvika, Trondheim Fjord, Norway, en route to Aalesund. No pollution was reported.
Vessel was disabled when its trawl nets entangled in the propeller-steering group complex. Tug Atriya towed it safely to Vidyaevo bay and divers carried out work to remove nets.

Vessel collided with inland cargo ship CUNADO in front of Berendrecht Lock, right-bank docks of the Port of Antwerp, while leaving Antwerp bound for Zeebrugge. She reportedly suffered hull cracks about 10 meters long, and was anchored near collision site.

Two crew members were found dead in their cabins in Atlantic ocean, en route from Port Elizabeth SAR to Macapa, Brazil, Amazon river estuary. Cause of death is yet unknown. The ship anchored off Macapa on 26 February.

Vessel had engine failure during Istanbul strait passage at Uskudar point, Turkey. She was towed to Yenikapi anchorage and departure permission was cancelled untill repairs and sea worthiness certificate.
Vessel was taken out of service due to an undisclosed mechanical fault. She was sidelined at the Portsmouth Gunwharf for trouble shooting.
Vessel developed an engineering problem and needed repairs. She was taken out of service and remained sidelined in Wellington for the time being.

Vessel dragged her anchor in Bay of Gibraltar due to strong eastern winds, threatening nearby ships and in danger of probable grounding. Salvage ship MARIA ZAMBRANO responded, later joined by port tugs. AGNES was stabilized at initial anchorage site.

Vessel dragged her anchor in Bay of Gibraltar due to strong eastern wind, threatening nearby ships and in danger of probable grounding. Salvage ship MARIA ZAMBRANO responded, later joined by port tugs. MERCURY was taken to Gibraltar outer anchorage in Balearic sea.

A crew member who fell overboard in Belfast Harbour’s Victoria Terminal 3. He was recovered from the water and taken to hospital the same evening but later died. Police in Northern Ireland are investigating the death.
Vessel reported X band radar was inoperative 12NM East of Lochboisdale while entering The Minch, UK. S band still operational, no assistance required.
Vessel serving on route Hareid-Valderoy-Alesund, had to cancel departure from Alesund due to a technical problem and remained sidelined in port.

Vessel collided with passenger/vehicle RoRo Ariadne at Perama Port. The Perama Port Department of the Central Port Authority of Piraeus banned the ships from sailing until seaworthiness certificates provided.

Vessel collided with passenger/vehicle RoRo Rigel II at Perama Port, during mooring maneuvers in the Perama repair zone. The Perama Port Department of the Central Port Authority of Piraeus banned the ships from sailing until seaworthiness certificates were provided.

Vessel was taken off duty following technical issue with SB engine, after returning from its annual maintenance at the Cammell Laird in Birkenhead. She arrived in King George V dock in Glasgow for repairs on 22 February.
Vessel had technical issues and anchored in Westhinder anchorage, Belgium. Engine started losing cooling fluid. Repairs were completed on 19 February. No injuries or damages reported.

Vessel had steering gear system failure off north part of Heybeliada, Turkey. Passengers were transferred to attending ferry. Vessel was towed to ferry terminal, where crew and shore based technical teams carried out permanent repairs.

Vessel suffered mechanical fault at Marina Smir, Morocco, Gibraltar Strait and drifted onto breakwater. Not able to move further to sea due to rough weather. There were 9 crew on board, 8 were rescued and 1 went missing. The ship was en route from Uruguay to Lebanon.

Vessel had fire in engine room in Port Melbourne,Australia. AMSA detained vessel until seaworthy, investigation on. She was towed out as "dead ship" by anchor handling tug/supply POSH Commander on 14 May.
Vessel had engine failure off Algier, Algeria. General cargo ship Halim M her to Sousse Anchorage, Tunisia. Permanent repairs were commenced.
Vessel was NUC due to engine failure 18.6NM WSW of Hartland Point, UK. Repairs were done and vessel continued voyage the same day. No pollution reported.
Vessel ran aground on a shoal off Mawson Station, Antarctica. She was refloated in about one hour but suffered minor damages to ballast tank.

Vessel collided with bulk carrier Golden Amber, while maneuvering to depart from Port-Alfred, QC, Canada. Both vessels were cleared to continue their operations after inspection. No pollution was reported.
Vessel had fuel pump failure, in Brown Passage, British Columbia, Canada. Vessel proceeded to anchorage to carry out repairs. She sailed from Port Edward on 18 February.

Fire erupted on cargo deck near Vigo, Spain, en route from Antwerp to Italy. The ship interrupted voyage and called Vigo, although fire had been extinguished by crew activating fire fighting system. She resumed voyage the next day.

Vessel suffered fire in its battery compartment while alongside in Quathiaski Cove, BC, Canada. CG vessel CAPE KUPER and workboat CAMPBELL RIVER I went to assist and stood down as local fire department responded.

Vessel had engine failure in right main engine while sailing at Myrtoan sea, Greece. Sailed on own means and moored at Heraklion for repairs and class inspection. She sailed from Heraklion the same day.

Vessel ran aground near Asparukh bridge in channel connecting Varna Lake with Gulf of Varna, Bulgaria, Black sea, en route from Istanbul to Varna. She was refloated within one hour, transited channel and was anchored in Varna Lake. No damages were reported.
Vessel operating off Brixham, UK, had restricted manoeuvrability due to suspected cracked exhaust manifold on main engine, in English Channel. She was towed by FV Sam of Landram.

Vessel suffered a fire at a shipyard in Yalova, Turkey, during routine maintenance repairs. Local fire brigade teams attended the scene and the fire was extinguished after about five hours. No reports on the extent of damages and the cause of the fire.
Vessel ran aground at Banc Saint-Joseph, Quebec in St. Lawrence River, Canada. She was refloated at high tide and proceeded to wharf in Saint-Joseph-de-la-Rive. No pollution reported.
Vessel had technical failure during Canakkale strait passage, en route from Nemrut Bay to Diliskelesi, Turkey. She anchored at Karanlik liman anchorage for repairs.
Vessel issued disstress signals in vicinity position 02 00 36.0N, 104 25 12.0E, south China sea. Vessels in vicinity requested to keep sharp lookout, assist and report to MRCC Singapore.
Vessel had broken down on 2nd day in service off Wellington, NZL,with blown turbo charger. She was sidelined in Wellington.
Vessel allided with wharf while manoeuvring in Contrecoeur, Quebec, Canada, while under the conduct of two pilots and assisted by tug. The crew assessed the damages alongside.
Vessel had main engine breakdown in Papeete, French Polynesia. Owner transferred freight to ships Mareva Nui, Dory and Cobia as repairs could take as much as 4 weeks.
Vessel suffered control system fault and had to be taken out of service, suspending Troon freight operations, in UK. She was still stationary in Troon as of 2 March.
Vessel suffered engine failure, while transiting Bosphorus Strait en route to Izmail, Ukraine. Traffic Control tugs towed her to Buyukdere anchorage, Istanbul, and anchored.
Vessel reported a man fell over board 10nm off Punta de Gando, Gran Canaria. Crew of the Salvamar Nunki located the seafarer and rescued him. He was suffering from hypothermia.

Vessel was disabled in waters near Madura Island, East Java, Indonesia. Reportedly had electrical damage and water ingress. Indonesian Navy coordinated with shipping company to send a tug. Crew were evacuated.
Vessel suffered engine failure in Aegean sea off Leros island, Greece, while en route from Libya to Tuzla, Turkey. She was towed next day to Lakki Bay, Leros, where she was anchored.
Vessel got stuck on a sandbar, off Cristobal, near Panama coast for almost 24 hours. She left the scene next day and arrived in Cartagena, Colombia, on 17 February.
Vessel was disabled in English Channel north of Ushant, while en route from Rotterdam to Yalova Turkey. She was towed by SAR ship ABEILLE BOURBON and towed to Bay of Douarnenez, Brest.

Vessel allided with rock on bottom, when it was due to dock in Hov, Denmark. Several departures were canceled throughout afternoon. Danish Maritime Authority conducted bottom survey and sailing resumed next day.
Vessel suffered a fire while she was at a shipyard in Port Nelson, NZL for maintenance. Nelson station attended, additional crews called in to put out fire.

Vessel had engine failure in South entrance of Canakkale Strait at Kumkale point, Turkey. She drifted and emergency anchored to avoid grounding risk. Coastal Safety tug Turkeli attended. Crew carried out repairs at Tuzla shipyard.

Vessel allided with side wall of lock, then hit southern lock tail in foreport, while leaving new southern lock after transiting Kiel Canal westbound in Brunsbuttel. She was anchored in Twielenfleth roads.
Vessel drifted aground at Aktau, Kazakhstan, Caspian sea, after she was anchored at Aktau anchorage on 12 February. As of 16 February she was still aground.

Vessel went aground on rocks off Penzance and began taking on water, forcing its four crew members to call for help and abandon ship into liferaft. A RNLI lifeboat retrieved the crew from the inflatable liferaft.
Vessel had engine failure off A Coruna, Spain en route from Ridham, UK. Tug Ibaizabal Diez towed her and berthed at Calvo Sotelo Sur dock, A Coruna next day.
Vessel collided with FV Athithuthar 37NM off Colachel, India, en route from Lubuk Gaung, Indonesia to Mina Sultan Qaboos, Oman. 4 fishermen were injured.
Vessel made bottom contact and damaged one of its propellers in Baynes Channel, BC, Canada. She berthed at the Seaspan Vancouver Shipyards in Vancouver for repairs.
Fire broke out on board while at Paraiso inside Panama Canal, due to mechanical fault. Firefighters were called to tackle blaze. No injuries were reported and transit of vessels was not affected.
Vessel went NUC due to gasket on one cylinder broken from lube oil line, anchored in pos 51 11 42N, 001 41 48E, UK. Vessel sailed same day.
Vessel had technical failure, sheltered and anchored at Sinop anchorage, en route from Rostov-na-Donu, Russia to Aliaga, Turkey in a laden condition. Crew carried out repairs.
Vessel had engine failure SE of Cam Ranh in Khanh Hoa, Vietnam. Crew could not manoeuvre and were rescued by Indonesian Navy.

Vessel was struck by Canadian Coast Guard workboat C25946NL, known as CG 281, while attempting to come alongside on St. Pierre Bank, NL, Canada. She continued regular operations. No pollution reported.
Vessel had partial loss of power, in the Cook Strait and drifted at a speed of 1.8 knots, outside of the route into the Marlborough Sounds. She was quickly back to normal speed and continued voyage.

Vessel requested permission to berth in Almeria, Spain and carry out repairs on one of the engines. She docked with Captaincy and Port Authority permission. Sailed from Almeria on 16 February, towards Marsaxlokk, Malta.

A crew member fell overboard while the ship moored at the commercial dock of Ushuai in the far south of Argentina. Rescue swimmers from the Prefectural Rescue, Fire and Environmental Protection Station, Argentine Maritime Authority, went to the scene and managed to get the crew member, who had a life jacket on, to safety. He was taken by ambulance to a clinic.

Vessel was reportedly attacked by an Iranian drone when in the Arabian Sea, while en route from Singapore to Fujairah. The attack was claimed to have involved several Iranian ships. No AIS position had been recorded since 13 February.
Vessel suffered engine issues and was disabled, in Juan de Fuca Strait, BC, Canada. She anchored in Port Angeles, Washington, United States. No injuries reported.
Vessel collided with general cargo with container capacity Fuldaborg due to strong winds, while berthed at Alesund, Norway. She suffered small gash at hull. No injuries were reported.
Vessel had technical failure of navigation system with communication radio unit at Novorossiysk, Russia. State surveyors reattended after repairs.
Vessel got in trouble off Henningsvaer and sought emergency shelter in Lofoten, due to bad weather, while proceeding in the direction of Kirkenes.

Vessel sank in the waters of Kendawangan in West Kalimantan, Indonesia. Vessel was towing pontoon when it capsized due to bad weather conditions. 7 crew were recused and SAR oerations were ongoing for 2 missing crew.
Vessel went NUC due to leakage in puncture valve on main engine, 41NM off Lowestoft, UK. Repairs were completed in about 2 hours and she continued passage same day.

A fire broke out aboard the vessel in the Kokkari area of the Greek island of Samos, while unloading fuel. A patrol vessel, a lifeboat, two patrol vehicles and a team of the Samos Fire Service were mobilized and the fire was extinguished relatively quickly. Vessel was banned from sailing until repairs and seaworthiness certificate provided

Vessel had propulsion problems that limited the her speed and the itinerary had to be altered. Sailing from Fort Lauderdale was affected. Issues will be corrected before repositions to Alaska for the sail.

Vessel had problems with anchor and was unable to dock, while serving route Hatvik-Venjaneset, Norway. She drifted some distance outside quay at Venjanesetk. Tech issue was resolved and resumed service same day.
2 perpetrators were sighted boarding vessel using rope attached to hook, at Puerto Bolivar anchorage, Colombia. Alarm was raised and perpetrators aborted boarding.

Vessel ran aground in the waters of the Moro’o district in the West Nias Regency, Indonesia. She suffered a leak and was partially submerged due to strong waves. All crew members were safely rescued by the Indonesian Navy. An aerial survey showed some oil leaks which later extended to a radius of 70km. Local authorities and vessel owner to deal with pollution and inspect the condition of vessel.
Vessel, in strong winds, collided with berthed passenger ro/ro Gann at Alesund, Norway. She sailed from Alesund on 14 February.

Vessel ran aground and crashed into a mangrove forest in Merati Island waters, Riau, Indonesia. She experienced engine failure and went ashore. The ship managed to get out and sailed towards Selat Panjang.

Fire erupted in engine room, when vessel was approaching Fishguard port, UK, on arrival from Rosslare Ireland. She was assisted by two tugs and docked safely at Fishguard,where passengers were disembarked with no injures reported. Fire was extinguished after midnight, and was said to be serious.

Vessel reportedly sank at Sharjah Anchorage, UAE, Persian Gulf, after she left Dubai early on 10 February. She initially sailed in northern direction but changed direction and sailed towards Sharjah at reduced speed in the afternoon of the same day. No other details available at the moment.
Vessel had sustained damages to its starboard main engine at port of Zea, Greece, en route to ports of Aegina, Methana and Poros. Greek CG prohibited departure until engine was repaired.

Vessel collided with the barge Butun in the mouth of the Barito River in the territorial waters of the Province of South Kalimantan, Indonesia, while en route from Surabaya to Trisakti Port, Banjarmasin. She suffered damages to bow on the port side. No injuries were reported.

Vessel struck container ship WAN HAI 288 portside with her bow, inflicting heavy damages to WAN HAI 288 portside cargo deck area, in Long Tau river, Ho Chi Minh, while en route from Laem Chabang to Ho Chi Minh. WAN HAI 288 got stuck into river bank after collision. RESURGENCE resumed sailing and berthed at Ho Chi Minh container terminal.

Vessel had main engine failure in vicinity of Hibusong Island, Dinagat Island province, Philippine. Drifted 6NM NE of coast of Hibusong Island. PCG-NEM & CGS Dinagat rescued vessel on 12 February and tug Napocor towed her to Loreto anchorage.
Vessel dragged anchor at Anchorage 29 in Chatham Sound, British Columbia, Canada. She was repositioned by a pilot.
Vessel had engine issues while departing from wharf in North Vancouver, BC, Canada. She proceeded to closest anchorage for repairs and sailed on 13 February.

Vessel was struck portside by container ship RESURGENCE in Long Tau river, while en route from Ho Chi minh to Kaohsiung. WAN HAI 288 suffered heavy damages to portside cargo deck area and got stuck into river bank after collision.
Vessel took on water and capsized near Majuro, Marshall Islands. Hull was cracked. There were 22 people on board.

Vessel allided with a navigation aid structure at the ferry terminal in Campbell River, British Columbia while towing a barge. No pollution was reported. Tug proceeded to the Fife Sound, British Columbia.

A crew member sustained injuries in an accident in the engine room of the vessel. He was taken to a private hospital in Kocji for treatment as he suffered head injuries which needed stitches as well as injuries to his ribs and spine.
Vessel had engine issues while proceeding inbound in Haro Strait, BC, Canada. She turned around and headed to anchorage off Esquimalt for repairs. No pollution reported.
Vessel had technical failure, sheltered and dropped anchor at Datca, Turkey. Repairs were carried out by crew. Vessel sailed from Datca on 14 February.
Vessel had engine issue while proceeding outbound in Strait of Georgia, BC, Canada. She moved to anchorage in English Bay, BC, where tug on standby ordered.
Vessel was reported as NUC and adrift some 100 nm off Libyan coast en route from Valetta, Malta to Tuzla shipyard.
Vessel had technical problems while serving Nesna-Levang route, Norway. Sailings were cancelled and repairs of main engine were completed at Slipen in Sandnessjoen.

Vessel ran aground in Weser river, while en route from Bremen to Sunderland UK. Tug was deployed and stabilised her, as her bow got stuck in the river bank. BBC UTAH was refloated a few hours later and taken back to Bremen, where she remained berthed as of 10 February.

A crew member was medevaced by the port captaincy of Trapani after he complained of abdominal pains. The man was transferred ashore and taken to a hospital in Trapani for further treatment. Vessel was en route from Bejaia to Canakkale.
Vessel ran aground in Karimunjawa, Central Java, Indonesia. This caused damage to coral reefs and went under investigation. Vessel was allowed to sail from 10 February.
Vessel contacted bottom north of Rorvik, Norway, while en route from Mosjøen to Kristiansund with cargo of aluminum. The ship was inspected then she moved to Rorvik and was berthed there.
Vessel was disabled after having engine issues while proceeding east bound in Juan de Fuca Strait off Victoria, BC, Canada. She was anchored in Constance Bank for repairs.

Vessel ran aground near Egg Island off Spanish Wells, Eleuthera and lost generator power. Tug to assist once weather permits. The ship was refloated and was docked at Arawak Cay, Nassau on 12 February.
Vessel reported engine issues in St. Lawrence River off Sorel-Tracy, Quebec, Canada. Vessel proceeded to anchorage off Sorel, Quebec for repairs.
Vessel had technical failure during its Canakkale passage and dropped anchor at Karanlik liman anchorage. Crew carried out repairs.

Vessel had engine failure, drifted to shore at South entrance of Istanbul strait at Sarayburnu point. She was secured by attending tug and towed to Istanbul anchorage. Salvage expenses paid by agents.
Vessel was caught in extreme weather conditions en route from Vancouver to Mombasa. Salvage operation underway, vessel to be towed to Tokyo Bay.
Vessel was NUC after engine failure in Dover TSS, UK, en route to Casablanca, Morocco. Repairs were done within 30 minutes.
Vessel collided with Sheppey Crossing Bridge, UK. No pollution. Highways agency and Police assessing damages. Vessel sailed from Sheerness on 08 February and moored at Chatham.

Vessel was NUC following electrical fault with steering in pos 53 32 28.8N, 000 14 06E. Issue was rectified within minutes and had full usage of main and reserve steering. She arrived in King's Lynn next day.

Vessel had serious engine problems off Albany and headed to port for repairs after fears it could run aground. She entered Albany port on 12 February and sailed from port on 25 February bound for Adelaide.
Vessel had engine breakdown off northern Spain. She proceeded towards Carino port, escorted by Sertosa Ventiseis and Spanish tug SAR Gavia.

Vessel requested the medical evacuation of the cook after he lost his finger in an accident, while en route to A Coruña, Spain. A Sasemar 102 aircraft and the Helimer 211 helicopter were deployed and medevaced the victim 180 miles from shore and transferred him to Spanish mainland for treatment.
Vessel allided with side of pier at Port Merak in Cilegon, Indonesia, due to strong wind and current. Starboard bow came in collision with side ramp. She was back in service same day.
Vessel collided with general cargo ship PINHEIRO which was manoeuvring to dock, while leaving the terminal at Bom Despacho Terminal, on Itaparica Island, Brazil. No injuries or damages reported.
Vessel experienced technical failure, sheltered and anchored at Fethiye, Turkey. Repairs were carried out by crew and ailed from Fethiye on 8 February.

Vessel suffered an engine failure off the Istanbul anchorage, en route from Istanbul to Izmit. Crew couldn't repair and ship started drifting due to strong winds. A tug and a lifeboat were sent to assist and towed vessel to the inner port of Istanbul anchorage and moored there safely.

Vessel had technical failure of its navigation system along with chart and pertinent equipment at Novorossiysk, Russia. Departure permission was temporarily cancelled. Repairs were carried out by crew.

Captain of vessel presented symptoms of diziness and chest pain and was medevaced by USCG at Southwest Pass Anchorage, Louisiana. He was transported to a hospital in New Orleans. His condition was stable.

Vessel ran aground on Kotsuku islet, western Kyushu, Japan while en route from Sri Racha, Thailand to Yatsushiro port. She was refloated 3 hours later and safely reached Yatsushiro, where she was berthed
Vessel dragged anchor at Anchorage No. 27 in Chatham Sound, BC, Canada. A pilot embarked to reposition and hold anchorage position until vessel was ready to proceed to Ridley Island.

Vessel reported both engines failed in pos. 52 45 26.7N, 04 57 41.3W, UK. One engine was restored at low power and engineer had second engine online. RNLI lifeboat escorted her to Holyhead port for repairs.
Vessel ran aground at Sile, Istanbul, Black sea coast, reportedly while ballasting from Eregli to Ukraine. Crew is still on board waiting for tug and weather improvement.
Vessel was NUC due to engine trouble, but managed to steer at 206 degrees, in position lat 51 26 29N, long 001 57 07E, UK. Defect was rectified and continued voyage to Guayaquil, Ecuador same day.

Vessel's captain suffered a mild stroke while sailing in the anchorage area of Surigao City, en route from Davao City to Batangas City. He was medevaced by the Philippine Coast Guard and transported to hospital.
Vessel had an engine issue while approaching ferry wharf in Village Bay, British Columbia, Canada. She managed to complete manoeuvre without any assistance.
Vessel collided with general cargo ship Thebe, on Elbe, off Cuxhaven, Germany. She suffered damages to upper deck and was berthed at shipyard Cuxhaven.

Vessel was struck by passenger ship JAN CUX 2, on Elbe off Cuxhaven, Germany. She suffered dents and scratches at bow and dropped anchor off Cuxhaven. She was allowed to resume voyage and reach Sczcecin on 6 February.
Vessel suffered mechanical failure in Pagasitikos Gulf, Greece. Tug Odysseas towed her to pier no. 2 at Port of Volos, the same day. No injuries or polution reported.

Vessel ran aground at Pulau Karangjamuang while approaching Surabaya, on arrival from Novorossiysk, Russia. She was still aground as of 10 February with no signs of salvage. AIS status is not indicating any trouble.
6 crew members died at Lagos anchorage, Nigeria, while cleansing cargo tanks. They most probably died after inhaling toxic fumes in empty tanks.
Vessel collided with general cargo IGMA-KRAAN 5 as she moored at pilings in Ijmuiden, Netherlands. She broke off moorings and hit a crew member of general cargo vessel in chest.
Vessel had engine problems and was anchored for repairs on Scheldt River in Antwerpen, Belgium. Issues were resolved the same day.
Vessel was allowed to call at Naples, southern Italy, with 109 refugees on board, picked up in two rescues in the Mediterranean Sea.

Vessel suffered fire in engine room, in port of Brindisi, Italy. A team of firefighters and tanker truck intervened. Fire was extinguished and cause of fire was being investigated. No injuries reported.
Vessel came in contact with pilot boat and two dolphins when entering the foreport of the Brunsbuttel locks of Kiel Canal due to strong winds. No injuries were reported.

Vessel ran onto rocks at entrance to port of Gustavia in Saint-Barthelemy, St. Barthelemy. After several unsuccessful attempts at low tide, vessel was released on 4 February. She suffered slight damage to bulb. Investigation on.
Vessel suffered a fire while from Incheon Korea to Singapore. As of 6 February she was adrift  off Vung Tau with fire not under control yet. No reports on firefighting, no tugs or SAR ships nearby.
Vessel was NUC, anchored and stopped with engine problems in Dover Strait.Engine has stopped to change pipe. No pollution was reported. Engine was soon restarted and vessel continued voyage.
Propeller of vessel was fouled by an obstruction while berthing in Lochboisdale, UK. Divers attended to investigate. She was taken out of service.
Vessel broke off her moorings at Rio de Janeiro  when hit by strong winds. The ship quickly restored her moorings with help from tugs. No damages or injuries reported.

Vessel allided with pier upon departure from Ronne due to being caught by strong winds, en route from Bornholm, Denmark to Ystad, Sweden. No injuries were reported. Vessel turned back to harbour where it was being inspected.

Vessel reported damage to flange allowing water to ingress, rendering it unseaworthy,  while towing Newfoundland Lynx off Cape Bonavista, NL, Canada. Tow transferred tow to Aqviq and escorted to Bay Roberts by Ann Harvey.

Vessel suffered fire on board while at White Bay, Sydney. According to reports fire spread to 3 cabins and it was put out within one hour. No injuries were reported, and no other damages occured except the 3 cabins.

Vessel ran aground on breakwater of port upon its arrival to Aero, Denmark, in stormy weather conditions. Managed to refloat unassisted and berthed in port. Vessel suffered some damages. She had arrived from Rudkobing upon Langeland.

Vessel was NUC due to broken oil pipe which feeds main engine in pos 50 10 29N, 001 48 13W, UK. No pollution was reported. All nearby vessels were asked to keep 1nm clear. Repairs were completed and vessel continued voyage same day.

Vessel partially sank in 26 feet water, while mooring in Milwaukee port, US. 4K gallons of oil and fuel onboard but no pollution reported. Hard boom with absorbent material placed for prevention. Working to refloat.

Fire services in Hvalba, Faroe Islands were alerted to vessel, after crew discovered fire in engine room, during unloading of 12,5 tons halibut. Fire was taken under control. Cause and damages unknown.
Vessel allided with the wharf in Mizushima Port. No oil leakage or injuries were reported. As of 8 February the vessel was moored at Osaka, Japan.
Vessel suffered explosion on board,at Nosco ShipYard, Hai Phong, Vietnam. 8people have suffered injuries and burns and have been hospitalised.

Vessel collided with cargo ship Koei Maru in the Kurushima Strait in the Seto Inland Sea, Japan, near the western entrance to the strait. Cargo ship Seiryu sank. Search operation is underway, the ship's first officer is still missing. As of 6 February the body of the captain was found in the wheelhouse of the ship.

Vessel sustained damaged to its bow visor due to adverse weather. She was withdrawn from service between Svendborg and Aeroskobing, Denmark and headed from port of Aeroskobing to Soby Shipyard for repairs.
Vessel was in collision with SAR vessel Pachena Bay while manoeuvring in Port Hardy, British Columbia. As of 19 February the Roy Kristian was still at Port Hardy.
Vessel collided with cargo ship Seiryu, in the Kurushima Strait in the Seto Inland Sea, Japan, near the western entrance to the strait. Cargo ship Seiryu sank.
Vessel allided with dock at section B5 in Becancour, Quebec, Canada. Manoeuvre made with assistance of 2 tugs and damages assessed. She arrived in Trois-Rivieres on 6 February.
A crew member was caught between moving cargo hold folding hatch covers, and was squashed to death, at Kartal anchorage, Istanbul, Marmara sea.
Vessel was removed from service to and from Rhubodach on Isle of Bute, UK, due to ongoing issues with main drive coupling on main engine which needed to be repaired.
Vessel had technical failure en route from Azov, Russia to Mersin, Turkey. She sheltered and dropped anchor at Finike, Turkey. Crew carried out repairs.
Vessel was struck by ferry ROMANTIKA at Eemshaven, Netherlands, when the ferry broke off her moorings due to gale force winds. Both vessels sustained damages.

Vessel broke loose from moorings while berthed at Ems Quay in port of Emden, Germany, due to being caught up in strong storm gust. Tugs pushed it back to quay a short time later. Damages investigations is on.
Vessel allided with a bridge leading to a historical building, in Ondo Seto Strait, Japan. Bow of vessel was flooded. No injuries or oil spill reported.
Passenger ro/ro ROMANTIKA broke moorings at Eemshaven, Netherlands and pulled ALLIANTIE along. ALLIANTIE was berthed in Farmsun, Delfzijl on 2 February.

Vessel broke off her moorings at Eemshaven, Netherlands,due to gale-force winds. She drifted from quayside and contacted continuously, bunker barge, offshore supply tug SAPTOR and support vessel WINDEA JULES VERNE.. All vessels sustained damages, but ROMANTIKA was affected most.

Vessel suffered fire in forward cargo hold during welding works at Husumer Dock und repair GmbH & Co. KG in Husum, Germany. Fire spread to wood chips on board and paint containers. Fire extinguish is underway.

Vessel was caught in strong winds and broke off her moorings and started drifting to Jade shipping lines, at Wilhelmshaven container terminal. She was taken under control by tugs and taken back to berth.
Crane cable broke, hurling 24 tonne steel coil onto wharf at Kembla port, Australia, while vessel was unloading. AMSA stipulate cranes aren’t to be used until certified by authority.
Vessel reported a technical problem and had to be sidelined in Bodo, Norway. Vessel remained docked in Bodo as of 2 February.
Vessel was struck by ferry ROMANTIKA at Eemshaven, Netherlands, when the ferry broke off her moorings due to gale force winds. Both vessels sustained damages.

Vessel ran aground in Suez Canal at 125 kilometer mark, Little Bitter Lake, while transiting Canal in northern direction. She was refloated some 3 hours later with the help of tugs. The ship was anchored at Great Bitter Lake. No damages or leaks were reported.

Vessel had engine failure 2nm W. of 10M depth line of Heligoland Isl, Germany and went adrift in adverse weather. Tug NORDIC and support vessel NEUWERK assisted. The ship was towed by tugs and safely moored at Cuxhaven on 2 February.
Vessel suffered fire in superstructure, reportedly in service compartment, at Portland, USA. Fire was extinguished by firefighters. There are no reports of injuries or dramages.
Vessel ran aground in Singapore Strait halfway between Singapore and Riau islands, en route from Singapore to Yantian, China. As 1 February, she was in the same position, with tugs by her side.
JRCC Juneau received distress signal from vessel in Bering Sea . Vessels in vicinity were requested to assist if possible and report to JRCC Juneau.
Vessel was disabled due to fouled propeller in Labrador Sea off Nain, Newfoundland and Labrador, Canada. She was towed to St. Anthony by fishing vessel Newfoundland Victor.
Vessel collided with fully cellular containership Cape Kortia, while located at Rosadani Terminal quay, Panama. No injuries were reported and transit through waterway was not affected.

Vessel suffered fire in engine room, on approach to Balboa, Panama Canal sailing from Chile. Fire was extinguished by Panama city firefighters and the ship was taken and berther at Panama International Terminal PSA, Balboa. No injuries reported.
Vessel had mechanical issues and all sailings were cancelled. She returned to port for repairs. Passenger ro/ro A. P. T. James accommodated passenger.
Vessel had a technical fault and was taken out of service for repairs. Ferry Kvernes was trying to cover some of the demand on the Standal - Trandal route.
Vessel allided with the pier No. 3 of the Portoferraio port upon Elba, Italy, due to a technical failure that occurred during the mooring manoeuver. The bulb of the vessel was damaged.
Vessel had technical failure and had to drop anchor at Datca, Turkey. Repairs were carried out by the crew members and it remained in a stationary position, at the anchorage.
Vessel was taken out of operation in Port of Spain, Trinidad and Tobago due to damage to ramp which was non-functional and needed to be repaired.

Vessel was disabled because of engine failure in Okhotsk sea, being dangerously close to Kamchatka Peninsula western coast. Tug SPRAVEDLIVYJ towed her to Petropavlovsk, but the operation is being made difficult due to stormy weather and icy conditions.
Vessel had technical failure, sheltered and dropped anchor at Bodrum, Turkey. Repairs were being carried out by the crew.

Vessel had a technical failure at the southern entrance of Canakkale Strait, Dardanelles, Turkey. Repairs could not be done by crew and on 2 February she was towed by tug Ayaz Bey to Marmara Ereglisi. As of 4 February she was at anchor at Korfez anchoarge, between Izmit and Gebze, Turkey.

Vesel was reported as NUC in the Gata traffic lane between Cartagena and Gibraltar, while en route from Sète, France, to Hull, UK. All vessels in area were requested to keep a safe distance from the ship and keep a sharp lookout. Repairs were carried out and vessel continued voyage on 31 January.
Vessel lost her anchor on her way into Arsvagen, Norway. Trips between Mortavika and Arsvagen were cancelled. No damages reported. She moored in Sandnes on 30 January.
Vessel had thruster trouble in Arsvagen, Norway, due to winds more than 20 m/s from NE. She was withdrawn from service and sailed to Haugesund for repairs.
Vessel had maine engine failure and loss of power in Cook Strait, New Zealand. Power was restored after 2 hours. Vessel's engine cooling system was identified as fault.

Vessel had technical failure of propulsion systems together with emergency safety alarms at Novorossiysk, Russia. Repairs were carried out by crew and shore based technical support. She sailed from Novorossiysk on 30 January.

Vessel was NUC and repairs were required on main engine, 24.3NM from Selsey Bill, UK. NUC in English Channel for approximately 5 minutes to do repairs. The ship arrived at Iskenderun anchorage on 10 February.

Vessel collided with container ship SANTA LOUKIA in Bangkok approach fairway, near buoy 9, en route from Bangkok to Laem Chabang. WAN HAI 272 sustained portside damages in fore cargo deck area, and remained at collision site, probably grounded, or entangled with buoy, with 3 tugs working on her.

Vessel collided with container ship WAN HAI 272 in Bangkok approach fairway, near buoy 9. SANTA LOUKIA suffered cargo deck damages, but was able to continue voyage and arrived at destination port, Bangkok, same day.
Faulty gearbox was discovered during sea trials off Hyundai Mipo Dockyard in Ulsan, South Korea from. She will most probably not enter service in June as expected. Performance otherwise positive.
Vessel was NUC due to a broken high-pressure fuel line, approximately 38 NM North of Bann Shoul buoy. She continued voyage to Gravesend shortly after.
Vessel suffered technical issue with one of the engines and had to change scheduled itinerary for February. Royal Caribbean informed guests about revised departure timings.

Vessel was NUC following unknown electrical fault with main engine in pos 50 31 38N, 00 04 46W, UK, en route from Svetly, Russia to Greenore, Republic of Ireland. Repairs were carried out by crew and the ship continued voyage.

Vessel had damaged coupling on Ronne, Denmark – Ystad, Sweden service. 2 of 4 engines were put out of action and had to sail at half power. She was sidelined in Ronne and EXPRESS 2 was sent as replacement.

Vessel was in restricted manoeuvrability due to a fishing steel wire entangled around the port side anchor, in lat 57 11 52N, long 002 00 25W. Sea Cab assisted the vessel to clear the anchor of steel wire.
Vessel was disabled due to engine issues in Vancouver Harbour, BC, Canada. She was assisted by tug HS HOPE until the issue was resolved.

Vessel struck reef off Quang Ngai Province coast, central Vietnam, en route from My Thoi port to Hai Phong. She suffered hull breach with ensuing water ingress, was disabled and drifted ashore and grounded on the beach. No injuries reported, crew are all safe.
Vessel had engine failure during dock changing manoeuvres at Vigo, Spain and requested tug assistance. Tugs San Martin and Rada Primero assisted her back to Berth No.1, at Bouzas, Vigo same day.
Vessel got propeller fouled by its trawl off Svalbard, S Spitsbergen, Norway. She requested assistance from Norwegian CG. Tug KV Harstad towed her to Longyearbyen.
Vessel was disabled and adrift due to engine failure in vicinity of pos 08 30 17N, 108 05 59E, S China Sea.. Vessels in vicinity were requested to assist if possible and report to MRCC Vietnam.

Vessel broke down while leaving Southampton en route to Le Havre, in The Solent, in front of Fawley. Several tugs responded and escorted her back to Southampton some 5 hours later. Cause of breakdown unknown, although local sources suggest she may have ran aground.
Vessel had a mechanical issue with the ship's thruster, failure of its propulsion unit. All sailings between Campbell River and Quathiaski Cove (Quadra Island) were cancelled.
Vessel had technical failure of navigation systems together with safety alarms, at Tuapse, Russia. Repairs were carried out by crew together with help from shore based tech support.

Vessel reportedly contacted bottom and suffered rudder damage in Buefjorden between Askvoll and Solund in Vestland, Norway, while en route from Bergen to Ulsteinvik. CG patrol ship NOCGV SORTLAND towed her to nearest port with repair facilities.

Vessel ran aground during departure from Namsos, Norway. She was refloated, with a tug's assistance and re-berthed at Namsos same day. Damages unknown. Vessel continued voyage after about 2 hours. No pollution reported.

Vessel ran aground in Western Scheldt upstream from Terneuzen, en route from Antwerp to Lagos. She was refloated by Multraship tugs within an hour and was about to anchor at anchorage between Vlissingen and Terneuzen. No reports on damages or cause of grounding.
Vessel was NUC following high pressure oil pipe leakage, in pos lat 49 48 59N, long 004 27 41W, UK, en route from Stanlow to Antwerpen, Belgium. She was repaired and underway.

Vessel broke free when was moved by ropes and allided with four other vessels in Teignmouth Harbour, UK arriving from Le Legue. One 18ft vessel was reported to have sunk and the other three and their moorings were damaged. No injuries were reported.

Vessel had technical failure off Fethiye, Turkey. She sheltered and dropped anchor at Fethiye anchorage same day. Repairs were carried out  by crew. She was still stationary at Fethiye anchorage, as of 5 February.

Vessel sank in East China sea some 75 nm south of Jeju island, Korea, while en route from Vanimo PNG to Incheon, Korea. Korean and Japanese Coast Guard joined forces in search and rescue. 2 out of 22 crew were rescued, the rest are missing, as they abandoned the ship in rough weather.

Vessel suffered a fire on board, while docked in Cartagena, Spain. Firefighters from Cartagena City Council and SAR ship Clara Campoamor were alerted and fire was extinguished. The ship sailed on 26 January for Bilbao.

A crew member was medevaced in Cold Bay, near Dutch Harbor due to an injury to his right hand. An MH-60 Jayhawk helicopter aircrew hoisted the man and transported him to Cold Bay for a wing-to-wing transfer with LifeMed Alaska personnel.

It was reported that vessel was hit by a missile while at Kherson port anchorage, Dnieper river, Ukraine. According to reports citing the ship’s Maste, her bridge was burned out. The Tuzla has been anchored at Kherson since February 24th 2022.

Vessel collided with combined chemical and oil tanker Etsuzan Maru No.3 while anchored in neighbourhood in Mizushima Port, Japan due to being pushed away by strong winds. Extent of damage to hulls unknown.
Vessel ran aground in the port of Kholmsk, Russia. A tug approached to assist and she was quickly re-floated. The re-floating operation took not more than 20 mins. Cause of grounding unknown.

Vessel capsized and sank during cargo operations at Asaloyeh port, Iran. A few containers fell overboard and are floating in harbor. All crew are safe, no injuries reported.  The ship is resting portside on bottom, alongside pier.
Vessel reported water ingress while leaving port of Vanino. She immediately returned to port. Sakhalin Transport Prosecutor's Office is checking compliance with navigation safety legislation.

Vessel had engine problems outside Obrestad, Jaeren, Norway. She dropped anchor to stop drifting. Norwegian CG deployed KV Sortland and escorted it to quay at Husoy, Karmoy, Haugesund where she was safely berthed.
Vessel had broken stabiliser in Fortune Bay, Canada. Standby safety vessel W.G. George assisted to secure stabiliser to vessel's side. She sailed to Fortune for repairs.
Vessel had technical failure during passage at Sariyer point. She anchored at Buyukdere under supervision of pilot. Repairs were carried out by crew and vessel continued voyage next day.

Vessel was damaged following Russian shelling of Kherson. The bridge of the vessel was damage when shrapnel hit. She was stranded in the port of Kherson, Ukraine, for about a year due to the Russia-Ukraine war.

Vessel had engine issues when pitch increased above 50% revolutions drop, in lat 53 25 36N, long 000 33 42E, UK and had to drop anchor. Engine issue was fixed and vessel underway to destination using own engines. She arrived in Moerdijk same day.
Vessel requested the medevac of a sick crew member in the Strait of Singapore, en route from Deason-Seosan to Singapore. The man was safely taken off for further medical treatment ashore.
Vessel collided with general cargo Shosen Maru No.8, anchored in neighborhood in Mizushima Port, Japan, as it was pushed away by strong wind. Extent of damages to hulls are unknown.
Vessel was NUC for about 15 mins due to undisclosed engine defect, in pos 50 11 59N, 001 50 19W, UK,. Defect was rectified and the vessel proceeded to Port Bury.
Vessel en route to Alesund, Norway, had minor fire with subsequent engine shutdown outside Nyksund in Vesteralen. Norwegian CG's vessel KV Barentshav towed her to quay in Loedingen.

Vessel was disabled and drifted aground between Ishigaki Island and Kohama Island, Okinawa Prefecture waters while en route from Indonesia to Yokkaichi Japan. All crew were airlifted by Japanese Coast Guard helicopter.

Vessel reported water ingress in engine room, at Hay Point Anchorage, Australia, Coral sea. Hay Point tugs responded and are nearby. A team of technicians was brought on board and have taken the situation under control. Cause of water ingress is yet unknown.
Vessel experienced technical problems and was sidelined in Lyngseidet, Norway for repairs. Passenger ro/ro Lauvstad was sent as a replacement for the time being.
Vessel had technical failure, sheltered and anchored at Sinop anchorage. Repairs were carried out by crew. She sailed on 25 January.
Vessel was reported to have run aground whilst navigating the Nakskov Fjord, Denmark. As of 26 January the vessel was underway again, travelling from Kaksov, Denmark to Gdansk, Poland.

Vessel, serving between Stockholm and Vaxholm, ran aground off Sandhamn, Sweden. Patrol boat, tugs arrived on scene and managed to refloat next day. The ship was taken to shipyard in Vaxholm for inspection and repairs.

A crew member needed to be medevaced from off the coast of Kerry, Ireland. A Shannon-based helicopter was deployed for the operation but it had to stand down due to unfavourable weather conditions. The ship eventually docked in Dingle where the patient was taken to University Hospital Kerry by ambulance.

The Indian Coast Guard was notified that a crew member suffered injuries to his abdomen on board the vessel, near Sagar Island. His condition was critical and he was airlifted to a private hospital in Bhubaneswar.

Vessel suffered structural damages to its starboard portable water tank at the wharf of the Bedford Institute of Oceanography in the Bedford Basin in Halifax, Nova Scotia, Canada. Inspections and repairs have started.
Vessel had engine blackout 30NM NW Hirtshals, Denmark. She requested assistance and was safely pulled back to Hirtshals by the lifeboat. Sailed same day towards Thyboroen.

Vessel had technical failure during Canakkale strait passage and dropped anchor at Karanlik liman anchorage, Turkey, under supervision of strait pilot. Repairs were carried out by crew. Remained stationary at anchorage.
Vessel went NUC due to leakage of main fuel line and pressure pump, in position lat 50 17 37N, long 001 51 19W, UK. Completed repairs and underway using own engine the same day.

It's been reported that vessel collided with tug MARK E. KEUBLER in Corpus Christi Channel. Channel traffice was not affected. Vessel proceeded to Moda Ingleside Crude Export Terminal, Ingleside, where she was berthed. Tug suffered hull breach and water ingress.

Vessel under towage of barge, had steering gear system failure during Istanbul St. passage and lost control. 2 tugs attended, secured and towed vessel to Buyukdere anchorage, for repairs. Investigation ongoing.

Heating system of vessel failed as she arrived at port Nakhodka, Russia, where the temperature was -26°C. Inside vessel temperature could not exceed 5°C. She was permitted to leave port after repairs were completed on 26 January.
Vessel suffered engine failure in Burrard Inlet, BC, Canada, but was able to continue voyage.
Vessel suspended ferry service from Largs to Cumbrae, UK, due to hydraulic issue. Further repairs were required and relief vessel was repositioned.

Vessel was reported as NUC 38NM SSE of Prawle Point, UK. Engine was stopped to investigate. A defect with engine solenoid valve in automode was detected. Vessel underway using own engine within 25 minutes.
Vessel ran aground in Corpus Christi Channel after, reportedly, she collided with VLCC tanker NISALAH. The hull was breached and she suffered water ingress.
Vessel had technical fault on the gearbox. She was taken out of service in Langnas upon Lappo, Aland Islands. Repairs ongoing.
Vessel allided with the quay and suffered hull damaged, during maneuvers on turntable at inner port in Gdansk, Poland. Due to strong gusts of wind, vessel pushed against quay. No injuries reported.
Vessel ran aground south of Merak Besar Island in Banten, Indonesia. Two tugs attempted to refloat but were unsuccessful.

Vessel had water ingress into the engine room while transiting the Volga-Caspian Sea Navigation Canal, en route from Astrakhan to the port of Amirabad. She asked for emergency assistance and was allowed in the port of Olya. The water leakage was eliminated with the help of sump motor pumps and submersible pumps deployed by MRCC.
Vessel had engine blackout on turning basin in Rostock port, Germany as she arrived from Trelleborg, Sweden. Power was restored, vessel moved towards its berth. It sailed again on 22 January.
Vessel reported to have an open crack in its starboard bow while alongside Roberts Bank, BC, Canada. Vessel cancelled voyage to Vancouver.
VesselTracker reported that vessel has suffered oil leaks from its propeller and rudder system connection while at Gebze, Turkey. The vessel was at Tuzla anchorage as of 25 January.

Mooring ropes broke in Ponza, Pontine island, Italy in severe storm. Captain was forced to leave port to avoid serious situation. The ship headed to Formia at slow speed and reached mainland in about 5 hours. No injuries or damages were reported.

Vessel had engine failure and was disabled while departing section 66, Port of Montreal, Quebec, Canada. She was assisted by 2 tugs back to port. She sailed from Montreal on 23 January, bound for Halifax.
A crew member was medevaced by SAR boat Salvamar Denébola, en route from Tanger-Med to Algeciras, Spain., and was taken to the marina of La Alcaidesa on the south coast of Spain.
Vessel allided with tail of southern lock of Kiel Canal in Kiel-Holtenau, Germany. Fastenings of rubbing blocks and signal lamp were damaged. Extent of damage to be investigated.
Vessel reportedly sank in the Caribbean some 50 nm west of Cartagena, Colombia. She was en route from Cartagena to Puerto Colon Panama. 4 crew members are missing, other 5 are understood to be safe.
Vessel had technical failure at Antalya, Turkey. Departure permission was temporarily cancelled by HM until completion of repairs. Crew made repairs and sailed from Antalya next day.
Vessel was reported to have suffered fuel leaks from its rudder and propeller connection system at Diliskelesi, Turkey. She sailed from Diliskelesi next day, bound for Kumport, Turkey.
Vessel had fuel leaks into the sea and on deck during bunker supply operation off Evyap, Turkey. A fine of 16,365,000 USD was imposed. Departure was cancelled. Kocaeli Municipality took precautions.

Vessel suffered main engine failure, while approaching the port of Savona, Italy, en route from Dikili, Turkey. She was towed to berth by two tugs were repairs were carried out. The ship sailed from Savina on 24 January to Cagliari, Sardinia.
Vessel was reported disabled and adrift off Southwest Pass, Mississippi mouth, as she was approaching Southwest Pass, en route from Kingston, Jamaica to New Orleans.

Vessel issued distress signals in vicinity of pos 15 06 36N, 118 15 36E, in South China Sea, Philippines. MRCC Hong Kong requested vessels in vicinity to keep sharp lookout, assist and report to them.
Vessel had mechanical trouble shortly after leaving Rostock, Germany. She was towed by tug/icebreakers Fairplay XVII and Fairplay 55 back to port. She sailed next day bound for Ouddorp.
Vessel had technical problems with one of its engines and she had to reduce speed. Technicians came on board, on Grand Cayman to provide support.
Vessel reported a small ingress of water in one of its ballast tanks while anchored off Cockburn Island, on Lake Huron, Ontario, Canada. She continued voyage to Buffalo, NY, USA, for winter layup.
Vessel started to list to port side before leaving the port of Lafito, Haiti, with 72 containers on board. She capsized and sank at her berth.
Vessel ran aground off Kashiwazaki, Niigata Prefecture, Honshu, Japan sea. Circumstances of grounding unknown, but it is said to have struck a reef.

A cable became entangled around starboard shaft and propeller causing propeller to become jammed, while mooring alongside port of Folegandros. Diving operation carried out and vessel sailed for Piraeus with delay.
Vesel suffered a technical failure during the transit of the Canakkale Strait, en route from Gemlik to Aliaga. She moored at Karanlik Liman anchorage, where repairs were commenced by crew.

Reports that vessel ran aground after having technical issues near Janzour area, Libya. 9 Indian sailors detained by Az Zawiya and taken into custody. Reportedly they were released by Libyan rebel group on 2 June.

Vessel collided with breakwater while trying to enter Amasra port, Turkey, Black sea coast. Strong wind is said to be the cause of the accident. She may have suffered underwater hull damages and she will be inspected divers.
Vessel had technical failure of navigation system, echo sounder along with bridge main communication units at Zonguldak, Turkey. She sailed after repairs on 23 January.
Vessel stopped making runs to Metlakatla, USA and will be out of service until 1st February.
Vessel was NUC as its injectors needed a replacement about 25 NM SSE of Selsey bill.. Repairs were completed within 2 hours and vessel continued voyage.
Vessel reported engine cooling issues while proceeding westbound in the Chenal du Nord, QC, Canada. Vessel proceeded to section 50 of Montreal Port, Canada for repairs.
Vessel reported anchor winch tripping and not holding, in lat 51 38 04.8N, long 001 49 45.0E. She arrived in London Gateway on 19 January after repairs.
Vessel suffered a total blackout en route from Rotterdam to Lisbon and requested tug assistance. Repairs were done by crew and the ship resumed voyage some 3 hours later.
Vessel experienced exhaust temperature issues in Strait of Georgia, BC, Canada. Vessel proceeded to anchorage for repairs.
Salvamento Marítimo SAR vessel Salvamar Enif and an SAR helicopter evacuated a crew member and transferred to the Hospital de Jerez. Vessel was anchored in Banco del Hoyo at the time.
Vessel ran onto outer pier and got stuck on stones of breakwater in Skagen, Denmark. Two days later she was towed off rocks and pulled to shipyard, after large holes in hull were urgently repaired.
Vessel reported having struck submerged object while towing barge in north Arm of Fraser River off Iona Island, British Columbia, Canada. Vessel proceeded to Point Grey and secured barge alongside.
Vessel had engine failure in Campbell River, BC, Canada. She proceeded to Quathiaski Cove, with remaining engines to offload traffic and had to interrupt service
Vessel suffered fire while docked at Gangstovika in Alesund, Norway. Damages were insignificant. No injuries reported.

Vessel suffered engine failure at Aliaga anchorage, en route from Nemrut Bay to Tuzla. Crew attempted repairs but were unsuccessful. Tug Esenkiyi began towage operation to the Tuzla shipyard area, with an ETA of 25 January.

Vessel lost stability during cargo operations at Genoa port, Italy. She developed heavy list and rested starboard on pier. She will continue voyage to Bulgaria once she's stabilised and inspected for damages.
Vesse had technical failure of pollution prevention system together with fire fighting system support unit at Novorossiysk, Russia. She sailed after repairsto Kavkaz outer anchorage.
A cargo handling accident occurred during the offloading of a road crane in São Francisco. The crane suffered serious damages, no injuries reported.

Vessel suffered explosion, followed by fire, at ship repair facility on Mae Klong river, west of Bangkok, Thailand. Explosion occurred during wielding works as undergoing maintenance repairs. 7 people are missing and 4 suffered injuries.
Vessel had engine failure and started drifting North of Zeebrugge, Belgium. Tug/icebreaker Multraship Commander and later salvage tug Multratug 18, towed to her Flushing next day.

Vessel reported water ingress with portside list in Taiwan Strait 90 nm west of Kaohsiung. 8 crew members were rescued by helicopter after they jumped in water. All are safe although some suffered of hypothermia. The ship capsized and sank.
Vessel ran aground in Bosphorus in Umuryen area while transiting the Strait, en route from Ukraine to Istanbul. Traffic was temporarily suspended and tugs have been deployed to assist.

Vessel collided with passenger ro/ro vessel Bithia, under strong southerly winds, whilst both vessels were moored adjacent to each other in ship repairs area of Genoa, Italy. Tug assisted and reinstated mooring.

Vessel collided with passenger ro/ro Mega Express Three under strong southerly winds whilst vessels were moored adjacent to each other in ship repairs area of Genoa, Italy. Tug assisted and reinstated mooring.
Vesselhad technical problems and was imobilised in middle of St Lawrence River opposite to Trois-Rivieres port, Canada. Cause unknown.
Vessel had technical failure, sheltered and dropped anchor at Anamur. Repairs were carried out by crew and she sailed from Anamur anchorage next day.
Vessel suffered mechanical fault with bow thruster and had to be taken out of service. Ferry Sankaty assisted.
Vessel went NUC following deviation in cylinder temperature caused by fuel issue, while en route from Killingholme, UK to Zeebrugge, Belgium. Engineers rectified fault and vessel continued passage.

Vessel towing a barge from New Jersey to Guyana had a 1,000ft towing line entangled with and fouled the starboard propeller. Crew attempted to regain tow of the barge, but the line became tangled in the port propeller, thus immobilising the vessel. USCG cutter Lawrence Lawson was diverted to incident to assist responding units. 7 crew members were evacuated by helicopter and transported to Ocean City Municipal Airport in Maryland. No injuries reported. Tug and barge are awaiting commercial salvage.
