Vessel suffered a fire in the laundry room due to an electrical fault, while at the port of Durres, Albania. The local Coast Guard and port tugs attended and 2 naval vessels evacuated crew and extinguished fire.

Vessel had engine failure at Burhanli point during Canakkale strait passage, Turkey. Tug Kurtarma-15, fast rescue boat and duty strait pilot were appointed to secure and tow vessel. She was secured and dropped anchor at Sevketiye anchorage.

Fire erupted on cargo deck at Palermo. 184 passengers were evacuated, together with part of the 80 crew. Many fire engines were deployed and took fire under control. Ferry is connecting Palermo with mainland Italy.
Vessel reportedly collided with fishing vessel SEA QUEEN which was anchored abt 69 NM off Colachel and dragged her for about 5 minutes. Boat was heavily damaged and boat crew escaped.
Vessel was reported to have been found abandoned, anchored off Dakar, Senegal, although its last recorded position, dated 20 July 2021, was in Douala, Cameroon.
Vessel had engine failure after striking a log while exiting Fulford Harbour, Canada. Vessel proceeded to Swartz Bay, on 3 engines and freed propeller alongside.
Vessel struck a log and was taken out of service because of a bent propeller. She remained in Kingston, US, for repair as of 18 January.
Vessel ran aground in front of Kruiningen on Western Scheldt, while en route from Antwerp to Hamburg. She was refloated few hours later and proceeded downstream escorted by tugs.
Vessel suffered an engine failure when about 15nm west of Savona, Italy. She was towed to Savona and berthed there until 24 January when she sailed for Naples.
Vessel  had to cancel the first scheduled departure from Sandefjord, Norway, due to technical trouble. Crew carried out repairs and the vessel finally left the port.
Vessel had engine failure, lost power and anchored off Haydardasa, Turkey. Tug Kurtarma 2 rescued vessel and a technical team assisted to anchor at Istanbul anchorage. Crew carried out repairs.
Vessel had to cancel its sailings from Kirkwall, after it snagged on a creel line. Northerly Explorer was called in to cover route while divers were deployed to remove the line from the propeller.

Vessel suffered major fire in engine room while anchored at Gresik Port anchorage, Indonesia. Fire spread to superstructure. Crew were evacuated. Fire tugs and boats were deployed. Fire still not under control.
Vessel had ECDIS malfunction off Ambarli, Turkey. Kurtarma-7 assisted and vessel shifted to Ambarli Anchorage. She sailed next day for Wilmington.

Vessel suffered massive water ingress off Hoenggan island, SW of Wando Port, southernmost Korea, while en route from Yeongheung Port, Incheon, to Donghae, Korea, Japan sea. Water ingress was taken under control and vessel reached Wando port under own power but escorted by tugs and boats. All 9 crew members were rescued safely.
Five empty containers were blown on board at Amalia Port, Rotterdam, Netherlands. One of them fell on and damaged deck of vessel ALIZE. Drifting containers were recovered from water.
Vessel had a blackout, about 20 M off Savona, Italy, due to a generator failure. Patrol boat CP 2094 escorted vessel until it reached Savona. She sailed on 18 January bound for Barcelona.

Vessel collided with Clair ridge quarter and utilities platform at low speed in pos lat 60 44 07.8N, long 002 29 48.0W, UK. Vessel underway using engine, intended to discharge cargo at Clair ridge/ Glen Lyon and return to Aberdeen.

Vessel's engine stopped at Cargill factory, Gunhildvagen, Floro, Norway. Crew were unable to restart engine and vessel drifted into rocks on land in 40kts wind. Tug secured her and she was berthed at Gunhildvagen. No damages to propeller or rudder.

Vessel started to sink at its berth, Havstenssund, Sweden. Rescue services and Maritime Rescue Society attended. Vessel listed to starboard and stern submerged. She was secured by crane truck and saved from sinking.Oil boom deployed around it.
Vessel was NUC and adrift while towing floating crane Hebo-Lift 9 off Skagen, Denmark. She anchored in pos 58 19 48N, 11 23 29.4E, and berthed at Brofjorden next day.
Vessel had engine failure while sailing towards the port of Guayaquil, on the Isla Marshal. She had to return to Island.
Vessel had technical failure at southern entrance of Canakkale Strait and dropped anchor. Tug AYAZBEY towed her on 3 February to Tuzla. She sailed from shipyard on 01 May.
Vessel reported having smoke in engine room while leaving Sydney Harbour, Canada. Vessel anchored and main engine was shut to investigate.
A fire broke out on board vessel in dry dock in basin 4 Delle Grazie, Genova, Italy, near the Giano jetty due to contact of welding rod with flammable material. Fire was extinguished quickly.

A crewmember on board vessel was reported to have broken both his legs 220 miles south of Dutch Harbor, Alaska. A MH-60 Jayhawk helicopter aircrew hoisted him from the tanker and transported him safely to Cold Bay for a wing-to-wing transfer with LifeMed Alaska personnel, who then transported him to a higher level of medical care.
Vessel ran aground while manoeuvring, in lat 64 23 20 N, long 010 30 45E. No assistance was required. She berthed at Kverhusvik Skipsverft for damage inspection and possible repair works.
Vessel had port engine failure in pos 58 45 30N, 003 30 30W, en route from Aberdeen to Oban, UK. Shetland MRCC asssited.
Vessel had issues with one of its vessel service generators in Chenal du Cap-Saint-Michel, Canada. Secured alongside at Montreal Port for repairs. She resumed voyage on 12 November.
A crew member fell into the sea while vessel was at PT Pacific Jetty. As of 11 January, search was still ongoing by officers from Basarnas, Lanal TBK and Satpolair Karimun Police in Indonesia.
Vessel had engine failure in Novorossiysk, Russia. Tug Ayaz Bey towed her to Tuzla where she arrived on 28 March then she was towed by tug Gisas-V into Tuzla shipyard area.
Vessel was NUC, as its oil filter got jammed, about 15.4 NM from Ventnor Port, UK, in the English Channel. Changed its AIS status to underway same day.

Vessel was reported by Vessel Tracker to have been fined for discharging dirty and oily garbage in Mersin, Turkiye, plus allegedly discharging dirty ballast water next day. An investigation file was opened. The imposed fine was reported to have been $536,500. Permission to depart was cancelled by the Harbour Master until the fine was paid, with clean-up expenses added. She sailed from Mersin on 13 January for Trabzon.
Vessel developed a list to starboard when off Söderhamn, Sweden. She was taken to Köpmanholmen port for inspection.

Vessel, berthed at the port of Kobe, Japan, was struck by container ship JOSCO Alma, while leaving the port. After an investigation by the Japanese Coast Guard, the JOSCO Alma was allowed to continue voyage.

A crew member had to be medevaced after he suffered injuries from a fall aboard the vessel, 45nm off the coast of New Plymouth, New Zealand. He was flown to Waikato Hospital by the Auckland Rescue Helicopter Trust, reportedly in a serious condition.
Vessel was NUC due to a pipe in the cooling system that needed to be changed. Crew carried out repairs and vessel resumed voyage same day. No pollution reported.

Vessel reported cooling freshwater leakage in main engine air cooler 9.4 NM SE of Beachy Head, UK, en route from Ghent, Belgium to La Rochelle, France. Repairs were carried out and she resumed voyage same day. No pollution reported.
Vessel had engine failure off Buyukcekmece, in pos 40 54 12N, 028 32 00E, Turkey. Crew couldn't repair. She was towed to Tuzla anchorage. A fine was imposed and departure permission canceled.
Vessel was NUC in position lat 58 19 00N, long 005 37 06W. Repairs were completed by crew and she arrived in Hamburg on 12 January.
Vessel allided with container ship Ever Conform in the port of Kitakyushu, Japan. Both vessels were investigated by the Japanese Coast Guard and subsequently were released.
Vessel was struck by general cargo ship Poteto Maru, while berthed in the port of Kitakyushu, Japan. Both vessels were investigated by the Japanese Coast Guard and subsequently were released.
SAR operation was launched by The Selangor Malaysian Maritime Enforcement Agency (MMEA) to locate a crew member who reportedly fell over board in the waters of Pulau Ketam.
Vessel allided with the berthed RoRo cargo ship DCL Qingdao while leaving the port of Kobe, Japan. After an investigation by the Japanese Coast Guard, the JOSCO Alma was allowed to continue voyage.
Tug collided with tug BIG D in Mississippi River, USA. Both vessels were pushing full barge tows ahead. NTSB inevstigated and said the cause was critical error in communication.

Vessel suffered mechanical failure while transiting Suez Canal in southern direction, halfway between Port Said and Great Bitter Lake, en route from Ukraine to China. Tugs took her under control and she anchored or moored in Canal, north of Ismailiya.

Vessel suffered main engine failure, about 6nm west of the Reykjanes peninsula, Iceland, en route from Immingham, UK, to Reykjavik, Iceland. Tug Magni was deployed to assist together with patrol boat Thor. Crew carried out repairs and the vessel headed towards Reykjavik about four hours later. She was sailing with 50% engine power.

Vessel went NUC at Gioia Tauro harbor entrance, Italy, while leaving port bound for Malta, and ran onto southern breakwater tip. Tugs were deployed to help refloat her. Harbor traffic was blocked and there were no leaks or serious damages to the ship.
Vessel ran aground, in Emden, at height of Knock, Germany. Stuck on Mittelplate near fairway. She was refloated by 2 tugs with rising tide. Resumed voyage after damage inspection.
Vessel had propulsion loss and was disabled during berthing maneuvers in 50 01 48N, 066 47 00W, Canada. She was assisted by 2 tugs and crew carried out repairs.
Vessel struck Simpson Bay Lagoon Authority operations booth during bridge opening for incoming maritime traffic, and caused severe structural damages. No injuries were reported

Vessel collided witth cutter suction hopper dredger MAHURY on Sea Port Canal of Delfzijl, Netherlands. She suffered scratches and dents above and underneath waterline. She sailed to Kotter Shipyard, Haren, for repairs.
Vessel had main engine cooling issues in Sorel, Quebec, Canada. Ferry service wascsuspended and crew carried out repairs.
Vessel had technical failure, sheltered and anchored at Sinop anchorage. Repairs were carried out by crew.
Vessel struck berthed tanker SONGA DIAMOND at Ceuta, Spain, while maneuvering in harbor on arrival from Carboneras. Both ships sustained damages.

Vessel was struck by cement carrier GRIT CEMENT at Ceuta, Spain while maneuvering in harbor on arrival from Carboneras. Both ships sustained damages. SONGA DIAMOND sailed next day bound for Algeciras.
Vessel went NUC after fuel pump malfunction and needed to replace gasket in pos 50 26 36N, 000 28 30W, UK. Completed repairs at Portland anchorage on 09 January.
Vessel reported to have had main engine breakdown in early January. She berthed at Namsos, Norway for repairs.
Vessel collided with chemical tanker Eiltank 66 on Sea Port Canal of Delfzijl, Netherlands. She continued work and tanker suffered several scratches and dents above and underneath waterline.
Vessel collided with dock in Simpson Bay, St Maarten due to a computer malfunction which caused her to lose steering. The ship moored in Magens Bay.
Vessel suffered fire in its accommodations in St. Mary's Bay off St. Vincent's, Newfoundland and Labrador, Canada. Crew extinguished fire and vessel continued voyage.
Vessel collided with disabled fishing vessel BEAT & POUND while manoeuvering to tow on German Bank off Wedgeport, Canada. No damages were reported. Towing manoeuvre undertaken towards West Head.

Vessel reported having made bottom contact causing damage to hull rendering it unseaworthy while proceeding westbound in St. Marys River off Sault-Sainte-Marie, Canada. She continued voyage to destination. No pollution reported.

Vessel sank in Gulf of Siam some 10-12 nm off Koh Phangan island, near Samui island, Surat Thani Province, Thailand, reportedly due to rough weather. All crew members were rescued from life rafts by tanker NAPAPA.

Vessel ran aground at 170.8KM mark of Volga-Caspian Sea Navigation Canal. No water ingress or pollution reported. Astrakhan Marine Rescue Service & MRCC assisted but vessel was refloated independently.

Vessel had technical failure of navigation system and echo sounder together with bridge main communication units at Zonguldak, Turkey. Departure permission was canceled.  Repairs were carried out by crew.
Vessel had engine trouble west of Karmoy, Norway. Tug BB Connector assisted from and took the vessel on tow. It safely berthed at Meljarvik, the same day.

Vessel lost stability at Mundra Port, India, during cargo operations. She listed portside, then starboard side, and finally rested on pier by starboard. Several containers fell overboard. The cause is yet unknown.
Vessel strayed off fairway, while approaching Cartagena Colombia en route from Brazil and ran aground. She was refloated some hours later and anchored to Cartagena Anchorage.
Vessel requested to be towed due to engine problems, 30nm NW of Cedeira, Spain. The rescue centre mobilised tug SAR GAVIA and towed her to La Coruna safely.

Vessel was taken out of service for its annual overhaul and had been in dry dock, in Greenock, UK, with more than £1M of work being done, including engine servicing. She returned to service on 18 April.

Vessel was struck by norovirus during a New Year’s voyage, from 29 December 2022 through to 3 January 2023 from Southampton to Hamburg, Zeebrugge and back. According to officials, 84 passengers and 10 crew were affected with the predominant symptoms of vomiting and diarrhoea.
Vessel had lost anchor and chain at Westhinder anchorage, Belgium. Position covered by 3 inflatable marker buoys and buoy with white flashing light and reflector. Vessel moored in Antwerpen next day.

Vessel had technical failure of its navigation system along with the voyage data recorder unit VDR at Novorossiysk, Russia.Repairs were carried out by the crew. She sailed on 07 January, bound for Mersin.
Vessel had engine fault and remained anchored within the Dover TSS to carry out repairs. Repairs were completed and vessel underway using own engine.
Vessel was disabled 46NM N of Estaca de Bares, Spain. Tug Ria de Vigo towed her to San Diego Pier next day. Fire fighting tug IBAIZABAL DOCE assisted until anchored near breakwater.
Vessel broke its mooring rope at the stern, during the mooring manoeuvre, in the large N lock of the Kiel Canal in Brunsbuttel. One crew member suffered leg injuries, possible fracture.
Vessel was reported NUC due to a leak in fuel injectors. No tug assistance was needed. Repairs were done by crew in approximately 20 minutes and vessel continued voyage.

Vessel suffered a fire while berthed at Blohm and Voss Shipyard in Hamburg,Germany. Smoke billowed from technic room. Fire brigade was alerted and flames were extinguished in short time. No injuries were reported.

Vessel had engine failure at the entrance to Trondheim Fjord in Orland municipality, Norway. A patrol ship assisted and stood by vessel until crew restarted engine. Vessel was escorted to Garten dock by lifeboat.
A fire broke out in lounge on second deck of vessel while berthed at clip fish museum in Kristiansund, Norway. Fire fighters responded and took fire under control with no risk of spreading to jetty.
Vessel caught fire in the port of Murmansk, Russia due to unknown cause. Six of the seven people on board were evacuated by fire fighters. The fishing port was temporarily closed.
Vessel had engine failure in the south of Bozcaada Island, Turkey. Repairs could not be carried out by crew. Anchor handling tug/supply Ocean Ergun attended.

Vessel allided with quay of Kaiserdock in Bremerhaven, Germany, amid wind gusts of force 7-8 when trying to enter the lock towards North Sea. She suffered slight damage, left port and sailed to Tilbury, UK, the next day.
Port Authority of Patmos, Greece was informed of breakdown of vessel and the existence of limited oil leakage in spare rudder pump. Crew carried out repairs and sailed under own power to Lipsoi port.

Vessel allided with berthed general cargo ship Shosei Maru as she was about to berth in the Sakaisenboku port of Osaka, Japan, due to being caught in strong winds. No injuries or oil spills were reported.
Vessel collided with tug RT Evolution during a towing maneuver at Lloyd Yard in port of Bremerhaven, Germany amidst strong wind gusts. Vessel was berthed at yard since 28 December.
Vessel had breakdown and was sidelined which forced inter-island service reduction with single vessel operating to Saturday timetable from 09-12 Jan.
Vessel had a main engine issue and was NUC, 11nm at 187 degrees from Beachy Head, southwest bound lane of Dover Straits TSS, UK. Repairs were carried out by crew and vessel resumed voyage same day.
Vessel suffered water ingress in Arabian sea some 280 nm west of Mumbai, while en route to Mumbai. She appears to be drifting or moving in SW direction at some 2 knots speed.

Fire broke out in superstructure of vessel at Zeytinburnu anchorage, Istanbul, Marmara sea, en route from Trabzon to Seville Spain. Reportedly fire was extinguished by the crew although other reports say an emergency team arrived with rescue boat and tug and tackled fire.
Vessel was struck by general cargo ship Pegasus 03 while berthed at Sakaisenboku port of Osaka, Japan, due to strong winds. No injuries or oil spills were reported.

Vessel collided with fully cellular containership Buxcliff at Lloyd Yard in port of Bremerhaven,Germany amidst strong wind gusts. She suffered damags and was berthed at Bremerhaven fishing port for repairs.
Vessel was disabled after having sustained a blackout in Placentia Bay, off Bordeaux Island, Canada. She regained power and sailed to Whiffin Head.

Vessel reported missing in South China sea. Last AIS was on 3 January in South China sea, 120 nm NE of Singapore. There are 5 crew members on board and she was en route from Lumut Malaysia, to Kuching, Borneo, Malaysia. Vessel's EPIRB was found some 30 nm NW of Pemangkat, Indonesia, Borneo. Malaysian authorities are conductin a search and are alerting all ships in the area.

Vessel allided with lock head of Zandvliet Lock, Antwerp, while leaving Antwerp en route to La Rochelle, France. Ship sustained damagesand headed back to Antwerp for inspection and repairs. Traffic was not suspended as lock suffered very minor damages.
Reportedly, Chief Engineer of vessel suffered a cardiac arrest and was found dead in his cabin, at Paradip Anchorage, India. His body was transferred to hospital for authopsy.

Vessel had technical failure during Canakkale strait passage, Turkey and dropped anchor in Karanlik liman anchorage under the supervision of Strait pilot. Repairs were done by crew and she arrived in Gemlik 8 January.
Vessel collided with a quay in Hundested port. Quay was severely damaged, which is expected to affect port's activities for 3 to 5 months and impact punched a hole in sheet pile wall.

Vessel emergency docked in drydock 6 at Dunkirk port, France, for repairs of damaged stern tube seals. Wire caught in propeller in Calais port after its arrival from Dover. She sailed from Dunkirk on 6 January.
Vessel was diverted to Navantia dry dock, Cadiz, Spain for essential maintenance, due to unspecified problem with blade on one of propellers. Crew working on repairs.
Vessel was disabled due to engine issues while berthing at Cascadia Dock in Vancouver Harbour, Canada. Vessel was taken to berth in Vancouver and moored same day.
Vessel had fire in its engine room while at section 57S, Port of Montreal in Montreal, Canada. Municipal fire fighters boarded the vessel.
Vessel had technical failure, sheltered and dropped anchor at Kas, Turkey. Repairs were carried out by crew at anchorage. She sailed on 3 January bound for Ashdod.
Vessel sank in Seget District waters, Sorong Regency, West Papua. The ship was en route from Sorong Harbor to Bintuni. 8 crew members were rescued and 5 remain missing.
Vessel was NUC due to main engine fuel pipe leak, 44.2 miles from north foreland, UK, while en route from Rotterdam, Netherlands to Port Said, Egypt. Repairs were completed on 1 January 2023.
Vessel collided with Zárate–Brazo Largo Bridges structure. ZINA suffered gushes in portside bow and forecastle and is to be repaired. As of 2 January she remained anchored below bridge.
Vessel ran aground while approaching dock in Oshawa, Ontario, Canada. She was refloated without assistance and proceeded under own power to her next port of call.

Fire broke out while vessel was berthed at No. 57 berth at Kronshtadt, Russia. Fire engulfed 2 cabins and affected an area of 10²m. Specialists continue to work on fire. No casualties have been reported.

Vessel with 10 people on board, sank in Karimata St. SAR (LUT) received distress signal 13 times. Pangkalpinang SAR found 4 crew with emergency life raft in waters of Tanjung Binga Sea and transported them to Belitung heathcentre. Search was still on.
Vessel discharged dirty oily water to sea at Derince, Turkey and was fined $604,500. Pollution barrier was placed in fore and aft parts. Cleaning operation was in progress.
Vessel allided with Buda bridge over Willebroek canal in Neder-Over-Heembeek, Belgium. Bridge was damaged and deemed inoperative.

Vessel allided with rocks at coast of Amsterdam Island in Indian Ocean and suffered damages. Research/supply ship MARION DUFRESNE assisted. Vessel arrived at Port de Pointe des Galets, Reunion on the 10 January.
Vessel had engine failure and drifted to shore off Darica point, Turkey. Crew couldn't do repairs. Incident cause and damage extent were under inspection. Tug towed the ship to Yarimca anchorage.
Vessel ran aground at Km 158 while transiting the Suez Canal with the Southbound Convoy. She was refloated by Suez Canal authority tugs.

It has been reported that vessel suffered a fire in engine room off Albany, southwest Australia, bound for Australian Esperance Port. Fire was extinguished several hours later by the ship's firefighting system but it has left the engine severly damaged. Vessel was towed to Albany anchorage, where she remained anchored since 2 January.
Vessel sank at National Guard Dock in Juneau, US. There were 60-80 gallons of fuel on board. Small amount of diesel was released and created sheen in port area. A boom was deployed to soak up oil.
Vessel suffered structural damages on the forecastle deck at Bandirma. She entered a shipyard in Yalova, Turkey, on 3 January where repairs commenced after a detailed damage survey.
Vessel was disabled due to engine issues while berthed at a terminal in Vancouver Harbour, BC, Canada. Crew carried out repairs.

Fire broke up in cargo hold at Durban as thick smoke was billowing from hold, and visible in areas surrounding port. All cargo operations were suspended, the ship is monitored by emergency services. DE SHENG 1 arrived from China via Singapore on 20 December.

Vessel sank off Hole in the Wall Lighthouse, Bahamas on 29 December or earlier, after contacting reef or bottom. She was en route from Finland to New Orleans, with cargo of steel. 12 crew abandoned the ship and are safe. According to reports, the ship started taking on water and tried to run aground on sandy bottom, but failed, and rested on bottom on bigger depth.

UPDATE: Vessel was moved to Seattle, to offload containers on board. Then she is said to be towed to China for repairs. Rudder was fixed in amidships position and prepared for Trans North Pacific towage. Vessel's rudder stuck in portside position as she was passing Juan de Fuca Strait, en route from Vancouver to Yokohama. 6 tugs were deployed and disabled ship was towed to Victoria to undergo repairs.

Vessel lost three 40-foot containers overboard, 23 nm west of Ushant island, southwest English Channel, while en route from Le Havre to Bordeaux. The ship continued voyage. Two containers were spotted adrift.
Vessel had a loss of flow in its main engine cooling water system and main engine overheated, in the St. Lawrence River off Saint-Nicholas, Quebec, Canada.
Vessel had fire in its steering gear room while berthed in a terminal at Vancouver Harbour, BC, Canada. Crew extinguished the fire.

Vessel suffered water ingress in high waves, developed a list to starboard side and subsequently sank in Sungsang waters, Banyuasin Regency. 36 crew members were taken aboard tug STL Miracle and transferred to Tanjung Api-Api Port.

Vessel was disabled and went adrift in South China sea in Riau islands waters N of Sarawak, Malaysia, Borneo. The ship with only 19 crew on board and no passengers was en route from Qingdao to Singapore. According to report, she suffered engine failure.
Vessel was reported NUC with engine problems and required a filter change, in lat 50 37 38N, long 000 35 58E. Repair works were carried out by crew and vessel continued passage after half an hour.
Vessel lost main engine power and was disabled while berthed at Annacis Auto Terminal in Fraser River, British Columbia, Canada. Crew did repairs.
Vessel had a mechanical fault which affected her maximum cruising speed, while sailing a seven-day Mexican Riviera cruise from Long Beach, California..
Vessel had technical failure of fire detection systems at Novorossiysk, Russia. Vessel departure permission was temporarily canceled. Repairs were being made by crew.

Vessel suffered engine failure in Hwasun port, Jeju island, Korea, while maneuvering to berth. The ship was stopped short of breakwater by joint efforts of rescue boats and tugs, and was towed to berth. HONG HE XING arrived at Hwasun from Qinhuangdao, China, with cargo of wind turbine blades and sailed on 28 December, bound for Qingdao.
Vessel had a generator failure at Loch Ryan. The engineer on board quickly did repairsand the ship proceeded safely into Cairnryan.

Vessel reported Master died from illness while sailing off Kochi port, India, Arabian sea. Tanker ballasting from Singapore to UAE interrupted her voyage and sailed to Kochi Anchorage. Body of 43-year old Captain was transferred to hospital. No foul play suspected.

Vessel lost 9 containers overboard at Ashdod Anchorage, Israel. At least three 40-foot containers loaded with house electronics and other consumer goods, drifted ashore. Locals started to loot containers cargo. The ship was taken to Ashdod to handle collapsed stacks with containers on board. ASTRID L is circulating between Israeli and Turkish ports.
Vessel had starboard anchor loss at Piraeus anchorage, Greece. Vessel was under detention by the port of Piraeusand was waiting for inspection. Vessel was underway as of 29 December.
Vessel had technical problems with one of the bow thrusters, and was sidelined in Omsa. She entered the route Seivika-Tommervaag, 3 days later, after repairs.
Vessel had technical failure of machinery system and fire detection units at Novorossiysk, Russia. Departure permission was cancelled until repairs were being done by crew.

Vessel reportedly sank after an explosion in waters of Tawi-Tawi province, Philippines. Ten crew members were rescued by bulk carrier FALCON TRIUMPH and tanker HIGH ADVENTURE. Both ships responded to distress message and sailed to disaster site.

It's been reported that the captain of vessel went missing at Bontang Anchorage, Kalimantan, Makassar Strait. Search team have been unsuccessful so far but the search is still on. Details of his disappearance are not known.
Vessel suffered engine failure and was disabled in the English Channel north of Boulogne, while en route from Dominican Republic to Rotterdam, with cargo of, mainly, reefer containers.
Vessel had blackout and was NUC, off Teesport, UK. Blackout was caused by auxiliary engine failure. Issue was fixed by crew and vessles resumed voyage same day. No pollution reported.

Vessel ran aground on Balabac island SW coast, Palawan Province, Philippines. The ship was on her way to Vietnam and anchored off Balabac southwest coast on 21 December to wait out rough weather in South China sea. Her anchor dragged and she drifted aground. All 17 crew were evacuated and are safe.

Captain requested medical assistance for 5 crew members suffering from poisoning by carbon monoxide. Vessel was anchored off Indian River Bay, Sussex County, Delaware. All 5 have been evacuated, assistance is rendered, understood poisoning is not life-threatening.
Vessel suffered main engine failure and had bottom contact in the St. Lawrence River off Grondines-Ouest, Canada. She anchored and requested tug assistance.
Vessel experienced technical failure during Canakkale strait passage and anchored at Karanlik liman anchorage under the supervision of strait pilot. Crew commenced repairs.

While mooring at Umm Qasr, Iraq, vessel struck berthed container ship ESL WINNER. The impact was strong enough to tear off the lifeboat from its’ lashings, stern transom also sustained damages. ESL WINNER shifted berth after collision.
Vessel experienced issues with propulsion and sustained damages to rudder in position lat 48 48 10.2N, long 127 52 30.0W, Canada. Tug Atlantic Raven assisted vessel. No injuries reported.

While mooring at Umm Qasr, Iraq, vessel struck berthed container ship ESL WINNER. The impact was strong enough to tear off the lifeboat from its’ lashings, stern transom also sustained damages. ESL WINNER shifted berth after collision.
Vessel had technical failure sheltered and dropped its anchor at Datca, Turkey. Repairs were commenced by the crew members.

Vessel lost power and went NUC while leaving Brunswick, bound for Philadelphia with some 1000 cars on board. The ship started to drift towards Jekyll Island Pier, but she soon under control with the help of two tugs, and safely anchored at Brunswick river mouth. Crew managed to restore power and the ship resumed voyage on 25 December.
Vessel went NUC following defective engine seal requiring 24 hrs repair, in pos 50 25 07N, 000 28 35W, UK. Vessel anchored. Repairs were carried out and she was underway using own engine next day.

Vessel allided with dolphins of central island of Kiel Canal, Brunsbuttel, Germany due to strong currents, wind. 2 dolphins broke off. No injuries or pollution.The ship sailed the same day and arrived in Skaerbak, Denmark on 25 October.

Vessel issued distress signal from pos 10 08 56N, 017 01 55W, off Guinea-Bissau, W Africa,. Vessels transiting the area were requested to make  contact and report to MRCC Dakar. Nature of distress unknown.
Vessel had failure of one of its engines while beginning to maneuver in harbour area of Quebec, Canada. Vessel proceeded to wharf to investigate problem.
Vessel had the main engine failure, in the Saguenay River off Tadoussac, Quebec, Canada. The vessel proceeded to Tadoussac to complete investigations and repairs.
Vessel had technical failure of navigation system together with communication units at Novorossiysk, Russia. Crew did repairs and sailed to Batumi, Georgia few days later.

Vessel had blackout, lost main engine and went NUC in position lat 51 25 06N, long 001 59 39E, UK. Identified issue with air in compressor system requiring bleeding. Repairs were done and vessel resumed voyage. No pollution reported.

Vessel ran aground some 4.5 nm north of Tubigon harbor, Bohol island, Philippines, while en scheduled trip from Cebu to Tubigon. 289 passengers on board were evacuated. Ferry was refloated and safely reached Tubigon. No leaks reported.

Vessel collided with one of pontoons at Cais do Sodre river terminal in Lisbon, Portugal, while manouvering for berthing and disembarking. 2 people were injured. Master was tested for alcohol which was negative.
Vessel had broken rudder while sailing Sofifi route, Indonesia with 311 people on board.278 were evacuated, 18 passengers along with 15 crew stayed because they still had their vehicles on board.
Fire broke out  in auxiliary engine when it docked in port Al Hoceima, Morocco, without passengers. Crew extinguished fire. Firefighters inspected affected area. Sailed from port on 31 December.
Vessel had failure of both its main engines upon departure from section 34 of Port of Montreal, Quebec, Canada. Crew completed repairs alongside.

Vessel was NUC and disabled in German Bight and needed towing assistance. She was taken over by tugs Rt Wilhelmshaven, Rt Pioneer and Vb Wilhelmshaven on the Weser roads and pulled to Wilhelmshaven, where it berthed.

Vessel  was reported as NUC due to small leak on engine and drifting SE in position lat 54 39 12.0N, long 000 38 06.0W. Engine shut down. It was repaired and the ship resumed passage same day. No pollution reported.
Vessel ran aground at Panama Canal entrance, Pacific side, bound for Corpus Christi USA. Panama Canal transits and traffic not affected.
Vessel got her propeller entangled in nets in Barents sea in Russian waters and had to anchor. Tanker is awaiting divers to clear propeller of nets. She was deployed in bunkering fishing vessels.

Crew member died on board, understood in an accident at Bluff, South Island, New Zealand. Cargo operations were already completed and dockers left the ship, reportedly ship’s cranes were moved when accident happened. Investigation under way.
Vessel was NUC due to fuel injector replacement in position lat 50 23 10.0N, long 000 26 11.0W, UK. She sailed the same day after repairs were carried out.

Vessel sank in Yellow sea, west of Gunsan, Korea. All 9 crew rescued by nearby fishing and cargo vessels, and later picked up by Korean CG. The ship was en route from Pyengtaek Korea Yellow sea, to Masan Korea, Japan sea. Reportedly the ship developed heavy portside list and capsized, cause unknown.

Vessel collided with a 11m-long fishing vessel in pos 34 31 50N, 134 44 23E, en route from Ube to Kobe, Japan. Captain of fishing vessel was thrown over board, but later rescued. Fishing vessel sank. No oil spill. Dents seen in TAMON's bulbous bow. She berthed in Kobe same day.
Vessel had technical failure and dropped anchor at Datca, Turkey. Crew did temporary repairs and sailed next day bound for Yasarsan Shipyard in Altinova, for permanent repairs.

Fire erupted in superstructure of vessel, off Sinop, Turkey, Black sea. Salvage and tugs responded in fighting major fire which was taken under control or extinguished by 21 December, but superstructure has burned out. Reportedly there were 17 crew on board, 16 were rescued, of whom 4 are injured, 1 seriously, 1 crew remains missing.

Vessel contacted Lock Control Tower at around, while entering Kiel Canal, en route from Estonia to Vlissingen Netherlands. The ship remained in Lock for about an hour, then resumed Canal transit. Ship’s damages, if any, are superficial. No information on Lock’s damages.

Vessel had a short circuit in electric ferry's motor and sidelined in Soby, Denmark. Sailing was cancelled as she couldn't lift visor. A crane assisted to lift cars on board. Repairs were done at quay and she resumed service next day.
Vessel transporting passengers from Vesuvius Bay to Crofton, Canada, had been affected by weather, mechanical issues and staff shortages and had to interrupt voyage for the whole day.
RCC Miami reported vessel was adrift in pos 25 11 50N, 084 47 40W in Gulf of Mexico. Cutter Shrike arrived to scene and rescued the 7 crew members on board. No injuries reported.

Vessel struck fishing farm Off Doganbey Kusadasi, Turkey. Fishing farm suffered structural damages. CG patrol boat attended and restricted traffic in the area. No polution or injuries reported. Investigation on.
Vessel was NUC due to a broken rubber coupling in engine cooling system, in pos 50 33 49N, 000 08 59E. Repaired after some time, reported to CNIS.

Vessel ran aground in St. Lawrence river in downstream Montreal area. The ship was anchored earlier, while sailing downstream, destination Atwerp. As of 21 December she was still aground with tug at her side.

Vessel collided with cargo vessel Dantic at ferry terminal, Nordoya, Norway. Mast on foredeck was  severely bent. She was withdrawn from service and taken on slip in Bronnoysund for repairs. Dantic sailed for Serkaug.

Vessel collided with passenger ro/ro Barmoy at ferry terminal, Nordoya, Norway. Barmoy's mast on foredeck was severely bentand and was taken on slip in Bronnoysund for repairs. Dantic sailed for Serkaug.

Vessel had technical failure at north entrance of Istanbul Strait, Turkey. She shifted to Turkeli anchorage with own power. Crew did temporary repairs. Dropped anchor at Tuzla anchorage on 21 December.

UPDATE: Vessel was removed from the grounding site as of 21 February, and was towed just a few metres away, but not yet into deeper waters as the salvors were waiting for a high tide. Vessel ran aground at Songkhla, Thailand. Anchor broke and strong winds carried vessel to mouth of Songkhla lake. Owner company planned to refloat the vessel once weather conditions allowed.
Vessel had structural failure due to container falling in hold, during cargo handling operations, at Diliskelesi, Turkey. Few containers and cargo holds permanent cell guide units were damaged.
Vessel suffered a fire in the naval port of Den Helder in Willemsoord. It was scaled up to a medium fire and it was quickly brought under control.

Vessel suffered blackout when she was entering Stockholm harbor on arrival from Tallinn. Blackout lasted some 5 minutes but he ship went out of control and sustained some scratches, but was allowed to continue scheduled voyage, with next port of call Marienham, Finland. Cause of blackout under investigation.
Vessel suffered engine failure north of La Coruna, Spain, Bay of Biscay, while en route from Santander to Huelva. Was towed to La Coruna by offshore tug RIA DE VIGO. Tanker is in ballast.

Passengers of cruise ship could not go ashore in the port of Roseau on the Caribbean island of Dominica due to strong winds and high waves. Vessel left Roseau prematurely and set course for the next port of Pointe-a-Pitre on the island of Guadeloupe.
Vessel had technical failure and sheltered at Cesme anchorage, Turkey. The crew carried out repairs. Vessel sailed from Cesme next day, bound for Sarande, Albania.

Vessel arrived from Brighton, in Stellendam, Netherlands, after it had engine damage. Since then, repairs to the Mitsubishi main engine were carried out by the technical teams of the engine factory Padmos.

Vessel reportedly crashed into Waterfront Kapuas Square in Pontianak, Indonesia. She apparently lost control, hit the edge of waterfront and 2 floating stalls/canteens. No injuries were reported. There wereno passengers on board.
Vessel reported as NUC after cylinder liners broke, causing the engine to overheat, 25NM S Portland Bill, UK.Vessel was underway same day after repairs done.

Vessel lost 10 containers overboard in stormy weather, off Quang Nam Province coast, central Vietnam, South China sea, while en route from Ho Chi Mingh to Hai Phong. 3 containers were found recently by locals, washed on the beach but broken.
Vessel had engine failure off Yenikapi point, Turkey. Coastal safety tug Kurtarma-5 attended. Repairs were done by crew at Istanbul Anchorage. She sailed on 18 December for Piraeus
Vessel collided with bulk carrier Ale at Les Mechins, Quebec, Canada. No pollution or injuries reported.
Vessel's mooring lines broke while docked and collided with moored tug Kamarina at Les Mechins, Quebec, Canada. No pollution or injuries reported.
Vessel had restricted manoeuvrability and was engaged in survey works off Guyana - Suriname coast. She has been reported as disabled and adrift on 31 December.
Vessel issued distress signal from pos 01 52 10N, 91 55 40E. Vessels in vicinity requested by MRCC Colombo to keep sharp lookout, assist if possible, and report to them.
Vessel reported propulsion issue and requested a medical evacuation Port Villa. She dropped 2 ports of call and returned. to Sydney on 18 December.

Vessel suffered fire on board, at shipyard Larsnes Mek. Verksted in Sande on Sunnmore, Norway. Crew are safe and fire was extinguished. No injuries reported. Vessel was carrying out sea trials at Larsnes Mek. Verksted.

A crew member died from extensive head bleeding, while vessel en route from Singapore to Phuket at Malacca Strait. She interrupted her voyage and anchored at Pangkor island anchorage awaiting autopsy results and probably investigation.
Vessel  lost its main engine amidst very bad weather in pos 36 32 02.8N, 06 42 23.8W. Tug/supply Rota Endurance towed her to Cadiz port, Spain on 17 December.

Vessel was in collision with a fishing vessel, east of Tanjung Lompat, Malaysia. Following an engine failure in severe weather conditions in the area, the fishing vessel had started to drift and hit the tanker as a result. The five Indonesian crew members jumped into the water and were rescued by the tanker and other fishing vessels in the area.

Vessel, sailing between Thyboron and Agger Tange, suffered broken shaft between hybrid ferry's generator and engine. Repairs are takeing a long time due to unavailable spare parts.As of 15 January 2023 she was at Thyboron.
Vessel lost steering capabilities and ran aground in St. Lawrence River off Sainte-Anne-de-la-Perade, Canada. She was refloated with tugs' help and sailed to Becancour, Quebec, for repairs.

Vessel ran aground on Samso island western coast, Kttegat, Denmark, while en route from Abenra to Aarhus, Denmark. The ship didn’t change course as she should, and ran aground at rather high speed. Watch, most probably, fell asleep. No leak was reported.
Vessel had mechanical failure at well site about 26 miles off the coast of Trinidad & Tobago. Rig could not fully retract leg and stuck in position, Crew were evacuated safely and well was secured.

Vessel capsized in the area of ​​Phan Thiet Transport Port, Binh Thuan Province, Vietnam, while receiving goods at bridge B1. The vessel suddenly tilted and overturned to port. Many of the goods on board were reported to have been washed out to sea. No injuries were reported. An oil boom was laid out around the semi-submerged wreck.

Reportedly and according to track, vessel ran aground on small islets or rocks some 8 nm NE of Kristiansund, Norway, while en route from Kambo to Trondheim. She was refloated a couple of hours later, most probably with assistance of SAR boat. Sailed, or was towed, to Kristiansund, berthed. No reports on damages.

Vessel collided with 75-ton fishing vessel in East China sea, 20 nm south of Tongyeong, Korea, while en route from Donghae to Incheon. KEUN YANG resumed her voyage, her hull wasn’t breached. Fishing vessel returned to home port with bow damages.
Vessel had engine failure at Castellon de la Plana, Spain. Crew could not repair. Fire fighting tug VB Hispania towed her to Seville for repairs.
Vessel had low lube oil pressure on its main engine and anchored in lat 58 30 04N, long 003 04 01W, abt 5 NM N of Wick. The defect was rectified the same day and vessel continued voyage.

Fire erupted on board of bulk carrier, docked at Muuga Port, Estonia. Fire started in superstructure, it was extinguished in an hour and a half, 5 engines were deployed. Fire was caused by electric shortcut in faulty wiring.

Vessel broke bow mooring cables, driven by strong wind and collided with pier jetty, in port of Livorno at Calata Alto Fondale, Italy. Moored safely with help of 2 tugs and technical-nautical service.

Vessel suffered ongoing mechanical issues. She will be heading to an emergency dry dock likely at the T. Mariotti shipyard in Genoa, in April, to repair the stabilizers and undergo maintenance to conduct repairs to the ship's stabilizers.
Vessel had breakdown of its emergency generator while at sea off Barkley Sound, British Columbia, Canada. Repairs were carried out once vessel reached Vancouver.

Vessel suffered a structural failure of the cargo hold access ladder, side hatch coaming handrails and other equipment during cargo discharge operation in Gebze, Turkey. Repairs to be carried out by stevedore duty teams upon completion of the discharge operation.
Officers from Brunsbuttel, Germany water police carried out Port State Control on board vessel and found some shortcomings. Captain and chief engineer each had to pay a safety fee of 2103.50 Euros.

A woman fell overboard and died when the vessel was off the coast of Florida. The coast guard launched a search and rescue operation involving a 45-foot vessel and a helicopter. A pilot boat located the woman's body and alerted members of the Coast Guard. It is not clear how the woman came to fall overboard, authorities have said.

Vessel collided with supply Far Spica after Far Spica lost control, 38 NM NNE of Peterhead, UK. She suffered potential damage to water ballast tanks and diesel tanks. Far Spica had superficial damage.

Vessel ran aground in the Sea of Okhotsk off Severo-Kurilsk, Kurile Islands, when due to unfavourable weather conditions she was dragged toward the shore. The captain decided to head to sea but the ship then got stuck. 13 crew members were evacuated into life rafts. Russian emergency services were on the way to assist the vessel and its crew. Refloating operations were to be started after weather conditions improved. No oil spills were observed.
Vessel had main engine issue in Chenal du Nord off Saint-Simeon, Canada. Repairs were done by crew after disembarking pilot at Les Escoumins and she sailed on the same day.

Fire erupted in superstructure of offshore supply tug, docked at Tampico, Mexico. Reportedly, faulty machinery caused fire, which was extinguished by city firefighting teams. Extent of damages unknown.

Vessel lost control and collided with floating production tanker Bleo Holm, 38 NM NNE of Peterhead, UK. She had superficial damages and headed to Aberdeen.Tanker had potential damage to water ballast and diesel tanks.

Vessel was boarded by 3 perpetrators while transiting E bound lane of Phillip Channel, Singapore Strait. Alarm was raised and perpetrators escaped. A hand phone and some generator parts were stolen, crew safe. Vessel continued passage.
Vessel with 6 people on board, collided with a barge while berthing at section 57 of Port of Montreal, Quebec, Canada. Vessel completed maneouver and repairs were effected.
Vessel had main engine failure in Chenal de Beaujeu Ouest off l’Isle-aux-Grues, Quebec, Canada. Vessel proceeded to l’Isle-aux-Grues for repairs.

Vessel experienced a seized engine and had to cancel all sailings to and from Rousay, Egilsay and Wyre, UK. Vessel is undergoing repairs, so other vessels have been called in to cover routes on North Isles.

Vessel collided with fishing vessel TG-91402-TS  some 2.5 nm off Vung Tau, while en route from Ho Chi Minh to China. Fishing vessel sank, of 6 crew on board 5 were rescued and 1 is missing. Search is under way. Tanker anchored off Vung Tau for investigation.

Reportedly, vessel was attacked by pirates in Gulf of Guinea 95 nm WSW of Kribi, Cameroon, while en route from Kribi Oil Terminal to Wilhelmshaven, Germany. Fast boat approached tanker, fired several shots, and fled. Crew safe, tanker continues her voyage.
Vessel suffered internal leak in fuel tank in La Coruna abt 6 NM W of Ons island, Spain, causing discharge of abt 150 litres of fuel. Vessel sailed Vigo after repairs on 21 December for Casablanca.

Vesse reportedly stopped engines to replace lube oil in pressure pumps after pressure pump malfunction and water ingress. She anchored in pos 50 15 12.0N, 000 58 19.0W, UK. Underway using engine after repairs, same day.

Vessel ran aground in front of Cote St Catherine Lock, St. Lawrence river, upstream from Montreal, while sailing upstream. She was refloared several hours later with tugs’ assistance and berthed at St Catherine. No damages or leaks reported.
Vessel had a machinery failure while transiting in lat 48 26 19N, long 123 12 21W, in Haro Strait off Discovery Island, Canada. The vessel proceeded to an anchorage and the crew carried out repairs.
Vessel, en route to Las Palmas, Spain, was delayed due to weather and port workers strike. Nicko cruises informed booked guests about situation and organised alternative program until vessel arrived.
Vessel had engine issues upon departure from section 48 of Port of Montreal, Quebec, Canada. She was repaired and resumed intended voyage.
Vessel was NUC due to leak in the engine approx 209 degrees 34 miles off Portland bill. Completed repairs same day. She arrived in Pasajes on 12 December.

Vessel was pushed aground onto coastal shallows by strong gusts of wind, while in the shipping channel of Volgo-Caspian Sea Canal. She developed list but was soon refloated. All crew were safe and no pollution was reported.
Vessel had a technical failure in Gibraltar. Crew could not repair. Tug Christos XXIV towed vessel to Gemlik, Turkey. Coastal Safety tug escorted during Canakkale Strait passage.

Vessel was disabled and adrift in the South China Sea. Vessels in the vicinity were requested to keep a sharp lookout, assist if possible and report to MRCC Vietnam. As of 13 December the vessel was in the Malacca Strait, heading from Incheon, South Korea to a Malaysian port.
Vessel had technical fault and had to cancel  service to Uist while at Kennacraig, UK. Steel wastage found, problem in Radar system and port main engine issue. Repairs done and sailed on 17 December.

Vessel suffered an engine failure off Nemrut Bay. She was towed to Izmir 3 days later. A detailed damage survey was carried out and a new set of spare parts was provided by owners. As of 10 January vessel was still at the shipyard in Izmir.

Vessel docked in Sydney, NSW, Australia, at Circular Quay, with 300 positive Covid cases on board. The New South Wales government classified the vessel as a tier 2 Covid risk.. The ship, which was carrying about 3000 people, had just completed a cruise to New Zealand, including stops to Christchurch and Dunedin.
Vessel had technical failure off Kas, Turkey. She anchored at Datca and continued voyage on 09 December.
Vessel and other 3 fishing vessels partially sank in Montevideo, Uruguay due to sinking floating dock of Tsakos Naval Industries.
Vessel partially sank after floating dock of Tsakos Naval Industries began to sink in Montevideo, Uruguay, with 5 fishing vessels on top.
Vessel had fire at breakwater of Mar del Plata, Argentina. Firefighters took fire under control. No injuries were reported. Vessel's safety not affected and material damages were minimal.
Vessel was one of the 5 vessels on top of floating dock of Tsakos Naval Industries which began to sink  in Montevideo, Uruguay. Tug Titon trying to assist.
Vessel suffered engine failure in Gulf of Tonkin. Vessels in vicinity were requested to keep a sharp lookout, assist if possible and report to MRCC Vietnam.
Vessel could not start engine at Tjotta, Norway. Ferry connection between Tjotta and Forvik was cancelled. Repairs were done 2 hours later and vessel was back in operation.

Vessel collided with fishing vessel some 4 nm west of Jersey, Channels islands, while approaching Saint Helier, Jersey, from Portsmouth UK. Fishing vessel sank, skipper and other 2 crew missing, SAR under way. COMMODORE GOODWILL docked at Saint Helier after collision.

Vessel allided with quay wall of Cruise Center, Hamburg-Steinwerder, Germany. Vertical breach of 3m in length at SB side stern massive dents of several m in length above water line. Repairs were done and sailed on 10 December.
Vessel  had a shaft generator failure, during its departure operations from Goderich, Ontario, Canada. The crew members initiated repairs alongside.
Vessel had mechanical breakdown Kumlinge, Finland. She berthed in Langnas for repairs which will last until Christmas. The entire engine was dismantled and parts were sent to Vasa for analysis.
Vessel had technical issues and had to cancel its sailings in Wood Islands, Canada. Sailings from Caribou to Wood Islands was also cancelled.

Vessel had engine faults and allided with the dock at section 52 of the Port of Montreal, Quebec, in pos. 45 33 15.0 N, 073 31 21.0 W. The pilot ordered the assistance of tugs and proceeded to an anchorage. The ship sailed to Montreal next day.
Vessel had damage to its engine and experienced propeller issue. She was towed by Gure Ametza II to a Lerwick harbour tug.

Patrol officers of Port Authority of Kymi, Greece found vessel  sinking at its berth at Kymi port. No injuries or pollution. Vessel was raised and floating oil defence barrier placed. She was kept alongside until dried out.
Vessel had an oil circulation failure and was awaiting parts, while anchored about 2 NM SW of Newhaven. Monitored by Solent CG. Repairs were completed on 13 December and continued voyage to Spain.

Vessel had water ingress while moored at Trouville-sur-Mer quay, Calvados, France. 2 compartments stern  were filled with water. She began to sink and waterline was no longer visible. Rescuers and firefighters on scene.

A crew member was medevaced by a Vietnamese SAR vessel and had to be hospitalized in Nha Trang city, Khanh Hoa province. The bulk carrier was en route from Yokohama to Singapore, situated some 123nm southeast of Nha Trang city, when the right hand of the man was crushed in an accident. The captain requested assistance from the Vietnamese authorities.
Four perpetrators in wooden fishing vessel boarded pontoon LKH 7887 under tow of vessel at Vung Tau anchorage, Vietnam. They stole about 1 ton of scrap metal but were soon arrested by Border Guards.

Vessel broke down afte arrival in Laxo from Symbister, UK. Single vessel service commenced from Vidlin terminal. Reportedly, Whalsay service was already disrupted when vessel had to be taken out of service.

Vessel lost an anchor with a weight of more than two tons, and a metre of the bow chain, in the Gulf of Finland, while en route to the Bronka transshipment complex. The owner of the vessel was instructed to raise the equipment by the end of May 2023.

Vessel had mechanical failure and started drifting without power between Dinish Island and Bere Island in West Cork, Republic of Ireland. They requested immediate assistance and RNLI's lifeboat Annette Hutton towed vessel to Catletownbere.

Vessel was reported as NUC due to main engine excess valve failure in pos 49 47 48N, 04 07 03W, UK. Crew carried out repairs and continued voyage using own power. She arrived in Santa Marta on 23 December.

Vessel suffered engine failure in Gulf of Tonkin, off Nghe Tinh province coast, while en route from Cam Pha. She started to submerge, Captain issued distress signal and requested evacuation. SAR ship was sent to assist but wasn't able to because of rough weather. All crew members went into life rafts. Rescue operation ran successfully, 13 crew were rescued, all are safe
Vessel had engine fault on her way to Bremsnesfjord, Norway, due to debris in propeller system. She was towed to Farkvam,  then berthed in Tomrefjord for repairs.

Vessel's stern was struck by passenger ship Lesvos while docked at the Chios Customs Port. Both suffered damages to hull. No injuries or pollution reported. Vessels were forbidden to depart until the presentation of certificates of seaworthiness and class maintenance.

Vessel on scheduled route from Cesme to Chios with 357 passengers on board, allided with the stern of the docked high-speed ferry Erturk at the Chios Customs Port. Both suffered damages to hull. No injuries or pollution reported. Vessels were forbidden to depart until the presentation of certificates of seaworthiness and class maintenance.
Vessel had main engine issues off Canaport Terminal in Saint John, NB, Canada. She proceeded to Canaport Anchorage to investigate the issue, assisted by two tugs.

Vessel had technical failure, in pos 35 59 12 N, 33 08 12 E, off Anamur, Turkey. She shifted to Anamur anchorage and dropped anchor under its own power. Repairs were being done by crew. She arrived in Reni on 25 December.

Vessel's side bow anchor was accidentally deployed while sailing from Swartz Bay-Tsawwassen, Canada. No danger to passengers but several trips were cancelled. Anchor was retrieved and vessel resumed voyage on 3 December.
Vessel had technical failure during Canakkale Strait passage and had to drop anchor at Karanlik liman anchorage under supervision of Strait pilot. Repairs being carried out by crew.
Vessel suffered main engine fault and went NUC 22nm SE of Selsey Bill, UK. Crew were unable to carry out the repair works and requested tug assistance.

UPDATE: According to damage survey vessel was damaged at the aft quarter. Serious structural damages were noted on the accommodation block, crew cabins, mess rooms, ship office and pertinent connections. Vessel was struck by general cargo ship TURAN C while anchored at Ahirkapi Anchorage, Istanbul, Marmara sea. BURHAN DIZMAN  sustained serious damages portside in superstructure area and TURAN C suffered bow and forecastle damages. TURKAN C was en route to Constanta and BURHAN DIZMAN was en route to Novorossiysk.

A crew member was medevaced by the US Coast Guard and San Francisco Fire Department, while vessel was at anchorage 9 in San Francisco. He was transported to Stanford Medical Centre where he was reported to be in a stable condition.

UPDATE: According to damage survey vessel was found to be damaged at the port sideforeship above the water. Various bents, indentings and cracks were found in the forecastle and pertinent steel members. Vessel collided with general cargo ship BURHAN DIZMAN, while proceeding to her anchorage, at Ahirkapi Anchorage, Istanbul, Marmara sea. BURHAN DIZMAN  sustained serious damages portside in superstructure area and TURAN C suffered bow and forecastle damages. TURKAN C was en route to Constanta and BURHAN DIZMAN was en route to Novorossiysk.
Vessel was reported as NUC due to main engine fault while en route from Saint Petersburg, Russia to Visakhapatnam, India approx 33NM from Ramsgate, UK. Repairs were completed and vessel underway.
Vessel had bottom contact upon approaching dock in Pigeon Bay off Kingsville, Ontario, Canada. No pollution reported. She sailed on the same day.
Officers of water police found MARPOL violation during inspection in Elbe Port of Brunsbuttel, Germany. Administrative offense proceedings began. Judge ordered confiscation of security deposit.
Vessel had engine failure at Biscay Bay, Spain. Crew couldn't repair. Tug En Avant 10 towed her to Vigo.

Vessel collided with general cargo ship BATANGHARI MAS in Bangka Strait, Bangka Belitung Islands, while on scheduled trip from Patimban northwest Java to Belawan, North Sumatra. SERASI I hull was breached with massive water ingress. All 17 crew were rescued by nearby vessel, all are safe. SERASI I has reportedly, sank, or was sinking.

Vessel suffered a technical failure of its fire detection system, along with its alarm unit, when it was at Novorossiysk. Her departure permission was cancelled by the Harbour Master until the completion of repairs and an inspection by state surveyors. Subsequently, the departure was granted and the ship sailed from Novorossiysk to Istanbul.
Vessel suffered main engine issues while proceeding downbound in the Strait Lawrence River off Mont-Louis, Canada. She anchored in the Detroit de Jacques-Cartier, Quebec, to complete repairs.

Vessel's portside lifeboat fell into water, during training or tender operation, during her anchorage stay at Aneityum island, Vanuatu.. Nobody was injured, lifeboat sustained damages. The ship left anchorage same day bound for Port Vila.

Vessel was struck by vehicle carrier SERASI I in Bangka Strait, Bangka Belitung Islands. SERASI I hull was breached with massive water ingress. She reportedly sank or started sinking. All 17 crew were rescued by nearby vessel, all are safe.

Vessel allided with breakwater in Mortavika, Norway, en route from Arsvagen. She suffered damages and was taken out of service. No injuries were reported. Quay and two of vehicles on board also suffered damages. Investigations are being carried out by the police.
A crew member was struck in the face by the vessel’s anchor chain after vessel lost propulsion at entrance to Galveston Channel. US Coast Guard launched 45 ft boat.

Vessel had heavy smoke from engine room in Samasjoen, Harstad, Norway. Firefighters, harbour guard and smoke divers attended. There were no visible flames. The thick, black smoke made it difficult to work on board but situation was under control in short time.
Vessel touched bottom above Lock 8 of the Welland Canal off Port Colborne, Ontario, Canada. She was docked at the Lock 8 south wallawaiting for divers to perform checks.
Vessel had technical failure, sheltered and dropped anchor at Sinop anchorage, while en route from Samsun, Turkey to Constanta, Romania. Repairs being done by crew.

Vessel developed 30 degrees list in rough weather some 40 nm E of Yangtze estuary. Shanghai MRCC sent SAR ship and helicopter and all 12 crew were rescued. Latest updates on ship indicate she’s still afloat, drifting, SAR ship monitoring. Understood she was en route to Kaohsiung.

Vessel suffered an engine failure in the Gulf of Aden and went adrift 60nm southwest of Aden. The crew carried out repairs while the vessel continued to drift in a northwesterly direction . The engine was restarted on December 3rd and the following day the ship moored at Djibouti anchorage, where it remained as of December 15th.
Vessel suffered an engine failure at Monfalcone Anchorage. She was towed to Tuzla, Turkey by tug Atlantic Power.  A detailed damage survey was carried out and permanent repairs have commenced.
Vessel suffered power loss north of Weihai, Bohai sea, while en route from Russia – Vanino She was towed to Yantai Anchorage, where she was anchored in the morning of 2 December .
Vessel suffered engine issues in the Chenal du Nord off Baie-des-Rochers, QC. Vessel proceeded to Trois-Rivieres, Quebec, with no further incidents to report.

Vessel reported steam leak from boiler handhole cover, requiring replacement of gasket, downbound in Lawrence River off Sept-Iles, Quebec. Escoumins Traffic was informed. Repairs were done and vessel resumed voyage next day.

Crane carried by vessel contacted Holtenau Bridge in Kiel Canal shortly after the ship entered Canal for southbound transit, en route from Rostock to Esbjerg, Jutland, Denmark. Some parts of crane fell into water after collision, and sank. Canal traffic is closed. Ship or ship’s cargo damages unknown.
Vessel was disabled due to steering gear issues while transiting St. Lawrence River off Trois-Rivieres, Quebec, Canada. Anchored nearby, repaired and resumed voyage.
Vessel ran aground with shoreline due to steering issues in Dodd Narrows, Canada. Crew inspected vessel for damage and continued passage to Nanaimo, British Columbia.

Vessel, en route from Melbourne to Newcastle, Australie, had to return to port of origin in Melbourne due to COVID-19 outbreak on board. Totsl number of cases is unknown. 5 people were taken to hospital when vessel arrived at Melbourne.

Vessel ran aground on 48 km mark in Zona Comun area, La Plata, looking like she strayed off fairway. She refloated, probably by own means same day and returned to Zona Comun anchorage. She was en route to Ghent, Belgium.

Vessel ran onto highway embankment at Yanai City, Yamaguchi Prefecture, Japan, Inner Japan sea, while en route from Mitajiri to Hiroshima. She was refloated and taken to Yanai Anchorage for inspection. Extent of damages unknown.

Vessel was hit by a large wave south of Cape Horn, Drake Passage, while returning to Ushuaia Argentine from Antarctic cruise. Several glass panels in the booths were broke, 1 passenger died and 4 were injured.
Vessel had mechanical failure in pos37 55 30.6N,024 34 09.6E, Greece. Vessel returned to Laurium with own power and resumed its schedule on 30 November.
Fire broke out in engine room during maintenance works at Hamburg-Ortkathen yard, Germany. 50 firefighters and several boats were deployed to prevent damages. Investigation on cause of fire started.

Vessel was reported to have ran aground in a rocky area west of Telendos on its scheduled route from the port of Leros to the port of Kalymnos. The ship suffered water ingress, but reached the port under its own power. It was assisted by patrol boats, two tugs and lifeboats. A diver investigated the hull and found tow cracks at the port side, a breakage of the rudder and distortion of the propeller, and of the shaft of the port side main engine.

Three migrants were found atop the rudder of vessel as she arrived in Spain’s Canary Islands after completing a 2700 nautical mile journey. They were exhibiting symptoms of dehydration and hypothermia and were immediately sent to hospital for tests and recovery.
Vessel lost anchor and chain at Oostdyck anchorage, TSS Westhinder, in pos lat 51 19 48N, long 02 33 52E, Belgium. Sailed from anchorage and reached Zelzate on 29 November.

Vessel skipped its port of Call in Bali due to a Covid outbreak onboard while en route from Sydney, Australia. She was directed to the port of Fremantle in Australia, which was the endpoint of its journey where she is expected to arrive on 2nd December.
Vessel struck the dock at the container terminal in Squamish, BC, Canada while being towed by the tug Hs Hope. Barge was attached with a new towline and towed to its original destination.
Vessel was reported as NUC in pos 57 50 57.6N, 06 30 31.8W, 5 NM SW of Shiant Isles, UK. Defect rectified on 29 November and vessel continued passage.
Vessel had problems with the generator and had to cancel its service between West Cowes and Southampton, UK.
Vessel contacted North Jetty breakwater at Quequen, Buenos Aires Province, Argentina heading to China. Bulk carrier was taken to outer anchorage. Hull breach and list were reported.

Vessel had technical failure in lat 36 44 05N, long 027 44 00E, sheltered and dropped anchor in Datca, Turkey. Repairs started by crew at anchorage on 28 November. Sailed from Datca on 29 November, heading to Beirut.

Fire broke out in living quarters of vessel in Okhotsk sea off western coast of Kamchatka Peninsula. Crew managed to extinguish fire by own means. Vessel is proceeding to 1st Khuril Strait to wait out storm and meet with SAR ship. No report on damages.

About 300 litres of oil spilled during transfer from chemical/oil products tanker Juno Marie to crude oil tanker Yamilah III at anchorage one in Pointe aux Trembles. An emergency stop was activated. The Yamilah III left Montreal on 3 December, headed to Gibraltar.
Vessel had main engine issues, in lat 45 13 44N, long 074 12 23W, on Lac St-Francois, Quebec, Canada. The vessel proceeded to the wharf in Cote-Ste-Catherine, Quebec, Canada to investigate.

About 300 litres of oil spilled during transfer from chemical/oil products tanker Juno Marie to crude oil tanker Yamilah III at anchorage one in Pointe aux Trembles. An emergency stop was activated. The Yamilah III left Montreal on 3 December, headed to Gibraltar.

Vessel suffered engine failure 54 nm W of Ushant, France, western English Channel, while en route from Antwerp to Caucedo Dominican Republic. She started to drift and SAR ship ABEILLE BOURBON responded and towed her to Brest, ETA 29 November.

According to track, vessel ran aground in Kola Bay, Barents sea, Russia, after she left Murmansk on 26 November. The ship was refloated on Dec 9, and taken back to Murmansk. Salvage was mentioned by local media, with involvement of 3 tugs, so probably, she indeed, ran aground on 26 November.

Vessel ran aground on rocks of Ecrehous, 6km off Barneville-Carteret, 40 miles S of Pointe de la Hague, Jersey, France. The 4 people on board had to be airlifted. Skipper requested assistance from Cross Jobourg.

Vessel reportedly went out of control while manoeuvring in Dingle Harbour in County Kerry, Ireland and collided with a marina pontoon. Several small craft berthed at Harbour were damaged. No injuries.

A crew member lost his right hand in job accident while the ship was under way in Gulf of Siam, en route from Laem Chabang to Singapore. Sailor was safely medevaced and transferred to hospital and vessel continued her voyage.
Vessel had engine failure and lost of power East of Gibraltar in pos 35 57 00N, 05 02 00W. Tug Eraclea towed her to Algeciras. Permanent repairs started.

Vessel took wrong turn while entering Teignmouth Port, U.K. and allided with some moored pleasure boats. She was backed off without bottom touch. Sailed on 29 November, bound for Amsterdam, Netherlands.
Vessel reported auxiliary engine failure, black out in pos 10 21 00N, 69 38 30E in Arabian Sea. She arrived at Colombo anchorage for repairs on 29 November.
Vessel had technical failure during Istanbul Strait passage at Yenikoy point in the Strait. Kurtarma-5 attended to provide assistance. Sailed from Istanbul anchorage same day.
Vessel was disabled and adrift when its trawlnets became entangled in its propellers while fishing N of Malpica, Spain. CCS Finisterre mobilised tug Sar Gavia and towed vessel to port of La Coruna.

Vessel had fire in the kitchen, while waiting for berthing and unloading in Japan.Vessel stopped its engine and anchored to extinguish fire. She was kept in Nagoya Port for investigation by JCG. No injuries or damages were reported.
Vessel ran aground into mud at Beachley Barracks River Severn in pos 51 20 52.8N, 003 17 27.6W. Investigation is on.

Vessel was banned from entering Spanish waters and port of destination Cartagena because she sailed from Yeisk port, Russia, Azov sea, with allegedly goods of Russian origin, in accordance with sanctions imposed on Russian ships and ships with Russian cargoes, after Russia invaded Ukraine. She anchored off Pozzallo, southern Sicily and remained at anchor as of 26 November.

Vessel had main engine failure in pos 37 51 18N, 20 50 00E, off Zakynthos, Greece. Port Authority detained vessel until repairs. Tug Christos XLIII had to attend. The ship sailed from Zakynthos anchorage 1 December, towards Durres, Albania

Vessel ran aground, in Lough Foyle. She veered to starboard out of channel whilst changing from manual to automatic steering and got stuck on the sandy bottom. Tugs Strathfoyle and Otterbank were tasked to assist.
Vessel reported that one of its generators was out of service while moored in lat 49 09 56N, long 123 55 43W, in Nanaimo Harbour, Canada. The generator was repaired and the vessel continued voyage.

A passenger that went missing from a cruise vessel sailing in the Gulf of Mexico was rescued after more than 15 hours afloat in the sea. A US Coast Guard helicopter rescued the man after being spotted by the crew of passing bulk carrier CRINIS. He was transferred to New Orleans Lakefront hospital and was reported to be in stable condition on Friday.
Vessel had engine failure and lost power off Nouakchott, in position lat 17 58 30N, long 016 07 00W, Mauritania. Crew couldn’t repair. Tug Pacific Porpoise towed vessel to Las Palmas, Spain.

Vessel was disabled due to engine failure off Boulogne, France. Tug Multratug 20 assisted and towed it to Ijmuiden, then tug Triton pulled it to Amsterdam. Vessel sailed from port after cargo operations and repairs on 30 November.

Vessel was NUC due to engine trouble and the exhaust valve needed a change, in lat 50 52 49N, long 001 14 58E. Proceeded to Dungeness East anchorage to investigate. Repairs were completed within 3 hours.

Fire broke out on board vessel, due to an electrical short in speaker system. Firefighters reported to scene and extinguished fire. Several areas of Deck 9 and 10, near fire, were temporarily closed for cleanup and inspection.

Vessel was NUC due to blown gasket and hole in the fuel line, in pos 51 04 52N, 001 34 54E, UK. Transit Traffic Separation Scheme, entered NE lane in French SRR on 24 November. Arrived in Le Treport on 26 November.
A local Bangladesh court issued a release order for the vessel and she sailed from Chittagong anchorage on November 27th, bound for Port Klang, Malaysia.

UPDATE: It has been confirmed that vessel was indeed boarded by pirates. They cut communications and stole cargo. Vessel was severely damaged and drifted due to engine issue. Italian Navy and patrol vessel assisted. According to Trade Winds report vessel is missing in Gulf of Ginea, with all communications lost. She left Abijan on 2 October, sailed to Freetown anchora, Sierra Leone, left it and went to area in Gulf of Guinea, then returned to Freetown anchorage, to leave it again on 17 November. Piracy reporting body Maritime Domain Awareness for Trade Gulf of Guinea (MDAT GoG) suspects possible piracy.
Vessel had main engine problems in Detroit d'Honguedo off Cloridorme. Crew did repairs. Proceeded to Trois-Rivieres on own power and sailed to Santa Marta on 16 December.
Vessel notified CROSS Corsen of engine damage and announced it was starting repairs. Next day crew was forced to shut engine down and requested assistance. Tug Abeille Bourbon towed vessel to Brest.
Vessel ran aground at Skjaholmen outside entrance to Tjotta, Norway. She was refloated the same day with rising tide and she proceeded to Stottfjorden, northwest of Glomfjord.

Vessel had technical failure during Canakkale strait passage. She anchored at Karanlik liman anchorage under supervision of strait pilot on. Crew carried out repairs and ship sailed for Yenikapi on 9 December.
Vessel had technical failure, sheltered and dropped anchor at Edremit anchorage, Turkey. Repairs were carried out by crew and she sailed on 23 November, bound for Beirut.
Vessel lost anchor in access channel La Luz to Port of Las Palmas, Spain. She was dangerously close to Avenida Maritima breakwater and threatened to run aground but situation resolved.

Vessel was chartered to replace research vessel Nuyina but was forced to turn back from Antarctic resupply voyage, to port in Hobart, Australia, due to mechanical problems. Electrical components were replaced and sea trials conducted.
Vessel suffered engine failure while berthed at Fibreco Dock in Vancouver, Canada. She was towed to an anchorage in Vancouver Harbour.
Vessel was reported as NUC and drifting, 6.4 NM at 185.6 deg from Lizard Point, UK. Fuel valve was replaced within 2 hours. No pollution. No tug assistance was required.
Vessel ran aground under Maloy bridge near one of the pillars. Refloated and berthed in Maloy. After investigations, the vessel continued voyage to Floro.

Vessel struck an abutment of Bridge 21, while proceeding downbound in lat 42 53 44N, long 079 14 53W, on the Welland Canal off Port Colborne, Canada. Proceeded to the west wall at Lock No.8 to wait for damage assessment.
Vessel collided with LNG Floating Storage Regasification Unit Hoegh Gannet due to gusty winds of about 64 knots at Brest, France. Tugs separated vessels. Damages unknown.
Vessel had technical failure, sheltered and anchored at Sinop anchorage. Repairs carried out by crew and sailed on 23 November. Arrived in Novorossiysk on 25 November.

It has been reported that vessel has been attacked by drones,  off Al-Dhaba’s Ash Shihr Oil Terminal, Hadramout Governorate, Yemen, Gulf of Aden. Details and reasons for the attack are not very clear. Vessel left Yemeni waters after attack and was sailing south at slow speed. No reports on damages or injuries.

Vessel had main engine issues in lat 47 25 00N, long 070 27 31W, in Passage de L'isle aux Coudres off lle aux Coudres, Quebec, Canada. Anchored in Pointe-au-Pic, Quebec where the crew completed repairs.
Vessel had a blackout in lat 46 53 18N, long 070 56 73W, in the Chenal des Grands Voiliers off Riviere Maheu, Quebec, Canada. Proceeded back to the anchorage in Riviere Maheu, Quebec, Canada.

Vessel had engine issues in lat 46 24 24N, long 072 22 55W, in the St. Lawrence River off Becancour, Quebec, Canada. It was tied up with the assistance of tugs. Crew carried out repairs alongside and resumed voyage.
Vessel was NUC due to main engine failure which caused propulsion trouble in pos 49 21 46.8N, 005 13 08.4W, UK. Tug Abeille Bourbon towed vessel to Morgat, France.
Vessel collided with passenger vessel Renaissance due to gusty winds of about 64 knots at Brest, France. Tugs separated vessels. Damages unknown.

Vessel had generator issues while proceeding in lat 46 18 51N, long 072 33 37W, westbound in the St. Lawrence River off Trois-Rivieres. Crew proceeded back to a wharf in Trois-Rivieres and completed repairs.
Vessel reported as NUC due to water leakage on cooling jacket, in position lat 49 26 49N, long 004 48 47W, UK. Completed repair works and resumed passage.
Vesselwas disabled due to engine issues while preparing to depart IOCO Terminal in Port Moody, British Columbia, Canada. Crew carried repairs.
Vessel sank at West Kutai in East Kalimantan, Indonesia. 2 crew members died. Suspected that hull of vessel leaked bigger, so water entered faster than it was being pumped, causing it to sink.
Vessel experienced engine failure west of Sinop, Turkey in pos 42 04 30N, 034 53 30E. Crew could not carry out repairs. Tug Bas Viking attended and towed her to Yalova.

Vessel had technical problem with steering of propeller, forced to cancel all ferries to and from Gotland Island, Sweden. Reportedly error rectified temporarily but all departures delayed by 6 hrs after disruption.

Vessel collided with a motor-banca en route from Calapan port to Batangas Port, Philippines, approximately 500 metres from shoreline of Barangay (village) Pagkilatan in Batangas City. 3 people on board motor-banca were rescued.

Vessel collided with passenger ship Frisia while leaving port of Busum, Germany. Stern of Frisia veered off course due to rudder failure and collided perpendicularly. No injuries or pollution reported. Vessel had only scrapes.

Vessel suffered an engine failure en route from Bejaia, Algeria to Algeciras, Spain and lost power in the Alboran Sea. Repairs could not be carried out by the crew so AHTS Kolga towed her to Algeciras. As of 23 November the ship was moored at Algeciras.

Vessel lost bow thruster control in lat 45 29 08N, long 073 31 01W, while proceeding upbound at the Saint-Lambert Lock approaches in Saint-Lambert, Canada. The crew resolved the problem at anchor and resumed voyage.
Vessel had main engine problem in St. Lawrence River, off Trois-Rivieres, in position lat 46 20 09.6N, long 072 32 13.2W, Quebec, Canada. Vessel conducted repairs at anchor and resumed its voyage.
Vessel had technical failure during Canakkale strait passage, en route from Nemrut Bay to Yalova, Turkey. She anchored at Karanlik liman Anchorage. Crew repairing.

Vessel suffered loss of power and propulsion in Vesterhavn, Kristiansand, Norway, shortly after Kristiansand bound for Tees UK. The ship was held stable in strong wind by 1 or 2 tugs, which were still around as of 18 November.

Vessel suffered engine failure in Bosphorus in front of Kandilli, while transiting the Strait, en route from Ambarli to Novorossiysk. The ship was towed back to Marmara sea and anchored at Ahirkapi Anchorage and remained in the same position as of 19 November.

Fire erupted twice in a boiler on board of vessel, which was offloading jet fuel at Anchorage, Alaska. First fire started at night Nov 18, with a lot of black smoke. Fuel offloading was immediately suspended. Fire was extinguished, but early in the morning Nov 19 it reignited, to be extinguished soon. No injuries or leaks were reported.
