Vessel positioned in Gulf of Mexico SE of Galveston since October, was evacuated as a precaution in advance of severe weather forecasts over the weekend. On 20 November she was observed to be off position on one side and without any major visual damage. Offshore tugs are nearby as of 22 November.
Vessel was diverted to Bermuda to transfer ashore a crew member suffering from a medical condition. She was en route from Singapore to Yum Kaknaab, Mexico.
Vessel had main engine issues while proceeding downbound in St. Lawrence River above lock in Iroquois, Canada. Anchored off Toussaint Island for repairs and sailed on same day.
Vessel moored at Saint-Vaast-la-Hougue pier, France reportedly destroyed by fir. Took more than 2 hrs for 30 firefighters to contain fire. Vessel secured along backwater. Investigation on.
Vessel collided with container ship ELLA Y while manoeuvring to anchorage in Turkey, due to strong SW wind together with heavy seas in area. Investigation file opened.
Vessel collided with general cargo ship Volgo-Don 207 in Turkey, due to strong SW wind together with heavy seas in area. No injuries reported.
Vessel was reported as NUC due to engine failure, in lat 52 57 05N, long 004 00 00E, Netherlands. Crew completed repairs and continued voyage the same day.
Vessel collided with tug Ocean Kitsilano as she was departing Deltaport Terminals in Tsawwassen, British Columbia, Canada. No pollution or injuries reported.

Vessel lost power and went adrift after towing arrangement parted, NUC, in pos 57 39 44.4N, 03 55 43.2W, UK. Barge under tow and under control by tug Carlo Martello. Vessel moored in Nigg terminal No 4 on 17 November.

Vessel ran aground on Balikci Adasi island, southern island of Princes’ islands, Marmara sea, south of Istanbul, arrving from Sudan. She was refloated with tugs assistance and taken to nearby anchorage. No reports on damages or cause of incident.
Air compressor exploded on board of vessel at Le Havre, injuring two crew members. Both have been hospitalised. Explosion didn’t cause fire, compressor was running test when it exploded.
Vessel collided with containership MSC Lisa at Deltaport Terminals in Tsawwassen, British Columbia, Canada. No pollution or injuries reported.

Vessel which sails between Garten and Storfosna, Norway visited by inspectors of Norwegian Maritime Directorate who found evidence of damage to bow and some water ingress. Repair work started in port of Garten.

Vessel had blackout and was disabled while proceeding westbound on Lake Huron off Manitoulin Island, in position lat 45 34 51.6N, long 083 12 58.8W, Ontario, Canada. Crew did repairs and resumed voyage. No pollution reported.

UPDATE: Vessel sank in the afternoon of 17 November after major fire, with 115 vehicles on board, mostly trucks. All people on board, including 237 passengers and 25 crew, were rescued. Ship’s hull remains partially above waterline. Fire erupted on board of passenger ro-ro ferry with some 270 people on board. Fire broke on one of upper decks in fore section, and then spread further. People on board were to be evacuated, at least 3 rescue ships and boats gathered around disabled ferry.

Vessel suffered engine failure and got stuck into Kiel Canal embankment near Rader Hochbrucke Bridge, while transiting Canal en route from Sweden to UK. She was freed and brought to Rendsburg, where she was berthed, few hours later.

Vessel was NUC due to electrical blackout and loss of engine power aboutt 2.05 NM from Varneon, UK. Vessel anchored in pos 51 10 31N, 01 38 08E. Tug towed to Zeebrugge, Belgium. The ship sailed on 20 November to La Rochelle.
Vessel had engine blackout during westbound transit of Kiel Canal near Breiholz, Germany. Tugs Fairplay Inagua and Fairplay 55 towed it to railway station pilings for investigations.

Vessel was inspected by water police in Elbe Port, Brunsbuttel, Germany. They found no entries in ballast water diary. Administrative offense proceedings initiated against Master, first officer and chief engineer.

Three robbers armed with long knives boarded vessel at Takoradi anchorage, Ghana. Upper deck watch keepers noticed robbers and informed bridge. Robbers escaped. Paint locker found broken and vessel’s stores stolen.

Seven armed men boarded vessel 50nm W. Sherbro Island, in position lat 07 11 00N, long 013 16 00W, Sierra Leone. Hijackers took control, steered vessel until it ran aground and abandoned her. Crew safe.

Vessel collided with cargo vessel HEISEI MARU NO.2 in Inner Japan sea while sailing in opposite directions. Bow of HEISEI MARU NO.2 struck KUROSHIO NO.1 stern, inflicting damages to both ships, mostly dents and scratches

Vessel ran aground in Sulina Channel, Danube, Romania. She was refloated with tug assistance and anchored downstream from Tulcea for inspection. She resumed voyage to Galati Steel Plant next day. No damages reported.
Vessel had mechanical problems and diverted to Brest, France, to anchor in roadstead, near Roscanvel. A crew died of heart attack. Sailed from Brest on 19 November for Gaeta, Italy.

Vessel collided with work boat Motobattello 23-VE 8784 near Tronchetto in Venice, Italy due to thick fog in the area. Motobattello 23-VE 8784 first hit ramp then scraped along side of vessel. Captain of vessel tried to stop it.

Vessel had generator failure and was forced to moor at Le Havre, France. Inspection listed 16 deficiencies. Commercial court seized vessel, at request of Balearia, whose debt was valued at 230,000 Euros.
Shipping company Armas Transmediterranea cancelled departures of vessel from Algeciras to Ceuta, Spain due to technical trouble. Vessel remained sidelined at Muelle de la Isla Verda in Algeciras.
Vessel had technical failure at south entrance of Canakkale strait, Turkey. She shifted to North of Bozcaada Island anchorage and dropped anchor under own power. Repairs on going by crew.

Vessel capsized and sank amid stormy weather in Peniche, Portugal. She was resting bottom up at quay since. Vessel was moored for about 2 years. Listed port side week before incident. PA, Maritime authority monitoring situation.

Vessel was hit by a bomb carried by drone in Arabian sea, some 150 nm off Oman coast. Tanker is en route from Oman to Buenos Aires Argentina. She suffered minor hull damage and continued her voyage. No injuries reported.

Vessel collided with general cargo ship  KUROSHIO NO.1 in Inner Japan sea while sailing in opposite directions. Bow of HEISEI MARU NO.2 struck KUROSHIO NO.1 stern, inflicting damages to both ships, mostly dents and scratches.
A crew member was medevaced off Roscoff by helicopter. After the sailor was airlifted he was transported to a hospital in Brest, France. The vessel was en route from Ust-Luga to Port Said.
Vessel suffered a fire in the lagging of a generator turbocharger in Whitefish Bay, Canada. Crew extinguished fire and kept on monitoring engine.

A crew member was evacuated from vesseld, near Kangaroo Island off the coast of South Australia, while en route from Adelaide to Melbourne. The crew member was evacuated by SA Ambulance Service Rescue 51 helicopter and taken to a hospital in Adelaide.

Vessel reported smoke coming from hold no 5 in the Gladstone Dock Liverpool. The fire was put out by firefighters working with the Coast Guard and the following morning the hold was inspected by the fire service.
Breaking wave caused zodiac of vessel to overturn near Cape Lookout, Elephant Island. Reportedly 2 people have died.

Vessel in lay-up in Rio de Janeiro since 2016, apparently unmanned and anchored just above Rio-Niteroi Bridge, dragged anchor and drifted onto the bridge. Traffic on the bridge was closed while damages to the bridge are being evaluated.
Vessel had severe damage to southern end prow, while tow from Poole to Falmouth, UK. Return to service is postponed until next year.
Vessel had main engine breakdown and drifted without power in pos 62 53 15N, 06 54 38E, Norway. Patrol ship KV Njord along with HPB 3 tug Erik Bye towed her to Elnesvagen.

A number of sailings of vessel on East Cowes - Southampton, UK service were canceled due to technical issue with forward PROP. A crew member had accident, broke leg, dropped mooring line and stuck PROP. Investigation launched.
Vessel was disabled due to issues with its main engine in Constance Bay off Esquimalt, Canada. She navigated to the nearest Royal Roads Anchorage by using her other engine.

Vessel collided with unknown obstruction on bottom of fairway while turning in port of Odden, Denmark. She suffered some scratches but hull remained unscathed. The ship sailed on 16 November after repairs.

Vessel went out of control while entering railway port and collided with gangway of ferry terminal in Borkum, Germany. She remained unscathed but terminal installation was heavily damaged. No injuries were reported. Investigation on.

Vessel struck Bainbridge Island ferry because of hard landing while someone was being trained. The dock had some minor damages and vessel sailing from Bainbridge Island was delayed. No injuries reported.

Vessel oil and gas processing platform shut and partly evacuated in pos 65 06 36N, 06 47 24E, Norway, following fire in transformer, caused by production outage. No injuries reported. Shutdown resulted in outage of gas production.
Vessel ran aground 0.7 NM from Hornafjordur port, Iceland. Vessel refloated the same day and continued voyage to Moerdijk, Netherlands.
Vessel had engine failure, SE off Cape Sagres, Portugal. Fire fighting tug Nervio towed vessel to Figueira da Foz, Portugal on 20 November.

The chief officer of vessel lost consciousness and needed medical treatment. He was picked up by an ambulance and taken to the Salamina Health Centre, but he was pronounced dead on arrival. A preliminary investigation was being carried out by the 3rd Port Department of Salamina of the Central Port Authority of Piraeus. As of November 15th the vessel was stopped at the port of Paloukia, Greece.
Vessel suffered power loss in South China sea off northwest Luzon, during research works. Tug SALVAGE RIGGER towed her to Kaohsiung.

Vessel had technical failure of firefighting systems at Novorossiysk, Russia. Repairs completed, state surveyors verified repair status, granted departure permission, vessel sailed from Novorossiysk on 15 November.
Vessel had fire on board during discharge operation at Darica, Turkey. Fire was extinguished same day. Investigation on. Vessel sailed from Darica on 13 November for Ravenna.
Vessel collided with fishing vessel north of Keelung, Taiwan. Fishing vessel was split into two and sank, but all 7 crew members have been rescued. Cargo ship returned to Keelung for investigation.

Vessel ran aground in Raftsundet, strait in Nordland county, Norway, while en route to Stokkmarknes. She was refloated 3 hours later and resumed voyage under own power, safely reaching port of destination. Damages have not been yet reported.
Vessel had issues with its ship service generators in lat 41 52 06N, long 082 36 04W, on Lake Erie off Point Pelee, Ontario. Dropped anchor to carry out further repairs before resuming voyage.

UPDATE: Vessel has been located in Arafura sea some 20 nm NW of her last AIS position. Reportedly, she ran out of fuel and changed course and destination in order to reach nearest bunker point Vessel en route from Timika Papua to Bontang with 16 crew on board has been lost at sea. Last AIS position was in Arafura sea, Indonesia, and she was drifting. SAR was launched but no results as of 13 November.
Vessel ran aground in pos 59 14 56N, 002 51 08W, 300m E Rapness pier, UK. Tug Odin Of Scapa escorted vessel to Kirkwall next day. No obvious damage, water ingress or pollution.
Vessel ran aground while approaching Tekirdag Port, Turkey, Marmara sea. Tug and aux boats responded and are at her side.

Vessel suffered engine failure under 15 July Martyrs Bridge, Bosphorus, Istanbul, while en route from Damietta to Constanta Romania. Traffic Control Center responded by sending tug, pilot boat. The ship completed transit and was anchored at Kumkoy anchorage, Istanbul, Black sea.
Crane cable broke while loading of heavy cargo on board of ship docked at Ennore port, India. A crew member was killed on the spot and another was injured and hospitalised with broken leg.

Vessel ran aground off Nyhamna, Norway, while en route from Kristiansund to Elnsvagen, was refloated at around a few hours later and reached Elnsvagen under own power. The ship is probably damaged as she reportedly grounded on reef.

Vessel had dirty oily water discharge to sea during its stay at Izmit anchorage, Turkey. A pollution fine of $225,000 was imposed and departure permission canceled by Harbour Master till payment of fine and cleaning expenses.
Vessel cancelled 2 cruises, from 19-26 Nov & 26 Nov-03 Dec due to defective transformer that needs replacing. On 21 November she was berthed at Estaleiros da Lisnave shipyard in Setubal for repairs

Fire broke out in engine room of dry docked ship in Dunkirk, France. Nord Dept Fire Service responded with about 20 fire engines, fire was taken under control. No injuries reported and all people on board have been evacuated. Vessel had arrived at Dunkirk on Oct 20.
Vessel, en route from Gavle, came too close to quay in Norrkoping, Sweden and allided with gantry crane while docking. Crane suffered damage to one of the legs. Vessel left port same day.

Vessel requested medical assistance for the captain who was suffering from cardiac problems, about 140nm northwest of Orkney, en route from Thorshavn, Faroe Islands, to Rotterdam, Netherlands. The MRCC requested immediate evacuation by helicopter.

All sailings of vessel between Nynashamn, Sweden and Rostock, Germany were temporarily cancelled due to engine damage. Vessel was towed to Rostock by tugs. Berthed at Oeresunds Drydock AB repair yard on 12 November.

Vessel rammed fairway buoy shortly after leaving Inga Finland en route to Riga, Latvia. Autopilot was reported as the cause of the accident. The ship didn’t sustain damages and was allowed to resumed voyage. Buoy was damaged.

Outbreak of Covid-19 hit crew of vessel with 62 people on board underway in Indian Ocean in pos 052 52 45.6S, 121 53 52.2E,, halfway to Australian Antarctic Davis Station with fuel, supplies and relief personnel.
Vessel had fire in the Port of Naples, Italy. The shipyard's fire-fighting service, the local fire brigade and the harbour master's office prevented the fire from spreading.
Vessel went out of service on Route 3 between Langdale and Horseshoe Bay, Canada, due to mechanical issue with vessel's main engine. Queen of Oak Bay to sail as replacement on modified schedule.

Vessel had issues with its draft information system in lat 44 11 41N, long 076 15 51W, in the St. Lawrence River off Wolfe Island, Ontario, Canada. Anchored at the Carleton Anchorage and resumed voyage after repairs.

Fire broke out on board vessel at about 180nm from Cape Verde. CNCS Madrid contacted vessels in area in case assistance was necessary, but crew managed to start engine again. Vessel reached port of Mindelo on 11 November.

UPDATE: 13/11/2022  - It was reported that Master of the tanker suffered cerebrovascular stroke during refloating operation. He received first aid and was airlifted and transferred to hospital. Vessel ran aground at 153 kilometer mark of fairway in Rio de La Plata, en route from Buenos Aires to Ushuaia. She was refloated hours later and resumed voyage.

Vessel had issues with its GPS that impacted its input to electronic charts and radar in St. Lawrence River off Grondines, Quebec, Canada. She proceeded to Montreal for repairs and sailed Montreal on 17 November, after repairs.

Vessel, en route from Damietta, Egypt to Istanbul, Turkey, had technical failure during Canakkale strait passage and dropped anchor at Karanlik liman anchorage. Repairs completed on 11 November and vessel continued voyage.

Vessel suffered fire in engine room at Piraeus Anchorage. Fire fighting and emergency boats and tugs responded, but crew managed to extinguish fire by own means. Extent of damages unknown and no injuries were reported.
